56kUGamLZ7i70U98T_-Icg.text: Excellent food and service. This is a gem in palazzo! The menu has everything you can imagine!

u-U6kk5Hsuglrf-QBEJZKQ.text: I saw in another review that this is owned by The Cheesecake Factory and in hindsight, it makes total sense. Large variety to choose from no matter the time of day (or night), huge portions, super tasty food. My hubby and I come here for the cream of chicken soup, of which I am typically not a fan. The first time I tried it, I was hesitant but since I was guaranteed to love it, I had nothing to lose. The first bite was okay, the second bite was pretty good, by the third bite, I was sold! Now I can't come to LV without having it at least once. Outstanding service every time.

aUq0ZYEOgKl_ynqa7fR93Q.text: I absolutely love this place. The staff is great very knowledgeable when it comes to suggesting food you will love. You can feel that they know what taste good. The wine pairings are exquisite. The manager is so accommodating  he makes you feel very special. His an awesome guy. When we ate there I heard that he was having a health issue but he made us feel like royalties.there was no way you can tell he was dealing with something ,I wish everyone is like that ,willing to do their work inspite  of anything. Your the best.i will definitely come to enjoy the food and hang out with you.  Love your pastas and bread.

q_-fij9FXcCHCmGBoLRXsg.text: The Garden Fresh omelet was amazing.  My server was fantastic although the general feel of the staff was unhappy.  No one smiled at anyone except the person they were serving at the time, not even each other.  The only bad thing was the coffee was just ok.  I had hoped for better!

X1K77UY6zkQ8CKwlYE1S6g.text: Sooooo I've never been here and had just went and picked up the old man from work. It was almost 1am so he suggested here, I shoulda been against it (since his picks ALWAYS suck) but was like ok! So we get there and theres hella ppl! I was thinking to myself, this place has to be yummy!  Boy o boy, I opened the menu and was like "WTF!" ok, lemme tell you... I'm a cheap date! I think its absurd to spend more than 10$ on a meal! Even though my bf was paying I was just irritated. I really wanted a club sandwich and seen one listed.. for 12$!!!! I scanned the menu and seen that everything was pretty much 12$+ and also everything they had on the "late night" menu didnt sound yummy. So I got the club.  We both got it and it came to our table... OK, when I think of a club I think of a double decker sandwich... not a plain 2 pieces of bread sandwich! This thing was 2 pieces of bread, arugula, turkey, and bacon. Uhmmmm LAME! The fries were good, but I wasnt pleased with my sandwich. I left irritated and will probably not go back!! The server was nice, and the place itself is very beautiful, but like I said I'm a cheap bastard. I didnt think the quality of the food was worth it.

o9Ejc7bUEqEaFN_k_V3CRA.text: Manager, Matt took a bad situation better.  Service started off bad but his personal attention to us changed our experience for the better.

UrxWdNzDhTDDvpuLR6u0vQ.text: Love love this place.The orange juice is freshly squeezed and sweet. Worth the money they charge. Big portions and reasonably priced. Very clean, great customer service. Haven't had a bad experience yet. Open 24/7 which is a good thing. The pastas are really good.

J2S8Q9Kwl2yAqf_OT9-nhg.text: Had brunch here with table of 6. Service was good, prices were decent, portions were large, but really nothing special. Group had the standard breakfast items - waffles, eggs/bacon, omelettes.  Essentially it was like going to a diner but in a nicer setting.

Ig7aWQSGe5jXv3bAwjpouQ.text: Affordable lunch or dinner conveniently located within the Venetian  As others have said, this is very much like a cheesecake factory. Huge menu, reasonably price, and very good food. The nice thing is that they aren't price gouging (as they easily could) considering its location within the Venetian.  Service was excellent. Our waitress was extremely attentive providing refills, more bread, and the check promptly. She was also very friendly and provided a lot of options that were recommended by her and frequently by guests.   I ordered the caramel chicken which came with a large portion of rice. This was a massive portion and I could only eat half of it even though I was very hungry. The chicken was very good and nice and crispy. Very similar to an orange chicken from a chain restaurant but a bit sweeter and overall tasted better.  Overall, great restaurant.. large portions, great service, and affordable.

Yj-zsjBAt06QczAy4O4Dpw.text: One of our regular go to spots when in Vegas. Ashly was wonderful and inviting and took care of us well. Check this spot out for casual easy dining

SBFzx6i4tbMS6qRxjX_l9A.text: The express breakfast is the way to go for a buffet. The orange juice is also amazing, not sure if anything special is done to it but its a must.

vyr0fZ39ql4M1RAJvZ3PvQ.text: I forgot how much I LOVED this place until I came back to eat here on a recent Vegas trip!  Grand Lux Cafe is located inside the Venetian on the Casino floor near the guest elevators.  PROS: -  Located inside the Venetian.  That's a pro in my book since no matter where I stay in Vegas, I always end up somewhere near the Venetian. -  Place is open late!!  Is this place 24 hours?  I'm not sure, but I love the fact that you can go clubbing and come here afterwards. -  Service is fantastic!  We got our food efficiently, everything came out for our group together, and she was attentive. -  Food quality is just delicious!  I got their Chicken Carbonara and it was so creamy.  Bacon bits in there were thick and juicy.  I could have licked the whole plate clean.  Bread they give you was also fluffy and chewy.  Yum!!  -  Ambiance is beautiful!  It's like Cheesecake Factory but a notch fancier. -  There is so much variety with food selection, so this is perfect for if you are in Vegas with a group.  Everybody can find SOMETHING to order on the menu.  CONS: I have none!  That's why this place is getting all 5 stars from me ;)

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

5YyonuIiGQJ68tJ3hn79gA.text: Exactly as described a bit more upscale than Cheesecake Factory same theme.  I had the chicken and waffles - they were only OK...

gsd9eqmicchkb_OI08wrIQ.text: Had the Cuban sandwich and my husband had the chicken and waffles. Food and service was great! Price point was a little much but not surprising for the location

MH954u63CpY5jZZtxk5gFQ.text: My parents have been talking about the ribs and ahi salad they got at the Venetian the last time they were there.  So last weekend, we do the walk from the Aria to the Venetian (really long walk) in search of this restaurant. It seems counterintuitive that this great food comes out of this normal looking casino restaurant, but it really was good.   I've been on a pasta carbonara fix (trying to relive my amazing Rome dining experience), so I ordered it with low expectations since every other place has been terrible. I have to say that this was the best pasta carbonara that I've had outside of Rome. It was a very cheesy cream sauce and with actual thick cut bacon. The whole meal tasted like smoked bacon. The lunch portion was huge and since it was very rich, I couldn't finish it. My husband ordered the short rib burger (short ribs are a topping on the burger) and he liked it a lot. Dad ordered the ribs and mom the ahi salad, which they both loved just as much the first time.   Unfortunately, there were some cons. My husband's burger came without any dressings/sauces, which is a little strange. He had to ask for mayo and our server said he'd have to go to the kitchen to get it. My mom asked for soy sauce and wasabi. Our server told us they only had soy sauce, which was a lie because they had a wasabi dressing for the ahi appetizer. I suspect the wasabi dressing was in the kitchen and our server didn't want to go back after retrieving the mayo.  All in all, I'd definitely go back and I'd order the pasta carbonara (maybe to share next time) in a heart beat.

q0c3pGsm76dzppIrEUfYww.text: The process are steep- $19 for a appetizer plate of 3 min burger/ sliders. It's Vegas and most spots are pricey. I get that. The worst part is the spot is so slow. We visited twice on our trip to Las Vegas last weekend. Both visits  were late night. Both times were waiting and waiting for our food and then much longer for our check. It was a convenient spot with in the hotel we stayed at and that's the only reason we made a second trip.

qgYiGSHShLWoWauMk705eg.text: Took a while for the hostess to seat us even though there were quite a few seats available, but hey no biggie. We finally get seated.         So right off the bf points out is it me or is the cutlery slightly greasy? Lo and behold there's a delightful sprinkle of it on the utensils. We ordered the whole egg omelet with spinach, mushrooms, bacon and cheddar. Eh it was okay I have had way better :/ for cheaper at More Than Waffles in Encino, CA. Belgian Waffles were pretty good but only with lots of butter and syrup.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Vzvqfxj2MX8YOFf0HfPIQA.text: Went here at 3:40 in the morning and again later that evening. Very reasonably priced and their chicken and shrimp crispy spring rolls are really good.

SomAeEy6RkkUBJExuEQOKg.text: Good breakfast spot if your looking for somewhere on the strip. Do you need a mimosa or bloody mary for breakfast? Portions are  large-- perfect for medium to small eaters  to share  a dish. Egg white omlete was good and pavked with filling of  choice. However, the one thi g keeps us going back is the red velvet  pancakes with chocolate chips  and topped with a whip cream drops. No syrup nessessary. Surprisingly this is not a sweet dish so perfect for the dessert lover that doesnt like it sweet and paired with a cup of coffee

W0wzEi83AX8S5_w9yAiYPg.text: We stopped for an early lunch and were seated promptly. Our waitress Anne was pleasant and helpful. I had the chicken and waffles which were good, but the hightlight of the meal was my girlfriend's avocado chipotle burger, it was delicious. This is a place that I will visit again.

_XSaPNslmIKCOhZQA3lQKw.text: BREAKFAST BUFFET   Naila, our server, was super kind and attentive.   Weekend breakfast buffet is usually $25 but on this weekday (between Xmas and New Years) it was only $20.   It's simple and uncomplicated and overall, a really good deal. There's a great variety of pastries, fruit, yogurt, and bread. Eggs are available but there's an omelette station that is way more worth your time. A good selection of toppings and I saw some of them making eggs to order for people who didn't want the scrambled eggs already put out. There's hash, bacon, sausage, and waffles.  Drinks are included- this is huge! Coffee is almost $5 and juice is almost $7 so I got both.   While the overall buffet is not large or glamorous it's a great deal considering it's on the strip (in the Venetian). If you're looking at any egg dish on the menu and a beverage, may as well go for the buffet.

h3JQmXgVJzY0IyfCYTV9wQ.text: Overall service was ehh.  We came here for breakfast and things started off great. We decide to do regular menu so we asked for a couple mins to make up our mind. Not quite sure if our server went on a break and passed our table to someone else but she literally became M.I.A. After waiting for about 18 mins, not being acknowledged by ANYONE, my boyfriend decided to ask the server attending the table next to us to please call our server over but instead she said she could take our order herself. When our original server finally appeared again, she seemed very upset with us. She stopped by our table only twice, the second time bringing us the check, mind you we were nowhere near being finished with our food. I felt like we deserved an apology or at least an explanation as to why we were hanging for so long but instead we received discourteous service. What a shame.   Food was bomb though!

kG4P4bOTkpTiiV8N89-4Dg.text: Was so excited to eat here after our location in LA closed. I got the chicken mushroom soup and strawberry pear salad. About 6hrs later I got severely ill and I'm 33weeks pregnant. Not how I wanted to spend my vacation :(

y0dr2qHbZ6n_H76Sw2VQQQ.text: The Grand Lux is one of those reasonable "Cheesecake Factory" type casino restaurants. They've got a million options from lettuce wraps, burgers, pastas to fake pho.   Good starter bread, but served with cold butter. I guess all restaurants do it, even the nicer.   Bacon cheeseburger - excellent for what it was the fries were good too. In fact, I ate this once when I was sober and again in the middle of the night after a partaking in the typical Vegas festivities. Great work!  Chicken Wings - tender and beautiful. So good I almost at the bones.   Lettuce wraps - taste like lettuce with some meat inside. It was alright.   Would I come back? Hell yes. You can eat here for a lot cheaper than the other casino restaurants. Great for lunches and after midnight meals.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Good ol&#39; American bacon cheeseburger
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken wings
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken lettuce wraps

dbLawVBK9x9UJfeYsl0MPA.text: Huge shout out to Carmen who I think is a gaming manager on the floor. He recommended we come in for lunch! And we where not disappointed! The lettuce wraps puts PF Chang's to shame! Our waitress was prompt and friendly! My lunch portion of pasta and salad was huge! And the Mr really enjoyed his burger and salad. We will definitely come back our next time in Vegas. When you sit down they hand you a delicious basket of warm bread!

BclHO8CpoSRQ0tc4zaJX0A.text: More upscale Cheesecake Factory - literally same owners. Brings a precision and love to your favorite dishes (avocado chipotle burger, chicken pot pie, Asian chicken salad) with some creative flair (Asian nachos were amazing).   Great if you're looking for a solid meal to kick off your adventures. 3rd time here this visit due to convenience and late hours haha.   Generous portions and friendly environment.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Asian chicken salad...my gf&#39;s favorite. She gets it every time.
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Asian nachos...YES! These were amazing. I did not expect this blend of flavored to be as delicious as they were (1+1=3)
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken pot pie, classic but nothing to write home about

2b6X2y0_Z_11f49d2rM_rQ.text: Came here on a Sunday morning with an angry stomach for brunch and there was a line almost out the door. My stomach couldn't wait, but I really wanted to try the breakfast items here after seeing pictures on yelp. We stood in line and asked the hostess how long it would take. She quoted us 5-10 minutes and before you know it, 5 minutes is up and we were seated. Don't overestimate the long lines, this cafe is huge and comes with lots of indoor and outdoor seating so the lines move fast. I'm so happy we got to try this place because it truly did not disappoint! What we ordered:  -Freshly squeezed grapefruit and orange juice: fresh and worth every penny! The grapefruit juice is a bit bitter for my taste but if you like the fruit, you'll like the juice. Served in wine glasses so the portions are on the smaller side. -Grand lux french toast with strawberries: perfect! Six pieces of thick toast sprinkled with powered sugar, strawberries, and maple syrup.  -Eggs bendict with hashbrowns: perfectly poached eggs atop canadian bacon and an english muffin drizzled with hollandaise sauce. Dish comes with hash browns on the side.   I highly recommend all the dishes we tried and will definitely come back again soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Freshly squeezed grapefruit juice (left) and orange juice (right)
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggs Benedict with hashbrowns
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grand lux French toast with strawberries

JjLo1BbMrwcgX126TJmx3w.text: Was in Vegas for cousins 40th weekend of 4/6-8/18 & stayed at Venetian.  Had late dinner inside the hotel at Grand Lux Cafe and the food was BOMB!  We were four gals and each ordered their own thing and we tasted a little bit from each other  I had the Spicy Ginger Beef - off the Foods of the world menu and every bite was delicious.  This place set the standard for my tastebuds in sin city.  The tenderloin was like butter in my mouth, the veggies firm and crunchy to the bite and the mushrooms flavor came through on their own.  The ginger was sharp as it should be but not overpowering. This was probably the best meal I had all weekend.  Friend 2 had BBQ baby back ribs that were flavored all the way to the bone, so good and tender and moist. Those were 2nd best  Friend 3 had Volcano Shrimp that were battered in light tempura and were large and succulent. The spicy chili aioli was not too sweet and not too spicy- perfect little app. Lastly the buffalo wings were a disappointment- the wings themselves were dry and over cooked and were cold when they arrived.  I give 4 stars because the sever was just ok- we had to call him to replenish and wings were meh.  Otherwise it was a lovely easy late night hang out spot.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

gL2d0hAlBHapDObjDowkMw.text: Tried some salads previously when visiting Vegas and tried  egg white omelette today , ok food nothing spectacular but healthy options abound and good for a post workout meal .   Place is open 24 hours as well and prices for the Strip

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Egg white omelette with veggies, fruit cup, and whole wheat toast

C8x7N5YZ8dzjpRkRosj2Yw.text: Accommodated my party of 16. Great food and service. Beautiful cafe. All food was amazing with semi big portions.

NazWMLVkv8eaJntsHQThbA.text: I want people on yelp to know that this is the place to eat if you are doing a late night drive in to vegas. Lux is open until 6 am and has a fantastic menu and cooking staff that will not disappoint.   I highly recommend 2 servings of the bread because it is just amazing. The appetizers are also first class. Most restaurants do not have main courses that are as good as these appetizers. We last had the ahi tuna and the ruben egg rolls, both were simply amazing.   This is also the only place I order a salad for my main course because their seafood salad is the best thing out there. No other salad compares in both beauty and taste.   All I can say is that we will be back soon.

acpHURKS6t60JGLTKPETiA.text: Located in the beautiful Venetian, This is one of our go to spots when we come to Vegas. The breakfast buffet is worth the money. It has a great variety of delicious foods. The biscuit and gravy and the chicken & waffles were delicious. I also like that this place is open 24/hours. The large menu is sure to have a little bit of something for everyone!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

5sHEM35w4alypk88KgV5fA.text: This is now my favorite goto late nite spot. Chicken Waffles are on point!! Crispy chicken tenders, yummy soft waffle, and that carmel tasting syrup  was perfect!

LPENxBmJpuAmhJGpix8W2Q.text: Casino-level in the Venetian, possibly still considered in their restaurant row, I don't know for sure. Anyways, good food and not too expensive for The Strip. Again, it feels like Cheesecake Factory, but I don't see a problem with that.  This time around, the service was just really really slow. The server was apologetic about it, but everything about our experience was slow. Good thing I was in no hurry!

OSC317DfLPfvB-yh5gebnw.text: Excellent weekday breakfast. It is hard to tell on the website if they serve the breakfast buffet daily, but at this location they do. Full omlete stations, pastries, waffles, fruits, oatmeal, meats, etc. All excellent and very fast. Highly recommend the breakfast. They also have a full breakfast menu with larger dishes if you don't want the buffet.

tB7av09gFeMPKzCoavh2KQ.text: Great breakfast here a few days before Christmas! The Cheesecake Factory influence meant that this place was dimly lit, but with an extensive menu, below average noise level, and great service. The service is why they are getting 5 stars from me! I ordered a side of avocado with my huevos rancheros, and when they arrived, I was so hungry I didn't notice they were missing. However, our server did! She hurried off to get it, and halved the price of the avocado add-on, which she really didn't have to do. She was attentive and friendly throughout our whole meal, and generous with the coffee and water refills. I ate everything on my plate! Thanks to my fellow Yelpers for the awesome find. :)

-5axIerA8aKPZrjJ1ia6ng.text: Hungover. Must have food. Need coffee stat!!!  Those were the thoughts when we wandered over to Grand Lux Cafe. A quick 5 minute wait then seated promptly, and water and coffee served up within minutes. This place is huge inside. I ordered a basic eggs, bacon, hashbrowns, and toast. They use delicious applewood smoked bacon so that's a huge plus in my book. My nephew got a side of sausage and biscuits and a side of bacon.  Only issue was service was a bit slow after we ordered. We needed coffee bad to chase away the effects of last nights vodka, and refills were a bit slow in coming. Overall this was a pretty good place to eat, not as fancy as other dining options in the Venetian. Better than most cafe's at casinos.

61kjc6-T5Prb1mBVlajUAw.text: I've been to this restaurant multiple times now. Remember, the grand lux cafe is just an upgrade from the Cheesecake Factory chain. If you look at the decor and the menu, then you know they are run by the same group.   The food is good. Wine list quite nice. Food is unexceptional.   Customer Service is pretty damned good.   I am on the FMD. I phoned in early. Do you have the food I need (brown rice).  Yes, indeed, they do!  When ordering, I think my server slightly misunderstood. I wanted broiled not poached. But I could eat it. Yeah!  Came back to fix minor stuff again and again.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon 3way redone custom for me on the FMD. Super servers!

8j7dDpnb5rrjrgb9O0uqjw.text: This was my go to spot while staying at the Palazzo. I swear I could eat the chicken parm sandwhich over and over. The portion is HUGE and it was just delicious. The prices are pretty good for what you're getting and where you are as well.

W4DIgdtH-5LGOZJ6T14Cvw.text: I absolutely love this place.  Everytime I go to Vegas I make sure I stop by here and eat.  The portions are more than enough m.  Always great customer service and the food is amazing.  Highly recommend this place.  Also they have a great menu selection

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Huge portions not super expensive.  Great atmosphere

UAGlEOnsNAYvBcrOHbvAgA.text: You should know Grand Lux is part of CheeseCake Factory.  If you're like me and don't prefer to frequent chains while on vacation, this would've been good to know ahead of time.  As we were looking at the menu, one of us even commented on how Grand Lux seemed liked a Cheesecake copycat . . until we noticed the Cheesecake Factory screen saver on the cashier monitors and confirmed it with our server.  Still, I'm not taking anything away from the quality of their food.  Just like CF, the food is high quality but like CF there's little regard for healthfulness of the preparation so I'm sure everyone of our dishes were close to 2,000 calories.  GL is open 24 hours so a good option for late night munchies.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

abXORT-PeZXiJpR9-YJb7w.text: My drunk after club spot!  If you did not know, Grand Lux is the same company as Cheesecake Factory, just fancier and more expensive.  I always order to go in the bakery area.  Sausage, Pepperoni & Mushrooms Pizza - $14 - Good fresh cooked pizza. The size is pretty small for the price.   Pasta with Chicken, Sun-Dried Tomato and Mushrooms - $18.95 - Go to dish here. Pasta is cooked to a perfect al dente. The chicken is cooked well and the tomato and mushrooms are the perfect addition. The sauce is cheesy garlicy creamy perfection!  Love this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pasta with Chicken, Sun-Dried Tomato, and Mushrooms - $18.95
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sausage, Pepperoni, &amp; Mushroom Pizza - $14

SUzX3KpaMeoemiH-EVJZDA.text: Server was SHELLEY D   Seating was estimated 10min, 1 min later we were being seated.  Menu options had everything we craved since me and my gf were craving different things and were indecisive.  Got the steak sandwich and she got the Lemon Chicken Piccata lunch serving (huge!). Server was so on top of everything and so sweet, real professional. Water kept full. Nothing missed or forgotten and I generally have many asks.  Saw we were ready and came to pack our food to go for us. So fast I never saw the check on the table and when I put my card down it was back before I realized she picked it up.  Great setting and vibes.   Amazing experience!

cP3y8lATgC8ucSAGKutQeQ.text: No wait on a Sunday was great! Fresh warm bread basket was yummy. I ordered the grand club sandwich and it was good, but on the dry side. I ordered a side of ranch, seriously one of the best ranch I've ever had. My husband ordered the bourbon chicken he didn't like the flavor it was kinda of bland. The service was ok we asked our waitress for more bread and never received it.

qiI6lpKLbhLk8n1MWYf9yA.text: After a great performance by Chicago in the Venetian theatre, we had a hungry party of 8 at 11pm.  They were able to seat us right away. We all ordered different things from sandwiches, salads, etc. I was honestly too tired to pay attention but it all came out looking delicious and huge. I got the lemon chicken piccatta. Fantastic with mushroom and artichoke hearts on top of a thinly pounded and battered chicken, all on a huge portion of Angel hair pasta. My other friend got the pastrami sandwich and my other friend got the warm chicken salad.  I didn't catch the name or take pics of the other end of the table but everyone was extremely happy with their choices. My only bummer was that they said they couldn't make an espresso martini, yet they serve espresso, vodka, Kailua. Hmmm? Inexperienced bartender? So I just ordered my vodka on the rocks and an espresso and mixed my own drink sans the simple syrup and Kailua  (save the calories for dinner, right?)It was delicious...good espresso. Lots of choices, good prices, good flavor. Very similar to the Cheesecake factory...same restaurant family I think. Great place in the Venetian!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lempn Chicken piccatta
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Warm chicken salad

A_M_D5IQbMpEm2EsI0sIzg.text: Overpriced hotel restaurant food as usual. This one wasn't too bad I guess. Nothing on the menu really stood out to me. I tried looking at yelp reviews to help me choose I ended up with a pasta something Sunday pasta? See it didn't stick with me because it wasn't all "WOW". But sure if you don't feel like exploring the strip, and staying in then yeah try this place out.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My friend didn&#39;t like hers either
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

kZWdVm45j_TSVeCNVxeQlA.text: So traditionally I'd venture out into some unknown cuisine since I'm in Vegas, but I was so overwhelmed by the many options and the varying taste palates of my party so we came here. We were immediately seated and brought water and then left for dead. I joke...kinda...but I think they thought that's all we came for. That had to be it. Eventually our server Whitney) came by, it was a Monday night with a steady crowd, by no means packed, but she moved with a sense of urgency.   The onion soup was probably the show stopping dish...think French onion, without the bread/cheese goop and crank up the flavor. The buffalo chicken rolls were stellar too. Then the ahi tuna ceviche, they tried, there's just nothing to brag about. They played it pretty safe. Those Asian nachos though; let's take a second, it's a peanut butter tasting bbq sauce based rice cake with chicken on it...thingy. Ugh! I'm sorry but I can't for the life of me imagine anyone enjoying that.   Like the real party girls that we are we finished off with Earl Grey tea before taking the city by storm.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken and Waffle...red velvet pancakes
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ahi tuna ceviche
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Asian nachos

Dz0u5znSqoOvp1v3NErq_A.text: Surprised to see all the good reviews on Yelp. We went for breakfast and the food was a little too greasy. The coffee was diluted and adding cream and sugar couldn't save it. The mimosas were good though. Our server was pre-occupied with a bunch of tables but was very friendly.

R72OuHDbm3rsVnH44Vc5fQ.text: Loved this place at Venetian. Tried their thanksgiving dinner, Indo-chinese chicken/shrimp and their house-special fish. Food was very tasty and their portions are huge. We ended up eating half for dinner the next day (kept in igloo). the waiter was super nice and very polite. the atmosphere was good too. I would go there again when in Vegas.

Xt_xMnq1JIkXV_AuhcLX9Q.text: Came in around 1am and for the late hour I'd say this is about as good as you'll find. Service and food were both very good. Plus you gotta support Venetian for not charging for parking :)

HKkrHHBehqTHjFC2FVNgOg.text: We stayed at the Palazzo which was amazing and in the casino there is the Grand Luxe Cafe. This is NOT the one in the Venetian (although I heard they are good as well). The only reason I am saying that is because I can't seem to find the one in the Palazzo. The food, drinks, and service was AMAZING!!!! The breakfast buffet was so delicious and fresh! Coffee was great! The omelette station was friendly and made great omelettes. The fruit was fresh and tasted sweet. The waffles, bacon, and short rib hash browns were the bomb! Deborah was our waitress and she was super friendly, funny and attentive! We came back for lunch and ordered the chicken pot pie, eggplant fritters, and poke tacos. All I can say is WOW!!! Presentation was amazing, tasted wonderful, and that pot pie was so good! The bartender made perfect Bloody Mary's! Jose was our server. He was very friendly, attentive, gave great recommendations, and also was fun! We loved the food so much that we asked the chef to come out so we could thank him! His name was Christopher. He was also very friendly and his team executed the menu's food perfectly! The manager Mardy came over to see how we were and we told her all about it! We actually had a few things in common! She was great conversation. We stayed at the Palazzo with our friends who were there were getting married and Mardy made reservations for our party to come for breakfast the morning before the wedding. They had our table ready on time and Ralina was our server. She did a wonderful job and even brought out something special for the bride and groom! The lattes were off the chain! All and all I know this is long but I had to share. We are going to come back to the Palazzo just so we can enjoy the Grand Luxe Cafe! MUAH!

F4FLFduOU8gn0pGzB_otVw.text: First time here and I've gotta say, FANTASTIC. Was recommended by close friends and I can't wait to visit again.  We had a late dinner after seeing Celine Dion.  I've had many versions of Chicken Pot Pie but not like this.  The contents were prepared like a soup and a large single crust resting on top.  Killer. Easily the best PotPie I've ever had.  Huge menu. Lots of types of dishes.  You won't be sorry.

LRLeSXmrBlywZIQJUMPA3Q.text: One of the most horrible services. We asked if could order some cake since it was my birthday. She said only 1 slice for 7 people. We were like yeah, we will order some drinks too. Then she was called the another person, who stared Saying the same thing that hey you have to order. We told her ok we will get it to go. It felt like she didn't want to give us service. The we wanted our order and the bartender literally didn't take the order for 20 mins. Dude how long does it take to get a couple of cake slices out. They don't represent service at Vegas. Killing the entertainment brand and vibe.

OH-dmBL5bo8FzUST-lHHjQ.text: Not bad... casual diner style. I believe this place opens very late.. 24hours perhaps. It's not the best, but def better than other 24hours diners around here

yaXIwsPG6YtDSovYOzvBWg.text: I was so excited to come eat here this weekend but I was SUPER disappointed. Our server had the worst attitude, my food was brought up way later than when everyone else's food came out and when it finally came after everyone else was already done eating they didn't even bring out all my food also my soon to be mother in law told the server that her glass was dirty and the server picked it up and was examining it as if she was lying. We complained to the server and she said it came out late because it was ordered later then everyone else. Yes it was but only by a few mins !!!! We're all a group we should all get our food at the same time. The manager came out and we told her what happened and she didn't even apologize and she said she couldn't comp us the meal in full because it was ordered separately. I gave this place 2 stars because the food I did get tasted pretty good. Probably won't be back. I'll be sticking to the cheesecake factory where I am never disappointed!!! Maybe you should take some lessons from them grand lux !!!

GjSW1canSRwPHN27csT7iA.text: Nestor was fantastic and so was the ranch. He anticipated every need and the food was quick and great and even had all of our modifications perfect. Surprisingly great experience for a touristy spot!

UDZnXS3mUdVSGGclWxW6dg.text: This was soooo good! Get the Churro French Toast, it was absolutely delicious! We sat in the outside area near casino and the smoke didn't bother me at all. It was the morning, on a Tuesday, but I'm usually sensitive to the smoky smell in casinos and I didn't smell any while eating. Great service and really good food!!

UrL-PNGmUgByrVY8vjjlQw.text: The food is great and the portions are a good size.  I had the Chipotle Avocado Burger that was amazing.  Decor is really nice and the service was fast.  Only bad thing is their draft beer selection.

For desert, try the bignets or apple pastry (can't remember exact name and need to order 20 min before). Drinks are nice. Pm6X0bKiU76DVUeFxbdVbg.text: Everytime I visit this location it is super busy but they always manage to get me seated right away! I love coming to this particular one rather than the one inside of the Palazzo. They are both a grand lux however I have always received not only better food but also service at this one! The Grand Lux Margarita has got to be one of the best margarita's that i've had whenever i've been to a place like Grand Lux! As far as the entree's I really like the Thai Chicken Pizza which was removed from the menu so I eat the Chicken & Waffles depending on the night i order it, it's either really bland or over seansoned. The fish basket is also another good choice.

ptHVorlMUOkrP6k6ZfBn7Q.text: This review is for the Grand Lux Cafe at the Palazzo Hotel's banquet services.  We had lunch at the restaurant last Spring while scoping out venues for our intimate wedding.  We noticed right away that they had a private dining room that had a podium and audio visual capabilities.  We decided in June to have an August wedding, and decided on the Grand Lux after discovering that their banquet prices were the most reasonable out of all the Las Vegas Strip options.  Yes, it's an upscale Cheesecake Factory.  I happen to enjoy the Cheesecake Factory.  I sent an inquiry email to the restaurant and received a phone response less than two hours later from Rich, the Events Manager.  He promptly emailed me a list of dinner options along with prices.  Even with the "plus plus'-es (tip, gratuity, etc.), the per person costs did not break the bank!  Rich also provided his favorite meal options as well as the ones that his customers enjoyed the most.  For the record, we settled on the Filet Mignon ($10 extra), Miso Salmon, Madera Chicken, and Pasta Fresca (for the vegetarians).  We met with Rich and his banquet staff two days prior to our reception, where we handed off our wedding favors and gave instructions.  Rich had our printed menus with meal selections and it looked fabulous.  We decided against bringing our own centerpieces since it was a destination wedding, so they agreed to put flameless votives on the tables.  We were already impressed with their hospitality and our event hadn't even happened yet.  Onward to our wedding day...the room was beautifully set up and Josh and Karen took over all responsibilities.  They showed us how to work the sound system and attended to all our needs.  Our guests complimented on the menu selections -- the filet mignon seemed to be the favorite.  I'm not sure I can adequately describe how the Grand Lux Cafe went above and beyond the call to make our wedding reception everything we wanted it to be.  You will not find another place on the Strip that will treat you like royalty without running you into wedding debt!  If I could give them more than five stars, I would.  I highly, highly recommend the Grand Lux Cafe  at the Palazzo Hotel if you are looking for a private intimate (less than 80) wedding reception.  Call Rich and book your wedding reception there today!

SWc_VZ3vz6mQzxacvnVeaA.text: What a Gem! Well you know those nights where you stumble upon a restaurant and just say why not because your just so dayummm HANGRY!!! ( I do know how to spell ;) Yes I mean HUNGRY and ANGRY at the same time!  Well this was one of those times! I have to say I absolutely enjoyed my whole experience here for sure!!! First of it was busy, right after the MMA Awards. I was surprised we were seated so promptly! Excellent customer service.  Our waitress had a strong accent and was a little older with short golden brown hair, she was absolutely a doll!! Had a Monte Christo sandwich with fries and 2 spicy Bloody Mary's. I basically just swallowed my sandwich whole and scarfed down my fries!  Loved the Bloody Mary's. Everyone (all 6 people ) loved their food! Love this place and will most definitely be back just for that sandwich alone!!

Y8GroshGCot52QqezRmAlg.text: Probably one of the best 24 hour diner/cafes I have ever been too! ONLY in Vegas!   Great place to get your munchies fulfilled after partying the night away. Food here taste like heaven! My girls and I have this routine where we wake up late, eat around 2 pm, get ready at 6 pm to go out....actually go out....then finish clubbing at around 3 am and by then...we're STARVING! So this place is so awesome that it is open all the time!   The food isn't gross either. The portions are large and the prices are just right! They even give you bread while you are waiting for your food. I got the Modern Cuban Sandwich. Fresh fries and the sandwich was so good with the sweet meat and a hint of sourness due to the pickle and mustard. Really good! I couldn't even finish it and ended up saving it for the next day.   Everything on the menu sounds good here. It was such a struggle for me to settle with the Modern Cuban Sandwich. My gf's breakfast  sandwich looked amazing! The egg looked so fluffy and vibrant next to the bacon, cheese, slabbed between two slices of bread. GAH.   This place reminds me of a Cheesecake Factory! Their cake options looked so tempting...but we were already feasting late at night...we decided to have portion control.   Need to come back here to try their dinner menu!  Asian Nachos? Chicken & Waffles? All the food looks so good!   Best all day everything. Good looking breakfast, lunch, and dinner, late night!

YCW34sAzZFZDD6CcxjschQ.text: Very good spot for chilaquiles.  This version of chilaquiles is:  Eggs Scrambled with Tortilla Chips, Red and Yellow Peppers, Chiles, Onion and Tomato Covered with Ranchero Sauce, Corn, Black Beans, Avocado, Cilantro and Pepper-Jack Cheese  We had very good service and the ambiance is nice.

fAnfYdvNGadRN78DfD06Ow.text: Was fabulous restaurant, i went there with my wife after the show she ordered Asian salad and i got chicken breast sandwich with salad and apetaisar, tthe food was delicious and service was nice.  I'll back again if i have a chance.

9ynW0BRseDkA_j6hKh2PTQ.text: Best described as "A High End Cheesecake Factory".  I heard that it is run by the same company that owns cheesecake factory so it makes sense.  Stopped in here for Breakfast with some friends before G2E at the sands convention center.  It was packed but we only had a 10 minute wait.  The atmosphere is luxury meets comfort.  The breakfast menu has just about everything you could ask for, and I was in the mode for some french toast.  I Got the banana brioche french toast and my mind was blown.  Not only was practically just a loaf of bread cut in half and turned into french toast, but it was really freaking good.  I washed it down with a mimosa that was good, but I was hoping it would be a little more than 3 ounces since it was $7.

5wbxSXSofMw5nXgJCSswvA.text: M6 friend was obsessed with beignet we came here end up having the buffet not bad not too many selection but still ok

XLyvlcGs4f6YKMPo-6rdwA.text: The service was fantastic, especially for a last minute group of 15. The food was great, especially for the price. Our entire group was very happy.

rvMUWL32HEKcv4hZ0krc7g.text: I came here on a Friday around 4pm with three friends after a long drive up to Vegas from LA. We were seated as soon as we walked through the door, and waters, and bread quickly came our way, which were much appreciated since we were famished.   After a quick peek at the appetizer section of the menu we placed an order for some Buffalo Chicken Rolls, and by the time those suckers arrived we were able to decide what we wanted for our main course. I opted for the Lunch Special Pasta and Salad with the Pasta Telephono. But more on that later. The Buffalo Chicken Rolls (which came with 6 pieces) were crispy on the outside, and warm, gooey, cheesy, and buffalo-y on the inside. Plus they weren't too filling. So we had plenty of room for our entrees.   Just as we polished off our appetizer, our lunch entrees arrived. And they were HUGE. The side salad was pretty standard. But the pasta was cheesy (notice a theme here?), well-cooked, and tasty. It was basically an adult mac n cheese. And it was so gigantic that I had enough leftover for a late night snack.   And, best of all, the bill came to under $20 per person. It was so very reasonable, especially in Vegas where everything is overpriced. I suggest checking this place out: it'll give you the most grub for your buck (except for maybe a buffet).

k-gXMyveUDj6sL_GD0IPGQ.text: I am not sure why this place got such great review.   We went there for Saturday brunch as a party of 6. We got seated right away as the restaurant was not busy. Our server took 30m to take our order and he only had another table to serve. Attitude at this restaurant is something else. We asked to place order and other servers refused to take our order or communicate with our server for us.  It took another 30m for our food to come out, and the food was not that impressive. Nobody brought us ketchup or refill our drinks. When we ask the servers to do so, they didn't want to do that and told us we had to speak to our main server (who was nowhere to be found). At the end, we finished our meal without condiment or water.  I felt like I could have been better off eating at McDonald. At least, they will give you ketchup there.

4_NoYETLVaWBx5CsDhs61A.text: I really didn't enjoy my meal or service here, but am giving it an extra star because I think it was a fluke.  We sat in the bar area and the service was painstakingly slow--which can kill a vibe if you are just starting your day.  We ordered one burger and a round of drinks and it took forever...so long it almost ruined our vibe...almost...but then it didn't...because let's face it, we are in Vegas!  On to another bar and can't decide if I'll be back.  It's got the makings of a positive lunch experience, so I might be able to forgive the over-cooked burger and slow service.  I'll let you know.

Zodfk1QxukafgD3-jIGbsQ.text: Ate here 3 times in one weekend -____-  Generally for Grand Lux, we head towards to location closer to Palazzo, but the two is exactly the same.  Since we stayed at the Venetian this time around, instead of venturing out into the hot Vegas summer, we stayed on the Venetian property for the majority of the time and Grand Lux is a favorite among my friends, which also meant we ate a lot of Grand Lux.  There is a food court, but we weren't really feeling it.    Grand Lux is good, especially for large groups because it is a huge restaurant and they can easily accommodate bigger groups.  The menu is also very diverse, from breakfast to Asian-inspired dishes.  It's owned by Cheesecake Factory, so I always thought of Grand Lux as a very expensive diner.  Went for the Chicken & Waffles, Short Rib Grilled Cheese Sandwich, and a Lunch combo for my visits this time around.  The Chicken & Waffles is a favorite of mine.  Belgian waffle that's topped with fried chicken strips and comes with this great brown butter maple.  The grilled cheese sandwich was the first time, and while good, it was just a bit too greasy for me.  Lunch combo with salad, soup, and sandwich is a solid choice for a little variety.  Grand Lux always have good soups at all times, and this time, got to try the Chicken Mushroom Cream, as well as the Chicken Tortilla.  The Chicken Tortilla seriously tastes like liquidfied nachos!  It's pretty damn delicious haha.  Also tried my friend's jambalaya.  Not even close to being the real thing, but not gonna lie, it is pretty damn tasty.  It's more like a stir-fried dish with cajun spices & seasoning!  The place is open 24/7, which is another reason why we came here so many times in one weekend.  After a night out, Grand Lux.  Dinner?  Grand Lux.  Another night out, sure why not Grand Lux again.    Need to convince the others to eat something else next time.

iGY784tKlkEium-8VhvRZw.text: I have eaten at this restaurant many times over the years. I love it because of the diversity of the menu and generally good food.  This week was no exception. We ordered spring rolls filled with potatoes. They were not as warm as they should have been but they were still absolutely delicious. My friend ordered a paste dish which she enjoyed but it was very rich. I had the Asian nachos. They were unique and quite good.  Service was good. She wasn't the most astute server but adequate and friendly enough.  This is a great place for good food and when you with a big group with a lot of different preferences or don't know what you want to eat. Lots of great choices.

Qi8dwNvSffWoHgHBct6lmA.text: This has to be one of the best breakfasts in Vegas!  In fact the whole menu is really good. Great value for money and great atmosphere! I came here after having so many POOR experiences in Vegas it was a refreshing change to actually like somewhere. The waiting staff are very quick and it has a great range of food.  Will be back every trip to Vegas!

4diemUmTpR6dA8QulP9OzQ.text: Came for breakfast and loved it! Had the corned beef hash which was mostly corned beef and not like other places where it's out of a can. This was good quality chunks and shredded bits of corned beef. The egg was over cooked slightly as I asked for over easy and it was over medium but so so good I didn't ding them for it. The price was high at $14.95 but you get so much it was definitely worth it. For our gluten free friends this place is great and they clearly mark which things can be made gluten free. Will be returning!

Xn_18nuwORpwMBUXKiUxhw.text: I love this place! Located in the Venetian is a fancy pretty restaurant always crackin' with ppl. Surprisingly its not expensive, $10 can get you a fat portion of food that can last you 2 meals if you wanted to. Its similar to the Cheesecake Factory but its in veeeeeegass and its open late nights for all the hungry drunkies! There's so much on the menu we didn't know where to start. Last year I had the cobb salad (wonderful fat salad) this year I went for the buffalo chicken sandwich. It was okay, wasn't spicy enough. My bf had jimbalaya and it was hella good. My friend really enjoyed his pastrami sandwich, finished all of it before we did.   As for dranks, I had the patron paloma. It was so good I could barely taste the alcohol. My sandwich+drink was probably $25, pretty pricey for a meal but I had leftovers of sandwich and fries for later (which were never touched and left at Cosmo hotel room garbage). Hehe.  Service was excellent, our waitress was funny, we tipped her well.

hXwZ0GhimyJM-kdoiAZojQ.text: So many places to eat in Vegas, and we are here almost everyday. Open 24 hrs, this place was perfect for after late night adventures. The meals are hearty and filling with huge portions! We were staying at the Venetian, so this restaurant was so convenient! That's not the only reason we kept going back though! I'd visit the Venetian or Palazzo special just to eat here!

ROO8idqah8axPYWQFITmlA.text: This place was awesome... The food was delicious and our waiter Joey was the best.. I really loved his energy and his attentiveness.. The prices are also reasonable..I would recommend that everyone coming to Vegas should eat here...

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy ginger beef... So delicious and very filling...

L-sNWloe4OQTlJo72sApqQ.text: We came here on a Sunday morning around 9 AM and were seated immediately. Overall, the service was great. The servers were all very attentive and helpful.  I ordered the Eggs, any style, Hash Brown Potatoes with Toast and chicken mango sausages. The eggs were cooked the way I requested and you could actually taste he mango in the sausages. I enjoyed every part of this dish. Though to be fair, it's a pretty straightforward dish to make. My girlfriend ordered the "The Best" Eggs Benedict with Ham & Hollandaise. It was good but not "the best." The eggs were cooked pretty well (the yolk was runny as they should be but it was a little undercooked since the egg white was a bit soft and runny as well). The ham was very tasty. The hollandaise sauce, however, was too salty. The English muffin was also burnt (too black and hard to cut) and not too pleasant after it soaked up all the hollandaise sauce. The hashbrowns on both dishes were excellent.   Overall, it was a pleasant experience though I'd recommend others to avoid "the best" eggs benedict.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

r4TeV5SObEtIuc6XjN4_Sw.text: Not that impressed at all. Stopped in for breakfast. Our server was very nice an attentive but that is the end of the "good." The hostess was not helpful and did not even smile at all; borderline rude. The atmosphere was no better than a Denny's and the food was slightly better and completely overpriced. The Palazzo touts itself as being upscale but this restaurant was anything but. I would find a new manager to completely upgrade the experience...and not a former manager from Denny's.

-tKFIU-KjKKokVhjxlvNhg.text: 08/03/2017  So this was a surprise... I thought Grand Lux was just another casino coffee shop. I was not thrilled by the notion of dining here but what a pleasant surprise.  The greeting was very nice and we were seated immediately. The size of this place was shocking... it looks a lot smaller from the outside. The menu is rather extensive. We were there between breakfast and lunch (11-ish) so got to seriously consider both. We ate breakfast. A few breakfast items were no longer available because that grill area had already been turned around for lunch preparation. No worries.. there were many great options to consider.  A couple of omelets, a waffle, and a smoked salmon platter later... our appetites had been sated (that's the past participle of 'satisfied' if anyone was wondering).  Prices are reasonable. The restaurant is comfortable. The service was swell.

8PVrAY5hvjx1tPB0Swi6zg.text: I recently had to work a convention in Vegas and ended up eating at the Grand Lux several times.  Let me say the portions are very generous, I can eat a lot when I'm hungry and this place always gave me enough for at least 1 1/2 meals.  I had the fish and chips, the caramel chicken, and one of the pastas, and they were all really good.  I ate there with my co-workers, and we were all real happy with the place.  The main thing I want to compliment the Grand Lux about is one of their servers, his name is Jon Fortich (correct spelling, I hope).  I was so tired on the last day of my convention I forgot to take my credit card back after I paid my bill.  I was freaking out, but when I called the restaurant they told me Jon had turned it in to the manager, and he had it locked in their safe and I could pick it up the next day.  I was so relieved!  In short, excellent food, big portion, and great service.  That's why this is my go to place to eat whenever I'm in Vegas!

pxe3JcjPQbBXL_tuu7FEwg.text: My overall favorite place to eat in Las Vegas. Pasta dishes are really good and portions are insane. Also a great place for people watching at any hour.

w3TCyXgaKLHtV-JaRlhzSA.text: So much food! Was good but wow so much food! Beware, the French Toasts are huge!  Service was also pretty decent, would go again.

xf6AEuhwI7wSRNXcunXI4w.text: The food here is amazing, You must try the cucumber and mint lemonade it is awesome!!! Our waitress was very friendly and answered any questions we had regarding the food or what her opinion may be on certain dishes. The atmosphere is a intimate setting, Dimly lit with a upscale feel due to the decor. You don't have to dress up but I would recommend bringing a small jacket or sweater it is a bit chilly inside. Overall I enjoyed this cafe and would return again whenever I'm in vegas.

V-jnx3Dzse3YBoyu2QGaDQ.text: What a way to start the day! Grand Lux looks and feels like a Cheesecake Factory inside a casino resort. Definitely not somewhere the average person could dine out on the regular, unless you are burning an exorbitant amount of calories every day.  Yes there are healthy options but when in Rome...  I enjoyed a breakfast sandwich served on a buttery croissant. Whether they make the pastries in house or not, it was glorious bread!   Also part of the order included a yogurt bowl and short stack of pancakes. Not a typical Wednesday ordeal but tasty nonetheless.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast sandwich and hash browns

uwyN4LCySo2CeLqmbFUGEw.text: Grand Lux Cafe is located in The Venetian Las Vegas  and prides itself on being "a culinary world tour" with an American spin on things. Stoppng by the cafe is somewhat of a tradition and its is an absolute MUST whenever I'm in town with  a party full of picky eaters.   The  menu is pretty big and contains everything from craft cocktails, appetizers, tapas-sized dishes, sandwiches, burgers, pastas, salads, and the list goes on. The portions are huge and i'm happy to say that  i've never left this place unsatisfied with quality or taste.   As an added bonus, there is brunch offered every weekend and the cocktails are sure to please. The Strawberry Bellini, Mimosa, Sparkling Rose, and/or Spicy Mary will quench the biggest thirst and leave you with warm fuzzy feelings.  5 stars for the establishment and those who work here. Thank you for always putting customers first and never hesitating to make tweeks and changes to my dishes whenever i stop by. Keep up the great work- hopefully i'll be seeing you a lot sooner than later =)

Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wood Grilled BBQ Burger
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Complimentary Bread

WNoKlt2n_0ss4mxt2eluzQ.text: One of my favorite chain restaurants. I think it is a sister restaurant of Cheesecake Factory. Sitting outside is perfect for people watching around the Venetian lobby. You will see a lot of interesting people walk by so I would recommend sitting there.   The menu is really big. There is something for everyone. It's mainly American food with burgers sandwiches salad and pasta dishes. Trust me, you'll find something delicious and to your liking.   We ordered the potato egg rolls. And omg this dish is amazing. If you love mashed potatoes you're going to love this dish. It's basically an egg roll with mashed potato filling in the inside. It's crunchy on the outside and they put cheese, bacon and green onion on it. Also a side of sour cream for dipping. OMG I dream of these egg rolls. Mmmmm. We also got the Asian nachos. Wow these were amazing too. Basically huge wonton chips seasoned with Asian stuff and a huge portion of rice in the middle to put on top of the chips. These two dishes were more than enough for me and my one friend.   The service was great. Our waitress was attentive and sweet. I loved her. Great girl. There's so many places to eat in vegas. This was a great choice. Still dreaming about those potato egg rolls.... :)

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Double stuffed potato spring rolls. My fav!!
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Asian nachos. Yum!

tpQJDFoCAq25h7UgS5kdZg.text: Visiting this place after a year or so..  Not many vegan option. Veggie burger has eggs in it( pls double make sure with chef) There was one veggie glazed  tofu plate which is removed  Good ambience and staff is friendly and helpful

ZJnYRU_K4so8Vn7huShP1g.text: Dined in on a Thursday morning, ordered the chilaquiles and it was surprisingly amazing. Very different but really good. The service was very very slow in bringing out our breakfast, hopefully they can improve on that while they serve buffet as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chilaquiles

R6qAutL93jyBbVGqtprRGA.text: Pizza was horrible. Asian nachos were great. Spinach dip was plain. Service was friendly. Not a necessary stop when there are so many choices in Vegas.

WrNhHfF2CM-kI7kp2zJbhQ.text: Grand Luxe Cafe, of the Cheesecake Factory family, is a great place for a family to eat in Vegas. The portions are VERY large which is NOT criticism at all! The appetizers are great and perfect for sharing. Just be careful that one appetizer is good for 3-4 people if you're also ordering entrees. The Asian Nachos are to die! Omg I am such a fatso but I really love them.  Upon this trip, I ordered a HUGE salad and I devoured every bite. The chicken avocado salad sounds basic but it was awesome. I didn't love the dressing so word to the wise, get it on the side. This salad goes best with ranch, je pense. They have entrees but they also have reasonably priced sandwiches and burgers (especially in Vegas hotels where everything is super expensive).   The waitress, Petra, was very professional. She said the portions were large and good for sharing, which helped us order appropriately.  Whenever I am at the Venetian, I strongly look forward to coming to Grand Luxe Cafe mostly for the Asian Nachos.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Asian chicken Nachos

s71PrmMlePU-XpbjL1qusw.text: Good service, quiet server. Our hotel accommodations got us a free American breakfast that was plentiful. We stayed at the Palazzo, and this one is near the Venetian if you are staying there. Service was quick, water and coffee aplenty. There can be lines, saw big lines at 9:30-10am.

cNBDXQa22Lj2t4ejWmd6xQ.text: Stayed at the Venetian on 6/9-12 (3 nights) and ate breakfast at the Grand Lux (the one in the Venetian the first two mornings).  - No wait to get seated. - Both of us (me and wife) had the buffet. I'm not a buffet person but I felt this was good value for the price. I had multiple glasses of outstanding fresh-squeezed orange juice, English muffins, oatmeal with raisins, fruit, and bacon. - The service was attentive and courteous. - Only gripes: 1) Too dark; 2) Too loud

c6XZQin9OARRnVkohAYmCg.text: I've eaten here a few time before but, never written a review. It's a great cafe in the palazzo casino. Reasonably priced food especially for a place in the casino on the strip and they have a huge selection! Like pages and pages of choices. I had the short rib grilled cheese w/French fries and it was one of the best sandwiches I've had! Man I love a good grilled cheese. My friend/coworker had chicken and waffles which I have also had in the past so I feel comfortable saying they were yummy too! Will be back again I'm sure great place for a business lunch or a Sunday brunch! Also our server was super nice!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spare Rib Grilled Cheese!!!! Yummmm
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken and waffles no pecans!

k6pt4NIflAdC9B7v6C7TWw.text: Last minute decision to try this place out since the Yardbird declined us since it was 11:40 and they close at 12. So happy that it happened cause we wouldn't have found this gem. These restaurants in The Venetian Hotel are pretty hard to find. The signs are not very helpful at telling you the floor or where the correct direction is to the restaurant. One good thing is that self parking is free at The Venetian. We were so hungry and luckily we saw this place was open 24hours. The restaurant is dimmed and is pretty big. Their menu has good options and their prices are really reasonably for Vegas. They have the best fresh warm  sourdough bread and with the butter makes it even more delicious. The food was really tasty and they give good portions. I had the double stacked chicken quesadillas which came with salsa and sour cream. My husband had the shrimp scampi. My son had the Caesar salad. The waiter we had could have been a bit more friendlier and sociable but I guess it was pretty late so he could have been tired. He had an accent and he spoke so softly so it was hard to understand him. He didn't ask everyone what they wanted to drink. He rarely came by to check on us for refills or to ask how our food was. Overall, the food and atmosphere was a great experience but service could have been a little better.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Caesar salad $10.95
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp Scampi $19.95
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Double Stacked Chicken Quesadilla $12.95

rx0SsPaA_1GbW8Z-Kxe2-w.text: I had the French toast which was delicious! I am still thinking about it & want to go back to Vegas just so I can order it again. My mom and sister had the breakfast buffet & really enjoyed the eggs & hash browns.

mWmzvjTbxrdxvkdbrZLIZw.text: Not your normal Casino Coffee Shop.  Large menu for each meal.  Very good food served 24 hours a day.  It can get crowded but they do seat you quickly.

tENcGVTz3e8EmadtedK-FA.text: This is the best place to refuel in between rounds of booze when you're staying at the Venetian.  The restaurant is pretty big, so service can sometimes be slow.  But they bring you yummy bread to snack on while you wait for your food.  I've never had to wait more than 10 minutes for a table, with parties as big as six.   Everything that I ordered or sampled from someone else's plate was yummmmmmmy goodness.  And they will pack up stuff to go for the friends who are sleeping in the room.  Bonus!

R1req7QGqZT2ERos29a8Yg.text: We end up eating almost every meal at the lux. Great food and very generous portions. We love the salmon and they have the most amazing burgers! Something for everyone!

UYaUPkcUgNgQxy46s8v7xA.text: Hey, what can I say? If you're not sick of eating at this place 4 days in a row, it's got to be good. There is no better feeling of rolling into this place after going to your usual Vegas clubs, parched and famished. I absolutely love their Pasta Carbonara!

CyBb8DWm5wqtMyUAVSU1bQ.text: Great food for a good price. Shrimp scampi pasta was delicious!

6G6_qNcvzRgAQdr2AWvkKw.text: I went to the one in the Palazzo and it was delicious! Portions were way too big but i'd rather have them too big than too small. you would think a restaurant right off the casino would be kinda iffy, but my entire party were impressed. the drinks, entrees, and desserts were excellent!

xw2PHKRr6-MLTivTFTrXKg.text: this place is definitely as good as it gets. i must remember so that i can come back everytime i'm in vegas. this place is a sister of the cheesecake factory, and what you get is a huge portion of good food at a good price. quantity, quality, price, service, awesome! you might have to wait in line for awhile, though. but this place is HUGE and usually packed with people.  i couldn't stop drooling while reading the menu. there's a LOOOOT of choices, and it was hard to choose. i decided to go for one of their "lunch specials," a lunch portion of pasta (choice of pasta pomodoro, pasta fresca or pasta telephono) and a small house salad.   first off, the pasta could have been for dinner! it was a good, big portion of gemelli with roasted eggplant, tomatoes, asparagus, broccoli, peppers, sun-dried tomatoes, kalamata olives, and garlic. SO. FRICKIN. GOOD. and the salad that had a delish roasted tomato-caramelized onion vinaigrette. it's too bad i just couldn't finish all this yummy food. they definitely don't skimp on the quality of the food!  fellow, veg buds, this is a great place to load up on great food. another note: the fresh mozzarella pizza is fantastic. it's got roasted tomatoes, spinach, artichokes, and garlic. and my dad loves their spaghetti with clams -- a great portion for 17 bucks. oh great...now i'm getting reeeeally hungry for some grand lux.

LB_EwB1sVv_zgX48UUrq5Q.text: Do yourself a favor, sit at the bar to have dinner and drinks.  The restaurant is typical, but the bar service is ALWAYS excellent!  My favorite is the Miso Salmon  It's always a challenge to order because everything is great.  If you're not impressed the first time, give it another try.  All their drinks are hand made with fresh ingredients.

prq67CzkU-CFRxuvQHD1JQ.text: While it has its Cheesecake Factory roots, I'm  not a big fan of the limited menu.  The service and quality were great.  Holy Kobe, did I really just have Kobe beef chili dogs?  The Kobe dogs were good, but the hormel chili they spilled over the top was not a good choice.  The Kobe hot dog appetizer, you must try just to have something to talk about with the hungover group at the next table.  Maybe if they open a location in Hawaii they can have Kobe spam.

jO457kAPSs8ayljcWh-vaw.text: Went here over the weekend for dinner.  I really like this place because I think it's decently priced food on The Strip in a nice hotel.  You get the feeling of dining in a nice place for a little cheaper than other restaurants located in big hotels/casinos.  I also like the variety on the menu.  Maybe I'm on the short bus but is this place sister companies with Cheesecake Factory?  They have similar decor, similar menu items, etc.  I ordered the Spaghettini with Clams.  It was yumm.  A little bit spicy for me because there was red pepper flakes which I didn't expect but it was still good and loaded with clams.  My husband had the Fried Chicken.  It was really good and a huge portion with a mound of mashed potatoes, mashed sweet potatoes, glazed carrots, and steamed brocolli on the side.  The Creole dippng sauce that came with it was the best part.  The service was really great, quick, and friendly.  I love that this place serves a pretty big variety of food on their late night menu (12-6am) too, so when you get out of the club, you don't necessarily have to eat greasy crap at 4am.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spaghettini w/ Clams (Dark picture, dark restaurant)
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried Chicken w/ mashed potatoes, mashed sweet potatoes, glazed carrots, and steamed brocolli

JjBMYT8JgXMe7expKWXTMQ.text: Believe all the hype/other reviewers as this place is REALLY fantastic. Two people for $100 gets you an outstanding meal with tons of dinner choices. 5/5 stars as the same quality elsewhere would be double the price. TIP: portions are huge so share!

RcsdHfLzRsInJe-Pj_xsUg.text: Holy cow! The food is fantastic.  We ordered the lunch pizza salad, 2 different pastas including spicy marinara. It is just the best Italian food I have had for the price in Vegas. Must eat if u can.

yk7bwgQkp4MkLcj5P7oiTw.text: I absolutely loveeee Cheesecake Factory so obviously I had to try its sister restaurant ~ and no doubt about it, the restaurant has awesome food - regardless of whatever you order (burgers, pasta, breakfast, steak, etc) ~ This place is consistently good hands down.

1FVJ8YxaCzgNhOj6poO8KA.text: I love this place for breakfast.  I know it's not as big a breakfast buffet as other places, but it was better food.  I always enjoy eating here.  The servers are very nice and they refill my drinks promptly.  And, they also chat and make me feel special (I am sure they are trained to do this - but, they are trained well!).  I like the made-to-order omelets at the buffet, all the fruit, eggs. bacon, breads, hash browns - a really great small buffet.  I have also ordered from the menu (French toast) and it was good, too.  I have only eaten breakfast here so I can't comment on everything else.

fgH3Zg45QyzTtGBVG0OXwQ.text: You can't go wrong when this place is made by the same geniuses behind The Cheescake Factory.  My favorite dishes are the Southwestern Salad and the Chicken Parmesan.  Prices are pretty decent at around $10-$20.  I suggest to go for lunch.  The portions are enormous and at a price that won't burn a hole in your pocket.  Got the munchies after clubbing all night at Tao?  Guess what?  It's open 24 hours.  =D

5eL29kzrJIltWrPSeow2zg.text: Rice cravers don't eat here...  I Didn't like it.  Service was fair for our party of 3.  I would have rather eaten at the food court if it had been open.

3q3s5T-nUSYYm6cSGOtMEg.text: This is another one of those restaurants on the strip that you can trust will be open after dancing the night away at one of the nightclubs or bar hopping on the strip.  You can also trust that there will be something on the menu that you're craving for or just something that will hit the spot unless you're craving for something specific like sushi or pho or something of that sort.  All of the times I've eaten here was after 2 am and you can bet that there will be a line forming any time between then and later until 4 or 5 am (on the weekend).   The quality of the food and service is worth mentioning.  The wait staff always are friendly and are very knowledgeable of what's on the menu.  One time a friend asked for no bacon in her salad and when the order came she noticed that there was some in it.  The waiter was apologetic and called his manager over and she offered the meal on the house.  It wasn't necessary to do all that since the restaurant was somewhat packed and were willing to let it go, but they were willing to fix the problem.  Some of the things I recommend are the flautas (appetizer) and the pastas are usually good.  From what I remember the prices are mid range/moderate.

lM5bwidQlFFBroXkaZnJPA.text: Beautiful atmosphere, warm, cozy, delicious food. Very indulgent treat which is great for groups. Try the beignets, they are amazing!

fMmAuVmndnpp77fM_a0Yng.text: I ate here because I saw Larry Flint eating there. There's a part of the restaurant that juts out like an outdoor area, towards the casino. And there he was, barely bothering to keep his mouth closed as he chewed. And though he had a glazed over look as he ate, I think he enjoyed his food because he finished everything including the table bread. This place is designed for a more mid- west palette, everything was just a little bit too much. The salad dressing just a little too sweet, the salmon just a little too smoked up, etc. It still taste great going down, just lacking diversity.

MQq_1AlcDWsyNs7Ot8J4OQ.text: This is hands down the best place to get corned beef hash and eggs for breakfast. Located in the lovely Venetian hotel, it offers a plush atmosphere with hardly any waiting time for a table whatsoever. Weird -- but this place is always packed! I'm assuming it is because of their wonderful service and extensive menu (so many choices!). And the coffee is a small dunk as well.

19JW6W75F1f-202-mkS3_g.text: This place did remind me of The Cheesecake Factory, a lot of items to choose from on their menu.  It was hard for me to decide.  There were a lot of good-sounding entrees.  I finally decided on the Crispy Caramel Chicken, and that was good.  I couldn't finish it because we also had the Chicken Lettuce Wrap for an appetizer, which was also really flavorful.  The portions are pretty big.  None of us finished our food.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Pot Pie
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Thai Fried Chicken
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crispy Caramel Chicken

o5uOvqbZghHjeN6f9d2Hiw.text: 3.5 is my rating.  This place is like cheesecake factory - really long and extensive menu and food portions were huge.  Short Rib Grilled Cheese Sandwich ($10.50 USD) Slow roasted short rib, caramelized onions, and arugula sandwiched in melted cheese on grilled country bread. Served with a Mixed Green Salad. The sandwich was really good. It was quite greasy though given it was a grilled cheese sandwich, but the slow roasted short rib meat was really tender and the caramelized onions really complemented the meat bringing out a sweetness to the sandwich.  Salisbury Steak ($15.95 USD) Chopped Sirloin Combined with Onions, Mushrooms and Garlic. Served with Mashed Potatoes, Brown Gravy and Fresh Vegetables. The texture of this steak tasted more like a burger, or even softer - you actually don't need a knife to cut the meat, a fork is good enough. Figures since the steak is made from blend ground beef. It was flavorful and tasty.  Food was decent but nothing special imo.

hl2_-NtHlYKvOeoD0zNvfw.text: Just had worst experience.  Grand Lux Cafe waitress serving Venetian poker room is one of the most unpleasant people ever.  I simply asked for a menu...VenetianGrand Lux Cafe please time check this waitress...1030 am, Sunday, May 19th, 2019.  She for all intent and purpose threw menu at me and alm I did was ask.  Another gentleman ordered, and she proceeded to walk away without so much asking.  There's a tremendous amount of a**holes in poker, I'm just not one of them.  I suppose the 20% standard gratuity for delivery and my standard $5 means nothing.  As you might imagine, I want nothing in return but common decency.  I'd ask the two entities to at least question this woman and ask why she is so nasty!

gZOdAbjb9tCMlG2IYzfC_g.text: Great service. Great food. Nuff said. Was stuffed for breakfast but would def go back. Grand Lux never disappoints! They also have the best chocolate cake in the world!

ObXR6ctn5XqShflSQVMD9g.text: We were STOKED to find a Grand Lux in Vegas! We've been to the one in Dallas countless time and absolutely LOVE the cookies! I ordered the salmon platter and it was FILLED with so much smoked salmon - super delish. My husband ordered the mushroom and egg benedict and said it was tasty. He also ordered  a bloody mary which he said was really good and I had the blood orange mimosa which was DELISH. Overall a great experience with good food and good service.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

dSVykKP5koyxAq62TW7uvg.text: At the coffee shop we were totally ignored. Worst staffing ever. A guy was standing there and didn't notice us and the second lady said to wait for the other worker. The other worker was doing something not acknowledging us so we left.

ndrK2OBt3rnboDRM35G6Tw.text: I eaten here twice this week during my trip and both times the food was better than I expected. When you see it's a casino cafe you are just assuming it's a big menu with food at a cheap price. Well the prices aren't bad but I wouldn't say cheap, but they make up for it with the quality of food.   Great service both times and lots of flavor!  I had the huevos ranchero one day and the lemon chicken picatta. Both were very well prepared with great flavor and large portion.

DWzqgez33L0-9usB5LeQxg.text: Grand Lux is one of my favorite stops while I'm in Vegas. Their chicken and waffles although aren't the traditional chicken and waffles, instead they are tenders and waffles. However, they are very well done and my favorite dish on their menu. The syrup and the pecans added to the waffles are top notch. My wife had a hamburger and fries, which is a great dish. Grand Lux is a great stop no matter the time of day for a good solid meal at a decent price.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

3x9KSdNrvjFJzmtbv96rCQ.text: Located in the Palazzo casino. Went here for the buffet brunch, which they only have on Saturday and Sunday. The rest of the time is regular menu ordering.   At $24.99 it is a very good value (it includes coffee and juice). The day before, it cost us $20 somewhere else just for an omelette and coffee.  The have custom made omelettes, various egg dishes, all the breakfast meats, and delicious pastries (sorry low carb diet!). The service was great, as our server Efrain was fantastic, as we didn't need to wait on anything! Highly recommend.

dmwFfVh6blixr98DBMffyQ.text: Amazing staff, great food, and kid friendly. Loved their version of the Beef Wellington!

z7cskTR4SYxCiSY7UdgFgA.text: Conveniently located in the Venetian and a short walk from the connected Palazzo, Grand Lux, the upper tier restaurant of the Cheesecake Factory empire is consistently excellent. Our favorite is breakfast. The Best Eggs Benedict never fails to please.   Lunch and dinner terrific as well. Diverse menu has something for everyone. It's nice to have a place you can count on for great food and service!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My fav for breakfast at Grand Lux - &#34;The best&#34; Eggs Benedict.
