Sierra comes along to see what's going on (because I'm SURE she knows what crappy service she delivered) and as I begin to complain she just gives me that "I don't have time for this" look and is dismissed by her unapologetic manager.   He showed no remorse, whatsoever. All I did was complain about the lack of service and a simple apology would have sufficed. My boyfriend and I have BOTH been servers in the past. I don't care if you're having a bad day, you're just slow as heck, or running behind... You still say SORRY.  Now I don't know if the manager just didn't take me seriously since I didn't wear my "big girl" pants and heels that night (maybe he thinks I'm just some child trying to get comped for a meal, who knows??). But as a current nurse and past waitress I would like to see how he would feel if he were my patient/customer complaining about his issues and I just stared at him blankly with no remorse or reaction.  But anyway... vent session, over lol. Hopefully everyone's experience will be MUCH better than ours :)

x6glzAp54zQphD6OFI0-UA.text: Terrible breakfast buffet. Cold eggs. No waffles. No muesli. Slow, disinterested service.

7tX7PxMHmYFVO-f2nxtreQ.text: Fancy atmosphere, and prices are not bad at all compared to most Vegas restaurants. Ordered the Steak Sandwich, a chicken pasta, and salmon (big small plate). They were all pretty amazing. We ended up coming here the very next day. Super satisfied with everything.

uCFqPl0ern4qr0THTENtuQ.text: I had my birthday dinner here. They don't take reservations so try to come here early especially if you have a big party. The atmosphere was really nice especially with the lights sort of dimmed. Anyways, I got some type of pasta and so did some of my other girlfriends. Tell me why the portions was hugeee! I ordered a drink here and when we got the check, it was freakin $12. No wonder they don't put the prices for the drinks on their menus haha.   Overall, it's a Cheesecake Factory that's open for 24 hours.

Pfi84iKZGwgsfxtwPDokrA.text: Came here on New Years Day, mid afternoon. They seem to have their JV service squad on the floor today.  Our waitress seems to be bored and confused. She left our table unattended with 5 empty drinks, 2 empty appetizer plates, 2 empty bread baskets and all the butter gone for over 20 minutes before coming over to refill our drinks. However, food was DELICIOUS! And the waiter who ran out our appetizers was stellar, giving us ranch intended for his table and swinging back through the kitchen to get more for his actual table.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our table has been like this for 20 minutes.....anyone?

5zRufwLGvBRsAWoOvTcprw.text: The girls was super duper hungry and this was one of many places that were opened late night and near our hotel.  This place reminds me of Cheesecake factory due to the decor and extensive menu. I don't remember the specifics of what we ordered, but the pizza, salad, wings were just okay. There were nothing to be wowed about.. Just happy there was food in my stomach.

_oj0beQtrEQzu2rCQAf2Lg.text: My god, never, ever again.  We came here at about 11:30 on a Tuesday morning for a late breakast/lunch. They were just putting away the breakfast buffet, so seeing that I decided to order from their all day breakfast menu. My husband is a chef, formerly at a hotel, and warned me that it would probably be the worst time of day to be ordering a breakfast since the cooks are winding down from making breakfast probably since about 5AM. Stupidly, I ignored him and ordered it anyway.  I ordered the eggs anyway meal: two eggs, hash browns, bacon, and sourdough toast. Everything was bland and overcooked. My bacon was burnt and flavorless, the hash browns were dry, and my eggs tasted like rubber, and my toast was cold. I would have complained to my server if I could have found her. Unfortunately after a few minutes my hunger got the best of me and I ate the crap anyhow.  My husband's vegetable soup was not any better. He found several vegetable ends in his small cup, and TWO bay leaves. I'd hate to think how many bay leaves the stock pot had in it if two ended up in his tiny cup.  And as I intimated before, our service was AWFUL. We ordered at 11:40 and didn't receive our food until 12:15. And our server was nowhere to be found in the interim. I think she just waited in the kitchen until her orders were up, delivered them and went straight back to the kitchen to wait again instead of checking up on her tables.  The food and the service were terrible, which is a shame since when we initially arrived I thought to myself that I wanted to get up earlier the next day to get their breakfast buffet. After this experience, I will NEVER go back.

n8JK63ACOriOo__lKL4edQ.text: If this place were down the street from me, in California somewhere, I'd give it an extra star.  The food's not bad.    But it ain't great. And it definitely doesn't live up to my Vegas standards.  And add to that the fact that it is inside my favorite hotel, the Venetian, where I constantly state that the food is AMAZING - - Grand Lux is the only establishment in that hotel that pales in comparison.  It's a coffeeshop atmosphere - extremely large with plenty of seating.  In all of my years of going to the Venetian, I've only stood in line twice or so.... usually, there IS seating available.  There is a LOT on the menu, so much that it is difficult to pick.  The basic things - like a bagel with lox and cream cheese - is fine.  But how hard is a bagel and cream cheese? Other things - like the club sandwich or the steak sandwich, or the burgers, are all mediocre.  HUGE, yes, but it is a 12 dollar burger so I expect either big in taste of huge, and Grand Lux gives you huge.  I keep on eating here on every visit in spite of the lack of taste, just because it's so convenient  since I stay at this hotel, and the mood is inviting and nice but I am consistently unimpressed with the food.  It's Vegas.  Impress me.... and I give them all these chances, and still - -  they don't.  Coffee is blaaah - as is the case with the entire hotel, and service is decent.  Nothin' to write home about.  For quick and easy eating - - Grand Lux Cafe is okay.  But your socks won't be knocked off, you won't come out moaning and groaning, you won't wonder when the next time you get to eat here will be, and it's definitely not one of those, "I CANNOT WAIT TO GET HOME TO YELP ABOUT THIS PLACE" type of restaurant.  I uploaded some of the food photos I took here. Believe me.  It looks better than it tastes.  :-)

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Club
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak Sandwich
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tuna Melt

_VPjmu8Etl_AXFaWrgR1vg.text: The restaurant reeked of cleaning chemicals and gave me and all my friends headaches.  Brunch buffet options were scrambled eggs, hash browns, pancakes, a fruit plate, pastries, and an omelet station. In short, the exact opposite of what you go to a Vegas buffet for.   For essentially the same price you could have gone to the Wicked Spoon instead - that place was fantastic.  TLDR - compensates for a pathetic buffet by making you feel too sick to eat.

GwpBXhoiUocE8V4DFqROHA.text: I'm only writing this review for Brian our server. He was so nice, attentive, professional and personable. I came here 2 weeks ago on a Sunday afternoon with my husband and friends and he the nicest person ever.   The food was also good. But, nice people like him makes you feel welcome and appreciated. He had a very professional attitude, kept refills coming and even offered to box our items to-go for us (which we refused) because we can do it ourselves.   Thanks Brian for your wonderful help!!

n8O78xtjcWzB4N-oE_watw.text: I try to eat at Grand Lux Cafe every time i visit Vegas. The food, service and atmosphere are wonderful. Never had a bad experience here. Not ostentatious-but presentation is beautiful. Love it and highly recommend this restaurant.

ZxFJW1xChA6jMwo-OZDsbA.text: Great place for late night eating after a long night of drinking, ate here twice at 2am. Huge menu with something to satisfy everyone's taste. From breakfast to sandwiches and a wide variety of entrees. Good size portions and reasonably priced for Vegas standards. Even at the early morning hours service at the bar and tables was friendly and efficient. Tried a couple of the sandwiches and burgers both were very good. Only item I tried here that I wasn't crazy about was the pepperoni pizza. The sauce was too strong and overwhelmed the pepperoni flavor. Even in the early morning people were waiting for tables.

6OhOaQ6czz9HKeQtTCXPdw.text: Visited the location in the Venetian Hotel in Las Vegas. Beautiful scenery with an unrestricted view of the Casino. Had the bourbon chicken, mashed potatoes, garlic spinach. Hot bread and butter, yum yum. Topped off with a lemon drop Martini which was the best. The service was excellent and would advise you to check it out.

DawTgg-cQrYMikFdgLEEgw.text: Short 10 min wait to be seated, service was good but food was very bland. We tried the stuffed French toast, biscuits and gravy and omelettes. The portions were as expected by the flavors were missing. Everyone at my table (4 people) were disappointed in our dishes. The grand lux at The palazzo was so much better.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Stuffed French toast
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Asparagus and crabmeat omelette
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sausage biscuits and gravy

Pqk_DuHfBwdEqAEvFoam6g.text: iLOVE the chicken and waffles here!  Yum!!  I was so excited to eat at Grand Lux when I came to Vegas. We had one in LA, but it closed down so I was super anxious to eat here. The food is really good......especially the COOKIES!

dhSU4LdpNnUScjkWneM3PA.text: 5AM: 3 college students, hungry, desperate, and unwilling to take another taxi. We shuffled over from Treasure Island to the Grand Lux Cafe at the Venetian and were seriously surprised. Huge portions with good to excellent flavors. Quite busy at 5AM.  Definitely on my list of late night options while in Vegas!

JreLL_arObJtAlRdw1EncQ.text: Service is fast and friendly. Lots of food options. I like the Madeira chicken & salmon three ways. Cocktails are good. My favorite place to eat on the strip. The bakery to go counter has delicious eclairs.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fruit eclair from the Togo case/counter next door
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Edible birthday card.

oxmk8DgSR3xjehGad2bwUw.text: Absolutely good food, worth every penny. I tried chicken mushroom soup and the grilled steak sandwich. Really enjoyed the dinner (For the side, me and my husband tried both salad and fries, the salad was absolutely better)

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled steak sandwich with the salad on side
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled steak sandwich

GA745Gv70kQpZaUG1LuRdg.text: My sweetheart treated me to a special dinner, (date night) here and it was Amazing from start to finish! My first time dining here and the anticipation did not disappoint!  The Ambiance is fantastic, classy and romantic dark it just made us feel so good!  We had a sexy little booth to ourselves and it was romantic cozy!  What we had...  Complimentary bread basket! Yums!  Appetizer: Buffalo Chicken Rolls  Chicken Breast, Cheese and Very Spicy Delicious Buffalo Sauce all Rolled in a Spiced Wrapper and Fried until Crisp. Served with Celery Sticks and  Blue Cheese Dressing.  Liquor: Orange-Citrus Cosmo  Grey Goose L'Orange, Limoncello and Aperol Shaken with Fresh Citrus  Main meal: Chicken Pot Pie  Chunks of Chicken Breast, Carrots, Peas, Pearl Onions and Mushrooms in a Creamy Sauce. With Housemade Crust.  Main meal: Chicken Parmesan and Shrimp Scampi  Side order: Green Chile-Cheese Cornbread  Baked in a Cast Iron Skillet  Wow this meal was ridiculous good! My sweetheart said he wanted to take me out to a wonderful meal and he was not joking! He really spoiled me with this dinner!  The service was Fantastic as well, our server was sweet as sugar and very attentive and full of great suggestions.  The menu has so many items it was mind boggling trying to decide.  I was pleased with what I ordered as I had the best chicken pot pie of my life!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious bread basket!
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sexy atmosphere!
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beautiful atmosphere!

iZufH5PLWUsrwC2TAxYvAQ.text: The Asian nachos are a must! Very fair prices considering it is in a fancy hotel! Would hands down request this to anyone looking for a fantastic 24 hr diner

qq93ibl56YeSHYIDlgYbeg.text: For rise to be a sister of the cheese cake factory I was surprised with prices. They are affordable!  The only don't side is that is inside a Casio but the service was phenomenal. The waitress came to check on us serval time and made sure that everything was up to par. Sadly her shift was over before we finished our meal, I would've love to have left her a tip.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken and shrimp curry

wKUxxvG2mc9EDrOmpjhkjA.text: Food here is always good.  I wanted something quick to take back to the room and I think I might have ordered the wrong item to take to go.  I tried the Zen Noodles.  It reminds me of pho because of the broth it comes with.  The broth was separate from the noodles so you have to put the two things together to make the meal complete.  Again, it's not a dish for to go, but I do love Grand Lux.

V24Elj0V9k9IPwQHn-vNcw.text: This is an ok place to eat at. Pretty much like Cheesecake Factory but I do prefer Cheesecake. I think Grand Lux Cafe and Cheesecake Factory are related.   I would say this is the place you want to hit up if you're hung over on your night in Vegas since I think this is one of the few places opened past 2am... I mean they have your typical hang over food like burgers and fries... :)

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

HwzFS6WuCfIzAXg0UhRONw.text: Great Vegas level service, decor is A+.   I had a Stella on draft and a spicy mango avocado chicken salad. The beer was good, I'd give the salad a three. The cilantro overwhelmed other flavors, the mango tasted pickled, and the chicken was cold and a little dry. It's an affordable dining option in the Palazzo, and while the salad was good, the flavors could have worked together better.

aU7Mu8tdRBN_2r4t-JFeWA.text: Brunch go-to every time I'm at the Palazzo! The prices are a bit high but service is great. Mimosas are always a great pairing with their chicken n waffles!

yh4yF-CM7bBAclFSNBuZLw.text: I'm amazed not only are their prices reasonable but the service was by far one of the best I have experienced. The ambiance was casual with dim lighting. They're open 24 hours for all you people who need a bite to eat after 12 am. The waiters are very knowledgeable and friendly.  They made sure that we were happy and enjoying our meals.  I ordered the pastrami burger with a garden salad. The salad was fresh and delicious. My burger was cooked just the way I like it,  medium rare, and the bread they give you as appetizers was warm and fresh. Grand Lux is so good that we came back 2 nights later on October 20. I ordered the Monte Cristo Sandwich then.  This was one of the best I've tasted and not every place I've had one knows how to make it. There are only two places I recommend for a Monte Cristo and that's Disneyland French Quarters and now the Grand Lux. If you haven't tried it, you're missing out. They're located inside The Palazo hotel. The Grand Lux will be one of those restaurants in Vegas that I will be enjoying for years to come.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pastrami burger with garden salad

N0tZV5tv4SOwr2BiqP5gXQ.text: We really enjoyed our brunch here. Big portions and good menu options. I had the Bloody Mary and it was excellent!   This place also has a Buffett.   Not a cheap meal but not nearly as bad as some other places on the Strip.   I highly recommend this spot.

zuvB2VUfl41BLIChDKDpFw.text: The service here was great. Our waitress was very attentive. She refilled our drinks and checked in on us throughout our meal. Food was fairly priced for its portion size. It was a little crowded; the tables were pretty close together.   Me and a few friends went after midnight and it was pretty busy. We all ordered different things so we could taste each other's food. I ordered a club sandwich and it came with a side salad. It tasted like a normal club sandwich, nothing too special about it. The sandwich was pretty big, so I couldn't finish it. One of my friends ordered the southwest salad, I thought that was delicious! I couldn't stop picking at her plate. Another friend ordered the jambalaya. That was pretty good. Not a bad place for a late meal if you're in the Venitian.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Club sandwich

7YtV9fgGNuH0HU6emPKwAg.text: I had higher expectations from this place since they had 4 stars but I was a bit disappointed. I came here for a late night dinner at 11:30 pm with my boyfriend because we wanted some pasta. This was just one of the few places that were open late.   First of the hostess was not very welcoming. I never really pay attention to stuff like that but I came a long way from walking around the grand canal shoppes. I was ready to get seated.  One waiter got our drinks right away and ten minutes later a nice waitress took our order.  We ordered crispy calamari, the beef wellington and shrimp scampi.   They gave us a basket of bread and butter. Of course I dig right in. This bread was the worst bread I have ever had. Do not get me wrong, the flavor was there but the crust of the bread was so tough! I could barely chew it! It seemed like old bread that has been reheated.   The calamari was a 30 minutes wait but it was good. Not the best I have had but good.  The main entrees took another 30 minute wait. I was a bit agitated at this point but I was happy about how the food looked.    The shrimp scampi was okay.  The pasta was cooked perfectly and the shrimp was yummy!  The sauce on the pasta was way too sour.  I was not a big fan and neither was my boyfriend.   The beef wellington had a side of rainbow carrots, Brussel sprouts, and mashed potatoes.  The steak was cooked perfectly medium rare. It had a very good flavor but sadly it was way too salty. I couldn't finish eating the second cut of steak. I never usually complain about the dish but I could not take how salty it was. I was downing so much water because my mouth was getting dry. I was highly disappointed with my meal.  I give one star for the kind waitress. The wait and food quality was not her fault whatsoever.  I give a second star because the sides on the beef wellington was really good! They were all cooked perfectly and the mashed potatoes were to die for.  And the shrimp on the pasta was also delicious.    I'll give another try one day but hopefully they improve the food quality.

cy0PrMK6-flA79owjCK5hw.text: Grand Lux is always a great place to go when you can't think of what you wanna have. They have a little of everything! I almost always get the pasta with chicken and sun dried tomato. Awesome pasta. The other dish I usually get is the shrimp scampi. It tastes much better than the version at Cheesecake Factory--shrimp is bigger, and crispier too. The combo dishes of caramel chicken and shaking beef are good too, but in those combo dishes, the shaking beef has VERY VERY FEW pieces of actual beef. Its a tiny bit of beef and a crapload of sliced green onions. Oh, and for the appetizers, try the chicken lettuce wraps. Very good, but they make it look like the dish is full of chicken...its not. Its mostly those white fried crispy noodles. But for dessert, ALWAYS, and I mean ALWAYS, save room for the Beignets. Holy smokin frijoles they are awesome. The three sauces are great too...the Beignets are the perfect comfort food....they can grow back a limb! But BEWARE---the Grand Lux in the Venetian DOES NOT serve beignets, only the grand Lux in the Palazzo!!!

n1RDMcbzLxhW2EocPdSjnA.text: This review is for their breakfast buffet. Frankly it was TINY. Just an omelet station and some fresh fruit, definitely not what I was expecting. The omelet station had lots of choices of what to add in but I wish we would have gone elsewhere for breakfast.

yQQsOUc5KwlJs4WDYnULEQ.text: Not so "Lux" (2.5 - I'm not a fan of commercial chains and it definitely wasn't my choice to come here). Value wise, it sux's because It's in Vegas. It's pricey for what it is which isn't much. If it was in suburban Hoboken this would be a happening spot. I can just picture some Jersey chicks chain smok'n and downing the best eva' flat bread sandwiches... oh my gawd.

d3wBWCSnuD6CbQyG75VG0w.text: This place was brought to my attention by my coworkers. I will have to say that I am very glad I joined them. The atmosphere is great and there are about a million options to choose from on the menu. I tend to think the larger the menu, the lower the consistency and quality of food. I proved my self wrong here.   The strawberry lemonade was very refreshing, but it is also VERY sweet. I then moved on to the duck pot stickers and finished with the seafood salad. The portions are huge and the price is good. If you want an reasonably priced alternative and don't want to leave the Palazzo then this is a good bet!

hNtY9kTcys4QdumsUgJ8LQ.text: I love this place. It's 24 hours with great food and good service. I love the seared ahi appetizer and the volcano shrimp

UJe6DVURKOZgdPvtuJrIMA.text: I really love this restaurant. Being a local i try to steer clear of dining on the strip but I do enjoy coming here. For being in a casino and considering the quality of the food, the prices are on point. Do try the stacked chicken quesadilla, its so good!! I also like the ahi tuna salad with avocado! The fresh bread they service is a plus, im a sucker for free carbs with my meal. The service may be a little slow at times but the staff act like the enjoy their jobs. Sit on the "patio" area and watch the tourists go by. Best part is they are open 24 Hours!

eWeQpfLl9Ax4pX0Bn0n2-g.text: This spot was our savior during our stay at the Venetian.  Service was good and the food was good as well.  Killer salad dressing made from scratch and the pizza and pasta we ate was delicious.  I would come back even if I weren't staying at the Venetian!

q4Fi_MfCcVgBrWRpfE6Qpw.text: So, I'd love to give this place 4 stars. It almost should get it, but it doesn't. The primary reason for that is that my burger was overcooked. I asked for it on the rarer side of medium rare and it came out medium well. The fries were pretty good, but nothing special.   The burger was HUGE though, so much so that I really couldn't figure out a good way to eat it with company around.  I would not recommend that you order the burger if you are on a business meeting!

3chKdjzihWMenr-nVPqkMw.text: I guess the comparisons to cheesecake factory is fair.  But I think the food quality is better and their cooks aren't as sloppy.    I drove the herd here on a weekday morning for breakfast.  Just beat the morning rush hour....10am-ish.   Started with a "Paul Bunyan" sized Latte.  Very good.  Then I ordered the corn beef hash and eggs.  HANDS DOWN, the best CB Hash i've ever had.  Sure its pricey, but its rare to see REAL chunks of shredded corn beef.  Not minced and ground like mush, but chopped strips of beef.  Damn....it was that good.  Throw in a couple of fresh eggs over easy, and wheat toast with preserves.  Definitely in my top 10 breakfasts of all time.  I really liked the decor and seats.  All oversized so it was a big thumbs up for me....especially for those who are 6FT and over.... I was comfy.  Service can be spotty.  Servers can get preoccupied with shop talk, and they get distracted by other customers.  Otherwise, they were quite friendly, but hard to flag down.  Looking forward to trying their lunch and dinner menu someday.  It looked pretty amazing.

aP6FmpS1dNNZ-618XMCzWQ.text: Last stop before we leave vegas back to Orange County.  We went to Venentian to get these macaroons and were so undecided on what to eat for lunch.  We just walked by and my friend chose it randomly.  The mojitos are great (Calypso is good and the pineapple one).  I was told to get the cripsy caramel chicken which is like orange chicken, and it was ok but the portions are HUGE. They didn't tell us how big the portions are. The lemon chicken picatta is really good, and that literally feeds 3 people NO JOKE.  If you can finish it all you are a champ.  Foods decent, and huge portions, and decent prices for vegas.  I wish i got another dish but the food I tried off my friends plates were good!

12qDM75eZV7G9i_gdKWB7g.text: Spicy avocado burger. Enough said. Perfectly cooked medium and tasted great overall. Only bad part it was very greasy/juicy but that can be a plus if you like that. Service was great and fries were decent. Friend dragged me here after he kept raving about it and had to finally try it-wasn't disappointed. Would definitely recommend if you like juicy burgers at a very reasonable price ($13 for a gourmet burger in vegas not bad at a all).

_LtCvGHQt6r_lKQ4HK1wlw.text: I can understand why people have an affection for this restaurant (the fact that it's 24 hrs bumps it from 2 to 3 stars), but come on: it's a dressed-up Cheesecake Factory with decent but overpriced food. If you're sitting around your house on a random Thursday night and have a hankering for Cheesecake Factory then fine, go eat there. But if you're in VEGAS for G-ds sake and you want a tasty and fabulous meal, then why would you waste stomach space on this place? Or.. if you're drunk and you want food at 4 am, then go find somewhere really cheap to eat (like Earl of Sandwich! or even McD's) because you are drunk, and won't be able to tell the difference. Maybe I've just eaten at the Cheesecake Factory one too many times to be excited by this repackaged version of the restaurant. I mean, if I was staying in the Venetian and my friends were all, "hey, let's eat at Grand Lux" then I would do it. But I would secretly wish that we were somewhere else.

uSj5rMYOHNeNQRgrurAYIw.text: not much to complain about, lots to choose from and so far everything seems to be average to good. open 24 hours.  wait, there is something to complain about. the zen noodles, sorry ass excuse for pho. if you're drunk and just left the club and need some noodle soup, I would recommend waiting a few hours until noodle asia opens up and get their roast duck noodle soup.

rD7x5nAix0khER8E8qtqww.text: the  food at the Grand Lux is very good, I had the cream and chicken soup, wow, you should really try it , the Ahi sushi was great too.  I will definitely be back, recommended..

PxACAD_hjkq-PK3BtqkU4w.text: MY NEW ABSOLUTE FAVORITE CHICKEN WINGS. In all certainty.  Slightly crispy, piping hot, yet with a spicy/sour/sweet/sticky sauce over the top that is absolutely great.  Also tried the chicken sandwich and BBQ bacon burger -- everything was delicious.  Favorite late night food spot in Vegas fo shoooo!

nEftnQK5cWl1_cUFeNcLGw.text: Owned by Cheesecake Factory - similar menu but a little bit different.  No wait on a Friday afternoon which was a plus.  Service was fair - our waitress was not very friendly or attentive which would have been ok if we weren't first time visitors to the restaurant and Vegas!

OEw3HolrsqnAf_oAGcI6vA.text: This is basically a mini-copy of the Cheesecake Factory. In fact, they are somehow affiliated, because the menu is really just a subset of the most common things at Cheesecake Factory. Regardless, it's not a great copy. It satisfies the late-night cravings extremely well, but the dishes aren't quite as well put together as you'd find at their big brother.

L287ls-Sk4Zka3OGZx-XyQ.text: Ate breakfast here twice and was very happy both times. Highlights were the eggs benedict, breakfast sandwhich and french toast. If you are a Grazie (venetian/Palazzo rewards) member your can skip the line (altough it moves pretty fast).

o6egqgSg8Shtis_JbZYx4w.text: Food was fantastic. I are there for both breakfast and for dinner and both had great food. Would have had 5 stars, but heard a lot of moaning and groaning from the servers when they thought people would not be able to hear...

0gAV6NL_I4Bl5usEkUIvvQ.text: A lower end version of the cheesecake factory.  The casino seems to use it as a substitute for their own cafe.  I have been many times and am always disappointed with the food options and prices.

ciaBX22vR59QqhL0Jru4tA.text: This was my second time eating at Grand Luxe Cafe.  First time was with family, and there was something for everyone.  Sister to Cheesecake Factory, so portions huge and freshly prepared.  This time there were two of us catching a bite before a show at the Venetian.  Happened to be happy hour, so we sat at a booth at the bar.  A decent selection of well mixed/prepared cocktails and appetizers for $5 each.  Thai nachos were delicious.  Portions huge for $5.  We split a "small" caesar salad, which was anything but small.  Also split pasta carbonara from the dinner menu which was also very tasty.    Perfect for a casual meal of fresh, flavorful food in Vegas.

pu1ABRVe33bbSkFSFIpCsQ.text: Of course we had to come to the cheesecake factory's big sister! We came a little too late to have breakfast so we all had sandwiches. The service was definitely slow and it was a bit frustrating. Also, we were sat uncomfortably close to a servers station and had to feel like we were in the way.  Now the positives!! Their mimosas were great!!!! I was pleasantly surprised! Their menu was easily marked with "gf" for those of us who have to live gluten free. The gf menu is fairly large so you won't just have to settle for a salad! Everyone enjoyed their food and their huge serving sizes!

VTvXxgF7u1hC50HW3TsDxg.text: Love the food at the Grand Lux & the service was great specially our waitress Linda was Awesome on the Venetian one

b_bNjji7JGRccb7GUhMO_g.text: Shoot. This place is owned by Cheesecake Factory.  I try not to eat there when I'm in any big city. There's few late night choices in the Venetian so I found myself here a couple times. I got a very expensive seafood salad and ate every bite of it to get my money's worth. My jaw hurt afterward from chewing so many greens. Wasn't impressed with the service here in comparison to the ultra friendly service everywhere else in Vegas.

9YRrCL7lVaVYkJeBsnogyQ.text: Went here twice cause there's really nothing better in the area. Chicken pot pie was good, just a little dry. Coffee was bad (really weak). Cappuccino was bad (too much foam, and also too watery). DeLux Burger was average - did get medium rare right more or less. Good sauce for the fries. Everything in Vegas is overpriced so can't really complain about the price.

J6ngrlfAsbr7HIPnXO18LA.text: Usually end up coming here every time I stay at Venetian. Late night pasta? Can't go wrong. Bit pricey though.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Turkey club (right) and carbonara pasta (left)

QTL3Z7DNQxOIiMWTXyfPAA.text: The restaurant was amazing. The food was great and the service was very quick. I ate a full slab of 12 ribs and I wasn't very hungry. First time coming here and will definitely add it to the list. Pricing was normal but the server didn't really know much of the pricing. Overall I would recommend it to anyone ! No wait and great food, open late too!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. That&#39;s some pretty good over pouring. Wowzers.

Z-ppogqhBhXupIqFa9eo7w.text: Best vegas value and quality. Order one meal for two people are the portions are massive. Never had a bad meal yet and tried many meals. Favorites; Joe's scramble, eggs Benny, steak, french toast.

u_u_jSqh3rjE1jzY2taZyQ.text: We stayed at the New York New York hotel and checked out the menu for this restaurant before leaving. We walked the 2 1/2 miles to get to the restaurant only to be told that they do not have mahi-mahi on their menu.they remove the mahi-mahi bring their menu six months ago. Boy that was disappointing. Then we asked him about the beignets for dessert. Again another disappointing response from the waitress. So we decided to eat there anyway since we were already there. The waitress was telling us how most men don't like mushroomsand she asked if we wanted mushrooms with our meal. we said yes. Our mail came and there were no mushrooms. Instead we were told it wasn't mushrooms that they gave us . It was brussels sprouts instead. Let me see mushrooms or brussels sprouts.  We felt cheated and disappointed.  Not a very good experience and another 2.5 miles back. We should have stayed and ate at the hotel.

K_LIHcIgJFoPvW2lmBvH3g.text: My girlfriends and I visited this Grand Lux Cafe location in the hotel, Palazzo 3 times during a 4 night stay.  This is Cheesecake Factory location.  Loved Happy Hour menu with the appetizers and $5 drinks special.  I loved the blueberry mojito.  As well, each appetizers were $5 each.  We ended up ordering Creamy Spinach & Cheese Dip, Chicken Lettuce Wraps, Crispy Thai Shrimp & Chicken Spring Rolls, Vietnamese Chicken Summer Rolls and Double-Cheese Mini Sliders.   Everything was yummy!  I really enjoyed the Vietnamese Chicken Summer Rolls.

CcxU9dV1X38D5zsB9DwrJQ.text: Like most people have described, it is like the cheesecake factory. I would also give the cheesecake factory 3 stars for these same reasons (to help you gauge my scale here). I place a lot of weight on the food quality and taste at a restaurant (go figure). Unless the server were to throw food on me and break the plate over my head I wouldn't take away more than a star for service. That being said, the service was good, food presentation was attractive, and the place was clean. No points given up there. It's just that the food tasted like chain restaurant food to me. Maybe some folks like that, but when I eat out I want fresh tasting ingredients and quality foods. It is very hard to find that these days though.  If you are out for a meal with huge portions and a good palatable dining experience, then this place will be fine. The price is right too. If you want a place that has ingredients that were never frozen and prefer a more natural and fresh taste, I think you will have to look elsewhere.

W-H0p_KBL3v80LW5l97hsg.text: Always the spot to go for late night and or all around time of the day's spots. No matter what time of the day or night you can eat here. It's an upscale I hop or Denny's with way better food. This is always my to go spot when there's no other places to go. Never a wait, and be prepared to sit for awhile reading their menu unless you're familiar with their menu because it's pages and pages long. Tons of choices to the point it's hard to decide if you're really hungry. My suggestion is maybe ask the server "what's good" because of course some items are better than others. I always recommend and suggest this place.

YQ2VzpV-XxXQHllE6dsjew.text: My hubby and I went to Grand Lux Cafe for their breakfast buffet on a Friday morning.  They had usual sausages, bacon, scrambled eggs, omelette station, pastries, fresh fruit, etc.   I personally did not care for the food other than fresh fruit.   Strawberries were very sweet and the watermelon slices were good.   The pastries were mediocre.  Service was good.

GpLF9Cru9nOaJA3gjv9d2w.text: The only reason I am giving it a 2 * is their soup... Mediocre and slow service. Took 25 minutes for 3 sandwiches and 2 kids meals. One of us was asked for salad dressing option, the other no. Extra fries never arrived. .. not worth the time or the $$$... will skip this from now on...

UoIOW2UiqFMZG_Sfmft3zA.text: I ate here with my family.   Apps: We shared the chicken lime mango salad and buffalo chicken rolls. Both were amazing! Portions were huge.  Entrees: for my entree i had the pasta telephono which was good. But the gnocchi were AMAZING! Possibly the best pasta dish I have ever had.   Service: Our waitress was very nice and informative even suggesting menu items that turned out to be fantastic!  OVERALL: food- 4.5 service- 5 total- 4.75 rounds up! (QUICK, RELATIVELY CHEAP, GOOD SERVICE AND EXCELLENT FOOD)

7xbMkFJoR7tEm4Xp7iMWSA.text: I love Grand Lux, but after having tried the one here and the one at the Palazzo, I must say I prefer the Palazzo location.  I usually stay at the Palazzo, but stayed at the Venetian this time, so when I had a very important business related dinner I was careful to book in the Venetian, to save us all some walking.  When we arrived, we were seated in a spot which was towards the front of the restaurant.  It was very frenetic and noisy, and stressful.  I like the Palazzo set up better.  Also, I ordered the Indochine Shrimp and Chicken, as I usually do, and it was not as good as they do it at the Palazzo. :(  It was fine, but not spectacular, as I've had that experience with this dish before.  I look forward to my next meal at Grand Lux, but I will go to the Palazzo location regardless of where I'm staying.

Hk3NyV0t7WTSHp1pH5b_oA.text: Gone are the days when food in vegas use to be cheap.  Now restaurants from celebrity chefs are all over the place and a typical meal at one of these places is going to set you back $40-$50 bucks.  Whats great about the grand lux is that prices are reasonable, most dishes running about $15-$20 dollars, good food and good service.  At my last visit to the restaurant, I got the Memphis ribs, lunch portion.  It came with about 8 bones, a side of coleslaw and jalepeno cornbread. The ribs were nice and tender and the bbq sauce wasn't too sweat.  My friend had a problem with his order, he ordered a kobe burger and the waitress brought out kobe meatballs.  Manager came over to apologize for the mix up and offered him a cup of soup while he waited for his food since the rest of out food came out.  Unfortunately since they tried to rush the burger, the burger came out well done when my friend ordered med well.  When the bill came the waitress mentioned that they didn't charge us for the burger due to the mixup.  Mistakes happen, so we were not upset, and the manager did what he could to rectify the situation.

38UrDIXti4qlKsVMW4Smpg.text: So we are sitting waiting for the 7pm Jersey Boys show to start and they say it's over 2 hrs run time. Hmmmm.....we are going to be hungry at the end so I pull out my yelp app. Based on the reviews it's an easy decision and thank you yelpers, I wasn't let down.    Tried a pulled pork grilled cheese sandwich that has me salivating just thinking about it.  Also tried their smaller bites of a mini pizza with spinach and burratta.....light and savory.  We didn't want to stuff ourselves so late at night so also opted for the duck wontons.  Yummy.  Drink prices were a little steep but the cocktails had a nice kick while still being easily sippable....well, gulpable....it is Vegas!!

t2E_G5t_18IPXukakeFxig.text: Really liked this place.  As many others have said, it feels like an upscale Cheesecake Factory.  This means you're going to have tons of variety, a massive menu, and some good free bread.  We had to wait about 5 minutes for a table (a massive rush came in after us).  The space is huge.  There are so many tables in the back area, so the fact that it was full at 4:30-5 p.m. is a good sign.  We had some edamame to start, which was nicely seasoned and came with a great dipping sauce.  I ordered the fried chicken, which came with creamy, delicious mashed potatoes and coleslaw with peanuts.  The whole thing was delicious.  I think I ended up with about 5 pieces of fried chicken, which was a lot, so I was unable to finish it.  A little tip for those going, if you are wanting to conduct business or use your smartphone in the back area where most of the tables are, you're going to have a hard time getting a signal.  This could be good for conversation with family, but potentially difficult if you're trying to conduct business.  I would highly recommend this place.  I was a little nervous going to a sit down place at the Venetian because you never know what the pricing will be, but the Grand Lux Cafe was very reasonable.  My wife and I got drinks, an appetizer, and two full-sized entrees and spent around $40 before tip.  Check it out!

rlIl9vrjGEniqyjQtqZj8w.text: Great food... If you can get it within the 30 minutes it takes for you to still have the patience for an appetite. Service was mediocre and didn't even offer us the free bread and butter, so we asked our server and 15 minutes later still no bread. We had to ask another worker for the bread we had been waiting for and he dropped it off without saying a word to us. The manager came by and stared down a waitress with a mad dog face who was in his way until she moved out of his way and really bummed the mood of the restaurant everywhere he walked... But GREAT ranch dressing, makes it all worth it. 10/10 ranch, would do again. But in all seriousness we ordered the Korean sriracha burger and it was delicious, great flavor. Just wish the service was better, they treated my boyfriend and I differently compared to others just because we are younger

vOH6x1OqJ_NXPI5sL4Dhqw.text: Food was good. Slightly on the pricier side. However service was prompt They have a lot of selections to choose from. The ambience here is phenomenal as it takes you back to the roots. Would definitely come back if there was more availability of their lunch menu into their dinner menu. Staff was very pleasant to deal with and they even remembered us from last time which is great knowing you are being acknowledged

uS9dpKXrx1GH85kduLTuhQ.text: First the 2 other people with me enjoyed their food and the chicken and waffles looked great with lots of fried chicken tenders.  I ordered the biscuits and gravy, it took a while for them to arrive and once they did the only item on the plate hot was the egg served over it was hot.  Potatoes were warm and biscuits were cold.  It was like these tiny biscuits were pulled out of the fridge and then covered in gravy.  I immediately  told the waiter which took it away to fix it.  After 5 minutes i was disappointed and asked to cancel the order because i was discouraged by the first attempt and having to wait.  The manager eventually came after 10 minutes, apologized and offered their buffet at no cost.  They were very apologetic but the buffet was filled with similar pastries i was attempting to avoid at the conference.  There was a few hot options and a omelet bar with a long line.  I picked a few options but everything was so so.  If you have time to wait for an omelet it might be worth it.  I was not really impressed.  Breakfast Buffet at Treasure Island was better.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken and waffles
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Cold Biscuits and Gravy

jR5yFvM-QyblLh2BYKWNzg.text: One of the best breakfasts I've ever had in quite awhile.  The French toast churro is quite a devilish treat, but it's sweetness might be overwhelming for those who are opposed to something you can sink your teeth in for breakfast, but also has qualities of a dessert. I'm actually curious to know whether it even can be ordered as a dessert.  The exterior of the toast is totally churro quality in toast and texture and hardness. The interior is another story; its softer, spongy egg goodness.   You don't really need to add on their special syrup, but for those who desire a spike in their insulin level like me, go for it! They already drizzle Caramel chocolate syrup on it.  Really big portion sizes too. A serving size is probably one of these babies. They give you a total of four!  Very good!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. You get four of these trick bad boys. Churro French toast is rich, and tastefully sweet.
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cross section of the softer egg interior

quIIiAjph94dOehBeYbJ9w.text: (See my Venetian review 2017 where I speak about GL.) On business, Venetian, a second home.   Restrained Review: Two visits to the restaurant this trip. Several impressions reduced to one.   Been going to GL Venetian since built, through renovations, know it well. (GL is NOT owned by Venetian.) I am big on the Venetian, a resort set apart from most others.  But the Grand Lux no longer measures up to Venetian standards, and it's all about appeal.   How it started: Table next to me a woman with about six tons of fake dollar store jewelry tells another to "say you didn't like it, they don't make you pay." She said it loud, like common information.  Although the feeling - something different - was there but ignored when I entered, the comment caused me to take that new and serious look around.   It was like I somehow was on the wrong bus. No matter your level of tolerance, the place insofar as patronage, is now more like a White Castles you might put your good sneakers on to visit at 3 in the morning.  Returning to that table, the Server picked up the book and by the look in her eyes I knew they didn't leave a tip. Stood there like she was going to breaking-point-cry. So I asked, and in fact, they jibbed the Server, didn't tip and didn't pay the entire bill. Money she is apparently obligated to cough up.   Society? Maybe. But, don't think so. After some thought and a second trip in, it occurred that GL might try to, dare I say, up prices on the menu. Stop competing down and think up, like middle and upper class. Be discriminant. Be loyal to the expectations of repeat customers.  I will be reviewing other restaurants on same stay that maintain the class and haven't submitted to cashing in their chips.  No problem with the food, nor the Service, but then, a soup kitchen atmosphere effects all and after being on the bus, what can I say, I wanted off.

QvETpF8ttlcDRSxsVe85Dw.text: Grand Lux Cafe is located inside The Venetian. Not hard to get to. I think they have 2 locations inside.  This has to be one of the best places to eat on the strip. The food was great and big portion size. They have a great variety on their menu. From pizza, pasta to noodles. Our server was friendly. And the most important thing, not overpriced. Everything on the strip is expensive. But we left extremely full with leftovers and the bill wasn't ridiculous.  **Must try their rustic pizzas. We couldn't finish and had leftovers. We put it in the fridge back at our hotel, and it tasted great the next night. The crust did not get hard. Still very very good. Pair with a beer, a perfect midnight snack (I would only do this when on vacay!)  Next time I'm back in Vegas, will definitely give them a visit again.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish &amp; Chips $17.95 Sausage Pepperoni Mushroom Rustic Pizza $15.95
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Calamari $14.50
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sunday Night Pasta $19.95

EhETahsdcelU2IcRpIau_A.text: The food was solid, good sized portions, and VERY reasonably priced for Vegas. We had a mix of breakfast and lunch items (breakfast items are served all day), I enjoyed my omelet with goat cheese a lot, my boyfriend's breakfast quesadilla was huge and well-apportioned. They also had soy milk for my latte which I really appreciated. Overall great place for a large group without too much of a wait.

2OiWxmXN45afsugcNeedPg.text: We came here on the first day of our stay at the Palazzo. There are two locations - one in the Venetian and one in the Palazzo. Service was great and our waitress was very attentive to refilling water and offering drinks. Portions were really large - especially the pasta lunch specials! I got the lettuce wraps and I wasn't even able to finish them. This place reminds me of a fancier version of the Cheesecake Factory, which shows in their pricing as well. I think my lettuce wraps were almost $14.   The one thing that annoyed me here was that there were no prices for the drinks so you would have to ask for prices individually. My boyfriend ordered some drink that ended up being $15. I didn't think this place was anything special but tastes good and convenient if you're staying at the two hotels.

YdKp1QOPLV7xeEaoQXO9Mg.text: Fantastic buffet breakfast and smoothies! Everything at the Palazzo and Venetian is first class including this breakfast buffet w delicious bacon and sausage and huge english muffins and delicious fresh strawberries! Highly recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

tzdD8pCGR7OC0_OC1htAow.text: Ended up being our go-to spot for good last minute food in the Venetian during our stay. It was located close to the elevator bank up to our hotel room and offered dishes other than pizza and tacos on short notice.   We had a hectic weekend filled with activities so we  didn't have the luxury of venturing too far for food, Grand Lux proved to be very essential to our trip to Vegas!

C8j6Lfol_Dg-JXSW84MB5w.text: The Churro French Toast was simply amazing.  It was so big I was not able to finish it right away and had it to go. So I can enjoy it next to the swimming pool.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Churro French Toasts
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bloody Mary

23cVp9Y_viS_kGRkGgkFyw.text: Best egg rolls I've ever had!!! Relaxing clean restaurant!! Will def be back!!! Hubby got the Cobb salad and it was amazing!! Good prices and excellent service!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cobb salad and egg rolls

b0PpKmygOJaUjL0F1n4_kw.text: When it is 5AM in the morning, where do you go when you're hungry? The Grand Lux Cafe. My friend and I met some awesome people and were winning at craps that we all decided we were hungry and our new friends recommended this place for late night steak. I got the filet mignon, some people got a burger, my friend shared a ribeye and got a whole bunch of appetizers to share with the table.   First of all, how do you not have fireball? this is VEGAS!!! fireball (chilled) is probably one of the easiest shots to take so early in the morning but sadly they did not have any so we got lemon drop shots.  We got this Asian inspired nacho and the sauce they use (teriyaki?) was way too sweet that you couldn't eat it. My steak was more medium than medium rare but it was tender enough to eat. Other people looked to like their food but again, it was 5AM, we were all drunk and came off from a high of winning that night.

GmGLjb_1jQnS2pk0nLRjXw.text: If you're going to eat at grand lux cafe. It has to be on the the palazzo where Eddie recommended the Salisbury steak #1 and Chris pitches your drinks fast. Great Service Always!

ShQrpsWxOQ7qDwgdJOaX_w.text: I know it's a chain, but they do a great job delivering a quality meal for the price.  Portions are huge.  Great, attentive service.  Even if you've been to another Grand Lux, menus do vary.

yAwAQ5Xa71JW9ikPY6cldQ.text: Very very plain food for 1.5x markup. We decided to give it a try because we heard it was rated the best breakfast in Vegas and right downstairs from our hotel.   The whole menu was super plain and catered to serve the masses. No original line item or special ingredients. My omelette was $17 smh.   I tasted about 1/2 cup of butter on my omelette. It was pretty gross to eat. I had to munch on a side salad to balance the grease from the omelette.   They also did not have a restroom. For such a big place like this, we were asked to go to the restrooms in the casino.

vwE5lo8Iu-2IYrhD-qJLkA.text: The breakfast was fabulous,  Marcio D was our server and he was spectacular!  Our drinks were never empty and he was on top of any request with a smile and promptness. The drinks are just as great as the food.  We ended up returning in the same trip because we had such a great experience.  Thanks Marcio!

65xaedJYzyQ-uTOR3lDQfg.text: I've waited a long time to come here. Grand Luxe near home closed a few years ago and I was devastated. When I found out there was a Grand Luxe was in Vegas I made a bee line to the Venetian.   Upon entering there was no line, my party was seated immediately and we had a blissful breakfast. I love the quality and attention to detail in the food. The service is friendly and equitable to the food for a full experience.   My recommendation for breakfast is a simple one egg, hash browns, chicken mango sausage, and pancakes. If you're going extra indulgent, have the French toast. You can't go wrong. Thank me later !

EJiMhuRUAaSo4HiWNQ5D7g.text: Another great choice for Vegas and somewhat off the beaten path, located inside the Venetian. While the menu is fairly extensive (a little overwhelming) our server was great (Linda) and gave us the skinny on her favorite choices and popular dishes as well. Always get a selection of appetizers and you won't be disappointed! It's a good choice of an American cuisine selection with a few "worldly" choices. All in all, we were not disappointed!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

qgIqNazw0m6kZLWZHP5neQ.text: This is a great restaurant located inside the Venetian hotel on the Las Vegas Strip.    We've been here several times and it's always busy but you still can be seated quickly.   They have a very extensive menu and it's all good. I've had some salads, pastas and meats here.   They also have great desserts.    I believe this is a sister property to Cheesecake Factory who also has a very extensive menu. With great service and a great atmosphere.   We came in last night and they were way busy so we just posted up at the bar, got some drinks and had our steaks right there.  Our bartender was great. Unfortunately I can't remember her name.  (1 too many Long Islands).

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-cNgxaOvE_Ra7ftNKAve9w.text: I love Grand Luxe's but did they all change the veggie burger or just this location in the Venetian? It used to be advertised as deep fried veggie burger and now it's just a crispy veggie burger with a boring presentation. I was wishing I ordered something different. The veggie burger was good but not great, thick and flavorful but it was not what expected from the crispness to the lack of toppings. Too soft, only offered crushed avocado on top. Kind of dry and boring all together. The Asian nachos are always amazing here, even the rice that goes with it!! Blood orange soda just ok, not enough bubble. My boyfriend liked his carbonara pasta. Slower service here but it's busy. The one in Palazzo is not open 24/hr but is advertised wrong on here. Good spot for late night snacks and people watching!

veBh9WY_mSzw0N97shY32w.text: Great service, great prices and amazing food. Personally going out with my significant other can be stressful for her sometimes due to her gluten allergy-but have no fear here! They have a ton of things on the menu that they offer gluten free options for.   Wonderful server who made sure we were full on drinks all the time and anything we needed she would do her best to help. I had chicken and waffles and it was delicious and for once not some heated up chicken tenders from the freezer and an amazing (house made I believe) syrup that was so wonderful over the waffle as it was covered in walnuts.  My lady had ordered the sandwich special that came with half sandwich, soup and salad. She had no complaints and was full to the brim when we left.   Would recommend for breakfast/brunch/lunch! (Did not order anything dinner related, so can't suggest any of it).

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

V1LowtLbwSQpj6UP3c2fYA.text: I came here while in town on vacation.  Having been to Grand Lux in Chicago multiple times I was expecting the normal huge, generous portioned salads.  I essentially received a plate of lettuce with a few tomatoes, a few small pieces of chicken, a few slivers of goat cheese, maybe 10 corn kernels and no almonds or dates as advertised in the description.  I asked the server if I received the wrong plate for which she replied that is simply how it comes- mostly lettuce.  Pretty disappointed with my experience here but again, I can only speak to the salad and how I compare it to the Grand Lux in Chicago.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mendocino salad

1rc_juv9VlXFgSUuhjeq_Q.text: Grand Cafe The Venetian  Open 24 hours a day, large menu, great service and quality food.  I have eaten there twice, once for dinner and once for lunch and on both occasions, the food was fresh and prepared exactly how I ordered it. Most recently I had a grilled chicken salad with many substitutions and omissions: (dressing on the side, no cheese, adding avocado) I was not expecting the quality of the salad I received and the generous portion that had followed each of my instructions. That experience alone does not merit consistency but prior to that I had a chicken sandwich that wa served in a similar manner, again paying attention to my alterations. My friend who frequents Las Vegas often. ordered a French dip and he said that the one there  better than the 2 others he had in higher end restaurants. He described the meat as plentiful, tender and with the right amount of fat as to give it the flavor he craved.  The restaurant may be owned by Cheesecake Factory and if so, it explains the large menu. However this place is higher end on its quality of. the food itself especially considering that with sauces and spices removed (due to preference or allergies), the  food still satisfies "au naturelle", which Cheesecake could not copy.

7L_8iVABmFFeWkhFHF6eaQ.text: I visit Vegas 3-5 times a year and eat at Grand Lux at least 3 times per visit. Between the consistently exceptional food, a wide variety, the impeccable service and the fact that a lot of the breakfast crew know me by name (the cookies I bring to them probably help) it's my go-to place on The Strip. In a town where the odds are pretty much always against you, Grand Lux is one of few places you'll win every time.

4ABiat7r6pg2jjGXUkGVPA.text: After much wandering, we somehow wound up here for dinner. At that point we were hungry and hoping for a decent meal. But we were pleasantly surprised.  I ordered chicken and waffles. I got a staggering amount of chicken, six good-sized strips, on a round waffle. I could barely finish it. Although it was strips instead of whole chicken pieces, the chicken was good - crispy, juicy, flavorful - but the waffle was the star, light and absolutely delicious. Served with pecans and maple syrup. It was a very good meal. David got a ginger beef stir fry, again expecting it to be decent, but he raved about it. The beef was top notch, tender and flavorful. All the elements were perfect. He said it was the best Chinese dish he'd had in a long time.  Our server was exceptional. Very attentive. The bread he brought at the start was very good. Iced tea was excellent and it was refilled frequently as was my water glass.

x8-ZKrlDmbLN8-GYGrP9MQ.text: Quite busy! Expect to wait in line.   Stopped for breakfast and waited approx 20 minutes for a table with a party of 7.  Nothing outstanding to note - it's a 24 hour restaurant with a very diverse menu to please a variety of tastes.    Service is adequate- they are pretty busy so the servers are running around.  Expect to have your order taking, having a runner bring it out and then the server will arrive to bring your check and bus the dishes.  If you need something additional -ensure to let the runner know so you have it to eat your meal with. 7 people $147.

BlY-eUkz1aocZ6KYtfNmVw.text: The breakfast buffet is great with quite a few options for a reasonable price in Vegas Strip! I took a star off because my friend is a vegetarian, and when we called the restaurant, they said they do have lot of vegetarian options but there were hardly any.

JRs4FFUjWOnxUokfDTeo9A.text: Had a dinner here around 6pm after Christmas. Wait was only 5 min. I ordered a seafood salad. The price was reasonable and portion was huge. Flavor was fine. I liked the variety of ingredients the dish covered. Service was very friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

0s-vRmiitvh85Ql84OcjCw.text: Grand Lux Cafe in Vegas was just as good as the one we go to all the time in Houston!

DkOBo-vVM50OIqGsaiZpVg.text: This place is good but nothing spectacular.  I got the pasta carbonara and it was delicious.  However, it wasn't authentic since it had cream . Real carbonara has no dairy.   Anyway, the decor was okay as was the service.   Overall, it's a good place.

tAT5HmlBw5P954cRjs2_5Q.text: Loved the food here and the prices were extremely reasonable for being right on the strip. Even though it's a chain I'd still highly recommend Grand Lux! We split the chicken carbonara and it was delicious and the portion was so big we didn't even finish it all!

81q3YZgJppOuN5Ti8Ke0NQ.text: We were looking for a hearty dinner and happened upon this place while walking through the casino. It was still early, just after 5pm so it wasn't too busy. We went to see how long the wait would be and it was only 5 minutes so we waited and were promptly shown a booth close to the front.   Our server was great throughout our meal from taking our food orders, ensuring we got our drinks, and checking on how the food tasted.  The menu is large and something for everyone with sandwiches and burgers, pastas, and hearty entrees with meat and potatoes.  I decided on the chicken salad sandwich and salad.  The sandwich was packed with chicken, 2 slices of tomatoes on each sandwich half and lettuce.  It was one of those open wide type sandwiches. The dressing on the salad was delicious and I devoured the salad quickly.   The others in my party were happy with their meals and the portions are large for a reasonable price.  I would definitely come back again and try something else from the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken salad sandwich and salad

1lYieFC4R-vVsnn7htARAw.text: Went in for a late lunch. Can't say anything about the food since we never even got water.  We were seated right away and there weren't many people in there.  Waited, waited, asked to see our waitress, waited, finally got up and left after a good 10 to 15 minutes with nobody coming to our table.  We were seated next to a pile of dirty dishes and towels at the next table that looked as if was abandoned half way through cleaning.  It was cleaned about 5 minutes after we sat down but we still never saw a waitress.  On the way out we told the hostess we were going somewhere else since nobody ever came to take our order.  She said oh sorry and walked away.  Won't be going there ever.....

mwcA6x2Q_gpo99VLGczsHA.text: the food is outstanding, I had the chicken jumble, which was delicious, I actually ordered additional side to go, I will post pictures and a video of both my food and my dessert, which was a short cake

OF_SifCWSdXPFIf4iuL67A.text: They have a great buffet and brunch.   For dessert I love their beignets. So good!!!

jP1srkzhhnK7ItTmT5tLyg.text: We met a friend for lunch during a very busy weekend.  We were seated and served quickly.  They had a very nice selection of lunch specials as well as a brunch buffet.  We all 3 ordered something different and each of us was very pleased with our meal.  The prices were moderate, the food was very good and service was great.  We will definitely go back!

qP-tWt0fP5cTL_D4DfsFrQ.text: Stopped by here with a friend for some dessert and coffee.  We chose this place as we weren't sure where else we could go and be able to sit down to nosh and chat, and, not to mention, we missed getting into Bouchon for dessert by about 15 minutes.  For a place like Grand Lux Cafe, with a nice menu of food options, I was surprised as to how limited their dessert menu was, and in particularly, how rather pedestrian was their selection:  bread pudding, chocolate cheesecake, strawberry shortcake, creme brulee.  We opted for the bread pudding and the cheesecake (since it was made with Godiva chocolate and was gluten free).  I actually liked the bread pudding better, not too sweet and not too dense.  It was a perfect accompaniment for a cup of coffee.  While the cheesecake was also good, it was a bit too sweet for me.  Service here is excellent, as is the ambiance, especially when it empties out around 10pm, and you can actually relax and have a casual conversation with your dining companion.  3.5 stars, rounding it up to 4.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

OLyJJDYy1E20DFeGY4dsWg.text: I went with my mom, who has a lot of food allergies (gluten, soy, & dairy), and their menu was excellently labeled for gluten sensitivities.  They had so many choices, and our server was very knowledgeable about how to modify anything to make it gluten-free.  Would highly recommend it for anyone who needs to be gluten-free.

hLt7EFFEKov-hN9l4_4omA.text: This location is supposed to be 24/7 but they are closed at 4am.  After losing big at the blackjack tables, you need some comfort food before going back to the room to sleep.  So one star!

GQySqWJqQDWv9NneZOXYwg.text: For a chain restaurant inside a casino I have to say I was pleasantly surprised by the reasonable price of the food. Service was prompt and efficient and the food quality was as expected. I've been to other Grand Lux Cafes and they were better food wise but I still give this location 4 stars for the overall experience. Plenty of choices in the Venetian but if you're looking for a casual reasonably priced place to eat I give this place a thumbs up.

qBjW4WnYzDJIN9mndxyK8w.text: Was staying at the Venetian for a week and I ate at this location every morning for breakfast. Every day the service was excellent until Tuesday morning when my guests and I waited for the server to get to work, she was 40 minutes late. She got to work and we all noticed she had a bad attitude. She slammed the metal water pitcher near my phone missing it by a half inch. When I told her about her attitude and what how her service, she went off. I corrected her she was in the customer service business and if she is having a bad day don't take it out on the customers. When the issue was addressed to her manager the manager took her side. There was other customers complaining about this server but the manager never corrected the problem. This restaurant don't care about customer service only about how much money it is making. A bad experience here. Not worth going back

tysL2ynMdeHJnlRcwzw7tg.text: #9 of 100 Review Challenge of 2016  Huge menu, huge spot and looks like it is related to the Cheesecake Factory. They have huge booths for 6 people and are accommodating with a toddler and stashing a stroller somewhere.   It was a busy Saturday morning and they unfortunately got my friend's make your own omelette wrong but their waffle topped with strawberries was delicious, along with my custom omelette. We also ordered a bottle of champagne to kick things off. The fruit smoothie was tall and looked tasty. They also forgot to bring a side of bacon and we had trouble with the separation of checks.  Convenient with a lot of options. I'd go back.

aW4w1Be10ZciUwl-vRvoUA.text: Very reminiscent of a Cheesecake Factory but this menu was still much smaller. The service was mediocre at best...sat forever waiting for drink refills and the waitress did flybys of the table which made it near impossible to request anything. We also didn't receive any bread (although we did get an appetizer, a piece still would have been nice with the salad I ordered). Wish I had better things to say as I had higher hopes of a great casual lunch spot in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

f-9nmGEEfj9vAsKbGMooqQ.text: What a Disgraceful and Shocking experience we had on August 14 th 2018 in this place, after our appetizer the waitress left the dirty plates on the table for us to eat our entree and never bothered to put  new ones ! The entree : Scampi with pasta came cold !!!!! We called a manageress who came like 20 minutes after and we said to her we want the check and feel she should not charge us and her response was you ve eaten some of it I have to charge you !!!!! That is rude and dishonest,I contested and my lovely mother 88 years old was eating with me and she is a very fragile , the manageress came back with 5 Security guards et frightened us to death ! My mum could have had a heart attack ! We paid and left immediately HORRIFIED !!!!! We went down to the lobby of the Venetian Hotel and spoke to a manager on duty he was very Apologetic to us and explained that GranLuxCafe belongs to the CheeseFactory group ! My mum bursted in tears and I rang the horrible rude manageress to tell her we would sue her for publically shaming us so rudely ! She called Security again and they came after us as if we were criminals or delinquents , in our entire lives never anything like that happened to us ! It was HORRIFIC, they interrogated me for 1 hour shaming me publically !!!!! We were the victims of a cold bad meal and we had no right to complain ! I rang the Headquarters of CheeseFactory and they parted up with their employee by lying and saying the manageress felt threatened !  What a Machiavelic mind this  lady has . We will never return EVER again to any of the Restaurants of the CheeseFactory group. AVOID THIS ABUSIVE RUDE GRAN LUX CAFE inside Venetian Hotel in Las Vegas that is the advice I am giving to Yelpers . Hope this information was useful to all readers.

nhyGPc4Oyj4tc2VBJ_AiYQ.text: Had late nite dinner here. Had the burger with side salad and the portions were huge. Dessert was sticky toffee cake.  This was to die for. But it's quite sweet...warning for those of you who don't like overly sweet.   Went here for breakfast as well. Had the deluxe breakfast sandwich.  Could have feed two people.  Delicious and filling.   Service was on point.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

UgqVi4vnPQwi5TfO3BdGug.text: Located in the Venetian, this place is definitely value for money compared to the other dining options in many of the hotels. Plus is it open 24 hours......  We walked in here at 11pm on a Tuesday and were greeted and quickly seated. Our server however, was not a happy camper that day. It took her 15 minutes to acknowledge our presence or ask us for our drink order. Since we were starving, this annoyed us a little more that day. Avoiding another delay, we ordered everything at once. Once she had our order, she huffed and puffed away.   BTW I must mention that this place is similar to the Cheesecake Factory (or so I was told when we checked in to the Venetian). Based on the menu, I can agree a 100%. It was 10 pages long - you have small plates, almost big plates, big plates etc. and the prices seemed to match those at the Cheesecake Factory. It took me 10 minutes to find what I wanted to eat and that also after scanning through only half the menu - maybe that is why the service is so slow - they like to give you time to go through the entire menu :)  Sourdough bread is complimentary, however it was hard and dry and not comparable to nice warm bread. Maybe this is something the restaurant can change.   For our food, we got the Asian nachos (based on the yelp comments and reviews) and volcano shrimp to start off. The Asian nachos are a MUST TRY. The nachos are freshly baked, crispy, with a sweet sesame topping, chicken, cheese and rice. The chicken is tangy and juicy, and the cheese does not overload the nachos (which is usually what I find on most occasions). The volcano shrimp were fried shrimp (the regular) but the dipping sauce was interestingly tasty - Spicy Chilli Aioli.   For the entree, I ordered the Indochine Shrimp and Chicken and my wife got the Pasta Pomodoro. Both these plates were good enough for 2 people each (so all in all we got food that could feed 4). I enjoyed my Indochine Shrimp and Chicken, even though it was on the sweeter side with raisins and really lacked the Indian spices it claimed to have. The chicken in this dish was probably a little under-seasoned but the shrimp counterbalanced the chicken in this case. My wife's Pomodoro was plain pasta in tomato sauce and nothing really out of the blue, other than a huge plate of food.  We waited another 15 minutes after finishing to get our check before walking out satiated though not thoroughly happy. The lack of seasoning and flavor in the Chicken (Indochine Shrimp and Chicken) and pasta (Pomodoro), and the poor service makes me give the place a 3 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Remaining plate of the Asian Nachos!! A must try!!

JjkQoVcNLlyHAs3LSdmtIA.text: Had breakfast here because it was much cheaper than our hotel's shitty breakfast buffet. Got the best chicken and waffles ever! SO GOOD. It ranks as the top two chicken and waffles I've ever got!!! Husband got some taco egg thing that he liked it too.

b0hS-Qi95kEH3qNVmy1bhw.text: I have been here numerous times and this is a convenient place to come when you are on the strip.  The food here is on the pricier side but the quantities are huge so you do get your money's worth here.  Def better price compared to other hotel restaurants.  This place=Vegas version of cheese cake factory.    I got the Sonoma salad to go which was bomb. The dates, raisins, goat cheese and crunchy bacon pieces created a nice blend of texture and flavor.  But I was disappointed they forgot to include the avocado!    They are open 24 hours.  There could be a wait post clubbing hours though.

_jhyrEnNYLSaTGYg8Ufi4w.text: Was super excited to bring my husband here and you guys really disappointed !! My food was super dry and oily . Service sucked we had to wave down the server . Wanted to order dessert and was told it was 30 min wait so we said no . Server took our card and literally took about 20 min to come back with him after taking other orders . So we could've order dessert since we had to wait anyways . Not worth the 100$ we spent

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Greasy, dry , service sucked . Not worth my 100$

-1mrp6Rm5cQWG-m6bnc0bA.text: Been eating here for years. It all started in Dallas. I have been going to the grand lux since 2007 so I have seen the menu change all these years.

jPGjiP1-1X43GgAtYJ4COg.text: Fantastic!  Hash browns were amazing breakfast quesadilla was awesome biscuits and gravy were just as fantastic.  Service was good. Very nice chatty waiter. After a horrible experience at yardbirds the day before this was a nice treat!!  May go back tomorrow!

J5sXoloL_dM-cdIV1KtSMw.text: Stumbled here after a night of drinking/clubbing. We were already staying at the Venetian so it was super convenient. We were all so tired, so that may have impacted my taste buds but the omelette I ordered was good. The hashbrowns....SO SALTY. The saltiness was consistent across our table of 6 so there may have been an accidental spill?   We let our waiter know, but didn't care for a remake. Just wanted to make sure the kitchen knew and he was very nice about it. Large portions, I'd maybe be back when I'm sober? Hah.

hROQ4tQ370jCkjryxLxvaA.text: Excellent choice in the Venetian. The weekend buffet is pretty Good. The service is amazing!

06UU_JUo6xnzHG7kYjlBXQ.text: Strike one, was giving my name to hostess, and rude white lady cut me off and the hostess ignored me and put her name first before me even thou i was speaking first. She even got sat wayy before me.   Strike two...i finally get seated and guess what its in the shitty part of the restaurant and my plates are dirty!   Strike three...was asking for something from my waiter and he completely ignores me and says "got it" n just continues walking right past me!  Strike four...ordered appetizers and our meal came out before our appetizers.  ..not to mention ordered a medium rare steak and got a well done steak instead...also server refused to bring us steak sauce, and didnt even give us a steak knife.  How is this restaurant even 4 stars?  Spoke to a manager Alex he didnt even care about anything i mentioned to him, and the fact that i was treated as second class citizen.

o8j8i7qRxr6QYr1Gf5a7Bg.text: Always s good experience here you get bang for your buck. I mean one salad could feed 2 ppl. This visit I had the chili lime chicken salad and it was great !!! Full of flavor and texture and a healthy portion !!! I also ordered the fresh baked cookies they are so moist DVD chewy they are just is a yummy treat !!! And they are made fresh to your order so if you want them right after your food the order them when you place your food order. !!!

Yeb_CAJgLThAVF03vkCmhA.text: This past Monday,  thought I would grab a light dinner of eggs & home fries as it was late. Asked the waiter for the kitchen to not add any extra salt to my food. A simple request. The Waiter was very pleasant and said it would be no problem. After around 10 min the manager came over and said the home fries were fairly salty, and it would take a little longer, but  she was having the kitchen freshly grate and prepare the potatoes without any salt. Thought this extra touch was so wonderful. Worthy of 5 stars! But that's when this tale takes a very different turn...45 minutes went by... still no eggs and home fries. I asked both the waiter and manager why the long wait. I Was told it would be right out. What I received after waiting almost an hour were three extremely rubbery hard yolked fried eggs (ordered over medium) obviously sitting under a heat lamp for quite some time). The "freshly made" home fries had the entire crunchy browned top removed and were extremely salty. So basically the kitchen took conventional home fries and removed the top, rather than making fresh, hoping it would go unnoticed... UNBELIEVABLE!!!. At this point, I was angry and hungry, got up and decided it was time to leave. Once again I spoke to the "twenty something" manager who professed her apologies and then had the audacity to say to me "Ok we won't charge you for your meal". REALLY!!!!!' There was no consumption...I just cut into the eggs and saw they were inedible, then tasted the home fries, which I immediately spit out.  I ended up getting a yogurt at the Venetian store.
