Will NEVER EVER go back to this restaurant again!!! So many great places to eat in Vegas, do yourself a huge favor and go elsewhere! Grand Lux SUCKS!

VFr1fSWj7Ayk3lVkfKGgzg.text: We were a group of 10 and our sever Brian was SO AMAZING forget the food lol it was all about him as a big group we all felt like he was there for us when it came to the questions we had very much enjoyed ourselves food was on hit and  thanks to him the whole lunch was great... Brian you are the man a Real MVP for holding it down for our table we'll be back just for you...

C0U2EXYx9b1Gp5q7J0FkJQ.text: As a guest of The Venetian, I ordered food 2 days in a row & waited for them to bring it out. Day 1 the food was cold & I had to bring it back down from my room on the 23rd floor! Day 2 I ordered dessert, which should have been ready in no less than 10 minutes. I waited again & it took over 30! Wasn't anything that had to be cooked. Just dessert. RIDICULOUS! Thankfully the manager gave me a refund & a bottle of water. Seems if you order to go, you aren't as much of a priority as those dining in. Good service should extend throughout your establishment. Pascal Bruelhart Pascal Bruelhart

iHGhHIe7993gu14aRFCXrA.text: Service was fast and friendly nice calm atmosphere for vegas , the salmon sandwich was excellent as was the salad. Reasonable prices for vegas as well.

2Kgxc0NUnn_JkMsmh2kf_A.text: My first time coming here and I'm not going to lie but they waiters and waitresses are sooooo slow .... Kind of got me upset especially since it wasn't hat crowded.... On the plus side, my BLT sandwich was good  and you would think how hard is it to make a BLT sandwich but let me tell you.... So many places screw it up so I was happy when his place didn't ;)

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

M9wo2OSmwnmRCI3xxF02nA.text: By request I was asked not to say anything by my family because they did not want a damper on our family trip and wanted to keep it positive. As "nice" as everyone is, there are a few important key qualities that were missing from this experience. We were a party of 11 and understandably at a restaurant it may be difficult to get everyone's food out hot and at the same time.   I'm going to start with there was 45 minute wait, great no problem, it's delicious food. We sat down and drink orders were taken, and not delivered for a while. I know it may be tough to understand if you don't have kids yourself, but when someone has a two year old, please bring the child's drink out... ASAP. No matter how busy your kitchen is, it doesn't take more than a few minutes to bring out Apple juice, not 10. Then after 15 minutes we sent someone to ask for the bread basket to hold us over, until the rest of our drinks arrived and food order was taken.  I ordered the Braised Pot Roast, delicious. It came out with the broccoli cold, I literally handed a piece to the server when they came back... He didn't seem like he knew exactly how to respond to that because it was so obvious. They took my (and my cousins plate who ordered the same)  back, promised new sides and hot plate. This time veggies and potatoes hot, but the inside of the pot roast was cold. Might want to check in the re-heating protocol so you know the outcome.  Needless to say we were starving and ate our dishes anyways.   I was not a fan of how this was handled and wasn't even offered a manager or a discount to appease this annoying situation. I feel like we were treated as is our business didn't matter because they are such a busy establishment. I won't be suggesting this restaurant any longer, whether I'm in Houston, Vegas, or Scottsdale...

DGIYVm1D8a4retMLuFoDwg.text: This is the sister restaurant of Cheesecake Factory, so expect huge portions! Ambience is similar too. Good food, good prices & good hours!   (Note: The Grand Lux in Venetian Hotel is open 24 hours everyday, which is a great place for a late-night meal! Don't get this confused with the Grand Lux in the Palazzo because they do have different hours there)   Food was delicious. Comes with bread and butter. I ordered the Asian Nachos and it was the perfect appetizer with that wonton crisp! Also ordered the pulled pork sandwich and that was one of the most tender pulled pork I've ever had! So good! Prices are mostly under $25, which is pretty good for the portions you get. Service, eh it was just okay. But definitely will be going back!

fw6_4MtJ7PeRGkMJBMWXQQ.text: Waited too long then when they seated us.. The table was not completely ready.   Highly recommend the Chicken Lemon Picatta & Bistro steak  ( less than $18 ea ) .. With strawberry lemonade. It was yummy indeed! The first server was not very pleasant ( female w accent/ blonde ) but the second one - ( shift change ) was absolutely delightful..( Pier - i think he was french ). Kids menu are priced right ($8 below, around there ).

gXVsYMyHR4HT6JGz8UE4VA.text: Had the pepperoni, sausage and mushroom pizza lunch. The pizza crust was nice and crispy... just the way I like it. The mid section was on the " tad bit soggy side" side salad a by small.  Service was great. I would return....

UsHdFz2hIO8CYQrB4rbHMQ.text: I loveeee this place!  Good 'ol yelp lead me to this wonderful place! The bread is pure deliciousness. I ordered the steak with toasted Brussels sprouts and mash potato. OMG. The Brussels were sooooo good. They were crispy with bacon I believe. The steak had mushrooms! I'm a huge mushroom fan so that was nice. JBH ordered one of the pasta dishes. It was a tomato basil mozzarella pasta very simple and good! We did find a piece of hair in it.... the manger came by to apologize & handled it very well. I appreciated that. They offered us a salad or soup on the house and asked if we'd like a new dish. JBH liked the one he had chose so he just ordered the same thing. Oh yeah the pasta had grilled chicken! It was cooked quite well. I tend to not order chicken because places always cook it so dry! But not here that's for sue. I'd definitely come here to try something else. Their menu has many options & it was kindof hard for me to decide lol. This always happens to me.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Really good bread!!!!

gT5JHVIo28Ijv6RW9MTExg.text: My go to restaurant whenever I'm in Vegas. This place is awesome and they have food at all hours of the night and even in your room with room service.   I recently discovered their "to-go" shop tucked right next door to the restaurant. They have the best turkey Havarti sandwich that I like to get when I'm arriving late and am hungry. I always stay at the Venetian so it is very convenient.   Their fruit cups there are also tasty when you feel like eating light and healthy to try to look good in that bikini for all you ladies.   Great place to eat. Highly recommended

b1j4s8RtoNHBV0L2rmz5Jg.text: Ordered soup of the day - cream of mushroom, potato rolls with cheese filling And chicken in plum sauce.. Everything was super.. The portions were huge..

TgeHOVt7NqbWjOHpBAXGVg.text: This afternoon on a staycation with family, we ate in the Grand Lux Cafe.With a location in the Venetian, I felt like I was transplanted to a cafe in Venice.    Grand Lux Cafe is the upscale brand of the Cheesecake Factory. The restaurants are upscale with decent prices. They include a bar and bakery.   The Cheesecake Factory website states that the Grand Lux Cafe came into existence when the Venetian asked David Overton, who was the founder of Cheesecake Factory to design an upscale restaurant for his resort. The story goes that he went all over Europe doing culinary research. The research resulted in the very first Grand Lux Cafe-where we had lunch this afternoon.     Our experience was that Grand Lux Cafe is upscale and affordable. Our table overlooked the extravagant Venetian.    In my opinion, where the menu shines is the lunch special. It is from 11 to 5. The lunch specials include Lunch soup/ salad ($10.95), Rustic pizza & salad ($11.95), Lunch salad ($9.95-11.95), Lunch enchiladas ($11.95), Lunch pasta & salad ($10.95-$11.15), and Lunch salmon ($13.25).    I was going to order the Lunch pasta & salad. When I asked the Waitress if the lunch portion is enough to fill you up, she answered that depends on your appetite. With that nebulous answer, I ordered the BLT with french fries. I don't think this was the kind of dish that David Overton was researching in Europe. Overall I was happy with the food.    I enjoyed having lunch in Grand Lux Cafe. I was off from work and with family. It is not too often that I get to have lunch in Venice. It was a change of scenery with good food that I appreciated. I am showing this appreciation with a 4 star rating.  The Yelp 100 Challenge. Review 50.

_e676WM2odxteJKBmrEAxQ.text: Good stuff! Nicely decorated in a Cheesecake Factory-esque way. The food was tasty. Service was friendly. I had the Cuban sandwich with prosciutto and roasted pork. It was very tasty and not dry. The fries were crispy with a nice soft center. The waiter was nice and brought me my requested array of fry condiments. My wife had the chicken salad sandwich and it was tasty as well. Not too inundated with mayo. A good place for sure. Sad we missed their brunch buffet - next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Modern Cuban sandwich. Delicious - prosciutto and roasted pork!

RuRT7BufpfvHoM38yf-UkQ.text: Although we missed breakfast by 15 minutes.. They had a small (but nice) selection of breakfast items, along with their lunch menu. Everyone thoroughly enjoyed their meals here. The chicken avocado salad I had was out of this world delicious! Hazelnut dressing.. Just yum!  Will be back in the future.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dad enjoyed his smoke salmon omelette!
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My husband said the Reuban was yummy, though a tad bit on the salty side..
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Could have used more chicken, but this salad was delicious! It had a nice hazelnut dressing that I wish I had a recipe for.  Yum yum!

DggtH3ekjKvqLUrWsPRx3A.text: Amazing cafe.  Fast and friendly service.  Great location.  The Kale and Grains salad was the first salad I've actually liked eating.  If I was staying at the Venetian I would eat here daily!

EyxK2TgzpC1VFsh975pHTg.text: 4 Stars for food, plus 1 star for great service!  Located in the Venetian Hotel, this is a good spot to try some quick American-influence entrees. I've been here a couple of times with a party of four or greater - of course here on business. It's pretty relaxing considering how crowded it can be. During my visit, the wait staff was very attentive, kept our water filled at all times. And kept on bringing warm bread.   One thing I found interesting is how they broadcast their recent health and safety inspection - a wall dedicated to letter A's. It's actually quite nice.   Food was pretty good considering the cost, and I must say, wait times on food is exceptional considering the crowd. During a tradeshow evening, this place was jammed packed - and we got our food in about 15 minutes. Very quick considering the crowd.   I had the Spaghetti with Clams and Shrimp. Good portions of food - although, I would've preferred less Clams and Shrimp. It seemed a bit much.   I also tried the Keylime pie - it was much larger than I expected - so, consider that a warning for those who have a desire with dessert.   If your crew isn't sure of what to eat, then bring them here - a relaxing atmosphere, where there something for everyone to eat.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spaghetti with Clams and Shrimp.
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Keylime pie
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Health and Safety Inspection Record

oILXzyJ7P4Ip6sw31M0a4Q.text: OK, been here twice now, because it was what was open/convenient. I definitely wouldn't have eaten here if the nearby Panda Express were open instead.

W7CDHaPh9jcu9pIq6CUCcQ.text: Absolutely amazing service.  The food was delicious as well but the service was top notch. We we're seated almost immediately on a Saturday and our server Rick gave my girlfriend and I the best service I've ever had. Rick really impressed my girlfriend and I and made us feel welcome.  We had the express breakfast and we we're blown away. Everything was fresh and delicious.  I love the Venetian and look forward to returning. Hopefully next time we are at Grand Lux Rick will be our server!

hx6vtgD_UAXXLOXDzsyWog.text: I am in LOVE with this place. I was attending a conference at the Venetian for several days and I ate here everyday. I can't believe I haven't written a review. When my family came to meet me in Vegas, the first thing I said was, "You have GOT to try this place." The only reason I'm writing a late review now is because I found an old receipt from the Grand Luxe and now I'm sad because I miss my Chicken Madeira.   First, it's conveniently located within the hotel (for you guests) and not a far walk away from the meeting/convention rooms (for people like me). There was no wait the several times I went, although it was busy but the space is large enough to accommodate indoor seating and artificial outdoor seating (it's not technically outdoors because you're outside of the main restaurant but still within the walkways/slot machine of the hotel and people are walking by as you eat).  Anyhow, let me tell you.. first let's start with the FREE bread.. my enemy. I love eating the inside soft part only and leaving the crust, and my colleague likes eating the crust and not the inside. Something for everyone.  As for the menu, everything is delicious.... except for this fish dish that was too lemon=y and I sent It back and ordered something else. I thought it was just me but my colleague ordered the same thing and sent it back also. They were gracious about it. The servers are all friendly. Maybe they hate you on the inside but they don't act like it on the outside.   Next, the portions are HUUUUGE... Yes, it could cost $15-20 for some plates (my madeira chicken and pot roast were each $18.95 according to my receipt) but you could split it with 2 people or take it to go and it's totally affordable. I have a HEALTHY appetite and I would always have an actual half of my meal to go because it was so huge. That is always a plus in my book when I can eat until I'm about to burst and still have enough leftover to feed me for another meal....   The prices are extremely reasonable. I'm looking at an old receipt and apparently my thai fried chicken was $12.95 and a kids mac n cheese was $5.95. Definitely reasonably priced. Considering the portions and quality, it is worth it. A large selection of comfort foods, pasta, Asian inspired dished with an American flare, etc... definitely something for everyone, including kids. This is like Denny's or IHOP's older, fancier, more handsome, brother...  Plus you know a place is great when I ate there several days in a row and ordered something different every single time and still had a great experience... CANT WAIT TO PLAN A TRIP BACK TO VEGAS JUST SO I CAN EAT HERE AGAIN... LOL

gsP6ye3QmQ-pefNvhydDQA.text: If you are a fan of the Cheesecake Factory then a trip to the Grand Luxe Cafe should be on your list when in Vegas.   Owned by the Cheesecake Factory so you will see the similarities. Solid plates served with panache but with a comfort food twist to it. Everything you get here is big, and tasty! Menu is large, and if you can't find something to eat here then you might as well just go get a candy bar. Plus, they have those great slices of cheescake made by the parent company.  I love coming here for lunch and getting the half sandwich and soup special. Also comes with a salad. Great deal for $10, and you get more than enough on the plate to satisfy. Also, many salads, burgers, sandwiches and so much more to choose from. Decent prices for what you get here.  Plus, the actual place is large and beautifully decorated. A lot of attention to detail went into the planning of this location. Another cool thing is to get a seat in the fake front outside patio area to people watch. Sometimes you can see a real freak show walk by here in Vegas where anything goes!

Qw9FJMN1DCmy4q-7C17vFQ.text: We had nice breakfast here this morning. We picked the Grand Lux Express Breakfast at $18,95 each. It was a small buffet with pastries, bread, bagel, oat meals, cereal, bacon, ham, hash brown, scrambled eggs, fruits and an egg station. It's really good. The orange juice was fresh. The coffee also not bad. Service also very prompt and helpful. Nice breakfast to start a day

hJC9WteY27X1gmcZl0aV7A.text: Its oooohkay. People compare it to cheesecake but I like cheesecake much better. The menu is all over the place. The Asian chicken nachos were pretty legit. Other than that it may have been that we were just too tired to enjoy it. They do give you sizeable portions, so beware.  The good thing is you can pretty much walk in and get a seat. There are so many great buffets for the same price though. Not memorable enough to go back...

fEmS6j0aQjfKJxHGEU2Kdg.text: The Grand Lux Cafe is pretty good in my book. The service is good  the food tastes good and everything is great at the cafe. I like how the cafe is by the Grand Canal Shops so you can walk at the mall after having a full tummy. It's also pretty easy to get a table here and depending on which location you can book a private group area for parties.

_ZPuiwowNKuCai4ePZecqw.text: While our orders took a while, it was nice to see what people ordered. I wanted to get something extra special and when I saw the Grand Lux Cafe French toast which is made of EXTRA thick slices of Brioche Bread, I knew I had to get it. The toast is so massive that the waiter even had to ask me if the size of the French toast was okay. I thought that was rather odd but I happily said I was okay with that. Helloooo, more food the better because that means leftovers! The cappuccino was disappointing. It was bubbly, not foamy.

EF_MmSsmh5aCvZKhSz45WA.text: Great customer service! Not to long to sit! The French toast was amazing!!!! Hashbrowns and bacon were good too! So good! Looking forward to coming back.

ACNgux4NwkVMEhXgOUmOnw.text: This is usually a good restaurant that I visit at least once every 2 trips to Vegas. Not this time. This trip we took with 4 other friends and have went here 3 times.  The last 2 are the reason for this review. We ate breakfast yesterday, I ordered a simple egg white scramble with fruit. I had to send the eggs back 2 times, once because they weren't only whites and the 2nd because they had so much oil on them they looked wet from across the table. It made my stomach upset, even the new batch had oil after I requested none. Second trip was last night, we wanted a midnight snack and after ordering the loaded potato rolls 3 days ago we ordered them again,  no bacon this time plus hummus and a personal margherita pizza for the hubby. The pizza was good he said, but the potato rolls were awful. They came just as I ordered but add you can see, there are barely any potatoes in the STUFFED rolls. We basically had fried wonton wrappers :/ . I won't go on and on, I'll just say we won't be going back again unless it's for the Belgian waffle, but you can get those almost anywhere, I prefer healthy eggs.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

dKzxuF3NiKfzJdrLFuRy9A.text: Although very busy with a convention in town we got seated quickly and served soon after.  Bistro steak - 4 oz of tender beef with a simple flavored polenta that complemented the beef. The Brussel sprouts that were with the meal were just the shavings of the outside layer without the meat of the whole veggie. Overall a satisfying meal.  Chicken pot pie - a large portion ( could share with another person ). The inside of the pot pie must have a white wine base with the layers of flavors. The inside of the pot pie was almost like a savory chicken stew with big chunks of moist chicken, potatoes and veggies. The flaky topping was also an enjoyable experience for the taste buds.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bistro steak with polenta and brussel sprouts
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The rather large but oh so good for the soul chicken pot pie

BQ9ST9w3N_Jdd6pcE1LXtw.text: Skip the Breakfast Buffet  We went in for breakfast one morning after checking out.  The breakfast buffet is kept hidden in a room off the dining areas, so you don't get to see it as you're waiting or being seated.  We sat down and saw the buffet on the menu at $18.95 a person.  Not seeing anything on the menu that immediately got my attention I opted to go with that.  I mean it's Vegas, and the Buffets are amazing right?  Not this one.  Very basic options, hash browns, sausage, bacon, oatmeal.  Some pastries, breads for toasting and a fruit bar. There was also an omelette bar.  Two guys fixing omelettes (basic ham, sausage, cheese, mushrooms, onions and spinach fixings) or over easy eggs.  That's it.  That's your Breakfast Buffet.  Embassy Suites has a better breakfast buffet and they don't charge you $18.95.  Our server was great, we didn't have to wait long for a table even though the line was very long and I can't say much about the rest of the food on the menu, but if you're looking for an amazing, Las Vegas style breakfast buffet, look elsewhere.  This place doesn't have it.

v-i0TT-tbC0Rkick68lKTw.text: This place is definitely worth a trip when you come to Vegas. The food was great and the service was very good too. The waiter checked on us just enough.  The decor inside the restaurant was nice and we sat right on the edge so we were looking out at the casino floor. It was a very pleasant view and experience  The food was great. We got fettuccini Alfredo and the caramel chicken. We also had the quesadilla appetizer and red velvet cake for desert. Everything we had was well made and good portion sizes for what you pay. The food wasn't cheap but you get exactly what you pay for. A couple could probably eat an appetizer and 2 entrees for under $50 which is not bad compared to the other restaurants in the area.   Overall a very pleasant experience and we will definitely come back next time we're in Vegas. Highly recommend.

Sj_dNYmMoZYol7P42ZeApw.text: OMG this place is so good, I had their garlic shrimp pasta, caesar salad and shaking beef. EVERYTHING WAS SOOOOO GOOD. creamy garlicky caesar, and the pasta was SOOOOOOOOOO good. and the shaking beef had such a great flavor. Man oh man! I loved it. SOMETHING AT A GREAT PRICE AND GREAT PORTIONED IN VEGAS.  Definitely recommend this place if you want something worth your money and leftovers to save to eat for later! YUMMMY i want more =( too bad Im back in seattle now

IovywtVXg4aZJEo-VaZLJQ.text: Food:  Big hearty portions. Not mind blowing delicious but definitely better than Cheesecake Factory. Got the lunch special today-Salad & Pasta for $12.50. Fresh tasting salad with heirloom tomatoes, light and refreshing. For the pasta I got the Pasta Pomodoro. This was like a dressed up spaghetti, but with skinnier pasta and fresh tomatoes added to it. Plenty of sauce.  Service: Staff was nice. However the service is extremely slow. Even though we were seated right away, we don't get the bread basket until close to 20 minutes later. The food took even longer to get out. Difficult to flag down any waiter, let alone your waiter.  Would I be back again? Sure. Would I go out of my way to come eat here? Not so much.

VyB9umaEdSBYCum6ybKdjw.text: My favorite 24 hour spot in Vegas. My faves are the double stuffed potato spring rolls, pasta carbonara, and chicken and waffles, but pretty much everything I've tried is good. After a long night out at the club, or gambling, this place might as well be Joel Robuchons.

LZefwJ6yobKoWgyhQtSZvQ.text: Large restaurant inside the Venetian. Place is clean and on the darker side.  The website for the restaurant is misleading. It says "$" although it is at least "$$". You might be able to find less expensive sandwiches on the menu at below $15, but most of the items are above $15.   I decided to go off the beaten path with the Spicy Carnita Sandwich. This is a great sandwich. It's not sloppy as you'd think with the ingredients. Only a little spicy. Wife had the fettuccine alfredo with Shrimp which she did not complain about.   Given the size, I doubt the wait time would be long. What makes this place worth going back for is the broad menu selection. If you have a large party with different tastes, this is a safe bet.

4PAi-bjk1sdbhGMVqzj1Ew.text: Food was pretty decent, but the wait was insane. Even for midnight. It wasn't super packed at all and we still waited about 40 minutes for appetizers then another 40 minutes for our meals. If there was anything else close by that was open at that time we would've gone somewhere else.

wHignPwtJkSsoKKixQBVYw.text: Perfect spot for breakfast, lunch, dinner and a late evening snack. Waiters and waitresses are friendly. We enjoyed the variety of food that is available 24hrs a day. The restaurant was very clean and management was professional. Great place.

pIS5KfTtAlklHFWbEcBL6g.text: It's like cheesecake factory but better and open late. (possibly 24 hours). I ate there several times and everything I tried there was pretty good except the breakfast buffet (2-3 stars). The enchilada lunch special was good. The reuben, short rib sandwich, sunday night pasta, all pretty good. 4 stars. The breakfast buffet was just ok. Pretty standard but small selection for $17. Omelette station, eggs, sausage/bacon, potatoes, waffles, fruit, cereal, oatmeal. I would rather have ordered from the regular menu.  The place is humungous and sometimes the service can be a little slow...

ArljmPFhY0OgTMDWSuIlSA.text: The Grand Lux Cafe is owned by the Cheesecake Factory parent company so they are quite similar in decor and menu options.  The menu is so varied that it can be hard to make a decision.  I had the Salmon Piccata with brown rice. The Salmon was very bland. It made the rice taste delicious in comparison.  The Calamari the first time was super salty, so we tried it a second time. Much better.  The soup and salad were soup and salad. You can't go wrong there.  Our server was friendly and attentive enough without being invasive.  Our orders came rather quickly. This was surprising considering the fact that the restaurant was packed.  The noise level was out of this world! My friends and I could barely hear each other talk.  We requested to sit further inside the restaurant to escape the smoke from the casino across the way.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Calamari
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon Piccata
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Soup and Salad

fIAwDPnRvgFBRkJY0RoBXQ.text: I went here for lunch yesterday with a friend. I had never been in the Palazzo before, nor had I ever eaten at Grand Lux Cafe, so I was super excited to experience both. The cafe is easy to find coming off of the parking garage elevators, it's a quick jaunt across the casino floor. We were sat right away by a pleasant hostess and received a booth as requested. The decor is beautiful in this cafe and the ceiling is simply stunning. It is a work of art, very beautiful.  Here's some pros & cons during my visit:  PRO's 1.) Large food selection 2.) Delicious, complimentary bread basket 3.) Great wait staff - courteous, helpful and kind 4.) Fantastic pot roast French fry appetizer (I recommend), yummy Manhattan salad and penne with a silky, smooth alfredo sauce 5.) Huge portions, easy to share  CONS's 1.) Food brought out wrong the first time and had to wait while they remade it 2.) Very pricey - think upscale, Cheesecake Factory 3.) Large food selection - I spent 20 minutes flipping through this huge menu trying to decide on something to eat 4.) The server we got was not knowledgeable on the menu. I asked simple questions like "what pasta does this dish come with?" and he didn't know.  All-in-all, I would definitely visit again for lunch, however I don't see myself coming for dinner service. I can see how this is a great spot for tourists or hotel guests though. Make sure you have more than a 1 hour lunch before eating here. It does take a bit of time.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Max Burger!

hKIFlyBT93gGkSbt8yfkhw.text: Grand Lux is bomb any time of day or night. Come here for breakfast, lunch, dinner or the late night munchies and you'll be satisfied no matter what! The food and service is solid here.  One of the best things to get during lunch is the sandwich or pasta combo that comes with a 1/2 salad or soup. Everything is either a good or huge portion here. You won't be disappointed!

qyUGm_OQwrwSbEjIqhn0nw.text: Very good food, drinks, and service. It's open 24 hours and is right in the middle of the casino

c7L1d_bH4aKGG54Mj2MrsQ.text: Wow, for a hotel restaurant, they are crushing it. First off, excellent service with amazing memory because the bartender Raymond remembered me from 3 months before and I don't think it's just me - he welcomed everyone with a smile and amazing service. The food is SO good.  We had the Volcano Shimp (which reminds me of the BangBang Shrimp at Bonefish Grill which I love and I loved these just as much). I fought the urge to go full feed bag and ordered the Kale & Warm Grains salad. What was so great about THIS salad is that I was able to feel full, satisfied AND smug! ok, fine, I ordered a side of fries as an afterthought. My friend at the Chicken and Waffles - OH so good. I was barely able to convince him to give me a bite! He was #SorryNotSorry about it too. ;)

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. And this here is a healthy salad with #quinoa
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mm mm #chickenAndWaffles

byM56MviiDFqXjkPNndxkg.text: Joe's Scramble is an excellent  breakfast dish worth the walk from another hotel.   Tasty combo of scrambled eggs, spinach, mushroom, seasoned ground beef, and onion accompanied by a side of homemade hash browns.   The portion is large enough to split, and be sure to ask for some of the house salsa.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yum yum

ZaV-qkNpHVc79yWeEFVZOQ.text: I'm giving Grand Lux a 4 star rating mainly for being at the right place and at the right time. That place and time was for a late night snack after drinking and running around the strip.  The food and price is good. Not amazing, but it's basically Cheesecake Factory. So expect that quality.  The real trick is that they have take out next door. So.... After about 1:30am in Vegas, we all know either food joints shut down or they have huge lines. And grand luxe did. So maybe I'm reviewing the wrong place, but I know the food was from grand lux.  Next door n the little cafe, you can order take out. And they have a perfect selection of perfectly creamy and satisfying pastas.   Pasta carbonara is always a winner. They'll load you up. You can feed one very hungry and drunk man. Two small drunk men and prob three to four small .... Kids?  They load you up with bread too.  We were done showering, eating comfortably in pj's in our room while our friends just finally got seated at the oyster bar over at imperial station.... Which I might add... We drove back from because the wait was so long...

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Carbonara - take out. An AMAZING past midnight snack, huge servings, creamy, with butter and bread. Hits the spot!!

AsmxVYNDRSNn_KpNQfxGJg.text: I came here for breakfast with two other people. Walking towards the restaurant there was a line going out the restaurant. However, a sign said it would only take 5-7 mins to get seated which is 100 percent accurate. The issue was that it too about 15 mins before we even got ask for our drinks and it took about 20 mins to get our food.   The food itself was okay. We got the Baja omelette, joe's scrambled, and the hash. The good was pretty good (it should be for the price). I asked for a sausage to be added to my omelette, but the forgot that no big deal. Also, the omelette was more like a ton of onions and peppers under some eggs; it wasn't really omelette, but that's not that big of a deal. The hash and joes scramble was great.   Going back to the service...its just slow. Ask for some coffee wait 10 mins. Ask for creamer wait 10 mins. The waiters are just overloaded with tables to serve. It's a huge location and the slow down in breakfast service reflects it.   I wouldn't come back here for breakfast.

AZvY1H6YyHR1EqH_id_wIA.text: Food was GREAT! Service was VERY POOR!  We stayed at the Venetian in Las Vegas and came here several times throughout our stay (only because the food was terrific). The entrees we ordered were amazing, especially for the price points which were great for the quality. I'd recommended coming here for the food.  SERVICE: VERY POOR. Each time we sat at the bar, and each time, the service was very poor. While we would be greeted in a timely manner, it was all down hill from there. Each time there, my drink would sit empty. I would have to request the refill each time. Additionally, there was no "check back" once our food came out. If you wanted anything additional, you'd have to ask for it. They were quick to put your bill in front of you (which was nice); however, I'd place my card on top the check, and it would set there for 30 minutes before I had to request the bill to be paid. Also, another server brought us our entrees. I requested for some additional items (silverware, ketchup, etc) and none of the items were brought. I had to flag down our inattentive bartender to obtain the items, which I got 8 minutes later. There were many other issues as well, but I will stop here.

sEpqsF8ANpJjV2Yewe3EOw.text: Theres nothing bad to say about this place. I used to visit this restaurant 3 times a week when it was in LA. Since they closed the Beverly Hills location, I always have an excuse to visit Vegas just to come here. Everything I eat is of high quality and taste. I almost skip dinner just to get to the delicious desserts.   Some of my favorites are:  Short Rib Fries w/Gravy and Cheese from the small bites section Jumbo Fried Shrimp from the seafood section Deep Fried Buffalo Rolls From the appetizer section  And Now For Dessert....  The Bread Pudding with Whiskey Glaze Butterscotch Pudding with Caramel Popcorn Topping Buttercake   and so much more. They even have a section for dessert where they bake it fresh for you. You order it before your entree so its hot and fresh by the time your ready to consume. The ambiance is elegant and semi-low light. The hostess and staff are friendly and I just can't get enough of this place.

1odEa0CKKaxi7Qkqwu4XAw.text: My favorite restaurant in Vegas! The variety is incredibly diverse, the prices are reasonable (a little high, but this is Vegas and it's not nearly as bad as I've seen), and the service is very friendly. I went there four times, and didn't have a single bad meal. I would try to be more specific in my recommendation, but honestly it's all good. I always try to sit out in the little indoor patio area rather than inside: better scenery and people-watching from there!

bsuiyXnQl2SmXQLHgsTbzQ.text: Came here in search of late night dessert with mom and sis and it was really the only option open after 11. I'd eaten here 6 years ago and remembered that the food was great then, so figured we would try it again. We ordered the creme brulee, warm brownie sundae, and the strawberry shortcake. The shortcake was pretty amazing, the biscuit was perfect and the ratio of strawberries to whipped cream to biscuit to ice cream was perfection. The creme brulee was good but nothing special, and the brownie sundae was the same story. Overall would come back but probably more for the food menu than the dessert

9xmrBN9MucWQ6Gx06EuJmA.text: Wide variety of food to choose from. I was very bummed they took out the Sear Ahi Salad. Was the only thing I ordered when eating at Grand lux. Came with a party of 12+ we ordered a a bit of everything to pasta and rice entrees. The Asian influenced rice dished were a bit sweet ...from the curry and the So called orange chicken. I guess we couldn't expect more Asian flavors from an American franchise, but we wanted to try it and we had older relatives who were not use to the Western type of food.  The Asian nachos were interesting...was hoping for a great flavor profile from what i read...but it was overly too sweet from the drenched peanut mix sauce they used.    The service was great and friendly... constant refills and checkups.    Overall food was a miss this time, but will come back but gonna steer away from the Asian fusion/influenced foods.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The curry dish.
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ahi ceviche. Refreshing and good...but Ahi was overpowered

YXxpL0_hmw4OLDtJQPaSsQ.text: My party and I had breakfast here yesterday and I was not impressed with their food. We ordered the chilaquiles, which is nothing more than glorified dry nachos. We did like the "churro" French toast but it is a big plate so prepare to share with 2-4 people.

Lu_YZLUR9wjFSonRl6kNXQ.text: My Wife and I went here and it was amazing. My Queen ordered the Miso Salmon and I ordered the Chicken and Waffles.  Both were great filling and flavorful.  We were both beyond full. The waffle was light and flaky th he chicken tenders were crispy. The salmon was cooked to perfection.   We went back the next day because my Wife wanted thw the chicken and waffles and I ordered a burger. Both again were great!  This chain is owned by Cheesecake Factory.  The service and food were the same in the Palazzo and the Venetian locations.   Would definitely recommend and go back again. I enjoyed the food, service,  etc...

zivTaRbcQL38wrHu7tl6-Q.text: Sometimes you just want breakfast at 1am that is NOT greasy! Had an egg white omelette with spinach and goat cheese that was nice and light. The fruit was great and the hash browns were crunchy on both sides and not super salty. Great service and really good people watching!

1BO-VHh9bFO-mFeinjMTRQ.text: This place is awesome!!! Ever time I come to Vegas, I stop by and I'm always pleased. My friend said she had the best burger ever here!!

JVP4OzGtR6D5Dq6cQd3nrA.text: I have been to the Grand Lux for dinner 4 times - twice here and twice at the Palazzo.  All 4 times, I've had the crispy caramel chicken.  It's an excellent dish with good tasting, deep fried battered chicken with a caramel glaze.  The glaze is a bit on the sweet side, but I like it.  Last night, I stayed True to form and ordered that.  I had a choice of brown or white rice and I went with the brown.  DInner was very good.  My wife had the Madeira chicken.  It was served with very creamy, good tasting mashed potatoes.  We shared a piece of chocolate cake for dessert.  It was huge.  Service was a bit slow last night, but we got here at the height of the busy time with people wanting to have dinner before going to see Phantom as was the case with us.  We had plenty of time and I didn't obsess with the time factor because I knew we were good.  Our server boxed our leftovers--dinner tonight--and brought it back quickly.  I had time to walk it to the car in the garage and put it in the cooler I brought anticipating a take out box or boxes.  I wish they had more large small plates on their menu.  Or if they would just downsize any of their meals for a downsized price.  My only complaint with Grand Lux is the level of the music.  It was not on when we first arrived. 10 minutes later, someone must have realized and they fired up the sound system.  At one point, it was so loud, I had to almost yell for my wife to hear me.  It got so bad, I downloaded an app for my iPhone and the decibel level averaged about 85 all the time we were there.  At times it spiked in the 90s and near 100.  That's just too loud!!  Turn it down!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Deep dark fudge cake.
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crispy caramel chicken.

sFk7D4UZwzzNeDs6ZeSclQ.text: Amazing. Just amazing! I always order the buffalo chicken rolls with extra Blue cheese, ooooorrrr the shrimp scampi pasta!!

rLOsDFg8KS3djYUGLESPdA.text: Food is mediocre. Service is below average. Unless you're desperate, skip this spot & go somewhere else!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Zen noodle- not bad

wC7b6J3vA7N5yfMmaupbzg.text: Great service. Extensive menu. Great suggestions. Quick seating. Hmmm, what else can I say. It was great.

zGKITrd-catNGReQa8mivw.text: The food was okay nothing special. It seems that the food could use a little more spice. The other locations like the one in Texas is much better. We were very surprised that the location was pretty empty.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. New Orleans shrimp sauté
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Enchiladas
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Buffalo chicken sandwich

MgIQm5UygHiF1B9JXJDDvQ.text: Came here for lunch with a few co-workers.  It took our group of 5 to get organized before we got seated. We got seated in short order.  I wanted to order a half four cheese and half sausage, pepperoni and mushroom rustic pizza.  The server didn't know if they would do this.   I said if thet didn't I would order the rustic pizza with sausage, pepperoni and mushrooms.  I wanted too take half the cheese pizza home for the kids.  Service so far was good. They brought our drinks pretty quickly. Later the server said that they couldn't make the pizza half cheese and meats/mush  the other half because the bases are different.  They brought out some bread to munch on. The bread was very very good. We asked for more bread-the server never brought any more.   It seemed to take as while to get the food but don't remember how long it too.   A co-worker ordered the four cheese pizza so we I gave him four pieces of my pizza and he gave me four pieces of his pizza so I could take it home for my kids.   The meats/mush pizza wad good but very salty.  My co-worker said the cheese was not nearly as salty.  Maybe it was from the pepperoni and sausage.  My water was filled once when I was halfway early on during our visit but not once afterwards. Others had water and iced teas, but it wasn't filled either.   Couldn't make half cheese half meat/mush pizza, super salty pizza, no refill for drinks after getting our food, and no requested bread makes for a subpar rating.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Super salty pepperoni, sausage and mushroom rustic pizza (6 slices) and four cheese pizza (4 slices).

I-dZN3pl4Knn7fpsD-lWHA.text: Five stars for serving breakfast 24/7.   Surprisingly hard to find a breakfast joint after 11 in Vegas of all places and Grand Lux was just what the doctor ordered. Our server, despite this being a pretty casual restaurant, was so good at his job, was fun, upbeat, and all the bells and whistles.   Aside from my husband's home cooked steak and jalapeno breakfast burritos, I think I had my second best breakfast ever. And my god, do they give you so much food! They gave me six sausage links in my standard breakfast, for example.  If you're waking up at 2 pm and looking for breakfast, head straight to Grand Lux. It was a wonderful surprise.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 24 hour breakfast! So much food...

ZY0NqpMVNi95F2qdVQVz3g.text: The food was good! The service... eh. It was okay. It took a while for our food to come out, and the waiter didn't seem very friendly. I had the French toasts. They were huge and very good.

uzdXNkyrzuMMLCw4TLRRvQ.text: We go to the Grand Lux everytime we are in Vegas. They have an extensive menu that will suit any mood you might be in. Their portions are fairly big so do plan on sharing your meal or you will be over stuffed. The Wait staff are always friendly and attentive. Bread is served as you are ordering and the wait time is not too long. We are always happy with our meal when we eat here. If you are at the Venetian or want to try a new place, this is definitely worth eating here.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Light and refreshing chicken, avocado, salad with a lime cilantro dressing. This is enough for 4 sides.
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Calamari with zucchini and shrimp! Yum!

CT_Xh1VAoGh7Hxo6nQjoOw.text: You know a place is awesome if the salad dressing is served in a gravy boat! With delicious food and extraordinary service, this Grand Lux at the Venetian is also open 24 hours! Note: the one at the Palazzo does close around 2/3 am..(and why do the connected casinos need 2 Grand Lux's on each end again?)  If a breakfast buffet is what you're craving, this Grand Lux lays out a hearty display of hot and cold breakfast items + beverage for a reasonable $16.50 (served until 11 weekdays, 12:30 weekends)   Though we were here during brunch hours and both the bf and I love breakfast foods, we wanted a filling lunch. I had the Pasta Carbonara lunch combo, and opted for the fresh organic side salad with ranch dressing IN A GRAVY BOAT! I've always been hesitant ordering Pasta Carbonara, afraid the overall taste of the dish will come out too sweet, but Grand Lux did their Pasta Carbonara right! It was so savory.. but not overly salty, and a hint of sweet from the bacon. I was in love with this ginormous entree!  I've always heard the Grand Lux described as an upgraded Cheesecake Factory, so I was expecting higher prices. Surprisingly, the sister restaurant chains have comparable, if not identical, pricing schemes.  Service here was top-notch! I don't remember our waitress' name, but she made us feel so comfortable. She came like every 5 minutes, but was the complete opposite from intrusive. She also kept apologizing for the wait (what wait? we didn't even notice that the food was taking longer than usual), and letting us know our food would be out soon. The manager even came to our table on a separate occasion, and apologized more for our food delay.   There are so many great dining options along the Strip, with Grand Lux being one of them. Though realistically, I will not be eating here every time I visit Vegas, this is now one of spots on the top of my list!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dressing in a gravy boat... Genius!
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pasta carbonara lunch portion

d_5rZQf2GvIyQSemnAzZmw.text: Affordable delicious food  Huge menu available until 12 and after that they serve the late night menu. I was with a group, I order the salmon trio. There was a mix up in the kitchen and I was the last person to receive my food but it was worth the wait. The server and manager were very attentive and brought me an Cesar salad while I was waiting.Other in party order ceviche, ribeye and ribs I was able to sample racks plate and it was very good. I will definitely be coming back.

K4FdgY_1e44RD1gEDzmk0w.text: Stayed at the Palazzo and the cafe is right downstairs. Excellent buffet breakfast. Also visited one night for dinner. It's similar to Cheesecake Factory as far as lunch or dinner. If you are looking for a variety and a place that has consistent service and food, then you shouldn't be disappointed.   If you are looking for something a little more chef special then head over to Chica.

gIFuSCuGDwAA-G5nIcBJXw.text: Last night I enjoyed the Pasta Carbonara with Gluten-free pasta and chicken. This dish was delicious it just needed a little salt. I really enjoyed the bacon bits with this dish it added the perfect flavor. It was so refreshing to have a pasta dish since most restaurants don't offer gluten-free options with pasta. I would definitely order this dish again!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

CFRXlcRCr6_atiT_O3vH-w.text: I was there two wednesdays ago with some out of town friends. I ordered The Rueben Sandwich. Well for starters when do we start toasting rye bread (Never had that before) and besides it should be a option.  Which was so GREASY it was terrible. You could hardly taste the pastrami/cornbeef because there was hardly none. As far as the fries went they should have been STEAK FRIES not your normal close as you can get shoe-string fries. And the potatoes should have been fresh NOT frozen out the bag. I gotta say this was one of the WORST Rueben sandwiches I ever had in Vegas and coming from a 5**** Casino/Resort/Spa...You be shamed. You really need to take lessons from the Marriot /Rampart at there Deli..Now theres is a helluva sandwich the sandwich is so big I can hardly get my mouth around it. And the bread is Marble rye omg to die for. Sorry the Grand lux you are just NOT it.

tSGXISDHLIiceQfppUBmBQ.text: An hour and a half for lunch. There was no wait and plenty of open seats. All 4 of us had sandwiches. Manager was rude, too much in our personal space and boxing my friend in, it felt threatening and very intimidating. We're 4 relatively timid girls. The food was only ok, not great. Cheesecake Factory might be better honestly.

romy2K4k7exDO1KP13L9NQ.text: Came here today with a large group of 9 and expected to wait a bit to get a table. I was pleasantly surprised the wait was less then 5 minutes before we were seated.   Our waitress was a bit too efficient as she quickly gave us menus and brought us menus. Less then a few minutes after handing us the menus she asked if we were ready to order. Considering the menu was quite extensive, a few in our party needed more time before ordering. She hovered til people ordered which bothered me a little.   I settled on getting the lunch special half sandwich, salad and soup combo. I decided on the chicken salad sandwich, mushroom barley soup. The sandwich was very delicious but the wedge of lettuce in it was a bit overkill. The salad was a vinaigrette and was really good. The mushroom barley soup was a bit salty for my taste.   What I also liked was at the end when we got the bill that gratuity was not already included (like most other places)

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cobb salad
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lunch special half sandwich, soup and salad

Tt5nNW2e8DftW3l9JGgmQA.text: The garlic shrimp pasta was delicious and a good value compared to other places around the Vegas strip. They got me seated quickly and the service was solid. Definitely recommend this place

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ZfbN-W1_gMqy_dvKaf8BjA.text: It's really hard to have a horrible meal at any of their locations. I went to the one in Vegas for a friends birthday after a night at the club. Side note: Bumps 1st  club appearance! I had the chicken and waffles. The waffle was absolute perfection. Perfect crunch on the outside and nice and delicate on the inside. The chicken however was a complete miss. The chicken was tough and under seasoned. I'd go there again in a heat beat for that waffle though.

HztQKHP2hRxoy4MASo8aog.text: Been here SEVERAL times over the course of my Vegas years, heehee.  Hubby's fave spot for his, self-proclaimed, "hangover cure."  Which I found out is just stuffing yourself with carbs and other tasty foods.  I love the Sunday Night Pasta, but the menu is so vast that you could come here dozens of times and not try it all.  We had great service and found the prices affordable.

QGlGp-eIOlV-mJF0PxhtYw.text: By the time of this review there are 2500+ reviews on Yelp, and these guys have a solid 4 star rating, so there is not a lot else to say other than: Yes, good food, friendly service, The Cheesecake Factory style, ample menu, tons of choices.   We had a party of nine, with seniors, young adults and teenagers, and everyone found something they wanted and enjoyed every bite of the food. The salads were a great surprise as well. Huge portions, so feel free to share family-style.  Don't overthink, stop by and enjoy a good meal.

PT5munyYMsXwufeh6fImtA.text: We had our wedding reception at Grand Lux last week in a reserved room. The room was beautiful with high ceilings, black and gold vintage detailing, and a very upscale ambiance. The staff was very attentive and gave outstanding service. The menu had a very wide selection, and everything was wonderful from start to finish. Thank you for making our special day so wonderful!

eT3FTp78WxxSlNMUpNDdZA.text: Every April, I have to attend a conference in Las Vegas. Aside from my business (technical) targets, having dinner at the Grand Lux Cafe is high among my MUST dos. Every year, I take my "alone" time to indulge in enjoying the same meal: Nashville Hot Chicken and Cucumber Lemonade. Once I had it the first time, I kept reminiscing about it and waiting to enjoy it again and again! The meal is massive; really large inhuman portion, but I ate every bite of it and will again! It states in the menu that it's a chicken breast. Well, it's not one, but MANY breasts and they were all delicious. The cucumber lemonade (with mint leaves) is the most well crafted lemonade ever; just try it!!

BFa-3TsGpqICUcVLUvQ7AA.text: Surprisingly, Grand Lux Cafe in Venetian has a good selection of entrees from different cuisine. Price is good with generous portions! Food tastes pretty good too. We enjoyed: * Chicken Lettuce Wraps * BBQ Chicken Pizza * B.B.Q. Baby Back Ribs * Shrimp Scampi  Good dining option in Venetian area.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. B.B.Q. Baby Back Ribs
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. BBQ Chicken Pizza
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp Scampi

jKFcwYsEBAtl1Q0fUegm4g.text: I literally got to Vegas at 5 in the morning and came to grand lux! At 5 in the morning these guys were literally packed, but the service and the food were both not bad! I don't know why but this place reminds of the cheese cake factory!

9igCXw6DbbbXoNrBu18wQg.text: We knew that this was a dressed-up and over-priced coffee shop but it was late and we were hungry so we decided to try it here. Sure enough, the prices matched the Venetian Hotel prices. If you could buy a $500 shirt in one of their shops, you of course should be surprised by the prices here. Our waitress was very nice and attentive.   I order their version of "Pho", which is a noodle soup. Presentation was nice but the dish was sparse and tasted terrible. I am not sure what was in the broth but it was more than beef broth. How do you mess up soup?  My wife ordered a chicken pasta. Again, it looked really nice. However, the noodle was over-cooked and tasteless. I think we spent over $40 and still went to bed hungry.

P5IcZSTdIO9-FSgw-cdHvA.text: I have eaten at Grand Lux Cafe a total of 3 times. The first two times were good, which is why I was stunned at how horribly my third experience was. It was by far the worst dining experience I have had in my adult life.  To give some context, a group of myself and two of my friends decided to celebrate the last day of our Vegas trip. One friend had won some money and another had recently been accepted into Law School, and we were staying at the Venetian. Our show tickets had just been canceled, and we were looking to save the night. Having had good experiences before, I recommended Grand Lux Cafe.  The night started off with us being seated at the edge of the restaurant close to the casino. We were not big fans of the table, so we asked to be moved and the hostess quickly accommodated. Props to the hostess and waiter.  After that, everything went downhill. First, we ordered Prosecco for the table. My friend clearly pointed out the specific bottle and vineyard. The waiter then returned with a bottle of Rose and wine glasses. When we asked if this was the correct bottle, the waiter replied, "Yes." Not convinced (why was it pink), one of my friends inspects the bottle and points out this is not the correct bottle. He also points out that Prosecco is generally served in champagne flutes and not wine glasses, and if the restaurant had flutes. At this point, the waiter apologizes, the first of many, and then gets the correct bottle and glasses. He then proceeds to heavily struggle in opening the bottle (not his fault), and finally is able to get us our drink.  We then place our order: 2 filet mignons w/ asparagus, a fried calamari to share, and a BLT. I do not know how we could have made it simpler. The calamari comes out pretty quickly. I liked it even if it was heavy on the batter: 4/5.  When our dishes come out, a different server brings over the BLT, a filet mignon w/ asparagus, and a ribeye w/ asparagus. We say we ordered two filet mignons. The server looked flustered and went to go ask our waiter what happened. After a few minutes, the waiter comes over and apologizes and says there was a mixup and he will put in another order of the Filet. My friends start eating because filet mignon is not cheap, and says the asparagus is completely unseasoned. Meanwhile, I'm just twiddling my thumbs. Strike #2. At least the manager came by and apologized for the inconvenience.  After 15 minutes, the waiter comes and says another table took my second order and he just put in another order. That's strike #3. At this point my friends are almost done eating, and my steak is nowhere close to being done. I call back the waiter and tell him to cancel the order. I tell him I do not want the order, am no longer hungry after bread and calamari, and would like the check.  The waiter leaves, and 2 min later, the manager comes with my steak. At this point, I am about to blow a gasket. The night has been ruined, and somehow nothing I say is getting to this waiter. I tell the manager I cancelled the steak and would just like it removed the check. I just want to pay my tab. At this point, the manager started urging me to eat the steak. He kept repeating that "he didn't want to waste a steak" and that "I should take a few bites, he doesn't want me to be hungry." When you have to keep repeating to the manager that NO I DO NOT WANT THIS, a restaurant has completely broken down in every possible way. This last interaction left me embarrassed as the manager made me feel like the bad guy for wasting food. I cancelled the order, and the kitchen still made it. Obviously, there was no issue in taking my order the second time and giving it to someone else so why not just give it to someone else? Or eat it yourself if you don't want to waste it, jesus christ.   The manager "comped" us for the steak and calamari, but not the other two items or the prosecco (which we would not have gotten if we had not corrected the waiter).   Not only did Grand Lux "Cafe" make me foolish in front of my friends for recommending this place, it made me feel small after messing up my order, and there is a clear breakdown in communication in the kitchen or staff training. I will not be returning to this "restaurant", and I do not plan on staying at the Venetian again after this experience.

5x3_FrHkH5LmTnepWENzDQ.text: Located in Venetian hotel casino level, we spontaneously chose this restaurant. Had lots of choices on the menu, and price was reasonable. Most of the dishes we ordered was decent, just nothing special. Personally enjoyed angel hair pasta!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Uuk5J3vahdZ4GBRPCrFmvg.text: Want a low key buffet in Vegas, where it seems like most people just choose to dine off the regular menu? Grand Luxe is just that. Crowded with singles, couples, families and staff.   There is this quaint AYCE room hidden in the cut. I called over to the hotel to see how much they charge and the front desk rep said $19.99, so I thought that was decent. Turns out, the actual price was $24.95 for the buffet -__-.   Kinda wish I was aware of that beforehand. Still for a smaller scale buffet, it had some righteous offerings.   We immersed ourselves in a bit of everything. Omelettes, salads, chicken, pasta, ribs, sandwiches, coffee, fruit and some petite desserts. All good quality, so my high expectations were positively met. Missed out on the pancakes and waffles, just forgot to grab some :(  2 things which could have made the experience better? Less noise in the restaurant (does a more quiet seating area even exist?) and they could have bussed our table more often and provided coffee or water refills. Other than that, food was satisfying and overall we had a lovely brunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bill
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spinach, mushroom and cheese omelette
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lil bits of everything

oJVmJ1B2RG0tLCbPrASlZQ.text: Love so yummy, good prices, so cute  this place is nice our waitress was Andrea she was very very sweet . Best customer service I have gotten in a while! Thanks for making it such a delight full time

Wbvou-Ze7YSXP-RFy0hENQ.text: This place is huge inside and because of that we didn't have to wait long to be seated for brunch. The menu is long which made deciding a bit hard. However I decided on a burger for lunch and my friends decided on actual brunch items.   The food is a bit on the pricy side but the portions are big. A bit too big if you ask me. None of the entrees really stood out to me, but it is a cafe I shouldn't be expecting much.  I will admit service took a while to arrive and deliver.  Overall a decent place to cure from a night of going out; however I think I'll stick to the food court.

-xkt2BNa3PmIvgH0TCtLrQ.text: I am not usually into chain restaurants like this during trips.  I actually go here for breakfast and late night dining every-time I am in Vegas. Service is good. Hope they keep up the good work.

RDwxk5K9sibQbV_mcH2djA.text: Excellent food. Prices were very fair. This is better than Cheesecake Factory although with the same theme.  Loved the Mahi Mahi. The menu is pretty big - lots of different items.  Noisy and too many tables.

wdfOxKun1aOBUGTxUP4xhw.text: good food, great service. The place is romantic and prices are reasonable. I do not eat at the cheesecake factory but I would eat here again! we had the avocado and chicken salad which was pretty good if you like oriental dressing. husband ordered the sloppy Joe which was really good but didn't expect it to be that heavy considering the waiter told us its lean meat!!

dF6_aDQKbdlO6Julj4YkWA.text: This is a really GREAT place to come for really decent food at a really decent price! We ate here three times on our trip (breakfast, lunch, dinner) - not all in the same day! But all three times the food was better than expected and the service was really good! Try the pasta dishes!  It's a little bit loud, because it is a really large restaurant, but the menu has something to suit anyone and the staff is excellent!  Plus, you get free bread with every meal!

MCFdaKjYTrvE-mZLjPIzog.text: Open 24 hours a day, gigantic portion sizes, and a relaxed atmosphere...Grand Lux Cafe was the perfect late-night place to go after dancing!  Since we were staying at the Venetian, we stumbled upon this place all three nights we were there and it never let us down.  We were seated right away, the waitstaff was very attentive, and the place always had a pretty good crowd no matter what the time.    The menu is huge (and again, seriously, the portions are too), but we managed to navigate some delicious food...calamari, pizza, and potato spring rolls were among some of our favorites!  This place is a must for anyone looking for a late-night snack.  I'll definitely be back...

uNImyQRdxFfrh7I_mA-2Tg.text: I had a business trip to Las Vegas a couple of months back and stayed at the Venetian. A couple of us went to the Grand Lux for some lunch and the service was horrible. Our server looked like he was hungover and trying to keep up. The only thing he did right was recommend the Max Burger which was AWESOME! Ranks as one of the best burgers I've ever eaten. It was so good I went back and had it again the next day. Just as good the second time. I ended up eating there a third time trying their Indochine Shrimp and Chicken which was also AMAZING!. This place would have gotten 5 stars had it not been for our smacked out waiter on the first visit.

gVBb4CAkh9i1vQDQjA6m5A.text: Oh how I love the Grand Lux!!  Always go there twice on our Vegas trip!  The place is huge, decor is awesome, menu is extensive and food is ALWAYS great!  My review is on their breakfast buffet.  Its not as huge as your casino buffets but the food is higher quality and simply awesome!  There is an egg/omlete station....the omletes are soooooo yummy.  They have bacon, hash browns, sausage links and as of this year now have ham.  There is sour dough bread, english muffins and bagels which you can toast.  The fruit is much fresher than in your traditional buffets.  My only somewhat of a complaint is the pastry selection needs an little makeover.  They have had the same selection for years now and it gets a bit boring.  Oh and also as of this year they have belgium waffles which were great!!!....the chocolate chips to sprinkle on made them super good!  Another plus is you get ALL the beverages you want included in the price.  I know this is relatively standard in buffets but where do you get FRESH SQUEEZED orange juice?  NO ONE has orange juice like the Grand Lux!!!   If you are debating whether to go to the Grand Lux in the Palazzo or Venetian I say definetly the Venetian....while the one in Palazzo is quite pretty inside there is something about the Venetian that really stands out and makes it my fav!

J7_pBMZK2BVfixJRvl4gMg.text: We went to the Grand Lux Cafe at the Venetian Resort to eat, I was looking for some really good GLUTEN FREE food.  Chef Craig Walter came out to visit with me and gave me some really good options.  I ended up ordering some huge prawns and veggies on a skewer that were on a bed of lemon/parsley rice.  Talk about yummy!  I couldn't even eat it all!.  Everyone wanted what I had ordered.  Chef Craig came out again to see if I enjoyed my food and I raved about it.  The restaurant was busy and he still took time to visit with me and fix me a special meal.  Beautiful restaurant!

tL2JVtVkczOidHllRbv3ig.text: If you have eaten at a Cheescake Factory, then this is the EXACT same.  Large portions and huge menu.  Decent breakfast (including a buffet).  Inside the Venetian casino.

QFP_NFgeq0qDuRZvDXXUQA.text: Great food - great gluttony - great times.

6qgbBBmQPnsB4IHxGmxatw.text: I love this place! The portions are huge, service is always great and the chocolate cake is to die for!!

GO0MORx7eqiYWdUFPdb2Tg.text: Great place to enjoy a casual meal in Las Vegas. It's part of the cheese cake factory chain. I only wish they had the tropical ice tea like the cheese cake factory.

F32_vq-XC0ihy1zo4xtwfw.text: I usually enjoy my food at the Grand Lux Cafe in LA, but I went here late Friday night/Saturday morning with a large group and we were all disappointed.  All the food we ordered was either bland or lacked real flavor.  The zen noodles were very hot but tasteless.  The pasta carbonara was creamy but bland. The pizza was bland as well.  C'mon, did they run out of spices or something?!  The "best" we got was the burger, which was actually decent, but would be forgetable in any burger joint.  In short, the whole experience was BLAH. :(

w-njjmowBnJOfKo-3R24HQ.text: We got seated right away on a Sunday night. I was expecting the encyclopedic menu, a-la Cheesecake Factory but the menu was smaller. I ordered the sliders which were ok, little dry and too much cheese. The service was friendly but we did have to wait quite some time before the food came out. The good thing is that the portions are huge and you will be able to take home a little late night snack for later.

JVrsW4p8Phg4kDjvP5AhwQ.text: Fresh sqeezed orange juice with breakfast.  Could taste the cheddar cheese

SCXlGHeDEAPd_9TPhTtwbQ.text: This place was perfect for the big dinner for my sister's bachelorette party of 21 girls.  Unfortunately, the special events manager didnt record my special reservation and when we arrived they didnt know what I was talking about.  But much to my satisfaction, the manager on duty got our table ready within 10 minutes (at 8pm on a Saturday) and we had a great spot for all of us ladies! The food was delicious and service was pretty quick.  Me and my sister shared the parmesian chicken, it was the most delicious I have had in a very long time.

iTzQpXlEkyNzvhNd8TYL5Q.text: One of my fave restaurants! They gave such an amazing variety of flavors. My personal favorite is the  Asian Nachos and for dessert the made-to-order beignets! This cafe is operated by the Cheesecake Factory folks so you'll see may similarities in the menu as well. We prefer to go to the one at the Palazzo as the one at the Venetian can get quite busy and loud. We're usually able to just walk into the one at the Palazzo. Beware, most portions are sharable!

iau68uGcb8B5ybqP7H392A.text: Stayed at the Venetian and absolutely loved this place I heard it is owned by cheesecake factory and I really do not like cheesecake factory at all, this place however is awesome all 3 times I went the food was fresh and hot and delicious tried the pizza mmmmm fish and chips yumm and fries with blt definitely wish there was one of these in LA

zaeoW6DqSzgjvsKU2WlRVg.text: We had the best service. In fact, that is the reason we went back. Yet, we had exceptional service from an exceptional waitress named, Jena on our last day in Vegas. In fact, a group from another table commented on our great waitress. They had observed her and couldnt believe how kind she was. She was very personable, reviewed the menu, wasnt overbearing, followed thru with questions, quick service...and the food was seasoned great!    Even the mgr, Anthony came over to our table. He was very personable. I felt like I was a high roller or even better they were welcoming me a a guest in their home.  Jena wasnt giving the best service for a tip but because she wanted our experience to be the best. ....The next time you are in Vegas, go see Jena. And, yes make sure you give her a great tip!  Oh, I had the chicken & shrimp jambalya-thought I was in New Orleans. Chicken & waffles-yummy! ..Pomegranate champagne-delicious! You must try the bread pudding!!!   You may want to take it back to your hotel room for a mid day aphrodisiac. Seriously, there has to be a magic potion in it. We ate this and lets just say I never knew "O's" were so palatable.

jQcAZ_FU8aWaJRCPPAVO0Q.text: I've been to this upscale version of Cheesecake Factory twice. The first time I had a sashimi appetizer and grilled cheese and short rib sandwich. The sashimi was quite good and the sandwich was greasily delicious. The short ribs were insanely flavorful and moist and really went well with the cheese and bread selections. Despite being very busy the service was exceptionally attentive.

8a7RYQ4MKn3Aqd1LqSwqKQ.text: First time visiting Grand Lux Cafe in Las Vegas and our experience was very positive.  The restaurant is big, bright, inviting and clean.  The decoration is nice and does kind of remind you of Cheesecake Factory. After all, they both belong to the same company. We walked in here hungry and tired, got a table for 4 almost right away.  We ordered 4 entrees and drinks (pictures are posted), our server was very attentive and friendly. We quickly got a basket of bread to hold us up for the main dish.  We were all very happy with our food selection. Everything was delicious, portions were generous, prices are reasonable and service was quick.   I would definitely revisit this place again next time I am in town.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Macada
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pasta carbonara
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef Wellington

0mznK5ru3vHb1nCrXBFmVA.text: This is our go to late night after the club meal! This review is for this experience. There was a short wait. Keep in mind we are in Las Vegas and almost everyone is drunk. Personally, we witness a drunk bastard spill his drink all over the floor and walked off. The hostess immediately wipe the floor clean without any complaints. That is great customer service! I applaud the hostess for her patience.  This is our order:  Buffalo wings with ranch sauce  margarita pizza with pepperoni

jQT_gBYwnq_xvnCI0oHLaA.text: We had appetizers for dinner! They have a happy hour menu Monday- Friday from 4 to 6 pm. Have a page of apps that are $6.50. Also have reduced price beverages and other reduced price appetizers. We ordered 3 of the $6.50 appetizers and ended up having leftovers - the servings are so generous. The cheeseburger sliders were our favorites. Burger had a nice char on the outside while still being pink inside. The crispy Thai chicken shrimp spring rolls and stacked chicken quesadilla were also delicious. Our server was so attentive. Husband was unusually thirsty and she did not let his water glass get empty. Brought us a basket of their sourdough bread (warm) even though we were not having dinner. The bread is fantastic - very crunchy crust, soft interior.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Stacked chicken quesadilla
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crispy Thai chicken shrimp wraps and and cheeseburger sliders.

YvD-EKrbQxQrnsqrBzEM8w.text: These guys have my all time favorite breakfast! The chilaquiles here are heaven sent. I make a point to visit every time I'm in Vegas & they never, EVER disappoint me. I do order the ranchero sauce on the side to avoid the chips from getting soggy. Personal preference though. The service is always pleasant & they make an awesome freshly brewed ice tea! Really, really good all around.

aXmSknubJdDADvv6LPnYtw.text: I LOVE THIS PLACE! large dishes at reasonable prices.  LOVES: shrimp scampi pasta... so good!! my fave.  brussel sprouts.. fave!! i always substitute my sides for brussel sprouts.  my brother likes the nashville hot chicken with sauce on the side.  it's literally just fried chicken though.  OK: lemon picatta chicken pasta  Stuff I don't like: beef wellington.. it's literally puff pastry on top of beef.  it's not wrapped around like a traditional wellington.  crispy glazed chicken.. it's very similar to panda express, but much more expensive.

zAjcxoeGwrKaxpotRaEIqA.text: Their chocolate chip pecan chips are to die for. I am still thinking about them. You can buy them by the dozen and cost less than $10. It takes about 25 mins to get them, because they bake them to order, but are absolutely a hidden gem inside this casino.   FYI: Grand Lux Cafe is owned by The Cheesecake Factory. The cookies are only found at Grand Lux and not Cheesecake Factory. If you have an American Express Gold Card, they offer a $10 dining credit to Cheesecake Factory but it does NOT work at Grand Lux.

zffsE3uEGHAiIIG5n7KgQg.text: I've been here three times and don't have a single complaint. The food is just pure deliciousness!!!!! Huge menu, so much variety, everything I've ordered has been amazing. From the chocolate brownie with ice cream, to the chicken and waffles, to the grand breakfast sandwich, to the flat bread pizza, and short rib grilled cheese! We also tried the zen noodles! AMAZING!!! Best place for breakfast, lunch, and/or dinner!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 1-4-19 Zen Noodle soup. We shared it amongst 3.
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 1-4-19 Chicken and waffles, amazing!!!
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 1-4-19everything is amazing here!!!

O03JNUzU9e5m5sBsqOmr8A.text: Delicious food. Was looking for a place to eat. Not really expensive but a good price.   They have so much food didn't know what to choose from I wanted to try everything but I was really craving pasta(spaghetti). So I got the chicken parmesan it was delicious! The chicken is thin & huge! There's 2 pieces. The spaghetti was so thin but delicious! My brother got the grand club sandwich. It was really good & comes with fries.   Before we ordered they brought us water & bread & butter. The bread & butter was so good! It tasted like the Cheesecake Factory bread. The water tasted good not like crappy sink water.   Inside is really nice & lots of room. The lights are dim.   They also serve breakfast, lunch, & dinner. This place is open 24/7!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Inside

avYwOo8tOQXp-QHR6e-sUQ.text: The Grand Lux Cafe inside the Venetian is one of the best go-to spots in Vegas for breakfast! This is my 5th time here at the Grand Lux and we just keep coming back for their exquisite, delicious food.   If you get here before 11, you get a chance at their big breakfast menu. Once it's after 11 a.m. (on the dot), you only have the breakfast buffet option. I've done both, but prefer the sit-down breakfast menu option.   It's a large place with a family atmosphere. The line does get long, so try to arrive early. Pictures: Huevos Rancheros.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

8lXzVyCRbDZOtF_ozY-HAw.text: I came here for breakfast because of convenience.   We didn't get the buffet because we weren't going to eat that much.   They have Cheesecake Factory servings.   I just got the deluxe breakfast which is enough to feed two people.  I was disappointed when I saw hair in my eggs.  I picked it out and my mom got mad at me.  She told me to get it redone.   The fat girl in me was just hungry.   I ended up taking it to go and just eating off my moms plate.     I would still go back to try out maybe lunch and dinner.   The reviews are still great despite me loosing my appetite.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hair in my eggs

qH7rHIHnKzId_07C34jA9A.text: Ugh I regret I chose to come to this restaurant for breakfast. It makes me feel like the regular American breakfast fast food restaurant like Denny but compared to other brunch I tried in Las Vegas it's below average food quality in the same price. It's fast sit in but the breakfast took way to long to serve. The plates are huge just like other American restaurants but taste very plain... the service is okay but in Las Vegas I'll expect more...

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

_IXQ7FdsUtH623ujBwqG0g.text: My recent visit to this Grand Luxe Cafe location was just OK, but I was somewhat disappointed with my meal.
