I'm absolutely in love with the Buffalo Chicken Rolls!  If you like buffalo wings, you'll definitely love these!  I love dipping them in extra buffalo sauce as well.  And, they actually taste even better cold in the morning when you're nursing a hangover!  :)  PS. There's one at the Palazzo as well but this is the one that opens 24/7!

VZlCUmyBID4c2hcKNC7nWg.text: The food here is FANTASTIC. 5 stars, easily.  Calimari : 9 out of 5 stars I'm a stickler when it comes to calimari..  I am in search for the PERFECT calimari. Here, it was perfect. Not too salty. Not chewy. And came with a flavorful and creamy sauce.   Pasta: 5 stars Generous portion of meat, cheese and pasta with a zesty sauce.  Ambience: 5 stars So much attention to details.   Truly an enjoyable experience.

8ZOvEg6xMD3K_I83pOEz9w.text: This is not a typical hotel restaurant.  Opulent decor and friendly servers.  More affordable than I expected, though the drink prices seem quite high.  Delicious food, huge portions.  Definitely a quick, satisfying lunch before hitting the town for the day.

gTRIIO6qD_wbFYuaVqYJJQ.text: This is the place you go to when you're either a) wasted, and hungry after nightlife debauchery at TAO or b) hungover the next morning and don't feel like leaving your hotel to get food.  Everything is good for the most part. The menu here might be a tad bit different from LA's location but the selection is huge and I've never been disappointed. The carnitas rocked my heels off and their burgers aren't bad either. For healthier options, all the salads are safe bets.  Never a wait since this place is huge!

d3B578_TWBWQSX8cmLWhWA.text: started off with the spinach artichoke  dip and cheese steak spring rolls. both were just okay.. i prefer my spinach dip with more cheese but i liked the salsa they had on the side. the cheese steak spring rolls were like a philly cheese steak in a cripsy roll.. it was tasty but the sauce they had on side was a little too thick for me.. too much mayo? iono..   i had the spicy flat bread chicken sandwich. it wasnt spicy at all! the avocado corn salsa was not so tasty.. even though it didnt have bell peppers in it thats all i could taste. luckily my best friend and i are almost complete opposites cuz i traded with her madiera chicken. it was perfect for me. the chicken was tender and the sauce was savory. i liked the  mashed potatoes. thank god they didnt mess that up! my sister also had the madiera chicken but i dont think she enjoyed it as much as i did.. and her bf had hashrowns and eggs and he finished it all so it must have been good!   overall it was just an okay experience. the server didnt check up on us much so that was a little disappointing. if i go back i'll try something else and hopefully get to bump it up a star. there are so many things on their menu i didnt know where to start! next time..

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. spicy flatbread chicken sandwich
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. madiera chicken

-cMcCmCFj1Ydz9szleqR5g.text: Definite spot to hit up in Las Vegas, especially if you just came from or going to Tao Nightclub. This place is a reason to book a room in the Venetian. All I will is that it's your favorite diner times 10. Check out the website for all the details you need: grandluxcafe.com Everything is pretty good, but I would just stick to the appetizers if I had to. You must order this: Double Stuffed Potato Spring Rolls Might as well get this: The Grand Appetizer Platter The food is too good. The wait isn't too long. The place is always open. I am sure that you will probably take a picture of your food too. Don't ask questions, just go and you'll have a new place to tell about when they plan a Vegas trip.

amFSkhZ4eAFoqjfJIxQDkQ.text: Every time I come to Vegas I eat here like twice a day. The southwest salad is so good and the slice of cheesecake is bigger than my foot. Mmmmz

0t9J2v0cb8J2qbvB2vnmVA.text: Huge selection of food. We had a sandwich, pasta, and a salad. Everything was delicious. Would come back again. Oh and very reasonable prices.

O9qoq8Acb3xl2KrflQ5Mmw.text: Great quiet escape from the bustling casino floor. The food comes in surprisingly large size, is very tasty and affordable. The "grand" in their menu category isn't just for eponym: the items under it come in very large portions. Our server was very friendly and speedy! I have nothing to complain about

kFYXQn4tKfn5Kmwx_1CPKw.text: After eating at many top notch restaurants and dropping a couple hundies having dinner for two and being mildly impressed, I discovered the Grand Lux.  The menu was so vast that there is something for everyone. I ended up coming here for three meals during my week long stay in Vegas.   I had a Grand Lux Omlette for breakfast, which came with asparagus, Artichoke, Oven-Dried Tomato, Portabella Mushrooms and Havarti Cheese. I asked for the hollondaise sauce on the side.  Also came with choice of hashbrowns or tomatoe/lettuce and choice of bread. I went for the tomatoe/lettuce and an english muffin.  It tasted perfect!  If you like cream cheese, ask for some because they make it fresh and boy it is gooooood!  As for the other two meals, I had the the Manhattan salad for dinner. The portion was huge, I had to take half of it to go.  It was a chopped salad with Romaine Lettuce, Asparagus, Tomato, White Beans, Fresh Beets, Red Onion, Peas, Lentils and Assorted Vegetables tossed in Our House Vinaigrette with chopped fresh turkey and cheese. I loved it!!! The other meal was the sonoma salad which didn't stand up to the Manhattan.    Meals cost between 10-20 bucks.  They have great lunch specials that are really dinner sized portions.    You can't go wrong at the Grand Lux. It's located centrally inside the Venetian and open late.  Service was great each time!

4CwIB2DSd-67dNBEkUErCQ.text: margherita pizza.  drools.  Queen Margherita would be proud.  Grand Lux has one of the best margherita pizzas I've ever tried.  The lux is one of my go-to restaurants in Vegas.  Nice venue, great service, and a very extensive menu.  I've tried their seafood salad (delish) and garden salad (very refreshing).  Their garlic infused ranch is soooo good!    I would also give their omelet with havarti a gold star.  I've heard good things about their weekend breakfast buffet, including the omelet bar.  I shall try it next time I'm in Vegas!

96HxjIjl5uwYNfHCPblpMQ.text: Went here for brunch on New Years Day. The restaurant is open most of the day and has the ambiance of a french cafe in Paris.   Had the buffet for brunch. It had been raided and it was a bit of a mess. The food, especially the sausage, was tasty so ignoring the mess at the buffet it was a good experience. We told the waiter about the lack of food at the buffet, and she was largely ignorant. Not the service I expect at a place that charge you $20 for brunch.

usTl1xG5-IGaRf8GDnZZOA.text: Whoa. Yelped something for some late night grubbery and this place popped up on Yelp.  There are two locations.  One at the Venetian and one at the Palazzo.  In essence, they're right next to each other.  Ordered some appetizers.  NOTE!  One appetizer is as big as a meal.  The calamari was just nicely breaded and had a nice bite to them.  The two sauces the calamari comes with is good!  Also got the chicken quesadillas.  This is not your typical chicken quesadilla.  You are probably imaging a flour tortilla and some diced up chicken breast and some cheese.  Not this.  It had three layers.  Some shredded chicken with a nice kick to it.  Some green chiles and cheese.  My only gripe was that we got sat near the entrance and I had to flag our waitress down every single time.  One for water.  One to get our orders taken.  Another to ask for some condiments.  Another for our check.  She was more interested in helping the table of 10 obnoxious guys next to us.  All the other tables seemed to be tended to.  It is what it is.

FrCCdlxsvb0mOo8W1ONYwQ.text: Good ambiance bomb food and large portions for the price.  ASIAN NACHOS are off the hook.

2PxSbOZjOVSX33IVdzfU5Q.text: This is my new usual spot. We came here twice to eat for the two days we were in Vegas! The first time I ordered the buffalo chicken sandwich and fries. I did have to send the fries back because they were just a little warm and my fries have to be hot!! The service was a little slow but the servers were nicer do offered bread while we waited! Yummy!!!! I also got the spicy Thai chicken with veggies and white rice. I would definitely order this again but with light sauce. They use all white chicken breast for their chicken plates. My husband always gets the chipotle burger and he is one happy camper. They are addy with the Cheesecake Factory so the prices are about the same but way better food!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy chicken flat bread
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Thai fried chicken soooo yummy
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Buffalo chicken sandwich is soooooooo good

uLswVE2jVVMPfld-bNWteg.text: Let's call Grand Lux what it is ... a slightly nicer Cheesecake Factory! The menu is pretty much the same (with noticeable name changes), the service is slightly better and the ambiance is just a smidge nicer! Overall good food, good service and they were able to seat our rather large party quickly, so go Grand Lux!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken and Avocado salad :)

EwxnEwWxb0TUngWh-lg8dA.text: Food was very tasty.  Ordered the Sunday night pasta which was hearty and hit the spot.  Service was somewhat slow.  Server asked how was everything tasting even though she could see we hadn't even taken a bite.    Prices are high for the overall experience.

XJKjkZ-6dF-vVvjuRWCcGA.text: Breakfast & lunch rocked -- French toast was so rich (deliciously so) that I could only eat half the order. The Rainbow Thai salad and chicken lettuce wraps were fantastic and decently priced. I would definitely go again.

6n7pTpRdVwrFiTIfZc9h_A.text: Good selection, great food and very reasonable prices for Vegas! We come back year after year. I highly recommend you give it a try!

Q9vWJ9QFM4wPz64H_mO0Ew.text: Ionno, grand lux gimme mix feelinz. Notha joint whur service gud, but fudz can b not so guds. Dis wuz one of dem timez whur 2/3 thangs we ordered wurnt vury gud n bof wur recommended by tha server. Can't trust NOBODY no mo. Got some azn beef steak flank shizz in sum soy sauz thang; mofo salty AFFFFFF. Musta kilt a whole bottle of soy sauz on dat janx cuz all dis salt n ma body gimme power 2 float in woda on ma own. Iz call da spicy ginger beef, ain't even spicy 2 me. Sum1 done broke chefs hart he be salty AF, tearz on tearz, GIVE DAT MAN SUM TEAR BAGS STAT. Now mebe it wuz ma mood, but I wuznt feelin dem buffalo chizkin rolls eitha but it wuznt actually bad nice crunchy greezy fo sneezy. Wuz gud? Dat woodgrilled BBQ burger. Juicy, crispy tempura onion, sauz, melt in yo mouf. Dis place open l8, I think two fo seven n I been hur b4 n da othr 1 in palazzo. Portionz fo entreez r prtty big, u ain't gon b hongray fo a while bruh. I think dat volcano shraamp gud but servr dude convince me not 2 get bcuz of portion. Next time doe, next time. Holla atchyo gurllllll

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salty AFFFFFF some skirt steak in soy sauce marinade
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Burger
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Buffalo wing rolls

azeyVTj6rhofXHPbdXcMUw.text: I've been here years ago born and raised in vegas always use to come in after going out at night..food is great but this past time I had a bitter experience...I came in and the customer service was the worst...I've been in customer service since I can remember..sat down and was trying to decide what to get..was ready to order and asked to get me a burger w everything on it waiter said " you know that's going to be more than 40 dollars right".first of all I didn't ask him what the price was if I want something I pay for it...the waiter was horrible,rude and made me feel horrible..I ended up ordering a salad..I wanted to walk out so bad but decided to talk to the manager"matt".He stated that the reason why he said that is for certain reasons..Matt gave me the option of changing waiters..from that time I had giving up and just sat there and looked at my salad..didn't even eat it.matt swung by and brought us a cream brulee.will never go back there again...disappointed cause I loved it there..have to find somewhere else to go

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

iqyJ_jBa0c7xdnO1k500hQ.text: I have been to the grand lux cafe at the Beverly center in LA, so when I found out there was one in the Venetian I knew it would be great.  It is open 24 hours, and we got there for a late dinner on Monday night around 11. Our waitress Ashley was very friendly and overall great! For an appetizer we got the fried calamai. It was great! I ordered the pan seared salmon and it was great! My boyfriend ordered the chopped beef steak - didn't like it at all, and wanted to the angus steak. Ashley was kind enough to switch it out for us , and offered salad or soup while he waited!   She was great on our refills, and was very sweet. Overall great food, greatttt service, (thanks Ashley!) and wonderful atmosphere! We will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chopped beef and pan seared salmon!

qbUlnC_HnJqm_J5V8IgkXw.text: I really enjoy coming here to eat when I'm in Vegas, and even if I'm not staying at the Venetian, I'm willing to make the drive from Mandalay Bay.  Yes, it's a Cheesecake Factory spinoff, but lunch is rarely more than $15 per head, and if you can find a better deal, please tell me because I think this place is a bargain.  If you're in a hurry, you can eat at the bar - they serve the full menu and you always get great service since the bartender is never more than a few steps away from you.    The Venetian is too fancy for a buffet, so this is the only buffet you'll find in the entire hotel, and it's breakfast only.  It has a pretty nice variety of small muffins, bear claws, croissants, English muffins/bagels/toast, bacon, potatoes and a made-to-order omelet station.  The line can be pretty long, but those guys work pretty quickly.  Lots of the entrees come in a smaller lunch portion, and the service is always fantastic with drinks frequently refilled and servers coming to check on you.  I've never had a bad meal here, and when you consider how much food this kitchen turns out, I think they are pretty much hitting home runs every night.

lBoHGEERVZr3g3LgQG6TQA.text: This place is delicious and I look forward to my next visit.  Vegas is always hot and humid, so venturing for food becomes quite a hassle and chore.  Luckily there are great places like Grand Lux Cafe that will spare you some time.  There is one inside The Pallazo and another inside The Venetian.    The first time I came to Grand Lux I had one of their chicken sandwiches with fries, about $13.  Its fairly big and pacts quite a punch.  I was stuffed for hours and even had to nap shortly after.  This last time I tried the burger melt, about $13.50, which also comes with fries.    The burger melt oozed from side to side with hot melted cheese and thousand island.  Every bite tasted just, if not better, than the last.  I highly recommend the burger melt if you're interested in a burger.  I got mine medium rare and it was delicious.   Service was pretty fast and efficient.  This will have to be a must for me next time I'm in Vegas

eF4ILd6IA-VulpNYraJjoA.text: I can't remember if we ate at the one in the Venetian or Palazzo, but the service and food was top notch. We ordered fried pickles, fish tacos, and pot roast cheese fries. All were the best we've ever had of each item. I highly recommend the pot roast cheese fries. The flavor of the pot roast was excellent. And the texture of the cheese was perfect.   The staff were extremely helpful with all the things my daughter kept dropping on the floor. At the end of the meal, I was cleaning up under her chair and the waitress came over and chastised me for doing so and said they'd clean that up for me. So nice.

mkmyr7KC63H1JTZXZu2NuA.text: This restaurant is seriously good.  Definitely a fan of their asian nachos & omelettes! Whenever I'm in Vegas, within the vicinity of Venetian, i'm down to munch here! Service is excellent. Though, it can get super busy on weekends!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. asian nachos!!

2AyobAN0dfRTuNIOJ_mb0g.text: Ordered the Chinese chicken salad with dressing on the side to go. There was only on girl working on a very busy weekend. She's doing her best. Kitchen took over 30 min. Someone brought out a tray of salads for the take out counter. I asked if my order was ready. They gave me my salad but who really needs 30 packets of salt and pepper? I gave them to the cashier and left.  I like the food but they really need better service.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chinese chicken salad with way too many salt and pepper packets.

NVilVHUnONYmxh_4X2hRZg.text: I was at a conference at the Venetian so I thought Grand Lux would be a great place to enjoy a lunch in between meetings. It was very crowded on a Monday afternoon but there is ample seating at tables or booths so I was seated right away. There are plenty of friendly and competent servers to make the meal time pleasant. Now the menu can be a bit overwhelming with all its choices so don't feel like you have to chose the very first item that catches your eye. Make sure to read the menu carefully. My mai tai ended up costing more than my soup, salad, 1/2 sandwich combo cost, but it was a GIANT drink. My only gripe about GLC is that they always seem to have it so dark in there! I would like to see my food and my company while I enjoy my meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salad, sandwich, soup combo-

4mL17iZoYsomhkyT-CM5HA.text: Our family had dinner at this restaurant three times during the recent stay in Vegas. Love the food and atmosphere. Even though the restaurant is in Venetian, the prices are very decent. Highly recommend it.

cpxx6i0XAUxBO8jA6Fl4Og.text: Grand Lux Cafe has become one of my favorite restaurants in Vegas.  I visit Vegas maybe three to four times a year and I make it a must to eat at the Grand Lux at least once per visit. Its open 24 Hours and their service is excellent. Their hamburgers, pizzas, pastas, salads are delicious! There has not been a single item that I have disliked. My favorite item on the menu is the Grilled Chicken and Avocado Salad, it is to die for! I have not found a better salad than this. I highly recommend it!    The prices are fair and the portions are huge, every order is enough for two people. You're definitely getting bang for you buck!!  It is a definite must for everyone!

OcILra6KmoxxgVVtIqHlEw.text: One of my favorite restaurants and this location in Vegas on the strip didn't disappoint. We brought friends with us who had never heard of the Grand Lux. They were extremely pleased and new fans. The red velvet pancakes and amazingly delicious, words can't describe how much I love them.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Awesome service, great food and really pleasant servers. We will definitely be back to this location

zItBJaSl2FH8ieBMy7hm8g.text: This is usually one of my favorite spots in the Venetian to go to at odd hours of the night because it is open all night long. I always get the buffalo chicken rolls which are usually amazing but they were pretty dry this past time I went. I definitely recommend the waffle with fresh strawberries and whipped cream around breakfast time. The smoothies are pretty good too. I tried the fresca pasta for the first time this past weekend and it wasn't amazing but pretty healthy.

doTV7BWdj0IzIN98V7qPag.text: The food here is good but the service is bad. It took almost 30 mins for us to wait for only 3 dishes and during the waiting time, the waiter didn't come and didn't give us bread, though I saw other tables had the bread. Also after we finished, I asked for a box to pack up the food. The waiter just gave me the box and asked me to do it by myself, though I saw on the other table, the waitress helped those guests to pack the food. I am not saying I can't do it by myself, but since it supposed to be a good restaurant, I feel being disrespect.

mwwufRipwVTj8NJb-0AOQw.text: This is a sister restaurant to Cheesecake Factory so the menu is pretty much the same. I've been coming here for years. We would drive in at 11pm and head straight over for a great late dinner. We love the service here, although the last time I was here they sat us in the patio... wrong move. It's in the casino so, smokers keep walking by and it's more noisy. No patio seating unless you want to people watch and don't mind the smoke. If you're there for Brunch get the Blood Orange Mimosa, Peach Bellini,  and the Brioche French Toast with strawberries... YUMMY!! We love the Chicken Enchiladas and The Crispy Carmel Chicken is my hands down favorite although, it doesn't taste anything like Carmel. Sweet & spicy crispy chicken would be a better name. The Pasta with Chicken, Sun-dried Tomatoes and Mushrooms is also very good.

LyTB4B2vfzxcn5BsuacEbw.text: I always liked this place over the years until last weekend,when our entire meal was horrible. and it took 15 minutes before our server even came to our table.  I've always ordered the pot roast in here but thie time it was dry and pretty much burnt.I sent it back and they admitted they were having "issues" with it.The salad I ordered in it's place had  soggy tomatoes that just ruined it.  The others in my party were not impressed with their food either.The worst part is we specificly went to the Venitian to eat there on my recomendation and nobody left happy.  The manager did come out and  try to smooth things over but the bad taste was already in our mouths!  Also while seated in the bar in a low booth we had a birds eye view of a overweight 40 ish woman in booty shorts,whose legs were spead eagle at  one the high tables across from us.When she wasnt showing everyone her goods she was rubbing her companions crotch with her bare foot! If I'd of been able to actually eat my food ,I'd of probably of thrown up!  I wish I could still love this place but I can't anymore.

hLqbiA0MYqbNBAZBpPcwHw.text: 5 stars all around! This place has everything you would want in a meal, taste, quality, quantity and price.  I see that many have mentioned that the food is like Cheesecake Factory but i think this place is much better and the portion size is ridiculous. Every entree can be shared between two people comfortably and the best part? The price is just right.   Came in here with a group of 6 on a Saturday night around 7:00 PM and was seated within 5 minutes. Next came the complimentary bread- omg, probably some of the best sourdough bread i've ever had. The bread was warm, the inside was soft and the outside had just enough of chewiness and crunch. Our group ordered the lettuce wrap, the pizza, the salmon and chicken terriyaki, the fettucini alfredo and another pasta dish. Eveyrthing was delicious and none of us spent more than $15 dollars each(with tax and tip already) - not to mention we all had leftovers for after-clubbing grub at 4 AM.   To top it off, the service was awesome. Our waiter was honest with us about the portion sizes and encouraged us to share- not like the typical waiters that roll their eyes when they know you are sharing. He also offered to split all of the checks for us and even went above and beyond to split the shared items among the pairs. There was a 18% gratuity charge on our check but almost all of us left him extra tip because he was so awesome!!!!   Thanks Grand Lux Cafe for a great meal!!! I'll definitely be back.   Oh, they are also open 24 hours i believe :)

qKRoMgBTnfSNTFysGK9BoA.text: There is nothing worse than raging the first night in Vegas, waking up and feeling so sick you have to sit the rest of the weekend out.  After partying upstairs at TAO, the girls and I went back to our room, changed into our pajamas and then went downstairs to soak up the alcohol that was surely seeping from our pores.  I ordered the Fried Chicken and Waffles and starved as I was, it was enough for me and one other girl to share. I'm not sure if it was due to the fact that I was so hungry I could've eaten a horse, but the chicken was extra cripsy, not greasy or gross and the waffles tasted fab (Did I detect a hint of cinnamon?).    I've since had the Bacon Cheeseburger and Fettucino Alfredo, both were absolutely amazing and the servings out of control.  I'd recommend sharing a meal if you go.  It also stated that the atmosphere is dress but multiple times I have been here at 4am dressed in my pajamas and no one has said anything.

TD9tiQb-IBwBLfIKHq9D6g.text: It's my own tradition to come here when I come go to Las Vegas, which is anywhere from 2 to 3 times a year.   I come here for 3 main reasons: The buffalo chicken rolls are perfection, it's open 24 hours, and I like to sit in the patio area so I can watch stupid drunk people passing by.   As much as I enjoy coming here I think giving it anything more than a 3 or 3.5 would be generous. Their fries are always dissapointing and the rest of the food is okay. For me, its main charm is the fact that it's open 24 hours and it's in my favorite hotel to stay at.  The buffal chicken rolls are reason enough to come check this place out.

rovtreywqAPbEOJ3_sWCWw.text: Came here after a long day and night of dancing on couches and five inch heels. The Venetian is so pretty and inside is this gem. If you haven't heard , Grand Lux is a chain with Cheesecake factory. I love cheesecake factory, so I already knew that it was going to be bomby food. So I came here when it was really late which means that I couldn't order anything. There is a special menu area for late night guests and i guess special seating? I ordered the pasta with sun dried tomatoes basil and chicken. Freaking delicious, yes. Weird down side to this place, was that the floors were extremely slippery, I had to ice skate myself around. And the way they seated us was so weird because we were sitting so close to the people next to us, that we can hear each other's awkward conversations.  BUt I guess that is something you only see in Vegas. Come here!!!!!

mEYQRWcbpz0onyY0lDUEdw.text: Love the one in Los Angeles and LOVE this one too. Our waiter went out of his way to complete what I ordered which was not on the menu. Seared Ahi tuni steak in a lemon butter sauce. It was amazing and made perfectly. We brought some new friends with us and they loved it too. Never disappoints. Love the buffalo chicken rolls, potato spring rolls. crispy ahi rolls and the Grand Lux Melt Burger :) Its all sooooo good !! PICK THIS LOCATION NOT THE PALAZZO LOCATION

3ykdXcYy9xHkU5mB1V6GcQ.text: I LOVE grand lux cafe.. it's a better cheesecake factory (it is owned by the same company)  The first one I ever went to was the one in Dallas.  I love how there aren't that many, so it makes it kind of special.  Make sure to get the beneigts.  mmmmm.... But the one in the Venitian does not have Beneigts because it was the very first Grand Lux Cafe.. just walk over the the Palazzo and enjoy some! :)

mclDajYn8DellQd3C2Zo7Q.text: service is excellent here. even though its not a fancy restaurant. the servers here are really nice, attentive and on top of things. we came here for a quick dinner before we pre-gramed it with some hot guys we met the night before. we all had different pastas and they were all delicious. two of us had the pasta fresca it had lots of veggies with penne pasta, it was so good. and two other girls had a different pasta that looked good, but i didnt try it so i can't say much about it. decently priced....pasta rangeds $10-14 a plate and its a huge portion!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ozuoDSHMskEqYf4W8rRNvA.text: My wolfpack was ravenous.  I ran into a girl in the bathroom that had leftovers from this restaurant that said it was cheap, pretty good and had BIG PORTIONS... and was just around the corner.  Sweet!  It was kinda like eating at Cheesecake Factory.  Which makes sense, since it's owned by them.  The food was nothing special - pretty good, and we all finished our apps (buffalo chicken rolls), entrees (patty melt, ahi tuna burger, chicken salad sandwich) & a dessert (apple pie) without blinking.  BTW, when I ask for my ahi tuna burger to be cooked raw, I don't expect to receive an ahi tuna burger that is medium well.  But I was so hungry that by the time I realized I should've said something, it was nearly all gone.  It was still pretty tasty though.  So... yes, we'd all eat here again. Especially if we were drunk or hungover.

Ed7wifLWxapFm2RZf5GsYQ.text: This restaurant is nice and the menu has a variety of great food and the prices are not to bad, about $20 or more per person.  Staff was efficient but it was obvious that the busy restaurant was stressful for them.  I would eat here again.

-AEvyKxPX3BOfIXFM7naFg.text: We stayed at the Palazzo and had breakfast here twice. I would absolutely recommend it for breakfast. I had the buffet both times and it really was outstanding. The fruit is fresh and nicely cut. You have a toast area that has many bread choices as well as bagels and English muffins. The only downside is there was no cream cheese for the bagels. The hot area had an omelet to order area as well as excellent waffles ready to eat, very nicely done scrambled eggs, which is rare in general, and by far some of the best bacon I've had ever. There was also ham, sausage and hash-browns as well. The price also included a beverage. My friend got the huevos rancheros which I tasted and they truly were amazing. Fresh and delicious all around.

h5A-EsdD-TLmSYXeRBOc8Q.text: We came here twice, which says a lot. Once for breakfast, the other for a fourth meal. Breakfast was generous in portion and tasty (omelette and smoked salmon). Fourth meal hit the spot: short rib grilled cheese and the spicy carnitas sandwich.

ZqNOetrbF0R_-RmMhiq4Hg.text: Higher end version of the cheescake factory! LOVE THIS PLACE! must try the buffalo wraps and the asians nachos are to DIE for! make sure you get there early because it gets super busy but well worth it. I go prolly 5-6 times a year .. The only thing.. service last time was kinda crappy but forgive and forget when you taste the food..:)

LTzjbBom78tEzfb7fLnVJQ.text: This was my first trip to Vegas, and I was visiting on a limited budget, so I searched Yelp for affordable eateries and found Grand Lux Cafe.  Since I knew it was owned by the Cheesecake Factory, I kind of had an idea of what I could expect.  There was a little bit of a wait, but it didn't take too long to get seated.  There seemed to be a lot of empty tables, so I'm surprised it took as long as it did, but no biggie. I had the Wild Mushroom "Burger," one of their vegetarian options. It was surprisingly delicious, and the fries were good too. My lunch buddies ordered the lunch-sized salads, which they really enjoyed, and were still very generous in size. On the way out, I passed by a table that had ordered some kind of pasta, and the portion size was enormous.  There was something a little cheesy or forced about the waitstaff ... but no more cheesy than everything else in Vegas, I suppose.  Overall, a decent place to stop and grab lunch for a reasonable price.

_zC91aGLwBjnMJji-rpG9A.text: Food was good but the wait was way too long to get in. My wife ordered a hamburger well done and the waitress said well doe takes an additional 15 minutes. Are the now using sunlight with a magnifying glass to cook. Why an additional 15. I don't know but it took 30 minutes to get our food.

xrnpdb7A9ELNtVNUm3ljoQ.text: Three months later and my sister-in-law is STILL talking about how good her chicken pot pie was! Everyone in our party was extremely pleased with the food (Kobe Meatballs, Kobe Burger, Chicken Pot Pie, and a Sandwich) and service here! I was impressed with the price vs. quality of the food. I don't go down to the strip all that often, but I would definitely recommend this restaurant to anyone headed into or near the Venetian!

gZC99lwl7KQG3swlP-C11A.text: We always eat here, and it's usually a very good experience.   Recently, we went here for lunch. There was a hair in our food. Disgusting! We told one of the servers, and they left the plate there on the table (weird?) and called the manager who took forever to get to our table. He took away the plate and brought another one in a timely manner. They did comp the plate, but we're a little traumatized still...

IU5APOaAS2a6V0v-6GXo1g.text: Oh the chicken and waffle...YUMMY! Pecan maple syrup for the waffles, then dip the chicken in the garlic ranch dressing. Nothing in life is better. The service could of been better. We waited a bit for our order and we didnt get bread like the other tables did. But I will over look that because the chicken and waffle was worth it!

4z5G5Ya7uh6AvvfbAiaSpA.text: They have a very extensive menu at very modest prices.  The atmosphere is best described as Italian Cheesecake Factory as well as the menu.  And it is located right in the casino.  We had a few lunches there with up to 12 people and everyone was pleased with the food for the price.

L1pOvj-juiCdqPruanKn7A.text: ...yea so my friends and i were hungry, hence, gotta eat, right?  so aside from slamming ourselves with vegas buffet, we decided on Grand Lux since it was reasonably priced and it lies within a prestigious hotel, the Venetian.    well i gotta say the food was pretty good although they came kinda slow;  it wasn't even crowded.  alas, when our food came, we wolfed it down like there's no tomorrow.  definitely hit the spot!  the waiter was fairly attentive and portions were pretty big.  we were all satisfied after the feast.  anyway, despite the longer than usual wait, i think i had a tad better time than my friends because i got a couple smiles from some grandma sitting next table from us with her peers.  heck if i had a bigger set of "kahones", i'd bust out my game and probably score me a sugar mama.  hey, it's vegas!  verdict: fair wait time good food reasonable price full tummy  .... no sugar mama though :(

veBmbmSrCdDHlq1GG0NHIA.text: When ordering BMG tix over the phone, a Las Vegas native suggested we eat at Grand Lux before the show.  She was spot on.  I actually liked both of the Luxes (Palazzo and Venetian) much better than the parent Cheesecake Factory.  My aunt indulged in vjeesy mashed potato egg rolls--I had to swipe one...YUM.  Another night she ordered a made to order Caramel Apple Pie ala Mode. Not only delish but served oh so attractively.  For some reason, and I wasn't drinking either, but I don't recall what I ordered.  I guess I was too busy scamming off her plate. Great locations, selection, service, pricing and hours of operation--24/7.

xNuu8Xq56vDH4PjP9jDgZg.text: I liked the service and ambience from the start..they bring out sourdough and butter which is great. I ordered a texas tea to drink. Good amount of alcohol and still tastes refreshing. I ordered the spicy buffalo chicken sandwich. Both the fries and sandwich were great..

YjfGI9UBFpA4nH80YtAIug.text: Love love love the Grand Lux at the Venetian. My friends and I have started out  many of our Vegas trips with a meal here and usually make many more dining trips here. And we have so much enjoyment when we eat here. The food is good and the portions are large enough to share. My favorite is their Portofino Salad. So delicious. Apparently everyone and their mother loves this place, too. There's usually a wait for a table, all hours of day and night! The service isn't the best here but that's not why we go to the Grant Lux!

84I1y2vsh5-49S3J1xydUA.text: MMMM the cheesey potato eggrolls are so yum! I love the fact that they have a great menu 24 hours a day!

SkfEcMyuNb1F1aUScdK3Zg.text: I'm not sure why.. but I like this cafe over the one at the palazzo. It stay open 24/7 and the one in the palazzo close at 2am. The food is really good here and the price is decent. You know how food in Vegas is totally overpriced.My gfs and I came here plenty of times on our last trip bc it was convenient.  I LOVE the ahi... we ordered this a couple times we were there. The buffalo wings is different and veryy gooood after a late night drunken partying. welll it was good overall. The crab cakes is VERY good =]. you have to try it! I really like the shaken beef. I was iffy at first because its a asian dish and this is an american place. but it was actually very good with a little twist. THey have such a big menu.. which is always a plus!! You can get anything from your regular american food to asian cuisine =]

8v8CijPPA59MROo7Xpi8WA.text: Great place to go for an after clubbing snack! I was afraid it would be expensive, but all the food was reasonably priced. I had the gemmelli with sun dried tomatoes and chicken which was delicious. They also did not seem to mind when we started to break out into song to Miley Cyrus's "The Climb":)

NDaHSNsk6cLQq2sh9Z5Uzg.text: Great food! I had the steak my girlfriend chicken royale and both your amazing. The service is excellent as they are completely on top of things. Another thing that was extremely nice is even though they were I would say 80-85% full we still had our amazing food in around 20mins

vWlDdq67UdDih8UTsk3FFw.text: You know, everyone raves about this place, and I can't see it. It's annoyingly loud, the seats are pretty uncomfortable and the food quality just isn't there. I just finished having lunch with a gf who loves Grand Lux and is in from out of town, so politely agreed to join at Palazzo. I ordered something different from the Asian Nachos which is the only thing that I have had there that I thought was extra good at one time, but the last time I got them thought they had gone downhill, so decided to switch today to the Rachel (sister to a Ruben). The meat was so greasy and bad tasting that I literally had to pull it from the sandwich and eat the slaw and bread alone which too was overly greased and dripping. I stopped eating at about half because I thought it would make my stomach upset if I ate more. Trust me, I don't usually walk away from a Ruben sandwich. With so many great places to eat in Vegas why bother?

oH-2Pz472GIDx5Ob85ZVrw.text: Customer Service here is a joke, but the quality of food makes up for it. I came here twice during my Vegas trip, once for a late dinner and once for an early lunch.  Bad customer service = hostess with a bad attitude, a table without basic condiments such as sugar for coffee, waffles delivered on a plate without any strawberries or whip cream  Food on the other hand was delicious. I had the avocado chipotle burger. Burger was cooked to perfection, tasted gourmet fresh. Avocado portions were fair, fries on the side and you are golden! For lunch, my friend had the chilaquiles (delicious, but light on the eggs) and strawberry waffles  Better than Cheesecake Factory!

YmnQ6yZPpE6d1gSaNTg-Eg.text: Ok, people.  Let's give a lill' credit where credit is deserved.  Grand Lux Cafe holds a special place in my heart.  Let me break it down for y'all,...  - Yeah, Grand Lux Cafe's evil twin sister restaurant is The Cheesecake Factory.  But, what this means for you, gentle reader, is a hearty, "American-sized" meal.  You won't go hungry here. - Not only are the portions generous, the food is DANG GOOD.  It might be reminiscent of The Cheesecake Factory, or even Mimi's Cafe.  But, it's consistently good.  REALLY good.  Comfort foods galore. - And, good comfort food is even better after a hard night of hardcore partying.  For all your alcoholics out there (particularly from California), don't front - you know y'all head to Denny's or Jack In The Crack or Mel's because really junky, greasy food tastes even better at 3am and when you're trying to sober up.  Well, the food at Grand Lux Cafe is several notches above Denny's, Mel's and Jack In The Crack.  AND, this place is open 24:7.  Even better.  You can stumble into the restaurant looking like a complete train wreck, missing one shoe and tiara in hand, at 3am, 5am or 7am!  And the yummy comfort food at Grand Lux Cafe will be waiting for you like a faithful, faithful friend.

ObKrCNEapv2rDcSmz4ASaA.text: They wouldnt seat us until our entire 20+ party arrived.  I've never understood this policy and it's bullshit.  If seated, we would have drank more while waiting for the few stragglers.  Plus, when they did seat us, the floor was incredibly slippery and even the guys in their flat rubber bottomed soles were sliding.  Real safe.  The food was okay, although I think my salad gave me a serious case of the runs later on (my friend had the same salad and felt sick the next day).   Our waiter was great, though, and she did a good job with our large table.  Drinks were watered down, which also sucked.

z5N2IqegzI6R8i_fieYP-g.text: first impression of this place when we came in was that it was going to be overpriced and run of the mill diner type food with a little twist.  after checking out the menu, we couldn't help the similarity with cheesecake factory (which i think there is some correlation or relationship at least).  anyways we opted for the calamari salad and the sloppy joe.  once the meals came and we dug in, we were instantly hooked. we terrorized each plate to the bone. the calamari salad was realllllllly good. very flavorful and the fried calamari really went well with it all. the sloppy joe very flavorful and complimented by the criss cut fries very well  our waiter suggested we try the beignets and swore that they were the shit. we ordered some and were kinda disappointed. they tasted like bland donuts imo. but whatever that calamari salad was so good.   i was very impressed and pleased with the service atmosphere and quality of food. thank god there is one in la as well.   this place is definitely worth a shot.

ZddkRKmQxhkZidbw29V9oQ.text: What can I say..Except for the price (Which you should know about since your in Vegas) the food and sprits were spectacular!! I especially loved our waitress!

boM5j7QqUxQ5-l6wXQkByQ.text: This place reminds me exactly of The Cheesecake Factory. In fact, I think they might be the same company. I believe this place is open 24 hours so you can come here anytime to satisfy your late night cravings. They have a huge menu, but it's heavy on the selection of pastas. I got the pasta carbonara if I remember correctly. It was good, but heavy on the cream, which might not have been the best idea, but I was too hungry to care at the time. The portions are huge and I could barely finish half. It was not that good the next day to say the least. The butter cream had solidified into a chunky rock-like state. I also tried the chicken and waffles, which was also good. The service here was very good as our waiter was helpful in suggesting my pasta plate. I guess it never hurts to be nice when your restaurant is located in a casino and you just hope you run into a lucky patron who is feeling generous. Unfortunately, I had just lost all my money a few moments earlier.

wse4kL4nH-FdB5YDKb4VKw.text: I go here every time I'm in Vegas. (the one in the Venetian of course, the one located at the Palazzo is HORRIBLE) The prices are amazingly cheap and the portions are HUGE! the salads are excellent. I really love the Italian Market sandwich. The calamari is great too.

SN1qhq9L8xXQ40I7E_v7Kg.text: If there's a book on how to run a large restaurant efficiently, serve decent food in a nice atmosphere, and get the orders right, then these folks wrote that book. Even though it's a large establishment inside a casino, the waiters don't treat you like you're a tourist at Disneyland.  There are, in fact, multiple Grand Lux cafes, with identical menus -- one  inside the Venetian and one at the Palazzo (the two casinos are seamlessly connected). And there's also a mini G.L. serving coffee and pastry.  This is a great option when you're looking for reliably good food served quickly -- but not in the mood for a) the food court, or b) a high-dollar, celebrity-chef inspired, fine-dining "experience". I ate at Grand Lux twice this weekend (once at V and once at the Palazzo), and the service was exceptional. For breakfast I had the best French toast I've tasted in a long time -- not too soft, gooey, or sweet (made with Brioche). (I rarely go out for breakfast, but for this place I'll make an exception; so many places seem compromised at breakfast, like everything is being done by the B team, which I suspect it probably is.) At lunch, I had the chicken enchiladas (available in two portion sizes -- the lunch consists of two smallish enchiladas, plenty of food unless you are really hungry). The sauces were spicy and flavorful -- a nice dish and only about $11. Hubby had the appetizer-portion Greek salad, also good, and quite substantial. We had a side of fries, and they were good.   The staff made sure our water glasses were filled, not making us feel rushed, and the time we spent there was exactly right (they keep the music up *really* loud to keep those tables turned... but in a nice way). Compared to the iffy service and cramped quarters at the Tintoretto bakery / cafe near the Grand Canal Shops, this place is a Godsend.

aKUKai4gRBV_9uuWNhkwTQ.text: please be aware that there are 2 grand lux cafes. one located at the venetian side and one located at the palazzo side. this is an excellent choice for breakfast (assorted pastries with drink).. FOR FREE! yes that's right i said FREE. i received enough free breakfast coupons at check in from the front desk for all 4 of us in my group to eat here every morning we stayed at the venetian for 5 days. this one is locatred on the first floor right by the phantom of opera theatre. we came here twice for breakfast (wasted the other coupons, sigh) and had the continental breakfast (valued at $8 per person on our bill but was $0 for us). it came with a drink selection and a small fruit dish with 3 assorted pastries that changed based on the day you came. the coupon also gave me an option of eating the buffet breakfast which would have been $10 a person with the coupon. the lines are never longer than a 10-15min wait although it may look like a super long wait, but that's also because i was here off season in december before the holidays. i think they have a line separate for grazie members although i didnt discover that til after eating there. (free to join). we just left tip based on the value of the breakfast. cheapest/best way to eat breakfast in vegas!

ZzIYMWjoSprgdQh2J6NX4w.text: We visited the location inside of the Venetian and it was amazing. The website says they close at 12, but the restaurant is open 24hrs. I ordered the Pasta Telephano and it was awesome. For a pasta dish it was really light. The hot chocolate is really yummy also.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hot chocolate
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pasta Telephano

_iIoIos6-cs596WhmJrHgw.text: Went there twice in 2 days: once for a long lunch with a friend and the 2nd time for a quick meal before my flight sitting at the bar. Both times I had a really good service and the wait time was appropriate to my needs.   The food was good, better than your average American chain, and the portions were very big for the price. This is Vegas so I expected a 6$ tempura green beans appetizer to be really small and it turned out to be enormous, enough for 4ppl. My carbonara pasta plate was basically 3 meals (was huge but really good, with al dente pastas). We left with to-go boxes as it turned out to be too much food, but it was good enough to bring back to room. They also serve side bread and give you unlimited soda once you order one.  Would go back when plans with friends are not clear and you didn't reserve or when you don't want to go far from the hotel. Also perfect go to restaurant late at night or hungover!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

WGfAyS-jiM_PSh9_ct_UQQ.text: SO GOOD!  Food was excellent.  Huge menu to choose from. the Joe's Special, Bagels and Lox platter, Manhattan Salad, Crab and asparagus omelet were all excellent. Portions are huge.  Wait staff were A++-- friendly, quick, helpful, efficient.  I liked the location of this place.. just steps from the elevator of our hotel suite.  This is just like a Cheesecake Factory.  They also have a buffet (not one of those silly ones with 4,000 items) but we liked ordering off the menu. The orange juice was fresh squeezed.  When we were done with breakfast, and commented how we liked the coffee (we are from Seattle, after all-- strong and flavorful), our waitress got us To Go cups to take some with us. Really great place for breakfast, lunch or late night eating....

C-ZluogQdDKnUhrxaLM_dw.text: Great food, short wait time, friendly service, comfortable setting, and HUGE portions.  'Twas an early Saturday evening in Vegas. Dinner time. Four hungry people each craving something different. Where to go? Oh yeah, and good luck getting a table at this time of day, right?  Well, we were in luck. We saw the Grand Lux Cafe. After checking out the menu we were relieved to see that the menu was so diverse. There really is something for everyone. It seems to cater to the myriad of diverse pallets wandering through the hotel at any given time. There is a link to their "Full Menu" on the right side of this page. Guess what?--that ain't their full menu. That is a teaser. The best part was that despite what looked like a large volume of people waiting for a table the hostess ensured us that it would only be a 5 minute wait. (And it was).  They have everything from burgers and steaks to pastas, pizza and seafood as well as a large selections of salads. There's nothing exotic here, mind you, it's all standard North American fare. If you're a food blogger looking to write about your latest culinary conquest you might be a little sad.  I got the Pasta with Grilled Chicken, Tomato, Basil & Mozzarella. It was served in a large dish and as mentioned earlier, portions were generous. Not bad for $16--ish.  A special mention should be made of our friendly and outgoing server. We never did get her name unfortunately. It's always great to receive amazing service that's equal to the delicious food you're getting.  My only gripe is that we were seated next to the area where customers wait for a table to open up. The dining and waiting areas are separated by wrought iron fence. The people waiting have tendency to lean on the fence, sticking their fingers through it and talking loudly amongst themselves with no respect for the people eating on the other side of it. Their was even a child trying to climb the fence at one point. If the staff try and seat you in this area I would suggest that you just wait for a table to open further inside the restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummers

VWj3mp_W-aN9hDI6QFODAw.text: Sisters trip to Vegas. Second day in a row here. The food is delicious and the wait staff is phenomenal.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Personalized omelette made right in front of me, sweet fresh fruit and more. All from the buffet.
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Waffles and strawberry from the breakfast buffet.

etYlN87XR-2e5S9FSOsmcQ.text: The food is really good in this place. Went for brunch with a bunch of my buddies. The decor is lit dim and the vibe is relaxing. The staff is very friendly and provides a good service. The food is also good.

H5KPp33zezVo4xoOJGB16g.text: I love this place, been here 2 days and already ate there 3 times.  Try the Nashville Hot Chicken, probably best fried chicken I have ever eaten.

6rAycvrt8fIb48kNIfoLWg.text: Ahhhh-mazing food. Really good service!!! I went there with my family. 3 if us were vegetarians and one would eat meat. The vegetarian menu although was less but they did a lot of customizations!   Delicious veggie burgers and enchiladas. Really great mimosas! The waffle was to die for. The chorizo breakfast enchilada was stupendous.  Their portion sizes are really big so order accordingly. The order came a little late, so they had freshly baked bread for us to eat and that kept us busy.  All in all a good place to get lunch/brunch.  Goods : great food and drinks! Great customizations and amazing service. I think it was Laura or laurel who was a great server.  Bads : a little on the expensive side.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

9K3LdyOv3tYGXl1kHwjxbQ.text: Crazy menu. Share your food, order less!!!  I've seen reviews comparing this place to Cheesecake Factory since they're sister restaurants or something like that... But my family and I are kinda meh on Cheesecake Factory and we all loved this one.  We came with a huge group (friends and family) for my cousin's bachelorette party dinner. I think it was a total of about 30 of us? So taking our orders and getting the checks to us at the end were a little insane, though our servers were good-humored and managed us well.  My boyfriend and I ordered the Creamy Spinach & Cheese Dip, Chicken Pot Pie, and the Baked Rigatoni. MISTAKES. We definitely could've gotten away with ordering just the appetizer and an entree... or even a single entree between the two of us. Portions are huge.  That being said, the food itself was pretty good. The spinach dip came at a great time since we were starving. I loved the rigatoni, though my boyfriend thought it was a bit too salty for his own taste.  If I could redo this experience, I would order less and save myself room for dessert. I would've loved to try their beignets or molten chocolate cake.

ThG2cTWLHyo6qwBNSjtKdg.text: This is for the location in the Venetian, my husband and I have been going to this place for 10 years and have always loved it. We were just there this weekend for a family reunion with my brothers from out of town. We ordered the wings and unfortunately all 3 of us bit into undercooked wings. We informed our waiter, as he is taking them back he talks to the manager? I believe. Well he came over and felt he needed to explain the wings were *not* undercooked but because the wings are so large the veins look bloody because it is difficult to cook them all the way due to their size? I'm sorry but I've eaten wings at many places, much larger wings and I have not encountered this problem. They were not veins. They were BLOODY. He stated he could cook another order but would come out the same. I felt that he could have made an effort to maybe cook them all the way? Idk maybe it's just me but I would want to make my customers happy and not go back to *try to explain why wings are raw. Very displeased with service, will not be returning.

A5WkYyDibsfpOQ-s_wMJRA.text: Ate here around midnight. Had buffalo chicken sandwich and it was good. Friend had fettuccine Alfredo. Loved that this place was open 24/7. Staff seem a bit distracted / not too attentive. But it wasn't bad. Would've like to try breakfast buffet brunch but didn't have time.

70UyHK_XZ5dOhglyMCdZLA.text: Good food!  Try the breakfast quesadilla spicy but so good...service was also quick and efficient! Best lemonade around

6vtsv8Ipf-krPRDwKERceQ.text: Came here for dinner before going out. I ordered the garlic shrimp. It was tasty and it had a lot of shrimp. This place is open 24 hours which is nice. Service was great.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Garlic shrimp pasta

LiRPSOXLmIonVa8PJQX5vg.text: Nice place to get a quick bite at somewhat reasonable prices.  The Lemon Chicken Piccata ordered from the lunch menu was very flavorful (cheaper price due to lunch specials from 11am til 5pm); however, while the chicken was tender and excellent, the sauce was heavy and anywhere the sauce wasn't touching the pasta was slightly hard, thus obviously had been sitting under the warming light for a few.  The service, while good, was not up to par for the price we paid.    However, I feel this restaurant provides a huge number of options that could please everyone.  If you were to go at prime time meal service (instead of 3:30pm), I imagine the food and service would be spot on.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

KRDvciiyg7a0RGe7CQme4w.text: Delicious and affordable (for casino prices). I recently ate here for dinner and for breakfast. For dinner, we ordered the Asian nachos, as well as a Reuben sandwich and a burger. All were very tasty and had generous portions. For breakfast, we split the smoked salmon platter, lemon poppy seed pancakes, and the crab omelette. We left very full and fueled up for the day. We also took two dozen fresh baked cookies to go. All in all, very happy with the food quality and service both times.

8IhituumruJXqAS7Qt5YUA.text: Came to Grand Lux Cafe located inside the Venetian Hotel on Saturday night after clubbing at 1Oak. Our party was hungry so we thought we would come here to get some chicken and waffles! This restaurant is open 24 hours so it's convenient for after-party grub! I heard that it's the same owners as the Cheesecake Factory and you'll see a few similarities.  Their chicken and waffles $13.95 are amazing!!! The waffle is very fluffy on the inside and the exterior has a slight crisp to it! I LOVED IT! They also pile on chicken strips.  I love that they serve bread and butter with the meal too! Bread and butter makes the restaurant so much better I think ha ha  Our server Ahmat?( I think that's his name) was very attentive! He was great! When we asked for to-go boxes he even went out of his way to pack syrups for us without us having to ask! He was awesome!  Definitely make this your stop after a long night of clubbing or gambling! It's way better than the fast food options!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken &amp; Waffles $13.95

oASS-MWMRHPs_sMGqkEYYg.text: Not bad, very much like a cheaper version of Cheesecake factory. This place has a huge menu, something for everyone.   I ended up getting: Pasta Pomodoro Spaghettini Tossed with Sauteed Organic Cherry Tomatoes, Fresh Basil, Tomato Sauce and Parmesan Cheese  It was a little tasteless, the chicken was dry. I wish I would have chosen something different. Maybe next time.  The upside is this place is open 24-7.  The waitress was extremely nice, attentive and quick!  We also got our food very quickly. We came here around 6:30-7:00 and had been seated right away, so I'm sure it's safe o say you don't need a reservation.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pasta Pomodoro... chicken a bit dry, flavors okay

c1Y1YTUqy1EkIhPqANg87A.text: Please don't spend your time and money at the Grand Lux, the charm ends with the name. I swear it is just like a Cheesecake Factory. The menu is huge, but so what. You will wait and wait and wait for service. The servers make you feel like you are at Denny's (actually I have had much better service at Denny's). We were there for a late morning breakfast and it was boring and bland. The place is loud and at least for me in the morning I would like just a little quiet. You would be better served at The Paris Buffet or the Buffet at the Belligo.  It took over 30 minutes for our food to arrive (you want more coffee--think again) and it was cold. I love Las Vegas and I love the places to eat there, from the cheap buffets at some of the smaller hotels to the hot dogs in Downtown Las Vegas to the expensive dinner houses in the hotels. This place fits into none of these categories.  Grab something else to eat, anywhere, and save your money for a great dinner house.  Any Buffet is better. Anyone. This is just bad.

qJfGVLZ3XzHELyN7UdXCKQ.text: Slow service and rude hostess. Asked for a bigger table when I heard more people were joining and sat the Lee waiting forever until someone said we should have seen the hostess. Than the hostess told us to wait another 10 minutes. When I told her that we had already waited a long time she snapped: "you should have talked to me!" Never going back. Not to mention that the scramble eggs were from that liquid instant eggs instead of real eggs and my bill came wrong and the charged for the soda that I ordered but never came.

KJlo85wc6RGWpfalSNeJCw.text: This is probably one of the better meals I've had in my short trip to Las Vegas. Most meals look good but taste inauthentic in the city, but Grand Lux Cafe was a notable exception.   We had to order from the late night menu since we were eating in around 5 am. I had a Cappuccino and their Turkey and Brie Sandwich which was delicious! My friends got Omelettes which looked delicious too. The waiters are friendly and patient especially given the number of drunk patrons they have here.   One of the better places to dine in the Venetian buildings and might I say, the Las Vegas Strip.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Turkey and Brie Sandwich

ucp7j6oovuJQ7J3gpnFZRQ.text: Great service at Grand Lux. Had a late night supper at 3:30 am and the food and service was top notch. Vegas never sleeps and neither does Grand Lux because it's open 24 hours. 5 stars all day long and twice on Sunday.

Mj3GprAb_W9z7RLtQiBCpg.text: I have been coming to this cafe with my brother for years now, and, as of last night, it is still our absolute favorite Vegas spot!!  Open 24 hours like most Las Vegas casino cafes, this place offers all of the convenience of other cafes with an amazing and gourmet selection, outstanding service, and good value (compared to other places on the Strip). We have tried just about everything on the menu and NEVER have had a bad experience. The wait staff is always exceptionally helpful and professional, and the food cannot be matched!  MUST HAVE: Asian nachos off of their Appetizer menu. It comes on a gigantic platter so don't be fooled by the "Appetizer" label. My brother ONLY gets this every time we go and it is his favorite!  Also, their dessert menu consists of different cheesecakes straight from The Cheesecake Factory, among other scrumptious items. Save room for dessert!  There really are no bad items on the menu so try whatever looks good and you won't be disappointed!

T0EM4-QUTAzJ2UXTbRynOg.text: I can keep this short and simple: This is exactly like cheesecake factory (also owned by them). From the taste of food (which i like) to menu items to design to everything. Only difference is that they don't have a big selection of cheesecake. However it is really good, 24 hours (a plus), and less filled up. I can see myself coming here again.

x8GPkaExeor-6_aVHUTo3Q.text: This is a place that you wouldn't want to miss when you're staying in Vegas. They have a little bit of everything and their menu is huge. Highly recommended

_GDau_htl541-JfrQ3I6Ig.text: This is Grand Lux Cafe the morning after a great night! The line was long, but service was fast and very kind.  While two of us chose the all you can eat breakfast, the lesser men ordered fried chicken and waffle, and french toast.  The breakfast buffet is rather small, but yields some great surprises. Choice of the usual breakfast meat, waffle, scramble egg, omelet, pastry, toast juices and fruits. On the meat side, bottomless bacon and sausages are perfect!  The fried chicken and waffle was served with honey butter. The french toast is rather boring, but hey, we don't really care about these guys' opinions.   We love the endless breakfast, fast service, and very affordable check at the end.

LQZFL4cihuwBA4dU4YZHgw.text: Same owners as Cheesecake Factory (I used to work there!) and just as good.  The service is always great and the food is better!  Reasonably priced, especially for Vegas, and top quality ingredients.  The Grand Lux in Venetian is 24 hours, which is really nice, and there is another one in the connected Palazzo (not 24 hrs).  Try the short rib grilled cheese.  HOLY MOLY.

HdLZhXSTEV2gIRCZkN8jPQ.text: Really convenient since it is open 24/7 and we stayed at the Venetian. Came here for the happy hour. Really big portions for a great price. Some of the dishes were on the salty side, probably so you would order more drinks. The drinks were delicious. There are two Grand Lux Cafes. One in the Venetian and one in the Palazzo.

FkCErLHUNW80aQTk4psorQ.text: We came here for late night munchies, or early morning munchies, whatever you wanna call it. The service was quick and the server was quite funny for 4am chit chat. Their menu threw me off because it had so many Asian fusion items. For example, I only wanted regular nachos, but theirs was Asian Nachos.   We ended up going with the crispy spring rolls and the bbq chicken pizza. The pizza and spring rolls were pretty good, but  the spring rolls came with a bowl of carrots that we didn't know what to do with.

Wj6WZ6iUHj-VAXvoRoZp1g.text: Came here twice during the morning hours after long nights in Vegas.  It was open and convenient and has something for everyone.  The menu is extensive, although not as scary as a Cheesecake Factory menu, and the portions are big.  The breakfast items are a good deal, came with 3 eggs, hash browns, meats.  But there are also other things like noodles to sandwiches.   Service wasn't great my first morning, the waitress seemed a bit confused and wasn't attentive to our table.  Food also took a little while to come out and one of our orders came out wrong.  Even when we were switched to a new waiter things didn't quite improve.  On the second morning had a much better waitress and food came out a bit quicker.  Probably shouldn't expect too much at this time of day.    I don't think there is anything mind blowing on the menu, but it's decent grub when you need some food and they're open.  Variety on the menu let's you choose if you want breakfast/lunch/dinner.  Portions are good, price is medium.  It's definitely a decent option depending on what time of day it is and where you're staying.

qjhkCeFQdJhclli7kmO4gg.text: Came here for lunch. It was recommended by a security guy at the Venetian where we stayed for the weekend. Such an awesome place, good food, great service. I wish I remembered our waiters name. He deserves a raise. He was very helpful, nice, and funny. So glad service was fast because I came in here starving. I ordered the glazed salmon with mushrooms, artichoke, capers and steamed rice. It was delicious, just the right size for my hungry tummy :)  Highly recommended for the good food, service and reasonable price.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Glazed Salmon

XQanvQMyeee9mD1913XDTg.text: We tried their breakfast buffet. It's not a good value for the price.  No cheese in the menu. Strawberries was gone bad.  Orange juice was awsome, freshly squeezed and delicious

gvyJzxtnp7HbRr7ePRvUiQ.text: Reminds me a lot of The Cheesecake Factory with the extensive menu. Decided on splitting the pasta promanado with a side of spinach with my lovely dinner date.  There was plenty of seating and great hosts and servers.  The sourdough bread was another favorite get a second order with a pasta.

QGh3Y0dJFqW1C2at-l66sA.text: more like a 3.62135/5 stars.  this restaurant very similar to cheesecake factory, in fact i believe its owned by cheesecake factory.  so if you like CF, then this place will feel like home to you.  its located right next to the elevators for the rooms on the casino floor at the venetian.  We wanted to start off with an appetizer and went ahead and ordered the  Double Stuffed Potato Spring Roll.  it came out hot, and was pretty guud.  however for the 8 bucks, i do not think it was totally worth it.  you get about 8 small pieces of just hot potatoes stuffed inside egg rolls.  meh.     We also ordered the Salmon with brown rice and the Pulled pork with side salad.  Both dishes were good.  The salmon dish was creamy and there were sizable chunks of salmon in there. as for the pulled pork, from what i remember it was delicious.  i think the bread was a bit hard, but whateverz.   the server was nice and super attentive.  you'll see a lot of drunk peeps here past midnight.  lol.  make sure to give everyone high fives, since strangers love that.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pulled pork with side salad
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon with brown rice

7Z6ugCDFCMbrh_TI5v28UA.text: Perfect restaurant. Good quality to a really fair price. I had salat, chicken. Every time you get warm bread. Delicious. Go there.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

m3I2XVRvgRHt0isAseGFyA.text: Came here twice during my trip to Vegas. That says something! The prices are so reasonable and the portions are very generous! The small/almost big plates are the normal size plates in NYC. They had a great menu, everything looked great! I love the fish of the day where you get two sides. I had trout with a side of sauteed mushroom and sauteed spinach. So yummy! Wish they have this in NYC! Definitely stop by. It's inside the Venetian Casino.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jimbalaya chicken and shrimp
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Almost big plate-market fish and garlic shrimp

Uj0q9tAq02s7vCrNV9Mg1w.text: Average option for brunch. They didn't screw anything up like eggs, but nothing that stood out. Friendly service. Slightly overpriced. I still can't believe it took $1000 of losing at craps to earn enough comps to eat a brunch here. :(

WPTGxmH2hWBZcZlHlQdmCw.text: This place is very awful!! Our server was very unprofessional and treated us differently based on our skin color. Everyone around us got different treatment and their food before us (even though they sat down after us). It was very poor and they treat people differently. The manager on duty didn't even really care when I approached her with my experience. The food was cold when we got it and terrible. I WILL NOT be returning ever. I know Grand Luxe Cafe to have excellent service and food but this time it was no where near what I knew it to be. I DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS PLACE AT ALL TO ANYONE.

ktWhE1g7dFVd9tfxVZ_7jg.text: Food: 4.0 Ambiance: 3.5 Food/Price: 2.5  Got classic vegas steak and eggs and it was surprisingly delicious some of the best cooked hashbrowns I've had and even the steak which looked a little low rent was incredibly juicy...20$ tho so typical vegas priciness

OmtG2Fzy5lKPIXriAW88AA.text: On the upside; -food was great! (Got the chicken and waffles) -great ranch and BBQ sauce! -clean -did not get charged when I had to change my order after it was made -manager offered me some more bread while I waited for my food to be corrected, very kind  On the downside; -out waiter this particular day was exhausted and thus the service lacked , not to mention we had to look at our food  for 5 min because he forgot to give us silverware   Overall do recommend. Their menu is great and has a great variety. The burgers are huge and the salmon is awesome!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken and waffles

0qt7COzoKDRpDVFa7k4XKA.text: This place is amazing I had the chicken piccata and it was amazing, the chicken was so very, very tender and the taste was so delicious. I have to say this place reminded me of the Cheesecake Factory but kicked up another level.  The menu is extensive like the cheesecake factory but the food is on point and very good.  My hubby had the rib-eye steak and it was so tender and juicy.  I can't find the descriptive words to make you want to try this place but it is so very good and you wouldn't want to miss the amazing taste for a really great price.  The amount of food is really great as well.

rG61LvcRJyBStzhSCQ3fmA.text: Good service and a fair menu. The best thing I've tried is the chicken mushroom soup. It is absolutely delicious!

FB0_Fs7y2uYq4w18vdiBjw.text: My favorite location is the restaurant located at the palazzo however due to their running out of several dishes and bread that was available at the Venitian location (they would not suggest or bring bread ) we opted to switch for the grand lux at Venitian....overall very noisy could hear the kitchen employees calling and yelling at each other and washing dishes too  although there was background music at the restaurant ....definitely took away from our conversation and enjoyment.  As far as the order the butternut squash cream soup was good the main course dishes were  barely warm  not hot at all and cooled fast. Definitely will re consider which location to visit next time.

vDDPmfMnTCyU3ah6J1NUZw.text: I heard a lot about the Asian nachos that were offered here so I had to go and try them out for myself. My friend ordered the nachos while I went for something more to my liking. They were very unique with a great mixture of different things (rice in nachos?). It was a little too strong peanuts flavor for my taste but I can understand what all the hype is about.   I wasn't blown away but still pleased with the meal. Large portions and an attentive waiter always makes things better. Everyone should go and try the nachos at least once for themselves.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ba0mBDkdsmblFXqLfLzM1Q.text: A group of friends and I were in the mood to pass the time and talk so we were looking for a place to grab coffee and desserts. It was in-between lunch and dinner so we thought the Grand Lux would be suitable for this. It met our needs perfectly. The waiter was cool with our plans and made sure to recommend some great desserts for our sweet teeth.   I got the molten lava cake which is a chocoholics dream. The vanilla ice cream is necessary to cut through the richness of the chocolate. The apple pie my friend got was more like an apple tart which she ended up liking better than if it was in traditional pie form. Since our group was from New Orleans we got a kick out of seeing beignets on the menu so of course we had to order some. About half of us thought the beignets were pretty decent, but not to be compared to a New Orleans beignet which are not as doughy and never served with sauces. That being said, their version of it was still pretty good so we aren't knocking them. The coffee was also good and strong which was the perfect pick me up we all needed.   Our server was cool and probably one of the more friendly servers we had in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Apple pie more like an apple tart
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Qg0lUSi4MkUbXIdlTsNGCg.text: Another great meal here.  The chicken parmesan is awesome.  Thank you Nestor for making our experience great.  Even though he was very busy Nestor was very attentive, accommodating and always smiled and looked me in the eye.

dZp3d9eaPdLLsO7zayKnCw.text: BAkED POTATO EGG ROLLS!!!!!! Burgers are great with actually the turkey burger standing out the most. Quality meal on the strip for around 20 bucks per head

60CqqCGa7WOtNH_SCowz-g.text: SUMMARY: Uninspiring cafe located in the midst of the frenzy of casinos in the Venetian. Food was terrible and expensive. I can't believe this is part of the Cheesecake Factory franchise -- their quality has really declined through the years. The servers seemed friendly but really wish one of them would have warned us to STAY AWAY from this place.   Rumour has it the Cafe on the Palazzo side is better. I have no idea. Play it safe and don't approach this franchise.  VERDICT: I would not return here, and I would not recommend eating here during your time in Vegas.   ITEMS ORDERED: (1) Turkey BLT with sweet potato fries -- my mom ordered this and liked the fries. However, the sandwich itself was not good. Cold wet turkey on some untoasted OLD bread in a sandwich that fell apart upon first bite. Dry, tasteless, and was about $14... are you kidding? (2) Margherita pizza -- ha ha HA... this is not a pizza. It was thin, wet (???), and tasteless. Remember those rectangular pizzas they served you in grade school? Imagine flattening it to about half a milimetre thick and then popping it quickly in your toaster oven to give it a "crisp". It was bad and I finished eating it out of the sheet guilt of not paying for my meal.  (3) Breakfast sandwich -- my sister ordered this. It seemed okay and she didn't complain about it. But honestly, I think I've said all I wanted to say and would recommend you to steer clear of this place.

s7tqEcihtRsOQ4b4juKVMA.text: Stopped in here last week with my girlfriend after the Wynn buffet was over an hour and we needed to eat. Walked into The Venetian and instantly went into Grand Lux Cafe. We were starving so I ordered the Spicy Flat Bread Chicken Sandwich, which was fantastic. The service was a bit slow that night even though it was not very busy but our waiter was extremely friendly. This place is a great if you want a sit-down but casual meal!

bDP6a2pQkpFA1VvKOM--3g.text: A great restaurant in the Venetian Hotel. They have two of them in this resort and have been there for several years. Very decorative & comfortable ambience. If you're looking for a restaurant with a lot of variety, that serves big portions for a very reasonable price, AND tastes awesome, then this is your place!! Everything I tasted here was fantastic! With the portions they serve, for me, I can make two meals out of one...almost three! I highly recommend it. The service is also friendly and very accommodating.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Half rack baby back ribs
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken parmesan with side pasta
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Garlic chicken with mashed potatoes and garden vegetables... Tastes amazing!

5gDK-EHD-rk4xBYu5ZTWkA.text: Grand Lux has been a staple at the Venetian (and Palazzo) forever. Owned by Cheesecake Factory, their menu is quite expansive and nearly everything here is satisfying.   For me, this place has a little bit of built in nostalgia. My wife and I used to sneak here when we were dating (and she was my boss...well, she still is the boss). Usually we'd hit up Grand Lux around 1am for some late night eats.  Nowadays things are a little different. We're a party of 3, and Grand Lux is great since it's a super family friendly spot and loud enough that if a meltdown does ensue, the entire restaurant doesn't turn around to look at you.
