Fortunately, on our most recent visit the little man was on his best behavior. We ordered the kids Grilled Cheese and were shocked with how large it was. UUUUUGE. Enough for two kiddo's to share. AND, it was really, really good. My long standing staple item is the Santa Barbara chicken sandwich. Grilled chicken, pepper jack cheese, and avocado on a hamburger bun. So good. Side dishes are decent. I got a house salad, which came with a vinaigrette. It was so-so.   Pricing, given the location on the strip, is really reasonable. $13-16 for most sandwiches. Pasta dishes & entrees a tad more expensive. Given the location, quality of food and service (very good), I definitely think Grand Lux is one of the better values on the strip.

3u4hjQQWZu3B18RhyIbk3w.text: We stay at the palazzo every month .. we have a huge family and our kids love being here I also , love the customer service at the palazzo - but when it comes to this restaurant there is zero customer service . They messed up my order 3 days straight , no apologies -  the guy just throws you the food, and when I come back to fix my orders .. no apologies - nothing .Wow, when you spend good money / time to stay at a prestigious hotel , you would think that the affiliated restaurants would have the same courtesy or values as it's establishment . Please check your food before you leave , our family has thrown away money on their "To Go" service . I called the manager and instead of "fixing" it he thought I was calling the wrong location . Very defensive. Get rid of the horrible employees there , there no need for that in the customer service industry . We are changing hotels after this .

v66U9AW1hF-fcZKX6_2cnQ.text: Fantastic place for breakfast. Line moved very, very quickly. Service was amazing. None in my party ordered the buffet, let's be real Vegas buffets are not the legends they once were! We each had different entrees all were amazing. Massive portions, endless coffee! This is a must stop!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Huevos rancheros!

NKOVLER2q2nnfE72D7--0A.text: I have missed this place so much. This was one of my favorite spots when it was in LA. I literally had been going since the week had opened and went countless times since. Why it closed, it beyond me! It always brought it a nice crowd.   When in Vegas, this place is a must! I was a bit sad to see the chicken lasagna not on the menu. That was one of my fav items. I went to my other go to item...shrimp scampi with pasta. Just as delicious as I remembered. The chocolate chip cookies are still phenomenal.   Please come back to Cali!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tahitian Pineapple
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp and Chicken Scampi

hnzKM-E3MbLYZPW5V9686w.text: Food poisoning! My husband was throwing up all night. Vacation ruined. He spent all day in bed  He had the pork chop

AiPH11bvVpzkiTrPxX6efw.text: Nothing special here.  Stay away from the pizza. It was just a sad rectangle and nothing close to an actual pizza. The volcano shrimp was popcorn shrimp with some spicy aioli. Tasty but boring. The skillet mac and cheese was just ok.  Wish there was some lobster or bacon added to it.   Meh.

wKLJMXBcVYj4_siqQx5vOQ.text: I was honestly extremely disappointed with my negative experience at this restaurant. We arrived with a large group of 15 and were quoted a 45 minute wait time. After a large wait time, we were seated only to hear that they were out of many of their items, including (but not limited to) many of their seafood dishes, meat dishes, Alfredo sauce, etc. This is something a restaurant should let you know of before you wait a full hour to be seated. Reluctantly, we ordered different food than we initially wanted. They brought a Caesar salad for us earlier and although it tasted good, it came served three pieces of lettuce with some breadcrumbs on it. I don't understand why you are allowed to pay $15 for a salad that comes that you have to chop yourself. My husband sat there chopping the salad with a butter knife because they didn't even have good enough service so that we could ask for a better knife. After 30 minutes of waiting, our waiter comes to tell us she made a mistake about the ingredients in one of our dishes (it had pork even though we stated we had religious restrictions that would stop us from eating pork) and they ran out of the Mahi Mahi that was in FIVE of our foods. Essentially, 5 people couldn't get their food anymore. I genuinely don't understand why they waited 30 minutes in to tell us that they ran out of one of the main things we ordered. Even though they have a sister restaurant in the next hotel over which is literally a five minute walk they weren't willing to accommodate us and bring food from over there so we had to end up getting up and leaving after a night of starvation. The manager was not helpful at all and we ended up being so disappointed.   We will never return to this place. Such a disappointment considering everything we've heard about grand lux.

qHnWGl29yazol9zOQhna_g.text: I decided to give this place a try since the reviews were so good. I guess it depends on what you order. I had the biscuits and gravy with scrambled eggs. Everything was tasty minus the potatoes. I personally feel like the dish doesn't need the potatoes, I mean they weren't even seasoned which blows. But anywho, the sausage gravy was very hearty and tasty. My fiance had the french toast which is enough food for two people and he didn't like it at all.....bummer. I wouldn't mind trying this place out again, without him of course because he's just gonna watch me eat and that's no fun.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Biscuits and Gravy

w13CWRZePoenNN7Ypmt6Iw.text: This place is situated inside The Venetian and they have two locations inside. This place is great for breakfast between 6am-11am. There are better options elsewhere for lunch but the Grand lux takes the cake for breakfast.

GEjU4hdM2rPP6gx2zhpb5w.text: Moderately priced and came for lunch today.  Food was good, A very fresh crisp green salad with rocket lettuce, frisee, batavia lettuces, small fresh grape tomatoes, dressed in a premium olive oil light balsamic. A Side of mushroom barley soup, Sparkling Lemon Mint Cooler with ,Lemon, Lime, Agave and Soda was delish, worth it, refreshing light and tangy, presentation nice on the beverage. Adequate on other food items. Painless to place your order and pay and be out of the door.  Atmosphere is large, expansive what you expect on the Strip in a large casino.  Three stars because I like the Lemon Mint Cooler.

WJyGW0S7uKEakO9KKRN5rw.text: I travel from Dana point to Vegas often. The only place I have food at is this location. My 2 favorite dishes are chicken piccata and cafe beef Wellington

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

L1nhXbMTfobrGAReLzsc2A.text: Went here for breakfast. I had the churro French toast and it was amazing! I'm a total French toast snob and this did not disappoint. I'll be back again in May and definitely plan to come back. I docked a star as service was just okay and I was charged $5 for a tea bag and some hot water, I know it's Vegas but come on.

lIi1toq186bCbhH4mUSOww.text: omg the best over the top buffet I have ever had!! Let me just say I hate going to buffets but my husband loves to go, so yes I gave in and we went. Well I was not disappointed at all!!!  Don't get me wrong this is not a huge buffet but it's quality food and what they do have is cooked to perfection, they have an omelette bar yummy also the home made chicken and waffles are to die for of course I over loaded my plates yes plates only because everything they do have is like Home made reminded me of my moms cooking  and to my surprise fresh squeezed orange juice WOW!! Amazing and the server kept it coming to top it off I had to try the sweets once agin they did not disappoint me at all they were fabulous!  This little restaurant is a must!  Housekeeping everything is clean nice bar and all the employees are very nice friendly and helpful please don't forget to tip the very nice man behind the omelette bar. Now that we discovered this place we won't to come back soon and bring our family to try this restaurant  Thank you team lux hope to see you soon

snh_jTA2joKOPiLSkPV1wQ.text: This place is the only reason why I like staying at the Venetian. It's opened 24 hours and the food is really good!! I will be back! :)  What I Ordered: - Grand Club Sandwich - Caesar Side Salad - Fries  I really enjoyed the caesar salad the most out of my meal haha. Dressing was on point!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grand club sandwich with a Caesar side salad

5_u4cJMsMkvNitVTnMECjQ.text: Here for a conference busy in this area but food is great they give u a lot.. will definitely return

fcSeb5JCsKdMeoeczK_zZA.text: 3.5 stars, but they get 4 from me since the grilled chicken was super juicy!  My friends and I came here around 9:30pm to grab dinner before clubbing. It took about 10 minutes to be seated, which wasn't bad considering it was extremely packed. It took awhile for our food to arrive, so this may not be the place to dine if you are in a hurry to get somewhere.  We saw how large the portions were, so my friend and I shared the Pasta with Grilled Chicken, Tomato, Basil & Mozzarella. The grilled chicken wasn't dry at all. I was surprised at how juicy it was considering it was white meat! I couldn't finish even though we shared. Definitely kept me full the rest of the night.  Yelp reviews said this was the sister restaurant of The Cheesecake Factory, so we kept comparing the two. I think I like this one better! We saw the next table's Shrimp Scampi and that looked absolutely delicious! Dine here if you want good quality and portions for the price!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pasta with grilled chicken, tomato, basil &amp; mozzarella

ej21jDa4n-E--jY4xclzxQ.text: Fantastic Happy Hour - 4-6pm Weekdays for $5.50 you get a passion fruit margarita that will make you very happy!  In addition, the chicken lettuce wraps and eggrolls are SO delicious.  LOVE the sliders!  The meat is tender, perfectly seasoned and they give you pickles and tomatoes to go with.

DD7JF4G-JLQr9Pqcke1l3w.text: Terrible I don't know if it was a race thing or what but first my sister points to jambalaya on the dinner menu the server asked did u want lunch or dinner portion. My sister asked her if it was the same. The server continued with it's the same thing just smaller portion. It came out and was only chicken and my sister asked where was the shrimp. The server Susan R said u didn't specify chicken or shrimp. My sister isn't confrontational so she didn't say much. But said she was never asked before on chicken or shrimp because it is Cajun chicken and shrimp jambalaya. So the server tells her she will make another one. The the manger comes over and ask what happen? My sister proceeds to tell where the disruption in communication could have happened and the manager walks away before she even finishes like she wasn't interested in the story, but does say well They rushed to bring a new one.  We orders cookies the lady said they take 30 minutes. They came out hard and cold mine were slightly warm but hard . The manager explained that the cookies come out that way and they let them sit to cool down. Some were burnt. So your telling me you send out slightly burnt cold cookies? I continued to tell her how I was here I was here on the 1st and had better service better cookies and she dismissed it and started walking away before my sister could ask for another. We didn't even get bread to the table until we asked for it and it came with food. I've been looking around watching people get bread right away and Susan Has continued to check on them and we weren't getting that same service we got half her attention because she didn't even care to bring bread or explain that the dinner and lunch portions are different entirely. I won't be coming back here. This is located on the strip there should be better service.  I asked the manager if the difference in the service was based on race and she immediately shut me down. She said no. Yet myself and I are the only ones of a different race not being treated the same. No one asked if we needed boxes, how the food was, if we needed anything else. It was like pulling teeth. We present with a clean appearance. We have manners. Went to college. There is nothing outward that is different than our skin colors but we were served after people that arrived after us. We are still sitting here writing this review while other people have come and gone and we are still waiting on the server to bring back the check.  This is horrible customer service.

j8dm24EWwjNSs1OKY791yg.text: Went to breakfast there and it was not a disappointment. Not only did the menu look great, but the buffet was amazing. Food was awesome, service was great, and the atmosphere was nice. Whenever I may come back to Vegas, I will certainly go there again.

Z7oH_M5CUJN4-sKHsn2n-w.text: Great breakfast buffet and made to order omelet. Our server Kathryn A was the BEST. So personable and responsive. Great way to start the day

UyrXc9yk6VstyOsHkrA9OQ.text: The simple convenience of having such an establishment right downstairs from our room was awesome. It's not some rinkydink place either! Imagine the Cheesecake Factory... with a different name. Boom. The huge menu, the vaulted decorative ceilings and the ability to see right into the kitchen. All the same. It was awesome. The fist time I went I had the lunch buffet for $26.00 and it was well worth it. You can have an omelette made custom for you or a pasta. There was a lot of options to choose from. The 2nd time I came it was late night and had a plethora of appetizers before going to gamble which consisted of the chicken bites, duck triangles, and a few other things. I'll continue to come here whenever I stay in the Palazzo.

ovGUoJBUGc4oyZuXx8Fhfw.text: Stopped into the bar for Sunday breakfast and was able to beat the brunch crowd. I ordered the blood orange mimosa and the beignets. The mimosa was really refreshing and def recommend after a night of drinking. The flavor was amazing and my favorite drink I had in Vegas. The beignets will have you coming back each time you're in town. They come in a shareable quantity with a variety of dipping sauces. The caramel was my fave! These beignets are made fresh at time of order and melt in your mouth. I'll be craving them until my next time in Vegas!

40ipEvS-sP_kwlMAvHQmZA.text: Never had an issue here. Great, fresh, consistent food.  My regular is the buffalo chicken bites and loaded baked potato egg rolls with a dilche de leche cheesecake. All perfect to share in a pretty nice environment.  Was once in a nightly show at the theater next door, so ate here a ton and will def be back.

CmCgo3HIqT9kXYSUJJpp5Q.text: Without a doubt, the BEST ribs that I've ever eaten! I'm a local and a few months ago, I went with some friends to the Venetian. I didn't know what to expect when they said that they wanted to eat at a cafe versus the steakhouse. I ordered the ribs. The ribs were phenomenal!  They were so good that I have been wanting to return here ever since. Well finally over the weekend, I was in the area running errands ( go figure, running errands near the strip). I was solo for the day and treated myself to more ribs. Once again, they were cooked perfectly. Service was fast and friendly. The server as well as another server engaged in minor chit-chat with me every time they came by the table. I plan on returning here in a few weeks and take the entire family for a night out. No special occasion. I just want to enjoy delicious food.

TaxSRhxyHxwfjWAazY9OSA.text: Yummy place inside the venetian. I was staying there, so what seemed like unlimited food options were quite overwhelming the first day. I came here for a lunch before I got checked in. When you sit at the bar and look young, expect to get carded. In fact, expect to get carded everywhere.   Grand Lux can get a little busier during breakfast/lunch then dinner. The options are endless. And they are open 24/7. I opted for a chicken soup and a steak sandwich with fries. All good/standard for a lunch. I like the ambiance and the service was spot on. They are very polite and fast but not pushy.   Good choice if you are staying in the venetian. I don't know/think I'd go out of my way to get here.

IyoR0CO8knOspdLU2cF1DA.text: A friend recommended this place, and omg. It was our first stop in vegas and probably our favorite. We were told we had to get the Asian nachos and they were just as amazing as we thought. We wanted the pastrami Reuben egg rolls but they were out...so we got duck triangles (amazing) and mac&cheese (delectable). We almost went twice in the two days we were there.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Asian nachos

Rhm-z8jqNRCNAqDE0-Vjgw.text: Stopped in for a light lunch.  Had the seafood salad - lump crab, shrimp, avocado, etc. and iced tea.  Service was a bit slow, hence 4 stars.  But overall, nice atmosphere and the seafood was fresh.

0nOmn8kUp0h1Ez1FRGUBnw.text: Service is slow AF on a Monday ... And my straws never came lolzzz.  However the food is good chicken pot pie bomb the crust is puff pastry with a creamy pot pie filling and the pasta sundried tomatoes and mushrooms will not disappoint.  If you like mixed drinks the margarita and calypso mojito tall drinks are good as well.  Just don't come on a Monday -_-

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken pot pie bombbbbayyyy crispy puffy pastry nomzzzz
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Margarita and Calypso Mojito .. Why not on a Monday lolzzz
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pasta with sundried tomatoes and mushrooms pretty good

k_JEflAgWXXNxaxjbBPfQw.text: The bartender Lina S. was extremely rude tonight. My husband and I sat at the bar and Lina gave us a very bad vibe from the beginning. Her demeanor was irritable and not personable. We asked for clean plates after she gave us dirty plates and without saying a single word, Lina grabbed our plates and started making someone else's drink. After making a few drinks, and again without saying a single word, Lina tosses two plates in front of us. So I asked to speak to a manager. Her response was, "Sure" and she goes back to making drinks. So I stood up and walked to find a manager myself. The manager asked if I wanted to be moved to a table instead, I said no because my husband wanted to watch the game, which is why we sat at the bar from the beginning. He went over to speak to Lina, but after he left, she still remained unpleasant. We merely came to have dinner and watch the game, not to be irritant Lina. Very disappointed in my dining experience.

KG6kRDb7ASEYKfNuvEPikg.text: We were staying in the Venetian and tried the Grand Lux Cafe.  There was no wait and the service and food was spectacular.  We left overly content with the service and the presentation of our food.

rrsB9c0n81LkWXM5DL-LqQ.text: You would think the is expensive because it's right on the casino floor, but it's reasonably cheap for Vegas standards and damn good

u0Nc2zrPlWMH0BAb6GX6TA.text: First time visit and it was fantastic!!! Brian, our server was absolutely by far, the best waiter I've ever experienced. I think it was 70% his personality alone and 30% training. Either way... he was amazing the food was amazing and Brian stood out from the crowd! Truly amazing experience. We will be back for sure!! Brian! Brian! Brian! He needs a raise!!!

ltYGuYrlhhBLfXQNu1aGVA.text: Came here on a Tuesday night and sat at the bar where a very nice bartender named Tina served me immediately. Thoroughly enjoyed my warm grilled chicken salad and passion fruit/ginger mocktail (pictures attached). Salad was perfectly dressed--not too much dressing/not too dry. The chicken was well seasoned too!  Bonus for the five stars: I'm not a drinker so the long mocktail drink options were a welcome surprise!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Passion fruit/ginger mocktail. How pretty!
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Warm grilled chicken salad

_rIpgmx9XZQTDkAAIQ7yaw.text: Listen my fellow YELPERS.  I have to work in Las Vegas quite often and I don't have to tell you that if you eat on the "Strip" or anywhere close by, you're gonna get financially gouged, whether the food and service were good or not. Not here!   There is no doubt that I go out of my way to eat off the "Strip" because I can and I know lots of great places but today three co-worker said let's just stay in the hotel and eat and I obliged him, now I want to kick myself in the ass for not knowing about this restaurant/s before.   Our server tonight was ( Brian S ) and he was outstanding. We are four, very seasoned guys and all of our dishes were great and the portions were more than you'll even need and to top it off the prices were low, shockingly lower than expected.  They have an extensive menu and I was watching food go by to other tables and everything looked great. A must for YELPERS!   Do it!

DjZL-Cp1Ld7iY9-U1-H1hw.text: A huge restaurant. The menu is extensive. Their veggie burger was sooo good and really really big. The service was friendly. I have no complaints!

BPJLngyxpFAYO64ovBS-1A.text: I think this is owned by Cheesecake Factory? If not, it's EXACTLY like Cheesecake Factory. If you like it there, you will like it here. Same dishes (although I dont think they have all the cheesecakes), same overall menu and look to the restaurant.  I ordered what I usually order at Cheesecake--the miso glazed salmon lunch special! Alway good and filling. Huge portions, even for the lunch size.   Apparently they have a weekend brunch that goes until about 12pm, but they keep the food out until 12:30pm. If you're interested in getting a full breakfast while at the Venetian, this is the place to go.  We opted just to order from the normal menu.  The place is huge, servers are quick and free bread at the beginning, delicious. Great spot for a causal served meal. Happy to say they did have some veggie friendly menu items as well. I think I will try to tofu next time!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lunch portion of miso salmob

_exDudaw9Tm8G8cgscNbHg.text: The food is very bang for your buck. Everything is good, not gourmet flavors but definitely solid good food with great tastes and worth every penny. So we came here a few times this week. The omelets were good very mediocre but tasty large quantity garden omelet. I had the pizza which was good but has a little bit of a fake taste. The salmon burger was amazing, I had the bbq salmon which is what I highly recommend most and give 5 stars to very fresh with great flavors! Also recommend the spinach and cheese dip very tasty. The mac and cheese was alittle of a let down for me because it's very basic. I would say all the food is 3.5 and salmon is a 5/5! I recommend going for sure if you haven't . Also open 24/7 which you can't beat

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 4 cheese pizza was good not as fresh tasting but still great. The salmon burger was tasty. Although my favorite was the salmon dishes
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Garden omelette with egg whites. Basic/good

Ml_TuQuxWFmS4C8QaDKCog.text: Grand Lux Cafe seems like the go-to place for everyone staying at the Venetian. It is conveniently open 24 hours and is reasonably priced.   My group of 4 came here for breakfast after a night of partying. There wasn't a wait, and the restaurant is huge with plenty of seating. Does feel kinda grand inside. The overall look, especially with the orange lighting, is reminiscent of Cheesecake Factory, which is owned by the same company.   The highlight of our meal was the exceptional service we got from our waiter, Mike. He was friendly and personable and checked up on us regularly. I don't usually take note of server's names (although I should start to), so that means he did a really good job.  I ordered the corned beef hash that comes with two eggs and hashbrowns. The corned beef had just the right amount of fattiness. The sunny side up eggs were cooked perfectly with the yolks still runny. And potatoes are always a must for me for breakfast. The portions are pretty big, so we all ended up taking leftovers back to our room. The only con about the dish was that it was a tad too oily and greasy, which made me feel a little nauseous towards the end. But the rest of their menu sounds promising. Will definitely be back whenever we stay at the Venetian or Palazzo!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Corned beef hash (4.5/5)

l0yTmfsIR-hnfHXxiKjRhw.text: What can I say.. Been here a hundred times by this point and not a single time have I been unhappy with the food. Yes its a familiar  menu to anyone that has that one restaurant that serves 60 things (looking at you cheese cake factory) and yes its not the most luxurious unique restaurant. But dammit this food is always fantastic! Another great affordable(relative to Vegas) restaurant that serves a wide array of choices, so good luck thinking you don't have an option.   I can never go wrong with the Cobb salad here. I know it's a Cobb salad how can you screw than up but at the same time how can you make it that great. Well they just do! Whether it's the Panchetta these use in lew of bacon, or just the sheer size of this thing I don't know I don't question because it's good for the 30th time in a row. I've had many different sandwiches here and you just can't go wrong. The appetizers are always spot on, heck even the drinks are good here... Now where can this place go wrong right? Well...  So the service... Listen I can look past a lot of things when the food is good at any restaurant. Which is why this place still gets a 4 star because dammit the consistency is just unreal how good it always is. But the service...they are always pleasant and nice but they can be slow to check on you or bring your food. A lot of these things are pieces of the puzzle and I'm sure is not just one person's fault. Just don't except to be able to come here and get out quickly is all I'm saying.  Grand Luxe is worth the walk if you are saving a few dollars... It's not going to wow you with atmosphere, it's not going to blow you away with service and handcrafted organic offerings.. But it will blow you away with the quality and how much you just paid.. Just go folks you won't be disappointed

xT-IgVpY6VqP4xRiE2EamQ.text: Wow. This restaurant is great. It's open 24 hours a day, for breakfast, lunch, dinner. My family & I went here to have a late birthday dinner for my mom (around 12am) and were seated in about 10 mins. The servers were very polite and helpful.  I ordered the Belgian Waffles with strawberries and that had me full right away so portion size was exact.  My sister ordered the chicken waffles & when I had a bite of her chicken, YES. The batter perfectly coated the chicken and gave it a good crisp.  My mother ordered the chicken caesar salad. I'm a bit upset because I wish I ordered it. It was so good. The chicken was grilled & gave it that "taste" that was just right. The croutons were to die for! I'm just sad that there wasn't a lot.  My brother ordered steak. Very pricy & he it wasn't cooked the way he wanted but he was so hungry he ate it. All he had was the steak and a side of vegetables for almost $30.  My other brother ordered eggs & steak and he ended up with a bigger steak than my other brother for about $11-17 I believe. He had way more on his platter and left more satisfied.  My father had ordered the breakfast with salmon and he liked it very much.   They were also very helpful and able to surprise our mother with a simple HappyBirthday dish.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

guxz-TuZWf3r97Je0Ub_0Q.text: I dined here many years ago.  Last week my family and I were in town and opted to dine here for lunch.  We were immediately seated and had the most attentive service I have had in a long time.  Everything was delicious.  The bread and butter is yummy and all our lunch items were perfectly prepared.  As I mentioned, our server was extremely friendly and charming.  I know this is owned by the Cheesecake Factory.  Their menu has some of the same items, but it's not quite as large.  We walked away very pleased with service, quality and value and will definitely return when visiting Vegas.

tfUKDloQXw71O4Xq5IujcA.text: Had the most amazing patty melt there. Food was fairly cheap for where the restaurant was located. I went with two other friends and we all were raving about the food while eating it, which rarely happens.   Our server Linda was really friendly and attentive. Next time I'm in Vegas I'd like to pay another visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The patty melt pre-demolishment.
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. They actually had vanilla vodka so I got to have a vanilla vodka coke!

J_UIwJe-G423adjR-trb2A.text: I can only review breakfast, but it was amazing! I had strawberry Belgium waffles and the strawberries were great and fresh! And the waffle was perfect! There was powdered sugar on the waffle (I'll add a photo) that was perfect to add to the strawberries. The place was also very accommodating to my severe allergies.   My sister and mom also loved their meals as well and we will definitely come back for breakfast during this week!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Belgium waffle with strawberries

MzTPVzMpMFOO2njuArHYGw.text: Amanda our server is great!food is a bit salty i ordee the shrimp pasta,thebaby back rib is very good,its just the a long waiting for the food to come out

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

gLw2le1x0fPpjCCJG3IKGA.text: This place is always one of the best restaurants in Las Vegas. I've been here plenty of times and it always impresses me.

BrM2qRut-bK4XJ84NszeNw.text: My family came to grand lux for complimentary continental breakfast as part of travel package. We each received a bowl of chopped fruit salad, 3 assorted small pastries, coffee/tea.   Fruit salad consisted of chopped honeydew, cantaloupe, pineapple, watermelon, and strawberry. Pastries included muffin, Danish, cinnamon roll, or croissant. Even though they were all tasty treats, I wished we were allowed to choose the type of given pastries. (Since I'm not a big fruit jam person, any fruit based pastries meant stealing the cinnamon roll or chocolate croissant off my parents' or husband's plate instead)!   Overall - complimentary fruits and pastries  - although a good morning start for our stomach, definitely don't see ourselves paying out of pocket for the meal. Lots of more interesting, tastier options on the strip.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Continental breakfast complimentary

mmX0iFrgkP6NPM1eEaUIIQ.text: Great assortment of quality foods. Very similar to Cheesecake Factory. A lot to choose from but all of the food is great quality. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Also, great location for Casino people watching at The Venetian.   Assortment of pasta's, salads, and even breakfast foods. I went with the Chicken Lettuce wraps which were good. Very similar to PF Chang's.   Great overall choice in regards to food.

mlZDJAcZimTv98jrmUg1Eg.text: This place has an amazing breakfast buffet. A good variety of meats(bacon was really good), breads and pastries. Amazing freshly squeezed orange juice and freshly cut fruits were the highlight for me.   Worth the money. :)

zXCLNmKhPPWK-0LkkXyqfg.text: Our server Vanessa was very polite and super sweet! She helped us through the menu when we were super indecisive. The mini crispy fish tacos are to die for! They were super crunchy and delicious. The french fries had some nice crunchy one but also had some really tough over cooked ones. Glad we decided to come, over server made up for the bad fries.

Eq9W6K-ecED58USEZ8w81Q.text: Truly amazing at any time. 24/7 So much to chose from and the staff is so service oriented. Even the to-go area is fantastic. Packed to perfection and much much less expensive than room service. Use your gold Grazie club and jump the line.

xuNTeAZp_SGVqWp8fVmU6g.text: So many choices when you are in Vegas, we always stay at The Venetian so the Grand Lux is our go to when we are hungry. The food is always delicious. My favorite is their shrimp scampi. I know have my hubby hooked on it. We had the breakfast buffet this morning. Delicious fruit, omelet station, waffles, and a bunch more. The most delicious fresh squeezed Orange juice.

gpSaz5ve5aqKAOnZtciyYQ.text: This is my favorite place to order Huevos Rancheros. I like that it's made with crispy tortillas and every thing about it is delicious. The very best I have had. The sauce is outstanding! This is not an ordinary Huevos Rancheros. Not typical at all. Try it. Even the employees rave about it.

28cXB7QuZtgDY_elQQXd5A.text: One of my very favorite spots to hit up, open very very late night. Every dish is delicious. Owned by Cheesecake Factory, same style, very large menu with so many options!  Best Shrimp Scampi I've ever had.  Their Asian nachos are also delightful. And if you are into garlic get their fries with their garlic ranch.  Yummy cocktails.  Very reasonably priced.  Breakfast is excellent too.  There's a second location at the Palazzo casino next door as well.   Just GO!

ECsB16QdExexlsMIwVlRYA.text: I went in for the breakfast and I had the best customer service. I will always visit this restaurant because there are so many delicious entrees and we are always given excellent customer service. Great waiting staff

qV08AAQy8Y0xgH_pP47ZSw.text: Ok so the Asian nachos are pretty much the best thing that ever happened to me lol!!! (Memoirs of a foody) so many options in this restaurant ! I can never remember which location is 24 hours but either way they are both open late to satisfy cravings at any hour of the night !!! If you haven't tried Asian nachos you haven't lived yet !!!!

VlvlVIpB83Q9CpHmDg0p3w.text: I always come here every time I come to Vegas and they never fail me with the food they have.  Open 24 hours a day which is good and have a variety of food from pastas, chicken, salads, sandwiches, wraps, and so much more.  the service is fast and friendly.

U5wjz9YhSJgij5nGU5I1ww.text: Pretty good for a Vegas breakfast joint! Had to wait in line, but not too long. The menu is HUGE! We tried eggs, potato hash, creamy spinach and cheese dip(my favorite), seared rare ahi, avocado and heirloom tomato salad, and the grand club sandwich.   The creamy spinach dip was the best and so was the grand club sandwich. The eggs were great too.   I didn't like the seared rare ahi. It was wasn't very fresh. I guess that's what you get for ordering sushi in Vegas at a breakfast place!  The salad was refreshing, but just make sure you like the dressing. It's best to request it on the side!  I liked that there were lots of options for everyone. Breakfast ends at 11!

iJdzCexbqyA3YFVRP9HxIw.text: Not many more consistent places than this one. Always a solid all around option any time of day.

-b9980_qJYh4LRFIZsqjCg.text: I had not been to this restaurant in a long time and I was not disappointed. I ordered dessert first and totally confused our server, Tilde.  She was good, though. She went with the flow. We ordered the Warm Creamy Butter Cake, the Deep Dark Fudge Cake, Crispy Caramel Chicken,and the Beef Sliders. That butter cake- whew! Talk about decadent! It was crispy on the outside and warm and gooey on the inside with a scoop of vanilla cake on top. Yes! I bow to the butter!  The fudge cake was super rich and was not bitter at all. Very good. The Sliders were your typical Sliders- no complaints there. The caramel chicken was hot, sweet, crispy, tangy and spicy.  My taste buds were flooded with flavor. A very good after concert meal!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crispy Caramel Chicken
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grand Lux Cafe - Deep Dark Fudge Cake
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grand Lux Cafe - Warm Butter Cake

ds5A2RGbBnhwN0lynG299g.text: Great service, large portions, friendly staff, fantastic sourdough bread, reasonable prices (for Vegas). Many entrees also can be prepared gluten free.

T_bv0j4fZVWogdaTzEnpPQ.text: The grand lux has good lunch specials at decent prices for the Strip. The Manhattan salad was fresh and filling. And a little on the healthy side. Also house wines for under $10. A nice respite from high end. Service was great.

_wYUs-rGEjF-y8dJ0JGxrw.text: Came for their Fried Chicken and Waffles. I had no idea this place was owned by cheesecake factory. Once the waitress told me I realized that the place did look an awful lot like the same restaurant, but a bit more upscale. Good thing I happen to like cheesecake factory.  The waffle was really really good. It was soft and fluffy and the honey butter sauce just made it perfect. The same thing can't be said about the chicken strips. They were crispy, but they were a little dry on the inside and they were bland. If not for more honey butter I might not have enjoyed my dish as much. Honey butter and chicken are just meant for each other. The portions were huge too. I barely finished half.  Would I come back? Maybe. I think I like cheesecake factory better.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried Chicken &amp; Waffle

rZLuHm7H8c9Z9RY4FCb8Lw.text: I have been here a couple times.  I was not thrilled with this last time.  We were seated pretty quick, but the lights were dimmed to the point where I was squinting to read the text on the menu and I know it is to set the mood.  But I do not want to leave with worse eye sight.  I ordered the parm chicken- thin chicken with a thick breaded crust.  Only one side of the parm chicken was browned.  Weird... So I kind of picked it off and placed it on my bread plate.  The bread offered, some was good and some tasted and felt like it had been sitting for a while and warmed and then served.  Shouldn't hurt my teeth to tear into it.  Our waiter was great.    I just wish that the meal would have been better.

cJ6x3z_H_XJGmDasucKDAA.text: This is a lovely go - to for good food. Great quality and big portions! Owned by the Cheesecake Factory, you can also order desserts with your meal.  My husband and I always go there whenever we're in Vegas. Other times I've taken my family, and we've also met up here with friends whenever we do Vegas trips.  Our last time there was a great experience. I forgot our server, but he was very friendly and checked up on us regularly.  For food:  I had their Cobb salad, and my husband had a burger/fries (the fries were delicious) and the presentation for both were great. My Cobb was HUGE! I couldn't finish it. :)   As for drinks:   My Pina Colada was also creamy and delicious and my husband's beer tasted fresh.  Never disappoints!!!! Will always be back for late night eats!

WfRPyNjyN_txvzEzP6GqTQ.text: Open 24 hours! Their kitchens use the same food products brought in for all the restaurants in the Venetian. The quality shows!   Their salads are exceptional and everything on their very large menu is delicious! The quality is consistent and the service is EXCELLENT EVERY TIME!   Considering where it is located, it is reasonably priced as well. It is the first thing you get to when you come down the escalator from the parking garage so you don't have to go through the casino. The PERFECT late night after the show go to place! Boom!

i4XKrXy3ohfywt3yJ2aXFA.text: If you have to eat one thing -- eat the waffles!  They're amazing.  Best waffles one ever tasted and we come here every year when we visit Las Vegas and we come here a few times every time we go and they serve it from 6 am to midnight

FOI5lT-1PwXNST5xfmUPGQ.text: Paid$30 for prime stake that the knife couldn't cut through.  Jaw hurt after trying to chew through it.

65IxMPJtsgMlG-fCJy7SAg.text: The food here is good but the wait can get long even after you are seated.. I appreciate that they are open 24 hours and that's about it.   I've had the chicken and waffles here as well as a club sandwich.  Nothing to write home about --- mostly convenient if you're staying at this hotel, or if you need variety... but are not down for a buffet.   GLC is a something for everyone type thing with an all day (albeit limited) breakfast menu.

zgVsNu0KfNJqg-WkFyVOdQ.text: Great place to have a meal at the Venetian! Service was exceptional, and they were very accommodating for my gluten intolerance. The menu is well labeled for gluten free options and they also have a great cocktail selection. We were seated in their 'outside' area so we did some good Vegas people watching!   Food was great, price was normal for Vegas to be honest, and the menu has something for everyone for all tastes!

a19zC3PWwhOG0KIgsi2Xug.text: From the owners of Cheesecake Factory this place is delicious. I'm a gym rat and I was surprised to see many healthy options. Even offering a side salad instead of fries at no extra charge. I ate there twice at my stay at the palazzo. For lunch I had the grilled chicken avocado sandwich which was very good and for breakfast the fried chicken and waffles tickled my fancy.  Everything was presented and prepared very well. Service was good and prices are average for what you would pay on the strip. Large portions too! I will be back.

tyrWXnKSFH-WPZAR3XDiDg.text: This place is awesome! Their chicken Parmesan is melt in your mouth good! They have very large portions. I also love the convenience of this nice restaurant being 24/7 and the service is always attentive and nice.

5BTNc3M0hw8pOqwAgV79dA.text: I went to the one at The Venetian and I must say I love this place and I would definitely come here again. It's just like the Cheesecake factory but service was way better. There was at least 25-30 of us with one waiter. He was able to accomodate everyone without any hesitation and we didn't even have to wait that long for our food to come.   Their portions are HUGE. I had the chopped steak and I wasn't able to finish it. Actually I don't think anyone really finished their food=P

Bgwfqeo6Z1Mn8XzyzOqd3g.text: When sleepless in Vegas... and hungry.......... This is the perfect spot to unwind after a long day. We arrived at the cafe at 3am and ordered a couple of drinks appetizers and salads. The service staff was very attentive and polite. The atmosphere was one of the most memorable settings of our dining experiences. Iron patio railings, antique lamp posts and beautifully painted sky ceilings all created the perfect little Italy at 3am.

fDg_YeEHXvnwWC9AoFZ05Q.text: Came here for an early breakfast with a couple of friends.  We came to Vegas too early where we couldn't check into our room yet.    We have heard some good things about this place but needless to say it was horrible.  We had breakfast food and did not experience it very well.  I got eggs, sausage, and hash browns.  My friends gotten the breakfast steak with hashbrowns as well.  Their food was plain and the hashbrowns were over cooked.  All our hashbrowns were hard.  No, it was not crispy, it was hard where it was hard to eat... My friends believe their meal was not worth what they paid, it was close to $20 for their dish and their steak was BLAH.    I hate going to Dennys but Denny's is better than this place.  Oh yea, and our server sucked! Freaking disappeared for over 20 minutes, never refilled our waters, and took 10 minutes to get our check, and 10 minutes to get it back.  Service was horrible there too.  We will more than likely not come here again.  Maybe it was a bad day where both service and food sucked but who knows.  I had my experience there and won't be back.

e-xuhTmY24OTk9GR485lrQ.text: Cheesecake Factory rocks, and this place is the greatest hits album.  Good service, great food, nice place to spend some winnings, but it's not Delmonico.

gUuOk8qYdYiDkHCqe3uYFg.text: I played the Venetian Deep Stack poker tournament all month, and I ate at the Grand Lux nearly every day.  Every meal is awesome, I swear to god.  Portions are huge, prices are decent, service is friendly, what more can you ask for?  My favorites are probably the Santa Barbara chicken sandwich and the chicken parmigiana.

XDctfMMr1bjN8gU3joi19w.text: Yep.  Definitely owned by the Cheesecake Factory.  Large portions.  Varied menu.  Some of the salads come in "small" portions which is great for a normal size meal.  Can sit out on the patio and watch the casino go by or inside.  Outside tends to be noisy as you're right next to some slot machines.  For breakfast can get a standard breakfast or their version of a buffet.  Really an omlette station, fruit, bagels and croissants, breakfast meat, and includes drinks.  Not a bad deal for $14.99.

5MEWEMYbOr1gJh60ZQ4-fQ.text: Long wait, food was weak. Even Ray Charles could see this meal was a fail.

98kJGkubcLeMJUwrC_CQkg.text: Have eaten at this place twice, once for breakfast, once for lunch. The Venetian has been packed all week, but I've lucked out and gotten here during down times, so I was seated immediately and had good service. Tried the Cobb Salad (HUGE!) and the Huevos Rancheros (also huge).

QSD4nWcewJAZd-8mRVHIgA.text: Nice ambiance, and open 24 hours. The portions are huge and its usually easy to get a table for lunch and dinner. Since it's one of the few places that serves breakfast, you have to get there early to avoid a wait in the mornings. The food is good, though nothing to write home about. Perfect place to go when it's late and you need food before going to bed.

Nfj8myh1DIuq_mALZUKc2A.text: I was on a conference trip in LV and staying at the Palazzo. Co workers and I arrived LV with hunger pains and we were ready to fill the lunch void.  My co-workers and i decided to hit up the Grand Lux Cafe, a cousin of the Cheesecake Factory.   It was my first time, the food was surprisingly good; I am not a big fan of Cheesecake Factory entrees, but i was real satisfied with my meal at Grand Lux--salmon piccata...mmmm, yum! Their bread is bomb good (i am picky with my breads. So, bomb good is bomb good!)    If your taste buds are feenin for something different they have "world" dishes. They've got Comfort foods, such as chicken and waffles, to tend your hang overs. Basically, Grand Lux provides more on the menu than Cheesecake Factory-- you have a wider variety of good stuff to choose from, and of course, cheesecake.   For you late night to wee-hours of the morning Vegas goers, I am pretty sure they're open all night.  They'll serve you up some breakfast, lunch, and dinner meals. Whatever you want. YAY!  Service is okay, if your waiter is not around you can flag down someone else wandering.   I am definitely coming back to this place during my next visit.

HvlfRLCh8gSGCI2y0aHjAg.text: BIg BIG BIG portions. If you love cheesecake factory this is the place to be. The place is awesome with a huge menu. If your hungry this is the place to go to.

6F8UW6UoGqvM27_0UoX_jA.text: We had two (three?) meals here during our stay at the Venetian hotel. Decent, but the experience and food quality reminds me a lot of the Cheesecake Factory (who also own the Grand Lux).   They serve your usual rote of bland (or over-salted) American standards: pastas, giant burgers, monstrous breakfasts. On one meal, my husband's Grand Lux Burger was relatively dry, I enjoyed the Shortrib Grilled Cheese, which made for good hangover food, but really nothing to write home about. During another meal I had the corned beef hash, which was nice -- not your typical Denny's canned fare, but the over-easy eggs that I'd ordered were slightly overcooked.  It's relatively inexpensive sit-down fare (by Vegas standards, anyway) - not bad if you want to grab a fairly quick bite in between gambling runs and don't feel like leaving the hotel or patronizing the food court.

q1uPrecAQwBq84eCdiLUcA.text: I had heard about the 24 hr restaurant in the Venetian but had no clue what to expect.  I was pleasantly surprised that it wasn't just some food court lookin place.  Got here around 3 am after a long night at Tao and ordered the 3 egg breakfast...love breakfast. It came with potatoes and toast. Best breakfast at 3 am ever!! Could it have been...or was it the Grey goose talkin?  Nonetheless, it was yummy!  Not really my type of place for a dinner but breakfast and hunger at 3 am, its perfect.

duJf6xDeTVA9Zx7w0reztQ.text: A MUST STOP WHEN IN VEGAS!!! ONE OF MY FAVORITE PLACES TO EAT IN VEGAS!!!  I've been coming here for several years eversince a bellhop from Caesar's Palace recommended to me and my bestest gal pal one late night back when I was 21 yr old young buck.   - Love the beautiful atmosphere (appropriately located in the Venetian) - Love that it is 24 hours (good for breakfast, lunch, dinner, or late night snack) - Love that is from the makers of the Cheesecake Factory (Lot of similarities) - Extensive menu (so much to choose from it can be overwelming) - Great food (Most of the dishes I've tried are pretty good) - Excellent food presentation (kinda that fancy smacy stuff that you get wooed by) - Good portions (wooh....don't think I've finished a whole meal) - Decent prices (avg meal range anywhere from $8 - $18)  ****BUT...I am tempted to give it 1 less star due to my experience the week before heading Vegas. I called to two seperate times to make reservations for a group of 20. I was put on hold for over 10 minutes and just hung up since I was so frustrated.  Nonetheless, due to convenience our group decided to still  eat there since we were staying at the Venetian over the weekend. When calling from the hotel room (making sure to emphasize I was a guest at the Venetian), I quickly got reservations and hardly waited. A bit shady.....guess that have high priority for hotel guests. Good thing to know in the future  When we got there, we got a long table in the back where they usually have big groups. One long table and it was spacious and private for a bit. SERVICE was excellent. They had two waitresses serving us. So Grand Lux  I guess I forgive you just this once better not let this happen again ; ) ******  Just to note: My friends ate here 3 times when in Vegas since it's the best deal around in the Venetian and still one of the nicest and most decently priced places on the strip.  IF YOU LIKE THE CHEESECAKE FACTORY (AND AREN'T THAT INTO THE CHEESECAKE), YOU'LL LIKE IT HERE!

YLyY_fmDnsysp8QHig3Xvg.text: Holy Cow, I cannot believe they stopped serving my favorite sushi roll!!!!! Anyway came here after Da Vinci Exhibit ordered their Volcano Shrimp and it was delicious very light and crispy and the sauce was flavorful with a bit of spicy. I had the Ruben and OMG it was freaking delicious and pastrami was so good!!!!! My g/f had the BBQ pull pork sandwich (again!!!!) and it was the same as last time, very good, just have to say that the side of coleslaw was bland (agian!!!!). Can't go wrong here and for you breakfast sandwich lovers I suggest the Breakfast Sandwich Its my favorite it all of  Las Vegas.

GGFxEiGpIM6h9YZ1xabI-Q.text: If you like Cheesecake Factory you'll love this spot that's by the same creators of Cheesecake. The menu is obviously similar and they didn't make any drops in quality. I've been here four times and have had:  Caramel Thai chicken - delicious, thick sweet caramel glave on top of chicken breast bites. It's a humongous plate that should be shared. The sauce is just amazing and the chicken is juicy.   Spaghetti Carbonara: Real melting cheese silces on top, high quality bacon, perfect texture.. I've been to Italy and had the real deal and this is the same if not better  Grilled salmon - as good as expected.. put a hint of lime on it and you're good to go  I've had the breakfast platter (saugage, ham, eggs, etc) and it's very good too, but not that amazing nor unique (overpriced too).  The service is friendly and also make sure you get the smoothies. They're about $6 but worth it. Huge glasses of perfectly blended fruit, mango and rasberry are fantastic!

rjGOqa3NinpqWjRKYGAQOA.text: Been here a couple of times before. I've never been disappointed by the food that comes out of the kitchen, the service, or the view (last time here, saw Lebron James, Donyell Marshall and their posse). This appears to be one of the favorites of my close buddy and his family as well.  The Venetian hotel is known for it's 5 star service and decor, that of classic elegance. The name itself evokes thoughts of royalty and class. The restaurant almost always has a line, especially at night as this is one of the few restaurants open late night with a full palatable menu.  Environment: the restaurant had the main dining hall, a couple side sections and the "outdoor" patio. All are very open with high ceilings so that you never feel crowded. Given that this is in the middle of one of the more popular hotels in Vegas, ambient noise is a given. We happened to sit on the patio which is still inside the hotel but enclosed by a 3 foot high antique gate. Perfect for people-watching especially because you have a great view of the hallway leading to Tao nightclub. The tables are a little too closely situated together (I coupe clearly hear the conversation of our neighbors) but you're never hitting elbows. If you're a larger person, request the booth seating because the chairs are designed for people with a BMI of 25 or less.  Waiter/waitresses: she made several trips to our table to make sure we were enjoying our dinner. Every time she came by, she had a smile on her face. Our water cups never went empty nor did our bread basket. Overall, impressive service and something you'd expect at a more intimate 4-star restaurant.  Food: I just learned that this restaurant is owned by Cheesecake Factory. That explains the decor, bread, an much of the menu. The bread basket contains freshly baked honey wheat and sourdough. The crust is crunchy and flaky while the middle of the loaf is soft and chewy, the perfect consistency for bread. The honey aspect of the wheat bread is not overpowering but adds jut a hint of sweetness to enhance your appetite and clear your palate for the entree. For the main course I had the crispy caramel chicken. Basically, it's fancy orange chicken which is served with a medley of vegetables marinated in the sweet and spicy thai sauce covering the chicken as well ad a generous helping of either brown or white rice. The chicken's crust was a little thick, making it difficult to chew. The chicken itself was on the drier side and the sauce a little too sweet. In fact, the dish was more sweet than spicy. If that suits your taste, you may want to check this dish out.  Drinks: just water.  Recommendation: EAT!!!

ltg3Mk_EYWuEHpNekc61eA.text: The food is alllllright. I prefer the Cheesecake Factory. The service is good and the bread and butter they serve in the beginning is delicious!

RqWd9QryiKfK9c0R-yG0EA.text: My favorite casino restaurant in Las Vegas!   The modern classy decor is beautiful. The dim lighting makes it classier.  It can be loud during the dinner hours though. The line can get long at night but it's not too much of a wait since it is big restaurant.   A few of my favorites are the Santa Barbara Chicken Sandwich, Southwestern Salad, and the Asian Chicken Salad.  There is a pastry counter outside the restaurant as well.

U2pAl5GN_9OTlXG0iogviw.text: If you like Cheesecake Factory, you will love the Grand Lux Cafe.  Same type of food but better and tad bit pricier.  The portions are just as huge and service here is on par.    We ordered the fried calamari, rock shrimp, and vegetables appetizer.  That was huge.  Fried calamari was not the same as Cheesecake so that was a bit disappointing.    Bf ordered the slow pot roast sandwich ($10) and he said it was delicious.  Fries were good.    I ordered Sheila's Dream Salad, which was ginormous.  It had lettuce, shredded carrots, tortilla strip crisps, peanuts, chicken breast, grapefruit, and other things I forgot.  It was $13 and totally worth it.  My only complaint is that it contains so many ingredients, that there isn't enough lettuce to balance out the salad.  And there was hardly any chicken.    Open 24 hours so it's perfect for any time of the day.

9bNd7uzVYSV3vaTycW4UkQ.text: I disagree that this place is like Cheesecake Factory. The level of service provided was incredibly slow, and we got ZERO refills of our coffees and water. It felt more like TGIFridays.   We waited forever to give our order, the food took even longer to come. We got there at 7:45 and were seated, but the food didn't show up until 8:50! Most of us had meetings at 9 AM that we had to get to.  We basically had to shovel down the food. The waitress got my meal almost completely wrong, but I didn't have time to have them do it again.  The total bill for 3 coffees, a salmon omelet, french toast, bowl of fruit and breakfast platter came out to $67.   I had originally planned to go here tomorrow night for a cocktail hour before going to see a show- but I'm definitely not doing that anymore.

HvJYV5qJ1f-YoN-bAvbRVw.text: Fantastic service and beautiful decor.  Nice prices for Vegas too.   Soup and bread were fantastic as was the smothered catfish!   Too much food with appetizer.

vMBdtn462FUtMgYuKUd62Q.text: In the beginning, our party of 5 had a little argument with its hostess, but in the end everything worked out.  Food was mediocre. Since this place is known to be a 24-hr joint, I guess when you're a bit buzzed and in need of some midnight snacks, this place will be good. However, for lunch, the pasta was a little over-done. I would not recommend this place for sober-minded people, but would go back after a Las Vegas night.

_mkQLzqhdoodI1aT_ZmOqg.text: My granddaughter and I have decided to meet weekly and have lunch together on the strip where she works.  We chose Grand Lux Cafe as our start.  We were promptly seated and the section we were in  was not crowded.  Nevertheless, it took 20 minutes for our waiter to appear.  In the meantime, when the bus person came, I mistook them for the waiter and they let me know in minimum words, tone,  and tempo that they were not the waiter. Interestingly enough, when the waiter did appear, he too used the same communication style as the bus person.  We ignored the lack of communication skills and asked for some clarifications of the menu and ordered: Crispy Calamari, Fuji Apple Salad,  and the Honey Cashew-Honey Kale salad.  By the time the food arrived, we had lost 49 minutes of my granddaughter's lunch hour.  The batter on the calamari batter was mushy, not throughly cooked, so we asked the waiter to remove it declining a replacement due to time.  The Honey-Cashew Kale salad had an excellent crispy texture but was extremely bland in taste.  My granddaughter requested shrimp in her Fuji Apple salad and was given 2 measly shrimp, split in two, to appear as if it was 4 for a $5 additional charge.  The manager came by and using the very same communication style as his subordinates, with a steroid boost of monotones, stated his concerns and that he would remove the calamari from our bill as if he was doing something benevolent for us.  As we left and passed the hostess, who WAS NOT and DID NOT have ANY customers to serve (no problem figuring out why) failed to bid us farewell or happy returns.  While the food and customer service was throughly disappointing, the atmosphere was pleasant, so... you've been warned.

L60VpD_H8cY4sZAWTHX0ew.text: Awesome location just inside the Venetian. We sat on the "patio" so would people watch and take in the sounds of the casino "WHEEL OF FORTUUUUNE!". Our server was great and really took time to give us information and make some suggestions. We had Caesar Salad to start and it was amazing (reader beware: this is a WEDGE salad). For our entree we had veggie gnocchi and Asian lettuce wraps - both were great. Portions are big so be prepared to share unless you're REALLY hungry.  I will return for sure.

uckYSSY6LRJbaBssQi-VYw.text: Worst meal in Vegas. Food was alright, the 1 star is for service. Terrible service from the start to the finish. The server did not write down the order, forgot our drinks, after we reminded about the drinks, she messes up one of omelette orders. What was appalling was that our server did not even acknowledge that there was a mistake. Servers like these make restaurants look really bad. Hope you can find better servers.

g0AAFet2bw_dKbJAVA9DPw.text: We visit this place 1 year ago and the food I had was horrible...who can't cook eggs?  I was very disappointed.  I will not return sorry!

ZgDSLa1doZLq7PMOaNoP3g.text: Love this place! Great value and so many options!  Can't go wrong with anything you get!

nFu-fJp5VGbaZAkl9eEVKw.text: Hands down 5 stars.  The place is really elegant the food is really good the service was great you cannot go wrong the selection of food is amazing there is something for everybody and the price is fair you get what you pay for

tw_vMc1u4EVaSSqu1rIWUw.text: We come here almost every time we are in Vegas.  It's great for lunch and dinner, but the breakfast is what keeps us coming back. The buffet has good, fresh food at a nice price point.  And the fresh squeezed OJ is to die for! You won't regret it :)

89Gkf0tIZkew_FJaaWfnZw.text: Worst experience ever.   And we haven't even had an opportunity to order. The manager is rude, speaking to us as if it is an inconvenience to have to serve a party of now 10(we started at 13, went to 11, and are now at 10).  I called ahead and was told 5-10 minutes.  When we arrived, we were told 15-20 minutes. When we went to check on the reservation, we were told 20-30 and that the 15-20 minutes we were quoted was a mistake.  Miraculously, they are able to serve several smaller parties that came in behind us.  I would think they'd ask us if we would mind splitting up.  Service everywhere in Vegas until this point has been phenomenal.  Just goes to show a 5 star hotel doesn't always employ 5 star employees!  If you want good food and good service visit the Hard Rock Cafe and ask for Sarah.

rV7_n4EAzepgvaVH6eKk5g.text: I'm shocked that there are so many 4-5-star ratings for this restaurant. Perhaps our server just hated my table. He was really rushing us for our order even though it wasn't very busy. It was Sunday, July 8, 2012 around 7:30pm. We were seated quickly, but our table didn't even have place settings for all 7 of us. Our server took the order and was pleasant enough, but that's where the service ended. It's like he disappeared for 45 minutes and our food was nowhere in sight. Our order consisted of 3 breakfast entrees, enchiladas,1 burger, 1 salad and one hot entree, nothing out of the ordinary or difficult.   Once the food finally arrived, it was just ok. Not bad, but nothing memorable. I felt like the food should have been outstanding for how long we waited, but it was just so-so.   I won't be going back to this place for long waits on mediocre food.   Our server never even acknowledged that our food took over 45 minutes. Rude!  The (only) upside: the prices were reasonable.

WodEaKq_VsVykzaxa_cpZQ.text: We were staying here on July 4th weekend (what a mistake) and wanted some cheap eats. This place had good prices. I had the chicken and waffles, which I liked. The boyfriend had the spicy carnitas sandwich. He said it was not spicy at all. The fries sucked, but it was still a good deal. The asian pear martini was strong. I only wish it was a bigger drink for $13 bucks. If we're at the Venetian or Palazzo again, I'd come here instead of walking in Vegas heat trying to find a place to eat.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken and waffles!

SBQ9bEP3Qy5MdJrX4EpwtQ.text: Came in here because all the buffets were too crowded around the area. But, to my surprise, there is a small buffet in here. All you can eat breakfast. Pretty standard. Cheaper than competition at $19 though.

m6K74VjVnlJGwCMUR4qlTw.text: When I first came here I was like "this place looks like the Cheesecake Factory, but the food is better." Well, turns out it is owned by the Cheesecake Factory or something. But it is definitely better than the CF in many respects.   First off, it is open 24 hours. So basically if you are wondering Vegas at 4 am you can go here and eat whatever you are crazing.  Second, they have some bomb appetizers like Flautas and this crispy shrimp thing.  Third, their Mojitos are awesome.   Fourth, It is reasonably priced for the portions you get. You could easily split their entrees.   Definitely a spot I try to hit up when I stay around the Venetian/Palazzo. I also believe there is one in the Venetian and one in the Palazzo.

s6yHqKMQcfqI8NHaRylr1Q.text: No idea how this place has four stars.  The service is super slow.  I had the opportunity to meet clients here twice during my trip to Vegas.  Both times it took over 30 minutes to be seated, another 10 to have the order taken and another 20 to be served.  This was at 6:30 in the morning.  The food is diner food.  Nothing to write home about or make this place a destination.  I do give them kudos for some of the best orange juice, but for $4 per glass it had better be.

b2tA0HU_Jk6kq1HSTb73Og.text: Love the Asian nachos! The decor inside is really nice, pricing is good. But be careful where you're seated! The kitchen doesn't have its own room so of your sitting near it you will hear everything- cooks talking to each other, dishes clanging, etc. I'd sit anywhere else before I take that table again

EkdDGzsyeMaEkbbdl13uzA.text: The southern fried chicken was good. Wasn't no hooters tho, but it's worth a try if you're ever going to stay at the Venetian

CPbPNYUGqlAWR-IUh5eLgQ.text: We came here at 10:45 am and ordered two burgers and a sandwich and our waitress Christina told us that they might not have them available since it was still a breakfast time. Then we switched to some breakfast items; however, my kid started crying that he doesn't want eggs and I went to another waitress to ask if I can order burgers. She checked with the kitchen guys and told us that we can order them and it's gonna take them about 15 min to make. Then our waitress Christina came to us and I told her that I wanna switch back to burgers. She said I cannot do it since they've already started my order. What?!?!? You gave me the wrong info in the first place and now you don't wanna do anything to keep your customers happy? She was very rude and unprofessional with a very bad attitude that is not supposed to take place on the 5-star property such as the Venetian/Palazzo. She literally ruined my good impression about the whole experience at the Palazzo.

LQ1MeflEptdmSAquAQkn1g.text: DON'T COME HERE SOBER!  That is all.

Opbf8VnvzrwdlN6q9k6xiQ.text: By Vegas price standards (on the strip anyways), this place was really good. I got a massive Chicken and avocado salad! And it was very generous on avocado even. Ordered from the to-go section. Highly recommend. They have lots of other options as well - burgers, entrees, desserts! Think cheesecake factory (but better)

y0ZFWD_ZYk2QQ635VSQvlQ.text: We had 4 comped breakfasts here. The buffet offerings never changed. Service is good. If we had to pay out of pocket, we would have dined elsewhere.

feH8t7UKHVnif4Dckbu5FQ.text: I have to commend this place for the quick service. We were trying to fit in a meal before a show and the server was very attentive and helpful in making sure we had a nice experience and got out of there in time. We ate in the bar area and appreciated that there were some appetizer specials available there. I tried the Vietnamese noodle bowl for my meal and it was the perfect healthy and light dinner. Although I cannot comment on the experience of sitting in the regular dining area I do recommend stopping here and sitting in the bar area for happy hour or a quick meal or drink.

IAaA12JQh4F9MylfrsfDUA.text: One of our favorite places to eat in Vegas! We've already been here once & I'm sure if we win more $ we'll come back once more before we leave Monday. Definitely try their Fettucini Alfredo with chicken. They claim its made fresh daily which I would tend to believe them, it's very flavorful & my fiance's favorite!! Also recommend trying their Zen noodles!! Yum Yum!! :)

-KwUQNYjhY27HOq5-7VYZg.text: We went for breakfast with a toddler and infant in our group and were greeted with the nicest server, places in a boot away from the crowd and experienced an amazing breakfast of pancakes and biscuits and gravy! The syrup that comes with the fresh, pillowy pancake is out of this world good! The hidden potato's under the eggs, biscuits and gravy are a pleasant suppress. Even the hot chocolate was rich and hit the spot! The prices were also reasonable. Must try for breakfast/brunch.

eEnadjuY13Vo_5WeHD--Xg.text: They didn't really want to accommodate us when we asked to be seated inside. There were available tables for 2 on the inside - we saw them with our own eyes. Initially, one of the hostesses seated us in the outer area, where you can see and hear all the people walking to and from the garage and shops. When we asked for a quieter table on the inside, she took us 3 steps over to a table that was just as bad. We asked the waitress if we could sit "inside-inside", and she re-directed us to a different hostess. That one seated us near the entrance - still not inside-inside the actual restaurant. Then, we had to spend our meal watching other parties of 2 get seated inside-inside - quite a few of them, actually. From what we overheard, they weren't joining other parties, nor did they have reservations (this being a cafe, and all). So what was the problem? Did we not look old/important enough, hence not threatening enough to get seated where we specified? Why's it like pulling teeth?   Regarding the food, the Garlic Shrimp Pasta and Hawaiian Smoothie I ordered were great and tasty, but the Short-Rib Grilled Cheese my sister ordered was not "one of the best sandwiches" she's ever had, like some people on here who claim it was one of the best sandwiches they've ever had. The waiter was good, though. I think his name was Eric. The ambiance inside the actual restaurant seemed visually appealing and easy on the eyes - from what we were able to see of it.

wkp49nILKl7XPWZiR9T5zg.text: I would definitely suggest going here, especially with a group! This place is HUGE! They have one of the largest menus I've ever seen also. Sometimes that worries me when restaurants try doing too much, but in this case, it seems to work. Went with a group of 6 and we all got something different and everyone enjoyed what they got. Our waiter was really friendly and knowledgeable too! Overall good experience! Also, check out their dessert when you're leaving - they have a walk up dessert counter where you can take it to go. So many delicious items!!

kzsgeTRcMPyi_wykpkRzRA.text: Chicken in waffles!!!! Order it, eat it, savor the flavors, and love life. Pleasantly surprised how tasty this was. The butter and syrup mixer brought this all together. The Mai Tai drink is strong but so good. They use passion fruit juice like elephant bar. Not as tasty as the Elephant bar version but really close.    Service was great.  My friend has nut allergies and made sure to let our server know that. Her salad arrived full of almonds,  so our server comped her salad for the inconvenience.   Overall the dining experience was great. Everyone enjoyed their food, it was fresh, hot, flavorful, and large portions. We had buffalo chicken rolls (a must for buffalo chicken fans), entree salads, miso salmon (I recommend subbing the rice for mash potatoes) jambalaya, chicken n waffles,  and a sandwich.   This place is definitely a go to when in town especially since the location in Los Angeles closed down.

rlavTOHmn-cY5PEe0Ez10A.text: Large portions at very reasonable (for Vegas strip) prices. Great staff and plenty of options for any dietary restriction. Nice enough for a date, large enough to easily accommodate a group. My gluten free pasta was really delicious.

drpBNn4zxbfwG9ahY48oSw.text: This place is pretty much the Cheesecake Factory; I'm not sure what's the difference (especially since it's the sister restaurant) except the fact it's open 24 hours haha.  We went here around 3 AM, after the club of course. We ordered a chicken strips, a burger and some shrimp scampi, as well as more drinks hehehe. As expected, the food was served in huge portions and was very filling, but they were pretty good overall! We kinda spent too much but whatever, it's Vegas, you have to accept the high prices when you travel here.  Also shoutout to our waitress for taking care of our buzzy selves, and still getting the staff to sing me happy birthday with some cheesecake! I wish I remembered your name, but I remembered the moment :) haha.

Pt01uU1AlIYSTeXNWy3wGg.text: Eating late night dinner and this place never disappoints! I'm just so happy to eat my cookies that I'm not supposed to eat. Just love this place and disappointed they closed the location in LA. So now when I travel I go to Grand Lux Cafe in other city and states.

Gu9_cmdlryyah-OjfGdLZg.text: The short-rib grilled cheese was one of the most amazing sandwiches I've ever had. The restaurant is conveniently located near the elevators. Some of the seating is a bit cramped... long bench with tables and chairs on the other side, which seems to be popular in Vegas. The hostess kindly accommodated our request not to be squeezed in between two parties and we got a more cozy spot. The menu is huge so we'll be back for more.

WTPIXBITggEnXHmcY-1ezg.text: Flew in late on Friday night and was craving a salad like no other. Came here around 11pm to kill the craving and it worked!  Ordered: x Ahi Ceviche (Fresh Raw Ahi Tuna Diced and Marinated in Lime Juice, Chiles and Cilantro. Tossed with Avocado, Tomato, Onion and Cucumber) - shockingly the tuna tasted fresh. Chips were grease-less, crisp, and crunchy. 10/10 would recommend. x Seafood Salad (Lump Crab, Shrimp, Avocado, Tomato, Corn, Green Beans, Egg, Celery and Green Onion Over a Bed of Crisp Romaine Tossed with Our "Louis" Dressing) - SOOO much of everything. This salad was HUGEEEE. Shared the two dishes and we were stuffed. Everything was good except the shrimp.. tasted and cut like rubber.  Service was extremely slow, but it's fine considering how HUGE this place is. I've dined at the Grand Lux in Palazzo and this place beats it by far! My 2 star memory now became a 4 star :)

jP4lqzVrXegdsORe3w4x2Q.text: Went here for my bday in vegas and the beef Wellington was absolutely phenomenal. The mashed potatoes and sides that it came with really completed the dish with the sauce!

KG_t6IJXLGMY6S5lFaXsTg.text: Came here one day for happy hour and food and the next day for breakfast.   Impressed with the quality of food and the amazing service.   During the haply hour, they have appetizer specials for only $5 and certain drinks are on sale as well. We had the fried potato spring rolls, fettuccine Alfredo, and lettuce wraps.   For breakfast we had home made corned beef and has and chicken and waffles.   The food portions are very generous so it's enough to share.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Home made corned beef and hash

zkfb8Tp2Pd23cjFYmZCz3w.text: A glorified diner with the glorified prices to match. Lousy to just okay service. Our waiter disappeared for about 15 minutes when we needed him most. My wife finally found him chatting up another server in the bus pit. he finally gave us our check.Disappeared again. it was the check for another table---about half what ours should have been. My wife hunted him down and got the right check out of him. He gave no apology. No thanks.  We stayed at The Venetian for a week. Ate here four times just for convenience sake. it was in our hotel and open late.  There's nothing special about their breakfasts. Despite the commercial channel they feed you in your hotel room. Their breakfast buffet was standard for any hotel. The omelette station had only the lowest end of cheese available (strictly cheddar and mozzarella) and their pastries which are so touted on their in-room food channel were dried out and nothing special. Not worth the calories.  Coffee is $4.50 a cup. Digest that.

YNuEAiH4uDAfnMMLWMvLkA.text: Seriously my favorite place to eat in Vegas. Every time we touch down, this place is our go to. The food is incredible and have large portions. Buffalo Blasts, Chicken Parmesan, Chicken Alfredo and even the Churro French Toast. Maaaaaaan! I can't wait to go back at the end of June.

As6TdiB1AwkCoVyyazsj-w.text: Came here to grab breakfast on a Tuesday at 8am. They offer a Grand Lux Express breakfast for $18.95 pp and is a great value. They have potatoes, breakfast meats, pastries, fresh fruit, omelettes, scrambled eggs, toast, bagels and waffles. It also includes orange juice and coffee. The food and service fast and good! I definitely recommend grabbing a fulling breakfast here.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Buffet breakfast comes with coffee and orange juice
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My buffet breakfast plate
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon!

2nBPIwliTOwzaz_NxbEGFg.text: Our favorite place to eat on the strip!  The price point was reasonable and the food options were endless.  This cafe gives a bit of a Cheesecake Factory vibe but the food is even better.  The food was so good that we ate here 3 times! Twice for lunch and once after Cirque de Soleil around 11 pm.  The food was great no matter the hours.  I had the Belgian waffles and quesadillas!  The Grand Lux  is conveniently open 24 hours.

6xZebE1hioYLqz38x3EAjg.text: In all the 15 years of going to Vegas I have never had such a bad experience in a hotel cafe. And this is the Venetian we are talking about. The only reason they get two stars is for the eggs Benedict that was cooked perfect. But the service was slow, the waiter was half drunk on a early shift, and other workers are rude. I expect better when I am Paying $400 a night for a weekend in at this resort.

o0ElsaG9i_wPxe3sU37P4Q.text: everyone and their mother comes here! lol  ive been here numerous times and here is whats good.  indocrine chicken - phenomenal! very different, fusion taste.. good if u want chicken and rice... with an asian indian taste  sun-dried tomato pasta - sometimes they dont make it good but make sure u tell the waiter to make it extra good and  not to fuck it up or its free! ahahha  BRUNCH! - super good... i kno it sounds crazy but the OATMEAL is the shit here! hahahah  Smoked Salmon Platter - Super good, cant go wrong.  Finally FROZEN PEACH BELLINI!!! always!
