aIb7eNQnRHJ01eVL2E0iFw.text: Three words: CHICKEN AND WAFFLES!! Two More: EAT HERE!        I'd heard of Grand Lux being a Cheesecake Factory owned chain, and saw one last weekend in L.A off of Wilshire. I  yelped 24 hour restaurants in Vegas and the second one that shows up was this one. We arrived at 11:45 p.m this past Thursday and everyone from the hostess that answered our questions on the phone to the bus boy that gave us water was nice, professional, and attentive!! It's hard to find good food and excellent service during normal hours of the day let alone at midnight! Only in Vegas, I guess. Our waitress was so nice and gave us some suggestions on what clubs are hot at the moment. We loved it so much we went back the next night at around 10 p.m. (would've gone three days in a row, but no time!)and same deal except this time we noticed they offered chicken and waffles on their menu. GOURMET CHICKEN AND WAFFLES! TAKE THAT ROSCOES!! For dessert we got a dozen pecan chocolate chip cookies to go for something around $6.00 and they were made fresh!! You can't beat that!!  Grand Lux is better than Cheesecake Factory! Trust, I went to one at Caesar's and everyone there thought they were too good to work there or threw their dirty laundry with other workers out in the open with us. Not classy.       I urge you not to waste your money or time on crap late night food cafes that over charge you for undercooked food and bad service. Grand Lux is better than Cheesecake Factory!

E5T-KKUFmLrL6briKh6ffQ.text: I ate at the Grand Lux Cafe (GLC) at the Venetian Resort this evening -- one of many visits to this restaurant since the top-rated Venetian opened in May 1999. I arrived around 6:00PM after cruising the G2E Global Gaming Show all day. The restaurant was crowded but, thankfully, there was no wait to get in.  I was promptly greeted by a friendly hostess and was offered a seat in the Bar area rather than the main restaurant. (I'm glad they didn't seat me on the casino terrace as I don't like that area at all -- mostly because the scent they fill the casino with is obnoxiously strong there.) There are two TVs in the bar -- one was tuned to a sports channel while the other was tuned to the first presidential debate.The restaurant areas I visited appeared clean, fresh and well-cared for. My table and seating area were also clean and the table was set for two. I was given a glass of water, a 1/2 loaf of their amazing sourdough bread and a generous serving of butter within just a few short minutes of being seated.  My waiter, Charles S., was very friendly and attentive and he wholeheartedly agreed with my choice of dinner: Pasta with Grilled Chicken, Tomato, Basil and Mozzarella. The large main dish portion was made with fresh ingredients and presented nicely on a large clean plate. There was lots of tasty, well-prepared pasta with a tomato, cream and garlic sauce; a generous portion of flavorful grilled chicken breast; and many appealing small orange and red pear-shaped "mini" tomatoes. The dish was garnished with fresh mozzarella cheese, grated Parmesan cheese and a basil pesto. The menu claims the tomatoes are roasted but mine did not appear that way. A very delicious and filling dish. The iced tea I was served also passed muster though the refill I was offered was a tad strong for my liking.  GLC is owned by the same company that owns The Cheesecake Factory. I have eaten at many GLC locations across the country and I'm always happy with the facility, food and staff. The price for meals is a bit on the high side (my dinner this evening with tax and just over 20% tip was a tad under $26) but well worth it for the quality of the experience.  -- 4.3 well-deserved stars

NTzpAQOpV_xQ71tBUJx53g.text: Went for breakfast since The Mirage doesn't have a cafe (It looks like they are putting one in though). I ordered a cappuccino but it came in a coffee cup which I think is totally weird, but it was good. They offer a breakfast buffet so I cruised through it but was not impressed so we all ordered a la cart. I was HUNGRY so I ordered bacon and eggs AND blueberry pancakes. It was good, bacon was crispy, eggs were cooked just right, hash-browns were nice and crispy. I like the big plump blueberries in the panckage. My husband had the chicken and waffles. That waffle was the BEST waffle EVER! I ended up eating his. My friends got the salmon platter and breakfast sandwich. The salmon/lox were really really good. The sandwich was big and my friend was only able to eat half. Overall it was a good breakfast but I would definitely get a waffle next time. Service was ok, they were busy. Plates are big enough to share.

yXHCZzj4w3Y-rRFMCX6Ltw.text: Yet another favorite place of mine when I'm in Vegas.  The Grand Lux cafe totally reminds me of the Cheescake factory.  Decent food and service.  Defintely a good place to dine.  I will be back the next time I'm in Vegas

3-7B5gdcZZRfs_O3llgCfA.text: Almost every time we go to vegas we eat here and its always great! I always get the chicken picatta and my husband gets the patty melt burger.... But the best thing is the caesar salad ...you gotta add blackened chicken!

XHQMsM1FHK7FHdMMfyq4IA.text: The Manager Matt was very attentive and his crew was awesome! The food was delicious all 4 times we have been here and the salsa was super fresh!! Delicious!! A must go in Vegas!!

qJTXNkiRpjZPYR_ckhU3qA.text: Fettuccine Alfredo was creamy and the noodles were fresh but the chicken was dry. Garlic Shrimp Noodles and Chicken and Waffles were better. Excellent service!

JEHLJaYCzfigN5U3PQ93Fw.text: By leaps and bounds this was the worst experience of my 5 days in Vegas. I consider myself a somewhat optimistic person, but I am at a complete loss for positive things to say about this place. I went here at brunch/lunch time to grab a quick bite before heading back to a conference, and I now wish I would've made the walk to McDonalds so I would've had some quality food and service - you heard right, McDs is quality compared to this junk.  My friends both ordered omelettes and I went with a chicken sandwich that involved avocados. The food wouldn't have even been all that bad if they wouldn't have... A) taken 25 minutes to deliver the goods, B) forgotten to tell us that they messed up our order and needed a few extra minutes, C) neglected to explain their mistake, D) placed my food under the warmer so that my bun became burnt and my lettuce an ever-appetizing wilty black, E) neglected to say one more word to us the entire meal - not even thank you.  Sometimes a restaurant delivers crappy food but the service makes up for the mistakes, and sometimes a black hole emerges in the kitchen and maliciously sucks in every hint of good service and humanity of the entire staff. I probably should have expected all of this knowing that the restaurant the bastard child of Cheesecake Factory, but that damned blind optimism got the best of me. Spend the extra cash and go somewhere else, or go to the food court and get a respectable panini, or just don't eat and get a martini instead - any option is a step in the right direction as long as it is a step away from Grand Lux.  Also, a side note - there was something like 200 items to order from on this menu, meaning that I can rest assured that the entrees have been frozen longer than Ted Williams, yum yum.

ey-oFyT90KsUmadpC7Ci_A.text: Am I missing something here? There're are three grand lux cafe's on yelp? They all seem to be the same place though. Anyway, the food here is average, expensive (18 dollars for a simple salad with a little ahi tuna?? Seriously??). But the waiter we had was fast and efficient and checked frequently to make sure everything was okay.   The place would be better if they would drop their prices to something more reasonable.

mmB-pyB48uU8FIxiVI-WJA.text: We ate here 4 times during our most recent Venetian stay.  Everything was great:  Cobb salad had fresh chunks of chicken, the chicken salad was excellent, service was good.....reasonable prices.  They're owned by Cheesecake Factory so it's that style of experience.

Jt1mNBTjbXljm-vw5gVZnw.text: I've eaten here twice and loved it both times. It's a very nice and cozy place to eat at when you don't want to spend too much money but still want to eat some decent food. They have very great variety. The menu is pretty overwhelming because they pretty much have every food possible (that's American that is).   The first time I came here was for after hours food, and tried some of their desserts. The strawberry shortcake was amazing =) My friend also ordered the sloppy joe, which was pretty good too. I'm a huge fan of dessert though and I think this place definitely has pretty yummy desserts.  The second time I came for lunch and just had their grand lux burger sandwich and frieds. It was a pretty filling meal and tasted pretty good. I was craving a burger at the moment so it was awesome to me.  Personally, I'm a huge fan of the Venetian because I love the whole Venice architecture of the hotel, and the cafe definitely lived up to that feel too. Open 24hrs, cozy place, nice ambiance, good food, and decent pricing...I'd definitely want to come back here everytime I go back to Vegas again =)

5wLcRwO4EG-L7uqMg1ZZCA.text: i usually only come here after getting fucked up at tao or lavo...but ive been here sober so it's safe to say its pretty good here mans...i usually get the same shiet but ive picked off food of my table buddies and i cant complain about anything here really mans...it seems as if im always drunk after reviewing my own reviews...buyt i promise you i am not...  oh and all the waiters and waitresses seem to have a pretty good attitude...if i were them...seeing all these drunk hoodrats with no ass and guys with no swag...id be a bitch...but they all seem to have patience...esspecially the one time i was so drunk i accidentaly dropped a plate and it broke into a million pieces and caused a loud commotion...  ooo the fried chicken and waffles are good too...ok so all you people in vegas come stop by to sober up

W9qZXl5PuQ6dwCe0UHCMEA.text: We had a complimentary breakfast coupon from costco travel. We ate at the luxe for 2 days. The first day our waitress seemed turned off the minute I said I have the coupon. She got a bowl of fruit , 2 muffins and a Danish...talk about sugar! This inspire of telling her my mom was a diabetic, she said I could just upgrade ! The second day still wanting to use that coupon, we went in and was served by super sweet Miguel who was so good to us that when I mentioned my mom was a diabetic, he got toasted bread, fruit bowl and oatmeal with no sugar. If not for him I would have walked away thinking this was a snobbish place to eat.

uMwy3uUJQXCagXjn411rAA.text: Prompt attentive service. Wife had seafood salad, 3.5 stars, I had the Indochine shrimp and chicken, awesome, 5 stars. Elegant decor. A but noisy the closer you sit to the kitchen. Solid 3.5- 4 stars.

pQ5nzFZ_Vo5djAP6rL4uEQ.text: This place was great.  We discovered it on accident and were very pleased.  Everything in vegas is so expensive and it was nice to find a place with good quality food and great service that we didn't have to spend an arm and a leg on.  The server was very friendly and checked on us often.  She told us the restaurant is owned by the cheesecake factory and to expect big cheesecake factory portions.  We both had burgers, the were gigantic and they tasted great.  I plan to vist the grand lux every time I go to vegas

peN0CWT5mzbKGUzrMxBBoA.text: Grand Lux Cafe is an upscale Cheesecake Factory. They are owned by the same company so the two restaurants are very similar.   Their food is pretty standard, decent quality but nothing amazing. They have huge portions for the prices that they charge, and the service is decent too.   Grand Lux was convenient and right inside our hotel, so we went twice. I had an omelet with a side of hash browns that was pretty good and then we went back after clubbing for zen noodles. Chicken broth with rice noodles after a night of drinking? It's not pho but it will have to do. Yummy!

j10m69mV8mbhUHxKGaSHAA.text: Thank you Yelpers for this culinary treat in the middle of the night!  I didn't even know this place is a sister restaurant of the "cheesecake factory" chain.  If cheesecake factory tasted this good, I'd go more often.  My fiance and I went exactly at Friday 12:01am.  Pros:  A sign of a healthy and good restaurant are full tables even at midnight.  After getting of the plane starving for something good, my fiance told me Yelpers recommend this place.  We were staying at the Treasure Island and this restaurant was located inside the Venetian across the street.  I loved our waiter Abraham.  He made us feel welcome, recommended some great dishes for us to try, and even went in the back to ask the chef the secret to preparing those wonderful mashed potatoes spring rolls! (I'm not imparting the secret, you'll just have to go ask the restaurant yourselves).  We tried the aforementioned mashed potatoes spring rolls, their flautas, and an order of their prime rib sloppy joes.  Everything was delicious!  I was all rejuvenated and ready to go back out there and gamble some more!  Cons:  So many choices, such a small stomach.  I couldn't have thought of anything wrong with the meal.  Bottom line: Next time I go back to Vegas and am craving a midnight meal, I'll so go back to the Grand Lux!

lDycp81uD2a8e4p3I9X0sw.text: Love it.  24-hour cafe, but it tastes WAY better than just a cafe.  The interior feels spacious with their high ceiling, and the food is really tasty.  I know there are so many "fine" restaurants in and around the Palazzo.  But this place is priced reasonably, and will satisfy your appetite.  You can spend $18 for a bowl of Pho (at the Asian restaurant in the Palazzo), but why the hell would you?  Come here with an appetite, and I am sure that you will go away feeling good and ready to hit the tables again!

pIhfAwuHTfCt_zSxH08Naw.text: So this is the Cheesecake Factory in Vegas.   I don't remember what we did that made us so tired and hungry (gambling, probably...) but I'm glad we made a stop here.    If you're tired of all the other cafes that open late at night with the Hot dog + pizza menu, I'd definitely come here. I think they have a decent menu for a cafe that opens until the wee hours of the morning.   Our server was super busy (on Sunday @ 2AM), and was late bringing out our food, but the manager came and apologized for him and then offered us more food to tide us over, but we declined his kind offer.  I had the Max Burger and thought it was worth every penny.  What a giant mess!  I ate it in 2 meals.   I know, I came to a cafe and ended up getting a burger anyway, which I could have gotten down the street at Sonic's, but I still maintain that this place is better than the other cafes.    I would definitely come back, considering the variety of options and non- fluorescent atmosphere and esp. the fact that you pay the same price, but get more for your money here.

T21ffii2dw5vfjlHETyAeQ.text: So disappointed in the food and the overall grand lux experience We had one in LA in Beverly Hills, unfortunately it closed.  So now every time we're in Vegas Grand Lux is our first spot for food.  Today's experience was so disappointing that next trip well skip grand lux  #1 the restaurant was slow its at 3:00pm #2 they didn't have a menu item available and the server said to do the burrito which was a fail  #3 French fries were undercooked and cold  #4 The food was super salty  Just an overall fail experience so disappointing

Tg8L_zGepq1lwbMZX7hPsg.text: Peatra is the server to seek if you come to this restaurant. We stopped in for a late night bite and got her as a server. She was energetic, helpful, fun and knew the menu well. I would ask for her every time I ate there.

ANL-tsyds8A6ryXVcJtLiA.text: Came here for a quick bite to eat and split the chicken lettuce wraps & cheeseburger sliders with my husband. The sliders were very good, but the lettuce wraps won the show! They were so good! Good spot for people watching in The Venetian casino area and good food!

62voCc0mkZo2eWhJPEI2_w.text: Service wasn't too great here the waitress took forever and it wasn't even busy... We had to ask for the complimentary bread twice and straws.. The food was was pretty good but kinda reminded me of Cheesecake Factory ... The cafe bakery was great!It's kinda upscale but affordable considering it's in the strip...

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My cousin loved it there though ...

0p_W2_HhWHrz6ZPSch14aA.text: Went here for our last brunch in Vegas.  This place is huge.  It does remind me of cheesecake factory. Got here and was seated right away. Coffee was ok.I wanted to check out the  chicken and  waffles as recommended here.  It was good but not great.It needed a sauce so  I was dipping my chicken in my sisters chipotle sauce.  That was good!  Ask for extra!   With the price and decent food... I see why people go here.

Jiafi4j0aY4JQHr8BO1DYQ.text: ASK FOR RICK to be your waiter!!!! He is so warm towards his guests and looks so passionate about his job (or maybe life in general)!   My dad, whose trip to the U.S. is his very first one in the Western world, is very picky on the food. I almost gave up hope that he would like any restaurant food I order for him. He doesn't eat beef or lamb, so it narrowed the choices and at least made my life a bit easier. I ordered the Cajun flavor chicken for dad, and surprisingly, he LOVED it.  The rest of us got ginger beef and Thai salad. Everything was delicious and especially pleasing because our waiter Rick was awesome. My parents couldn't have better words for him.

w9ISuv4uvG79bJnNWEw8IQ.text: Go there and get those beignets/donut thingies with the dipping sauces. That is all. Puts Cafe DuMonde and fried/greasy/funnel cake type beignets TO SHAME.   Would go back to Vegas for those ALONE. P.S. the famed "Sunday night pasta" was just OK.  Not "grandma's Italian"  (Italians know what I am talking about)

fDcBlE3i9VxQKkAeJRrqYQ.text: The portions here are huge.  I was a bit sick this time around so all I had was the mango salad.  Can't review it this time around since my taste buds are off, but the salad was still good considering I was sick.  Will update it next time I'm in vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

SDPmI9vwdQ0e4Jg-pVuFAw.text: I'm so sad they closed their Beverly Hills location!! I truly love this place & now I can only indulge when I'm in Vegas. I came here with my girls at like 3:30 in the morning after leaving Lily. After midnight I believe, They only have a selected menu so I couldn't get my usual which is the chicken royale. But I got the chicken picatta & it was so good & full of flavor.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken picatta!! My new fave

j9XpUgGm6ueXPETd4zld0g.text: This was such a great place to go with family in Vegas.  The service was excellent, the food was exactly as expected, the portions are huge!  Everyone enjoyed their meal.  We had the chicken parmesan which was light tasting and fantastic, the chicken piccata, the ginger beef and my son had the steak.  Everything was cooked perfectly - wish we had room for dessert!

9OF8-6xR-UsRMyAy0nq1xQ.text: Their brunch is amazing! I would highly recommend their steak and eggs. It was soooo much food I took it back to my hotel to my disappointment my hotel did not heat up food from outside places and there wasn't a microwave in my room. Bummer since it was delicious should've just stuffed my face lol

88pEiDlAhGcWC4USu6GXfQ.text: Ordered breakfast here at 1pm. Convenient, cheap, and good! Friends ordered all kinds of pasta that was meh. Server was cool.  Overall, great because you know you're gonna be hungover when you eat here. Oh, and unlimited coffee refills for your long drive back home if you live in Cali

kQSxvFPeEPEvu28p4GZkig.text: Every time I come back to the Grand Lux I get better customer service and pretty yummy food!!!  I had to update my review because of the great customer service I received today, plus that the waitress that previously served me and my boyfriend the other day held onto my debit card that I totally forgot about on the table...the funny part was that I didn't even realize my debit card was missing until she asked if anyone of us had lost our debit card after she acknowledged that she remembered us from the previous day.

NMGSodwd9h7hBtygMAHQ-Q.text: This review is based on a terrible 20 minute end to an otherwise enjoyable time in the bar area of the Grand Lux Cafe. Two friends and I walked into the bar to have a couple of drinks before calling it a night (our first and only drinks of the night). One of us, who does not drink alcohol, ordered a coffee beverage (latte), his wife ordered a mojito and a shot of tequila, I decided to take a shot with her, so I ordered a shot of Belvedere and a pour of Balvenie 12 year as my sipper. The waiter brought out four drinks. The latte, my friend's mojito and two shots, one clear (vodka) which he gave to me and one brownish-gold (tequila) which he gave to my friend. I hate shots so I was waiting for my Balvenie to have something to sip after, but it was taking a while. Fortunately, I had a bottle of water I had brought in with me, so we went ahead with our shots (which were very generously poured, btw). After a few more minutes, I asked the waiter for a status on my Balvenie. He then told me he already brought it. I explained that he had brought my shot of Belvedere, but not my pour of the Balvenie. He didn't seem to believe us, but acknowledged and walked away, presumably to take care of it. A new waiter then came over and asked what happened, and we explained again. He seemed more accepting and intent on correcting the issue and proceeded to get my pour of Balvenie. With that in hand, we decided to order another round of shots. The tequila was way too strong for my friend, so she decided to take my advice and join me in another shot of Belvedere as I found it quite smooth. We drank our shots and the second one definitely tasted much harsher and was a noticeably more conservative pour than the first shot (if I were a more cynical person, I would question whether it was actually Belvedere) and continued talking, laughing and simply catching up with each other. Then the bill arrives:  They charged me for two Balvenie pours even though I only received the one I ordered. The difference between the Balvenie 12 and the Belvedere is only $1.50, but it wasn't correct and I did not feel responsible for having to pay for what I did not receive. I called the waiter over and explained that the bill was off and the situation (this is now the second one who came to help resolve the issue in the first place) and after explaining once again what had happened he acknowledged and stepped away. No big deal, people make mistakes. A few minutes later a gentleman that I presume is the manager, as I do not recall him introducing himself or being remotely cordial to us as customers at his restaurant, came over to talk about the confusion. I then proceeded to explain once again what happened. After a bit of what felt like cross examination, I and my friends explained the situation about three different times. Once again, the difference between a shot of Belvedere and a pour of Balvenie 12 is $1.50! One of the concerns this gentleman raised, which I found the most ridiculous was the notion that the first waiter was now gone and couldn't confirm what happened as if we were only now raising this issue and had not already addressed it with both the first waiter and the second waiter who was still present. Also, essentially implying that we were lying and without another, obviously honest, witness to validate our story, we should pay this bill. He then stepped away for quite some time, questioning the bartender, questioning others to get to the bottom of what he seemed to be treating as our conspiracy to pay $1.50 less on our $88 tab. I stepped away to use the restroom because he took so long to come back. When I got back, I was told by my friends that the presumed to be manager came back again and once again argued stating he spoke to the bartender and they confirmed that apparently the entire night they only poured two shots of Belvedere and two pours of Balvenie. Shortly after them taking me through this (our laughter, fun and good mood on our one night together in Vegas completely eliminated) the second waiter came back with the corrected bill, apologized sheepishly, and walked away. For the record, I do not blame the waiter. I'm sure he was probably trying to reverse and correct the charge, needed a supervisor or manager to approve this and then we got Sherlock on the case of my nefarious attempt to come to Vegas, spend an average of $90 on each of my personal meals, average of $20 on each cocktail at the Cosmo and Aria (which I adamantly recommend over this place) and $100 on a ticket to see The Who, only to cut costs and even out for the weekend by stealing a dollar and fifty cents from the Grand Lux Cafe.   (BTW, I just noticed the tequila shot was $18. If we were going to lie about a drink to save money, why wouldn't we go for the $8 savings instead of the $1.50 savings? $8 would have almost covered the tip I still left for the waiter).

z9a-DjKBMt8Q3DwCWAdDbg.text: It's owned by the Cheesecake Factory and it's open all the time.  It's a perfectly fine place.  If you want haute cuisine, you should know better than to patronize here.  But for a decent meal, it's just fine.  My absolute favorite thing at Grand Lux is the mini hot dogs with kobe beef chili.  The buns are divine, chili is excellent, and a fabulous mustard comes on the side.  It's the perfect drunk food.

OxiJUC9LG9__KngjCOD7UA.text: Went here all the time when I was a kid. Came here last during december 2013. Loved the shaking beef, so sad to see they dont serve it anymore. But the waitress recommended the spicy ginger beef which uses even more tender beef supposedly. It tasted almost the same just a little bit more spicy and gingery. I think if I ordered it without the spice and ginger it wouldve tasted nearly the same with just the sauce and green onions. But the spicy ginger beef was just WOW. i didnt expect it to be that good!

lo5y0cJ1oLYuF1qUQAmX0A.text: Great experience here. Awesome service and good food at a good price. I was mega hungover and in need of some quality grub. The hubby and I both opted for the sandwich special-half sandwich (BLT, chicken salad, turkey), salad and soup. The yummy fresh baked bread with butter to start off our meal totally hit the spot. Everything was delicious and very affordable, especially for Vegas.  They have a fab late night menu too. Totally going to visit there again :)

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sandwich special- half sandwich, soup and salad). Only $11!

aGOCsL3CCX9BAg2Ar9Vwyw.text: Good food. Friendly service. Came to the bakery to order to go, ordered the chicken and mushroom soup after their chicken avocado sandwich was a fail. The soup was very creamy and filling. Not bad for $5.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cup of chicken and mushroom soup
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken&amp;avocado sandwich

Ynru1VG0BEWA1yCtpWTQLw.text: This place is absolutely stunning.  The inside is an what I can only describe as an exact replica of Cheesecake Factory.  I told this to my friends as soon as we were seated.  And it turns out, that I guess this place is a chain since it sells trademarked Cheesecake Factory Cheesecake.  Once I figured this out, I knew the portions were going to be HUGE!    I ordered the parmasean crusted chicken.  After we ordered, we were given very fluffy and warm bread. We killed the first bread almost immediately.  Then I needed to use the restroom.  I hate how a lot of restaurants in Vegas have their restrooms outside and not inside.  It isn't convenient at all.    It took awhile for our food to come out.  We were hungry so we asked for another loaf of bread.  Yum, still warm and fluffy as ever.  Finally the food comes, and the presentation looks amazing.  The chicken was breaded very nicely and the edge was crispy as hell.  The inside was juicy too.  Although I thought the spaghetti that came with it tasted very bland in the beginning, I realized it worked really well with the parmasean chicken.    Eating regular meals in Vegas is so hard, especially for a gambler like me.  It's nice to sit down at a nice restaurant and have a hardy meal.

eM6KapR4GXP6Edu1Lk2M-A.text: The food is fabulous! I had the vegetarian tofu and its great.  I only wish the guy cleaning the tables near me had a little finesse. Wow, was he noisy!  I go to Grand Lux over any other places both in LV or Chicago.   Give them a try!

Rkbb0uzoeYw1MJdfdl2Vcw.text: There is a Grand Lux in Chicago but I had to come to Vegas to try out this restaurant chain! Unfortunately for us, the experience was only ok.  We arrived around 11:30am and were seated immediately.  We placed our order at 11:40am.  Our waiter took the orders of the table behind us AFTER he had taken our orders, but their food came out BEFORE us.  I was not happy.    Our waiter stopped by our table at least 3 times to tell us our food was on its way out.  I seriously wanted to tell him to not come back until he had our food in his hands!!! Strangely when our food was ready, another person brought out our food. Maybe he was afraid of us?  I had a pasta dish which I was really looking forward to, but it only tasted ok. The pasta was dry and hard.  Really lacking in flavor. I was disappointed.  My friends ordered the breakfast dishes.  They tasted pretty good. Maybe I ordered the wrong dish? I'm going to have to try out the Grand Lux in Chicago just to see how things match up.

5H3BZo0wd-KhrXjer0auBg.text: Good food, reasonably priced, similar menu to the Cheesecake Factory, we ate there several time. Ours was in the Venetian, there is a similar one in the adjacent Palazzo, open 24hrs.

wjvsYZC8OAnUlD2vkbNaWQ.text: This place is great specially if you can't decide what kind of food you are craving for. The menu is so full of various kinds of food-pasta, seafood, salads, ---open 24 hours-reasonable price for large servings--we ordered the hummus and pita flat bread for appetizer--it was delicious! ordered jambalaya--it was good but the brown rice that came with it was not that great! I would come back here again to try other dishes.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Inside the Venetian Hotel - casino area

JmNwzXNyb2kyMbEh-Eb5tQ.text: My whole experience is good, but I gave them just one star because of one of their guys who was so rude and I'd never seen the behavior like this before, of course I think the guy was not in normal condition. I asked for High chair and he pushed me back and told me Bring your voice down (my voice was low). I was surprised by what happened that two ladies ran toward me and bring the high chair in a second. Unfortunately, I didn't see the guy's  name. Other staff were so nice and perfect. I was with my family and friends and I didn't want to make a terrible day for them so I refused to complain to the manager.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

CEuSBuqA_MXgdhE-OdHnLQ.text: I thought this place was great. Came on a busy Friday night around 11 PM and were seated very quickly, though our food had a bit of a delay that came with it, but the service was very friendly and apologetic. They have an unbelievably expansive menu and the prices are mostly reasonable for a high end hotel restaurant. The portions are ENORMOUS. Enjoy.

YFaANGBEzGH7_afAnsIeoQ.text: Came here on a Friday morning because someone online said there was. A breakfast buffet . but there wasn't it was an old post.  We got seated in 7 minutes  Ordered the Belgian waffles with strawberries it was good Salad and pasta pomodoro, pasta was toooooo salty Ribs and half chicken, ribs were really dry, but the chicken was decent with extra BBQ sauce.  The only thing I can recommend was the waffle.  Our server Kim  was on top of her game .

WeVUS6GNp36e-SNh68KCiQ.text: We ended up at Grand Lux because the Venetian was going to be compensating our visits to restaurants at the hotel, and so we figured we might as well try it.   When we headed in, the restaurant was a bit dark, with a very comfortable atmosphere. The service, however, was decent but not really great. They were cordial, but not very attentive or friendly, which I suppose was fine since we were more interested in talking to each other anyway.   To start with, the drinks aren't bad at all. There was always something good to drink, at pretty standard prices.   The food is actually mostly decent as well. We tried some dinner/lunch food such as burgers and also a chili dog meal, and they were okay, though perhaps not the best. The desserts, however, were absolutely wonderful. Our favourites were the creme brulee (I'm a huge creme brulee lover, so getting to try two was pretty nice) and the beignets, which were amazing.   If I were specifically looking to go out, I might not choose this, but when we were headed back from the casino or the club, or just looking for something to eat nearby, it was a trustworthy option.

Sk1gAmUfVWSLeSc81LhQPQ.text: Worse service ever. We were the only customers seated in the back area since we were 5 in the group. The waiters and waitresses never check on us if we needed something and every time we needed more bread or water we had to call one of them.  When we were done eating, nobody check on us if we needed dessert or more food. The service was so bad that we had to ask a waitress where to get our bill to pay for our food.  We should not have given them any tip but still gave them 10% in gratuities just for the food.  Food was okay except for the poor customer service.

ndS8chiLLJM38qS501a0mw.text: One of my favorite places we are in Vegas! The bread they give out is great. I got a salad and my fiance got Beef Wellington. We split butter cake for dessert. Everything was delicious and the price was great for the amount of food you get. Next time we are in Vegas, we'll definitely be back!

xC2d3G89SgD6Xmg-uzHdcQ.text: Yummy restaurant, but painfully slow service............  First time we were there, it took forever to get the bread! That's after asking for it too. And our drinks...... Took like 20 minutes! 20!!!!!!!  The food was good, my boyfriend had something with chicken, pasta and shrimp, and I had the spaghetti carbonara.  The next day I ordered pick up and brought it up to the room. The pancakes are delicious, so is their chilaquiles. Perfect hangover food.

gnUEBizMfUUEpyu_AR-tOA.text: This is the best cafe in Vegas! Just walked over from Caesars at midnight to grub out on oversized portions. Started out with a Belvedere Dirty Martini which was huge and  had the Seared Ahi Tuna salad for my entree! Fortunately I was able to split a mushroom cheeseburger which was awesome.  There wasn't any room for dessert cause I got to look good at the pool parties!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seared Ahi Tuna Salad.

gjLI5gPJA9XFtOlPdoQzBw.text: After 3 days of convention and fast food, I decided to dine in and eat real food. Hence the Grand Lux, a great place to have a casual meal in a clean and spacious restaurant with stylish decor (yes like Cheesecake Factory).  I ordered a soup and salad that came with sourdough bread. The soup of the day was chicken tortilla, simple but very flavorful and filling. The sourdough was probably the grossest (is that a word?) I've ever had. The ceasar's salad was nothing special.  I also tried their chicken and waffles, which comes with no sides so I ordered fries as well (fat @ss!). The dipping sauce for the chicken is really what enhances the dish and the waffles were just as delicious.  The service I received here was better than mediocre, our server was friendly enough and the food was quick. Great food, good service, extensive menu and a nice looking restaurant. I will definitely return again.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. yumm...ohhh vegas

jdsZmcdzcZ-3306c7rl58Q.text: Came here with my boss on a business trip as our first dinner.  As we approached the host, we were greeted with eye contact, a salutation and a hand beckoning us in.  Imperial pint of Boddington's...Check.  The menu here was extremely enticing and I found myself struggling to select just one dinner.  We decided to order a plate of nachos as an appetizer to start us off and quench some of the hunger within.  After drinking some beer and some nachos we decided it was time to get some dinner.  Boss order a cheeseburger and I opted for the Grand Lux burger (with the spare rib on it).  What was delivered was a vision of pure deelish.  I love burgers (I've done Collin's Pub, XXX, Red Mill, and so on)...and this burger definitely would give them all a regimental rodgering.  I think I spent about 15 solid minutes just savoring all of the flavor of this burger.  Whatever they did to my burger I hope gets repeated into perpetuity because it was magical.  Enjoy Yeeps.

RkE98wI1uISKUsxlbQFt-g.text: Absolutely terrible service!  Very average food!   Coffee machine been broken for weeks and no signs of being repaired.  Tea water comes out totally cold. Twice.

iCF2GcQtFt_yDtr22KIJRg.text: HORRIBLE SERVICE. A usual late night stop for us in vegas. its always been alright.   On June 30, 2013 i went for my late vegas dinner around 11:50pm host and hostess were unorganized. but the waitress on the patio took the cake. I have NEVER been treated to rudely. After waiting for 10 min. with no one coming by I stop this young african american lady asking if she was our waitress her response, sure. alright my friend starts to order she literally rolls her eyes and starts a conversation with the table next to us! I get its vegas and late at night but atleast take our orders nicely and id be happy with just that.

r0_z_bHnB8nch06fT5h5mg.text: This little gem in the Venetian served the best meal I had in Vegas for this trip! I had the Chicken Parm and it was so good, nice big portion, the chicken was tender and the cheese, pasta and sauce just right!   My friends all enjoyed their meals as well. You can't go wrong here, great value for your money, I hope they do not change the quality and portions of the food because I will be back every time I go to Vegas. Excellent.

FQTQSUK2qTf_UAaRM5zaFA.text: Yo! You MUST ask for the waiter Daryn! Not only did he get my meticulous order correct, he was even able to chat with the chef so that my friend and homeboy could enjoy their chicken and waffles. Hey if you're going to eat the fat and consume the calories- said good should Always be ridiculously fresh. Daryn made that happen! Not only did he make sure all our food was fresh, he also ensured that my sauteed spinach was just that and not slathered, drenched and drowned in Olive oil! Shout out to the chef on duty tonight/ this morning 4/26 @ 4:51 am

94nwSgstnn-_Nq1rZBDLmw.text: I ordered a "Sunday Night Pasta" (meat sauce simmered with short ribs, steak, mushroom, short ribs, onion, garlic, Parmesan served over Spaghettini). The sauce was tasty and the portion very generous.  I also had a piece of my friends "Double stuffed Potato spring rolls" - spring roll wrapper filled with mashed potato and bacon, cheddar and green onion. These were delicious - crispy and cheesy.  Overall I found the food good value and tasty. The spring rolls were a definite winner and I will be back for these.

c2xRxh1AMYPxrrRBZhmaGg.text: During my 11 day work trip to Las Vegas (where I managed not to kill myself), I visited this Cheesecake Factory location a couple of times.   Oh wait. This isn't another Cheesecake Factory? It's actually the Grand Lux Cafe?  Wow. This place had me fooled.  Regardless, this place features a friendly staff, good food, decent prices, and very flexible hours. Had I came here drunk, my rating might have been 4 stars.

r0AzEzm-QmryQya3ZqbhiQ.text: Don't get the chicken tortilla soup. Actually, other than hating the soup, I can only remember loving the free bread and butter. Nothing else was remotely memorable. Unless you get comped and have nowhere else to go, save your time and money.

kYRG8Y9Sj2XI5XHcaHosww.text: Basic. Just what you would expect, but not as good as the Cheese Cake Factory. Warning about the club sandwich, the bread was so toasted (or maybe the crust of the bread started out hard and crusty), that is could literally cut a steak. I couldn't even pull it away from the rest of the bread without making a mess of it. And not enough mayo on the sandwich because it was really dry.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

_HyBNkWQfPDXFEyGSFLpRQ.text: We ate lunch on our first day in Vegas & had the crappiest service. We then had breakfast here the next three days & service was fine on one day & fantastic the other two.  The portion sizes were huge & delicious.

kF4RtepOIiq6WFplMJ-UOQ.text: My first meal in Vegas was here and it really set the bar high for my food expectations for the trip. Now I'm notorious for ordering a classic breakfast with just eggs,bacon,toast, and some kind of potato. I had every intention on doing just that but spotted a plate of chicken and waffles being dropped off on a table next to us.  Well that changed my mind in an instant! And I'm happy to say, my last minute decision paid off big time. It was probably the best chicken & waffles I've ever had! They served it with a side of honey butter syrup that was so Damn good, I could seriously drink a gallon of it. It was just the meal I needed to walk up and down those Vegas streets.

Yyn1KN93DjArmxE4VtdAbA.text: We came in right on time! I noticed a bit of a wait after we walked in. We had an amazing dinner. Great vibes, food, and drinks. Our waiter George was fantastic. He gave us fantastic recommendations, and even better service! Thanks George!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best ever!
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great Service George! Thank you sure to be back
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

yFumwjoblvTJptzbH3W_9w.text: It's so loud and dark in here bc the lights are dim, my son wasn't able to tell the difference between the pancake syrup and the melted butter!!! My order was the Huevos Rancheros, they lacked flavor and the excess cumin on the red sauce was overwhelming!!! They do offer a breakfast buffet but we passed. My husband wants to come back for lunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Huevos Rancheros
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu at Grand Lux Cafe inside the Venitian, Las Vegas

gP2sI0s59eNhqgNgi2Skew.text: This was are go to when we stayed in Vegas for a bachelorette party! They literally have some thing for everyone! I would consider it a less overwhelming version of the cheese cake factory! Great portions, great food, and great service! I will so go back here every time I am in town! It always feels impossible to pick a place! Even better- the wait was hardly ever long!

j791IYDaU0jRl8bN9YOopQ.text: Went here this past weekend and the food was delicious. The portion was huge, especially the sandwiches/flatbreads. I ordered the Spicy Flatbread Chicken Sandwich two days in a row. The downfall...it wasn't spicy! Not even a kick. It tasted good anyways.   Garlic Shrimp Pasta was very creamy and had lots of baby tomatoes, yum! I would order this again, but have them tone it down with the salt.   Chicken Parmesan: chicken and sauce was good, but the spaghetti was on the dry side.    Blood orange soda was really good!!!!   Service was absolutely wonderful (on Friday). My husband and I had the pleasure of having Otilija serve us Friday night. She was sweet, professional, respectable, and very personable. On Saturday evening, the service was okay. I was not too happy with the service. The waiter started off nice, but it seemed like he didn't want to wait on us after we ordered our food. The sad thing is that he didn't even thank us when we left and he was literally standing a couple feet away from our table waiting to take away the check. Yes, he was even looking at us.   Whether it is breakfast, lunch, dinner, or even midnight snack...this place is great to dine at.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy Chicken Flatbread with a side of mixed greens
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy Chicken Flatbread with a side of fries
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Garlic Shrimp Pasta

rTSqL-_fUuui3sS6PsO8lw.text: Visited Grand Cafe Lux Cafe twice during our stay at the Venetian.    There is a bakery attached, the muffins are delicious!  I enjoyed the egg, hash brown and bacon breakfast.    The service was very good as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

5pY-CBZcozSivof38zqsng.text: John from customer service/corporate reached out, listened to my horrible service experience, and sent me a gift card. John also assured these weren't normal Cheesecake Factory practices and  the manager and waiter of the time will be reminded of this.   I appreciated the call and of course the gift card.   Updating my review based on the food; which was absolutely delicious!!

lGIL5zCsaMXQokEVpqPpjw.text: I love their super yummy SUNDAY NIGHT PASTA and never fail to order it every time I come to the Venetian....

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. SUNDAY NIGHT PASTA

GQKN83njxbiyLSxFPVgQwA.text: @ the Venetian   Friendly staff Eddy( Eduardo ) "NOT ED". Defat was kind and chatty. I ordered the assign nachos. Which were delicious and filling. I'd definitely order those again. My main course was to be the short rib ravioli with white Parmesan sauce, sound good. WRONG. It was horrible.  I took two bites as was totally grossed out. The meat was not seasoned at all the the dough didn't seem fully cooked.  Eddy took it back and took it off my bill.  I would come back but it's a no on the short ribs raviolis

Lc2F1170fgiEDFsctFcvpg.text: This place is a hit or miss. We came in for brunch on a Saturday morning, starving. Our party of 9 was seated once everyone was there, surprising considering the place was empty.  Everyone in our group was vegetarian- hence we had questions about possibly modifying certain meals ie removal of meat and apparently the server didn't like having to clarify with the kitchen. Maybe there needs to be an indicator on your menu of an item can be made vegetarian?   The food came out after a long time of waiting. We had to flag down other staff to get drinks ordered because our server would flee the area as quickly as he could.   The food was mediocre at best. The vegetarian burger was dry and kind of bland. When we pointed out that there was an issue with my friends burger the server practically yelled at us to ask "what's missing?"...   The potato spring rolls are really good, Mac and cheese is worth skipping, nachos are decent.   A couple people got omlettes and the orders were all wrong but we had already waited so long for food that it was not worth sending back.   I would give them 3 stars for food, but the terrible service and attitude of our server really made the experience terrible. It was so uncomfortable and to a point where we almost asked for someone else..

Xzstql0GIMl8ZLWFCPy8VA.text: The staff at both locations were extremely accommodating I made a reservation for happy hour at the Palazzo and the manager went out of her way to ensure our happiness   The food here is also some of the most reasonably priced on the strip

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This restaurant is super accommodating the staff is wonderful and probably  one of the most reasonable places to eat on the strip

uwObWE4dKPVxr6PcCbAYfw.text: Really love the Cheesecake Factory...knowing this is its "sister" restaurant we thought we'd give it a try.   It's very good.  We had the wanton nachos...sticky yet very flavorful.    We loved the beef Wellington...so good.    Definitely worth a visit when attending a show or shopping spree at the Venetian.

Y2C00wMGv7twOwfc7ukCrg.text: My wife and I went there last night for dessert after a long day in Vegas. It was really nice time and our server Jason couldn't have been better. He was very knowledgeable about the menu resonated and amazing cucumber lemonade and also recommended the amazing brownie sundae that couldn't have been a better ending to an amazing day.   The only thing that he say about the grant looks cafe is that I did not see that grand. It was very dark seem to be kind of small and compared to the location in Chicago it just seems like a nice restaurant not very grand though.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

IzuoxY-pUqzPbcz7PKBapw.text: What a lovely view of... the smoke-filled casino. This restaurant is located inside the Venetian and is right next to the casino. I'm not sure if maybe the air hindered my tastebuds or what but this place really didn't do it for me.   The menu is pretty much food that you would find at the cheesecake factory, but more expensive and kinda sloppily put together. Honestly pretty mediocre food.  I started off with the Ahi ceviche ($13.95) which includes raw ahi tuna chopped up and combined with lime juice, onions, cucumber, avocado. It was pretty good with the chips but didn't seem that fresh. Chips were crispy. The Cajun Shrimp & Chicken Jambalaya ($19.95) was pretty basic and nothing special. Just seemed like a bunch of stuff thrown together with some tomato sauce and rice. The Almond Crusted Trout ($23.95) was bland and the breading wasn't crispy. At this price, I would have expected the presentation to be a little better, instead of just putting things on a plate. The trout had string beans just thrown on top of it.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ahi ceviche ($13.95)
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Almond Crusted Trout ($23.95)
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cajun Shrimp &amp; Chicken Jambalaya ($19.95)

m7LxI5YuX_47yOtiBdwz6g.text: Service can be slow here but the slider apps are great. A convenient place for casual.

2778rbykljALKMf-6Qcmsg.text: Overall another good dining experience. I had a burger and my wife got the soup and salad special.  Only thing is that when it gets busy the service can be a bit slower than usual.  However the quality of the food makes up for it.  I would recommend this if you are hungry for just about anything.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I ordered the bbq burger.

JiYF-B4WLLWOktUsr9OuDA.text: Nice small cafe spot. I ordered the chicken salad sandwich and the honey vanilla latte and they were both good. Found this spot on my last day at the hotel wishing I would have found it sooner. The staff was friendly and helpful

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

YA0Z42xiPiwi0LphLgEt4A.text: At the Venetian, the Grand Lux is a great choice if you want good food with outstanding service at reasonable prices.  Had lunch and breakfast at 2 different locations inside Venetian/Palazzo, and was happy with everything.   Highly recommended.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken enchiladas
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mai tai
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sangria! Yummy

kZdPsmXkVg5IqYaGWKaYYg.text: I underestimated Grand Lux Cafe because it's owned by The Cheesecake Factory. I've been reminded not to judge a book by its cover, or jump to conclusions. I adore both the full-service restaurant, as well as the bakery section, where you can pick up to-go orders. There are two, one in the Venetian and one in the Palazzo. The Palazzo serves cooked food until 3:30am, and then cold salads, sandwiches, baked goods, and all the espresso drinks you can dream of. The one in The Venetian is 24 hours. I've had several things on the menu, as it's on a property that I work in. The quality of every single item on the menu was beyond satisfaction, always extremely fresh, and made correctly, to the "T." I'm sure I will continue to go there many times over.

plR2Y1dwy2VctfDIcQ5upw.text: Such good food and service! Parmesan crusted pork chops was amazing!! Our server was on top of it, our water was always filled!! We went in a group and all of our food was amazing, the brussel sprouts were delicious and I love the pork bao and their potato cheese spring rolls! When I visited I went their like 3 times since it was so convenient too since we were staying at the Venetian. Also had their BBQ burger which was also AMAZING! I also recommend drinking the strawberry lemonade! I highly recommend this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

By410GzawXypurtNTxRVlg.text: I enjoyed my breakfast with hubby here on a Saturday in December. We got there around 9:30ish am and no wait at all. The hostess took us to table in the bar area. Our waitress was very nice and suggested the breakfast brunch $24.99 which I kindly declined. My mind was focused on fried chicken and waffles. The waffle was light and fluffy topped with pieces of pecan and fried chicken were shaped as sticks. The fried chicken sticks were coated in panko and seasoned very well. Overall I enjoyed my breakfast. The waitress was very good on refills of coffee, water, and soda. I would come back again for dinner. FYI, parking at Palazzo is free for now.

DyMOM-DP2_NA4YWbdM-xCw.text: Such an amazing experience!  Didn't have milkshakes on their menu, but after a short conversation with the manager Matt he surprised us later with a milkshake he managed to obtain. He really went above and beyond and the rest of the staff's service was ridiculously amazing.  The food was great!  Overall best experience I've had at a cafe

cfIdrkMZWEhl3xN4M_oI_g.text: Ate here a couple of times during our stay at the Venetian.  This place reminds me of a Cheesecake Factory knock off.  The decor and menu is quite similar and anyone can find something to munch on given the diverse and plentiful options they have.  Our first visit was for dinner and service was great.  Our server was on the ball and came by to check on us many times during our meal.  Portions are out of control and enough to feed at least 2 per entree.    Our second visit was for lunch before leaving Vegas and the service then was a bit marginal as the waitress that time seemed to be all over the place.  She forgot to bring out people's orders and had to go back to the kitchen a couple of times during that visit.  Overall, if you are dining with a group who has varied taste, this place will fit the bill as anyone should be able to find something they like off their huge menu.

rkaYGrnkntuXQeZemWkOwA.text: Excellent service from our waitress Jessica. She was very attentive and on target. The food was fresh and plentiful. A great way to start off our anniversary weekend.

OMOFqwYGGG1et3glJtN9fg.text: I really really really like this place a lot. I found out this place is owned by Cheesecake Factory - amazing made all the sense in the world.  Menu is not exactly but comparable and actually had some great things they might wanna consider rotating at CCF.  I ordered 2 eggs any style with an English muffin the first morning and had a breakfast sandwich with a substitute veggie patty (cause I don't eat pork) - food was delicious, service was great.   Great gem inside the palazzo - excited to come back :)

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ugpWfgSRo9ozgj0PQIGGFw.text: Great food. Went here for Saturday brunch. We were seated pretty quickly. Loved the ambience of the place. The portion size is very goood.  We ordered 2 Dishes for 3 people, we still had food to go. Both omelette & flat bread were good. Loved their cappuccino.

d6_4bXUmbL9lqfWdTw7msg.text: Went to Grand Lux Cafe for brunch with some of my girlfriends for a bachelorette.  We decided to find somewhere convenient since there's a huge group of us and we were getting hangry, so down the elevators a few steps- we found this place.  We were greeted by a hostess that brought us to our table of 10. We had our drinks ordered by a waiter after 5 minutes.  My friends and I decided on the Grand Mimosa which has sparkling wine, Grand Marnier and OJ.  When it came out, the strawberry was very old and was going bad not only for my drink but my friends had the same issue.  The drink overall was so flat that I left it after taking 2 sips.. So I wouldn't suggest ordering this beverage.  For brunch- you can either do the Grand Lux Express, where it's a buffet style breakfast and you get to pick and choose what you'd like from bacon, sausages, eggs, crepes etc over at another room of the restaurant where it is hosted.  But I opted out on that and just got a basic eggs, ham & toast kind of meal.  Everything tasted fine, mediocre and nothing extravagant, I mean, there's nothing special about my dish anyway.  My friends seem to be okay with their dishes.  There really isn't much to complain about if you're here for a solid basic meal.  Wish we were here for lunch because I would much rather have that at 10am than my boring breakfast.   Our server seems flustered because there was so many of us that it took awhile to get the orders in- delaying our food... And we didn't want to give him a hard time about the mimosa although 4 of us couldn't finish it. All in all, it's a place to eat- that's it lol.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Typical breakfast with crispy hash, ham and scrambled eggs! Mm.

rcv7Yds7WZyAg4XpalHFmg.text: Came to celebrate a birthday  and it turned out to be an excellent choice. We started the evening with Patron Anejo shooters. Nice, chilled and smooth with salted rim and lime. Server recommended her favorite Salmon Trio so we ordered it with a Cesar Salad. We were sharing and was looking to order an appetizer but the server thought the entree and salad would be plenty for us. She was right. The Cesar salad had crispy Parmesan cheese on top which was tasty and I love crunch.  The three taste of salmon were all very delicious  Asparagus, green beans and mushroom.were cooked to perfection. Ended the evening with the "best carrot cake" and it tasted just like Cheesecake Factory's...and come to find out the two restaurants have the same management.  Service was excellent and about five minute wait because we didn't like the first table; and was moved to a booth.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

pPnNAeZCdCRLCQ6lCtVY-g.text: Grand Lux Cafe is comparable to the Cheesecake Factory. It was so freaking good. My boyfriend and I were just looking for something to eat. This place was moderately priced, there wasn't a wait, and it got pretty good reviews on Yelp. Their wait staff was on top of things. We got some bread and our waters. It took us a little while to look over their menu; there were so many options. Again, it was comparable to the Cheesecake Factory. Both the Cheesecake Factory and Grand Lux have similar dishes. I ended up ordering the chicken pot pie and my boyfriend ordered some sort of Thai chicken. At that point, I had never eaten chicken pot pie before. I only got it because I was craving peas and carrots. Haha, I don't know if anyone ever craves peas and carrots. We were both in for a treat when our meals came out. They were HUGE! It was lunch time but we ate so much that we couldn't eat dinner that night. There was enough food for four people. We hate wasting food, so we ate pretty much all of it.

GUAKFyBuNOcl1lZAUAHr0w.text: It's an old favorite but we haven't been for awhile but decided to eat here on our last night in Vegas and was quickly reminded why it's a favorite. We had Calamari, salads, flatbread, black cod lettuce leaves so good! We finished by sharing an amazing butter cake with both whipped cream and ice cream so yummy!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummy butter cake with both ice cream and whipped cream! So good.

uyqfx9Rca2DKoWp9mnnEPg.text: My girlfriend dragged me there by force basically (its a mystery how someone so small can be so strong lol). I loved the place! I read yelp reviews that helped me make a choice on what to order. Everything was sooo delicious!  We ordered small chicken pot pie, chicken buffalo balls, and spinach and artichoke dip. Omg! Everything was seriously delicious! That chicken pot pie tasted amazing and it was huge! Somebody here complained about the "small" size of the pie (and they ordered large! - are you out of your mind girl?! This thing is enough to feed an army.. Exaggerating, obviously.. Lol but the point is that even the small size is actually pretty big, enough for 2 people to share or for 1 person to eat but without ordering anything else. Keep that in mind. Artichoke and spinach dip was also perfect. Great texture! I could taste all those crazy calories but it was so good that I didn't care anymore lol Buffalo chicken balls with ranch were good. My gf is obsessed with them, really. I liked them but I didn't care for them as much as for chicken pot pie and s&a dip. I will absolutely be back to this place, so many other good things to try. Can't wait :)

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spinach and artichoke dip - delicious. Great texture
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken pot pie - soooo god, mouthwatering good, fingerlicking good! I need to stop now but it&#39;s very good lol
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Buffalo chicken balls with ranch - really good

9o8hf1vgYJ9SyyzjaiAWXA.text: One of my favorite places to go in Vegas because it's always so consistent. If you like Cheesecake Factory you'll also like Grand Lux as they're owned by the same company. Be prepared for the huge menu just like Cheesecake Factory.   For the first time, I went with the fish of the day which was Sea Bass. For my 2 sides, I went with broccoli x2. Got capers and onions to go on top as well. My buddy got mushrooms to go with his salmon and I borrowed some of them. All together it was delicious! At $23.95 it was one of the most expensive things on the menu so the place is reasonably priced in general.   The fish was moist (definitely a little undercooked but I didn't mind because at least they didn't dry it out) the broccoli was hard and understeamed but also didn't bother me.   I didn't try it but my buddies had the bread and it looked heavenly.   This really hit the spot after a day in the sun at Tao Beach.   Will definitely be back and you should give it a shot too!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sea Bass, broccoli x2, onions, capers, no oil on anything as requested. Delicious!

SV1SamJR3CuX0LEe6PkvoQ.text: Had the worst service imaginable for Saturday morning brunch,  which is hard to believe considering the food is a buffet and the only thing the waitress had to do was take the order and refill drinks every once in a while.  I was out here for a conference that had just ended and was dining alone, and it was quite clear that I was an afterthought to the waitresses.  It was 8am on a Saturday, and the place was pretty empty at that point so the wait staff had me seated very quickly as there was no line. I sat at the table that I was placed at in the bar area and waited almost 10 minutes for someone to take my order.  I am usually understanding and don't want to cause a fuss, especially when a place is busy, but there were only 10 diners  in the room at the time, and four waitresses. Eventually one came over and asked if I had been helped yet, which I had said I was not and she apologized and took my order and brought me my coffee, water, and Tabasco.  A few minutes later, the waitress that I guess was actually supposed to be assigned to my table, the check later said Patricia Z so I'm guessing that was the waitress that was supposed to be helping me,  asked if I wanted juice as it was included with the buffet and I politely declined as I was fine with coffee and water, and I guess I was handed off to her at that point, which was a shame given the first waitress to help me actually did something.  I proceeded to the buffet and finished my water first, and as I noticed that no one was coming back to fill it I started my timer and started nursing my coffee.  Eventually I finished my coffee as well and now had both glasses conspicuously sitting at the end of the table, and finally 28 minutes and 34 seconds later the waitress that was supposed to be working my table finally stopped by and asked if I wanted a refill (yes please)! She then brought refills of both along with the check (I guess that was supposed to be my sign to leave).  As I was drinking my coffee and water she stopped by later and conspicuously stared at the empty check book and asked if I was ok (huh, ok). During this time she was doting on the table of 6 that was sitting next to me, obviously now banking on the better tip coming from them, which I was not going to disappoint her there due to the non-existent service. I took to writing my Yelp review halfway through waiting for the refills, and as I was still typing she came back with a table busser and asked if I was done while removing my empty plate and asked if I needed change. At that point a line was forming outside the restaurant, so obviously they wanted the table, and I wasn't going to cause a scene, so I said no and walked out.  Unfortunately the check amount was $27.01 and I was regretting not having any loose change but did have $28 so she unfortunately did get a $0.99 tip that she did not come close to deserving.  I would definitely stay away from this place.

Tn7JvEAGYF5f-Q4if4cOaw.text: This was a random find while in Vegas.   Food options were great and delicious. I think I came here on a slow night as there was no wait and we were seated quickly.

qxHgW9xadYqndhLwl-k8VQ.text: You know how when you're on vacation and you just eat nothing but junk food and feel like you need to throw some veggies in your body? But then you also don't want to because you're hungover in Vegas? I ordered the Mendocino salad because it checked off all the things I like in a meal size salad I am eating in place of deep fried vacation foods. Grilled Chicken Avocado  Goat Cheese something crunchy  (Cornbread-Cheese Croutons! super yummy) and weirdly, Dates - which worked pretty well. Light vinaigrette and I was sold. So I am familiar with US portion sizes but this salad was so friggin big I was shocked. I can eat a lot but after 15 min my husband commented that it didn't look like I'd touched it. I conceded defeat. Deadly salad, bring a friend and share it.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

XEWhAA4R5mO_woUZXR_nxg.text: Great place to eat with kids. Generous portions, great food and service! Pancakes are amazing best I've had in a while. Turkey and Brie sandwich with sweet potato fries are delicious.

sDMRTiOTv30vluiVA0uKFQ.text: This is my go to place for late night food in Vegas.  They used to have a grand Lux Cafe in LA but I heard it shut down, so sad.  I like the location inside the Venetian better than the one in the Palazzo but the food is just as good at both.   They have great bread,  good omelettes refreshing ass Arnold Palmer's. The patty melt is good all of the sandwiches are great. The grilled cheese with pulled pork is yummy as well as the Santa Barbara chicken sandwich. They have those amazing cafe fries that are crispy but soft at the same time.   BUT, The most amazing thing they have in their Encyclopedia like menu are the burgers. Holy shit their burgers are bomb. Outrageously good!!!!  Add bacon, cheese, avocado, crispy onions, add mushrooms, add pulled pork, add anything to it and it's going to be delicious!!!!! Man it sucks that I can't get one in Los Angeles anymore. But one of these when you're drunk or even sober is out of this world!!!  Also David was our server last time and he had such a great attitude for working the overnight shift dealing with a bunch of drunks, lol  Great service from him!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The amazing burger
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Burger is out of this world omg I drool just thinking about it

pelUEzbdTJslTuTsmMuJgQ.text: AVOID!!!! I wish someone could  have warned us about their customer services. Ordered a Cesar  salad and took more that 15 minutes. They were more concerned about a couple having a loud conversations than providing service. When I asked for a waitress to check on my order she gave me the ugliest look like if she was doing me a favor. AVOID THIS PLACE.

gytyNCMpjXGvk-PD9vU22Q.text: Went here Sunday for lunch. First let me say the price for what you get is excellent for Vegas. We ate lunch at the bar and the two bartenders were amazing. Totally focused on customer service. I had the best Cobb salad I have ever eaten and my wife had carbonara.   We are planning on going back Tuesday.

n0g3s4kN7QbT70ciZbeUGA.text: Ate here for my sister and I's birthdays and we highly recommend this place. We made reservations ahead of time because we had a large party so they put us further away from everyone else. They serve warm bread and butter while waiting for our food. Everything on the menu is very good and not too pricey considering it's a restaurant in the Venetian! This place is just like the Cheesecake Factory (I'm sure they're under the same ownership) with a bit of a different menu.  The staff is friendly and the food came out pretty fast considering the amount of people in our party.

q9lBTSmdi4g6FJPHcgc0SQ.text: Reminds me of Cheesecake Factory, only a more luxurious version. This place is HUGE and extends far into the back. The menu is equally extensive with just about anything you could want ranging from basic salads, sandwiches and burgers to breakfast foods to Asian fusion items to insanely large desserts.    We dropped by at an off time (2:30PM) but the place was still very full and busy. We had an early dinner planned so we opted to share a few appetizers and had drinks. We shared the spring rolls, crab cakes and strawberry shortcake dessert. Note: even though it says "spring" rolls these are more like egg rolls and deep fried. The inside is kind of a mushy texture so it wasn't obvious that it was chicken and shrimp. The crab cakes were surprisingly good, with each (two per order) a good size and filled with a generous amount of real crab. Mustard-y sauce was a great tangy complement. Strawberry shortcake was huge with a large scoop of vanilla ice cream in the middle and topped with whipped cream and strawberries. Very sweet and decadent but not the most amazing in terms of quality of shortbread. Drinks were solid and the drink menu offers everything from wines to different kinds of bellinis to bloody Mary's and more!  Overall solid option and great for variety but nothing amazing.

5aU_AKQsYwnRqZomfhduZA.text: When I was younger and a lot more frugal, this was the fancy place to get a good meal.  I absolutely loved it.  Now that I've eaten and can afford the fancier Venetian restaurants, this one is just A-OK.  The restaurant is also unnecessarily dark.  I would've preferred a little lighting at the table.  I got the fettucini alfredo which was insanely heavy and the extra broccolini and sundried tomatoes did not lighten it up.  I felt a little too full after this.  I remembered this as really great food on a nickel and a dime.  I recommend it for those on a budget, but in general, I probably wouldn't come back unless its the to-go menu.

e7RY5qMmv5mULI4XhXSWtg.text: Amazing place.. where else can you get beef wellington for $20 and it was perfect?  Chicken carbonara was amazing also.  They bring you fresh warm bread.  Service was great, so were the drinks. Can't beat the price in Vegas for sure.  Loved it all.

Tk-1nxFWZTYDF38x1lsKUA.text: Fantastic every time. Wait can be a bit long but the food is always superb.  Great value considering this place is housed in one of the most expensive resorts on the strip.

7teBZQ93jZuBB8IW5ddlSg.text: Somebody posted a review saying this is exactly like the Cheesecake Factory, and I'd have to disagree.  While yes, it is owned by the same people, Cheesecake Factory, to me, is a too-large menu where every dish comes to you simplified and blander than necessary where if Cheesecake Factory would just figure out what they wanted to excel in- they'd be great.  Enter Grand Lux Cafe. Exactly what I've wished Cheesecake Factory would do. Grand Lux seems like they figured out everything they did well, and only put those on this menu. Either that- or I, and the people at the table, ordered really well.  But, what really stood out was our service. Quick, no nonsense, and always there for a refill, question, or helpful advice- LINDA C. was THE BEST server I have had in a really long while, and (if you didn't notice) I'm very critical when it comes to service. Not only was I a restaurant trainer, but moreso- I was a BOH trainer, and anybody in the industry knows- there's an unspoken line between Front of the House and Back of the House. So, a server of mine is already battling with some prejudice when I sit down.  I have to tell you- if I could- I'd take Linda C. with me to show any future trainees- THIS is what a server does, how they look, how they act, and the service every customer should expect when they decide to be lazy and not cook their own food.  I hope this review finds its way to somebody at Grand Lux for further accolades for Ms. C.  I couldn't have been happier with my meal.  Easy 5 stars.

xz2sPpOCA_CCuXc-tFbwGw.text: Date. Saturday Time 6:39 am   We are at this moment at Grand lux Palazzo Vegas.  Keep in mind Grand lux Venetian we have had great  Service and food,  since they opened   Grand luxury palazzo front desk Girl very nice.  But waiter here a Real jerk .   My husband notice waiter taking Food order from customer that Came after us. We had been waiting Over 7 minutes . ( African American  Short guy - no name tag so I am describing for identification purpose Only .  My husband said hey I thought you  Forgot us, he answers maybe I should  Very nasty comment from a server  That depends on customer tip.  Food was average but waiters attitude Ruined our happy morning.  He avoided Talking to us after that.   No name tag is bad, wish I could have  Given his name instead.  So if you go.  Palazzo Grans Lux Not the best of two locations

OLxyqJmE2nSalltccxAxIg.text: A nice place to visit incase you are nearby. Not the best lunch menu, breakfast could be better. The front hostess was a bit rude but our server was great. They are pretty accommodating with choices and make alterations which does tell that it is pretty fresh!  The lemonade's were good and the orange juice was fresh too. Pasta was a tad too al-dente for my liking but my friend's enchilada and veggie burger was good.  Portions are generous and a good value for money. 3 stars for crunchy pasta and not-so-pleasant hostess.

SLFLKoMXoHEmcaptnb7bow.text: Asian Nachos (6/5 NOMs).  Holy fried wontons! This is probably one of my top pic in Vegas so far. Its Asian-Mexican fusion dish! I just ordered this appetizer as a full entre. And trust me such a big order that it will fill you up. Where can you find Crispy Fried Wontons as chips Covered with Chicken in a Sweet-Hot Peanut Sauce. Topped with Wasabi Cream and Melted Cheese. Peanut Sauce was very strong, maybe a bit too much, but I didn't mind it and ate the whole thing. Got to get this again!  Waffle (5/5 NOMs).  Waffle me up with thick waffle. Can never go rong with something so thick. Great way to start the day :) or continue late night of clubbing! Nice and thick, just the way waffle should be.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Asian Nachos (6/5 NOMs)
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Waffle (5/5 NOMs)

uyV60T9kBrCjaUT1P6jZtg.text: Pretty disappointed. Came here with a friend and the fiance on my last trip to Vegas. We were tired of walking and wanted a bite to eat late at night. We saw the good reviews and though we'd give it a try. We ordered the jambalaya and ahi tuna tartare. The food fell below my expectations. I thought it would be similar to cheesecake factory, but the food was worse than than cheesecake factory for sure.   Food:  Chicken jambalaya: pretty weird, but okay in taste. The chicken was separated from the rice, which isn't traditional of jambalaya. it was more of a stir fry spicy chicken with the rice on the side.  Ahi tuna tartare- Not the best. Didn't stand out and not particularly appetizing for me, but I'm a raw fish/sushi snob.   Price: pretty expensive for the quality. Similar to the cheesecake factory price wise.  Overall, if your desperate and hungry and don't want to go off the strip maybe consider eating here, otherwise take your money and appetite off the strip. Some of the restaurants in the asian town are open pretty late.

I7lH1pzd1seOfdyCB4UoXg.text: This is one of the best restaurants I've ever been in Vegas. The portions are big, fair prices and excellent service. Lory was our server and she was super nice with all my family including my 2 year old boy. I will definitely come back here next time I visit Vegas. Thank you for a wonderful experience.

slKTAVDEWKhwYOI8ac4noA.text: My fiance and two of our friends came here on a Sunday for a late breakfast and although I will say the food was amazing, unfortunately the service was not (hence the 3 stars). We were sat right away which was great and upon arriving, our server came over to greet us and gave us a few minutes to decide what we wanted to order. We ordered some coffees along with our food and honestly our server was super personable and nice...the weird part was that this was the last time we saw her.   As we waited for our food, a few tables were seated after us and got their food within 15-20 minutes while we still hadn't gotten ours. So we continued to wait maybe 30-40 more minutes without any sign of our food and not once did anyone check on our table. Finally I waved someone down (he looked like the manager) and let him know we had been waiting for a long time and were wondering how soon our food would come out.
