He simply said "it should be coming out soon" so I asked him if it typically takes this long (the restaurant was half empty) and he said "well no, but your server was feeling sick and went home so it just took a lot longer than normal for anyone to put your order in". I guess it made sense since we never saw her after we placed our order but I just thought it was weird how casual and non-apologetic he was about the whole thing. I would just think someone would've come over to let us know what was happening in which case we would've been understanding of the situation. Another 15 minutes go by and we get our food everything was great minus the bagel that came with my fiance's entree...it was literally burnt to the point that the bagel was entirely black so we asked for a replacement. That was it...we never got a new server and no one ever checked on us again. We had to waive someone down to get the check and even then it took so long for anyone to help us. Not that we would expect any sort of comp, but I was honestly surprised that they didn't once try to make up for the lack of service...we paid full price for everything and the manager didn't really seem to care that we had such an terrible experience on their accord. Maybe this was a fluke but I doubt we will go back after what happened which is such a shame because we go to Vegas all the time and the food really was delicious.

ZHbw--KtXj8_hWH4PGtDew.text: This restaurant looked very nice and has a lot of potential however the execution is one of the worst I have ever seen.  First of all the menu is very large and confusing. They give you a menu that has all the options for the entire day instead of what you can actually order for the time your eating.  Even without this extra menu there still are a lot of options that make your choices confusing. If I wanted a buffet I would be going to one of the numerous ones on the strip.   We had a fairly large party for a wedding rehearsal. Now this can be quite a hard task to cater 18 people but they had numerous mistakes that were simply aggravating.   Half of our table was completely ignored for ordering both the drinks and food. The appetizers were already coming to the other guests before we had to insist on ordering drinks.   Also the food orders started coming out wrong as well. Appetizers were brought instead of the actual main course.   Luckily however the food is fantastic. I had the Mediterranean Mahi Mahi and it was some of the most flavourful fish I have ever had. Everyone else at the table as well were raving about the food.   It may have been that we caught the waiting staff on a bad night. I would be willing to come back again to see if it was just an abnormality. .

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mediterranean Mahi Mahi.

XjtfSP6vtQLJe12VyB8c6g.text: We just finished a very good breakfast today! Refills on coffee, water and buttermilk pancakes a large as a standard plate. I ordered an omelette which I struggled to finish. Georgia went with the Egg Benedict which I was glad she shared! Hash browns were 'ok'. Some of the best Orange juice ever! The waiter was quick and attentive. We left very satisfied! Yes, I do recommend! P.S. A huge breakfast buffet is also an excellent choice!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Here is what we ate for breakfast at The Grand Lux!

Zfh6yuGfjGvmiURcfiF_HQ.text: It is so great here!! I had the Zen Noodles,  (rice noodles, sliced chicken, onion garnish in the soup and on the side they put spinach, cilantro, jalapenos, and bean sprouts) and it is soooo good!   I was helped by Michael Angelo (he said this to me that's why I put the full name), and he was a really good server. I was also seated very quickly and the hostess was very nice and held the chair out for me! The food came out quickly as well.  A definite must and I recommend to everyone!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Zen Noodles! Lights were dinner style so had to use flash :) so relaxing!

8e0N5U4gfMLLck0tK8VILw.text: Our second visit here - the first was a late night dinner after Phantom in June and the Short Rib Grilled Cheese sandwich ($13.50) was so memorable, I had to get it again! Although their horseradish sauce could use A LOT more horseradish - they probably have to make it super mild for middle America.  This place is really affordable for Vegas standards.  Lunch or dinner under $40.00.  Some other great dishes here are the Sicilian Pasta ($10.95) and the Short Rib Shepherds Pie ($14.95).  They start you off with fresh sourdough bread, hot from the oven and the iced tea is fresh brewed.  The menu is giant, just like it's parent company The Cheesecake Factory. Definitely a satisfying meal that's easy on the wallet!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Short rib grilled cheese w/fries $13.50
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grand Lux Cafe, Venetian

5snP9AlOoo_TRu9kpmfMyg.text: If you want to enjoy a awesome b fast and listen to Phantom of the Opera tunes, this is the place to visit. Sit out front on the patio if you can and people watch.  My B fast order - corn beef with eggs and sliced tomatoes with English muffin. This is one of my faves for corn beef due to the corn beef is in chunks and is awesome tasting. The chef puts bell pepper's and a small amount of potatoes.  Yes it's pricey at $13.95 but it's all about the quality here.   My friendly waitress from Chicago Amanda was awesome and has worked here since  they opened - 13 years ago now. The Grand Lux is owned by the Cheesecake Factory and the menu reflects their similarities.

5_hUFzKyE2Au1YQnt3KmeQ.text: This has always been our go to place as well. I love their casino royal chicken. Our friends have always like their choices like the spaghetti , chicken parmesan, alfredo and the sandwiches. Except this time the bread had the hardest crust you can imagine. It would break glass. Otherwise .... Everything else was GREAT!

6-viHqFLZ4rWBoPvuWuR9A.text: One of my favorite breakfast/brunch/lunch spots on the strip! A very large menu with many variety. My husband loves the breakfast buffet with the set fee, there's an omelet station, tons of pastries and other breakfast options. I love the mimosas and cocktails here too! I do miss the monte cristo sandwich here, WHISPERS: bring it back! But the cubano was just as great!

XfWgsJHWsW69wGAM92_VJQ.text: SImilar to cheesecake factory  +1 open late +1 great food +1 servers are tolerable of all the drunk people +1 HUGE servings +1 decent prices considering its a touristy area

n1BtdsuOqN_ynTq_wFgFVw.text: Located at the Palazzo hotel Our family had a great breakfast here Their best by far was the chicken and waffles. I've never tasted waffles like this before. So light and airy and the exterior is so crispy. Dip it in their caramel syrup....Devine :)

cp3_gWt6aPSql57M9F0ucQ.text: Came here not once, not twice, but THREE times. First night I was vaguely reminded of the Cheesecake factory. The menu and decor are pretty similar so I was excited. First things first, you're in Vegas. Order some cocktails. I had the Peach Bellini, Lux Cosmopolitan, and a Mai Tai. I was buzzing my way outta there when we were done.   My party of 3 had the Buffalo Chicken Rolls and Crab Cakes to start, then onto the Garlic Shrimp Pasta and some Pizza. We had to rush to get to Surrender at Wynn/Encore. This was about 8pm Friday.  5am Saturday, we were coming from Drai's after hours. We were STARVING so we had the famous Steak & Eggs dish.This time, we didn't get dessert. But wait for it.  Following night it was 10pm and we were a little drunk. Not exactly throwing up everywhere and all but things were spinning and our sense of balance just wasn't happening. We came again and this place was kinda busy! 4am! These people never quit in Vegas. Our servers were extra helpful - must be common for them to get delirious people in Vegas because of the heat and the massive consumption of alc. I ordered the Sticky Bun Bread Pudding, friend ordered the Strawberry Shortcake. Let me tell you. I don't know why I chose that over the Cheesecake or the Molten Chocolate Cake, but man. MMM MMM MMM. Sweet, soft breading and crunchy cause of the pecans. Good portions too!  I have to say, with the amazing experience we had here THREE times, we're coming back. Until then, What Happens in Vegas......

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Peach bellini and angel hair pasta

K9V4sBWGWcpZlMADe2QRqw.text: Since the food court in the Casino area at Venetian does not have many options, my coworker and I decided to dine at Grand Lux.    They have very extensive menu and the portion is huge.  Their food is nothing special but good overall.  Service is great! We had a very attentive and polite waitress.

6-KlBDhw3W8zN_EV7ipAAw.text: Solid 3.5 stars, how can anyone not have a good time here, it's good for casual and good enough for higher-end too.  Another good place for late night munchies, a bit gloomy for my tastes, made me sleepy.  Ordered their famous carbonera, and while it's good, I've had better.  Overall, good value for the experience.  Located in the back, across from the washrooms which is convenient.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Ejw6X-dPanaXH8TCtd5JPA.text: Quick Tips:  1. Pretty easy for you to get in very quickly on almost any day. There is also a location on the Palazzo side near the elevators to the rooms that is a little less busy.  2. The theme of the restaurant and even the menus scream Cheesecake Factory to me, but the restaurant has very much it's own character.  3. Open all night! A great destination to unwind from post-clubbing shenanigans.  I love the Grand Luxe Cafe because the times that I've gone there, the servers are not only friendly and willing to give suggestions, but also they are efficient and quick.  Vegas is all about moving from one place to the next, sleeping, and then starting all over the next day. Grand Luxe offers the time for people to cool their heels with decent, quality food. My girlfriend usually orders a pasta dish, while I always try something more adventurous since we're always on a vacation.  It's so sad, but they took away one of my favorite menu items, a carribean style jerk pork chop dish. It had amazing textures and flavors through it, but I guess it wasn't really a popular choice among diners. Anyways, back to other foods, you will always leave Grand Luxe stuffed since the portions are huge and the food is pretty yummy.  One of the things that I really like about Grand Luxe is the price. Though it's $15-18 a plate, the food is still cheaper than dining at most of the sit-down restaurants across the strip. Furthermore, it's not like we waited for more than 10 minutes to get into the place. If it is too busy, and you are willing to do a bit of a walk, you can get to the Palazzo side that sees much less customers.  Anyways, I hope you guys try out Grand Luxe Cafe!

E8ccWgNsDIMxppA5xEYcOQ.text: I went here with my friend's family in celebration of his 21st birthday. Even though we missed our reservation because our flight got delayed, they happily accomodated our late party, allowing us to sit in the bar while they prepared the late night dining room. The food was delicious, and the cocktails were even better. Our waiter handled the large party with aplomb, and the entire experience was great. Of course, the food is pricey, but it's Vegas, and this is just a stepped-up Cheesecake Factory, so you should expect to pay more than you want to for a plate of pasta. Think $17 and up for pasta dishes and $20+ for meat entrees.

g-F2W8JNrxUprkFIMuUHCQ.text: This is basically a cheesecake factory without so much cheesecake and no brown bread!. It's open 24 hours, so we grabbed a light dinner before hitting the clubs and came back around 3 am for desserts. I'm in love with the chocolate creme brulee! The chocolate fudge cake and the bread pudding were good too. Unfortunately, they were out of the dessert we originally wanted to order (something involving bananas). For dinner, I wasn't too hungry so I split a margherita pizza with a friend. It was pretty standard

1iOXDkxtXxq1GV-8S5x2pA.text: I always end up here because: - it's open 24 hours - it's conveniently located in the casino, near the Venetian tower elevators, near the escalators, you can't escape it - it has variety in the menu and therefore should be able to please anyone in your group - it's cheaper than other restaurants in the Venetian and it's nicer/better than the food court  Why I hate it: - I go there too much - food takes forever.  It's open 24 hours but I tend to fall asleep while waiting for food in the early hours of the morning  Tips: - the complimentary bread tastes wayyy way better during the day than late night - don't get the asian noodle soup.. or whatever it was.. why get that here...

0Nzn8V15is4I2U72P-T_KQ.text: I LOVE this place. The food is really yummy, prices are not bad ...considering it's in the heart of The Venetian Casino, and the atmosphere is fun. I especially enjoy sitting out on the 'porch' area, as you get to people watch.  Service is sometimes a little spotty, as they are always crowded, and it seems like they could possibly hire another waiter or two, to 'float' and make sure everyone is good.  They don't take reservations, which sucks, but if you are a Grazie member, no waiting in the line.   On a side note, coffee is not good here, not sure why. I never like it, and anyone I have brought here, without exception agrees.

jniWYvVXbDlydYvSscnnTw.text: Last time we were in Vegas, we had Grand Luxe three times because we stayed in the Venetian so it was convenient. This time, we were at Vdara, but we just had to go there for our late night munchies. Totally worth cabbing there for food.  I love love love their Pasta With Grilled Chicken, Tomato, Basil & Mozzarella. (Their pastas are bomb!) The portion was HUGE. Although I was super hungry, I only ate about half of the dish. Good thing though because I woke up hungry still craving Grand Luxe and there was a good amount of pasta left! The sauce was flavorful and evenly distributed throughout the dish. Their chicken was A+. Chicken is my favorite kind of meat, so I am a bit picky about chicken in dishes, but the chicken here is DELICIOUS! It's not dry at all, and they give you a generous amount.  The boys all ordered burgers, and when their orders came out, I wish I ordered my pasta and a burger. Alas, although it sounded okay in my head, it's probably not socially acceptable to order two entrees, huh?   They are pretty busy at all hours, so you might have to wait for their servers a bit. We waited a pretty long time before someone came to take our orders. That was no bueno! But what can you do when this restaurant has a full house and a line at 1am?

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pasta with grilled chicken, tomato, basil &amp; mozzarella

9OEagfSYsUo6iJKQHpWg4A.text: Service was entirely too slow. We had to ask our waiter for bread after waiting a while and then we waited foreverrr and a day for our food. Plus side was that the food was good, although the fries were cold. It also took a while to find our waiter to get the checks, we ended up asking a different waiter to cash us out. I guess some of the wait is to be expected in a busy Las Vegas restaurant but 45+ minutes for food isn't reasonable.

QJ08q4zkPw-8KfkMjamxFg.text: Food is normal, everyday food, not much for vegans, but the service was amazing. Very friendly staff, and convenient because it's located in The Venetian.  We were in and out in no time.

TfXHhSHDzfk6clGWFacLlw.text: The Grand Lux Cafe is located in The Venetian Hotel & Casino, Las Vegas. The Venetian for those of you who may not know, is a very beautiful resort. There are beautiful interior features and rooms, a fabulous casino and a lot of places to dine at. There is something for everyone, from high end restaurants to snack bars. To each his own and I'm sure that even the most demanding diner will enjoy one of the restaurants. For me, I love coming to the Grand Lux Cafe because it has an upscale feel to it without the pricey menus. The fare is reasonable for resort dining and it's a very comfy atmosphere.   I came here for dinner on this particular evening and we were seated promptly. Upon being seated, the waitress took our drink orders, customary green bottle and water with a lemon wedge. A basket with fresh baked bread was also served. Next we proceeded to decide on what appetizer to have. We agreed on this creation called a Double Stuffed Potato Spring Roll. Let me tell you, it's awesome! Imagine a lumpia wrapper with mashed potatoes in it, served halved, crispy with melted cheese and topped with green onions, applewood bacon and a sour cream dipping sauce... I was absolutely in appetizer heaven! Probably not something you can partake in everyday, but a must when you are on vacay and enjoying dining out!  For dinner, I settled on the Ribeye and my dining companion had the Shrimp Scampi served on a bed of Pasta... I ordered the Ribeye medium rare, and that's the way I got it! Now that made me a happy diner. Now, it's not easy to prepare a Ribeye because you can't see it cooking inside, but they do a great job here. I was impressed because it wasn't a thick piece and the thinner they are, the harder they are to prepare. I glanced over at my dining companion and saw that she was happily enjoying her Scampi. There were lot's of generous sized shrimp and the pasta looked delicious! We enjoyed our dinner here and as for dessert, well, there wasn't any room left! Definitely a favorite whenever in Vegas, I shall return next trip!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. So refreshing...
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Double Stuffed Potato Spring Rolls
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ribeye

lNmGsUb7iwlwbEFXzQ59Rw.text: Absolutely LOVED this eatery.   It's 24-hour so it fit right in after we had a late-arrival in Vegas and were starving.  The service was fast, friendly and helpful!   I ordered the Grilled Steak sandwich but asked to special-order the prep on it to mimic the sausage sandwich (tomatoes, fontina cheese etc).  It was amazing!! Sliced (on the bias), chargrilled steak on a roll.   I was craving something grilled and this totally hit the spot.  Tipped the chef 10 bucks simply for creating it and doing it right.

d1zpJEqJury5Quyse7k5MA.text: We tried to do breakfast here for a business meeting during Money 20/20. We flagged down five different servers. It was almost impossible to get anyone to pay attention, to bring a beverage, or to bring food. I'm not sure they knew who our server was and therefore our overall service experience was terrible. Location is convenient inside the hotel and I have eaten good meals here before, something has gone all wrong with Service.

O7xiLKiS6XqGvnGxChaWLg.text: Great atmosphere :) reminds me of a fancy Cheesecake Factory. Prompt service. Great cure for the common hangover lol

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ate all of that!

gfSHApJKksjxNVMUhJDc0A.text: Went there last night with a friend. I ordered 3 way Salmon and it was no cocked in the middle. It was completely pink. The manager offered to make another one. He apologized and brought another one. He said he is going to check on me in few min. Few min later he came by and I cut two pieces in-half and it was worse than the first dish. He was embarrassed anapologized and wanted to get me another dish but at that time I lost my appetite.  I miss the Grand Lux cafe in LA it was awesome. This is the second time this location at Vegas was terrible. Last time we got there after midnight and all our dishes was greasy and terrible as well. I love the place but they really need to train their chef much better.

K3kuzavsOJaXRGYTQlqVow.text: Had the best crab omlette, I wanted to be healthy but ate all my friends hash browns and her breakfast sandwich! I recommend this place highly! They were pretty fast and the service was really good. The food is a lot, I have a large tummy so I can eat it all,m but if you don't I recommend you split

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Got the crab and asparagus omelette!

ZXtjo_REFMSRRsHiAA5fKg.text: Solid 3/5 stars on food. Service was 4/5--great, friendly staff  Apparently this is the "Cheesecake Factory" of Las Vegas.  First time here, but it is frequented by many of my friends.   Very extensive menu, so it took us a while to figure out what to order.   We ordered: 1) Seared Rare Ahi Tuna Salad: 2.5/5 Eh, good, but obviously not as great as Ahi at a sushi restaurant  2) Shrimp Scampi: 3/5 not shabby

koAUfJ2nKAZKzQsCu1hyOA.text: One of my all time favorite restaraunts in Las Vegas!  This place is especially good for breakfast.  My meal of choice is the homemade corned beef hash and eggs with a Belgium waffle on the side.  Service is always on point as well.  I've tried a lot of different dishes for lunch and dinner too and none of them have disappointed.  Check them out!

6OB0Qb2O_dDE9eYzhLMb0g.text: I was on the hunt for a baked sweet potato.  Husband really really wanted one.  I finally found Grand Lux Cafe had it and made the reservation for 16 people.    But they didn't have sweet potatoes!  I was bam boozled by the online menu.    Think Cheesecake Factory.  Giant menu with 1000 of food choices.  Good prices and hefty portions.  Our entire bill was $300, which is a steal in Vegas.    Didn't love it, but can't complain.

ky8MQbmWNUjf0Fyl1M0KWg.text: This place is SO great! A sister restaurant of the Cheesecake Factory but so much better. The menu is huge and a tad overwhelming. Even though the line tends to be long they seat you in under 10 minutes. The red velvet pancakes are to die for!   A must in Vegas

g6-A4hWHZeB7gRqmV-eVMg.text: Came in on a Wednesday night around 6:00pm, no wait line whatsoever, though my party was only 2. Had the short rib grilled cheese sandwich, amazing! Companied by 2 Moscow Mule cocktails. This is the spot if you are in Vegas, 24hrs! Don't let the picky eaters trick you into thinking this spot is no good, I read their reviews. They are just salty bitter people!

1sX_wuswuasILWPkUFcDmA.text: If you are on the Paleo diet/ lifestyle, it is sometimes hard to find a place to eat out.  This place fits the bill.  They will accommodate special requests.  I had the grilled salmon and double portions of asparagus.  I was a happy camper. My husband was also happy because he could order virtually anything he wanted.  I come here everytime I am in Vegas!

sWFyitvTAi5y5nvp2zSYyg.text: After making it to TAO for our stamp and open bar bracelet, we ventured out to look for food. Whaat? Don't try to tell me you'd rather pay to go in and booze!   We couldn't really walk too far since the girls had heels on and walking was really not an option. After a quick escalator ride, we found ourselves situated in front of the Grand Lux Cafe. I knew I bookmarked this restaurant but couldn't remember why and thanks to the awful AT&T network in Vegas, yelping it was not an option. (I remember now that I bookmarked it because it was good for late night snackin!) My friends and I were eager to try it since we were all starving! While walking to our seat, I couldn't help but feel like I'm in a Cheesecake Factory and what do you know.. it's from the same makers!  Between Mr. Dubs and I, we ordered the ahi tuna salad, duck potstickers and burger.  Salad and burger were yums but you can skip the duck pot stickers-- tasted like any other potstickers! From what I heard from around the table, the burgers were the best and judging from the few bites Mr. W. allowed me, it was yummy!  Prices are good-- anywhere you can eat a meal for under $20 on the strip is good in my book.  I'll be back the next time I visit Vegas!

oOI8iZbn9JfedV7pSwZ34Q.text: I first heard about this restaurant in 2008, a cab driver told us to try it out. Every time I visit Las Vegas we dine at Grand Lux. The food is wonderful. Large portions, great for sharing. My favorites are Shrimp Scampi and Thai Shrimp and Chicken Spring Rolls for an appetizer!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp Scampi
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Thai Spring Rolls

pWBKCICnvo2xDde8C5k84Q.text: Loved the food here. Atmosphere was very loud, but at least the food was worth it. Great place to go when you want good food, but not when you want to talk.

GpwUqwok1443S5d6FRAsRg.text: Had dinner with my family on our last night in Las Vegas. Our server Joey was very polite and helpful. The food is amazing and gr8 value for the $$ spent. I recommend sharing your meals as the portion sizes are enormous. Good ambience and very family friendly. Strongly recommend the Chicken Parmesean and the Beef Wellington.

KmHZ67KEcB3vRwn8lY4yxA.text: Wonderful atmosphere and fresh food. Try the huevos ranchero or white egg omelette.  Get the Grazie card and skip the line!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fun to people watch and eat!

rOoIFBvONIQIcZDDghjjXg.text: Food was fine, service was fine, hit the spot

WJlvyc9RhIMztTIbLg02fw.text: Unresponsive manager and people using their fingers to get food from the buffet! Yuck. Save the $19/pp and go somewhere else.   Ate here on a Saturday morning and ordered the breakfast buffet. Hot plates to put cold fruit on, if you can find a plate at all. Frozen cream cheese next to the strawberries (thinking it's whipped cream).....was so stuck to the serving spoon, that people were using their fingers to get it off on to their plates.  Bacon did not have tongs, and people were using their fingers instead. Tasteless food and chef burning cooked to order eggs was a turn off.  My husband was so dissatisfied with the buffet, that he ordered eggs Benedict off the menu. That was actually better. Hash browns tasted like they came out of a box, but the eggs were fresh and hot and the hollandaise sauce was very good.  When we spoke to the manager, he was hearing me, but not really listening. Did not offer any remedy. All he could tell me was that he would look into quality control. Our server was the one who suggested we order breakfast from the menu.   Walk right on by this restaurant.

TkHEY6jioTgl5VVbsQAwyg.text: I came here for a super late dinner with David G, Sarah A and Minh D on our first night in Vegas, and really liked what I had:  Joe's Special - a huge serving of ground beef, spinach and onions, scrambled into eggs, add avocado.  Served with hash browns and a bagel with cream cheese and jam, this hit the spot for sure!  I tried DG's Seared Ahi appetizer - a large piece of super dark red ahi, sliced thin and presented with separate little piles of cucumber, carrot and bean sprout salads. Yum dipped in the soy sauce with wasabi that it came with.  Sarah's Short Rib Grilled Cheese brought back yummy memories of years ago when I tried it - and Minh's Lox & Eggs looked delish!   I refrained from trying the red velvet cake, but I can't promise I'll make the same decision next time - my somewhat weak decaf coffee coulda used a little excitement!  Service was pretty good and the people watching at this hour was super entertaining : D.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Joe&#39;s Special

8XGgyZvTa6km9XOcvcvQYw.text: My husband and I visited Las Vegas for the second time. It was a weekend getaway and we decided to eat dinner at Grand Lux Cafe located in the Venetian Hotel on 2/24/2018. We were greeted and seated immediately. Our waitress (older Caucasian lady) was pleasant but we noticed the service was not good. We sat among 3 sets of Caucasians families and my husband and myself were the only colored people. We noticed that 2 of the families that were seated after us were given bread and their drinks came before ours. Then we noticed the manager or someone higher than the waitress greeted one of the families and apologized to them for the long wait. A manager or supervisor never came to our table and asked if we were ok. We had to flag down another waiter and asked him for our drink. The food was good but we lost our appetite after seeing what unfolded in front our eyes. Also we waited long for the appetizer and food to come out. It was very noticeable that we were serviced differently than everyone else around us. I think management should educate their staff more on not being racist and treat each of their customer with the same respect and provide equal service. The waitress was clearly racist.

psRgZEL5mq2DnP6cm_JPgg.text: This place never lets me down and I always try to come at least one time when I'm in Vegas.   Today (Sunday), we came after our first choice had a long,  long brunch-time wait.  My friend had the chicken and waffles,  which she often gets.  She said they seem to have changed/improved the chicken!  I had the Korean "burrito."  It's a chicken wrap with crispy fried chicken.   Fabulous!

GerFhtwy2na763Wj1JO48w.text: My husband and I went here for breakfast the morning that we got married in the Venetian. It was so fantastic and to this day it is probably the best corned beef hash I have ever had. It was homemade, not that gross processed stuff, and it had so much flavor. Everything from the eggs to the potatoes and of course the best corned beef ever was just great.  The atmosphere is great and we didn't have to wait very long to get a table. It's casual and relaxing and we hung out for a long time. They had a buffet that morning but we didn't try it. We also tried the eggs benedict and that was solid too.   This definitely deserves 5 stars not only for the memorable hash, but bc it is in the most beautiful hotel in Vegas. I can't wait to go back and I will absolutely stay at The Venetian...and you can bet I will be having the corned beef hash every morning!

UCMe8pMfVa_iEeSEH4A2zw.text: This is owned by Cheesecake and it was fantastic!! Good quality and tasty little bites! The prices weren't outrageous either. Not sure why they have a 4 star rating! They aren't as well known as Cheesecake, but so good!

Tk3T2iK4PTsW-kj5uHCLQw.text: I'll start by saying that Debbie, our waitress, made this a five star experience. If not for her, it very easily would've been two stars.  We decided to come here at 1AM due to a lack of other veggie options (it seems like everything vegan is shut down at midnight for some reason).   The restaurant is nestled in the Venetian hotel, with bistro style seating right next to the casino. Inside, however, it's a bit more intimate with the dim lighting. We could still hear the occasional victory cheers from patrons who hit the jackpot in the casino. Definitely not a quiet place, but a nice reprieve from the hustle and bustle of the casino.   To start, we spent a good amount of time studying the drink menu. They've got some stellar cocktails, all on the weaker side and kind of expensive, but that's the Strip for ya.  Pina colada: not bad. Mojito: the bomb.  They've also got several wine and beer options for those looking to avoid cocktails.   When ordering food, we noticed they have separate menus available depending on what time of day it is. Their overnight menu has a lot of options: my friends got sliders, a breakfast plate piled high with bacon, and a couple cheeseburgers. They also have many steak, pasta, pizza, and salad options. But again, I woefully found a lack of vegan options on this menu.  This is where Debbie came in to save the day. She finagled with the chefs to see if they'd cook up a special dish for me. And they did just that. I was brought a beautiful plate of sauteed mushrooms, broccoli, asparagus, and brown rice. Large servings, well displayed, and made to order. It hit the spot and kept the night from going down a disappointing path.  We never felt rushed. And I was pleased to see one of the chefs, decked out in his nice white chef jacket, personally come out to let us know the progress of our meals.  Debbie checked on us routinely but didn't hover, and she really was a sweetheart.  Ultimately, it was a great late night dining experience.

K80Z3s5I7JLVFZsbkb-0qQ.text: Stayed at the Venetian so it was convenient for breakfast. Their breakfast ends at 11 am so make sure you get there by then. Breakfast was pretty disappointing after reading all the great reviews. Nothing special. I ordered an omelette with mushrooms Swiss cheese and scallions with hash browns and toast. The omelette was oddly served. I thought the ingredients would be scrambled into the omelette, instead the mushrooms and cheese and scallion were mixed together separate of the egg omelette. The egg omelette wAs just laid over my melted mushrooms and cheese. The omelette lacked any flavor. The hash-browns were tasty. The toast was good with butter. I ordered a tea it was pretty pricy for a plain tea bag. 4.25. But it's Vegas so shouldn't be surprised. The service was waitress was nice and listened to our order, the wait time was maybe 20 min or so from the time we ordered (omelette and an eggs Benedict, fruits and two teas). Do not think I'd go back unless I had to, too many other options to try.

KrxflcuNR4IaOvOgq9w0Bg.text: Awesome!! Everything amazing and fresh!! Fresh baked cookies hot out of the oven! Take's 30mins to bake so call or ask early. :)

fheNoXzogiir6kiHGUHQtw.text: I love the fact that this place is open 24/7! There's another location at the Palazzo, but they're not open all day though. My bf and I were craving for some food at 3 in the morning, so we set out here to get some grub!  When we arrived, we were immediately seated and our server was very friendly. There is a late night dining menu, which has your salads, pasta, pizza, steaks, and also the breakfast menu! Score!   We ordered:  1. Double Stuffed Potato Spring Rolls: This is a must-have appetizer! Creamy mashed potatoes with green onions wrapped in egg roll along with bacon, cheddar and a sour cream dip! Very savory and delicious. (5/5)   2. Fresh Garden Omelette: My order came with hash browns, white bread/jam! The omelette consisted of mushrooms, heirloom tomatoes, avocado, zucchini, spinach, Havarti cheese and sour cream. The omelette was very filling; I wasn't a fan of the tomatoes but everything else tasted great. The hash browns were so good! (5/5)  3. Rib Eye Steak: My bf loves his protein and meat. The steak was delicious and you get your choice of mashed potatoes or veggies. He opted for the mashed potatoes and OMG there were mountains of mashed potatoes on his plate! The potatoes were perfectly seasoned and flavorful, yum! (5/5)  Overall, the portions here are big. Like what the other Yelpers say, this definitely reminds me of a Cheesecake Factory with an expansive menu and large portions! Definitely worth your money! =)

Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rib eye with mashed potatoes
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Double stuffed potato spring rolls

jDqhVkVAm3_tDKTdganqtQ.text: love the chicken and waffles and love how they did the buffett too but i really love the food too wish yall can put one in colorado because the food is fresh n tasty

uw6DWFYNUPyxR9OKStmWRw.text: Zero help finding a decent plant-based meal. Front desk told us this place had a vegan menu, when we got here with a party of 5 people we found there was no options. Hash browns cannot be fried in anything but butter. Huevos Rancheros cannot be made vegan. Only option was the chefs were going to allow us to order steamed vegetables (bland much).   It's 2018 Lux, get it together.

bywDOouKh1-VLP1TwGWkuA.text: Took my family there and absolutely loved it. Great service, excellent food and variety. I recommend the indochine chicken and shrimp. This was the first time for us and my daughter said that this place is a must whenever we come to Vegas

DkPWYmL96h4FghewCoG3AQ.text: Delicious food- the kitchen was slow but the food was delicious- we are here every day during our conference. The chicken piccata, the ceviche, Spicy Thai Beef,  and  chilaquiles were the bomb ( the were take ot out with a delicious honey iced coffee) the only draw back is the sit down service and waiting for your  your food to be serve is 10x slower than eating at Luxe Cafe at the Palazzo- My friends loved the BBQ Salmon-.

7k2nTPHkCVHptHWmycs4iw.text: So you learn something new everyday... I learned that this restaurant was an extension/spin off (I don't remember the exact wording) of The Cheesecake Factory. My husband and I were in Vegas with friends and we were the last couple to get in. Everything else was closed except this restaurant. Overall everything was descent. The sauces on the dishes were really good, but my husband didn't really like how thin his chicken was.   The bread was pretty good with the butter. I had the Chicken Indochine Dish (a curry dish but had characteristics of an Indian curry and a Chinese curry). My husband had the Chicken Madeira. My dish was really good. The sauce was just right. I liked how they had cherries and apricots in the dish to add some sweetness. My husbands dish was good he said but the chicken was a little to thin. He said it was like they pounded it like it was veal, but it just didn't work for that kind of chicken dish.   Overall, it wasn't the best food ever but it wasn't bad for it to be a late night meal.

Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

GLiGsL7BmT2eu8yqrlr_bg.text: Love this restaurant. Unfortunately I need to come to vegas to visit this spot. Everything I have tried has been delicious especially when it comes to dessert.

3Y3f626KHwnSYfcYvb6Tcw.text: There's a grand lux in Chicago and this place knocks that out of the park. I'm a Chicago native and the Grand Lux is my favorite restaurant in Chicago. When I moved to Vegas I thought for sure this one wouldn't be able to compete and I was so wrong. I've eaten here three times in the past three weeks and every single time was a blessing. The waitstaff is incredibly attentive and friendly. They offer recommendations, however most importantly the food is cooked to perfection. I cannot tell you how much I love this place. As a local I try to avoid the strip as much as possible but the Venetian has free parking so I am more keen to go. Thank you Grand Lux cafe for bringing a little bit of home to my new home, and keeping your standards high. I can't wait to come back.

XeCZKuCeq3bY18bXXEMQdQ.text: One of my favorite places. Been here twice. Always great service and food. The portions are a bit on the large side. A+

pwiC2OTz3QxitKRDr201-A.text: Tanya, thank you so much! You made our experance there the highlight of our trip to the Venetian. Yes, the food is wonderful but how you took care us was stellar. Both my Heather and I think you such a doll. I dont know who has the bigger crush! Thank you again for everything. If Tanya's boss is reading this, I think a raise is in order.

K_MRv1b8xsQV5HHETT8GFw.text: This review is over 3 years late. :/ Sorry! My husband and I went here for an anniversary dinner. Good only knows what my husband ordered, but I remembered mine! A RARE burger. I emphasize- rare. I told them I want it rare and practically still mooing. Lo and behold, it came out and was perfect! I still think of that burger from time to time, which prompted me to finally review this place. I miss you perfectly rare burger...

fpmLUYbEFEiMqMRFed_Vmg.text: This place reminds me of Cheesecake Factory I came to understand that this is a sister restaurant of Cheesecake Factory I love everything in the menu especially breakfast part service is extremely good and you don't have to wait 2 hours for your turn

rHLqJTzyoNlxcz7uG6yGoQ.text: I really enjoy their menu selection and my husband and I truly missed when they closed down their California location. So upon our weekend stay in Vegas we knew that was one place we were going for sure.  I changed up this time and tried a new item and let me say the lemon chicken piccata was an excellent choice, (I wouldn't be upset if they allowed for 1/2 an order) I will definitely order that again on my next trip.  Both the service and food was excellent and I didn't expect anything less as we were frequent visitors to their CA restaurant and we knew exactly what we were going to order.

a-_f8TvNCJp6MpcwC1ok3w.text: They was a fly in my salad and flew into my sandwich I told the waiter about it and she seemed like it was nothing, and said oh it's just a little fly do you want me to just get you a new salad or you want a new sandwich too

zC_SMQgSf2X7lAqb6svp_w.text: Great spot to grab a late dinner. Prices area very fair for the Strip. As others have mentioned, the servings are generous. More importantly, the food was good. We opted for a simple meal - chicken club with regular fries and a burger with sweet potato fries. Both sandwiches were cooked nicely and the fries were piping hot. Our server was good, very cheerful for someone working at midnight. If you are tired of the buffets and/or can't drop $100-150 for every meal, Grand Lux is a nice option.

zJOpHVMcgO2ScY2pVmfzOQ.text: Fine place in the Hotel, nothing amazing. On the pricey side - I had a $9 bowl of oatmeal for breakfast.  For brunch they offer Menu OR buffet.

doq-frGHXj2HugU_hqmDSQ.text: The best place to eat when nobody can decide what they are craving because this place has everything. Always a must when in Vegas love this place and the service is always good!

BLNQftGW6LQiVbspY04VfQ.text: So happy we had the opportunity to try The Grand Lux Cafe. Our lunch was delicious and the menu has endless options definitely something for everyone. Can't wait to come back on our next trip

6tkb7blUs78jmeoTVNRhbg.text: We needed a quick lunch before our flight and they were super accommodating! We were in and out in 30 minutes.   I had the lunch special which included a half sandwich, soup and salad for $12.50. Pretty good deal! We also had the meat pizza which came flatbread style and that was pretty tasty too. Overall, it's a nice place for a quick lunch!

uGzZ_vUfJKKPadMCnd7Pbg.text: I'm clearly having a solidly three star experience here in Vegas.  I stopped in here for breakfast. I came at about 7:00 and even without a reservation I was seated immediately.   I ordered a pretty basic breakfast of eggs over easy, wheat toast, coffee and bacon. The eggs were pretty uncooked when indie them and the white were runny.   I will be looking for another place to eat breakfast while at the Venetian.

LhJ5stADEJ3h2k2flioJxw.text: Ambiance: spacious establishment inside the Venetian   Service: very slow yet friendly   Food: general ok   Buffalo Wild Wings - *** average taste, too sour   Egg White Omelet - **** we chose ham, mushroom, artichoke and Swiss cheese, freshly made, recommend    Orange juice - ** not very fresh and over priced       Price: in general most items are reasonably priced

yrt_EahfptSirY9Mu4t1uQ.text: This restaurant is pretty much like Cheesecake Factory, but not as good.  I believe they are sister companies.   I came here with a group of 6 other girls for brunch after a weekend of bachelorette festivities.  Here's what I shared with my sis who was the soon bride to be:  CREAM OF ASPARAGUS SOUP This soup was quite tasty and definitely creamy! More on the creamy side than the vegetable taste but it's so good! I wish I only ordered this!  SHORT RIB GRILLED CHEESE SANDWICH - $13.50 Slow roasted short rib, caramelized and picked onion, arugula and melted cheese, served on country bread. A plate you can share!  This crunchy and unctuous sandwich made also came with horseradish garlic sauce which really complimented it.  It also came with salad which I decided to have the cream of asparagus instead!  It's quite cheesy and greasy and all around good.  Although not the best grilled cheese I ever had, it was the greasy spoon I needed after a long weekend of drinking ;)   PASTA CARBONARA (lunch pasta & salad special) - $12.50 Smoked bacon, peas, a touch of garlic and karma dan cream sauce! We chose the twisted pasta instead of spegetti.  The pasta portion is HUGE! Definitely share-able.  although I had to ask for extra sauce because it didn't seam enough.  Overall this dish was okay :)  As for the salad, I'm glad it didn't taste like regular typical house salad.  It had dressing and a lot of the veggies that were decent.  My overall experience here was ok.  I feel we came here for convenience; it was in our hotel and we knew it had a variety of choices to eat.  Service was unfortunately weird although she was nice, there were a few mistakes and miscommunication  I guess.  Grand Lux is a place more for convenience than being part of the Vegas experience.

Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pasta carbonara $14.95
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Short rib grilled cheese sandwich $13.50

ROHIxYofA6S3c4Ob5P2EYg.text: 3.5 stars.  I constantly stay at the Venetian/Palazzo when I'm visiting Vegas so this has become one of my go-to places. It's convenient (right by the elevators to the suites), it's tasty, and it's open 24 hours. It really can't get any better than that!  I probably go to Vegas around once or twice a year so I rarely get to eat at Grand Lux (it's LA location unfortunately closed). Therefore, I always order the same thing when I go, which is the Pasta Telephono. I absolutely love it. It's got a nice tomato sauce, with melted cheese and bread crumbs on top. You can get the lunch portion which comes with a side salad ($12.95), but they only serve this until 5pm. The dinner portion costs $16.95. Kinda pricey for a pasta that doesn't even come with any meat. Adding chicken will cost you an additional $2, and they actually charge you per shrimp if you want to add that! I've never heard of a restaurant doing that before!  Anyways, I can't really comment much on their other dishes. I've tried a few others before and didn't have any complaints. They have a huge menu, including sandwiches/burgers, pizzas, and fried chicken, so you're bound to find something you like. It's very similar to Cheesecake Factory.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pasta telephono ($16.95 for dinner portion, $12.95 for lunch portion)

uHU7qaQaeQZS5AmwJOx8JQ.text: I usually stay at the Venetian and after a full day of traveling, the Grand Lux Cafe is the place to go. You'd figure with all the restaurants and snack kiosks around, why would someone visit the same restaurant twice? Well, first of all, it's the first restaurant you see walking out of your elevator... and also because they have great food at affordable prices.  They have three menus that rotate throughout the day. There's a morning (6 AM - 11 AM), a lunch (11 AM - 12 PM), and a late night (12 PM - 6 AM) menu. Each menu serves a variety of breakfast platters, sandwiches, burgers, and pasta dishes. There are two of the same restaurants somewhere in the area, so you have to check the hours cause I think one does close down for a few hours.  Oh one more word of advice, if you plan on eating there, call in and make a reservation, it gets pretty packed throughout the day!

EBz1w76DgBwnHzXePD-HbQ.text: Yum.  Post half marathon refuel on all the most amazing things!  I don't think there is a bad thing on the menu. Order fresh baked cookies when you arrive so they are ready for dessert. Consider sharing meals so you have room for those cookies.

Z_4g5yKbPzKqLVGUa5WkDg.text: Went for brunch on a Saturday...Service was excellent and food was decent.  Food was arrived quickly.

g--mToylzsLubyRgRG60rA.text: I went for a late night meal with my best friend and we both were extremely happy with the service and the food as well.  I highly recommend their steak sandwich. So much flavor, it was just perfection. And the creme brulee was just mouthwatering, it was the perfect finishing touch to send me to food coma.   But the service was honestly the best I'd had ever.  My server Mike was on top of filling our drinks and making sure we were satisfied!  And even the manager Matt, was making sure guests were happy and well taken care of.  Normally at restaurants you don't see manager's checking on their guests, But these two guys were on top of it the whole night. So shout out to you guys!  Most definitely will be back and will also recommend others to go :)

rmhnoYjGtYQI_DyU2-fktg.text: Have aten here for breakfast, lunch and dinner. The food is good. Their buffet is also good as they offer variety and you can have your eggs or omelette made by one of the 2 cooks on the back.

O08Jwvgjgne_Ep-epj4HTw.text: Okay so it's my husbands bday and first restaurant we thought of trying didn't seem appetizing so we wandered in the Grand Lux Cafe. We ordered the Bourbon Chicken and the Smothered Catfish. We modified the catfish dish and used the Bourbon chicken sauce and fried shrimp instead of sauteed shrimp. Husband loved the catfish. He called it heaven on a plate. Every bite was awesome. Our waiter: Jose Castaneda. If he's working make sure to ask for him. Hands down he was the most attentive, professional waiter and he made wonderful suggestions. Planning on coming back later tonight because the service Jose provided and the meal he helped us modify was the best we've had in Vegas. Thanks Jose!!!

gN1XPNPAm-0NiN7_GjdL1Q.text: Vegas seems to have a ton of "fake good" food. Glad to say that Grand Lux doesn't fall into that category. I stayed at the Venetian and only had Grand Lux on my way out - but it was a surprisingly good meal. I ordered a steak sandwich with a house salad - both items were really good!   The service could be better. Our waiter took forever to refresh drinks and take our orders, which could be forgivable since the place was packed. Unfortunately, he also happened to spill water all over my friends' plate and forgot to put in a couple of our orders. A bit frustrating, but definitely not reason enough not to try the Grand Lux.

ZEcXen-QjqsWdD7Kh5EKEg.text: As expected, there was a wait. Once we got seated,service was prompt. My server was very nice and recommended some dishes. Our food as a table was very bland and tasteless . I was a bit disappointed because I have had good food here. I think late nights the cook gets lazy. Even adding salt n pepper did not help. The cook wanted to replace the dishes with something else, but I was ready to go. Took the majority of my food home added some seasoning, it was then yummy. This mediocre food cost way to much for it to just barely be ok.

1OZGIjphldC-9CTWY63O7Q.text: I realize there's a new stigma surrounding chain restaurants. However, I have been rather fond of this chain. It was my go to in the web of lies of good breakfast places in Las Vegas. I have been told repeatedly we are a growing mecca of great food establishments? I beg to differ and Grand Lux cemented that fact. My go to has always been the pastrami hash and eggs. What I received was greasy onions, potatoes,bell peppers, pastrami, and no not greasy eggs too? No need to complain when you expect nothing more from a place you use to consider a great place to live.

UECjALmBJ33-Jfny-PNpTQ.text: My husband and I stayed at the Venetian, this restaurant was steps away from our room, which was great. We've only had breakfast here but the portion sizes are excellent and very tasty. I would definitely recommend this place. Our waiter was also very polite and on the ball. We ordered the chicken and waffles, the chicken strips were very tender and the waffles were perfectly made, not too soft or crispy. We also had an omelette with the hash browns (great size to share) also very flavourful and fresh, we really enjoyed our meals.  I

3zHxYJwP4QzvjcvTC0t3zw.text: I've been to Grand Lux multiple times while in Vegas. The one located at the Venetian is open 24/7 so it's perfect for those late night drunk meals everyone is craving. I've had breakfast, lunch, dinner, and the drunk eats here and I've never been disappointed.   The last time I visited here was this past weekend around 3am and had the short rib grilled cheese with fries. It was delicious and I had a bite of everything else my party had. Could have been because I was pretty tipsy but overall everyone loved their food.   I'll be back again and again.

iT70yzq3gRMObW9kOVe6gw.text: Came to the Grand Lux Cafe to eat twice during my trip to Vegas! We were seated quickly. The server made awesome recommendations. First time was for lunch and I got the lemon chicken piccata. Our server suggested it and said it was a decent portion. He did not tell me though that the lunch portion was enough to feed three ppl! He did say the dinner portion was bigger. It was full of flavor though and I ate until I no longer could! The second time we came for breakfast and I ordered the biscuits and gravy, gravy on the side because I'm a total weirdo. The biscuits felt very heavy, but they were flaky and buttery! It also came with eggs and these delicious smashed potatoes! Some friends ordered the chilaquiles which I also got to try and they were AMAZING!!!!!! I could probably eat that alone forever and be happy. Definitely can't wait to return!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

zE6jjy2DKQaAxn0Ty46FDg.text: This was a pleasant experience in a big cafe, we were seated quickly, customer service was good and food was great. I had the deluxe breakfast sandwich with hash browns it was very filling. It had scrambled eggs, ham, bacon, tomato, cheese, and mayo. Normally I wouldn't eat tomato with a breakfast sandwich but it actually tasted good. My husband had the build it yourself omelette which he enjoyed very much. We shared the red velvet pancakes but I thought it was too sweet. There was chocolate chip in it. Overall this place was great.

NSKE-o9axWkduHlYsdOLwQ.text: Okay, I'd go here for the free sourdough bread, alone. I got the pineapple mint splash drink and Thai Carmel chicken (as did everyone else at my table except my husband), and it was PHENOMENAL. GET IT! It's better than the picture let's on. I think they got awarded the 4th best burger in Vegas- my husband got the burger melt and it was way good too! Highly recommend this place!

BP5jwAJR0S3QbuVOYZSm3Q.text: Gotta love a place that gets it right...good portions..nice decor..Sunday brunch..good options for lunch, dinner, late night snack, etc  Can say enough about the service, which i thought was awesome!  Had the Madeira Chicken which offered me a slice of chicken covered in gooey cheese goodness at every bite. Sampled the Prawns served on a bed of raosted potatoes and i have no regrets there either  Two thumbs up from this foodie

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

FlaqpOpEoPFAA_XENbsVyw.text: You know a place is fabulous when:  Your traditional I-don't-prefer-any-non-Asian-food (nor like any-cheese for that matter) father sits down to lunch, orders the Caesar's Chicken SALAD (which arrives complete w/ a generous sprinkling of parmesan cheese), and proceeds to rave about how it's THE best salad he's ever had.  Over and over again.  In between bites.  Oh and my salmon dish was pretty good too.

14lKKMBSXKUNYLbJGRB8GQ.text: As a poker regular, I'm essentially handcuffed into buying food from a select few places during what can be grueling hours of play. Luckily, that doesn't matter here... As I have an extremely wide selection of quality food to choose from.  The thing that stuck with me of every meal I've had there was my omelette. The best I've ever had. Plain and simple.  It was a custom made egg white omelette with bacon, avocado, goat cheese, and sausage  Every meal I've had is usually phenomenal, the thing that brings me down was the zen noodles. They just are not good.   Price is overly expensive but as expected in Vegas on the strip

RzXkFP3NkkeejhBpe5pqQg.text: Late Night Cookies n Coffee only  OK, so hankering for something of substance in the sweet department, we wandered over to Grand Lux Cafe. (There's one fairly close to my place, but I've never gone --- for what that's worth.)  They offer chocolate chip/pecan cookies. In a box. Sounds good -- and they are. But, so ya know: Once we ordered them, the server told us it takes between 16 and 18 minutes. Verrrry specific. No problem. However, after not seeing them for, say, between 25 or 26 minutes later, I wondered what was going on...?  Meantime, my double espresso came, and that was just fine.   At last, the box o' cookies came and they were ..... pretty good. But only luke-warm. Now, of course, these babies have to cool. However, it's apparent they were ready, and cooled, and they simply didn't get delivered in a timely fashion. (Sigh) Not a deal-breaker, but certainly a bit of a let-down.  They are served in a handsome cardboard. And it's fun to take the rest with you. Just next time, I'd really love them coming out HOT!

PBUeO7G7B0pDlKxIxmO53w.text: What a great place! This has always been one of our favorite places to eat while in Vegas. Not only are the portions HUGE, but the food is delish, there is a wide variety, and it is always quick.   For this particular visit, we were seated by Matt, the Senior Manager. On our way to the table he found out we were from the Bay Area and actually from the same home town - small world! I mentioned to a friend how bad my heartburn was and how I was dying for a glass of milk. Literally, within a mintue of being seated, Matt was back with a tall glass of milk for me, and I hadn't even asked for it! Awesome service! I let him know I actually prefer Non-Fat but I was so thankful I would drink whatever, he insisted on bringing me the non-fat. That pretty much set the pace for the rest of the visit.  We had the warm bread - Nom. The menu selection is so vast we each had something totally diff. I went for the Pasta Telephono = GREAT success. I was glad my friends weren't flying home so that they could bring my leftovers back, way too good to let go to waste. We had a great time refueling after a night at XS and a long day roaming the strip. Matt's hospitality was awesome, and he shared with us some of the other locations around the country that have other Grand Lux restaurants for us to visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pasta Telephono!

od5TkRdwKfSZQANR83l4ug.text: Chefs made the steak half well and half medium-rare.  The service was very good, but the food wasn't very good at all.

CMgQ2wgYuzVwgbtfQ_MAfA.text: Items Selected: Red Velvet Pancakes - Fluffy Buttermilk Pancakes with a Hint of Cocoa, Chocolate Chips and Cream Cheese Frosting Caramel Banana-Nut French Toast - Our Brioche French Toast Topped with Sauteed Bananas, Pecans and House-Made Caramel Sauce Fried Chicken and Waffles - Topped with Crispy Fried Chicken Strips and Pecan Honey-Butter Sauce Warm Sticky Bun Bread Pudding  - Served with Whiskey Sauce, Sugared Pecans and Whipped Cream "The Best" Carrot Cake - Citrus Cream Cheese Icing  An 'upscale' concept from the team behind The Cheesecake Factory I'd probably walked past Grand Lux Cafe one hundred times before realizing the ever bustling restaurant was open 24/7, a strong selling point given my early waking hours that led to further investigation of a menu that seemed perfect for a touristy weekend with visiting family.  Somewhat brasserie in design with gold garnish and heavy fabrics plus a "patio" on the casino floor it was moments to seven on a Saturday morning that our trio was seated overlooking the Venetian's lingering late-night revelers alongside the morning check-outs and with immense menus soon perused selections were made - a sweet and gluttonous affair slow to arrive and marred by slow refills as staff seemed to be idling into shift change.  Admittedly more than a little puckish when plates were delivered nearly forty-five minutes later it was with relieved but bemused smiles that the three of us first laid eyes on the constituents of our $80 affair and although what was ordered would have been better suited for a half-dozen, the majority of it was worth the wait - an aggressively spiced carrot cake loaded with nuts plus shredded coconut and some of the thickest custard-drenched French Toast I've found both amongst the city's best.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Warm Sticky Bun Bread Pudding  - Served with Whiskey Sauce, Sugared Pecans and Whipped Cream
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. ...for three.  ;-)
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

aFbXtPFviyOt9JZEpUh6tQ.text: Potato spring rolls, Asian Chicken salad, Burban chicken, Pasta Telefono, Turkey and Brie sandwich, Veggie Burger, Shrimp Pasta, Buffalo Chicken sandwich, Crab cake appetizer--Everything we have ever ordered here is seriously delicious. The most appealing aspect of this restaurant is their consistency and open 24/7. (Except every other Monday from 12am-6am, when they do their cleaning! --Found out the hard way) We recommend it to everyone who comes into town! My only suggestion would be more friendly hosts at the front desk.

_g2jDgMJVEv10oXx_PERWg.text: I've been to the location in Chicago so when it came time to pick a place to eat for lunch we decided to go here - mainly because we were already nearby and the menu looked good.  There was no wait and hardly anyone in the restaurant but service was sooo slow and our waitress seemed to be in la la land. We asked for water 3 times before she finally decided to bring it and then she just left us there for a good 15 minutes even though we told her we were ready to order when she brought the water.   We finally order and the food takes forever to arrive. By this time, we've gone through 2 bread baskets and our water but she doesn't come back to fill the water, just brings another one and doesn't answer our question about where the food is.   When the food finally arrived it was just ok. My friend got the waffles and I got the southwest enchiladas. It all looked good but the portions were huge and the food lacked flavor. We got through about half of it before deciding we were done and once we decided on that, the check took forever to arrive. *sigh*

TQ66MRbmjEVQbLtKBoNoZA.text: Noisy over priced.  Breakfast is nothing special. Felt like a very noisy cafeteria with bad service.

Sl-5HCC61Nu3J7P8Fgp52A.text: Great serves. I found a hair in my salad, then the server called manager to apologize to me and my friend. And give the pasta and salad for free. Overall, food is okay, derive the price we pay! Recommended in Las Vegas!

PRTSPcfeN4rYXBEoZmCRaw.text: Apparently, not everything in Vegas has to be overpriced and hyped out because the Grand Lux Cafe completely made me swoon!  I never got the chance to eat in because I'm running around Vegas without that much time on my hands but there's a friendly, nice little take-out cafe right next to the entrance of the Grand Lux that I frequented!  Surprisingly, you can get a relatively good sandwich for $7 in this cafe. It is pre-made but none would be the wiser once you put it on a plate and ditched the wrapper. My gosh! I can't believe that I just got away with paying $7 for a sandwich in Vegas and it tastes relatively good?!  Also, the service here is not shabby at all. The girls that always help me are super nice and they take the time to make exceptions for me if needed and handle drunk people all night! I can't believe I didn't find this place in the Venetian sooner!

Vpj60wJBDEuwmLj9gYigHw.text: Seriously delicious!    My husband and I were staying at Treasure Island during a brief staycation away from the kids.  We knew we didn't want to eat at the cafe inside of T.I. because $15 for a plate of eggs is NOT okay.  I quickly Yelped somewhere for an early lunch and came across this place.  Since it's right across the street from T.I., we walked on over.  When we got there, I saw a line out the door and felt instantly defeated.  To my surprise, the line moved insanely fast and we were seated within 5 minutes of arriving.  The place is MASSIVE and it was packed.  Our server was sweet and competent and took our order promptly.  The food was amazing!  As an appetizer, we ordered a blue cheese salad-- lettuce coated with delicious blue cheese dressing, sprinkled with chunks of blue cheese, thick chunks of bacon, fresh croutons, and tomatoes.  To this day it remains the #1 salad we've ever eaten.  For our main courses, we had meatballs served on polenta and some kind of shrimp dish; both were perfect.  The price was extremely fair-- I'm sure each dish was right around what T.I.'s plate of eggs would have cost us, but obviously the food was above and beyond.  We had HAD plans to hit up several different Vegas eateries during our stay, but canceled those plans and ate at the Grand Lux for the rest of our meals-- dinner that same night and breakfast the next morning.  We talk about this place ALL OF THE TIME and can't wait to go back with our friends!  P.S. We HATE the Cheesecake Factory, so don't let their association deter you. =)

0UKBy2CSczuaVNvDOY0hFg.text: Calamari has other fried onion, zucchini and shrimp which is not typical if you order calamari.  Kale salad was a bit too much dressing.  Rainbow trout was super bland.  Service was good but food was mediocre.

1XJ_LDAFk4uryxHfktnMYA.text: With so many amazing choices in Vegas this left a lot to be desired.  I believe it is a sister restaurant to Cheesecake Factory and like them the menu is huge, but nothing is made fresh.  Seems like everything is simply heated or assembled.  They did not have enough staff . . . ate there twice and it was bad both times (lunch and super late nt).  It is overpriced for what you get.  Just down the lobby is an amazing restaurant row with GREAT choices so skip this and the fried kaka with poor service for something better.

Bg0-wCdgguU0UDtlsbseEw.text: Flavorful food and sumptuous portions. Shared a pasta with my wife. Waitress was super nice.

VKxcDcbC-ccCAXXNLB19Nw.text: A place that is open 24 hours in Vegas! Woohoo! Came here for their pasta. They give huge portions that will totally fill you up in no time. Service average considering I came here at like 4am. But hey, if you can still get some decent food at that time, that's all that matters to me.

583NTY13PE4k3Vejf5-eTA.text: One of my favorite restaurants in Las Vegas. While it is a chain, it is quite good. The food was excellent. Breakfast (a great omelet), lunch (soup and sandwich combo), dinner (asian noodles), and late night  (one of the best hamburgers ever). The service is also very good. Be warned that the portions are giant, but this adds to the economy of the place: if you share, it's even cheaper. Desserts are also excellent.

OudvCvQawOEFLzZnKnXixA.text: I've eaten at this place pretty much every time I've been to Vegas.   Never had to wait too long in line and the atmosphere is nice. Good menu selection too.

ejNxrKqH07mBLoFy2k2gYA.text: Located right in the casino at The Venetian, Grand Lux Cafe is easy to find. There are even signs posted directing you to the door. Once you are there, seating options are inside the restaurant or at one of the tables that is out in the casino.   My only complaint from the trip was what I imagine to be the only complaint I would ever have with the Grand Lux, the iced tea was not very good. My dissatisfaction goes no further. In fact, from there my satisfaction actually grows rapidly.   I believe on the menu it is listed as Creamy Spinach and Cheese Dip...though more commonly Spinach and Artichoke dip...and it just might be the best I have ever had. The dip is served with plenty of tortilla chips, so you never have to worry about running out of things to dip, a problem I frequently encounter at other restaurants.   If you are familiar with the menus at The Cheesecake Factory, then you understand how overwhelmed you can feel at Grand Lux Cafe as well. So many items on the menu and they all sound good. There just aren't enough hours in the day for a menu like that, but you have to start somewhere.  I ordered the Fried Chicken. The meal I anticipated, a breast/thigh/leg with a side of mashed potatoes, would have been right for how hungry I was. The meal I got, a veritable mountain of chicken strips with a side of mashed potatoes, was a bit more than I could handle. I think the chicken was like $13-14. You cannot beat that.   Grand Lux has locations in Las Vegas, Los Angeles, Dallas, Houston and Chicago with two future locations of Garden City, NY and Sunrise, FL. At least in the cities where there are currently locations, there are so many restaurants and I always try to not go to the same place twice when I travel since there are so many options. I will have to fight to stick to that when I have the option to go back to Grand Lux Cafe. The place is even open 24 hours (in Las Vegas)!

l_0IRe_vgJJdgJxuDwqx4A.text: Monday for lunch the place has mostly empty but they sat me in the corner for some reason, couldn't see the TV screen or much of anything. Had the steak and eggs, it was OK but the steak was medium but I ordered medium-rare. The server went missing in action. What a shame, I was expecting more from a restaurant inside the Venetian Hotel.

dUwYPNLx5pw0CRxrFOWEqQ.text: Very disappointing.  I wanted a small appetizer of mac and cheese before the show and was it small.  Came in a 3" cast iron pan.  Just some penne pasta covered with a cream sauce and a few bread crumbs.  Looks like they put it under a warming light for a few minutes.  The Southern Comfort Manhatten had way too much vermouth.  Other people in the group has the same experience with less quality than you'd expect for the price.  Overrated.

m31a_VyT9z50i8-AqHSsJg.text: Found it to be aesthetically pleasing. Too loud for an intimate diner for two on a Saturday night. Seating was quick, waiter poured beer in a glass so that half the glass was foam and over flowed onto the table. Didn't come back to clean up the overflow, but did come back to pour the rest over the top once more. I had a chicken and shrimp dish with ginger and curry, the sauce was great, chicken and shrimp satisfactory. My date had chicken and shrimp jambalaya, the chicken was dry and shrimp was rubbery and over cooked. Overall experience was mediocre, not great not horrible.

PABl-8M2laoUe3f6uOPKPw.text: The first time I went here, the food was really good. Then again, I AM a fan of the Cheesecake Factory. The second time I went here, I had had maybe a bit too much to drink the night before, and I did not feel like eating. The food looked and smelled really good though.

S4ZT2kOCxPMc4ySZX3G4-Q.text: This is Cheesecake Factory's better sister concept. The food is great, the portions large, and staff is very talented.

SPWmOtG9AfYLz9-QtJdRGQ.text: I love this place.  Quality abounds.  It makes me smile when people write that the association with Cheesecake Factory is bad.  Why is that?  With Cheesecake, you are guaranteed a reasonable experience with good food, enormous portions, and competitive prices.  Grand Lux is no different, AND the restaurant has a better menu.    People love their star chefs and fancy restaurants.  Maybe they live in parts of the United States where access is difficult and cannot compare the LV versions to the originals.  In my experience, they are often poor renditions or ghosts if you will, of their original versions (e.g. Craftsteak MGM vs. NY, Daniel Wynn vs. NY, and Bouchon Venetian vs. Napa).   The quality of food and service doesn't translate to Las Vegas, and I think the majority of people agree with me here.  But you can't say the same thing with Grand Lux.  It is a super-sized version of the Cheescake Factory; same decor but with better service and seating.  Wait-time is low, and the food gets served rather quickly.  Food quality is what you've come to expect - moderate to high.   Grand Lux in the Palazzo is the best "coffeeshop" in a casino.

mNZSbHS3SYASJ-E_S29Adg.text: The Food Is Great, but a little pricey$-$$ especially for lunch.  One other slight negative. Expect to Waite in line and because it is always busy, it can be noisy

lvIvFGsyv6TPhluJ4pkPlA.text: I ate here last night and order a burger and it was so good they put thousand island on it and bacon oh my it was delish and they also sell cheesecake from the cheesecake factory that was the icing of the cake I would re moment everyone go try it

h9nOD2nfZiRwIe8wmoKFfQ.text: A large menu and great to eat at with a group since it offers something for everyone. The Sunday Night Pasta is great!  We had the buffet breakfast and found it to be a reasonable price compared to the other buffets that cost more and offer way too much food. It is open late which is a plus.  We looked all over the Wynn and Encore for someplace to eat and nothing was open late.

FNgUUYciyArcdfSEJf3ERw.text: There is not better place in Las Vegas for drunk, late-night, affordable food.  Grand Lux is good for breakfast, its good for lunch, its great for late night, and we will always come back here when we need a food fix and don't want crappy food from some dumpy strip location.

1ZiqGz39bxsSuSNfidHiYQ.text: Bad service.... Sat my party of 6 down then 5 min later asked us to get up cause they had another party to seat. who's problem was that? All down hill after that

RxI9Kudv3MJnW6u9nShp0A.text: Prices were good, big portions, and a menu similar to Cheescake Factory with the addition of a breakfast menu.  Not super high end, but great all around menu pleaser, nice decor, and good place to hit.  Brian C. was our server and very helpful.  INDEED, Brian found me outside the restaurant after we left to return my expensive jawbone ear peace I left at the table.  Great service and they deserve a thumbs up!

E6nR6KevCA8CZbGxjR_JPA.text: Good alternative to the Cheesecake Factory. Portions are big, prices can be high but then again nothing in Vegas is cheap. We enjoyed dining here and will go back again when we are in the area.

k7kwNLOBAcd1y6sYKm1N5w.text: Extensive menu. Acceptable service. Reasonable prices. But no WOW factor.    I had the Chicken Madeira, it was okay.  My husband had some chicken sandwich which he said was okay.  The highlight was the Asian Nachos appetizer that a friend ordered.  The only odd thing was that our waitress kept apologizing when she had done nothing wrong.

GwKDvy6p2EGc8HKx1uJESQ.text: I gave this place a 5 star rating because my server...I think I over heard her name was MaryJo. She was probably one of the best servers I came across while I was in vegas!! But the food its self was pretty AMAZING!! I wanted breakfast but it was about 11 so I decided on something else. I ordered the Polynasian Salad(I think thats what it was called) SO GOOD!! It had chicken(would have better if the chicken was warm), Mango, red and yellow peppers(would have liked the pieces cubed and not in strips), it also macadamia nuts. The dressing was sweet and and deslish!! I also ordered a blood orange mimosa...SO GOOD!! I would come back for that alone!! They had a great selection on the whole menu..I plan to come back to try something else. Minor flaws but didnt take away from how delicious everything was. I only waited maybe 5 minutes and the place was packed...but then again I was by myself awaiting my friends arrival.

PO6jMSTJ2b1kVkxYkKZX8w.text: It's really just like Cheesacake factory, but I don't think it's an upscale version of it... just more expensive. My waitress was nice & attentive. I think you get better value at the Cheesacake factory.

tz80S7hzlsuGMxnGZtRtyA.text: I've only eaten here once, so I don't consider my opinion the most valued or educated.  However, I can say that when I ate here a while back the food was fantastic.  The portions were huge, as is consistent with the Cheesecake Factory, which is in someway affiliated with the Grand Lux (again, not the most educated review).  I ordered the fried chicken and waffles.  It was basically a belgian waffle with chicken fingers over top of it, but the food made my night.  The bread they serve as an appetizer is also pretty delicious.  Overall, a great dining experience.  I can't remember the name of my server, or anything in particular from that aspect of the meal, which is usually a good thing.

6hOTIXxqUQnGIx8NufqpPw.text: The portions are really really large.  In my recent visit here my cousins and i had tons of food.  We shared the Crispy Ahi Sushi Roll it was good but they used regular rice instead of sushi rice.  I was going to get the corn beef hash but as a waitress carried out an order of Chicken and waffles i quickly changed my mind.  It was basically a higher end version of Roscoe's Chicken and Waffles ... LOL.  Still yummy though especially with the added pecans :o)  My cousin Ha N. had the Seared Ahi Salad,  Anna had a mushroom burger and Phuong had a BLT.  All looked really tasty but i was pretty stuffed so i didn't have a bite of the burger or sandwich.  I did had a bite of salad to offset the lack of veggies for the weekend.  The Ahi was perfectly seared and fresh :o)  I can't believe i didn't save room for the creme brulee this time.  It's sooooo yummy here and made to perfection.  Now i'm a little sad :o( Not only did the Craps table at the Venetian take my money but i didn't have my creme brulee :o\

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. don&#39;t bother me ... i&#39;m hungry

shTetGSEk1zmVMmCWgPJJA.text: I officially LOVE the Grand Lux cafe. Over our four day stay in Vegas (The Palazzo) we ate here four times. I know, lame, right? It was just so good and consistant, too. The service was great and super friendly. They have late night eating where most places stopped at 10 or 11 pm. The prices are decent, too. Apparently Cheesecake Factory owns this chain, too and I would definitely say I like their food much better than the CF. Also, a plus to that is that you can order CF cheesecake for dessert.  We went one morning for breakfast. I had blueberry pancakes - whcih were insanely delicious and my husband got the buffet. I believe the buffet was around $17 and he was particularly impressed with the soft waffles and chocolate chip toppings for them. (I took a few pics which I will upload)  The other menu items we tried were the ruebin, BLT, and chicken parm - all great!  We visited from Sun - Wed and never experienced a crowd or a wait. I'm sure that on the w/e that might be a different story.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Blueberry Pancakes and Raspberry Lemonade

AJ6xztpjlrCqApZX9qnF8Q.text: Good food, decent prices and freaking huge ass portions. Seriously, you can share a meal with a friend...or a linebacker. Yes, they give you THAT much food. Great menu selection, everyone in your party will find something they like. Drinks are awesome too. Bonus: they are open 24 hours a day!

mJqR0C35KJGwibeUaKtysQ.text: Massive portion size and its very good food. Great veggie options too. If I recall correctly, it is open 24/7 but then again so is almost everything in Vegas! Didn't get to try the desserts so that's next on the agenda.

G32dcPVKNC86afqnFg4XEg.text: Very disappointing overall.
