Se3l7UJJJjS9lGCOGex1TA.text: Summary: Fantastic!  Better than I remembered of the one in Beverly Hills.  Great food, selection, service, and value.  Nothing to complain about; only compliments.  My buddy and I were in town for CES and in need of a no-reservations-needed dinner at around 8pm on a Friday.  I had been to the Beverly Hills Grand Lux numerous times in years past and always enjoyed it, but it never really stood out as a great restaurant to me.  When I called this Grand Lux there was no wait time, so we made our way there from Caesar's and were immediately seated.  We ordered a couple of drinks (I ordered the house Chardonnay, which was by Beringer and was a great deal at $7 and really good), looked over the menu and decided to share a few items.  The three we chose were:  Short rib sliders - Four little sliders on brioche buns, stuffed with super tender and flavorful braised short rib and topped with a creamy horseradish sauce.  Fantastic!  Avocado-Chipotle Cheeseburger - A pretty massive cheeseburger.  Messy and kind of hard to eat, but with delicious ingredients.  A nice kick, too.  Spicy Carnitas Sandwich - An excellent mix of textures and flavors.  Crisp on the outside and super tender on the inside.  A great sauce was provided with this one and it was delicious.  Each of the entrees came with a side salad, so for around $35 we had a great quality meal and were satisfied with the quantity of food, too.  Can't recommend this place enough.

1vNA6VjZJBtgAoXUBl8iLg.text: I heard about Grand Lux Cafe through a few friends, and I am very surprised I have never heard of it before (considering there is a HUGE location right in Chicago that I passed by yesterday). But anyway, I decided to check it out as our last lunch/meal in Vegas before we had to board the shuttle. It was a Saturday afternoon, and the rush of people on the streets was insane, so it took us a good 20 minutes or so to get to the Venetian. I love that hotel so much - so gorgeous, but we didn't have any time to explore, so we rushed over to the Grand Lux (very easy to find) and got seated right away. It's a very big restaurant, with plenty of seating and a very "grand" and beautiful interior, but it was PACKED!   With the little time that we had left, my boyfriend and I rushed through the menu and he ended up getting the Buffalo Chicken Rolls and I got the Spicy Flat bread Chicken sandwich - very good! My only concern was that the food took forever, so we literally had 10 minutes to eat and we had to go right away. The doggy bag came into good use when our plane was delayed for 5 hours...   Anyway, this place reminds me so much of Cheesecake Factory, but that makes a lot of sense considering it's the same owners. With that being said, the menu is endless, so I will def be making my way back here next time I am in Vegas. I LOVE the fact that it is 24/7, and I wish I knew that when I was there Fri night around 4 am when we were starving and everything around Cosmo had closed.   Service was good, but like I said, the food took way too long. I'd recommend this location and though it's a chain, the prices are very reasonable and there is def something on the menu for everyone.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Buffalo chicken rolls

8Rh1opyIhcYOEoVScXdglA.text: In comparison, you might as well come here cause the food court next door is only a couple bucks cheaper but you get substantially more here.  Plus you get a nice sit down, and friendly servers.  Their bread is a little hard though so if you're getting a sandwich, think twice!

R7MYK9Hkehdkcm1BbKn7dw.text: I would like to share my amazing experience with the "grand lux cafe" at the Venetian. this place have a great service! I went there for lunch and the server was super nice! They serve a very good portion size! I loved the salmon pasta.. They busy most of the time so it's better order seats ahead.    Its a place I highly suggest to eat  If your at the Venetian u most go there and the staff is amazing :)

INjGbMvK4JWFyNPL4Q8VPQ.text: Reasonably priced breakfast buffet with good selection.  Stopped by here for breakfast with colleagues. They have a breakfast buffet for around $18 that includes fruit juice.   The buffet was small, but had everything one would want at breakfast. (Eggs, ham/sausage/bacon, hash browns, waffles, fruit, pastries, cereal, breads, etc)   All of the food seemed fresh and of a higher caliber than your typical Vegas buffet. You also have the option of a custom made omelet if you would like.

cRToKjiNYN_wwaWRCzn_nA.text: Literally wrote the longest review ever for this place and then realized I didn't want to be one of those people.  Here's what you need to know  1)  Great spot any time of day - pretty awesome in the middle of the night 2)  Their food is exceptional - if you're drunk/hungover/about to pass out... whatever.  Just don't expect it to taste like the dish you're served once you get to heaven then you'll be disappointed. 3)  Yes, the line will look intimidated - but calm down... you'll be seated in 10-15 mins. 4)  I literally ate here every meal during my stay at the Venetian a couple weeks back.  20% out of convenience and 70% because of the good food. 5)  It's not expensive... especially for Vegas  Good stuff:  Whatever the hell those mashed potatoes wrapped in an egg roll are called  The miso cod - had it for lunch and dinner with the mashed potatoes instead of rice.  It's really good  Their volcano shrimp  The corned beef hash - my bf actually exclaimed "this is real meat!" when he got it  My least favorite was the Ahi tuna salad but it was still good (and I'll admit, it's a hard dish to pull off if you're not a sushi restaurant).  GO EAT THERE

0S_dYicFeXMsHENYEhcIAQ.text: Maaaaaaaaaaaannnnn...I can have this place all morning, all night, alllll dayyyyy long!!!  EVERYTIME I'M IN VEGAS it is a TOTAL MUSTTT to have Grand Lux. The breakfast is delicioussss..the caramel chicken is to die for, the chicken flautas are tastyy..the chicken and waffles was interestingly and suprisingly GOOOOD!!!!  I loveee the service, they have a wide selection of food and open late after those late night club hopping nights...The one in Beverly Hills totally sucks but this is the place to eat if your gonna be in Vegas..I have to say I would do Grand Lux over any buffet in Vegas anyyyday!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken &amp; Waffles

_CT2_2y0kTd4znFR9WI7MQ.text: You can tell me I suck for loving the Grand Lux Cafe, but I don't care! Judge me all you want, my feelings will not change despite your negative stares and belittling words. I am a devoted follower! While staying at the Venetian this restaurant became my favorite stop every single day. Like Vegas, it's open 24 hours a day so whether it's breakfast, lunch, dinner or you're completely sloshed at 3 am, the Grand Lux will be there welcoming you with open arms.   If you've never been to the Grand Lux it is essentially an upgraded Cheesecake Factory with a slightly different menu. Same 471 page food and drink menu which takes a good 30 minutes to read through. My favorite thing to order is the pot roast with mashed potatoes as I like to pretend that June Cleaver is my mother and she's whipped me up a beautiful meal.   My last memory of the Grand Lux Cafe is actually the inability to remember eating there. I woke up in my hotel room after a crazy night of clubbing for my friend's bachelorette party and groaned out loud:   Me: "I'm soooo hungry! When are we going eat?" My girlfriend: "How can you be so hungry? You ate so much at Grand Lux!"  Me: "We didn't eat at Grand Lux Cafe last night."  My girlfriend: "Uh yes we did, you had two strawberry waffles and a pot roast."  Me: "What?! And I don't remember a thing!" (Slaps hand to forehead) Me: "Want to go there again for breakfast?" My girlfriend: (Slaps hand to forehead)  Yelp 365 Challenge: #173/365 (The Forgotten Meal)

8Dyw3KKFsdCnfeiVR425ew.text: Food here is always great! Also open 24/7 I love this place ! The buffalo chicken rolls are my fave !!!!!

IOOcNcS2zRKp7urJGs94vQ.text: Service was 100%!me and my friends server did everything we asked for! The bread we got in the beginning was so good, especially the wheat.  Forgot what my friend had but I ordered shrimp and chicken jambalaya. The level of spicy was perfect and so was the taste of the sauce. Just wish I had more shrimps and sauce!   One of the less expensive places to eat in Vegas. And get a huge portion too :)

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp and chicken jambalaya with brown rice
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wheat bread before meal!

m2HSJJfMt2T4FD4MPRXgsQ.text: Love love love the Grand Luxe. Breakfast is the best. I had scrambled eggs, hash browns, and wheat toast. Eggs are fluffy and delicious. Coffee is very good. My husband always gets the buffet, and says it is one of the best he has been to. We are not big on buffets, so this is saying something. It is located on the Venetian. We are on inside patio, which faces casino, so it is loud. Highly recommend, plus open 24 hrs.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tahitian martini

xpbs6sDV3fquT-j5lJiNyA.text: Nice and beautiful cafe and bar.  Great ambiance friendly staff, great to get together for a beer or wine.  Variety of dishes and main courses in the cafe

rCuBK8Yw7vgXaZU9ZdkhbQ.text: casual dining venetian hotel...family type restaurant....reservations recommended...group of nine for lunch...calamari $12.95 and chicken lettuce wrap $10.95 for appetizers...finding enormous mountain for deep fried calamari rings...decent bite to start....lettuce wrap fine and savory chicken heavily marinated/seasoned...taking a combo of shaking beef and caramel chicken $20.50...intense saucing bit too salty and sweet...shaking beef bit too salty....caramel chicken a over sweetened orange chicken type of dish...battered, fried and generously sauced...portions are enormous!...share!...not a single person finishing their plate...enough variety and choices on the menu for anyone...definition of americanized over-sized meals overly sauced salty and sweet...roughly $55 per person gluttonous lunch...

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. huge portion warning
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. check please 9 people

nsIjbTAuIEz2OFaVgLZ4Yg.text: Matt Timms is the worst manager I have ever encountered. He is very rude and clearly does not care about his job. I don't want to waste too much of my time ranting about my experience. If you can find time to check out is Facebook he is notorious for talking about customers. To add the icing on the cake, the main manager follows him on Facebook as well.  Of course everyone's experience is different, please proceed with caution.

8-mgXhxg91bLRCVZJA9fFQ.text: Came to sample the breakfast of the famous Cafe Luxe. The atmosphere is very upscale and the staff were wonderfully friendly.  The fresh squeezed orange juice and fruit selection on the buffet was a highlight.  We chose the buffet, in Vegas style, but this was a very small buffet.  The choices were classic and flavorful, but this should not be your first choice if you are looking to embrace the all-u-can-eat mentality.  They have an omelet station with excellent fresh ingredients, they have an assortment of breads, danishes, meats (all pork based) and the phenomenal fruit.  There is also an egg and potato selection.  We were not disappointed by any of our choices.  The only downside is the buffet area is small and quite congested so it felt a bit rushed.  However, it was a great way for us to start our day...and the full bar in the restaurant allows you to jump start your party!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The decor is intriguing and helps with the True Vegas experience
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A few select choices from the buffet to start the day.

fz8x2dPfiSzqaKguk6lQ6g.text: Trendy cafe in the heart of the Venetian.  Friendly servers.  Tasty drinks.  Good food and GREAT desserts.  Can get pretty packed during meal hours, but stays open and is fantastic for a bite after 9PM.  4 stars!

Qjur8wQGuWzRlgA9y-Gk_Q.text: A truly pleasant surprise considering when you enter Grand Lux in Yelp it comes up with the option to find "closest locations."  The Palazzo was closest casino to our hotel so we gave in and ate here after giving up trying to find the Canyon Ranch Grill.  Despite the 5 - 6 minute wait to get a table, the stock tables and aging decor led us to grimly await a pretty mediocre experience...  Not so.  We visited during shift change but both our waiters were friendly and attentive.  They placed us right by the fence that separates the dining room from the casino so we could people watch.    We ordered the Protein Breakfast for a brow raising $13.95 and a Southwest Omelette.  I couldn't touch the omelette because it had sour cream on top and inside but the egg white and chicken were great for something so plain.  We split the hash browns which were absolutely perfect and I shared my tomatoes and asparagus.    Just over $30 with tip for breakfast which seems to be the Vegas average for a meal.  Those cheap Vegas getaways are gone for good.  I give a speech about this, but I won't.  :)

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Protein Breakfast
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Southwest Omelette with Hash Browns

xxk5Z9sUsOeOFTLqW6gFcQ.text: Can't go wrong with this restaurant. We ordered the potato spring rolls, queso fundido and guacamole, tempura green beans, chicken piccata, and the chicken parmesan. I tried everything and would order each one all over again. Absolutely loved the potato spring rolls, they were like a rolled up twice baked potato. There is so much variety in the menu that everyone in your party is sure to find something to their liking.

PNtJ2uOSRDG-BY67UNa1bg.text: This Grand Lux is a decent 24 hour eatery so it was an obvious choice for several meals during my stay.  I tried them during breakfast and dinner but never ordered the buffet.  Off the breakfast menu, I tried the fruit bowl and some coffee. Not much to write home about on a fruit bowl. During dinner they serve warm bread and butter while you wait. I tried the chicken salad sandwich is pretty good but I need to add a little salt. I didn't care for the fries. I've also tried the short rib grilled cheese sandwich -- also good. The Asian pear martini was good but I don't think that it is $14 good.  From the dessert menu, I ordered the red velvet cake. A nice size dense slice of cake, really enough for 2 people.  We never had a wait long to be seated, service was quick and the servers were polite for the most part. Overall, the experience and food were okay and I would dine here again (but not order any drinks) if they are convenient.

QdGmPXdavF6En2Yms9Tn6A.text: Went here for a lunch before losing all our money gambling. Ordered the chicken pot roast, Roma tomato pasta, chicken enchiladas. Also the volcanic shrimps and buffalo chicken fingers. The quantity was a lot and everything tasted perfect. Don't miss the appetizers and the pot roast!!! Stayed in Vegas for a week but went here for lunch on the last day. Should say that I regretted for not going earlier. Go here before you lose all the money gambling.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

aKE8W3bTyexK3fytFjmY3A.text: Been here more than once after a night out of drinking.. But now I can say I've been here sober and not so sober!  Quick seating, although it gets busy! Friendly staff & good for kids when the sun is still up.   Like everyone says-- it IS like a Cheesecake Factory minus the cheesecake, but in my opinion and if I'm willing to make the drive out here, I like it better!   This time around the better half and I had : Blue Cheese Salad - not a blue cheese fan but this was good, could have a little less dressing Calamari - FAVORITE! I liked the added fried zucchini and onions!  Kobe Meatballs - big meatballs, juicy and tender meatballs! Not too much sauce, comes on a bed of creamy polenta.  I unfortunately could not have any of the pasta dish but it did look good!   Must try if you're in the strip area!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kobe Meatballs!
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Calamari!
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Q3BqLBkjzHTe_kBi_avtdg.text: I've visited this spot several times over the last few years when I come to Vegas for a convention. Food is always reliably amazing. Churro french toast is not to be missed (huge portion, but they'll bag some of it for takeaway if you can't finish it) and the eggs any style with hash brown and bacon are also delicious.  This time, I've come for breakfast both yesterday and today, around 10am.  Since I finished my breakfast around 11 and it was kind of quiet, I took out my laptop to work for a bit, in agreement with my fabulous waitress Maria who told me it was not an issue until they change shift at midday.  At midday yesterday I moved out to one of the high tables in the waiting-before-being-seated area, where I stayed until 13:45, without any issues. Today, not even 3 minutes after I took out my laptop, the on-duty manager (who goes by Bobby but apparently is called Rene) came to tell me I needed to vacate my table.  I told him I'd checked with my waitress and that it was ok, he said no working or meetings are allowed in the Grand Lux Cafe. I asked whether he was kicking me out 5 minutes after I finished my breakfast, and he said I'd been there for an hour and a half (not True, it wasn't even 1h15) and that he had a queue waiting to get in and needed to use it (not True either, there was absolutely no one waiting in the waiting area). At this time, 25 minutes after I vacated my table, it hasn't been occupied yet. I'm not naive, I know they want high turnover ratio to maximise business, but if you can't allow a customer to stay for an extra half an hour to 45 minutes after she's asked politely and you have nobody waiting to be seated, you certainly have no clue what customer service is.

BbNpc2NZGjSb_OACUtBHGQ.text: One of the security guys suggested this place for breakfast, and it did not disappoint! I just had the best Biscuits and Gravy of my life here... So good! Must try it!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

_J-Cq6Uy-BpxvaaJacG3rA.text: This is definitely my favorite place in Vegas I somehow end up here all the time we have such a huge menu and somehow the food is always delicious no matter what you order great customer service I also like going there for the breakfast they have a buffet in the mornings. You looking for good quality food in a nice Casino Hotel this is a place to go same ownership as Cheesecake Factory just a bump up

qXAPwGex8FhkBub_o9lvyw.text: As we all know, Grand Lux is basically the Cheesecake Factory on steroids.  All my L.A. natives are still heartbroken over the sudden and untimely closure of the Beverly Center location.  Lucky enough there is a location that is open 24/7 4 hours away in Las Vegas on the strip inside the Venetian, a hotel best known for the Grand Canal Shoppes and the popular Tao nightclub.  During my time here in Las Vegas I decided to eat here with a friend as one of my birthday dinner stops.  As far as drinks are concerned, my friend ordered a mojito while I ordered a blood orange mimosa.  For our entree we ordered a Shrimp and Chicken Jambalaya in addition to BBQ glazed salmon.  As usual the food was delicious and what I would expect out of a restaurant of such nature.  If you like the Cheesecake Factory then you'll LOVE the Grand Lux.  An excellent choice for dining in a chic hotel like the Venetian.  For me personally Grand Lux is a MUST for most of my trips to Vegas!!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp &amp; Chicken Jambalaya
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Blood Orange Mimosa
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mojito

XGc56vIIPkGtblg4se-o5A.text: I really appreciate restaurants that are open 24/7 in Vegas.  So I was very glad to see that the Venetian had the Grand Lux Cafe inside their hotel.  My friend and I were pretty hungry so we went with the Grilled Steak Sandwich and the Avocado-Chipotle Cheeseburger.  Both came with fries and coupled with their yummy complimentary bread, the food was more than enough to fill us up.  I really enjoyed my steak sandwich.  The meat was very juicy and tender, while the arugula and tomatoes gave the sandwich a refreshing quality.  My friend completely took down his cheeseburger so I know he enjoyed it.  Also the complimentary bread they started us off with was soft on the inside and crunchy on the outside.  Served with soft butter, it was a pleasant addition to our overall meal.  I would definitely eat here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Avocado-Chipotle Cheeseburger
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled Steak Sandwich
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. complimentary bread

QP_9WdhUvQjq2rWkCxxLaQ.text: Terrible service.  The manager got into a fight with one of my guest over his order.  Over priced slow with bad service.  Sugar cane next door is a much better option

2aimvZ0sUy5ducNxLnP0eQ.text: We had a party of 14. We were seated within 10 minutes. The hostess and waiter was very friendly and prompt. The staff was very attentive. The atmosphere is loud and tables are close together. I got calamari for the appetizers which was delicious. I ended up getting a pasta dish which really wasn't that great. It didn't have a lot of flavor to it. My husband got the fillet mignon which he said it was pretty dry. The drinks were good. I got a bloody Mary. I don't think I would go back specifically for the food since there are other options in Vegas. They have bathrooms inside. The prices were average.

umXC358yF4zUQxLoilfMkA.text: We ate breakfast on our last day in Vegas 8 people, the service was slow a bit but this is wasn't the big issue. We ordered food and it took forever but the big hit was when my friend ate a large piece of paper/nylon from his greek salad and almost choked the waitress called the manager and of course she apologized. And the only thing she did it was to remove the salad from the bill, and that's it she didn't come to check how he is if he is fine or offer any compensation. We are nice people we don't like drama. But a lottle respect to your customers specially when we ate there every day.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

MchAZe-URxig645EDMLjRg.text: We had a really nice lunch here the other day. The restaurant reminds me a lot of a Cheecake Factory. There were so many delicious sounding things on the menu that it was hard to order! We ordered the buffalo bites as an appetizer and really enjoyed them. I went with the Asian nachos because where else are you going to get Asian nachos?!? They were odd but good. I would probably not order them again, but I'm glad I tried them. My mom's chicken quesadilla was very good. Everyone else enjoyed their food as well. Portions were big and prices were decent. I would definitely come back here if I am ever in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Double decker quesadilla
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Asian nachos
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Buffalo bites

ENmwbyaYyvNUEONP1_ZKrw.text: It is a chain. A decent chain but still a chain. It is owned by The Cheesecake Factory. Honestly, I am not sure what the difference is between the two. From decor, to menu, to food, to style to everything. Just pick one they are the same. It was late and we wanted a quick dinner without much fuss. We were staying at the Venetian so Grand Lux. it was Nice surprise.....it was good / really good and we were in and out within an hour at 11pm. Probably because it is Vegas, we will not go back, but we would go to other Grand Lux locations. Meaning that in Vegas too many great options nothing about the food or experience.

ZTuh9aoejemGSroWeL6FSQ.text: This is one of my go-to restaurants for visitors wanting to take me to lunch or dinner. The prices are very reasonable for ridiculously large portions. Darn, once again I forgot to take photos of the wonderful food we enjoyed last night. Almost any meal I've ever had here can be shared by two.  A nice warm crusty loaf of bread is brought to the table to start. For my entree I tried something new last night, Indochine Shrimp & Chicken ($19) & it was 5 star. The flavor was out of this world: onions, ginger, cranberries, sun-dried cherries in a plum wine cream curry sauce served with rice. I ate a lot but I didn't even get through half of it. My friend had Parmesan Chicken (under $20) & he agreed with what I told him I had thought in the past: best he's ever had. He also had more than half left-over.   While eating we saw a monster strawberry shortcake dessert get carried past us & my friend had to try that-delicious. I had the waiter bring me an eclair from the bakery attached to the restaurant. Again, leftovers.  Though I gave GLC 5 stars, if 4 1/2 were an option I'd have demoted it. Or if I have the same problem with the waitstaff again I'll give it 4 stars: The wait for the entree & then the dessert was very long. Our water glasses were never refreshed. I wasn't asked if I wanted white or brown rice with my dish. There's another reason I might demote GLC in the future: it's quite noisy & tables are crowded pretty closely together. Upon my insistence we were lucky enough to be seated at one of the only booths in the place.  I still highly recommend Grand Lux Cafe to locals & visitors wanting a reasonably priced  great meal & varied menu.

Mf6V6RsD5kwz_XuOnrn6ow.text: I came to Grand Lux Cafe on our most recent travel to Las Vegas. It was about 9 pm and we were starving. Grand Lux Cafe did not disappoint. We shared a burger which came with fries. It was more than enough for the two of us to share. We saw so many people leaving with to-go boxes that I was determined to not be one of them. We'll be back Grand Lux Cafe, next time we're in Vegas.  2016 Review #61

xq0yBhV-R80BhgSUggOYlQ.text: Outstanding food and service. We got takeout twice from them as we were staying upstairs. Could not be happier. Must order the cheesecake. Best cheesecake I've ever had.  Love all the gluten free options.

a4kCb0vvsVKzH0BgcNSOgA.text: We love this place!!!! Two travel nurses that come every time we're in Vegas!! Pasta Carbonara & their cheeseburgers! Open 24/7. Can't get any better.

1co3lbdpzOWisEWO6yF5zg.text: The whole time I was here I felt like I was at Cheesecake Factory. We ordered two salads, a southwestern and a manhattan salad. Very large portions, yummy bread and decent service.   Casual lunch/dinner restaurant at the Venetian.

1j3riYAByYT8qD3a0aTbNg.text: It's always so beautiful. It's tradition to come here every Vegas trip. The food is wonderful. If you haven't tried the cream brulee you need to give it a chance. So good your mouth waters. Until next time. I'll be craving you again for quite a few months.

eHpngmb1uxYz-lvYb2uzRw.text: Came here just for dessert. The bread pudding wasn't bad. It had very little egg in it but the caramel made up for it. The gluten free Godiva chocolate cheese cake was a little too greasy for my liking. It could be more cheesy. The entrees on the other tables looked rather large so the portions are generous here and the price is reasonable.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate cheese cake
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bread pudding

MzPfkYSwwWSxalcgcfO6yg.text: I think I won't come to Vegas ever again without stopping by to grab a stack of pancakes! The best restaurant pancakes I have ever had!

7FUXTmk5J8AS4IoSYTaY3g.text: Grand Lux has a very limited breakfast menu, but I gotta say, the husband and I left super satisfied and were no longer hangry (you know, getting angry because you so hungry).   We got the chicken and waffles and the chorizo omelet. So dang good. The waffles were super soft and fluffy. Most spots you go to throw over some dense thick waffles. Not here. You get some fluffy waffles (think pancakes!) with some pecan flavored syrup. You heard right!  The chorizo omelet was spot on as well. Not too cheesy and not to greasy. The sauce was a nice touch.  Only downside, the tables are super close to each other. Unless you like someone listening to your conversation and ogling over your food while you eat and they wait for theirs, I'd like to see the tables spaced out a bit. The line gets super long here too. Unless you wanna wait, get in at off hours or early in the morning around 8am.  All in all, great breakfast spot. $19.50 if you want an all you can eat breakfast buffet. A la carte also available

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chorizo and cheese omelet
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken and waffles

3QTHoqeVXmC1KYfsuTVhAA.text: The Grand Lux Cafe knows how to make a great meal.  I've eaten here several times and each time has been perfect.    The food is always incredible and the staff is amazing.  I believe they are open 24/7 and they have a large menu of options to choose from.  You really can't go wrong with anything you choose, I highly recommend Grand Lux Cafe.

zXca-7J8LmR5dUPOLwlwzg.text: You know, the food was good and the affordable prices make it great! I got a turkey sandwich, Brussel sprouts, and the chocolate cake! All of it was good. My one complaint is that they put this sweet sauce on the Brussel sprouts which I was not ready for.  Try it!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

kiCMjEbFwYVaHmF1uzpEjQ.text: Beatrice our waitress was so sweet and hard working. She brought us everything quickly and with a smile. Breakfast was delicious.  We'll be back!

iI80m85ClyI6YNbSU8_imA.text: Best food! This is always our go to food stop for breakfast in Las Vegas. We received excellent service from our waitress Amy. Can't wait to be back!

WRUQfSlcwg7BBqGhIx32WA.text: We ate a lot of meals here since it's in a convenient location right next to the Venetian rooms.  In general, you get a pretty good value for your money (big portions).   The grilled chicken salad was my favorite.  I was not impressed by their Sunday Night pasta, which had a weird aftertaste that I couldn't identify.

T4IJvGKAwxCxUqDYWMPVJQ.text: Went here a couple times for dinner and breakfast. The food is great and the service is good. Will definitely be back to this place when I come back to Vegas baby.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

GnTAbPyf-u7H6xBoT5sitQ.text: Located right next to the guest hotel elevators at Venetian and open 24/7, this place is the perfect spot for any time of the day. Came here on a Saturday night for dinner with a group of 14 people and they seated us very quickly. Service was very attentive from the start, they had waters and menus in our hands within a few minutes. After ordering, they brought our warm fresh bread and butter which I decided to stuff myself with.   I ordered the Pasta with Chicken, Sun-Dried Tomato and Mushrooms. Portion size was humongous, could have easily been two meals for me. Reminded me a lot of Cheesecake Factory, which I learned later that they are under the same ownership. I'm not a huge fan of pasta, but when done correctly, it's like I'm having a party in my mouth. The pasta to sauce ratio was perfect, chicken was cooked very nicely and the hot chili flakes added that much-needed kick to the dish. Definitely one of the best pastas I've had. Had I not stuffed myself in the beginning with bread, I probably would have been able to finish it, but I ended up taking half to-go.   For Vegas, this was very reasonably priced and once again, the service was on point especially with the number of large parties in attendance that night. They were nice enough to split off table by table for the bill which made it a lot easier to pay in the end. Been here multiple times for different meals and it is always consistent, will be back again!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pasta with Chicken, Sun-Dried Tomato and Mushrooms

TCuHo8WbRHgM18b-8qj-hw.text: Food is delicious but services is not always good. Been here a few times and service was always excellent until this one night I came here and the serve forgot to put our order in we waited for over 45 mins for our food after we placed our order. The table next to us got seated after us had gotten their food and paid for their bill before we got our food. Would give 5 stars but for that one night I took the 1 star away.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

hBUw3paInbsGJv_uFgcrwA.text: Long story short: The Cafe Beef Wellington is worth every penny and many more!  Long story long:   12 years ago (yes, that's how my story starts), I went to Vegas with a friend. One night we ate at Grand Lux Cafe at the Venetian and I ordered some chicken dish. The chicken was forgettable, but it came with the BEST mashed sweet potatoes I've ever had. It was so good that I immediately researched other Grand Lux locations, hoping to dine at one soon again. Sadly, there were very few of them at the time. I've been thinking about those potatoes ever since.  12 years later (i.e. now), that same friend had his bachelor's party in Las Vegas. We went out for some very fine meals, though I was most intrigued by our plan to return to Grand Lux. But alas, their mashed sweet potatoes are a thing of the past. A disaster! No way this place could live up to my memories of it now. Oh well; no point being sour at my friend's party. I found the Cafe Beef Wellington (filet mignon pieces) on the menu and after much debate decided to try it. I normally don't order any type of steak dish unless I'm in an actual steakhouse. A waste of money, I say, 99 out of 100 times. Not. This. Time. It was not only one of the best steak dishes I've ever had for under $30, it's one of the best I've ever had.. (Read that as "I've ever had, period.) And all of the sides were exceptional as well. Except for the mashed potatoes. Those should have been sweeter.  (Also, our waiter Joseph B. was wonderful. Huge thanks to him for chasing me down outside the restaurant after I forgot my hat. You might say my hat's off to Joseph. But don't; people will groan.)

wno8YN7Hc1PyCizpGcqJiw.text: This was one of the best places we ate at during our stay in Vegas and the price was reasonable for the amount of food you received.

2IMRzcg2crNXkGvh0ER7-g.text: I've been to both Grand Lux and I swore I would never go back, but somehow I keep ending up here.  The servers there were nice but service was slow. And no matter what time you come here, the food just sucks. I've had breakfast and late night. For the price you are paying... I'd rather go elsewhere.   I ordered the pasta carbonara with chicken and it came without the chicken. The pasta was nasty. I tossed a whole capful of pepper and Tabasco to help the taste. All I taste was olive oil with bits of peas and bacon as decoration. No flavor...   I also ordered the "Fresh" garden omelette. It comes with Mushrooms, Tomato, Avocado, Green Onion, Zucchini, Fresh Spinach, Havarti Cheese and Sour Cream. Sounds good right? Well, my question is how does anyone that works in a restaurant industry not know how to cook a proper omelette? And if anyone gave you food at 4 AM when you are starving, it wouldn't be a tough decision to eat it right?   My omelette was served half cold. The egg was rubbery and dry. The menu made it sound so savory and yet I taste barely anything. I couldn't even finish.   I really regret coming here and it will be my last.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pasta carbonara...Never again (even with that much pepper it didn&#39;t make it better)

wm08CdCLYrUGI6d4oV8a4g.text: All I have to say is ASIAN NACHOS! These are the best late night snack you will find in Vegas.

-1Y_1hsdxqf1Y8d3ykFC_w.text: This is one of my new favorite places in Vegas and I will tell ya why....  1. The place is massive so even at peak dinner time on a Saturday night our wait was only 5 minutes. 2. The interior is really nice, for a "cafe" it is beautiful...of course it is inside the Venetian after all.  We even saw two wedding parties dining here.  3. The menu is massive.  Think almost Cheesecake status. They really have something for everyone.  4. The drinks were really tasty. I had the pear martini and the strawberry martini. Mmmmartini 5. The service was wonderful. My husband's meal was late (ended up being only a few minutes) but they brought him a soup on the house for the inconvenience. The manager came over to apologize too.  6. Now onto the food...from the warm bread to our appetizer (we had ceviche) and to my entree (steak, rice, mushrooms) it was all quality food. I had a bite of my cousin's mashed potatoes...so good! And my husband's chicken parm was great too.  The prices aren't cheap, but less expensive than most nice restaurants inside Venetian and Palazzo. Plus you have cheap options in the menu of you want to save a buck.  Highly recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Strawberry martini
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak, rice, mushrooms and those amazing onion rings.
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tuna ceviche

MYnrs-zqwRDKJ5TSESswyA.text: The only delicious affordable casual choice we located on the Strip. Bonus! It is open 24/7!!!  We had some delicious soup sandwiches and salad here for lunch. I was impressed with the food quality. The atmosphere was nice - like a Cheesecake Factory. It is a great place to eat when you want something really delicious and don't feel like dressing up. We tried out several of the other cafe type places at Aria and Mandalay Bay and this was the nicest, most affordable and had the best food of the bunch.   We also came back another time for desert. I had the creme brulee which was two deserts in one- chocolate creme brulee and the traditional type. It was delish and would be a great desert for two. My sweetheart had Godiva cheesecake and proclaimed it as good as Cheesecake Factory... Minus the Godiva truffle they decorate theirs with.   The rars will be back.

uD1zFFjDqlnVpbj8VDULeQ.text: Dear Grand Lux Cafe,  Thank you, thank you, thank you. When I've stayed at the Venetian or Palazzo you have always been there for me, arms wide open, 24/7. I am pretty sure you've saved my life at 6 am after a long, long Vegas night on more than one occasion. Sure, you remind me a bit of the Cheesecake Factory, but when my heels are in my hand and my eyeliner is smeared all over my face I just want a goddamned sandwich... and you're always there to hook me up.   Thanks for that. -Lexie

fDehB8yjh7sid8blBBVQ3Q.text: It's like a better and barely more expensive Cheesecake factory.  Fantastic Cheesecake like menu, better service, right in the heart of Venetian and open late.  Came here twice, once with one a friend and once with S.O. on a double date. We have always enjoyed it. The portions are large, but are reasonably fresh and service is really nice.

SZrAISqNVTkUqXYcjyAnFA.text: We went in for breakfast and everything was great. They have a breakfast buffet too. Little pricey than other breakfast places but totally worth it. The waitress was too nice and welcoming. Service was great and food was awesome. This is the one in "venetian". We tried the "palazzo" one later same menu but waitress was rude and totally opposite to the one we experienced in "Venetian".

daFcuC7JR96qm9s1L0lAOQ.text: Absolutely zero star to manager "Matt Timms" He treats customers like ? . I'm really sorry for Venetian hotel with zero class restaurant. And the food is really bad... I never go to venetians hotel again because grand lux cafe!

C3JoDoAplcBQRZLQAqwRUg.text: on a work trip to Vegas I stayed at the Venetian for 7 days, so one night I had to try this Grand Lux Cafe for dinner. The food variety was great and the bartender/server was friendly. They were busy and it took awhile to get my food but I was in no rush.  I had the buffalo chicken rolls and a salad. Not amazing but it was satisfying.

6LUtda5sk5JLBNXyBanKUw.text: The Grand Lux Cafe is the sister restaurant of the Cheesecake Factory and are located in heavy traffic tourist spots. From Miami (beautiful restaurant location) to good ol' Las Vegas you can have a pretty good shot of finding one. If you're ever traveling this is a sure bet of a place to go with a large crowd if you have a wide variety of eaters including the picky ones. On the menu you can find entrees from salmon, steak, salads, and the menu is about 8 pages I felt like. SO MANY OPTIONS. The food is consistently good and I have always been a fan of their brunch especially the Sunday "All you can eat brunch" at the location inside the Venetian. The food is moderately priced especially considering you are eating in one of the most expensive cities to eat at. So it shouldn't come as a shocker when you're paying a nice penny; however, still far below the price of some amazing restaurants around town. I was fortunate enough to pick off of everyone's plate (yes I'm that friend) and each one was hot, properly cooked, and made correctly. The wait time is fairly quick and impressive considering how many people come to eat at this location. One thing for this particular location that bugged me was the underwhelming factor of the decor. Compared to their other locations I've eaten at this one was not impressive to say the least. Overall this is a great location to visit if you're wanting to host a large crowd without having to wait forever and a day.

coFP29YAY80XUv2y-TnJHA.text: if bouchon is my go-to for brunch in the venetian, then grand lux cafe is pretty much my go-to for every other meal in vegas. it has an extremely large menu, with enough choices to please even the pickiest of persons.   whenever we roll deep with 15+ people, this is easily the place to go if you don't want an hour+ wait.  i have found myself here more times than i'd like to admit after a night of clubbing. somehow, we always end up here, even when we're not staying at the venetian/palazzo. and nothing tastes better than their basket of fries after a long night of drinking.  everything i've had on the menu has been a hit with me -- burgers, sandwiches, pastas, meat entrees, anything fried... even their brunch (gasp, i know. not better than bouchon though).   i've heard some friends say their sandwiches or salads were just average. i say choose wisely, my friends. don't order something on the menu that doesn't look like it's gonna be good just because it's "healthier" or whatnot. you're in vegas, you shouldn't be on a diet.

PM-07shj_-szlBADdPaWzQ.text: I was at this place a few month ago and decided to leave a message today, as I just installed the app. Can not wait to go to this place again. The pasta was one of the best ones I ever had. Even spaghetti from Detroit could not beat it.

duvRrx92OYN-q7yI_5F1OA.text: Location was convenient and prices were reasonable.  Portions were sizeable and service was prompt.  The huevo ranchero was an awesome start for my morning!  Deeeelicious!

oEYEZVXqRFEJh9xIS23nEQ.text: This is a great 24 hour cafe. Perfect for soaking up all the alcohol after being up all night partying in Las Vegas. They have fast, efficient service and good food. Only took 15 minutes from the time we ordered until we got our food and we had a party of 8. I ordered the DeLux breakfast sandwich with hash browns, hold the tomato. Scrambled eggs with ham & bacon, topped with havarti cheese on brioche bread. It was a bit greasy but delicious. Ordered ranch dressing on the side which was very tasty.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. DeLux Breakfast sandwich

m7jMKzFXYsxS9y_V8Vs8WA.text: A quick and tasty spot for whatever food you want, whenever you want. We ate at Grand Lux for breakfast and took advantage of the breakfast buffet. The buffet selection was pretty extensive, and all of the food was quite tasty. The orange juice (provided by the server; not at the buffet,) was delicious! It was a True freshly squeezed orange juice and tasted like no orange juice I've ever had. I loved it! This is a good place in the Venetian to get a tasty meal fast.

rKMh9gRygkKGFyIybdKp2g.text: Double Stuffed Potato Spring Rolls.... amazing!   I am a huge cafe fan. I love them. This cafe inside the Palazzo is awesome! The staff at the bar is hilarious and friendly. Alex, one of the bartenders knows his stuff. Everything that he has ever suggested for me to eat from the menu has been delicious.   The appetizers are some of my favorites and Nadia (I think) makes a mean Texas Tea.   I have only ever sat at the bar, so I cannot comment on the dining areas, but usually it seems so fast paced and everyone on top of their game.   Try out this cafe if you are in the neighborhood.

wYcZXULjZaGhjUZhHLrPdQ.text: We went to the Grand Lux for breakfast on our last morning and were pleasantly surprised.  We had the "express" breakfast which was a breakfast buffet.  It was a simple buffet with a decent amount of choices.  Omelette, or eggs in any style you wanted prepared, toast, fresh fruit, yogurt, oatmeal, pastries, bacon, hash browns, and oatmeal.  After having gone to the larger buffets this was a welcomed change as the foood was fresh, warm and tasty.  It was fairly reasonably priced compared to the other breakfasts we had on the strip.

oCr3Po0DcSsBegq_MiIGrg.text: This is a good go-to spot if you dont want to walk far from the Palazzo/Venetian if you are a guest here.  The menu is large enough for the corresponding times with a good mix of American classics and auch.  Service is what kicked my review the extra star as the food itself isn't anything extraordinary from a Cheesecake Factory or other similar restaurant chains.  Prices are reasonable with all consideration with the hotel, casino and the atmosphere that it provides.

OZr3za31Y0pvJlZsrsjM8g.text: This place is open 24 hours and I was excited about that when we were looking for some late night nosh!   With that being said I was really impressed by this place. Located just next to the beautiful Venetian casino you will see the Grand Lux. You'll recognize the decor as a sister restaurant of the Cheesecake Factory. Probably because it is owned by the same people! Great food, HUGE menu. We went late at night so it was quiet but I never saw it completely packed probably because of the location. You'll enjoy anything you get from here!   Large portions. Go hungry!

btGRe3UzVuXvCEG4yL8lIg.text: I could eat at this place everyday and have something different each time and it would be delicious!  I love this place.

NExfACKxT3f6Ar6kesc5iQ.text: The staff was super friendly and the ambiance was chic for a diner type establishment.   The egg sandwich and turkey & Brie were perfect for a late lunch!   Reasonable prices and fast service make it even better!

fYoF5IUKQoVZzBpBA6r1pg.text: I usually am very satisfied everytime i come here. However this time around, i brought my baby and in laws and the service was so dang slow and horrible. Im waiting with my baby for a good hr to get our food.   We ask what is wrong and they say that they are understaffed. Everyone around us is getting their food except us.  Horrible service

AfXzpKj1WJhPgnSfXd5NfA.text: This place flat out sucked.   First of all, the temperature was FREEZING.  They explained that it was the casino that set the temperature of the place, but the casino was where I dreamed of being.  I was shivering the whole meal with goosebumps and my am hair standing on end.  It was uncomfortable to the point that I almost went to the shops to buy a sweater.  Hmmm, maybe that was the point?   The food wasn't good either.  I had the Sunday night pasta (short rib sugo basically) and it was not seasoned at all and had an icky taste.  Boyfriend had an Asian chicken dish that he ordered spicy, but it was sickly sweet.    All in all, will not be returning.  I wasn't shocked that this is related to the Cheesecake Factory, but I think this place is a step down (which isn't saying much).

Bf_oogTx-XFvK0vGSi8Jag.text: Absolutely terrible.  The menu items seemed like foodie choices, so I expected good food.  Our waitress was slow and entirely too nonchalant, but she at least wasn't rude.  However, the food was awful.  I had the goat cheese salad.  Waaaay too sweet and the fried goat cheese balls were soggy.  I had the duck wontons, they were the best thing on the menu.  My entree was disgusting.  BBQ salmon DROWNED in BBQ sauce.  Like I had to scrape it off just to find the salmon.  While the salmon was cooked perfectly, the sauce ruined it.  I had it with brussel sprouts.  They were very burnt and also cold.  I don't remember my other side, but I know I left hungry!  I ordered a Moscow Mule and it was waay too sweet and weak.  I strongly advise against trying this place out.  I would have complained to management, but my waitress was so slow I didn't have time.

3eZngCWjvELonICORz--HQ.text: Great food! Try the tomato pesto pasta it is AMAZING! My husband and I loved the atmosphere and our waiter was funny! Great experience!

tCERJT_zBWjc1t7c74l7XQ.text: Sad to say, I like the Palazzo location better.  The service there was good but here it was mediocre at best.  The pasta serving was smaller here and the pasta here wasn't cooked in the sauce long enough to infuse the noodles with the luscious taste that was present in their other location.  Also keep in mind that there are some differences between the two locations' menus so if you are in love with some dish at one location, be sure it's on the other location's menu before thinking "Grand Lux is Grand Lux."

b2TmWz9EQYQDU4C276iI0A.text: I'm happy I finally got to try this place on a recent trip to Vegas! First off, I am giving this place a star knocked off because of the extremely slow and rude service!  We were seated pretty promptly for amount the restaurant was already packed. We ordered our coffees, which was good, and we wanted to order brunch, but the server managed to not come around for quite a while. I got the belgian waffles with fresh strawberries - which were heavenly!   The friends I were with ordered some mimosas, and they did not come for a good 20 minutes, so they wanted to cancel it, but the server mentioned that were already made. My friends refused to pay for it, and the server simply rolled her eyes and took it back, and gave us attitude about it. She made my experience here really not very good, next time i'll make sure she is not my server!   Overall, good food, mediocre ambiance, and RUDE service! I mean you have to eat in Vegas, so I guess some will have to put up with this rude service - definitely worth the visit though.

G5BwLRx7etZ7gmmjSFA8oA.text: It's the cheesecake factory.   So, this place has an extensive menu and loads of options, but you won't be blown away by any of it. That said, it's super reliable, clean and easy. The staff are friendly and helpful.   I've has their egg white omlet, which was great and their chinese salad, which was also super fresh and tasty. But it's not on the same level as the incredible vagas dining.

3ttxiTLxZl_sCcoZqDUcTw.text: Best breakfast place I've ever been too in Vegas. It was so good that I had to eat here everyday (4days) while I was vacationing. Food portions were perfect for one person besides their pancakes those can feed 2 people. Great customer service and extremely clean. Would recommend to anyone who is looking for a good breakfast. Had to try the churro pancakes omg...amazing!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Churro French toast!!!!! Delicious

saE_ZNIXpg924n8Ht9Uq_g.text: This is the sort of place you go to when you just need to eat something and it happens to be nearby and open.  Reminds me of a more upscale Cheesecake Factory.  There's a large menu with something for everyone, and the food is good.  Nothing too unique or exceptional, but everything is generally tasty.    If you want something nicer than fast food but don't want to spend an insane amount, this is a perfectly serviceable sit-down option for some solid basic bites.

ksklIszlS268fOCYJnr-fA.text: My Wife and I arrived at the Venetian at midnight. We were very tired and hungry! We dropped our baggage off in our lovely room and headed back down to the Grand Lux which is open 24/7. Almost no wait time, and we got a booth right away. Very friendly staff. Got our drinks and food promptly. We had lemonades which were good but way too sweet and concentrated so we added extra water to them - then they were delicious. I had the Madeira chicken which is chicken breasts covered in mozzarella cheese and a mushroom sauce poured on top. It was pretty good. My Wife had the Cuban Sandwich which was decent. Price ~ $40 minus tip.  We decided we won't eat at the same place twice whilst visiting here but if you need a quick food fix it's definitely a reasonable and convenient place.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Madeira Chicken

HXmvZA9q1qW6ojtJc0CnFg.text: Came here for desert and had a really enjoyable experience.   Got the creme brulee and butter cake. And a hot chick Colgate and caramel latte.   A fine way to end the night though they seemed a little understaffed. Would definitely come back here again.

ung7yw4cVMC_hidhHW0Xaw.text: So this place is very elegent and very nice to check out the view and to have a meal in. This place really went all out, and why not, it is in the Bellagio, so expect nothing but the best.  Enjoyed a very late dinner past midnight, and since i needed my fix of a steak we hit this place. I tried their Sushi Roll and Steak w/ mash potatoes and everything was deliscious.  Since it is in Vegas, just expect to be seated with some very loud people and if you do not think they are, maybe you are the one that is loud. Hey it is Vegas right.  Staff is polite and treat you right, place was some what packed, no waiting of course since it is a very large restaurant.  So if you need a good meal or dessert or just want to relax and sit down and chat try this place.  Hope you enjoy it as much as I did.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak &amp; Potatoes
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy Crunchy Roll

ew77EYCr99BWXl0ZxDBUcg.text: So much better than Cheesecake Factory even though they are partnered .  The Buffalo chicken bites are the best!  We also tried the margherita/pepperoni pizza as well as the spicy Chipotle burger. So good!!!   The service is always great. I just wish they had one of these out in LA.   Bryan our server is proper, professional, knowledgeable, and very friendly.  What a server is truly supposed to be like.   We love !! Love!! Love this place :)

IEbPNCUkl5tX1jIu02NQvg.text: Ordered potato rolls, shrimp scampi, and chopped salad. Let's just say, my mom and I had plenty of leftovers! So much delicious food! The service was beyond excellent, and I enjoyed the romantic darkened lighting, and it was enjoyable to be able to watch the gambling through the wide open entrance. Definitely will come here again, when I'm back in town! Oh, and killer Arnold Palmer! Yum!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

SfM-hcBr8sub-wBiqS4oVA.text: Open 24/7!  My friend and I split a regular Asian salad. Our server was nice enough to have the chef split the salad into two plates. The portions were still huge!!

iRLj4KfIPpiCuZAuqUsW9g.text: We love this Place! When ever were in Vegas we always have to eat here usually two or three times it that good. I always get the chipotle avocado burger. its one of my favorite burgers in town. My dad always gets the turkey burger and he loves it. By brother had the Chicken Royale and was impressed. The size of the meals are really good too. if you aren't that hungry you could easily share your entree or take it home and have a nice lunch the next day. The Asian Nachos are not to be missed! They are out of this world! It comes with a wasabi cream which I don't care for but every server but one reminds us of this and ask if we would like it on the side.   The space is very large but you wouldn't know it looking at it from the casino floor. There is tons of seating and we've never had to wait more than a few minutes. The servers are great and always make sure we have what we need. The one thing that drives me crazy about this place is they don't serve lunch until 11:00 but are open 24 hours. I don't care for breakfast and we had to wait 15 minutes for our server to put in order.  All in all the positives out way the negative. Its a great restaurant with great food and service. If you give it a try you won't be disappointed.

AZ0mWcBoUyeLtI3ZvUgtQQ.text: Amazing food. Late night menu couldn't be better. I'd rather eat cheap there than a fancy restaurant in the Venetian // Palazzo.

iJ3WiAHYqusheyQEyT6lmA.text: The Grand Luxe is the breakfast spot in the Venetian (and there is one in the Palazzo).  The food is meh and the service is worse. It wasn't terrible food - both days I ordered some pretty easy breakfast fare (eggs, bacon, etc) and my wife did too (pancakes, eggs). The service was super slow and the food was not cheap.   We didn't try the buffet.  I'd recommend room service. We had a much better breakfast via room service in the hotel and it was cheaper or just as expensive even including the service charges.  The only shining star of the Grand Luxe was their coffee. It was great, smooth and not bitter.

RU-hDBQp0u0O5YKoGSbpUQ.text: Had to eat at Grand Lux Cafe after a group member I was with was obsessed with this place claiming it was everything. We went to the Venetian location mainly cause we could not find the location to the palazzo one where we were staying.   The wait time to be seated was non, however to get service it too a little while, especially to get drinks. Our server was semi nice. However, here are why this establishment received two stars:  1.  The food took over an hour to get out, the restaurant was not busy nor did we order complex dishes. (6 people total in group)  2. Refills on water and drinks took a while   3. The food was just okay! Way bellow Cheesecake Factory standards for a place that's suppose to be more upscale.   Overall, don't go here if you are looking for quick service and great food. There are other places to go for similar prices both at the palazzo and Venetian. My top is to go to Bellagio or Paris where they have restaurants with great views, after all you can always go to a suburb near you and get Cheesecake Factory type food but you can't get world class entertainment and quality there.

nQP-JAsTSM9XAqRdPndrrA.text: Seeing that they had gluten free options is what made me decide to gove Gamd Lux a try. The Gluten free pasta was good. Our service was friendly as well. I would have liked to try some of the other restaurants at R The Venetian but there weren't other gluten free options.  I would come back here again.

bH-S45EijCA-3N9hCvu1Pg.text: I've eaten here a couple times now. There's nothing specific, so I can't quite place what exactly it is, but I've enjoyed it. It's never over the top great, but I've left here feeling very satisfied.  I wouldn't go out of my way to eat here, but it's definitely worth it if you're in the Venetian and don't have better plans.

RwE0jqArmKX4XxEicWVVBQ.text: I only eat here when I stay in the Venetian out of convenience but you get great food at a great price (considering you are eating at the Venetian, on the strip).  I hate eating food court food and any hotel, so its nice to have a sit down restaurant with affordable options.  Grand Lux has a huge menu for breakfast, lunch, and dinner and its 24hrs!  I am pretty sure everyone can find something they want here.  Hot entrees are better than the sandwiches, and burgers are legit.

u8eB4yz3SvmfH0J3t08Waw.text: Anakaren provided excellent service. She made recommendations based on my dietary restrictions and requests. She was very patient with me and understanding of my needs. Thank you !

wiFP7droA6tVksNQSdZXXg.text: Had lunch here twice and both times were good experiences. First time I ordered an omelette which you can have at any time of the day. Second time I ordered their Cuban sandwich and my husband had the pastrami burger. I tried the burger and it was good. I enjoyed my sandwich a lot, very flavorful and packed with pork roast & ham, along with Swiss cheese, mayonnaise, mustard, & their jalapeno/pickle relish on grilled bread. This is a very nice large restaurant that can accommodate large parties. Open 24 hours which is great! I believe it's owned by the founder of Cheesecake Factory Restaurants. Service can be slow at times since they are always pretty busy.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cuban Sandwich &amp; House Salad
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pastrami Burger

O-r_Fa_aGGjQxPfncnhXFg.text: Great brunch location with suprisingly excellent service.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The dining room
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast nymphs

YNw431lFcOna5tLT0djjaA.text: Went here for the 1st time..Wednesday Jan 17th, 2018 at around 3:50pm,  the waitress was an elderly white lady, never introduced herself, when i ordered water no ice, she brought it to the wrong person, water tasted bad so.i ordered a bottled water, she said small right ? I said if you have large ill take that,  she brought a small, my guy ordered a chicken pot pie , she said small right ? Because the large one is to large,  crappy service to begin with, food was delicious but the service was horrible, will stick to their other restaurants which have better customer service, Venetian and palazzo have amazing service not Grand Lux cafe...later we saw ppl getting bread to their table automatically, we were wondering if we had to ask,  she never offered of we wanted appetizers,  well since she was making our minds up for us , I just figured she would have offered...i wanted to get the heck away from the waitress or else I would have asked for the manager

2yAFEoDgryv71dA4xFW-0Q.text: Grand Lux Cafe is the sister company of Cheesecake Factory. This place is great for late night food or just a casual dinner. The price options are affordable compared to other restaurants in Vegas which is great because it can serve a variety of customers. I love all the menu options because it has many different types of cuisine. I definitely recommend getting the shrimp scampi. It is phenomenal. It's a popular menu item at grand lux. For late night, I love the artichoke dip. They have amazing breakfast too. You name it they have it. All in all this is a great establishment.

vUbcLtXQY8FLCP28D-eQhg.text: Grand Lux Cafe, the better version of the Cheesecake Factory. The selection here is endless. I had the hardest time deciding what to order. But when in Vegas, pasta is ALWAYS a good idea. My friends and I came here for lunch on a Friday and I shared the Asian Nachos (Crispy Fried Wontons Covered with Chicken in a Sweet-Hot Peanut Sauce topped with Melted Cheese, Green Onion and Wasabi Cream) and the Pasta with Chicken, Sun-Dried Tomato and Mushrooms (Tossed with Sun-Dried Tomato, Fresh Mushrooms, Garlic, Cream and Parmesan Cheese). The Asian Nachos were a bit more on the sweeter side because of the peanut sauce, but it was still so delicious. The Pasta with Chicken, Sun-Dried Tomato and Mushrooms was also good, but did not WOW me. I also got to try my friend's Pasta Carbonara (Imported Spaghettini Tossed with Smoked Bacon, Peas, a Touch of Garlic and a Parmesan Cream Sauce) and damn this one was so DELICIOUS. I would definitely order this one the next time I visit Grand Lux Cafe.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Asian Nachos
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

P3S15UhU6yay7hYMixZxDA.text: Food was delicious, drinks were good, service was great, highly recommended. We originally tried Yardbird but it was packed. This was a great alternative!!

ds0acuLp00XaUZ29WmzCRw.text: This place is SO good. The 5 of us (4 adults, 1 child) came here on a Saturday night. We waited 15 min for a table. Our server took drink orders after a few minutes - cocktail, 3 beers and a lemonade for the little one. Then shortly after our orders were taken. We ordered 2 of the pasta with sun-dried tomato, chicken and mushrooms and 2 of the Caesar salads without chicken - all of this food was split between the 4 of us. The little one ordered the kids quesadilla. They brought out fresh bread and butter. The food was so delicious! Priced on the higher side, but worth it!

1PKXtDugc9AZLrg4Cq-ABA.text: The best faux pho ever! It's called "zen noodles" and it's pretty much pho but none of that unhealthy msg or oil. The broth is similar but very light and more of a lemon grass flavor... it's soooo good! Especially if you've been drinking all night and just want some homey pho...the zen noodles does the trick. You don't even need sriracha sauce or anything to make it flavorful.   I had it 3 times here, after each night of drinking! It did save a hang over every day. Sooo good!

mLJTdF9Orkni5OzVlAuv6Q.text: Been here twice since it's conveniently at palazzo.  Service has been great so far and the food is bomb. Cafe beef Wellington and almond crusted trout are amazing like I just wanted to sit here and eat it forever but I'm a small little Asian girl so dat not gonna happen.  Had a bunch of other stuff too but can't remember what they were tbh... it was good though.. just not noteworthy I guess *hehe

Zo4cjuJrQZ0GgZKMjOZe_A.text: So my Yelp account is basically a diary of the last 11 years of my life and if you were to look back into a wee little bratty 23 year old Maria D., she would not be caught dead admitting she ate here in a public forum.   But old AF Maria D. doesn't care what you think and is here to tell you that Grand Lux Cafe is the jam.   My man and I shared the ultimate chain restaurant food, the chicken quesadilla and it was everything you'd expect: filled with fat and sodium and delicious. I followed that up with chicken and waffles and it was legitimately good. Like, the kind of food you'd rave about if it were served at a hipster establishment you waited in line for. But the waffle was light and fluffy and the fried chicken was bomb.   So. Grand Lux Cafe. I can hang wichu when I walk by you for the trillionth time next time I'm at the Venetian casino.

S-cMS2wd48I4b7F4mKb_Uw.text: Came here for my parent's anniversary and my dad's birthday. (Both are on the same day). First of all, I was very happy that they were able to accommodate our last minute reservation for a party of 16 on a Saturday, a couple of days beforehand. Last minute sibling shenanigans.  Secondly, you know how you have a reservation but you're still waiting once you arrive despite the reservation you made. None of that here. Our reservation was at 5:30pm and they were ready to seat us at 5:30pm. Since I hate not being on time, this already made my day lol.  The remainder of the evening went well. Everyone enjoyed their food. Sorry, too many people to name individual meals. My dad alone sampled 5 different sibling plates and he definitely gave a thumbs up to each one of them. I believe Linda was our server and she was really great and patient with such a large party.   In the end they brought both of my parents a pastry dessert celebrating their anniversary. Although this was not my first selection for our celebration, I was so happy that this is where we ended up dining. And most importantly, my parents enjoyed themselves.  Thank you Grand Lux for making our dining experience such a great memory!!!

E6TZP-8cj4C_Ywsfl0-vAg.text: One time when we stayed in Vegas for 5 days, we ate at the Grand Lux 4 times.  Yes, it's that good.  Not only is the food scrumptious, but the menu is as large as the average American.  It's causal, flexible, and you can have whatever you like, however you like it, whenever you like it.  Poached eggs and a burger at 2AM?  The Grand Lux can make it happen.  The food at the Venetian location tastes noticeably better.  We had the Manhattan salad here once and the shrimp came juicy and grilled (which wasn't the case at the Palazzo location). My recommendations include the sliders, the miso salmon, the grilled veggie pizza, Chipotle avocado burger, the spaghettini with clams, and the calamari.  The calamari merits its own sentence--we're talking squid, rock shrimp (think mini shrimp tempura), zucchinis, and onions.  For the price, it's basically the best calamari you'll ever get.  Now, the Palazzo location has better desserts (the dessert menu is almost entirely different).  I highly recommend the molten chocolate cake (see my pictures and you'll know what I mean).  The Palazzo location, at least during the afternoon, also had a smaller menu listing mini appetizers (around $5 or so).  We tried the haystack which was similar to the regular calamari appetizer, but stripped of the seafood--just onion strings and zucchini slices.  The result? A vegetarian delight and now one of my new favorite fried appetizers to get!  We went to the Venetian Grand Lux the next day hoping to order the same thing, but alas, no mini appetizers there.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. manhattan salad with grilled shrimp
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. calamari with rock shrimp, zucchini, onions
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. vegetarian pizza again...so freaking good, especially with the kalamata olives

nixHoWXoFGVmodUAgt_u6A.text: The service was great at 3:30 in the morning. If you enjoy Cheese cake factory then this is its half sister. The setting,  the floors, the bread, and everything is almost the same. The would was delicious. No complaints. The sandwich was ok and the side salad with the home made vinaigrette was excellent. I had the turkey bacon sandwich. I didn't finish it all and kept half to go. The French fries was good.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Club sandwich

kR58tXylgT9eT-RawTKvDQ.text: A three star option that gets a bump for sheer convenience. Breakfast ends before noon but you can still find breakfast items throughout the day (like egg dishes). Food is reasonably priced and is acceptable in quality (think upscale greasy spoon). The hostesses were kind of duds, but our waitress was nice. Good for a quick bite when you're tired of fine dining or everywhere else in the vicinity is closed.

G9Ngh7x2r8Vqrm9RVIotNQ.text: One of the most affordable places I saw in Vegas. The restaurant is huge as is the menu! You can get anything you want here. It's like a classier diner leaning towards cheesecake factory. I had a salad with kale, butter lettuce, apple, toasted pumpkin seeds, toasted chickpeas with warm quinoa and farro that come with a lemon vinaigrette. It was good and filling (big portion) for being "only a salad." Our waiter was extremely friendly. Great choice for affordable dining with plenty of options.

clxvj3MiIUuC1ANaWK2MfQ.text: The food here never disappoints (and we're self-proclaimed food snobs).   Our breakfast go-to is the chicken & waffles- they do a good job with their take on this dish.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken &amp; waffles (best we&#39;ve ever had!) pecan-flavored syrup &amp; no bones in the chicken are the highlights of their take on this

HT4iuROuGyUG1pN6tfbiaQ.text: Exactly like the Cheesecake Factory. Ordered some food to go at the bakery side: the calamari appetizer and the margharita pizza and a whoopie pie. The calamari also included fried zucchini (I skipped on the onions). Both calamari and margharita pizza were pretty salty--downed my entire liter of bottled water during the meal. The margharita pizza was also pretty thick for a pizza I expected to be more thin crust. Both do not stand well for consumption the next morning. Whoopie pie was okay, though the cream in the middle was very heavy on the frosting.  Portions indeed are huge. I probably would've been fine eating just the calamari appetizer without getting the pizza. Order was ready 20 minutes, so not too long of a wait. Pretty convenient for those who want a quick meal to take back to their room (restaurant is right near the hotel room elevators!).

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. calamari appetizer (includes fried zucchini)
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. margharita pizza

k4dprPnNUAaUVEsW-m579Q.text: Came here after shopping at the Fashion Show Mall. We ordered take out and took it back to our hotel room to eat.  The food was amazing and probably a lot better than what I expected to eat. We ordered:  Baby Back Ribs: Juicy, tender and the meat just falls off the bone deliciousness Pasta Telephono: Simple pasta but good tasting  Bacon BLT: Simple sandwich but extremely crispy bacon and the sandwich was huge Turkey Burger: Bursting with flavour that was juicy, and succulent  I would return here in a heart beat. If you are looking for a cheap eat and generous portions, that is also delicious, stop by the grand luxe cafe!

Xkt-4FdvPJR78a_vouGLlw.text: Not sure if I'm reviewing the correct Grand Lux but... IDK. This place is bomb. I like that it's open 24 hours - perfect for Vegas.  Their food is deliiciiious. It is basically Cheesecake Factory, same style of food, same decor. The food is good though, from pastas, to sandwiches, to smoothies and drinks. Never had a bad meal here!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ZPe4wHNimuZdX1stI9cDJw.text: Our hotel reservation comes with a daily $65 at Grand Lux Cafe for breakfast. It surely does not disappoint.   We were here during weekends and the cafe offers a buffet style including - station 1: four kinds of cereal, oatmeal, raisin, brown sugar and milk; bagels, bread, roasts, and English muffin, jams, etc.  -station 2: ham, scramble eggs, pork sausage, bacon, hash brown, assorted pastries such as muffins, danish, chocolate croissant, etc.  -station 3: omelet and any style eggs made to order; ingredients include spinach, mushroom, tomatoes, onions, egg whites, sausage, chicken, bacon and mixed pepper, cheese; chicken and waffle, breakfast quesadilla  -station 4: pastrami hash, egg Benedict, pancakes, Joe's scramble with spinach, eggs and mushroom, gravy and biscuit   My personal favorites include pastrami hash, egg Benedict, and breakfast quesadilla. We also ordered the molten chocolate pancake, very fluffy.   Their orange juice is freshly squeezed, very refreshing; coffee is good; you can also order pineapple juice, cranberry, mango, and apple juice.   Service can get spotty during peak time but a solid option.

wg4XuuQkb2Vl6BYfLrIPgg.text: The breakfast quesadilla is hands down one of the best items that I have ever eaten. I lived in AZ for 3 years and had nothing quite like the one at Grand Lux Cafe. Grand Lux is very busy and very loud, has almost a Cheesecake Factory feel to it. It is open 24 hours which is nice if you need somewhere to go early in the morning or late at night. Next time I'm in Vegas - I will go out of my way to make sure I eat here for breakfast again.

PH0A3PUKbOGWkF8Q4Ra34g.text: 2017 Yelp 100 Challenge! 75/100  Bf and I came here for brunch - Unfortunately we missed bfast by few minutes :( (Was looking forward to their Egg Benedict)  We decided to order the following... and we're both glad we did (everything was AWESOME!): - freshly squeezed oj (to die for!!! delicious!) - Bloody Mary (Perfect) - Joe's Scramble (Huge portion & cooked perfect to my taste!!) - Grilled New York Steak w/ 3 eggs (BF killed it!)  Our server Jerry was great and was very helpful. Our food was great... had a wonderful time ^_^

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

t_tJjn59JviqycA7bzXEHw.text: I ordered The Pastromi Rueben sandwich.. came out bread was hard (it was toasted) the sweet potato fries was old and dark,stale and cold.. my wife ordered a burger well done came out pink through out, No Problem ,,, wrong only problem was getting server to come back out.... when after 20 minutes she makes her appearance and takes it back to correct... 15 minutes later the Manager comes out asks about our food and says " He will fix it." 20 minutes later he brings out wifes burger and my fries.. Both were hot and fresh we have now been here 1-2 hrs. still no refill on drinks.. 15 minutes later waitress came back with fries snd drink..... I rate this visit 1 star.... was not  impressed... plus had no bread.. they were out.

lnwPuIH7tXkRiOxt1fviwA.text: EVERYTHING on the menu is good here! I love the food. It is always prepared better than you would imagine. I have eaten: goat cheese salad, calamari, potato bites, every french fries they have, BLT (the best BLT I have ever had by the way), omlets, bacon, pancakes, waffels, and I could list for days... This has been the best experience I have had eating at a restaurant with so many choices (aside from Cheescake Factory). I would rate Grand Lux Cafe three bars above the Cheescake Factory. Thank you!

73E5PW_cMqHegkeEhyFDMw.text: Great food and service. Good sized portions! Visited this place several times and never let me down.

CrJOR27ZswZtpgdLBp0EEA.text: Best restaurant in Vegas , every other place a rip off or charge prices not justified by quality . This restaurant is great quality , portions and prices like small town America . Service so friendly and genuine just make this place your base for meals you won't be disappointed . I am stuffed , 3 courses for $30 . Recommended by my Aunts very grateful to them , savvy travelers advice is a blessing .

xSNlYJ3p4qHqUrOkszyYDA.text: Palazzo Grand Lux Cafe only open till 2am but their (bake shop area) is open 24 hours. There is Only a limited selection on the menu which are mostly appetizers. Don't get me wrong, these dishes are fulfilling and decent sized. If you are still craving for Grand Lux after 2am, they do have a 24hr dine-in on the Venetian side. A lot of guest staying at the Palazzo complain about walking to the other side for Grand Lux because the restaurant side closes early. It really only takes less than 5 mins. to walk there.
