Although the menu is limited at the 24hr bake shop, I personally like everything from the menu like the buffalo chix rolls, buffalo chicken wings, alfredo pasta, smoked salmon, cheesecake options and carrot cake.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pecan roll

cYYahjpd3cPH6v6VkBKFgg.text: Excellent food! Ate here more than 5 times and tried different items! All were great! The Porkchop was the best! I highly recommend that! Chicken Parmesan is my second choice! Oh, Asian Nachos was also bomb!

CmK45ga6txmYLsnMvRDj0w.text: *review is for their buffet only*   We were staying at the palazzo and really wanted to try a breakfast buffet we hadn't been to before and this worked perfect because we could just head downstairs! We thought the $25 per person for the buffet was a steal until we saw the small one room of buffet items which mainly consisted of bread and pastries.   Their savory items are far too few and they lack flavor. Their hashbrowns were dry as heck. Their scrambled eggs were good though. Too bad most of their items contained pork. The buffet wasn't creative in the least. I enjoyed some of the good items like the mini chicken and waffles and they have a build your own omelette bar where the chef has mastery of cooking eggs how you like them. Be sure to tip them!   Their desserts were really good though. Particularly the creme brulees and the fruit tart. Skip the honey vanilla latte, it wasn't included in the price and I couldn't drink more than 3 sips because it tasted purely sweet and not at all like coffee. Gross.   The order off the menu items looked better. Service was okay. The server was efficient but not friendly. You should just go to wicked spoon buffet for breakfast instead.

RQPKIXrFPy1369HsvXbvRg.text: Had breakfast, French toast in brioche bread and it was the best French toast I ever had. It tasted like cake. Moist and flavorful. For lunch I had a BLT sandwich and mixed greens. Everything was so fresh and tasty. Open 24 hours.

fRBivBarTYGehnF4w5CRVQ.text: This is probably one of the best restaurants I've been to in Vegas. Huge portion, great tasting foods, quick service. They also have a lot of food choices, - from brunch, to pastas, to steaks, seafood, etc.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salisbury steak. Goood.
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Garlic Shrimp Pasta. Really good!

kRgVt1SUPOfsT_P5VgI6ZA.text: Went here after me and my bf checked in to the Venetian as it had good reviews on yelp (4 stars) and let me tell you....Not worth 4 stars because of the service provided here!! Our waiter was terrible and the place wasn't even busy during lunch hours. She only had 2 tables that she was serving and that other table was also dissatisfied with the service provided. At one point I heard them say "this is ridiculous" and they're right it was ridiculous!   We only saw our waiter 2 times. 1st was when she took our orders. & 2nd is when another waiter had to go get her because we needed "to go" boxes and our check. & on top of that, she didn't even bring us bread and we knew it was complimentary because everyone else was brought bread to them.   Overall horrible experience. The Venetian is a very upscale and elegant place that provides excellent services and amenities to their customers and I believe the customers who stay here should be provided the same exact service from their restaurants.

AVudNj-rdqDGH8XaQYq6Qg.text: This restaurant has a lot to offer.  Good food for ant time of the day and a wide selection. Portions are generous and the food is very good.  It's our go to place when we are visiting the Palazzo:Venetian.

WSvMEHhbVHt7akmlrbwQTg.text: Simply 5 stars.  Open 24 hours.   Great food.  Big menu with everything made perfect.   Prices are good, especially for being in the casino. Lots of room.   They also offer a breakfast buffet that is small but real good. Fresh omelette bar and breakfast basics are done well. Fresh squeezed orange juice refills.   I'll be back for sure.  Enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Roasted pear and strawberry salad.

8SrVSxn6om3_KW3srj44nQ.text: Came here in the morning after a long night of drinking.  There was a bit of a wait, but it did not take long.  The staff was nice, and was very helpful. I was able to order a burger since it was almost lunch time.  I had the following:  - Double Lux Cheeseburger - two certified angus beef prime burgers with melted American cheese, slow-cooked caramel uses onions, red wine sauce and garlic aioli on a toasted brioche bun - the burger was so delicious and hit the spot, much more satisfying than a breakfast omelette or something!  Would come back if in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Double Lux Cheeseburger

kQ1NownsSOxxvPB0cld63w.text: Pro tip: share your pasta because the portions are huge! I loved everything about Grand Lux Cafe. The service was great, the prices were affordable and the flavors were spot on. I love that this place stays open 24/7 because late night, post drinking food cravings are unavoidable if you're doing Vegas right.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

zTpKwqibV7hxFA5schQ2QQ.text: The area is really nice! The breakfast buffet was alright. The omelet was the best thing since it's cooked fresh. Overall not too bad if the food was hot

QKZXlagLIvScnFzap876Dg.text: We decided to have breakfast at the Grand Lux Cafe before leaving LV.  We were seated promptly and our orders taken just as quick.  I ordered a standard 2 eggs, toast, and sausage.  There was nothing special about the food, but you get linen on your table and a good set of silverware.  As always, this came at a casino restaurant price.  If you're limited in options and want to stay within the casino, then the Grand Lux Cafe is a good enough option.  Sometimes, you just want a quick bite to eat that's better than fast food.

2ZrWPtNIJzvfoiwKgQ34ig.text: Buffet -disappointing . We are staying at the Venetian and the Grand Lux was just convenient. They said it was like the Cheese Cake factory and we love the CCF. We arrived about 11:15 am and I ordered the buffet. First off the majority of the hot selections were luke warm. I had to go through several plates before I found a clean one. There was no syrup in the syrup craft and several times I had to ask for serving utensils as there were none to be found. For folks who do not eat red meat there was no fish, chicken or tofu option and most of the dishes had red meat in the mix and it was not listed on the placards. The Best thing was the ready to order omelet and the custard. Our server was great ! We may have done better at one of the cheaper buffets.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I really enjoyed my omelet.
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Custard- yummy.

DvKZsCY8I8pzbifBO7VhBA.text: I love this restaurant! My boyfriend and I have this tradition of eating our first meal here everytime we visit Vegas! There is actually another Grand Lux in Beverly Hills but I think the one at the Venetian is much nicer!  Anyway, I love this establishment for the excellent service they provide. The waiters are always willing to answer questions, refill your drinks, suggest or recommend a meal...i mean...they have a very attentive waitstaff.   Their menu is pretty long and it usually takes me a while to get through the whole thing and decide. Everything sounds delicious! I love their complementary wheat roll...mmmm...always wrapped in that warm napkin. Mmmm...kay i'm getting hungry! Their sangria is served in a tall glass and oooh...they serve it pretty stiff!   Ahhh...can't wait til the next time!

2ou4TqWIaPuqppEfdcsduw.text: This restaurant is one of my brother and sister-in-law's faves when they come to Vegas. For me, it's just another upscale Cheesecake Factory. The food is just the same, so I enjoy this place as well. However, there are some items that vary from the regular Cheesecake Factory menu (for example, some pastas aren't listed).   At any rate, I enjoy eating here. The service is acceptable, as well as the food.

f4-OEmdIj-oQQIbWS3etDw.text: When staying at The Venetian- the Grand Lux Cafe is a lifesaver!   I just recently stayed at The Venetian with 7 other girls for a bachelorette weekend and Grand Lux came in handy on SEVERAL occasions. We had several other meals planned out, but between staying at pool parties too late and needing disco naps before heading out for the nighttime, we didn't make most of our dinner plans...so this place was the answer! We would call in the order, go down in our robes (quite the site, lol), pick up the food, take the food back up, and feast in our rooms :) We had everything from pizzas, to potato spring rolls, to salads, and everything was great. The best part was the price...for 8 girls to eat, the total was only $96! That's less than lunch cost us the first day at one of the panini cafeterias across from the Grand Lux...if only we knew!   We also used the Grand Lux for breakfast one day as we surprised the bachelorette with a Lingerie party brunch in the room...we had the waffles, scrambled eggs, hash browns, bacon, and fruit salad (along with some bottles of bubbly and OJ we picked up from different places around the hotel...Afterall, what's a brunch without mimosas?!) and we all loved every breakfast item we had.   Some of the girls also used this spot as a late night (OK fine, early morning) spot to snack before hitting the sack, but I didn't...I was more concerned with keeping my liquid diet going ;)

f9uDMTeBBG5AcUXF6ywEKg.text: Joe's Special doesn't get better than at Grand Lux Cafe.  Or the Crab Louie salad, hold the scallions, with olive oil and vinegar on the side. Or the egg white omelette with olives, tomatoes, and onions cooked in a dry pan.  You get my drift - Grand Lux Cafe (from the people that brought you the Cheesecake Factory) will do it your way and in family sized fashion.  Now that I think about it, of all the times we've been there I've never made it to dessert.

ukucttNheLu6ZOS-hwvKbw.text: Yum yum yum!  We wanted to eat dinner and we were at the Venetian after going to Tao beach.  The security guards said that there was something for everyone here and it was great food!  I love the cheesecake factory and I love this place.  The chicken Madeira  was HUGE and delicious.  A wonderful experience.  The service did take a long time though.  Everyone had more than enough food and it was definitely worth the price, you pay for the quality of the food and you definitely get what you pay for.

nNv5KtLH6BWRLG22zNrpGA.text: My husband loves the Grand Lux, which is owned by the Cheesecake Factory, so we have to eat here several times every visit to Vegas.  The music is a bit loud, and like its parent company, the decor is overly ornate, but the menu is nice and the portions are good.  The breakfast buffet has the worst hash browns I have ever tasted; even covered in a thick layer of salt I was unable to eat them.  However, the fruit was great and they will make you an omelette to order.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

QBbRXh-adSQAz9b9P8LMQw.text: I'm not really into chain restaurants, but this was very good.  American-size portions (= disproportionately HUGE), prices low, considering you could feed at least 2 with one platter.  Here's where they got me.  The service.  Our waiter, jeez, I wish I remembered his name, was AMAZING.  I have to say, it's the first time I've been WOWED by service in Sin City, which up to now, has been quite disappointing.  Fast, charming, new his stuff.  Was able to make recommendations.  EXCELLENT!!!

yyY0oGpUt4dRJJ93KkfJ_w.text: Simply amazing I'd say.  It is every bit tasty and delicious just like Cheesecake but the prices aren't as high.  After a good night clubbing and walking down the strip for a late night bite, coming to Grand Lux is exactly the place to be.  Although the wait can be long especially for the late night crowd, this place gets pack so be ready for a long wait if you have a big party like ours.  We couldn't decide on what to eat for the longest time but the server ended up deciding for us on a pasta w/ sundried tomatoes, mushrooms, chicken with some sort of alfredo sauce.  I have to admit that the first bite took me to the Pearly Gates and back. This is an unforgettable place and I'm glad the recommendation lived up to it's hype.  =)

Kn300qbWoKl1zyjz-ovamw.text: I'm not a real big fan of The Cheesecake Factory...but their Grand Lux Cafe at The Venetian is pretty great! I ate breakfast at 3 A.M. here after having gone to a show and done some gambling.  My breakfast was very good.  I had eggs with bacon and hash brown.  It was delicious.  My husband had the New York steak with eggs and hash broown and he was surprised that his steak was so good (the menu states that it's certified Angus beef).  I don't make it a habit to eat at this hour.  But after such a long day, it was great to be able to have breakfast at this wee-hour of the morning and not have it be a meal from Denny's.

RoHDwTSA6Hu0RPppQ0icCQ.text: The Grand Lux Burger Melt is the best sandwich I've ever eaten!  Grilled onions, toasted bread, perfectly cooked beef, melty cheesy goodness, and.... wait for it.... thousand island dressing.  Mmmmmmm......

5WixqY6Jaz2lGnpZIrF0kg.text: What a disappointment. :(. lets start with services for breakfast. slow and not tentative at all. We were there this morning even though they were not busy the service was slow. The server told us about the breakfast buffet, honestly they should not have this at all, because it is not a buffet's review is for their breakfast buffet and their breakfast service. They had a omelet station and fruit station. Not a good selection.   Now this review is for breakfast, the server only came once to refile our coffee, before we ordered anything, we placed an order for "benue" sp.. the server told us that it will take 10-12 minutes to get it. No problem since we had not even eaten yet. The server was MIA, since we could not get any services and i Finlay saw him and inquired about our desert an hour later, he told us he was not sure what happened since the food runners bring out the food and he though we already got the food. don't you think we would have liked some coffee or something to drink with the deserts?   Not a place to go for breakfast.

C0wSyGhU4MamTEAqzRNWJQ.text: Stopped by here with my wife after seeing the Phantom of the Opera at the Venetian.  I have never been a fan of the Cheesecake Factory so I knew walking in that I would probably have a similar opinion of this place.  Huge menu, daunting really, I had a tough time making any kind of a decision but finally settled on the lasagna.  Maybe I didn't read the menu well enough, but it came out with chicken in it?  Wasn't bad but wasn't great either.  Service was OK, nothing to write home about.

-PdVGClbUMf3xo81R7bC3g.text: Yes, Grand Lux is a chain, but with food and libations like this, who cares?!?    We started with cocktails.  The Carmel Apple Martini is KILLER.  Now that they no longer offer their White Cosmo, this one is my favorite.  Two of my dining companions had Bloody Marys that were made just right -- spicy but not too.  One had a frozen Margarita that was well made and not overly sweet.  We stuck with appetizers on this trip, and the best of all were the crab cakes.  No doubt the best I've had with lumps of crab in a well seasoned mixture lightly grilled.    We ordered the appetizer combo and enjoyed the following:  Vietnames Spring Rolls with chicken and fresh cut veggies in a steamed, cold wrap served with peanut sauce or spicy sweet and sour sauce.  Philli Cheese Steak spring rolls with diced steak and cheese in an eggroll wrappper fried and served with chipotle mayonaise.  Also eggroll style was the buffalo chicken served with the absolute best bleu cheese dressing I've ever had.  My husband's favorite were the steamed duck dumplings.  The Spinach Artichoke dip was creamy with plenty of artichoke.   For dessert I had to revert to my all time favorite creme brulee duo - one vanilla and one chocolate.  Best ever!  It was 11:30 on a weekday.  Seating was immediate and service was outstanding.

6Tr5Ytd-EspJzT7hS1Nl8A.text: great food!  great price great servie.. for a strip venue.. cannot complain! everything is good or great always!! try the Asian nachos!! to die for!! you guys do everything right!! keep up the good work

Z2ocgXijwFKHOUXOwtR3Ew.text: Pleasantly surprised. Was expecting to be overcharged for mediocre food--but it turned out to be a very good meal. The Shaking Beef was great, perfectly seasoned and generous portions.

NUb2rZG2QLW5M-piByenRg.text: Do you LOVE noshing on summer noodle spring rolls and club sandwiches, while sipping white sangria and espresso martinis, at 3am on Thursday? Do you LOVE The Cheesecake Factory, but never get the opportunity to go? If so, then hit Up GLC at The Venetian when in Vegas.  We needed to grab a late night meal after landing into McLarren post midnight. We were seated right away, excited by the extensive "Late Night" menu options, and enjoyed every bite and sip.   Sorta pricey, but hey, it's VEGAS!

bGZLeqNwKOtGqWbpZbgoQg.text: Food is basically the same as it is at the Cheesecake Factory but I like C.F. better.  I think this place serves Pink's hot dogs too though.

F8lrO3i3rNQs8wS9sCuILg.text: The first time I ate here was a couple of years ago when I was in town with friends over the weekend. I don't remember exactly what we or I ordered, but I do remember enjoying the food and having a very tasty dessert.   Being at the Venetian last Saturday night and preparing myself for a long night of partying, I decided to go ahead and have another fulfilling and delicious meal at the Grand Lux. My friend and I ordered calamari, duck potstickers, and beef and shrimp, and pudding for dessert. The calamari, potstickers, and combo beef & shrimp meal were all good, but as far as the bread pudding goes, I've had better.   The combination of the good food and an excellent server (sorry don't remember his name, some Filipino guy) made our dinner experience at Grand Lux a memorable one again. I will surely come back next time I'm in Vegas.

6zayKaao_MO2_VGZ4q3nAg.text: Everything was delicious!  I would've given them 5 stars but the waitress came back twice to tell us that they've ran out of what we ordered.  We ended up getting full on bread and getting our food 1 1/2 hours after we ordered.  However, the taste of the food and the prices made up for the wait.  Yum.

URK-mZX9dRzCDbeeQZ_abA.text: The Grand Lux Cafe has become the Zippy's of Las Vegas to me.  Always open and always consistent food.  It's always got a HUGE selection of food to choose from and the portions are equally large.  The best bang for your buck for spur of the moment hunger attacks.  One thing I don't understand is that no matter how many times I order the Strawberry Cheesecake, it just doesn't taste as good as the ones from their sister company (Cheescake Factory).  3 stars because you were  too drunk to give a proper review Maritel?  Gimme a break.

yxesJqY_F1naXaoNZkOVwg.text: Great for accommodating large groups (came here on a sat. night with a reservation for 16). Restaurant is basically an upscale Cheesecake Factory (same creators) minus the million flavors of cheesecake. Food is just as good, almost the same actually. I got the Madeira chicken which I always get at The Cheesecake Factory and no complaints. I shared a calamari appetizer and was pleased to find some fried zucchini and even shrimps as well. The batter could have been more crunchy though.  Service was great, although the pace of our meal was a bit slow but I can understand that since our group was so large. Also, it was a bit dark in the restaurant to where I had a hard time reading the menu. And ladies in heels, be careful as the floor is quite slippery. Nonetheless, I'll be returning.

EDEyldcACx00EDC0E0HIag.text: This is my GO-TO late night dining spot on the strip, without about. Whether it's 4pm or 4am, you know you're going to get some high quality grub!   This place is a sister restaurant to Cheesecake Factory, so you'll see a lot of familiar menu items and decor. The menu or at least the late night menu is much more limited than Cheesecake Factory, which to me is a GOOD thing! I can never decide what to get at Cheesecake!  This last time that I went the server was AMAZING! And it was like 3AM, I think his name was Sean. He was running around like crazy serving, but was super attentive and friendly filled my water and diet coke countless times. I was very impressed.  The food was good as always. I have had several items off this menu in the past, but this time I tried the Kobe Burger. I tend to stray away from the Kobe Burgers because usually places just put the Kobe name on it and make a mediocre burger leaving me disappointed! That wasn't the case here... The burger was moist and really flavorful with caramelized onions, sauteed shitakke mushrooms and togarashi aoili!   I really think you can't go wrong here, grab something that sounds good and I am sure you will be more than satisfied ESPECIALLY if you are here in the middle of the night!  MY GO-TO DISH: Quality food at any time of day or night? They're all GO-TO DISHES ;)

zrFoKEC2y8zSdz6AxhfIBA.text: This place had deliciousss food. I ordered the Pasta Carbonara and i had them add some steak. It originally included amazing bacon, peas, and alfredo sauce. I was hungry for some steak on top of it all. I let my friends try my dish. The 4 of them each got a forkful of the pasta, bacon, peas and sauce combo (i didn't share my steak)... they all raved about it and couldn't believe PEAS could be so delicious. Grand Lux pulls it off.  My friends had:  chicken and waffles... 4 stars (good but too sweet for her)  burger... 5 stars delicious  crispy caramel chicken 5 stars!!!  chicken parmesan... 5 stars  I had an overall really great experience with the food here and i can't wait to go again!  Tim our waiter was very attentive and helpful as well as knowledgable about Vegas tourist info. Thanks Tim!

F8cN_edM1Ojo7kItCHbqog.text: We went there for desserts since we already had dinner at a Chinese restaurant in Venetian. I ordered butter cake with vanilla ice cream and asked to give a candle for my husband's b'day .. they were out of candles but they did decorate the cake nicely for b'day and it was yummy !!! Would definitely come back again for dinner next time

r4bKCVB32efrvjErtbDqXQ.text: Located in the Venetian Resort Spa Casino on the Las Vegas Strip. This 24 hour coffee shop deluxe has quite the extensive menu. The prices are very reasonable and the portions huge. I can recommend any one of the burgers, sandwiches or salads. Everything here gets top marks. Go on an off hour so as to avoid lines. Live it up, you are in Las Vegas for cryin' out loud!

DjBEmKR3g6ecPQVBCg1PmA.text: This is the best food I have ever experienced in my entire life!!! No exaggeration.. The shrimp scampi flavors are unbelievable. The crab cakes with the side salad?!? I can't even comprehend those flavors! This is a must for great food and nice atmosphere at the Venetian!! Dessert OMG

83_cUkiZVuhaTnVO8Y0eJw.text: So, this is a Cheesecake Factory. They even admit it's by the same people. I'm not familiar with what CF offers to compare the menus, but I will say this is a fine lunch spot. At the recommendation of a friend, we had the Buffalo Egg Rolls...which are awesome. Buffalo chicken fried in to an egg roll and served with bleu cheese dressing? Yes, please.  After that, I had a kind of tropical salad, which was good, but not great. The chicken was kind of tasteless, needed a little seasoning, and the dressing was way too sweet. It was served with a nice mix of lettuce, jicama, bell peppers, sweet peas, and other veggies, but it didn't need to be drowned in all that sweet dressing. The fried flour tortilla chips served on the side were drenched in the stuff, which made them like eating sopapillas.  Price was...not appalling for being inside a casino, and service was friendly. I would probably go back for the buffalo egg rolls, but there are definitely more exciting spots to be had.

XfC9Dm4WMSyMVnDE0_uWQw.text: Wouldn't have been interested in coming here except that it's in the Venetian right where the Phantom is playing, and a line was forming right after the show let out... The Grand Lux Cafe is in the same family of restaurants as the Cheesecake Factory so you can expect the same kind of menu with the same large portion sizes. Even though there is one in town back in LA and this one has been here in the hotel for years and years, this is my first visit to a Grand Lux; heck, even my daughter has been to this place with her friends before we've been here, so on this occasion since the four of us were all together as a family, she acted as our unofficial guide... The Lux has a very casual cafe style and feel to it. Even though it was located in a posh hotel environment, you could tell that people came to this place in waves: basically before and after each showing nearby, and anytime there is a group or convention in the hotel. What I really didn't like about this particular restaurant was that the marble tile floors were so slippery. I remembered that I almost skid and ate shit once I got up from my seat, the floor had a thin veneer of grease or butter where I had stepped. I tried to warn our waitress who was standing close by to be careful about the slippery floor, but all she could muster up was that the floors were always slick and that she wore shoes with special soles. Great, what about us poor unsuspecting souls?.... Everybody here (on Yelp) seems to like the Chicken and Waffles so that's what I ordered. yelp.com/biz_photos/NvKN... Nice thick 8" round Belgian waffle with deep nooks to hold the toppings and maple syrup and dusted with confectioners sugar, finally topped unceremoniously with fried chicken strips. Nothing wrong with the chicken strips as they were skinless chick boobs fried crisp in their stretched and mangled shapes, they were not greasy but a little dry because of the white meat. I still don't really get the whole chicken and waffles Southern style because I usually eat either one separately. All I can say is that I could only finish 3/4 of this incredibly heavy plate of carbs... As a matter of fact, I was so disinterested in my meal at this glorified diner, that I didn't take much notice in what the rest of the family ordered. A Chicken Madeira plate,yelp.com/biz_photos/NvKN... a Short Rib Cheddar Cheese Burger,yelp.com/biz_photos/NvKN... and a Manhattan Salad w/turkey, avocado, and beets... yelp.com/biz_photos/NvKN... The good thing about this place is that it's open 24 hours, but for the price and convenience, I think I prefer the Peppermill down the strip a little more...

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 091311:  Strawberry Lemonade &amp; Sangria...
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 091311:  Short Rib Cheddar Cheese Burger...
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 091311:  Chicken &amp; Waffles...

NhnBEKooEYILxWv1mxRxJg.text: I am updating my review due to the poor service.  I am very disappointed in the change and actually refused to believe feedback I received from people I suggested this location to.    When I took a friend for lunch we had to stand and watch 4 people at a podium pushing papers and talking for almost 2 minutes before I finally cleared my throat and asked "are you able to seat us?".  We were dropped off at a table and every server walked by and never even hinted that they would be back to help us.  Finally one of them walked up and quickly asked " are you ready to order? " .  We were not even given water earlier.  After our meal, the server walked by and placed the check on the table.  So I guess a refill of our drink and possibly desert was out of the question.  I am very disappointed and embarrassed that I have continually recommended this place to visitors and had no idea how much the service level had declined until experiencing it first hand.

jZ2SH-HpU2566FD0PNHOFg.text: This restaurant has never fail on my Dinner every time I go  with my family the food is always delicious and a great experience   I'm very happy with Yesterday Dinner was Delicious  The restaurant was very clean  The host,waitress ,and the rest of the staff was very nice specially a Spanish speaker man he took care of Us and made sure we had everything we needed

vf55nesaYziJJNw-UOp1oQ.text: The only thing that saved this evening was the outstanding service of our waitress. In our party of 7 only 1 meal was satisfactory. This was very disappointing part was this is usually my FAVORITE restaurant in Las Vegas. My pork chop was over cooked and 3 others had to send their dishes back to be corrected because it was cold. I ordered the chocolate cookies for dessert because I LOVE the fact that they bake them to order but they were actually cold as well.  We asked for a manager on 2 occasions and he brought out a supposedly fresh and hot potato that was hot on one end and cold on another? I asked him was my cookies supposed to be hot, he replied yes. So, I said please tell me if these are and he said no. His resolution was to remove the item off of the bill instead of correcting the poor food quality.  One last thing, the lighting was sooooooooo poor that the menus were unreadable. The group at the table left to me were using their cell phone flashlights to read their menus...sad to say this may have been my last time patronizing this business.  I once again want to thank our waitress for the effort she put in to salvage a pretty bad experience.

1I-JoPuqEUw2o9cVWYhA1Q.text: They DONT take reservations.   Not sure why it says they do.   Kind of annoying.   Guess they do for parties 7 or more.......   However, the food is awesome!!!!!!!!!!  Love this place.   It's my favorite.   The garlic shrimp pasta is phenomenal!!!! I highly recommend it.    My husband got Thai crispy chicken and that was also great!!!!!  Everything has always been good.    It's a must try!!!!!

O-4UZEhzsObtm7Z4yoCHAw.text: Very disappointing! I have been here before and it was always good. This time the server was very rude and gave us attitude the entire evening. Out of 7 dishes to come out 3 were cold. The burger was cold and 2 steak sandwiches were almost freezing. The manager have us a desert for free, but honestly that did not make us feel any better about the meal. I will have to think hard before I come here again.

dmGkSx5sFieALsPk_XJ39A.text: Best part about Grand Lux...they are open 24/7!! I have eaten here on various occasions and tried multiple dishes off of the menu whether it be breakfast, lunch, or dinner and I have to say, much of the food is mediocre. It tastes good, but it is nothing special. The reason I am usually drawn to this restaurant is because there never is more than a 5 minute wait and the service has always been great. The prices are very reasonable and all the portions are huge.

W27-FukzlC3kfEZlKJWg5w.text: This restaurant lives up to the reviews. The prices are outstanding and the food is to die for. I had a burger and fries and dear god it was good. The fries taste like McDonalds on steroids. Dear god it was good.

vGA5GdjAUMrpLVGJVz7img.text: Huge selection!  We ate here 3-4 times when in Las Vegas.  Best waffles I've ever had, nice and fluffy on the outside and crispy on the outside!  Great light butter pecan flavored syrup.  The Berry Fizz is a fun drink if your looking for something different and non-alcoholic.

pTdAOZxMm5vqO-3fCECF7Q.text: Another Yelp success story. We didn't wait at all to get in, so that kind of worried me, until we got our food. The menu was very big but now overwhelming. I ended up going with my gut and getting the bbq chicken pizza. It was amaze to say the least. Chicken was juicy and the bbq sauce was a perfect blend of tang and spice. Coming back for more next time we're in sin city.

DUhWlioMidsYU3VslCMxIQ.text: My wife and I stay at the Venetian often and enjoy the food here.  The breakfast buffet has good food and is priced right.  They serve eggs to order and the sausage is very good.     I am a fan of the Kobe salisbury steak.  It is well prepared with a tasty gravy and generous serving of vegetables.    We also enjoyed the pasta carbonara.  It was served with angel hair, pancetta, the right amount of peas and an excellent sauce.

OVp6S6WmeQNiGtTxws8HDA.text: We had one in Scottsdale but it closed down. Went there twice I think before it closed and both times were just OK so we never went back. We were in the area so thought to give it another chance. We came for breakfast before we left back home. It's like a cheesecake factory but the quality of the food is nowhere near as good. i got the chicken and waffles which were okay nothing special and the hubby got Huevos Rancheros again nothing special. probably won't ever come back even if they opened one up in Scottsdale again. Service was okay, the waitress seemed a little busy so we didn't see her that often. Oh the strawberry lemonade was delicious though.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken and waffles
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious strawberry lemonade

NUBhRWbzXGMCIT1sCozmUg.text: Zero stars. After ordering salads to go during the week and them being fresh, we decided to come to dinner. ABSOLUTELY horrible!!! My dads burger was literally red and bleeding and not cooked, my husband's burger was  one half red and the other half well done...literally half and half, and my empanadas were cold and old. Such a disappointment.

Nu1wmEFbIV3mk3vz63DSVQ.text: Issa chain, but that's okay. Food here is consistently good and reasonably priced.  In general, I feel like a trip to Las Vegas isn't complete without a mild hangover (or completely hungover) trip to grab steak and egg somewhere. While Ellis Island was a bit out of the way for us this time around, Grand Lux doesn't disappoint when it comes to a spot for steak and eggs. Oddly, it was served as a large plate of 3 eggs (your style) and hashbrowns, and a nice side of NY strip steak and choice of toast. All in all not bad for $20.   Their brunch buffet is also a great option for $25 and includes coffee and different juices (grapefruit, orange, apple, etc.) as well as several items available off their breakfast menu. All in all a good deal as well.  Anyways, I'm a fan. 'Til next time, cheers!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hash browns and eggs with a side of steak

Pe6SU7SmDMFFwEtpIpg_MQ.text: I'll keep this review short and simple. Every time I stay at Venetian I always eat here at least once. Great food, great ambiance, never disappointed. They have the best French toast! And amazing pasta. 100% recommend trying this place if you haven't yet!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French Toast with strawberries

UAp7KSlkKN-O9NUZfrrTXA.text: The three way salmon is everything. Soooo good.  Basic Vegas vibe but worth it when you've been day clubbing and need some solid eats.

KkSDynirDxpAhUfHHwmhLQ.text: As part of the Cheesecake Factory family, that focuses more on food than cheesecake, Grand Lux is a solid restaurant located in a Vegas casino.   I have been to this location many times over the years, weather as me and another person or in a group. Each time the service was friendly, the food was great and the prices are good for a restaurant on The Strip. I especially like the breakfasts here, the variety of French toasts here are pretty delicious.   If you are looking for a nice sit down on the strip and do not want to pay an arm and a leg, Grand Lux is a fantastic choice. The food portions are generous and the menu has something for everyone. The food is Cheesecake Factory like, so if you like that chain, you will definitely enjoy Grand Lux!

BRY4oGpiVaN9JrgOnLs46Q.text: Grand Lux Cafe is a solid option for every part of the day 24/7 in the Venetian Hotel. It's same company as Cheesecake Factory, so the menu is pretty dang extensive. They will have something for everyone. They not only have regular menu items, but also late night and early morning menus.  Food: I came here for an early morning breakfast and ordered the breakfast quesadilla which was fantastic! Crispy tortillas with generous portions of cheese and chorizo. What's not to like?  Service: A bit slow even though there weren't that many people inside.

kBu89RQt36eQFEZy5XgMPw.text: So there we were, hungry, in a big hotel, The Palazzo, and we didn't know where we were going to eat.  My son, the local, suggests the Grand Lux, and he's not wrong.  During our stay we ate there twice and enjoyed it both times.  The service was great, food was exactly what was ordered, and I'd strongly consider going back here for meals on our next visit.  Quick, friendly, tasty, that's a good formula.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

xw8Cm5kIbwGIwm8y6hO4Pg.text: We came for breakfast for three straight days, and the food was consistently good. I had the eggs, hash browns, toast, and applewood smoked bacon. The eggs were not too greasy, the potatoes plentiful. Of course, the bacon was good.  Even though it was quite busy, the hostess was efficient in getting people seated. We didn't have to wait more than 10 minutes. Service was fast and friendly in a Las Vegas sort of way.   Including coffee, I think the meal was around $16 before gratuity.  Not exactly cheap, but it was a large meal.

ETDcLDo_ogSRRG7BkwdKeQ.text: Totally disgusting to say the least. Giving even one star is generous of me. I ordered a classic steak and eggs breakfast with potato hash. Steak was tasteless and tough, eggs were watery, and the potato hash I think was still half frozen from whatever pre-packaged prep it comes from. I was not going to eat a sub-par meal, especially before taking a flight. When I let the server know, she didn't even flinch so maybe it's not the first time crap food gets to a table?!  Waitstaff was S-L-O-W and it was fairly empty inside. There's a boatload of places to pick from but purely out of convenience decided on Grand Luxe. Never again!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

gfDL6Un3xTSgAiflLt8w6g.text: Wow. So surprising. My son and I ate two meals at the Lux. Over the top good. They do big food here and frankly it was underpriced.   Eggs Benedict. Oversized muffins with 4 slices of grilled ham. Eggs were PERFECT and the hollandaise sauces was ample.   Side order of Biscuits and Gravy. So flavorful. Fresh biscuits. Very tasty.   I'd eat breakfast there every day if I could.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Egg Benedict
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Biscuits and Gravy side order! I think this was $7

_Gy4k2KGCow8Trb14h_ohA.text: This has fast become one of our favorite stops on the Strip for breakfast/brunch and our most recent visit reaffirmed this as a solid choice.  Even though the place is massive, service is always very efficient. Our server, Amanda S, was really outstanding from start to finish, even assisting in plating up our leftovers to take back to our hotel.  The French Toast and pancakes are both where it's at, we trade off getting those two things each time we go, I wish I could give you pointers on the rest of the menu, but those two items (of course with a side of the honey butter syrup) are so consistently good, there's no reason to try anything else!

-rxW6VhSMkYOlkksr-IDSA.text: Unfortunately one of our party got food poisoning so that's the reason for only 2 stars. He was violently ill and not able to participate in the Baker to Vegas run, which was extremely unfortunate since he was the lead guy for their department. It ruined his whole weekend. The reason for 2 stars and not 1, is because my sister in law and I enjoyed our meals very much. We got the lettuce wrapped turkey burgers. The server was nice and provided good service.

Uaqm4xLyaFEJyrupohukHg.text: My boyfriend and I wandered into the Venetian looking for a nice sit down area for brunch. We eventually were recommended to Grand Lux cafe by a person whonwas staying at the hotel. I am very glad they pointed us there as the restaurant was fantastiic. Food, service and even pricing was not bad at all! It definitely reminded me of The Cheesecake Factory with how it looked inside. I think our waitress told us the chain was owned by the same people who run Cheesecake Factory. In any case, I think the food here is a step up from Cheesecake. I ordered the eggs benedict and my boyfriend ordered the 2 egg breakfast with hasbrowns and bacon. My eggs benedict was delicious...both poached eggs perfectly cooked and just the right amount of hollandaise. Their hasbrowns are amazing too...very crispy outside which I love. If you are looking for a nice brunch on the strip I highly recommend Grand Lux Cafe!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggs benedict!
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 2 egg breakfast with hasbrowns and bacon
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. View from our booth into the kitchen area

SpjXy1W189VCUs70gXx7mg.text: Food used to be including their ranch that used to be my favorite ranch dressing. Still a great place eat with so many options especially late night.

QAFj_-TKBoL6HNoX0rHjEA.text: Came here with a big party of 15 for a friend's birthday dinner. It was delicious! The food was very reasonably priced for how big the portions are! I would definitely recommend sharing because the portions are huge. I couldn't even finish 1/3 of my pasta! The ambiance is also very nice, you could come here for a nice meal or a more casual meal. The bread they served before the meal was also fresh and warm, however the butter was hard and difficult to spread. Overall though, highly recommend the restaurant!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pasta Milanese

Xu7OG__WXvb6sTaaM8_IBQ.text: Whenever I'm in Vegas I stop by for a bite at the grand lux cafe.   This place is a hidden gem located inside the palazzo hotel.   You can get anything here from breakfast to dinner options. What I always crave for is their fettuccine Alfredo!  The sauce is delicious and the noodles are fresh!  Honestly it's a hidden gem that is so affordable and you get huge portions of food!  My mouth is watering right now just thinking about that fettuccine!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Turkey burger! Huge Portions!

3Ryls2xfDGHHMHmQGqH4Jw.text: Full service coffee shop with no line open 24/7. What else is there? All the accommodations you need for a coffee break.   None dairy cream, fresh pastries, plenty on indoor outdoor clean sitting within walking distance.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Inside

RsAKbxHzzTRQQm1V0XXjMQ.text: It gives me great pleasure to finally review my favorite restaurant in Las Vegas. We have been to Grand Lux more than 10 times.   We always get seats at the bar area since there is no wait time. They have impeccable service.   They also have THE BEST French Toast in the world. I'm a French Toast specialist and these guys are definitely the best. Please note that the portion size for the French Toast is huge so I will recommend to share.   I've tried other items from their menu as well..  I have absolutely no complaints. Their pancakes are also pretty awesome.  Dining in Vegas can get really expensive but I'm happy to report that prices at the Grand Lux seems really fair. You essentially get your money's worth for sure.  If you're visiting Vegas at any point please visit Grand Lux located in The Venetian Hotel.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

iRgKa-Aw5t7OEui--fmkvQ.text: This review is for the location in the Palazzo.  For some reason there does not seem to be a separate listing for that location.  I sat at the bar and had a nice meal by myself.  The waiter was friendly but not overbearing.    They seemed to be owned by the same company as Cheesecake Factory so there are tons of things on the menu.  Basically all types of food to feed any craving.  I had the Mendocino Salad - Grilled Chicken, Avocado, Tomato, Corn, Dates, Goat Cheese, Cornbread-Cheese Croutons and Hazelnut Vinaigrette.  It was a huge portion and very tasty.  Loved all the toppings on top, especially the croutons.  Nice vinaigrette - not too heavy on the salad.    Overall a nice meal.  Good food, good service, enjoyed sitting at the bar by myself.

xm1fN8Mzjn_LClhUG-99cg.text: I order the pasta for vegetarian, they have three options, which is vegetarian friendly.  the amount of the noodle is so enough, and the taste is also very good! yet you will feel a little bit salty if you ate the whole dish.  overall, it is worth to come.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. pasta

JkYCNUr0s4c1Uu8rXXxODA.text: What a gem! Our party of four had a DELICIOUS breakfast here. We had a particularly spicy Bloody Mary with pepper vodka. Yum! We also had the pastrami hash and eggs which was enormous and came with toast, bagels or muffins. So much food! Great service and timing, good atmosphere and I was full all day until dinner. Highly recommend!!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Don&#39;t pass on by, grab a seat.
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dive in!!

ZcYJhIXafZrD7OorAQ9QyA.text: This is the best restaurant in Vegas. open 24/7.  great menu,  I had the Walnut something something french toast, its there signature dish. I also on another day had this taco avocado scrambled eggs thing, it was also awesome. The waiter told me its the busiest restaurant in America,  I dunno maybe he was just bullshitting me to get that tip.  But its definitely the best I had in Vegas. and its convenient because I was staying at the Venetian anyway.. Will certainly come back again.

BlPIAOvMUloCd1SXrsJGdQ.text: So basically we go to vegas at 11:40 PM, went clubbing immediately after checking in. Did that until 4 AM, wandered and met up with friends at around 6 AM, and decided we needed some grub. Did I mention we didn't eat since about 6 PM the day before?   We were basically starving zombies in need of nourishment. Someone recommended this place and what a great idea! I'm not sure was it the hunger, the alcohol at the club, or the zombification feeling I had, but my order was awesome. I got some sort of omelet. I want to say a california omelet, but I'm not sure. I know there was sour cream, avocado, and tomatoes. Whatever omelet I got, it was soooooo tasty. This was one of the best omelets I have ever eaten. My group seemed to agree and they all loved their dishes (3 got omelets and 1 got a breakfast sandwich).   I would definitely come back for their omelet.

TX-5OnsktbYzSXwHbrAymg.text: Dinner was excellent! I had the Beef Wellington, a first for me and not disappointed. The filet mignon melted under my fork...topped with tiny perfect pastry puffs. Large portion sides...$20 bucks, not bad for Vegas! Will def be back!

IcGILc_ztNoVWEXm2B1dKQ.text: It's a little pricey, but almost everything is homemade. So good.

C97174lU81W_IbbFxKqHjA.text: My must go LV stop!Good atmosphere, food, staff, what a good way to start a LV trip.   Foods to pick: Cesar salad; it's huge! And delicious. Eat with chicken, I ask for extra cheese & crouton piece- so unhealthy, but who cares I'm in Vegas with all the alcoholics, smokers & sinners, cheese & crouton are the least of my worry. Lol!  Jambalaya with rice also fulfilling & delicious.   For flavor twist try Thai/Asian nachos. Tasty but not spicy yet has a small flavor kick.  Seems pricey but really the portion are LARGE. Try it, you won't regret it!

VTkep-46mjn9mUwLTg4PYg.text: Grand Lux is for you if:  --You're staying in the Venetian or Palazzo --You want to spend less than $15.00 per person for a very nice brunch/lunch --You want kind and helpful service --You want to be seated immediately --You want lots of options and choices  Thus my four star review, which surprised me, since it's owned by the folks who own the Cheesecake Factory (which I consider the bastion of decent mediocrity).    Everything we had was uniformly good, and one item--the Duck Triangles (crispy wrappers filled with minced duck, onions, garlic, ginger, soy and sesame)--was absolutely stunning.   We left feeling full and pleased.

3JkpwON3Pwh6sEdY_rC7Gw.text: Brought to you by the same people behind CheeseCake Factory, Grand Lux Cafe is a nice option for any type of food for reasonable pricing and generous portion sizes. Good enough that there is one in both the Palazzo and the Venetian. Good for kids as well.

pSnRT_DB9iBtSP10DAD5ew.text: Stumbled onto this place while at a convention and I have to say the service was OUTSTANDING and the menu was great.   Great selection if you just aren't sure what you are hungry for.  Great selection of salads.  Our food was great, I am sure we'll be back again!

X0RvVzqdp46kKeA7Efbt7Q.text: Food in Las Vegas is expensive. Thank goodness for Lux Cafe. The portions are amazing and the price is reasonable. Staff are also very nice.  A lot of people have been comparing it to the Cheesecake Factory, and well...they ought to because it was created by the same company.  We stayed at the Venetian, so it was a convenient place to grab breakfast. For those of you who (like us) don't get up early enough before lunch closes at 11am, don't worry because they still have breakfast items available on their lunch/dinner menu.

wOjmaD1d55p5OKzZ0FaEzA.text: I have been eating here since the first weekend they opened. I have had breakfast, lunch, dinner and late night snack and have never had a bad meal. It's owner by the Cheesecake Factory so you know quality and good food is there standard. There Asian nachos is one of my favorites dishes, crispy won tons top with cheese and peanut sauce served with fried rice. A dish you must try. They now have a small bite menu, a good value with nice size portions. BBQ sliders and Korean tacos are some of my favorites. The sandwiches and salads are also great. The desert, well like I said its own by the Cheesecake Factory so you know they are great. I will be back every time I'm in Las Vegas

2TpNUMVRxljttrk19pXytw.text: A great experience for anyone staying at the Venetian or downtown in general. Almost no wait to be seated and the service was incredible. The chipotle-avocado burger was one of the best I've had and the Grey Goose martini I ordered was spot on.

Qd2Wn7pyGrd4QtwmVkYWnA.text: Convenient location and pretty big portions--who can go wrong w/ that?  Wasn't feeling the $3.00 tea but hey, I was in Vegas and I shouldn't expect anything cheaper lol....  I had the Mai Tai for lunch--was delicious! Ahmm, I ate here 2x for breakfast and I enjoyed both meals....VERY filling and the staff is very friendly!

CZ-DDhaQQ82fKXUqFOfEyQ.text: I dined at the Grand Lux last night.  The food was average.  I had the southern fried chicken with roasted brussel sprouts and  an asian style coleslaw.  The slaw was bland and the sprouts were a little too toothy for my taste.    The portions here are huge.  I could not finish my plate, that is saying something.    What made this experience amazing was our waiter, Jose S.   I have had good service in the past, but Jose S went over and above all expectations!  Not only did he gladly ask questions of the chef regarding dietary questions that I had, but he when the computer told him that they did not have the item I desired, he took the extra step and checked.  Who would have thunk it?  The computer was wrong (even though two other waiters came by and told my table that they were out of fried chicken.)    The waiter can make an ok meal great, or make a great meal terrible (see my review of Nundini's.)  This waiter made the meal amazing.    Even though he was working on Christmas day, he was happy to be there, glad to help and treated us like guests in his own home.

BkrqgzP3uzYw6ULNKKeBBg.text: I love brie. That's a fact, Jack. So when I quickly glanced at the menu, my eyes were set on the turkey & brie sandwich. Turkey, brie, cranberry-apricot chutney, & arugula made up of this sandwich. The one thing that irked me was the overdose of mayo. The side salad was also overdressed. The waiter was super spacey, and couldn't remember anything we said. He also forgot to charge us for drinks, so that was good for us.

b8EAJe_3Z2pEYcYTtLThuQ.text: Came for brunch this morning. Absolutely incredible. We had the buffet and the possibilities were endless. There was even an omelet bar. The best part was the orange juice. I am pregnant and all I crave is OJ. This place, hands down, has the BEST OJ. Can definitely tell its fresh squeezed. Highly recommend this place.

Cj62Yv6qd5kftZoygekTpw.text: Excellent service and good food. Overall very good experience with a family of four. Was very quick to seat us - about 5 minutes while some of the other restaurants could take 45 or more (a lot bigger inside than it looks).

dIq2VVMifD9sDwM1vvEe7w.text: Everything that I have tried on the menu so far is really good. I'm definitely a big fan of their appetizers. The spinach and artichoke dip, edamame and calamari salad.   Service is always great, and they always serve bread and butter. But I ask for jams with my bread.   There are only two Grand Lux Cafe in town both in the Sands Properties, Venetian and Palazzo. The Palazzo location closes at 3 a.m. and the Venetian has the 24 hour one.  Best place to stop by if you're fiending for good food after clubbing at Tao or Lavo.

6r57AcxbGCXkE-Fo1RozCw.text: Bread pudding is a must have. Of course their cheesecake is great, but I was shocked how good the bread pudding was.   Nice staff. Had an awesome waitress named Gina H, who was very helpful in any touristy questions my family and I had (not just on the food in the restaurant which she also knew well).   Definitely will come back.

nRMin7RvOiT_c2XoY6PWvg.text: They serve good food at this location just like their other locations.  I only gave it 3 stars because the waits are usually very long and it gets very crowded.  It is also closer to the casino where the smoke can get really bothersome.  We much prefer waiting without all the smoke.    They also did not make beignets at this location.  The location and atmosphere at the Palazzo is much nicer and the food at the Palazzo location is just as yummy!

AtpetIwlcEWzCdvdHiBE8Q.text: Horrible customer service! Waited over 20 minutes and was never created by a server. Told two different people including the manager and still no one came over. Such a disappointment! Do not waste your time or money here. Go elsewhere.

d7q-BdtJRcUR3X8X4pTRUw.text: Use to order this salad a few times and was shock how it was presented this time!  Lots of lettuce that wasn't even chopped up, Lil piece of chicken with little dressing and croutons replaced by 2 thin toasted bread!!!    I should of ordered steak instead if I knew I had to cut up my own lettuce!  Salad shouldn't be so much work to eat!  Don't  know what's going on but seem like GLC got on the lazy/half ass status!!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Left over wasted lettuce!
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Disappointed!
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sooooo much lettuce!!!!  I don&#39;t even prepare salad like this at home!!!!

mPAy_t4vJs1M54amEypirA.text: It's the Cheesecake Factory- from the tables to the food to the service, to the menu design.  Cheesecake Factory. No bread though  We called to order ahead- no can do.  The service risks being slow, but it's good! The French dip made us come back the second day.  The chicken avocado salad tastes more asian than American/ western, but it was still good!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken avocado salad.  More asian then western tasting  but good

R0v5GYbsdxbIrfw-C2irKw.text: We have been here before  and had multiple great meals! This last time however was a terrible experience! The server had an attitude and the thing we went there for....the order was wrong. Too bad...left a bad taste in our mouths!

oSowcfcYz5dMVQfaqiBNYQ.text: First of all, Grand Lux has their operation down to a science. Getting diners in and out with efficiency is something they've mastered. I was impressed when we dropped in for a late breakfast/lunch Saturday afternoon. Located smack in the middle of The Venetian, the line was out the door. Luckily, we only waited about 5 minutes before being led to a table.   Rumor has it that Grand Lux is affiliated in some respect to The Cheesecake Factory. I'm not sure if that's totally accurate.. Whether or not that's True makes no difference to me because I am a Cheesecake Factory fan!  At any rate, I opted to be good and order a Turkey Club Sandwich. Unfortunately, I also acquiesced to their offer of a bread basket. The bread was nice, reminiscent of Cheese Cake Factory bread. It was damn delicious. My Turkey Club was also nice. It had fresh tomato and thick cuts of bacon. Bread was chewy and perfection.   My lunch companion opted for the breakfast buffet for $18. They will cook you a custom-made omelet. Hash browns, sausages, bacon, pastries and scores of other goodies are also available. Likely a good deal, especially if you have a good appetite and want multiple servings. But I was trying to be good, and was happy with my Club Sandwich. Although, admittedly, my lunch companion brought me a side of hash browns from the buffet. So, in retrospect, I guess I wasn't really that good.  Overall, very pleased. Cost is very reasonable, especially considering it's a restaurant located in a Vegas hotel. I would certainly come here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bloody Mary
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast Buffet
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Turkey Club

bcAOFstCglWxAOVzhYvHTQ.text: Bobby the manager is horrible and incredibly rude!! I had an allergic reaction to the strawberry pear salad which caused my tongue and throat to swell up. I felt that the least they could do is not charge me for this item as it had caused this. I went to speak with the manager who told me it's my fault it happened because I ordered it and consumed it. He said there is nothing he can do and shoved my receipt at me. He is so rude, has no sense of customer service, and ruined my entire experience at the restaurant and hotel.

vYq3k3haX1cHyS2oKs7rfw.text: Because we stayed at the Palazzo and were working nearby, we came to Grand Lux every day for a satisfying breakfast.  Portion sizes are hearty and the food is tasty! We ordered different omelettes each time. We made our own omelettes with the list of toppings (max of 4), as well ordered the chorizo and cheese omelette, fresh garden omelette, and the crab & asparagus omelette.  The chorizo and cheese was bursting with flavor but a little too oily/greasy for me - especially for breakfast. Between all the omelettes we've had, it definitely had the boldest flavor. Something I'm willing to skip first thing in the morning.   I liked both the build-your-own and the fresh garden omelettes - fresh, hearty, and nutritious! Definitely a nice kick-start to the morning!   Crab & Asparagus omelette - tasty, but a bit of a waste. The tomatoes, asparagus, and cheese were simple and awesomeee together. Unfortunately, they overshadowed any presence of crab. Sure, you could see the little crab meat pieces, but the expected seafood-y sweetness that comes from crab was buried under the other flavors in the omelette.  All the omelettes came with a generous side of toast + jam/butter!   Def recommend for a hearty and fresh breakfast!

ogSsT2NNkHvyr4wTWBA8JQ.text: What a pleasurable experience. Miriam P. Is a fantastic server. Upbeat positive attitude, knowledgable about the menu, and a perfect example of what great service should be.

-Jc7aIESanJRUw6lKi8UBQ.text: Solid food. Cheesecake factory sister restaurant. Thus you expect hella-huge portions, lotsa calories. And some enticing desserts. Decent option for a quick/ modestly priced dinner.

-B0UtzY5YxPQqFBTt8C0-Q.text: The food here is good. The price is excellent for the area. I found that everything on the strip is overpriced but the prices at the Grand Lux were decent. The service is great. It is nice to eat there to take a break from the casino which is right outside of the restaurant.

eKO6J4UkanBweJOn0vze6A.text: Always great Burgers!  Good for the family, or after work happy hour. The profiteroles are a great dessert selection.

AnhpFFsiweRPZgyuaojSXg.text: I love all the options and prices of the food at the Grand Lux Cafe! It is a reasonable price lunch or dinner option in Vegas! On past visits we ate at the Grand Lux more times than I can count. We would carry out to the pool even. This trip we stayed at the Aria but ate at the Grand Lux as our last meal. The waiter was the fastest of anyplace we ate on the entire trip and he split all of our checks without any attitude! They also came out with a special desert for me as the bachelorette! Loved it!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Special dessert for the bachelorette!

WPjAwly9dVCIFYk3kYIzHw.text: I am in Vegas 2-3 times a year for work. Always over a work week and I am dying to leave after day 3. Fancy dinners, drinks, blah blah, it gets old.  I was pleasantly surprised after staying at the Palazzo for a week and found this restaurant in the casino, late one night. My co-worker and I were walking (crawling) back to our rooms and I really wanted pizza, she some dessert.   Anything you want in Vegas! We walked in and gave it a shot. Pizza was devoured and the dessert thoroughly lapped off the plate. We eat pretty clean during our trips but this was magical. We even discovered that the place is HUGE inside when we returned to have some burgers for lunch later in the week. Very much like the Cheesecake factory but I like this one better. My new late night and hang over secret in Vegas.

Fb1waLFNqFzd7XGnRLNt6A.text: I had eaten here a few years back and my experience was great but I had forgotten all about it. I restumbled upon it for this Vegas trip and omg. Large portions, fresh and made to order with really reasonable prices for Vegas ($10-15 per plate). We started with brunch- phenomenal food with an all you can eat buffet option , which we decided against. The food and service was so good, we came back later for the late night food (this place is 24/7). They have options of seafood, pasta and sandwiches to Asian and chicken and waffles. All of the food is amazing and the drinks are good too! This place is great at all hours with something for everyone, including the kiddos, in an intimate, dim-lit setting. This is a must eat while in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The best biscuits and gravy with eggs and sausage
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious cocktails!

lCtsPAdOuk7lC9zF3o3qyQ.text: I had breakfast here for two days on the third day we optioned to go elsewhere. The first day we ordered from the menu and the food was hot, service was great and food was fresh and delicious. The second day, my eggs were ice cold, bagel hard as rock and my waitress was MIA. When I asked for new eggs all they did was heat up my old eggs and gave it back to me. Now they are over cooked. Come one get it together as I was very disappointed. Ask to sit in the patio at the front of restaurant if you come here as that is were I got the best service.

I4IfmgZCNyBfflO0F6qqIQ.text: Not sure where to begin.  We waited in line to get seated and it took a good 20min before being seated and I was around 12:15am.  No problem.  As we were walking away from the entrance and headed to the back of the restaurant, the floor started to get REALLY SLIPPERY!  My wife had on heels so I was worried she may slip and fall and asked her to hang on to me just in case.  We made it to the table ok.  Once we got seated, the waitress was quick to return within 10min and asked if we were ready and I said give me 5min.  Well she kinda disappeared for another 15min before coming back. I'm was still fine with that.  We ordered and then also had a glass of wine.  It took almost 15 kin to get the glass when the bar was right behind me. I could have walked there and got it myself.   It took us 45min to get our food!!! WTF!!!  I was tired and hungry and thought it was a quick bite.  My sliders were just ok and my wife's fish was way over cooked.   Well, what made me really upset was when I heard a loud crash of plates and looked behind.  There was a waitress getting off the floor and broken plates all around.   How can a restaurant inside of the Venetian be so careless that their own staff can't even work without dangerous environment.   I hope she she's the shit out of them.

jTQIjS7_0HHyj_ubh5gtpg.text: Growing up, I always stayed at the Venetian whenever I took a family trip to Vegas. I have such fond memories of this restaurant. So when my group of 13 was looking for a place to grab lunch on a Sunday, of course I recommended that we go here.  To my dismay, it was not at all what I remembered it to be. The food in general was of low quality and on the opposite side of the spectrum from a fresh, juicy meal.   The fried chicken tasted like it had been sitting in the warmer for a few hours, the macaroni and cheese was really bland and dry on top (my boyfriend recommended that I dig into the middle parts to not have to eat the stale pieces on top-- I shouldn't have to do that!!), and the Salisbury steak tasted like it had just come out of a frozen food box.  My favorite part of the meal was the iced tea. 5/5 on the iced tea.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Macaroni and Cheese
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salisbury steak
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried chicken

Pgq1g0MFxA-df72XrQ--OQ.text: Delicious! Best Spicy Chicken sandwich I've had! Server was awesome and the Blue Cheese dressing is the best I've ever had! Excited to come back tomorrow for breakfast to order the Belgium Waffle and Chicken!

4bmdgoHVAv2jpOg4d6-qbA.text: Had a quick lunch here soon after checking in and dumping my bags in the room. It was too late for a full lunch and I didn't want to fill up as I knew my friends and I were going have a big dinner in Chinatown. This place seems pretty crowded no matter what time of the morning, day, or night it is and there's usually a bit of a line to get in. Luckily for us we only had to wait a few minutes since it was kind of getting toward the end of the lunch hours.  I must say this is a pretty nice place....nice trendy looking cafe....dimly lit....with lots of table or booth seating. Immediately after being seated, our server came over to greet us and took our drinks order....nice and friendly guy. It didn't take long to decide what I wanted and I knew the portions would be pretty large, so my friend and I decided to split a chicken salad sandwich with fries. Not bad.....had pretty much all the fixins' and the fries were hot and fresh....my only complaint would probably be that it could've had more chicken salad filling in it.  We came back here again two days later for their breakfast. Before I flew out to Vegas, my brother had given me a couple of Costco coupons for either a free continental breakfast or the grand lux breakfast buffet for just $11+ (Usual price about $19+). Of course we went ahead and chose the breakfast buffet! It wasn't a huge spread, but good enough for a very filling breakfast....lots of fresh fruit. yoghurt, pastries, breads, a couple of hot food stations with hash browns, sausages, bacon, scrambled eggs, and waffles.....and there's an egg station for eggs made to order.....nice touch :) Drinks are ordered from the server separately, and OH WoW......the OJ is freshly squeezed and amazingly refreshing! For what you get for the grand lux breakfast buffet, it's well worth the regular $19+.....and is just an absolute deal at $11+! Yum!.....Very good breakfast!  The menu is pretty extensive with pretty much all you need to satisfy any kind of 24/7.craving.

-ZOPiT-sN-y12b_Arwv8Fw.text: Really good food for a decent price. The waiter took a while to get around but the restaurant was full and the waiter was very professional. I had shrimp scampi, there was a lot of tasty meat in the shrimp. The pizza was pretty cheap for size and tasted good.

L2q2jDBfRdhHjyvezfyD_A.text: Cane here for the first time last year for a bite to eat after our endless night dancing away at one of the near by nightclubs. They are I believe open 24/7 with a great selection of different dishes to choose from! My favorite that we had was the nachos wich had some kind of rice or grain on top with a sweet teriyaki sauce of some sort. We also had other appetizers as well. Service was good and we barely waited that long for our food! Looks like we have a new spot to go to after hrs if we get hungry in vegas

eSIeVGU2v9hXoXkp6dCFXA.text: Food is good. But as Ally K. mentioned, the service SUCKS... jus tlike any other Cheesecake.  We came here only for dessert and I guess our waitor thought we weren't worth his time. So he didn't come at all to check up on our desserts or anything.   We got the strawberry shortcake. They have this at Cheesecake as well, but it's a little different at GL because they have sugar on top of the shortbread.  I also tried their strawberry smoothie. It has coconut in it. It's just like Jamba Juice strawberry's wild with coconut.  Their creme brulee comes with regular and chocolate. The chocolate one is VERY rich in chocolate.  For 6.95, it's not bad for two large servings.   Just don't expect great service and you'll be fine.

OR300V3i3N_hdiSfcLfnXQ.text: I went here twice during my last trip.   Sometimes what is lacking in Vegas is a middle ground restaurant, especially in Venettian. You want a restaurant atmosphere, but don't want to pay $200 just to have a meal for two. Yet, you don't feel like paying $15 for a greasy Philly Cheesesteak at the food court. Grand Lux is your middle ground restaurant. Its owned by the creators of Cheesecake Factory and its basically the same to me. Different menu, but still diverse and extensive. Perfect when you need something casual and have a lot of mouths to feed.  My first experience was very pleasant. I had the most attentive, kind, and honest waiter I've had in years....and...he was new!  When I first ordered, he made sure my party knew that the portions are generous. Personally, I like it when they're honest that the portions can be too much and sharing is encouraged for people with smaller appetites, even though it could affect their total tip.  I ordered a pasta and requested for no olives. The kitchen made a mistake and added olives so they had to redo it. I never saw the plate with the olives because my waiter caught it before it was delivered to me. He apologized repeatedly for the tardiness, but I was fine since I wasn't in a hurry and he was just so nice...its hard to be upset. The manager also came over to apologize at one point. Finally, I got my pasta. I just wish they would clarify that it was chicken chorizo on the menu, it makes a difference since I was expecting large chunks/slices of chicken.  I ended up tipping the guy almost 25% in cash and wished him luck before he left. He was such a doll, I would take him home.  Second time I went? Disaster! Snobby waiter who was giving us horrific service. Ignored us most of the time, didn't like the fact that a couple members in my party wanted to share a meal. When he was passing the meals over, he wouldn't even lean over to hand me mine, he just held it up in the air and I had to reach for it. Didn't refill my drinks until I was getting ready to leave! What's the point then? Didn't even give our party a basket of bread unlike the tables surrounding us. Lazy!  However, I think he's just the bad apple of the group. As my previous waiter was great and the manager wasn't bad either.  I would still go here just because it is nice to have something in the middle for dining, plus the menu accommodates just about anyone that's with you. I just hope my service is as good as my first visit.

lKNL3NU7EKpGCExFcLKhDg.text: Ate here the other night for a cocktail and appetizer right before watching the Blue man group! The service was pretty quick, and the appetizers were pretty darn delish! -Calamari -Seared Ahi Tuna  *who knew there are 2, 1 in the venetian and the other in the pollazo..

QqxMJAq95Axq-UBoGWCcyw.text: Basically a smaller version of Cheesecake Factory (well they ARE owned by them hahaha..), but for some reason a whole lot better!   I've been to Cheesecake Factory plenty of times, and I felt that it was relatively over-priced for the measley portions they offer. However, Grand Lux shares just about the same menu, but pricing and portions are worth the cost.  While my friends and I were staying at the Venetian, Grand Lux Cafe was basically our go-to spot for food, regardless of time or circumstance, since of course it's open 24 hours. Incredibly convenient, especially for a city like Vegas!  I tried a couple different things I don't often order at restaurants, the Braised Yankee Pot Roast and the Veal Saltimbocca.   Now, you can get pot roast just about ANYWHERE, but Grand Lux prepared it so well. Normally, at your run-of-the-mill restaurants, the Pot Roast description says "slow-roasted until tender" and ends up being all dry and chewy. Grand Lux's version was a different story; I could've sworn the meat was as tender as butter and as savory as can possibly be. The vegetables were fresh and buttery, though I wasn't too fond of the yams. (Not a yam guy, so sue me.)  The Veal Saltimbocca was pretty much like a Chicken Cordon Bleu, but with a nice twist. The veal was done just right and the prosciutto and Fontina cheese complimented it well. Throw in a well-balanced mixture of Parmesan breadcrumbs and herbs and you've got a classic mainstay dish on your hands. The angel-hair pasta with wine sauce grounded out the dish very well, though I personally thought it was a little too oily.  I believe Grand Lux is one of those restaurants you just have to stop by if you're ever in Vegas, especially since it's open 24 hours. So whether you need some food to sober up after partying a little too hard at Tao, or would like a nice breakfast to talk over plans of the day with friends, I highly recommend Grand Lux Cafe!  -- Quan

i4-oujve5NHwG8JOL1BBwA.text: I thought this was the upscale Cheesecake factory?  The menu is underwhelming and the food is mediocre diner quality.  The need to redo the menu at this place and hire new cooks.  They are better off just putting a cheesecake factory in here.

ePX9OKy_EuQtYU2v0TtOng.text: If you've got a hankering for breakfast at 2am and don't mind heading to The Venetian, then Grand Lux Cafe is the place to be.  Bacon, eggs, hash browns, and toast may sound drab, but when cooked to perfection it's nothing short of amazing (for your tastebuds at least).  Craving for something sweeter? Belgian waffles with whipped cream and a side of strawberries should do the trick.   Yeah, they have other items on the menu, but after trying a wide variety of entrees, their breakfast choices are by far the most satisfying.

5vmuboijuiCbeVW9HWeKnw.text: Honestly, The Grand Lux Cafe is one of my top five favorite restaurants and has held this prestigious honor since it opened up.  Here is my top 10 list as to why The Grand Lux Cafe deserves the honor:  10. The menu is huge. If you can't find something that you utterly enjoy on it, go back to McDonald's.  9. The wait staff is always accommodating. You can substitute things and it will still come out the exact way you asked, on the first try. ( I have a picky mother-in-law and there are ALWAYS substitutions when she orders her meals)  8. If you are lucky enough to snag a seat at the bar and want to eat there, they set you up right with all serving utensils and place mat. Plus, you get your drinks faster, score!  7.Seating. We never have a bad table, and comfy seats.  6. Plenty of tables. When a restaurant is as popular as this one, they need lots of tables and The Grand Lux Cafe has plenty. I have yet to wait over 10 minutes  for a seat, even on a holiday weekend.  5. Artichoke Dip. This is my favorite appetizer ever and the Factory does it well. Spinach, artichokes, cheese=Heaven.  4. Avocado Egg rolls. Really, I have no need to say more.  3. Cheesecakes! In every flavor imaginable. And they all rule! They even have sugar-free ones for those of us that can't have sugar. Yes!  2. Blue-cheese stuffed olive martinis! These little morsels rock and The Grand Lux Cafe hand-stuffs them. Mmm...  1. And Finally, Miso Salmon. I can't even find the words as to how great this dish is. The fish, the sauce, it is so freakin' good. I have been to the restaurant when they were all out of it (it has to marinade over night and they only make a certain amount) and I think I cried. Thank goodness there are so many other delicious dishes but the Miso Salmon, just might be my request for a last meal.

PkenkYzTZsFTcB2SsRhQ2A.text: We went there for lunch since bouchon was closing at 2pm and it was already 1:30pm. There was no wait, had feeling of cheesecake factory like other reviewers mentioned. I liked sweet potato side (who doesn't like sweet potato!?) but my pasta was... meh. I ordered pasta fresco (not sure about the name) basically pasta with grilled vegetable. It was lacking in flavor. Lots of olive oils though. I left more than half of dish... :/ Nothing amazing here I suppose but for the price I guess it's ok. (since everything in vegas could be expensive!)

SPUswCqM0VIVk8lDe8zjVQ.text: It'll be open after your night of dancing at Tao which is probably its biggest bonus, meaning you're not going have your girl walking down the sidewalk to Denny's on her bare feet because the stupid uncomfortable heels she wore made her feet hurt.  A cheese cake factory by any other name is still a cheese cake factory.

RH6FZgG7G2VRCTUJGi89Xg.text: Disappointing that such a large chain would have such a limited gluten-free menu and the wait staff are uneducated about what gluten is.  Enough said.
