6HGpyvp8iVy19E3uB95KQQ.text: You can't go wrong for a quick casual reasonably priced bite to eat. Food is tasty and service is good!   Enjoyed the Enchilada Plate with rice & black beans (both on point) and the hubs ordered cheeseburger sliders - also really good!

ab6mtE6fqWeSIvQwNHrJig.text: I find that food in Vegas is either delicious but costs and figurative buttload or nauseating and still costs far too much.               This place has high quality food for some of the most reasonable prices; especially since they give you a hefty amount of sustenance.         My roommate and I came here for lunch one day while exploring the Venetian and we each got drinks, salads, and pasta. Each dish was so good and the menu had many more options so we decided to come back for another meal at some point during our stay. We came back for dinner and it was even better! Our server was very accommodating and was more polite than most of the other servers we had during our entire trip. Needless to say we had a great couple of meals.

CAtbU81VMCNY0IZljJKC7w.text: Yum!  Come on Saturday night for the Tuna Tartare, use the leftover sauce to use as a dip for the crab legs!  Gelato wheel!  Good service...tip your server, they looked overworked!

n_oIoUxMID1GSzhS-mcbVA.text: I must say I was VERY disappointed in this meal. I am such a lover of The Cheesecake Factory and all of their other products including this restaurant which I attended in AZ and NV. The problem with my meal (Jambalaya) was it absolutely no flavor, it was greasy and it was down right bland. I have eaten this dish at TCCF for years all over the country and this was such an absolute bust that I will never return to Grand Lux Cafe! Come on you cannot represent this brand like this.  Get corporate in there to fix the problems!!!!! It pains me to write such a low score for my favorite restaurant franchise of all time!

5-bZY7oOn95XpoujiugPtg.text: Wonderful.  Loved the grand lux cafe.  Menu is ample, ambiance is great, and service is excellent.  Had the chicken Parmesan, kale salad and a white sangria.  Awesome and will definitely come back.

CE1ByK21iWsnhiqBCNOHwA.text: Sooooo good. They have this one chicken pasta that costs about $18 and tastes amazing. Not to mention, it's guaranteed to fill you up!

vVvqPtXTOSCRMufdM1VzgA.text: Amazing food! I love the Margarita Pizza and the kids share the spaghetti with tomatoe sauce which I usually take a few bites. My husband got the beef welington and he said it was great.  The pricing is reasonable as well. Usually betweem 13-25 per plate for our family.

quwhWX06zc3cMl2FUWwbzA.text: We ate here for breakfast based on the yelp reviews and Yelp did not fail us.  I had the Churro French toast and it was delicious.  Probably only needed half the portion but I will finish the other half for breakfast tomorrow.  Prices were comparable or close to what is on the strip.   They had a buffet too but they are not my thing.  Their Mimosa was excellent too and filled with alcohol to get the morning started right.

hAVkphVPNh4lKREd8nTwvQ.text: While our stay at Venetian we decided to try this place in breakfast! I had fresh garden omelette  and my husband had red valves pancakes! Both the things were outstanding! Really heavy and no one person can complete the pancakes but they were amazing! The only one thing which can be improve is - the toasts they gave with omelette were not crispy rather soggy so we told the waitress about it and she rather replacing those put them in oven again and which kind made them bit burnt! But overall the service was amazing and she was really entertaining and loved everything else about this place! Can go again!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pancakes
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Omelette
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Toast

9WP1lEUW-3AKhZpQJxn2tw.text: Came for Valentine's Day lunch, got seated in under a minute. It had a very romantic feel. We ordered the grand calamari ($15) absolutely delicious!!!!! It had fried shrimp, fried onions, fried zucchini, and fried calamari. They also served bread and butter with it. I ordered the pasta telephono it was amazing. My boyfriend had steak and mashed potatoes which was delightful. I also ordered a side of fries which weren't all that- very oily, and came almost after I was done with my entree. Waitress attentive but must have been busy because she didn't check on us that much and took a while for food and the check. Luckily we weren't In a hurry. But the total for everything was about $73 which I think was worth it. The portion sizes we're HUGE we could barely for our two entrees on the table. Had a lot of leftovers to take with us.

3U4Fi3qIAqz3_gcB0pzlbg.text: We have eaten here before but this last time was one of the worst experiences ever. Keep in mind it was not busy at this hour. We walked in and were greeted right away and quickly seated. After waiting 10 minutes someone casually dropped off 4 waters  but nothing else. At this point we had waited 15 minutes but still had no idea who our waiter was. We finally asked the lady in the front to be moved into another section and she quickly sat us somewhere else. After that we had to wait another 20 minutes for food and finally ate after what felt like forever. This was an awful experience and the manager came over and just apologized and walked away. He didn't say anything else, didn't ask us if we needed anything. It was  a very disappointing experience especially because we have eaten here many times before. On the bright side the food was good.

Not0qqlhvtOtgTwryjYArw.text: Seriously forget about the other fancy wannabe restaurants that charge twice as much for food that they can't even cook well.  My all time fave is the jumbo shrimp pasta. And this dish is huge enuf for two and less than $20. That is why Cheesecake Factory Co rawks!   You will not miss it when staying at the Venetian cause it is located right next to the room elevators and you will not mind going more than once because there are a lot of dishes to try and their desserts are great too.  And service is impeccable. No snotty waiters nor waitresses.   Fill you up and go easy on your pocket and will not let you down kinda restaurant ... yea!

b_SSIY5B-SVwQz9Nhri6hg.text: I love the quality and variety of food as well as the prices. They also have a nice breakfast buffet. This is a regular stop when I'm in Vegas.

1iccUEbbxBm9vqiAUREIFA.text: It's not the most original concept or location in the world.  But god damn if it doesn't have the biggest menu of all time.  You can come here with a group of 10 people who are all looking for something completely different, and they will all get a good meal.  Burger, Salad, Sandwich, Pasta, Chinese, Thai, Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner, Soup.  They have it all, they do it well.  Huge seating capacity as well.  Exactly what is needed in this particularly location.  Great bread baskets too.

TvhzBSPTikPI5KN0HEUibg.text: Woah so good! Or maybe that was the alcohol talking?  I went here with my buddies after clubbing at Lavo. I was so hungry but did not want anything too heavy, so I opted for waffles haha! First of all, I'm so grateful to our server. He was so patient with us while we were all being drunk and breaking things (we're so sorry!) He was friendly throughout, so we all gave him 18% tip. Back to the food, WOAH those were some awesome waffles! I originally wanted chicken & waffles but they ran out of fried chicken (sad face) but I was definitely satisfied with their waffles & strawberries. Their serving was pretty big and the waffle itself tasted soooo yummy and fluffy. I'm usually very picky when it comes to waffles because ever since the first time I tasted authentic Belgian waffles as a kid I've yet to find anything close to it... I don't think Grand Lux's was close BUT it definitely was delicious. Have I mentioned the size of their menu!?? I guess it's because Grand Lux Cafe is related to The Cheesecake Factory. I've tasted one of my friends' slider and I was impressed at the consistency of their food. At other places, some of their dishes are hit or miss but after tasting my friends food, all tasting very good, there's a good chance that whatever you order here will be delicious.  So whenever I'm at the Venetian or Palazzo and hungry enough to eat at the casino I'll most likely to dine here =)

YxfHWGMrV2BDTCJ6GbUE_g.text: We heard this was a great buffet breakfast place and it wasn't.  Very limited selection and the only selling point is that you can have made-to-order omelet.   Very disappointing buffet and on top of that it's 37 bucks for 2 peeps.    TOO OVERPRICED for so little.

PjkkSX0K6ChKa36AS1ZN9g.text: Solid. Open 24/7 and large portions. Perfect for after the club or early risers. I love the Asian Nachos.

C8biS7UELWgZ4mJan7mC7g.text: Opened by the same creators of The Cheesecake Factory but I think their food is a lot better.  Love that Grand Lux is open 24 hours so you can come whenever.  Their portions are ginormous!  Two dishes is definitely more than enough for two people.  The boyfriend and I shared: ~ Fried Calamari: appetizer with rock shrimp, zucchini and onions.  One of the best fried calamari dishes I've ever had.  Batter was super light (almost tempura-like).  Also liked that they threw in some shrimp and veggies for some variety.  Yum-O!! ~ Cajun Chicken Jambalaya: ordered the lunch special (which is supposed to be smaller than their regular portions but still huge!).  Tasted more like a Chinese stir-fry to me than a Cajun dish but it was still alright. ~ Half BBQ Chicken Pizza & House Salad: another lunch special with ginormous portions ~ Creme Brulee Duo: two huge creme brulees (vanilla and chocolate)...still liked good ol' vanilla better.  We had so much food leftover...we ended up eating it for dinner.  Our server was really friendly and helpful.  Definitely would come back next time we go to Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. creme brulee duo
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. half BBQ chicken pizza &amp; salad
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cajun chicken jambalaya (lunch special)

lE3HcvJat-Cgogw8XBUOgg.text: Cuban sandwich is bomb!!! Definitely try the Caesar salad also. Everything I tried was super heavy on the pepper, just the way I like it. SERIOUS knock off of Cheesecake Factory...

xpijl3DtUhN_PbCQzsPvHw.text: This place is so impressive.  The food was excellent!  The service was above and beyond my expectation.  Very fast service.  The pricing was surprisingly reasonable.  I will definitely come back on my next trip to Vegas.

9elg68VYAOakdgFYbkBumg.text: This place is great. And everything taste amazing.  I've been here like 4 times and everytime has been consistently great.  I've had burgers. Clam chowder.  Eggs benny.  Everytime.  on the money.

hB-SCnJrxm0vco4w1xCvZA.text: Grand Lux is your slightly more upscale Cheesecake Factory.  And if you find yourself in Palazzo or Venetian and are shell-shocked by all the 4 star, celebrity-chef restaurants (with prices to boot), then this is probably a welcome sight.    HUGE portions, strong drinks, reasonable prices.  Plus, the restaurant is large so seating isn't too bad.  Unfortunately, they were out of a bunch of stuff (ahi tuna, certain scotch, etc).  Good for after seeing Jersey Boys or Blue Man Group.

wNLxU80XjdD8qWIusHKd5A.text: FAVORITE: Turkey and (i believe it was) Havarti   We stopped here right before we went to go see The Blue Man Group to grab a sandwich to take in...we went with this one and it did not disappoint it was a great sandwich and the cheese pairing was delish!

V1JQnWUV2lBFYmTR9sZkvA.text: DEFINITELY WORTH GOING.  We were staying at Caesar's but after seeing the over the top prices there, we decided to look for something a little more standard on the strip. We knew we were gong to pay a premium for anything around here, which was fine, but I was pleasantly surprised when we saw this place in Yelp.  Food is fine. Prices are fine. Only gave it three stars as the service was really slow - not from our server, but from the kitchen. But the place was busy and bustling.  $ 36.00 for breakfast - not bad considering you are on the strip.  I yelped the price at $$ because for the Vegas strip, it's lower than usual, which is okay by me. Anywhere else it might have been $$$.  I would definitely go back.

lWUOPEIwZLK8TL9nbP0EaQ.text: Cheesecake Factory's sister restaurant, so you can expect great variety in the menu and huge portions. Yum!

4jVA4tRfy4PvGoFB3wpdOQ.text: Didn't wait very long to be seated. Very large restaurant.  Felt like a large cafeteria type dinning establishment more than a restaurant.  Service was good.   We ordered the chicken, basil, tomato, mozzarella pasta. Decent flavors. I thought it could have been more potent.  Four small pieces of chicken with a little mozzarella melted on it.  Some heirloom tomatoes.  A lot of pasta but again not much chicken for 16.00  I was disappointed with the product quality and would not order this again.

QabQz85Lkn0y8ailLt8K8g.text: Perfect spot for late night grub at 5am, after losing money at the Venetian casino.  There was a good amount of people dining (and a group of loud annoying yougins), but we had fast friendly service which made up for it.  It took a while to look through their massive menu, but I was happy with what I ordered.  I got me some Fried Chicken & Waffles, which was a very generous portion.  I was bummed I got fried chicken strips instead, but paired with the honey butter, hot syrup, and crispy waffle, it was pretty good.  Everyone was happy with what they ordered, from pasta to burgers.    Great place for large groups, large portions, and late night dining.

9smDctbPSfdx-IhuyOl4Yg.text: This is more a review of the coffee shop. The fact that they let everyone order from the full restaurant menu is absurd.  When all you want is coffee and an eclair you have to wait while others order breakfast for the entire family.   They have a limited menu posted.  That should be the only options.

a66RlThMv1gHTturnv1_mA.text: Great place to eat at when hungry late late at night in Vegas. Their appetizer sampler is amazing but not available after a certain time. My friend ordered the lettuce wraps, another ordered potato poppers, and I being super asian and wanting comfort food ordered a noodle soup.   slurped it all up though. bonus star is for our sensitive waiter who, without our asking, made sure my friend got some hot water and honey since her throat wasn't feeling too well.

gZo4hGN6fJ-hQ5R_MvwKCQ.text: Great portion size. The menu is huge so it takes a little bit of time to decide what you want. The shrimp are HUGE! Totally a must go for anyone who has never been!

2d-rWvqQyH2jB3mWij9X0Q.text: Love that it is 24/7 as it feels like vegas does die out in the food category we went in after midnight and thats when we checked in! my husband loved the buffalo chicken wraps.

UwIJ-N7vBj3DBxTY13-qRg.text: Been there for the third time today, never been disappointed. The Caesar salad is delicious and a good portion, my friend always gets the turkey club sandwich and their fries are absolutely amazing some of the best I've had, and today I got the pasta carbonara and it was so good! Good atmosphere good food, definitely  recommended

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

WubdI9jHf-e1zErxpWdLcg.text: I'm a local and I am currently expecting. I love love love this place! I've been there in person, tonight was my first night trying to order via phone so my husband could go and pick it up. I had some one answer the phone and tell me that they would be with me right away well, here I am 45 minutes and 30 seconds later!!! ON HOLD!!! No one even took my order I am very upset that no one has even picked up the phone. I do understand it is late but I would at least appreciate someone explaining to me as to why I waited this long!!   (Now the one star is based only on the hold time)

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Here is my proof!!!

qqaY1tgm-9oW5xGYlWgqJA.text: This was my first time to eat here and I figured I would give it a try since it has good reviews on yelp. We had a group of 7, 4 Adults and 3 kids. They sat us at a rounds table that barely fit 5 people even though half the restaurant was empty and they had plenty of open tables. When we asked them for a bigger table, they had us wait in the front for 15 minutes without giving us any update or telling us how long it would take for them to seat us. When they finally found us a table, it was a booth that was smaller than the first table they offered us but we were so hungry that we decided to just squeeze into the small booth. Our server came and seemed like he was irritated that he had to serve us. He said he recommend the buffet instead of ordering off the menu, so we took his recommendation. Out of all the breakfast buffets I've tried in Vegas, this was the the smallest with the least amount of variety. Our server rarely came around to check on us and refills were scarce. For $25 dollars a person I was very disappointed with the overall experience from the service to the food. I don't plan on coming back here again. With the amount of options Vegas has to offer for food, I recommend saving your money and going to eat elsewhere.

RkaKDj9j1t93wAi91Gx6rQ.text: Just finished a delicious Burger.  Avocado, plenty of cilantro and poblano peppers ,thousand island dressing is served on the side to use at your liking.   Perfectly cooked medium well and a side salad w/ excellent ranch dressing.  Awesome brew of decaf coffee and they start you with delish artisan bread with butter.  Better yet at an awesome price and most importantly the service from Aba with her attentive and gentle spirit made it a truly pleasurable lunch.  Thanks

qKZoEAYZVEtwLTn5yIZykg.text: Service was one of the most surprising I've ever had in Vegas. Our waiter treated us like children, despite our attempts to be completely professional. She rearranged our table and moved our sauce trays only "a tad to the left" of the plates, and reached OVER our main dishes to do so. Her sleeves lingered over our drinks and plates; not to mention the fact that as we politely asked for tobacco sauce, she was grabbing it WHILE calling out over her shoulder "what else was that?" She described our portion of pasta to be huge, but in reality our probably could feed one person. Hair was on the extra plates we received, and hair was IN the mozzarella of our pizza. Disgusted and disappointed in this service. Especially being around Vegas' variety of restaurants. I'm sure there are other wonderful waiters and other great reviews, but this is mine.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Let&#39;s play eye spy the HAIR. (P.S. This wasn&#39;t the only one.)

49rnXAetkNlaxlkXFYzv9A.text: Amazing veggie burger and angus burger. Soft juicy and perefrct consistency. Veggie omlett was ok and can be avoided.

z92aeh1SkdHt_9j1dQ5HTw.text: As always, one of my favorite places to eat when in Vegas. The food and service were outstanding! I had the Chinese chicken salad, Lunch portion. It's still a huge portion! Hubby had chicken salad sandwich and soup and salad. So much food for lunch specials. We will definitely be back!!! Thanks for the good eats.

The-bpMoJe4D9ypdyUDqCQ.text: Great food and staff. Had dinner there last night, could not ask for better service. Our server was magnificent, I even remember he's name "Marcos". Thank you for making it a great experience and I'll be there again next month. We will make sure we ask for you! Thank you!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great soup and salad with green tea &amp; honey and lemons!
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Soup &amp; great salad! Green tea with honey and lemon

bIQihuZp-PNfYdxH_6nHFA.text: Fantastic breakfast buffet!!! The waffles were prepared perfectly, I mean perfectly!! All the other breakfast items were fresh and warm. Lots of fresh fruit too!   Ordered a hazelnut latte, awesome!   Definitely suggest this location for breakfast.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

4iRffkFzCeL26RdH8J0q6A.text: I have loved the Grand Lux for years, both in Las Vegas and when it was in Los Angeles. Tonight I was disappointed with the bar. This restaurant is very skimpy on their alcohol, but big on prices. I questioned the bar tender and got no where, not good customer service. You would think they would try and accommodate their customer, but that didn't happen so I sent the drink back. Too bad because the food is good. I walked away very dissatisfied and will not be coming back. Too many other restaurants in this town, this restaurant doesn't need my business.

IlLCCCrYk0NvCou7QYdyxA.text: We arrived here about 2am and had a very late dinner (or was it early breakfast) after leaving The Sayers nightclub.  I had the calamari and chicken and waffles.  Both were very good.  There weren't many people here at 2am so service was quick and efficient.  I like that it's open 24/7.  It's nice to have it as an option anytime of day because the Grand Lux is a great restaurant.

slsOybotOcnOtvwtTB2H0A.text: PARKING: It's free parking in VEGAS!  PLACE: Located in Venetian hotel, small , poor decor. small seating area looks like its not belong in Venetian. Totally opposite from the Grand luxe i have been in LA. 1 star for this , needed make over !!!  SERVICE: came here late midnight after a long walked  on the strip of vegas .  Quick and nice waitress.  FOOD: Grand luxe never fails me, we ordered cuban sandwhich they always make it fresh and hot when you order food in here . flavor of the meat is pretty good. by the way their desert if made to order  and they are delicious. yummmmmm  Fries: hot and freshly cooked the way i like it. well seasoned.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sober food

lRKzhDY9xdQ0-C20xeyy0g.text: This is my favorite place to eat when I come to Las Vegas, I've never tried anything here that turned up to be less than perfect.

s-r8L1JKfNCrYCEa0Tfkog.text: One of my favorite restaurants in Vegas for breakfast. My go-to has been the French toast - extra thick slices of brioche that are perfectly crispy on the outside and oh so gooey/custardy on the inside. It's very rich and is best with the added strawberries.   They're also adding new items to the menu - today I was able to try the breakfast quesadilla and it was amazing. The chorizo was the perfect balance of salt and spice, and paired greatly with the cheese and medley of veggies/salsa/beans.   My other great find today was the dozen of freshly baked chocolate chip pecan cookies for $8.50. We ordered it when we got to the table and it arrived fresh from the oven as we got our bill. The cookies are amazing - can't wait to go back!

36iI4BJfoRnukn_EYrngbg.text: The palazzo has always been my favorite hotel to stay in Vegas, it's amazing, however the coffee shop they have inside (not the restaurant) grab lux left me with a really bad experience in the palazzo. The cashier had an attitude, we waited 30 min in line just to order! So much for "grab and go" as a slogan. They don't have a microwave to warm up any of their pastries, so we had to eat them tasting refrigerated. Please don't come here if you're looking for something good and quick.

9ZYmXq_rhiSpTCPu5TmxqQ.text: Another repeat time that I have been here but finally reviewing.  biscuits &  gravy : Biscuits were that good blend between toasted on the outside but soft enough on the inside, so as not to scratch my mouth. I like the gravy because it also had sausage in it. portions were enough to share between my wife & me.  Caramel banana French toast: Brioche bread instead of sourdough, I was with that. The sauce on the side was a good addition, bananas were fresh.  Our server was attentive and brought pur refills without us asking.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Caramel banana French toast
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Biscuits &amp; gravy

AxfEhRW9IAfC70CLrLeF_Q.text: OPEN 24/7  for breakfast, lunch, dinner & late night!  Grand Lux Cafe is under the same ownership as Cheesecake Factory, so the atmosphere and the menu are similar in some ways.  FOOD. My favorite items here are... Pasta Carbonara with Chicken - Wow. I thought I've had good carbonara in the past, but that was until I've had theirs. Not only are their portions HUUUUUGE, but the pasta was so delicious! It was extremely cheesy, saucy and full of chicken. It was the most perfect carbonara I've had. Southern Fried Chicken - my #1 favorite item here!!!! I order this most times that I go. It's half a chicken, breaded in this amazing batter and deep fried to perfection. It's served with mashed potatoes and peanut cole slaw. It is so good. KFC got nothin' on this. Seriously, it's amazing. It's enough for two people, too. Cream of Chicken & Mushroom Soup - This soup is the bomb. Just trust me on this. Deep Dark Fudge Cake - One of my favorite chocolate cakes I've had, ever. It is rich and extremely chocolatey. A must try if you come here!  PRICE. Not too shabby, compared to other Vegas restaurant prices. The servings are huge so you get your money's worth for sure.  SERVICE. This is where they lost a star. The service I received on my most recent visit was sub par. Our waiter was M.I.A. most of the time, failed to refill our drinks and bread basket, and took forever bringing us what we asked for. The restaurant was busy when we got there, but the crowd died down after a while. I understand these waiters are juggling a bunch of tables at once, so no complaints were made. It just would've been nice to have quicker service. Not to mention, it took thirty minutes for our food to come out! Yikes! I usually order over the phone and just pick it up to eat in my hotel room. I highly recommend that. The service is quick and you get to eat in bed (score!).  OVERALL. I love Grand Lux Cafe and will always come back. I wish they didn't close the one in LA so I don't have to wait until I'm in Vegas to eat here!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

83vfx_jI0yk98WJXx3_3Dw.text: If you're stopping here for breakfast the Buffett is the best way to go. Lots of fresh fruit, pastries, eggs, bacon, waffles and an omelette station.  Fresh squeezed orange juice is the real deal!

2iX3ehwfzkm3lvEWFpR7Yg.text: This restaurant is located inside the Venetian and right next to the casino which is pretty convenient for hotel guests. I dined here twice during my trip and the food was delicious! I believe they're open 24 hours because the first time I was here was at 4am. I tried their chicken quesadilla and it was soo good! The portions are huge too it would've filled two drunk people! The next night, I dined here for dinner and tried their pasta. I can't remember what it's called but it was the beef short rib and ground beef pasta. The portion is also huge even to share! Service here is great and pretty quick too considering how busy they were for dinner. I'll definitely be back when in Vegas again!

tfw2GQCOL1uRXCzgziyMsw.text: We stopped by Grand Lux on our last day in Vegas. I ordered the chicken and waffles and my mom ordered a salad. She didn't like her meal and we ended up splitting mine. The chicken and waffles were a perfect combination of sweet and savory. Their menu is quite extensive, which can be a little overwhelming. Service was standard and the wait wasn't bad.

KMvzZ6tbeQaDZmOHQFYngg.text: Even if it is lined up, they move people in and out quickly, so you won't be waiting too long.  The service is outstanding.  The staff are helpful and friendly, but also seem to have a good sense of humour and really enjoy working there (or at least... they're good at faking it!).  We went for breakfast here both mornings that we stayed at the Venetian.  The first morning, I tried the Huevos Rancheros.  It was way too big for one person, but it was delicious. I ate way too much of it.  The second morning, I tried the biscuits and gravy.  They were different than what you'd expect.  There are potatoes as the first layer, then your eggs are placed on top of them, then the sausage gravy is poured on and it's topped with 3 or four mini biscuits.  A great take on an old classic.  Again, it was too big for me, but it was great.  I would happily order either dish again.  If there was any downside it would be that we weren't told about the buffet option.  We saw people bringing their plates back to their tables, but didn't realize it was an option.

yhGY00MmHiJXZutNY2njOQ.text: Great service and the menu had so many delicious selections it was hard to choose. I got the miso glazed salmon lunch and my husband got the chicken salad sandwich and we shared a tuna ceviche. The ceviche wasn't the best-probably wouldn't order it again but the lunches were very good. Salmon was juicy and had lots of veggies and brown rice. The chicken salad was flavorful and juicy, too. We went back for late night food and got the grand club sandwich which was delicious. The fries were disappointing (hard and hallow).

3FZzBBE35iX1a-jzggj3EA.text: Great Happy Hour menu! Was busy so there was some hiccups but not enough for a bad comment.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tahitian Pineapple!

YccXOVU8pOprz6zJfr1qGg.text: I was looking for a place to eat at 3 am without leaving the palazzo and I'm so happy I found this gem. The food here is delicious and the menu has many options. I got the chicken parm along with the mushroom pepperoni pizza and they both were sooo good. Leahanna was our waitress and she was very nice and attentive.

tJNIYgiMeW4zSfUzGKpyzw.text: The food was so good! I got the lemon chicken pasta and my husband got a fried chicken filet that came with mashed potatoes and green beans. We also got macaroni and cheese, which was delicious. The server was friendly, too.   I only took off a star because they sat us at a table for two, which was too small. Both of us knocked our silverware to the floor, as we sat. I could have understood if the restaurant was full, but there were numerous bigger tables empty, the entire time we were there, and they sat other couples at bigger tables. Next time, I will insist that we are seated elsewhere. This is going to be a regular stop for us.

28HeXa6LZQawrMRWcMUdNg.text: Good chicken and wild rice soup. Chicken salad sandwich was also good. Pain au chocolat was dry. Beet salad was more accurately a salad with beets, not a salad of beets.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

EsLtgNQ1EF4OWnQX26s_UA.text: Kept passing by this place and decided to stop and see what the hype was about. I ordered a Long Island (or as they call it, a "Texas tea") which was a little pricy but omg it was huge. It was delicious and worth the price imo. I got the burger slider appetizer and my hubby got the Asian nachos appetizer and they were SO GOOD.  We didn't try any of the main menu stuff but if the appetizers are this good, i bet the main courses are even better :)

ij_oWuPyA95fH_ap5wuSgA.text: I passed through this place a couple of times and finally decided to give it a try to for breakfast. When my boyfriend and I arrived, there was a long line to the hostess stand but it moved fast and within five minutes we were  seated. We opted to order off of the menu instead of taking advantage of the brunch buffet. I ordered a cheddar and bacon omelette with home fries and toast. The menu did not specify that home fries came with the omelette so I was pleasantly surprised to see them on my plate. The chef did not skimp on the bacon in my omelette, I had a mouthful of bacon in every bite. The bf got churro French toast and a side of bacon. The churro French toast was so soft and sweet. If you have a sweet tooth, this is the dish for you. The portions of both our entrees were HUGE. We struggled when trying to finish our meals. I really wish we had time to return for lunch or dinner because everything on the menu looked sooo good. Next time!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Churro French Toast
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheddar and bacon omelette with home fries

_s-c12oS6b6T18omn7Tu2Q.text: Always an amazing time dining at the Grand Lux Cafe. The breakfast is always delicious and the staff was very friendly and took the time to answer questions about the food.

GRMI1q8gRtMBRH48kN48Xg.text: The food is awesome  I had the jambalaya and French fries. So good and tasty.   The service is awesome too!   It gets a little busy during lunch and dinner, but doesn't all good Vegas restaurants? Lol  They have a huge selection of American food.   Great brunch menu too.   Enjoy and be happy

mRT2z6uGmd4ItGb214U8hA.text: Great food. Great service. Huge menu. Lots of variety. Order chocolate chip cookies when you are seated. They bake them fresh and take 30 minutes. Well worth the wait. They are amazing. Everything was great.

pv9wfHFW4vN_VNlecUAMOA.text: Staying at The Palazzo this was the easiest for breakfast. Our party had Churro French Toast, 2 Florentine omelets, and lemon poppyseed pancakes. Everyone was happy and VERY full!  Generous portions (even my teen boys took home leftovers). Staff was gracious and attentive. Will definitely return!

ErxHj7lT2zJSFMIKVFxWZg.text: Sunday night pasta is so good we order two. The short ribs and light sauce just stick to the thin spaghetti perfectly and is comfort food at its finest. It's nice that the Las Vegas locations are still open for business when the Los Angeles ones have all closed down.   A restaurant concept from the originators of the Cheesecake Factory, Grand Lux Cafe also has a diverse menu that focuses on what I call new American diner. It is a good place for larger groups because the menu options are wide enough to give most members in your party something to choose.   The food is rich and some salads have more calories than their regular entrees.  Iced tea is one choice: regular, which differs from Cheescake's passion fruit iced tea option. Calamari tastes better than Cheesecake's version but order the large because the mini is really mini. For dessert get a cheesecake of course.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

jSh7FABiORP2ciKKMENp1Q.text: I love that we get sat right away with a huge group. When we went there was no reservations because of a convention. Fast service, good food, great service

rxZjMX8SxtMRoFC4CUuMxw.text: This is me and my family's favorite restaurant to go eat at with all the kids in Las Vegas. My sister moved there a couple years ago and we visit often. My nephew has a severe serious peanut allergy and my niece has a milk allergy, so it's very awesome when we can all go to a restaurant and eat and it accommodates all of us. They are so good with kids allergies and very careful to not cross contaminate foods. We can come here and have peace of mind that the kids will enjoy a delicious meal and be happy and healthy when we leave. The food is so good, and they have so much variety. Our waitress was so amazing and so so sweet. I forgot her name I feel so bad but she was there in the evening tonight on Tuesday the 14th of May. Thank you for always being one of the best places to eat in Vegas! Xx

JnExZzs-PsAaN2lhO-EIdQ.text: I got the chicken piccata with mushrooms and capers in pasta from the lunch section, delicious! Great and decent portion. Just like Cheesecake Factory but better because it's Vegas and the service is usually always good.  Good for groups or eating alone. They have a lunch buffet but I never did it.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

RXIPg8PGxrAjqDw594X07Q.text: "Well, you know what they say, you don't sell the steak, you sell the sizzle."  - Kramer, Seinfeld  Da scene:  It's 2pm, I want a steak, but don't want to hassle trekking to Cut or Delmonicos. This spot fits the bill nicely. Deep menu, people watching, close to guest elevators.  Da grub:  Actually ate here 3 times this stay: breakfast, late lunch, late night.  All excellent.  Express Breakfast buffet ($20) has standard American staples plus an omelette station - Score! Did the t-bone for lunch ($25), legit steak cooked to perfect med-rare. Then after a poker session, did the Beef Wellington ($22). Yep, that tells ya this isn't a standard coffee shop/cafe. Great quality, good pricing  Da service - Hosts were a little lame, no spirit, a bit disinterested.  Servers were very good, never waited for anything, checked in enough, and settling up was quick.    Even with the hosts, I still give them a 5.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. $22 Beef Wellington, 4 fillets topped w/ mushrooms &amp; wine reduction &amp; pastry. Sides: charred brussel sprouts, carrots &amp; mashed taters

mL6icgo5B75ewRDf_n2aag.text: Breakfast in Vegas means the great buffets--Hot coffee, cold orange juice, omelettes, and eggs made to order, and fresh fruit.  I cannot forget the great bagels, waffles, crispy bacon, and salmon with capers.  I wish I had always realized how important breakfast is.  Do not miss the Joe's scrambled with spinach.  Oh how I love the Grand Lux Cafe at either the Palazzo or the Venetian.  A better breakfast buffet you will not find for a reasonable price!  I can hear Elvis, Frank, and Wayne singing now!  Counting the days to my Vegas return!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. G is for Georgetown!

-vyff0-g2Ws4quKYntsL4A.text: Ambiance This is the same company that owns The Cheesecake Factory.  Just be ready to feel like one has seen this layout before.  This is a pretty big place.  There is some seating close to the casino floor or more towards the inside.  Food The portions are very big just like the Cheesecake Factory.  Super tasty and can always come to eat something here.  The deserts are delicious as well.  If one is staying in the Venetian or Palazzo, definitely get some carry out.  Service I've had good customer service at the carry out or sitting down.

qoWZTL4ByOqiZ7LCG7gJKg.text: I'm not  a fan of chain restaurants -the food is always mediocre and the service is never good BUT I liked this place. We were recently in Vegas with six friends and couldn't decide where to have dinner. A friend suggested the Grand Lux Cafe....   The restaurant is located inside the Palazzo at the Venetian Hotel.  It's very casual-- has the feel of an upscale diner with booth seating and Fluorescent lighting. The menu is several pages long and includes everything from Thai Spring rolls, pizza, burgers and fries, all day breakfast, Chinese noodles, etc. Normally these places scare me because they try to do everything but end up doing nothing well.  This place was an exception.  We all enjoyed what we ordered, the service was attentive and the food was solid. Order the vegetarian chop salad with peas, lentils, beets, asparagus and cheese. Very fresh and filling. Note the portions are huge so you might want to share with a friend!

mfbjuQYCtjokG7u01xDi4g.text: perfect. same as here in LA... good, clean, well-priced, friendly & knowledgeable staff. no complaints.

YMc3j02bWXXyBehI5WtJNQ.text: went here right after partying @ Body English since we went bak to da venetian cuz dats wer we stayed. went wit a group of friends and we enjoyed  it. portion is big...and service was great considering we wer all drunk (probably annoying too haha) our server was very patient. good place to go after clubbing in vegas.

UeFYqtv4GBmQ04yV8K_KgQ.text: I've always wanted to try this place but never got to until I went to Vegas. It's pretty much like the Cheesecake Factory. It has a huge menu, with many different foods and everything we ate was delicious. The portions were huge though, so make sure you're hungry.

NAGa7vqLS_Q--ERuZ26LUw.text: This is the official mecca of my friends and I when we go to Vegas!! We been coming here for 5 years, that's saying something. The place is pretty damn nice. The atmosphere is not too crazy but you know you're in Vegas. The place is always pretty crowded but you will get seated fairly fast. But anyways, to the food. I love the Mango Smoothie, by far their best smoothie worth the6 Dollars. My favorite appetizer from this place is The Fried Calamari and Shrimp. Fried to perfection and the tartar and tomato sauce are the perfect combo. Their burgers are pretty good. Specially The Max Burger. This has one of the biggest patties on a burger I've ever eaten. But my favorite main dish for sure is The Shaking Beef. Tenderloin Beef with red and green onions and spicy marinade and steam rice . I get the plate almost every time. But there's something for everyone. My favorite Vegas restaurant by a mile. You feel like a million bucks when you are here. The food is beyond expectations.

MgUIJKr-1vuCe9m0FswvEA.text: We decided to eat here after we ate dinner at Woo's and left hungry.  This place is very reasonably priced and the staff was very friendly.  Open 24 hours and perfect if you are staying in the Palazzo hotel.  We also ordered food to go and brought up to our hotel room.  The guy that helped us made sure we had everything we needed so we wouldn't have to come back down from the room.

Rhb8mLgxTJSYlpPa-htBtA.text: I'm amazed that a coffee shop/diner type place can be so incredibly great. The food is simple but really good. For example, if you get a turkey club, its on thickly sliced bakery bread with applewood bacon and arugula instead of wonder bread and iceberg. Its open 24 hours a day (which surprisingly, a lot of Vegas restaurants are not). The service is awesome, with frequent refills. Warning: DO NOT order an appetizer, unless its instead of an entree, the portions are huge (more Vegas hotel rooms need mini-fridges for leftovers, meals can be a rel waste).Highly recommended.

adCe9tjbjWqFg_GMGxddUQ.text: As always 5 am drunk, hungry and ready for bed. We stop at our fav 24 hr cafe both nights we were there. But for some reason on the second night the Venetian location was closed so we had to go to the Palazzo one. The first night was Halloween and my guy friend dressed as a sheep falls asleep on a chair and takes a head dive into the ground, after a good laugh I was ready to eat and that was great pre-meal entertainment and I knew our meal would be delicious. The boys always order their chicken and waffles and they said it was the best as always and hit the spot. I'm a salad whore so of course I get a salad which was also delish! The service was a little slow but they warned us ahead of time saying that this was the busiest night they had in the last 2 months. But it was 5 am and it wasn't really busy, maybe they are just finally catching up after the rush...I don't know. But that explains why they were out of my fav dish there, the ahi tuna salad...nummmy. Oh well, there's always a next time for sure.

lsq46eYSiFkDG3umiRuCrw.text: This is the only reasonably priced restaurant in the casino other than fast food and junk. The food is generally above average. Its on par and similar to the average New York / NJ diner. Recommended unless you just want to spend money. I do agree the menu is also similar to a Cheesecake Factory, but a bit better.

dzW2U_P20cC4Qh8otm9LsA.text: Wow, this place way surpassed my expectations!  We were all tired after going out dancing and drinking, and just wanted somewhere to eat that was open late.  At that point, we were not being picky, but boy were we in for a surprise!  First of all, the menu has everything!  A huge selection, and definitely something for everyone.  Secondly, the most amazing part was the fresh bread.  It was SOOO good, one of the best breads that I have ever eaten.  In fact, I almost wanted to cancel my order just so I could stuff my face with it.  It was warm, chewy, crusty on the outside, with the butter melted... ahh!  I wish I had some now.  But on to the main food...I got a chicken sandwich, but the portion was humongous, and it was really good.  The fries were delicious too.  Everyone looked happy with their food, and the waiter was really nice.  I would definitely go back just for the bread.  Reasonable prices too, esp since you can share and still have some left to spare!

Dk7X9BN2uk5pO9pz-W7iNw.text: i love grand lux.  it's the type of place where you and all your friends can go and everyone will find something they like on the menu.  everything i've ever ordered has been great.  it's usually crowded, so try to go early mornings or late nights.    the cocktails are sooo good.  some of my favorite menu items are the bbq chicken pizza, greek salad (ask for some grilled chicken on top), and the ahi tuna salad.  i think it's funny that this place is owned by the cheesecake factory.  they have similiar menu items, but the food is soooo much better!  and they serve their bread warm unlike cheesecake factory.

C0rp-_oX9EJX4JzjWDzkTQ.text: Pretty good food, not excellent, and quick service make this a great breakfast or lunch spot. Definitely take advantage of the other great restaurants in this hotel for dinner. HUGE menu, lots to choose from and HUGE portions. I had a salad and it was enough for 4 people, no kidding. Go for lunch and share!

yCdUaeM0jDQKuRqBI23UPA.text: same company as cheesecake factory  same kind of food, but with a fancy twist , and no cheesecakes here  great food, huge portions, big clean atmosphere with friendly staff

VkUqCaxyTK1IToCtETKiAQ.text: This was the last meal we ate in Vegas because we were sick of eating buffets by then. Didn't do any research on non-buffets so we came here at the recommendation of my aunt. Place was a little hard to find because the signs at the Venetion/Palazzo weren't too helpful. Even though the casino was packed there was no line when we went in so we were seated almost immediately. The waiter forgot to bring us bread so we didn't get any until after our main courses arrived. I ordered the Sunday night pasta, which is basically spaghetti but with steak and short ribs in it instead of ground beef. Don't get me wrong it was pretty good, but not really something I would pay $15 dollars for. You can't really tell the meat is better since the pasta sauce has a stronger taste. My dad's dish, on the other hand, was excellent. He ordered the slow roasted short ribs and they were fantastic, full of flavor, juicy, and tender. This place really deserves 3.5 stars but I guess I'll bump it to 4 since the decor is pretty nice.

rEaBX6UX3bh6f8mmS10CBw.text: Ate breakfast here.  Wonderful choice.  The farmhouse eggs were delicious.  I would recommend asking for a table "outside" so you can watch the people walk through the casino.  Service was average.

gyTrAaDHasbwdbGws5AfAw.text: Average food, Average service, Average ambiance.  Overall, if you have people who don't want to try something good I guess you can go to this big box chain restaurant which I hope is among a dying breed.  Don't know why you have to eat here in Vegas.

6gaZwDxbVLWIl4qvzSCeOQ.text: great service and atmosphere. I have had the patty melt, lot's of food and sooo good. I have eaten here about 3 times so far and always bring my friends. never a wait, and great for lunch.

sHHkO3WT7vbYT7rJtpaedg.text: best. drunk. food. EVER!!! it's right next to tao and its open really late which is perfect if you're hungry after sweating off all the alcohol you've consumed during the night. i've been here twice and never had to wait...but then again it was like at 2 or 3. BUT, there were still a ton of people there. i got the chicken and waffles...which was heavenly. i shared it with my friend and still had some to take home, so the portions are definitely huge. I also had some of my friend's chicken flautas...MAAAAAAAAAN with the green sauce. SOOOO GOOD!! we took that home too. to me, grand lux cafe is like a less classier cheesecake factory. its a lot cheaper, but the food is still just as good in terms of quality and taste. and our server was so nice. I can't imagine having to serve a bunch of drunk annoying asses all night. if you're gonna eat unhealthy after a long night of drinks, might as well come here and pay a few extra dollars and have the most orgasmic drunk food ever, rather than go to mcdonalds or some other fast food place, just saying!

KQLYj-FA9M2ivhHJH0tz6A.text: wow, this place has a lot of reviews, but i guess one more couldn't hurt. this place is JUST like the Cheesecake Factory, only not called the Cheesecake Factory, and the menu doesn't have as many pages and they don't have as much cheesecakes. but just like Denise M. says below, if you've been to the Cheesecake Factory, you've been to the Grand Lux Cafe.

XsV5Izqao7dnDl61dBNx0w.text: this is pretty much a cheesecake factory but with a different name.  at first glance, this place seems tiny, but when  you actually walk inside, it's huge.  this is a great place to go when you don't want to pay the expensive prices of a 5 star restaurant or want something more than the everyday buffet.  i would have given this place 5 stars, but it was busy and packed.  our waiter concentrated on the group of bachelorettes.  i don't blame him but there are other people to focus on.  other than the service and the wait, i'd definitely come back here.

oYZAiUshk1pbodMufWS9dw.text: I got the lunch portion of the Asian Chicken Salad. It was HUGE! I ate about half of it before I gave up. My husband got the potato spring rolls and those were good too!  The place was dimly lit, which is probably supposed to give it nice ambiance, but it was lunch time and I don't love feeling like it's nighttime during the day. The menu was expansive, and based on all of the good reviews, it looks like they do a lot well here.

VGbHl1s1YdjlCVMQUizm0w.text: Late review, but still a great experience! There are two Grand Lux to dine at. This review is for the Grand Lux on the Venetian side, since the Palazzo was closed in July from a leak in the ceiling.   My mother & I decided to dine here at the Grand Lux twice. The first visit we sat in the bar area & was greeted by an awesome server named Aubry. She is very friendly & helped my mother order, since she was undecided & is hearing impaired. We ordered the empanadas & crispy Thai chicken spring rolls with fun drinks named passion fruit penicillin & sangria. Our overall experience with service, drinks & food was phenomenal.   The next morning we had breakfast & ran into Aubry on our way to being seated. Once we sat down, Aubry greeted us & let us know that her husband Joseph will be our server & helping us out with our breakfast. Aubry & Joseph are fantastic servers! They really made us feel comfortable in the dining location, helped us with any questions regarding the menu, & always checked in on our dining status. I highly recommend that if you dine here at the Grand Lux, Aubry & Joseph will provide a great dining experience for you.

v-YBroBKHEI2dpo8i7c1Cg.text: Oh my god this was so so good ! Loved the vibe and music. The breakfast buffet options were limited but mimosas were on point. The restaurant was crowded with warm and friendly people as well as staff. The brunch was priced at $20-$25 which is a great and worthy price for what they serve.   Must must visit if you are staying at the Pallazo or Venetian !

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

5lUT465OlEy_fL5Rf-6Ohg.text: I cannot believe I haven't reviewed lux cafe yet it's like tradition to eat here every time we are in Vegas. a) Good Food b) Great Service  c) reasonable prices  d) open 24 hours   Located inside the Venetian we have found ourselves eating here most nights (very late in the night to wee hours of the morning) When in Vegas we like to eat breakfast and get our beauty sleep in the mornings.  Must haves ~ Crispy Thai Shrimp & Chicken Spring Rolls ~ Buffalo Chicken Bites ~ Shrimp Scampi ~ French toast & omelette  ~ molten chocolate cake  Basically everything from the apps to breakfast to brunch even the drinks are great. Portion sizes are generous compared to most restaurants on the strip.  This might be your best bet if you don't want to leave the strip for affordable prices.  Cheers!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Volcano shrimp
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cucumber lemonade
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Espresso

EOtjYHIEwb3rBWR6Jco89w.text: What Changed: Other than a slight increase in prices, not a damn thing.  What Didn't: This is still one of the best values in the area. The food is quite good and portions are generous. I've never been able to finish an entree here. Service is friendly and personable.   Extra Info -I stopped by for dinner this time and ordered the Sunday Night Dinner which consisted of simmered chunks of beef short rib, ground beef, onions, and garlic served that over spaghettini. After an eventful couple of days in Vegas for a bachelor party with minimal sleep, I was feeling exhausted and surprisingly cold. So this pasta was exactly what I needed! It was both filing and comforting. Basically, the damn thing gave me life. I just wish it was also spicier.   -Tea selection is decent. They present you with a fancy box of teas and you can make a selection. Tea comes with a lemon wedge and honey.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sunday Dinner Pasta (available every day)

iBQtYs39rPAMoRTmRL4P-A.text: Our last place to eat on this trip before saying 'Adios Vegas!'. This place is very nice. We didn't wait long as our timing was good. Our waitress was quick and got us water. We had two options, order off menu or do buffet. We were able to walk and check out buffet. We came back and decided the buffet was the best choice to go with since some of the platters from the menu cost almost as much as the buffet. If you're here, I'd say do the buffet. More food for your dollar. But if you're just filthy rich then you can do either. Our food was delicious. I really liked my fresh omelette the cook made right there. All the other stuffs were good too. I apologize for no pics and just a bowl of fruit with a tiny strawberry danish, lol. I was just way too hungry and forgot about pictures until towards the end. Oh well! Btw, their OJs are delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

aFPJGqEK8oRVGAtz7ws-NQ.text: We love to come here when staying at the Palazzo. We come here often and we have tried most of the items on the menu.   This morning we ordered biscuits and gravy, huevos rancheros, and the chicken and waffles.  The biscuits and gravy was really good. The gravy is made with thick chunks of sausage and the biscuits were fluffy and delicious.   The huevos rancheros was very good. It was a large portion and the ranchero sauce was delicious.   The chicken and waffles (my personal favorite) is very good. Not the best in the world, but pretty close to it. It is very good especially for Las Vegas.  This is the best restaurant in this hotel as well as in the neighboring Venetian. It has a great selection (akin to Cheesecake Factory). The menu is big and there are many options. The service can be a little slow, but the servers are very friendly and attentive.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ErysSAi0WGK5Gol7Z3_YFw.text: Located within the Venetian, this restaurant (cafe?) is convenient for those staying in the hotel and for those traveling through it. The weekend brunch menu is $$ priced but the ambiance and service are worth your money. Dropped by on a Friday morning around 9:30 with a party of 11 and we were seated immediately. We were split into two booths, but this wasn't an issue. They do have a breakfast buffet option featuring your typical breakfast favorites. I ordered the Florentine Omelet (~$15) with no mushrooms. This omelet features sauteed spinach, bacon, tomatos, grilled onions, and melted cheese. It is also served with a side of hashbrowns and toast. The grilled onions really flavor the omelet and the bacon adds the crunch factor. I wouldn't say it's a super special omelet, but it definitely satisfied my craving for a decent omelet.  The bathrooms are pretty dark.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. florentine omelet

B6rBR-O5dmWhaAKHfFf7fw.text: I had a long, tough travel day and I wanted to eat some dinner and go to sleep. I walked down to The Palazzo to stretch my legs a bit and figured Grand Lux Cafe would be perfect.  You can't really go wrong with Cheesecake Factory and sometimes it's just nice to know what you're going to get before you get it. I read over the menu and settled on a small salad and the appetizer Calamari. I asked that the salad come out first and they hold up the Calamari for a few. Of course the Calamari came first and the salad a few minutes later. I ate them both at the same time. Other than that the service and food was fine.  It's kind of a bargain for the Las Vegas Strip and specifically this end of the strip where things are pretty high end.  I would return next time I'm in Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Calamari

85lDRhL2p_B6U9cMvF-IqQ.text: Came here for a late lunch Saturday! The service was extremely slow! Our appetizer took almost an hour to come out! We got the buffalo rolls and they were really good! We all ordered burgers and that took super long to come out! Longer than usual! The food is delicious is here just the service isn't the best!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Buffalo rolls
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Burger

AFEmc1PdAoO_Ufv2TfzjfQ.text: I needed a quick breakfast (ordered to go) as it was my last day in Vegas and found the Grand Lux Cafe on Yelp.  Thanks Yelp! I ordered the short rib Benedict to go and it only costed me less than $20!  The Short Rib Benedict is so so good with the short rib sitting on crisp potato cakes and two poached eggs on top. The portions were decent compared to many places in Vegas.   Grand Lux Cafe is a definitely must go if you are staying in the Palazzo esp for breakfast or brunch.

qPlr5TR_unVDnirYktnMpw.text: It's hard to explain, in words, what makes this place so great! Maybe it's their many food options or their luxurious ambiance.   On arrival, we were seated at a high-top table close to the bar for watching a crucial sports game (that we *gulp* betted on). Our table of 4 ordered the buffalo chicken bites and fried eggplant to get us started. Verdict? Delicious without too much olive oil. For entrees, I went with a big caesar salad - containing enough lettuce to feed the army from "300" and split a chicken parmiggiano sandwich with my girlfriend. The portion sizes were HUGE but somehow, that aspect did not take away from the high quality food in front of us.  Grand Lux felt like a Cheesecake Factory only with better quality, service and feel. Situated a stone throw away from the both the Palazzo and Venetian hotels, it was a huge relief finding a place with solid food that did not try to "nickle and dime" us. Highly recommend this place, especially if you're considering brunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried eggplant
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Caesar salad
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Parmesan with a side of sweet potato fries

UpxdWVmoYCJPwp6qb0bPKA.text: If you find yourself in need of a Late Night Bite near the Palazzo or Venetian, the Grand Lux Cafe is probably your best bet. The prices are more reasonable than other places during late hours. The sizes are incredibly generous and most importantly the food was surprisingly delicious!!   My late night partner in crime had their Bacon Cheese Burger ($14.50) medium rare and a Coke ($4.50). This juicy savory burger comes with crisp applewood smoked bacon, melted American cheese and grilled onions. He asked for the Thousand Island on the side and they kindly obliged. Presentation was great! They put the lettuce, tomato and pickles on the side to prevent the burger from getting soggy if you don't plan on eating it right away. The burger also comes with a mixed salad or french fries. We opt for the side of fries. I had a bite of his burger and it was super juicy and flavorful. The applewood smoked bacon was a thick slice so you can really taste it with every bite.   For my late night bite, I enjoyed the Asian Nachos ($12.95) and a large Orange Juice ($6.50). This glorious creation had crispy fried wonton chips as a base, covered with chicken, sweet-hot peanut sauce, topped with melted cheese, green onions and wasabi cream... with rice in the center. The rice really threw me off because there is not usually any rice in a traditional nachos, but it was really good. I love fried wontons so using this to make nachos was perfect for me. The generous amount of chicken and cheese was both delicious and fun to eat. I was able to save half for breakfast the next morning.   The Grand Lux Cafe operates throughout the day and night hours. I had such an enjoyable meal here, I would definitely consider coming back for breakfast, lunch and dinner... and of course the late night menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Asian nachos
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. bacon cheese burger, medium with the thousand island on the side

XevrbJGyRLyMEarDJ2WR7g.text: We ate dinner here on our last night in Vegas after a leisure stroll through the Venetian shops and it was  awesome! We ordered Calamari for appetizer, Sunday Night Pasta, Cafe Beef Wellington, Pasta Milanese, and Garlic Shrimp Pasta. Portions were so big, one order of pasta can be shared by 2 people. All the food was well done and tasty!  The restaurant appeared to be large with plenty of seating, very nice ambience. It was a busy night when we came but we were seated right away.  We all had a wonderful dinner experience here and would love to come back. Great service too!

1D0KQKk6PgDRWzFVi7nl1Q.text: Loved the bacon eggs toast breakfast. Can't wait till my next Vegas trip. I will be coming back.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Entrance

lLdeq1Au1mozLctzvlB7LA.text: If your looking for breakfast there is no place better than the Grand Lux Cafe. When you arrive you might find a very long line waiting to get in.  Don't worry this  line moves quick. I think I waited 15 mins before being seated. You can grab a to go cup of coffee from them before you get in line if you cant wait for that first cup. Service is fast and friendly and the food usually matches. This am we wanted one of our favorite dishes to have. The home made Corned Beef Hash. However this am we were informed it was being prepared with pastrami not corned beef. We always  add two fried eggs in top. As you can see from the picture the eggs were poached not fried and very small. We swapped out the hash browns for fruit. Good thing as the fruit was the best part of the breakfast.

Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dining room

UvL3VT9jKmdPQNWoaWhQOQ.text: I must express that customer service is on point.  Staff are wonderful and energetic.  They are also helpful.   Ordered the crispy chicken royale which was more of a soft texture inside and crispy on the outside. Very hot by the way.   Crispiness 3.5/5 Flavor 4/5  It wasn't so bad after all.   The service was what made my day.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

jPjcvCtwGfVWk0OBvsOIWA.text: Running late (purposefully) for #k19 #knowledge19 #knowledge2019 #knowledge #servicenow conference trainimg bc I wanted a real breakfast and the first hour would be review of the previous day.  Service was good but nothing to write home about, also, nothing at all to complain about.  The food was good. Again, nothing to write home about bit it was breakfast so it's a little hard to mess up. The steak was a little too well done but its hard to get it medium on a thin 6oz. I thought I was ordering sliced potatoes (like you've seen me make many times before) but it was sliced tomatoes but that was the healthier choice.  The eggs were good and more than I expected which was good bc I love eggs. The blood orange mimosas was on ppint though.  The only other time ive been to @officialgrandluxcafe was for restaurant week in #cherryhillnj, not so much bc I can't afford it but I cook so I don't like spending too much money on food. I will go back though. Maybe before I leave.  I'm writing this while in a seminar and this guy keeps saying "umm". Don't they teach you not to do that before they let you speak for a company? Its so distracting. I'm counting them now, 67, 68, 69...   @officialgrandluxcafe is in @sandsexpo which is in @venetianvegas  #robsfoodreview #robsrestaurantreview #restaurantreview #foodreview #Vegas #lasvegas  Wish I could do stars by half bc it deserves an extra half at least, if not a whole one.

hGeDbEmGTK2jY0cHAVlpZA.text: My go to place for a late night bite, especially when I'm staying at the hotel  What I ate: - Pepperoni pizza: Pretty tasty. Oblong pizza shape - Strawberry cheesecake: Yummy! A traditional cheecake with strawberries in syrup on top - Cesar salad: Fresh, with plenty of parmesean cheese. My only gripe is that they present it fancy by providing uncut romaine lettuce leaves - Beignets: My friend LOVES these beignets. I don't get the hype  Pros: - The take out counter is open 24/7, so you can always get food no matter the time.  - I usually call ahead to order the food so it's ready by the time I get downstairs - Really large menu with basically anything and everything you can think of - Large bar inside  Cons: - Can be crowded and busy during peak meal times  Would I come again? Yes

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carbonara pasta

hpQy4zZaZPxxbW7Ts6CojA.text: Excellent late night hangout place with great food and drinks.  Being a hot spot, getting a table here can be challenging and we ended up sitting at the bar.   Their drinks were not bad and very refreshing. Their appetizers are for sharing. Their chicken lettuce wrap was very good but their fried Calamari could've used  another minute or two in the fryer.

76OYk2xCnlL1f-GynI2EuA.text: Absolutely delicious! Also very good portions! Kale salad and Asian taco was absolutely amazing! My go to place when im in vegas and it wasn't expensive at all!!

oLPUh98MHxoXLKCXPb5EzA.text: Came in on a Sunday morning and only waited less than 10 min. The wait probably isn't as bad, because this cafe runs 24/7. We all ordered different things and they tasted delicious.  Salmon & eggs: The salmon was cooked perfectly. It was very tender and didn't have an overwhelming taste of seafood. The eggs were also good (very fluffy). Chicken & waffles: For me, the better half of the dish was the waffle. The chicken was very lean and seasoned well. Corned beef & eggs: I have never seen corned beef prepared the way Grand Lux does it. Usually, the corned beef I order is a little mashed up and thin. Theirs is on the thicker side and in big chunks. I'm definitely not saying it's a bad thing, because their corned beef is at the top of my list. Not greasy either. Red velvet pancakes: YUM. Just thinking about their red velvet pancakes makes me wanna go back. THE best red velvet pancakes you will ever find. Out of all the red velvet foods I've had, Grand Lux has convinced me that pancakes are the best way to have them. There's no way I'll ever be in Vegas without stopping by for their pancakes.  Service was decent. The food came pretty fast, but our waitress had a very "fake" attitude. She said everything a little too perky and she talked to our entire table like we were kids. But whatever. She was the last thing on my mind. I was too distracted by the food haha.

ZQ067l1jR8XfB7dlEpcyhQ.text: I've eaten here countless times, whether it be for breakfast, dinner before a crazy night out, and for late late hangover cure meals. They also always seem to be open and busy regardless what time of the day it is. THat's always a good sign. And the service is quick which makes waiting for a table a quick process!  Yes, it's similar to the Cheesecake Factory with their menu diverse and offers almost everything. But not to worry, despite their vast menu, the quality of food has NEVER suffered! The portions are huge but I never take it with me simply because my hotel room lacks a fridge and microwave for reheating purposed. The salads are always on point, fresh & crisp and not doused in heavy dressings. The pastas are always rich and creamy, and the sandwiches and appetizers are delicious. They also have great lunch combos for a great price and the breakfast meals are dynamite. Again, the portions are huge, even if it's only lunch for for the great menu pricing and quality, its worth it!

BGzqRWbZPeKYGEkUjHBZqQ.text: A great find in the Venetian especially when coming back after a crazy night in sin city.  The food here was surprisingly well done and not too expensive either.  The scrambles, omelettes and sandwiches were all tasty, but the star was the corned beef hash.  Very flavorful without being overly salty and topped with fluffy scrambled eggs, it totally hit the spot in the wee hours of the AM.

lSaQ9yNGq_EloLU7Tx5ePA.text: I visit Grand Lux at the Venetian frequently and have never been disappointed.  The options are many, including pasta, salads, main entrees and desserts.  If you have been to Cheesecake Factory, you will understand this is a similar menu.  The servers have always been very attentive from initial order, to drink refills and checkout.    I've tried a variety of the meals here.  The Crispy Caramel Chicken is outstanding with a bit of sweetness to go with a little kick.  The steamed rice accompanies nicely.  The Buffalo Chicken sandwich, the Club, Chicken and Waffles, and several salads are a big hit as well.  One tip: Order a dozen cookies when you first sit down and they are delivered to your table warm when you get ready to leave.  Excellent!  Grand Lux is a great option for groups or if you want a nice variety to choose from.  Definitely recommend!

Y0wNr8fDZ-lKmbOCN6OpPQ.text: One of the best places on the strip for a 24/7 cafe. I have always frequented this place because their selection of food at ridiculous hours is pretty good. You have your burgers, breakfast, the classic BLT, desserts and cocktails. Everyone comes here after their clubbing or gambling. This one is located in the Venetian and is spacious and the people who work the graveyard shift are peppy and upbeat.  We had a breakfast sandwich that was delicious and was recommended by our server. I only ate half of it and saved it for later. The servers are awesome, or at least the one we had, was cool. THe ambience is like a Cheesecake factory.  Definitely recommend this place, go check it out.

3x0NoLZ460_os3WPJWDjWQ.text: 4 stars for the food 3 stars for the service (LONG wait time) 1 star for the grouchy hostess with a MOLE on her face D:  (You're supposed to be the FIRST face we see when we come in! Lighten up!)  After a LONG day of traveling, The girls n I are in search of FOOD! We were starving and since we had to wait for our suite, we decided to grab quick a bite here. The bite ends up being not so quick, and the food takes forever to come out, but once it does, It was worth the wait. Well, At least my dish was.. or.. maybe I was just starving ..  The menu was excessively long, A section with breakfast, lunch , dinner, late night. all day.. with most of the same items posted over and over.. Suggestion.. maybe have one menu for each time of the day? I found myself finding something good, then looking at the time frame its served.. and then going back to the actual page I should be looking at and then getting disappointing its not there :( . eh.. small details.  I ordered the breakfast sandwich with sausage instead of bacon. Breakfast is good, all day.... hasbrowns yummo.. crispy n tasty, I asked for an over easy egg instead of scrambled and the ooey gooey yolk dripping everywhere just made this sandwich everything I could ever want and more.. lol  Corned beef hash - eh.. sorry, but I prefer the canned version over this one.. The corned beef was actually a bit dry and the overpowering bell peppers made this inedible for me  Bacon Carbonara - Although I am not a fan of Bacon, This pasta dish had excellent flavors . This is a must try for all you bacon lovers out there.

TLwm_sdvvHa--wrsFTZMAg.text: You don't get to take chicken strips from the lunch menu, put them on a very average waffle and call it Chicken and Waffles!!!!  Thesse were by far the worst Chicken and Waffles I've ever had.  They weren't even good chicken strips.  Please please please go find someone's grandmother's fried chicken recipe and start over again.  You should immediately take these things off your menu.  They were HORRIBLE!!!!  Wow!  Ok!  Now that I've got that out of my system, The Grand Lux Cafe has always been a "Go to" spot whenever we've stayed at the Venetian.  It's the affordable dining establishment.  Overall the food has always been pretty good and they're open 24 hours.  I'm sure I'll stumble in again some time.......

VDUbvPziNzbNPR2HzckRNw.text: We enjoyed a large group (30+) dinner at Grand Lux after our meetings at a conference. Grand Lux was happy to help us out with a reservation on a Tuesday night.   Despite our huge group, service was punctual but no effort was made to be friendly. Water glass was full and food arrived in a timely manner.  The best part about Grand Lux is that there is something on the menu for everyone. From pasta, to steak, to fried chicken and waffles; yes, your picky eater will find something.   Our table ordered several appetizers, and the crowd favorite was the asian tacos. A must-try if you're looking for just a tad bit of an adventure!  And although my company was footing the bill, I was still peeved that many of the drinks (beers on tap, mixed drinks) did not have a price associated with them on the menu.   I ordered a plain old (or so I thought!) caesar salad for dinner. It was under the "small salad" listing, but it was definitely large enough to share between two people and certainly big enough for an entree for one. I only ate half of mine.   Overall, this was a great choice for a large group because of the diversity of the menu. With all the other great places in Vegas it wouldn't be my personal first choice, but certainly it's a crowd pleaser!

KCj0X3zzfrME9KXk2Y52OA.text: This place was pretty good. It was ideally located since we were staying at The Palazzo so getting there wasn't a struggle. I ordered the Santa Barbara Chicken Sandwich and it was pretty good. The service was also pretty good. Definitely recommend this place.

KGRQX5FAxtayFgCx3v56Ww.text: Food is super amazing! Service was awesome, big restaurant so lots of seating! Must try the Cesar salad!!! So good :)

tEUuSfPCo1UXx8rR98wTTw.text: Came here for the breakfast buffet (served till 11 am and is approx $20 per person). I was disappointed in the selection of food options and variety of food. I mean come on we're in Vegas! It came with all beverages (coffee was just okay but the orange juice was freshly squeezed and delish) and your choice of omelette bar, waffles, oatmeal, fruit, bacon and scrambled eggs. There was nothing impressive about this buffet and there are plenty other places on the strip that are much better.

mHsGGyXLhIn1-oiLsOwgqA.text: I recently went here because I heard it was almost like Cheesecake Factory. However, what started off as good service (being seated fairly quickly for a large group) was a plus until we realize how absolutely LONG we had to wait for our food. Our server forgot about us or something? While everybody else around us was getting their meals, we were wondering what happened to ours?? We had to ask a person who was not even our server for BREAD. We were seriously all famished and were getting extremely grumpy. I guess the manager realized we waited long and as a kind deed, he gave us free orange juice.   After waiting what seemed like hours, we got our food. I got the combination of the salad/fetucini alfredo and I was extremely eager to eat. Once I took my first bite into my pasta, I was disgusted with the amount of salt in it. I never taste such a salty pasta dish in my life! I thought I was the only one, but my friends tried and agreed it was extremely salty. My other friends ordered pasta/salad combo and it was super salty as well! I do NOT recommend the nasty salty fetuccini alfredo. It was so salty I didn't eat it anymore. I do not recommend this place, nor would I ever go back. I am sure other dishes were better, but I just had a terrible experience due to the long wait, our server who forgot about us, and the salty meals. Definitely NOT worth it.

GrrpEk4X60YYPH0vmu-u4A.text: I'm not sure but maybe I expected too much when I read the other reviews. This is a small cute little place in a casino in Vegas. 1: It's overpriced (duh, read the part about being in a casino in Vegas) 2: Its crowded (Vegas, casino do we really have to keep going over this ?) But it is tastefully decorated and the servers are good. The food is darned good considering I normally avoid these places like a case of Ebola. If you're in Vegas ( obviously) and in the venetian, we stayed at the palazzo so we wandered by here quite often. We got horribly lost ( OK it was me SHH don't tell my wife I said that I'll never hear the end of it.) So this was always around, if you can't get out of the casino to eat due to lack of time or inability to find the door then this is a good albeit expensive alternative. Personally Vegas has a ton of great places to eat try not to stay inside the strip casinos. Be adventurous strike out see what else there is to see & eat.

Etgqmj7oOJgDiAPn4TraNg.text: Oddly enough I'm by no means a fan of the Cheesecake Factory, but with the same people behind it I remained sketchy about eating here. However, after the breakfast I consumed here I just maybe have found a change of heart.  I had a baja omelette I think it was called. It had loads of sour cream, veggies, and really felt like I was chowing down on a fajita, but without the meat. My wife had chilaquiles which was certainly the best I have tasted and had a perfect blend of kick, but not overpowering.   We went early morning so it certainly helped with the wait time as we got seated instantly. When we finished with our meal there was a giant line, but I think there was a huge party that was the root cause of that. Our waiter was amazing and very cordial during the entire meal which created an uplifting mood.   I still get tripped out by saying (in the style of Arnold) "I'll be back"
