Service was good, the only minus is the "outside" seating area is within the casino facing slot machines, therefore the decor is so so..

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mushroom burger goodness

FqheMGzN_CurF2YXrnzfHw.text: One of the most moderately priced places on the Strip for this quality of food.   Tucked in the Venetian, this place has a good atmosphere, many tables, and is open 24 hrs a day, Vegas style. I got a seafood linguine and my date got the salmon which came with tons of mashed potatoes and green beans, though you could substitute those for other sides. Both dishes were very good and well portioned.   The price was 15-20 for most things I would say which is pretty good for a pretty classy place on the strip. Good for you budget Yelpers looking for quality eats and atmosphere!  Service was nothing special, though the food came pretty slowly.

TEtCI7yVw1SGBIag4zcruQ.text: An amazing find inside the Venetian not only because of the quality and the variety of the food but also because of the prices. Through my previous stays in Venetian I always tried to eat outside of the hotel due to every other restaurant being $$$ but then discovered this cafe. The food is delicious, cafe is located right below the elevators and priced at about half to a third of the cost of room service!   As an added bonus they are open late & have takeout service.

7ut26J5zgBRSjrKlFP5M1w.text: A great place but similar to Cheesecake Factory. It is a sister restaurant.  Very nice service and great food.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best bread pudding I have tried thus far.
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious chili chicken Mango salad! Really sweet mangos for this time of the year. Pure yummminessss.

xlOZDYqToUC3F8DkC3wa3g.text: Bouchon (both the restaurant and bakery) were closed during dead week.  ALL THROUGHOUT CHRISTMAS.  I was severely disappointed.  So we came here instead for lunch.  I had the brie, turkey and apple sandwich with a side salad with vinaigrette and it was pretty good ($12.95).  I would come here for a quick and casual meal and they can seat large parties quickly.  They also gave a birthday dessert, which my gf appreciated.  I think Cheesecake Factory is tastier but the food comes out faster here.

aSxmyMPG4KycpeS4xHPnjQ.text: Jeremy was our server and Scott had no problem jumping in to help. Theses two guys were fabulous. They were friendly and attentive. The food was delicious and the atmosphere was perfect for my 9 years old. We've been here quite a few times, but the service this time was definitely something to yelp about. We will continue to return to this restaurant.

5Fq1BZZqFsu__QS_NlZPXA.text: I have not revisited a sit down restaurant in Vegas as much as I had with Grand Lux Cafe.  No its not my favorite restaurant but its my go-to place for many reasons: 1)Huge menu - when we cant decide or agree on what we want we end up coming here more times than not... something for just about everyone: steaks, burgers, pizzas, pastas,seafood,asian, mexican, and everything in between. 2)very good prices considering its a sit down restaurant in the Venetian 3)nice decor - Looks good amount more expensive than what it really is 4)Fast sitting times - I never made a reservation and came during peak hours but this is a huge capacity restaurant so never had to wait much at all to get seated 5)open 24/7 6)pretty good food - My fave is the chicken and waffles but you cant go wrong with the shrimp scampi

An06j_jTb8YZ0HSdO-FTFw.text: it is a great restaurant. International cuisine, great Salads ans stakes. exelent Brekfast and buffet every morning till 11:00 am  it is very safe and fast to eat here. you are not going to get sick.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

4RRiKCZ2gsTev9KLjbODrA.text: Great "little" spot inside the Venetian. All references to "Cheesecake Factory" are correct...great selection and variety of food.  Came in for some steaks after my friends got lucky at the blackjack table.  Our food was cooked to perfection and the size of the portions were just right. If it weren't for their damn good bread served at the beginning, we could've finished everything!  We also ordered the fried calamari, which actually includes fried onions, zucchini, and shrimp...if you go, this is a mandatory side dish, it's THAT good!  Service was phenomenal! I believe our server's name was Amanda (hope I got that right) and she was the best!  The only knocks on this place is that the AC was blowing a little too hard and cold at our table. So, as much as we were enjoying our food, my friends couldn't wait to get back out into the Vegas heat because it was that cold in the restaurant.  Also, the marble floors all around the dining area made for iffy footing for my friends wearing high heels.  Other than that, we enjoyed the Grand Lux Cafe and will be back whenever we come back to Vegas.

dxvLPNx1flTMAhpqnuqiBw.text: Be prepared to be overwhelmed by the endless menu. This place has a menu like The Cheesecake Factory.   The Grand Lux Cafe is conveniently located in the Venetian so I dined there more than once on my recent trip to Vegas.  It was a great place for both breakfast and dinner. Regrettably I never had lunch there...at least not yet.  For breakfast one of my friends ordered the chicken and waffles. She said the waffle was amazing but she was disappointed that the chicken was completely bland.  I guess it didn't taste as good as it looked. Another one of my friends and the steak and eggs and absolutely loved it.  I had a spinach and mushroom omelet that was served with hash browns. It was more than I could eat and was delicious.  For dinner I had the short rib grilled cheese. oh. emm. gee. It was heaven in my mouth. One of my friends ordered the same thing and she loved it as much as I did. My other friend ordered the burger and said it was the best burger she's had in a very long time. We were all so full that we didn't want dessert but when we saw the creme brulee duo on the menu it was a no-brainer - one chocolate and one regular. I'm usually more of a purist when it comes to creme brulee but both were amazing. I could have eaten both of them by myself but thankfully my two girlfriends saved me by helping me out.

puhxUlMiSgFWh4pxrwWjGQ.text: Have you been to Cheesecake Factory? If so, you should know what to expect from this place. While they don't serve the exact same dishes, it's essentially the same type of food, portions and price.  Like most places in Vegas casinos, it can be difficult to find. It's on the casino level near the escalators that connect the casino floor to the Venetian Shops.   This is by no means a 'must eat' place in Vegas, but if you're nearby and looking for a meal that's better than Denny's but cheaper than Tao, then give this place a try.  If I was rating this place based off of my most recent visit, I'd only give them 2 stars because our food took forever to come out and when it did it was cold. But I generously gave them 3 stars because the other times I've been there this wasn't a problem. Perhaps it was the time of day when we visited. I think we got sat in our server's section just as she was about to get off.   Finally, other Yelper's said they had good pancakes, but sadly I didn't get to try them (despite my intense post Vegas night out cravings) because they stop making pancakes at 11am. But they do make Belgian waffles all day.

iuLTHddc07vz1cOF3IbUmw.text: Why they didn't call this place Cheesecake Factory baffles me, because it is the same thing! The menu is massive, the portions were some of the biggest I've seen in Vegas (outside of a buffet) and it's the same selection of cheesecake.  But for me - that wasn't a problem, because I've never had any complaints about Cheesecake Factory. Our cab driver who took us to Mystere across the street at Treasure Island suggested we try this place. I'm glad he did because it was one of the most satisfying meals we had while we were partying. I ordered a spinach dip appetizer for the table and the chopped salad for my entree (which I couldn't finish it was so big!)  Service was prompt and attentive. It was a great base for our last night out in Vegas.

l0W0d-9NnMFbfUSgwwT2ew.text: Great option at any time.  Whenever I come to Vegas I make it a point to dine at Grand Lux at least once.  The great thing is that this location is open 24 hrs, so whether its grabbing a quick lunch, or late night post clubbing, you can always find time to stop by.  Some of my favorites on the menu are the corned beef hash, chicken salad sandwich, or the patty melt.  This is one of those places where you really can't go wrong with anything.  It must be noted that from my experience, the service here is always top notch, waiters and waitresses are very friendly and knowledgeable of the menu.    There really is not much more to say, you must come and check it out for yourself.

awniE4gsHgi8TEMojGguKg.text: Great breakfast buffet!!!   That is a lot coming from me. I never seek out a buffet. Let alone a breakfast one!!! They have everything you could think of for breakfast from fresh fruits to hot eggs and bacon to fresh made pastries.  I have already eaten here several times on this stay and will keep coming back.   And come on! They are owned by Cheesecake Factory! How could you go wrong?!?

zOsiw6zrz32zXK714_RdwQ.text: Wow, this place was a surprise. I have had take-out cheesecakes from here once before, but did not realize what an extensive dinner menu they had. It goes without saying that the deserts are sensational, but the dinner menu is just brilliant. They have two menus - the 'Skinny' menu (appropriately in a skinny format) if you're after healthier options and a regular menu. As others have said - very refreshing to have the option given that there are not a lot of veges involved in most fast food joints (potatoes being the main exception in the guise of fries of course!). We were surprised at the extensive range of things to choose from as well as the really very reasonable pricing. The hard part was trying to decide what to have! I had the fresh-made guacamole and it was hands-down the BEST I've ever had. My gf had Tuscan chicken off the skinny menu and he loved his as well. Servings are generous without being over the top. The atmosphere was great, nice little booths and they seemed to cater really well to families and large groups as well having a glance around us. Bathrooms exceptionally clean. Can't recommend this place enough, would love to eat there again...if only we had one were we live!

zkWP2cGrUsG40b3p7lV_dQ.text: In my opinion, this Grand Lux Cafe's food was not as good as the Cheesecake Factory's, but their service and atmosphere was better. For one visit, I think a 4 star rating is adequate for the food and service. I had a quesadilla and my mom had a shrimp basket. Both were good. The quesadilla was a little strange though. It was like a quesadilla that had the chicken and cheese between two soft pieces of bread, then there was a third hard piece of bread by itself.  The service was fast and friendly. The atmosphere was more intimate and formal feeling than Cheesecake's. Most of the meals ranged between $10 an $25 and the portions were huge. This is a great deal in Vegas!

3KY8pnbUDFzsUaXYmKmeMg.text: Had lunch here on Sunday (9/1). Food was good even though it took awhile to come out, ill give then benefit of the doubt seeing how it was very busy.  Had the reuben which was good, maybe more kraut on it and it would have been better.Wife had a short rib hamburger thing which tasted real good. Dont recall what sister or her bf had.  Overall a good experience minus the wait on food.

wS_xIxnUzc2RNCrT5DTqmQ.text: The reason it's 3 stars is because of the staff. They were very pleasant and quick with drinks and bringing appetizers which was also a bright spot. The entrees were o.k. But not worth the wait. Our group had a variety of food and the response was common, it was average at best

HbUD1bSNODj_3w-MvhIdOw.text: This place deserves 5 stars: 4 stars for the food and +1 stars for being open 24/7.  Leaving the club at 3 AM and super hungry? This place has legitimately good food for a decent price.  Waking up at 6 AM to drive home and avoid the insane NYE traffic? Thank God for Grand Lux!  I tend to eat here every time I come to Vegas, which is saying something.  Usually it's in the wee hours of the morning but I'm happy to say that the service and food has never failed me.  For breakfast I really recommend the Joe's scramble (Palazzo Grand Lux) and red velvet pancakes.  The hubby really likes the protein breakfast.  My friend ordered the Shepard's pie for dinner and said it was really amazing.  This place is owned by Cheesecake Factory so everything is going to taste pretty good, you literally cannot go wrong!    Tip: Only the Venetian Grand Lux is open 24/7.  The one at the Palazzo is not, but has slightly different menu options.

IV4WUU-gOmkdecp6ibYRCQ.text: During my last stay, I ate at both locations - this one and the one in The Palazzo. We decided this location was better. The ambience is nicer, and the service a bit more attentive, and the food was presented with a little more care. I had missed Grand Lux after the one in the Beverly Center closed out here in Los Angeles, so this was an extra nice treat. I had my favorite - chicken and waffles...I'm getting misty eyed on the memories.

MrD6qgrJC_txNb35DYAl5w.text: My go to stop for Food at the Venetian. This place seems like it's Always open.  The ribs are mediocre, I recommend the pasta   My friends water had peices of glass in it!

Yiquaku8v53qCuBPk-hrVw.text: Decent place to have breakfast if you are in the hotel. They have a buffet with an omelet station. The service was good and the coffee and OJ were constantly filled. standard breakfast fare - meats, eggs, potatoes, breads, fruits, cereals, etc. Everything was A-OK.

xLrhvzK03-7uKfPULCeS3Q.text: Excellent lunch, vegetarian burger is huge and satisfying. My husband liked the Reuben burger and we split a slice of key lime pie! Come early for lunch because there is a line later. Nice place to sit and be waited on after fighting crowds in the strip.

VdtBkl8jk80Vb_7G3MlAgw.text: It is what it is - cheesecake factory with a different front!  I've eaten at this one in the Venetian more times than I'm proud to admit!  It's huge, but generally there is a line - unless you eat at midnight! Bar is usually a good bet and the portions are huge!  Staff is usually pretty friendly and helpful.

m0St9uOX0fMsZK1MIfKXAA.text: This isn't your average all night place in the hotel that serves marginal food. I came here twice, once around 6:00ish to catch a bball game, have a beer or two and eat a snack. My friend was not coming in until later and I could not wait. I sat at the bar and Raven is a banging bartender. Super nice and friendly. She hails from Madison, WI. They only have Sierra Nevada, Stella and some other beer on tap. I had 2 Stellas. I ordered the buffalo wings and they came out quickly. The manager brought them out and you could tell he was customer service oriented. He asked me, "Is there anything else I can get for you?" The wings were not enough so I ordered the clam chowder w/ bacon and sourdough bread. The soup was poured where I was sitting and it was delicious. Creamy, not too much potatoes and you could see the clams and taste the bacon. I noticed other dishes coming out and they looked hearty. My bill came to $36 which was fine by me.  The restaurant seemed like it was for everybody. They had tables and stools in addition to being able to sit at the bar. You had a mix of 8 people sitting at a table, another guy at the 4 seat stool table on his computer to regular seating in the dining room. The full menu is available in the bar also.  At 3 in the morning after LAVO only the late night menu is available. I had the cuban sandwich, my friend had eggs and bacon and the girls had a salad (one is a vegetarian) and the other one had sliders. The bill came to only $67 including 4 non-alcohlic drinks.  I sat on the corner of the bar and noticed that all the servers were pretty cool and that they seemed to like their jobs. The foregoing is essential for good service. I will definitely come back here when I have the pleasure of staying at the Venetian.

pnceaEb5DqJJi2_WcfNr8g.text: The food came out hot. Every meal I had was delicious especially the bread pudding. Hash browns nice and crispy. Service was good. Nice atmosphere.The buffalo wraps good.

5G67eisyYXqyfpqf5A9Vig.text: The quality and variety to choose from will satisfy the pickiest of eater....  The service was  good and I enjoyed my spaghetti with braised short rib sauce!  Considering a repeat visit.....  Sampled another's meal, also good.... Thought the mashed potatoes were super!

x3gnQw6P8PTl2AuNKzfPmQ.text: Great food, very broad menu and as fairly priced as anything you will find of that caliber at a nice hotel in Vegas.

chGM_vn6VBGpHTzwLSSROg.text: Favorite spot when I come to Vegas! Wish every Cheesecake Factory was as good as this place!

xXRNCLYu4GOUq7VNSlvhkg.text: Ordered to-go:  Told it was going to be about 15 minutes and it was 30 minutes which was rather annoying. The food was sitting on the counter for who knows how long. I got my food to my room and it was borderline cold...barely warm. The egg white omelet had an extra type of cheese on it that I didn't order.  Bread was too toasted and hard and he didn't include any Jelly.   Regardless of the first experience I did go back during dinner hours and the service was much better as well as the food was hot.

9TwZ6uVm33FfvylMMGDP4w.text: I really didn't expect this restaurant in the Venetian to be as good as it is!  We ordered the Asian Chicken Salad and the Pan Roasted Salmon and they were excellent.  The prices are very reasonable too given that restaurants in Vegas hotels can be pricey. Just as good as the food though is the people watching if you get a table by the railing. Be prepared to see all the freakiness Vegas has to offer.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

0xayJ3jGtbaYiPWJKwbgtg.text: We are here second time in a week, we ordered the telephono and we found a bamboo stick on the bottom of the pasta , guess what , imagine someone who just used the stick and left it inside . That was very disgusting! And the main point which the waiter told us that the stick was on the top of the portion and we didn't saw it , come on ! The stick was fully stick with the sauce ! If the purpose for the stick which is lunch special portion it should be clean on one of the side! We are not stupid tho !

Rwof5blLvIt2j4NlZn02Lg.text: Menu was good and a lot of food to choose from. Ordered my food, didn't take too long. The food looked good but, when I tasted my food, it was so dry and no flavor. My side order was stale and changed. Someone with me tasted it too. He's a chef so he knows his food. The service was great and clean. I would have gave it a 5 star only if the main reason why I went there wasn't like that.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Looks good and appetizing.

cBCP1jiCS1eC0DM3UeOBxg.text: Love that great eats are so close to the theater. They were extremely busy but still managed to be pleasant. The food was excellent and we weren't rushed. Saturday night before a show. We will bring guests back, btw we're locals.

ntn67LHpsuOh63JrXC8ZsQ.text: I was pleasantly surprised by how good the food was here. I thought it would be a typical restaurant - the menu seemed typical contemporary American - but my taste buds were definitely excited from this dinner.   **Note that the menu on Yelp is NOT complete. The menu at this restaurant is much longer and has way more options.*  I ordered the: (1) Shiraz, Rosemount Estate, Diamond Label, Australia $9.00. - This wine was very very smooth. Almost like water.   (2) House Green Salad - mixed greens and heirloom cherry tomatoes tossed in their roasted tomato carmalezied onion vinaigrette $7.50. - A very nice presentation with an excellent salad dressing. I was happy with ordering this salad.  (3) Cafe Beef Wellington - Filet Mignon Steak Medallions Covered with Crimini Mushrooms and Topped with Warm Puff Pastry; served with Madeira wine sauce, mashed potatoes and vegetables. - This was delicious!!! So so so good. I would definitely come back here to order this again. Eating the pastry with steak was just a delight and the sauce had just the right amount of kick.   Carli was our waiter and she was amazing. She was always prompt, very friendly and made me enjoy the meal even more. She deserves a raise! :)

Vcd3Qb1ZffoItF7rrsz5KA.text: I smiled the whole time. It could have been because the freshly baked cookies :) It's a fancy atmosphere, I sat at the bar, but service is still great there. The shrimp linguine is so tasty!! And those cookies, well I took some home and they were gone by morning :(

GPq5ZpLdf2SNU6m3h0H_Bg.text: This place is open 24/7 the food is great and if people compare it to the cheese cake factory this one is much more affortable. The food is delicious and freshly made. My chicken was absolutely delicious and melted in my mouth. It is really big so I think you'll never have to wait for a long time and the atmosphere it's really nice and not that noisy. Service was prompt and the food came fast and really hot with some good portion sizes. At the end of the day what matters is if the food was good not if it's like another restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This is delicious.

Jb5pOZ56KspaB5VGLA-AAg.text: The Grand Lux  Cafe is absolutely beautiful.  The food, the ambiance and the staff are just superb. Love the amazing menu and great staff.  Definitely a place to recommend to others.

CJpyjOIM8BrYKkxfE30D4Q.text: As other reviews has stated, this place bears a strong resemblance to the Cheesecake Factory. The restaurant itself is quite large, so even during the dinner rush we were seated within 5mins of putting our names down. Once we were seated, we spent  a good 10mins going through the pages and pages of the menu. Luckily, they served warm bread & butter to munch on while deciding on what to eat.   We all ended up choosing a 'medium plates', which was actually still too big for any of us to finish. My housemade pierogies were so delicious! Light, fluffy potato dumplings served on top of braised short ribs & mushrooms.. mmm. I also tried a bit of the kobe (softball-sized) meatballs in the creamy cheesy polenta which were also great. Our appetizer of wings were also moist inside with a nice crunchy exterior. Yum! Considering how much food they give, the prices are definitely reasonable and they are open 24/7, which is perfect for everyone in Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wiiings
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken angeli
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kobe meatballs

59ZaDQfGCqwZRf705s68Jw.text: We decided to stop here after the marathon for a quick dinner. I ordered the t-bone with Yukon gold potatoes and mushrooms. My wife went with the fish and chips. The steak tasted good but was a very thin cut which was disappointing. The potatoes were quite good and the mushrooms were ok. My wife said the fish was really good and like the crispy batter and overall flavor. I would have gone 4 stars but we had to wait about 20 min for a table to open up even though we saw 4 tables remain open from the time we arrived until the time we left.

QEyKfA_gGNnTX4QcCykcwg.text: My go to spot for post clubbing food when I'm staying at either palazzo or Venetian. The food here super bomb, even if you're not drunk. The fried calamari and chicken wings is fried to perfection so eating those drunk will make you very happy. The pasta portion is huge so share with a friend but it's so good you'll prob end up killing it all anyway.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pasta and calamari!

yp22Qsi-r2KTnqDZIZyj_g.text: I have eaten at this Grand Lux Cafe over a dozen times and each time it has been amazing.  Grand Lux is sister companies of the Cheesecake Factory, so there menus are super similar. They both have a ton of options, full bar and every type of different food for you to choose from.  They still have the Cheesecake options on the menu from Cheesecake Factory and can accommodate anyone in any budget because they're menu is just that diverse.

Hb5Ldu2nXUw1-85VKuvm3A.text: Great place to eat! We went a bit before noon and got seated right away. I was really surprised that their lunch and dinner menu still had some breakfast items on it so we ended up getting a breakfast sandwich and a plate with eggs, bacon, hash browns, and toast. They were both delicious and had pretty big portion sizes for the price on the meal. What sets it apart from other places is how beautiful it looks inside. The architecture, decorations, and art makes you feel like you are in a more expensive restaurant.

0_HsvHTblKZu6AX8v62AWQ.text: Just mediocre at best. Props for the space and hours though, I mean there is almost always no wait.

eTDjFKfUa83BKdDUitrqJQ.text: Grand Lux is Cheesecake Factory's sister restaurant.  It's the same exact food, except you have to wait for a ridiculous amount of time... in your Vegas dress... starving, drunk, and cold.

jO75JnKILzG3Fe3ajZi6aA.text: Food is always delicious here. The wait can be very long so it's best to plan ahead.  Apps 1) potato rolls 2) buffalo rolls  Main entree 1) chicken parm 2) ribeye steak  Drinks 1) island cooler 2) mango smoothie

9G2FtimUH2aSwhOHs_-oVw.text: Loved it just as much as Cheesecake Factory for the most part. My hubby got the Bacon-Cheese burger and it was the absolute best burger I've ever tasted. I got the chicken and waffles but the waitress misunderstood me and thought I asked for strawberry waffles so I had to wait for my order to be corrected. The manager came over and offered soup, salad or fruit. I took the fruit. Mostly melon which I hate but not their fault I'm picky. Chicken was really crunchy but SO freaking salty I couldn't enjoy it. The waffle was crisp on the outside and soft on the inside but bland as hell. Ugh. Huge disappointment. I'd go back but I'd stick with a burger or salad next time.

EsnrGv7hznAQLeQaHSv3ZQ.text: Absolutely amazing! The pasta is the best I've ever had! Everything I've tried has been perfect and I'm amazed at how they got the food so good.   I've been coming here for years and used to get the wood planked salmon until I discovered the pastas. I've tried all the pastas and have been extremely pleased with them all. My absolute favorite is the pasta carbonara. I hate they closed the one in LA because I want to go here all the time and I'm stuck living so far away! I don't know how a restaurant could get all the pastas so right but if you love pasta please come here!   I really meant I've never gotten anything off the menu I didn't like, which is saying a whole lot! It amazes me how I can order anything and be totally satisfied. I wish I could rate higher and I'm not generous with my ratings at all...this is my favorite restaurant!  I love the presentation of the food and the customer service.  There is one in the Palazzo and not only is this one much nicer, this location is open 24 hours. The food is presented better here, which is kind of weird. The service at the Palazzo is also touch and go so I prefer to come here.   I cannot wait to come back!

AXhHh3phjCnsl9dX-tf4sg.text: Similar to the Grand Lux Cafe at the Palazzo, this one offers pretty much the same menu items and also has the ambiance of a Cheesecake Factory. This one won our hearts for its fantastic and personable customer service.   Our waiter was Crisanto and he was just wonderful. He was very engaging, friendly, funny and have a great disposition. He definitely made our experience here mucj more enjoyable unless yesterday's experience at yhe other Grand lux. Our glasses and mugs were never empty, the ketchup was thete without me asking for it, everything was cooked on point just how we wanted.  I highly recommend this restaurant for those that want breakfast at later hours. We found ourselves here at noon and they still had a reasonable selection of breakfast items. The food looks and tastes fresh, and they offer healthier options upon request.

GxVnw9e_fSlswsn7D_yjaA.text: I love the variety their menu has to offer! Whenever we're in Vegas we always make a stop at Grand Lux Cafe, whether it's for brunch or for the late night munchies. I love their bloody Mary mix and you can request to have it made in different ways! Don't be afraid to try their asian dishes like the pho or the spicy ginger beef because they're actually done quite well.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rustic apple pie dessert-- put in the order at the beginning of your meal!
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The perfect bloody mary!

Ybv3EnnKmJKEtPcAghVnRg.text: Surprising that the food and service are outstanding for the price point.  The portions are huge so had to take half back to the room.  This is their 24 hour cafe in the Venetian but will definitely eat their again when in Las Vegas.

JT2EAAnClpVsCPuwdjGtXw.text: Superb! Crispy caramel chicken with Thai-style veggies and brown rice. Plus, their Happy Hour drinks are out of this world.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

JwoeiwUf5HxxcsE0qBnflA.text: I buy the salads here a lot. Spent a lot of money here but will never go back now. Just tried to calling and they hung up on me literally 5 times!!!! Went and met with a manager William who was completely useless & didn't seem to care to help. Never going here again. I've even had to return a salad before because there was uncooked chicken. Too many eff ups with Grand Lux. They've lost a loyal customer.

BAMiD7Wx-3ywts8FZPe2Yg.text: This place is conveniently located on the first floor. Best part is that it opens 24hr! My waitress is great, she kept on checking on me making sure I am satisfied with my meal. I order a strawberry lemonade and an omelette. The bill comes to be $20, what a steal! The strawberry lemonade is too sweet for my taste, but it's still good after diluting it with some water. The omelette is also worth to try if you're an omelette fan and enjoy goat cheese.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ray
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Omelette
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Strawberry lemonade

TZ0zWPpRLxDr3hLVBSsmrQ.text: Went to the one in Dallas which I think it's the best. Went to the one in Las Vegas and it was ok had a breakfast bar omelet station was good but wish there was more select... go to the Belliago!

tSRAoKAxdNIIC8jfLEpEzQ.text: Stopped by on Sunday around 2am. Just looking for a quick bite before calling it a night. Plenty of seating at that hour. Service was good with one exception.  The waiter got my order wrong, but I didn't even notice till later. I ordered the Smoked Salmon with scrambled eggs and onions. However, what I got was the Smoked Salmon platter. It still tasted good.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Smoked Salmon Platter

w8WUsimHKmlDjYaapck5RA.text: Carli P.. you're a horrible bar host. Rude for no reason, sadly it was my first time at Grand Lux.. the food was great but I won't order takeout from the bar again if employees are going to act bothered by me & being friendly to others while in my face. Don't hate your job so much

0-WtYi4Tt7hPdkYnwLl-IA.text: The food was very good and the portions were decently sized. Of course being in a casino, especially the Venetian, it was a bit overpriced but that is to be expected. Service was also very nice.

ep4tEWWMLsseB46XmiLM8g.text: I love the menu here so many options, great flavors and always large portions which are great for sharing. Today we had breakfast and our server was Deborah C. AMAZING!!! There are not enough words to truly express how much we appreciated her service this morning. She was kind and engaged and service was WAY above par. She made sure our food was what we ordered and fixed the problems we had and made sure to keep our drinks full.  She ROCKED our morning and last breakfast of our vacation.  Thank you for a great start to our day.

bCfJStzczlhN6AJRzPbMoQ.text: We had several meals at the Grand Luxe during our stay. All were really good and reasonably priced.

A2POSNf1M8rX3XA7jxD6xw.text: We got burgers and chicken/waffles around 4am on a Friday night. Given the time of night (and in Vegas), you can imagine the state of most of the customers.   There was still a short wait - maybe 5-10 minutes! The food was fine (you can see my photos - and they have a late night menu that's still a full page. A few options of every category, including brunch!), but I really want to commend the service here.   One of my friends was, to put it politely, a little difficult to deal with. Our server was extremely patient and accommodating, especially with several tables of customers in similar states. Thank you for being so wonderful to a difficult crowd!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Burger and fries (late Friday night 2015-07-17)
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken and waffle (late Friday night 2015-07-17)

g1lJqgpQSp2VJ2WxNZ9zFg.text: When you're in Vegas and you're hungry at 2AM in the morning this is a good place to hit up.   PROS:  * It's open 24 hours  * Very similar to a Cheesecake factory so there are a ton of options for everyone.  CONS: * Very similar to Cheesecake factory. So the food was mediocre. I had the chicken carbonara and it was alright. Nothing AMAZING but it was a good option at that time when I definitely was in need of some carbs!

PE7GjNXsCfeW9VVE2Lw7hg.text: A more expensive version of Cheesecake Factory is the perfect way to describe this Vegas spot. Yet it is still one of the cheapest sit down options you will find on the strip. I went to the location in the Palazzo before catching my flight for a quick lunch. I had pasta with sun died tomatoes and mushrooms- Yum!! Definitely recommended! My waitress was a doll and made sure to bring me an ice cold glass of pinot  to beat the impending hangover lol

y1h_9JLvzsXZYfZuKNYLXg.text: Let's just cut to the chase. I really like the Grand Lux Cafe. I mean I really, really dig this place!  Located inside the Venetian Hotel and Casino, the cafe is actually pretty easy to find just off the casino floor and near the escalators from the parking garage.   items of note..  - the room is MUCH larger than it first appears from the casino floor! With high ceilings and plenty of seating, the room is tastefully decorated and feels upscale. - Service is top notch here! At least it has been every time I have been here so far! For our last visit, Casey was our server and he was great!  -For being a food outlet a)on the strip and b)inside the Venetian, the prices are incredibly fair! It's a great way to enjoy a nice meal and not feel like you're breaking the bank! This was probably the biggest surprise of all! - the menu is HUGE! The amount of options available to you is fantastic! - this staff hustles! I mean servers and bussers were in constant motion tending to a guest or prepping a table for the next party!  - Casey was great about keeping drinks filled and checking in with us from time to time without being intrusive. It was perfect!  For this last experience, I ordered the rib eye steak(cooked medium rare) ($27). The steak was cooked almost perfectly! It was so juicy and tender and marinated beautifully! The garlic mashed potatoes were pretty tasty as well! The steak was so good that I decided to enjoy it without any steak sauce or ketchup(which I never do!)  I think this place is a real gem and I will keep returning to enjoy more of the menu! I teetered back and forth between 4 and 5 stars for this review, but given the price point and consistently good service, I have to give it a 5!   5 stars!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grand Lux Burger Melt    $13.95
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Hfl2H5VHg5piOEpmEgmF0A.text: The 1 Star is for the service. The food was fine as it's a sister company of the Cheesecake Factory. The service was horrendous. First the waitress spoke so softly you could hardly hear her. She took forever just to bring waters and ordered the bus boy to bring them instead. My family and i went for lunch. We ordered three entrees. Two off the lunch specials and the chicken and shrimp jambalaya, which had no shrimp on it, from the regular menu. Now to clarify there is a lunch special that has just chicken jambalaya so we weren't overly upset about no shrimp. Note there is a huge price difference between the two. About $8. We couldn't bring it to the waitresses attention because she never came to check on us. Only would swoop by so quickly to grab a soda glass to refill and then rush off before we could even say excuse me. When the bill finally came, we told her about the mistake. She said nothing instead went to get a manager. The manager was the absolute worst! Not only was he insulting and insinuating that we lied about the shrimp, he offered no compensation what so ever. We weren't looking for a free meal. We just wanted the correct price. He was rude and obnoxious. Stay away from here. Robert was a complete jerk. How he became a manager is beyond me.

5hTwdPKjhTKf6_b1HTTttQ.text: I've eaten here twice and the second time I had a few issues but my waitress was on top of it. I wish I remembered what her name was but I gave her a very nice tip. It was about 10am and the person I was with said maybe we should share a meal and I agreed. I'm not a big fan of eggs Benedict but that's what we ordered. So when they came to the table the eggs weren't runny as they should be.   I didn't want to send them back but my travel partner insisted and I thought sending them back was a bad idea. You never know what people will put in your food once you piss them off. We got the second eggs Benedict and one of them was runny, I didn't eat that one and the muffin was burnt. The waitress came and asked how the food was and we mentioned how the muffin was burnt. She apologized and left our table and told the manager.  Well long story short my travel partner vomited twice within an hour. So the moral of this review is be nice to your waiter and don't send your food back. You should also watch the real funny movie "Waiting" with Ryan Reynolds. The waitress was so nice and even took the eggs Benedict of our bill.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggs Benedict and a White Russian.
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

_F1PMNDWH7klkqUCYBkXtw.text: Every time I stay at the Palazzo, this is the place to be after the clubs because it's the only thing open 24 hours. They have many selections in their menu, a lot of great late night munchies. I mean everything takes great after 2am just like how everyone looks hot after 2am also.  But I actually been to this place during normal hours and sometimes its good and sometimes its not. My first time I had their Shrimp Louie Salad and it was very good! However after that the other times I went, it was ok. I guess it depends on what you order. But this is a go to place esp if you are staying in the Venetian + Palazzo after-hours.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

qtppHiaBaTm7e6vQJVTdkg.text: I used to eat at the Grand Lux a lot in the Beverly Center in LA, so was excited to see this outpost at the Venetian. Arrived around 2 am and was feeling something sweet, got a piece of cake to tide me over until the morning. Super moist and hit the spot!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

eQY67TYiiuWFoqi3ZTUMUg.text: I'd like to say a Huge Thank you to Charlie who was working last night during this mass shooting. I went in and ordered food for some family that were waiting at the hospital for our loved ones.  He really stood out to us. He was kind and very caring during our crisis. Our food was so good and I appreciated the service we received. I will definitely be back because of our outstanding experience, as well as tell our friends to come down to eat there.  Thanks so much Grand Lux Cafe!! You have a great employee at your spot!!!! ~~S

h967Gpok3zKyMSoRiwKKVQ.text: OMG! Was recommended by a good friend of my boyfriend when we arrived in Vegas. This is now my favorite restaurant here. The price isn't too pricey. The food is well worth the ticket price. I had the T-bone Steak and Sauteed spinach. It was so yummy that I have been talking about this place none stop. The steak was cooked to perfection that no steak sauce is needed. If you are familiar with the restaurant Houston's, it is on that level all around. My boyfriend had the fish and chips with fries. He said that was really good and crisp to perfection as well. If you're ever in Las Vegas please stop by and try. You will not regret it. It's located in The Venetian Hotel.

WT9k5fIcalDaqmRIM--C4Q.text: Food was good and even though were very busy we did not wait long. Will definitely be back when we stay in Palazzo again.

0V15i42pYSK9YlHA3IKPzQ.text: Came here for a late night dinner. I had the half turkey sandwich with soup and salad. I wasn't really craving the sandwich so I didn't eat it, but the soup was ok and the salad was really good. It was just green leaves with ranch, but for some reason, it tasted really good to me. My family got a spinach dip, and pasta and they seemed to really enjoy both. I didn't try them, but they finished it all, so it must've been delicious.

UoX3uea3OwjJCpeU1tU7ww.text: A GREAT CHOICE.  The service is always friendly and relatively fast. The dishes are all pretty well made, tasty, and generous in portion size. The prices are also very fair for the quality and portion size. All in all a good deal for a fair price, and very convenient especially if you're staying in the same Hotel.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chilaquiles were delicious and very tasty

jXjArNow6vaiEOTxkMmJ6w.text: Loved the chicken pot and the Braised Pot Roasted! We are French and this was our best meal in the US :) Big up to the very nice brown-hair waitress

VRtz8QtEHSYwXx7buygvMg.text: Love love this place! Every time I go to Vegas, I always try to make an effort to have lunch here for their Salmon Piccata (which is only offered during their lunch special hours 11am-5pm).  Service has always been good and the food is always yummy from the ones I've tried.

uOFG9_jLS7LELCNQa4NqbQ.text: My breakfast was jus perfect! Steak and eggs were at the perfect doneness (this is so important to me) no problem exchanging hash browns for sliced tomato... our server was very attentive.

EB2Oci5z0esyHHX7KJaKmA.text: Sometimes I get pretty overwhelmed.  Going here was one of those times, because the menu just goes on forever!  That's not necessarily a bad thing.  If anything, it's good because my family can have a lot of different ideas on what to eat at the same time.  I was in the mood for some chicken and waffles, my daughter wanted salmon, my son wanted steak and my husband wanted pasta.  Bam!  Done!  Just like that!  We did share some pot roast cheese fries.  Yes, say it with me... pot roast cheese fries.  Delish!  This place definitely met all of our hunger needs and I'm sure we will return again to try another fraction of their ginormous menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Miso salmon with mushrooms and jasmine rice
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Milanese
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken and waffles

CTBqE9gugJRwkiZ5bB3P_A.text: Pro: Cheesecake factory done right, TONS of seats, great food, excellent breakfast buffet. 24 hours!!!  Con: Back of the Venetian, can still be crowded during major conventions.  This is it, skip all your buffets and $150 dollar per person meals, come here and dine. The menu is long and detailed, from small to epic portions, everything is done right from 6 am to 9 pm. I have personally ate here 3 times while in those ungodly hours and everything is just done to perfection.   The breakfast buffet is a quick service option, most time is when my crew are here for CES, skip the wait, and go get your own food. The fruit is always the highlight, it's just better than the $33 dollars Caeser/Aria buffet.   If the place is packed, go eat at the bar, the service there is sometimes better.

hoBPzBv4s-XhFDA5wfTMVg.text: Try the pasta telefono!  YUM!   You get a great basket of bread before dinner with creamy butter.   Very quick service and reasonable prices on everything.    One of the better meals I had in Las Vegas and they are open 24 hours.

PIM2LCmyFyn5r1kMnvFdJQ.text: Wonderful food! Had the pot roast and it was divine! Not to mention our server was absolutely wonderful. Would recommend.

S74xgU_xYRuBVEIutcPrFA.text: Walking around trying to find a "foodie" grade restaurant that wasn't going to break the bank, we stumbled across this cafe/restaurant in the Venetian Hotel.   The restaurant itself was HUGE and we were kind of skeptical at first, because we had long written off Vegas as a foodie tragedy, but this cafe pleasantly surprised us. According to the waitress the bread was organic and made on site, all the sauces and salad dressings were made there and even the service was five star! This was my third visit to Vegas and my husband's many and both of us had a smile leaving this restaurant after our meal.   Price was right too. For once, I didn't leave  thinking I was taken a advantage of.

HvRjJdQl88kvxpq_0MQqPg.text: This review isn't about the food.   Basically after our meal, we paid partially cash and the rest was on my card. Let's just say someone charged the full amount of my card around $90 even though I know i signed a credit card receipt for $30 something dollars.  Clearly the waiter felt that he was smart enough to steal from me! Ugh!   Luckily i did get my money back, but honestly for all the trouble I went through, they should have picked up the whole bill. Management did help me through this, but no one really bothered to make up for this horrible experience.

74ajzYfjzvlfVvAMKOES-w.text: Really enjoy the Protein breakfast.  Staff is both friendly and attentive.  Service was quick and I was on my way.  No pressure to finish and leave.  Never been disappointed in all my visits.  Will definitely go back again.  Prices are reasonable.  Good for families too!

t92cmNbQyYx5-smFvhaC4Q.text: Even though this is the same restaurant as in The Palazzo, food here is just slightly over seasoned. Have tried the traditional breakfast, lunch and dinner here. I would skip the pastas and just get either a sandwich or burger. Had a steak sandwich and it was great.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak sandwich medium well, highly recommended.

B7lNQdLcuraviipDkWvwUg.text: Food : great Prices: reasonable Customer service: almost left the restaurant because food took forever. Our waiter was awful!

eX-nlgMgbZ5RT-KnyqpYeg.text: Awesome breakfast buffet. Why pay $15 for an omelette when you can pay $18.95 for as many omelette as you want? Fruit, eggs, bacon, sausage, ham...you can have it all!  Also came here for dinner and it was very good as well. The salads are huge! I had to take it to go and would have loved to have eaten it after my night out if my friend hadn't knocked it all over the floor.. Ugh. So sad.   Our waiter was cute too. And he knew it. Haha. Would def come back again.

bAYcvnZPe_rRixCR0fkFAg.text: This is usually where I go for breakfast when I'm leaving Vegas. I had lunch here today and their clam chowder was lovely it is very hard to find a good clam chowder. I've yet to find a menu item I don't like here. For breakfast I get chicken and waffles

i1O0sL1x5uSBbrvP0SJ5CQ.text: You can tell they are affiliated with the Cheesecake Factory, by the number of options, portion sizes, and decor of the restaurant. My wife and I found a number of options that looked delicious. Portions are big enough where you can split it with your spouse and both will have plenty to eat.

YobzMUjCAtYQ4WzgtHLRtQ.text: absolutely fabulous. Everything we ordered was delicious. a sister restaurant of the cheesecake factory. Can't go wrong here. Huge portions, Enough for two people.  Best value in the The nation resort.

izCrhp3euLWL-Yzb9DbR4g.text: Pros: - decent, not amazing food - open 24 hours, thank god! At 4AM, it's a really nice spot to just hang out and grab a bite before turning in for the night. - great service, frequently hilarious, honest, and so on top everything - great policy where if you're not happy with your food after tasting it, you can ask to get it switched for something else. They are seriously all about the service. - huge menu with hundreds of items. There's something for everyone. - little to no wait to get seated for late night food  Cons: - the food takes a little while to come out - the food is alright for the price  Overall, I'll probably come back the next time I'm in town and craving late night food.

lfawpPWZxsVBjCjUE7HTCw.text: I ordered the calamari and got a plate of fried batter.  I was able to find a few calamari, shrimp, and vegetables.  But I was left with a plate of fried batter.  #culinary_shame

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. After eating the calamari, this is how much fried batter was left.  There were only a few calamari.  #culinary_shame

QDxNuHLIqjgkCIhbl_Povg.text: I came in at 2:30am in the morning on Sep 18, 2013. I ordered a chicken club which was not technically on the menu but they made it for me anyhow. The server was friendly and they were open late good...  The bad: at 4am - 12pm I was vomiting with diarrhea. Never before had I been so sick. I felt like a character in a movie; sleeping next to toilet because I couldn't go 15 min without vomiting, the pain was so intense I nearly called 911. I think the only reason I didn't was the lack of insurance.   By 1pm the pain finally stopped. I slept it off but it ruined my vacation. All week my throat was burning in pain from the acid. I've vomited before in my life but never like this; it was horrifying.   I called the restaurant where they tried to blame it on something else and used the phrase "Well you didn't consult a doctor so how could you be certain it was caused by us" oddly they said this before asking if I was okay! I hadn't eaten since 9pm the day before; it was the Lux. Someone in corporate relations left me a voice mail and I will update this review after I talk to them on the condition they do something. So far I am incredibly disappointed in how the manager handled the situation. I will be filling a report with the Nevada state health board. If you too got food poising always report it to the government agency; don't just rely on the restaurant. This morning (Sunday) I ran into a random person at the pool who ate at the Lux also Wed Morning and was also just as sick. They too were given the 'well you didn't consult a doctor did you...' story by a manager there. So stay away!

CCG_DY6tDzm4xm2pdJxSHQ.text: This is a great place if you have a large group of people.  Their menu has an incredible amount of variety.  The food is great.  The service is good.  And the portions are terrific.  And for dining on The Strip, you can't beat the price.  Whenever I'm entertaining a large group of people, I recommend this place for those reasons.  They have one in the Venetian and one in the Palazzon.  The one in the Venetian is 24/7.

OZUFQ19IhifmDTEpx_a0dA.text: Have eaten here several times. Great food and service. Whether breakfast or dinner, it has never disappointed. Highly recommend.

AE9X3IXeyh7o1JeKiEVOTQ.text: Great menu, great happy hour, great location! Always seats at the bar area. Sister to Cheesecake Factory so you know it's good! Just don't check calorie amounts!!  Ouch.

v14fBR3CHK7iz2IL1Ijeyw.text: We came here for breakfast every day while we were in Vegas, mostly because it was conveniently located so close to our hotel and we wanted to get to shopping and gambling ASAP.   We tried the eggs benedict,  breakfast sandwich, and corned beef hash. The star of the show was definitely the corned beef hash. They use huge chunks of corned beef, none of that stuff you get in a can! I shared some with my family and they loved it too! The eggs benedict was okay, I couldn't put my finger on what was missing. It may have been that the slice of ham was too thin or something was missing in the hollandaise. Regardless, the food was good enough to keep us coming back!   Try to get there before 9. We went around 8:30 on both days and didn't have to wait, but on our way out we saw a huge line.

8F1b6Nw6SNAnkDDR5GH4kw.text: Potato Spring rolls!!!!!!! I dream of those things. Its open 24 hours. Tourist and locals love it, I know a lot of friends that go to this place after work.  I have also celebrated my birthday  and gone on dates and anniversary events. This place is perfect for EVERYTHING!  They have good drinks too.  Caesars salad is waaaaaaay good! Most of the appetizers are, and deserts!  The graveyard menu is decent, and I have mixed feelings about the main entrees. Most of the best stuff is on the appetizer menu.   Love this place! Hate that its in a casino, but I guess I have to live with that. If it was off the strip I would probably go more!

xW0EWUNy7WbXHhxpnPq3_Q.text: It's a little pathetic that three of my meals were from the Grand Lux Cafe and I didn't expand my Vegas eating horizons, but it was convenient for me (next to the elevator at my hotel, The Venetian) and open 24 hours!  Their portions are huge and heavy, and the bread is complimentary, which is perfect for absorbing all the alcohol you consume.  It is the sister restaurant to The Cheesecake Factory, so expect the same foods and same mediocre service.  I didn't loooove it, but I would definitely come back.

u8dKm2iEGBdE5QRpErX_nQ.text: Cheesecake Factory owned and operated (i believe). I usually end up here once or twice a trip after drinking as it is one of the only places open late at night. But for some reason it always hits the spot, maybe it's the big portions, but yea. Food is decent not gourmet, it's cafe food think of any other cafe in another vegas hotel it's the same type of food, but this IMO is better than most other cafes.

435wf1CkGPLmoU2OEXMRDw.text: We were staying at the Venetian for a wedding and had lunch at the Grand Lux . The food was amazing I never thought I would give a 5 star review to a chain restaurant but this place deserves it. We had the Mini Kobe beef hot dogs topped with chili and cheese . They were as good as Pinks hot dogs in LA SOOOOO GOOD. The spicy calamari salad was the best I've ever had and I love calamari. Sis had the pasta carbonara and Ed had the huge fish n chips all amazing. The prices are great it has to be the most reasonable place to eat in the Venetian hotel. Our bill was like $60.00 bucks for all the food we had drinks included. I only wish we had time to go back for breakfast so I could have tried the fried chicken and waffles. Oh well next time.....

W-CnNv2IXImQo7vRNCXcVQ.text: FIVE STARS you say? FIVE stars for the Banana Republic to Cheesecake Factory's Gap?  Yes gentle readers, FIVE STARS it is.  Grand Lux is pretty underwhelming on an objective level, sporting all the expected elements of a Cheesecake Factory-esque restaurant (giant menu, dim lighting, carbtastic breadbasket, etc.) with one great FIVE STAR exception: it's opened super late. Billions of kudos to the genius who decided to bring a menu of varying selections and super-sized portions to the extremely inebriated (one demographic in dire need of such a gift).   I have only been here after midnight and yes, that is when MAGIC happens. The waiters are usually fast, attentive, and accommodating. Once I ordered only a variety of BREADS. Another time, an egg white omelet. But of course the best part is people watching while the lighting is dim, your brain is fuzzy, and inevitable awkward eye contact with fellow diners awaits. My personal favorites include: girl who yakked into her napkin while her friends heartily consumed their meal, guy who got lost and walked by thrice, and girl who passed out face first onto a table.

r1T3ADsnaZj6bOKTGuoSBw.text: Highly recommend the indochine chicken and shrimp. Was surprisingly good!  Favorite lunch item on here is the spicy flatbread chicken sandwich. Very tasty.  There are like 400 reviews for this place, just go, there's something for everyone here. For all you new yorkers, this is the cheesecake factory of Las Vegas, except for the cheesecake factory at Caesars :)

TEydSoa3NVgev81VxYyGVg.text: One of my first trips to Vegas, I somehow ended up here with friends and really enjoyed the Crispy Caramel Chicken. It comes in a large serving size, enough to easily fill up two people. Later that trip, I ended up back at the Grand Lux Cafe and again, endulged on the same Crispy Caramel Chicken. My most recent trip to Vegas (3 years later), I once again couldn't pass it up. As I expected the memory of the dish exceeded it's actual quality, but it was still pretty tasty and reasonably priced. This restaurant does a great job of accommodating large groups, the food comes out fast and is easy on the wallet.

-aCbmFFFwUxGQjeBZ3iXOA.text: Its a 3.5 rating for me. Very close to 4;   Ryan and I were having a Mini Vacation out in Vegas December 14-17th; My friends always come to Vegas (my best friend is Dating someone from out there) and I had only been to Vegas once in my entire life for a little less than a day.   I decided that since I've stepped into this town without the faintest idea of what I'm doing, I'll holler at my friends who are no strangers. They suggested Grand Lux; I had never heard of this place before even though its a chain and I didn't even know it was part of the Cheesecake Factory family until I Yelped it (Like the good yelper I am, I referred to my iPhone app to spy on this place before diving in)* and was relieved to find that it got pretty good reviews.   We ate here twice. First time was yum nummy.  Lunch:  --Buffalo chicken rolls HOLY COW good;  --Ryan's Enchilada lunch special was very good --My chicken salad/house salad/chicken and mushroom soup was.. a little bland, it was okaaay, but It needed SOMETHING. Finished my salad the vinaigrette was good.   They have some pretty good lunch deals which are HUGE servings even for lunch. The Buffalo chicken rolls were soo good, I crave them all the time.   Dinner (the next day)  --Ryan got Crispy Caramel Chicken with Rice which was pretty good although we were a bit apprehensive about the caramel part.   ++Now here's where they lose points++ --I got the flat bread spicy chicken sandwich which was HORRIBLE! Bland Bland; Flat bread was tough and tasted like cardboard, chicken was bland and tasted like Subway "roasted chicken" the spicy mayo was gross and the fries were way too crunchy & COLD. I was so disappointed.   --Good thing I was able to get a little full from the Buffalo Rolls we ordered again.   It seemed like I got the short straw here.. My food was never that great, but Ryan's was waaay better. Almost like a different place. Put I do give it points for having some good things on the menu, but I have to take some away for being kind of inconsistent.   So I struggle with the stars here. I wouldn't kick GLC out of bed though. I'll come back here again because for two 21 year old struggling college students, the prices weren't bad at all. I'll come back. But I just wish the place was consistent.   **Yelp actually saved me from a lot of places out in Vegas. You could be a big name four star restaurant, but if Yelp gives you bad reviews I'm taking its word for it. I love Yelp.

pTgW7Mq4BJd6IW7uINL5Yw.text: Last time I came here, we had a feast.  We ate pizza and some other items.  They were so good.  This time I decided to eat more "healthier."  We started off our meal with the bread.  It's always good when hungry and free.  I got the Chicken Salad Sandwich.  I didn't like how the chicken came.  It reminded me of eating tuna, and the sauce they used to moisten the food sucked.  I also ate (off my friend's plate) the breakfast sausage, hash browns, and egg meal.  It was alright.

dMr5392QGL4OaGMB8kHFRg.text: This place reminds me of The Cheese Cake Factory (maybe because it's by the same company) and the caliber of food is top notch, like that at the Factory. We went for an early dinner on Saturday night at the Venetian before heading to Jeopardy and were going to skip this place when we saw the mass amounts of people waiting to get in. They handed us a pager and said 5-15 minutes and we thought there was no way, but within 10 minutes we were being seated.   I had the Spicy Buffalo Chicken Sandwich that was heavenly. The chicken was super moist, the bun perfect.... it was perfectly flavorful, The fries were pretty damn good, too. I generally think fries are fries but these were crispy without being super oily. I was very pleased with my entire meal.   Mike had the Pasta Telephono. I'm going to cut and copy from the menu now: A Rich Tomato Sauce with a Dash of Cream and Melted Mozzarella Cheese. Baked and Topped with Toasted Bread Crumbs. And yes, it was divine and we ate every single bite. Very yummy.   We decided to splurge on some dessert (although we barely had any room left...) and went for the Candy Bar Pie. HOLY CRAP. I wanted to be bulimic right about now to fit this sinful plate of sweet goodness in my belly.   Overall, a scrumptious meal worth every bite and every penny.   Bonus: the CES convention was getting out just as the Adult Entertainment expo was beginning-- so of course, I got my picture taken with a male porn star. Surgically implanted horns and all. Nothing like dinner and a show...

gDNBkQChGIHMEWfufJMAPA.text: After walking around for what seemed like eternity, we decided to stop at Grand Lux Cafe for lunch. Right away, the cafe reminded me of The Cheesecake Factory. After doing a little research, I found out that Grand Lux Cafe was actually owned by the same owner as The Cheesecake Factory. Figures, because their decor is pretty identical.  Anyway, their vast menu really gave me a headache. There was just too much to choose from. Shrimp scampi?! Barbecued pork sandwich?! Pasta with grilled chicken, tomato, basil, and mozzarella?! Enchilada?! They even had pho! It took me awhile to decide on the Madeira chicken, which was really good. It came with sauteed chicken breast with asparagus and mozzarella, topped with a mushroom-Madeira sauce. It was also served with a side of mashed potatoes. The chicken breast was surprisingly tender and the mashed potatoes were nice and creamy. It was pretty decent granted that it's a chain restaurant. I don't recommend that you get their pho though, my friend ordered it and it looked pretty gross. The bean sprouts and basil that was supposed to complement the pho were all wilted and browned. Pho would have been the last thing she would have ordered at an American restaurant, but she wanted some soup and there was nothing else soupy on the menu.   Our waitress was polite, but she didn't come by our table often. It was completely understandable, as she had a lot of tables to tend to.

tUNKIAXBxs2oAZHnF7L7IQ.text: Average Breakfast - Little Expensive for what you get.   I hosted 4 people for breakfast and most ordered a traditional Eggs, Hashbrown, bacon/sausage and toast meal with Coffee or O.J.   The service was fairly quick, no waiting to sit down, and the food was average - no surprises.   Bill was a little high topping over $20 per person.

Amzd_1tRTZhFQMlOUAq9qQ.text: I had the Asian Nachos and the Chipotle-Avocado Burger. The nachos were some of the best and most interesting nachos I have ever had, while the burger was slightly above average. Beyond that, the rest of the food was average at best and for $15+ a plate I expected a bit more. Overall, ,decent food, but nothing special.

r_ktiQ7_axbxq8O66hne3w.text: We stopped in after a long flight with a large group and didn't have to wait long, although it was 3:00 in the afternoon. Regardless, all of our dishes came out in an appropriate amount of time and were well cooked. Our waitress was attentive and kind and made sure our drinks were always full. We were pleasantly surprised by the median prices, Vegas can be quite extravagant, and the pleasant atmosphere. I will definitely be returning in the future, especially since they are open all night.

TM1kG764Vr6j16BdffQYdw.text: I came here after work with a coworker; we had to wait about ten minutes for a table, which was better than I'd expected. The service was great, the food was so unbelievably reasonably priced for the strip (we spent $62 total and we ordered 1 appetizer, 2 entrees, and 2 desserts). The food was delicious as well; try the lettuce wraps!!

QQ1o2SSorFinItZzu0XMBw.text: We weren't sure where we wanted to have breakfast, but my husband stated he just wanted to have a good ol' standard breakfast. Nothing frou-frou. We settled on the Grand Lux, thinking it would be adequate and standard fare. It was... but BETTER! The food was very good, the wait staff was attentive and we thoroughly enjoyed the meal. The wait was not as long as the line indicated it would be either. We're glad we stopped by for our "standard breakfast."

b7irBtyjyVAf5FCLP8yHHQ.text: Grand Lux Cafe is just a cafe.  It's a step above Cheesecake Factory and I love CF.  The service was good, but the food can be better for the price we paid.

cz76GNlP8j6ZtrhvJWFuew.text: On my first visit to the Grand Lux Cafe during a stay at the Venetian many years ago, we walked in expecting an entirely new experience. The ambiance and menu looked and felt strangely familiar until I saw the Carribean Skirt Steak, and instantly I figured the connection.   If Cheesecake Factory had an older sibling, GLC would be it. The menu items are different, but nevertheless it possesses the great quality of CF, and although the experience is not "entirely" new, it is an absolutely enjoyable variation... I love it.  GLC feels like it is a step higher than CF, or perhaps it's just the Venetian. So, if you like Cheesecake Factory, there is little doubt that you will love Grand Lux Cafe.

Xb3SpULQGqUBxwHuPGZXIw.text: This is the cafe next door to the Grand Lux. The service is pretty crappy but the food is good. They have the best Creme Brulee and their sandwiches are very good. Their choc chip cookies are not bad either. Since our food was free, it was great! Most importantly they are really well priced items for the strip and a great place to grab some food before you head out of town.

KkCsd9izgiJr0vvBIE2Phw.text: The best waffles in the world, even better than the ones from Belgium.   And, I have spent 2 weeks in Belgium on a business trip.  The waiters and waitresses go the extra mile, wow!

gRmJPCPQthxqzpaQyBXJrQ.text: I'm giving this place three stars because of the service. And becuase it's by the Cheesecake Factory.  We stopped in for an early dinner to get some food in our guts and water in our veins so I could start drinking. We ordered water from waiter David F. and he seemed to instantly peg us for poor people or something... Anyway, his attitude from that point was to ignore us throughout our entire meal.   Waiter didn't serve us our food, and someone else refilled our waters. The place wasn't busy, so I don't know where he was the whole time.   I ordered the Grand Lux Burger Melt which was awesome. It was a spin on a regular patty melt, but was on parmesan bread instead of rye and had lots of melty cheddar. It was delicious.   My man ordered the spicy chcken on flat bread. It was ok, but not spicy at all and it didn't hold together well.   Stll no waiter.   Waiting. Getting pissed. Oh, here he is filling  our waters. Not looking at us, but instead scanning the rest of the place. What's he looking for? Someone to come pull up his sagging pants and comb ihis ridiculous hair? Gone again.   Comes back with the check. No talking, just drops it on the table. Meanwhile, I'm looking with envy at another table that has a good, attentive waiter.   I scratched out the tip section and was going to write a note telling him that if he wants tips he ought to engage his customers in small talk or at least be polite.   I almost complained at the hostess desk, but thought better of it. In rerospect, I feel bad not leaving a note explaining why he didn't get a tip, because know he probably REALLY thinks I'm poor (which I'm not).

bokv7bM6zpdl40O1_yHfbA.text: Two Words: Food poisoning. To make matters worse, I encountered another couple a couple days later who also fell to food poisoning from this place.  My husband had a custom made quesadilla with chicken at 3 am. But 5 am he was sooo sick. We ruled out a hangover when the stomach cramps and other ever-so-lovely food poising symptoms kicked in. Normally I say by-gones-be-by-gones but after hearing this other couple suffer from the same location, there is sufficient evidence that this restaurant needs to review their food prep policies.   We have reported this to the manager hoping for a refund. We are in contact with corporate but I will be taking this to the state.

NJyzBz5Zo-7SYcixtsuRgA.text: I always have great food here and excellent service. My recent trip to Vegas, I could not find good food in my hotel so I made a special trip on the other side of the strip just to eat here. Waiter was great; food was great!

-0wSgDtB7yTwef3TfzsH5Q.text: I thought the breakfast was pretty ok. Nothing special though. If I stay at the Palazzo or the Venetian again and if there's no line, I'll stop by for breakfast.

JehzJDJbM7aDWg4_hzKYbw.text: I dig the subtle differences between Venetian and Palazzo. Venetian is starting to show its age, but it's busier and louder. Conversely, Palazzo is newer, but more relaxed and mellow. The differences are also evident in the two Grand Lux Cafe's for each hotel and casino.  We had a good experience at the other location at Palazzo the last time around, so we decided to come here for breakfast. There was a long line already at the front, waiting to get seated. On the left, there is a sign that says "Grazie card" members only. Skipped ahead of everyone and got seated right away. I could feel the seething stares at the back of my head.  I ordered the exact same thing from before, corned beef hash with scrambled eggs, extra crispy on the potatoes and corned beef. It was awesome, just as good as I remembered. Huge chunks of corned beef, with just the right amount of flavor, to go along with a mixture of diced onion and potato hash. Squirt some ketchup, and I was good to go.   My wife had the smoked salmon plate, and it was pretty darn good. We sat next to the breakfast buffet, which many people opted for around $16. I took a peek around, and it looked like your standard breakfast with sausage, bacon, and eggs. They did have a custom omelet station, but the lines were long. Overall, on the pricey side, of course.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Corned beef hash w/ scrambled eggs
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bagel and smoked salmon

7I1OPv8RLmkrGb-HYxTk3w.text: This place was great!!! The server was nice and friendly and my chicken paramsean was huge!!!! I would defiantly go back!!

lddMOkpypAd4FAXr0mqoTg.text: Good for DRUNK MUNCHIES after TAO Nightclub. Good for DINNER before all the club ratchet activities. Good for LUNCH too. I have not yet to try here for breakfast yet. It is quite hard to wake up early in Vegas.  I have one check in here but it's only because I just started to use Yelp.   I have been going here EVERY SINGLE time I go to Vegas. I usually go to Vegas almost every month. My regular order is Pasta Telephono. It is basically pasta with marinara with bread crumbs on top. If you want chicken, its extra! This pasta reminds me one of the Corner Bakery's pasta with breadcrumbs. (I can't recall the name).   I have also tried the Baby Back Ribs. Their portions are HUGE. So if you go with one person and have small appetite.... I say order one plate and share and get an appetizer.   I have also tried their Eggroll on their Appetizer Menu. The sauce to dip that came along was so tangy! Loved it. Pasta Pomodoro is also something to try!  5-star. Excellent service. Excellent Food. I love the decorations. OH, one thing I do not like is their lighting, it is so dark in there and makes me sleepy. BUT their food makes up for it.

Z1xEzE_wEeFiycSRyCsSPw.text: What a nice surprise in Vegas .  I absolutely love this place .  Honestly this is the best restaurant in Vegas for bang for your buck .  I ate here all 3 days of my stay and had steak and eggs for breakfast . Less than 20 bucks and cooked to perfection . I also tried the bloody Mary's and they were just as good as well!

YE-LaQgXOyi6HmYcKS6YMw.text: It's great staying at the Venetian and know that the Grand Lux is just a short elevator ride away.  We always have breakfast here and even lunch when we're staying at our favorite hotel the Venetian.  The gals up at the front podium could use some friendliness training but the service staff have always been friendly, genuine and attentive.  Our first server Magaly S was super sweet, friendly and went the extra mile to make sure we were taken care of like family even though she looks like she's pretty far along in her pregnancy.  The food was even better than we could had done at home, hash browns extra crispy and the omelet was amazingly fluffy and well stuffed with our choice of ingredients.  Next morning, Aimee O took care of us in equally fantastic fashion.  The coffee might be $4.00+, but well worth it for it's smooth, flavorful roast.  Magaly S and Aimee O even got us  to-go cups of this rich blend which makes it really a super nice touch.  Well done, Grand Lux, this is just another reason why we always make the Venetian our destination hotel/casino.  We've been coming to Vegas for 30 years and have stayed in most every major hotel/casino, but this remains our favorite and no-brainer pick each time.

1nx9wPXqrGyprD3IejQ6NA.text: My experience here was disappointing to say the least.  I waited an extremely long time for a to go order. I asked 3 different employees if anyone was working the bakery and I was told to wait. I finally asked for the manager...Matt Tim's came out he, was extremely rude.  He told me he was helping the server pack up the food, but he had to come out to get yelled at by ME! As a manager that was so unprofessional and low class. I didn't even raise my voice when I expressed my concern with the long wait for food I ordered over 40 minutes ago. So basically I paid 50 bucks for cold food and bad service and an attitude!!!

AvwU1LLYW1u8PCbQEFRZDQ.text: This place reminded me of a glorified version of The Cheesecake Factory. Came here for an early dinner and then again around 4am for some after the club grub. We stayed at The Venetian so that was our biggest deciding factor on going here. Otherwise, I don't think this place would warrant traveling to another hotel for. They do get props for being open 24 hours though. I heard their breakfast is where its at, but I don't remember the last time I woke up during breakfast time in Vegas.

KX2e5xZ6V4TZdzbgCuug1g.text: As far as Grand Luxe's go this one was  very good.   We came as a party of 8 on a Sat night and had to wait 15 minutes to be seated, not too bad. The waiter came over promptly after we were seated and brought over some water and warm bread. Our orders were taken but then the waiting game began. It took over 30 mins for us to get our food. No one ordered anything too fancy (salads, pasta, salmon, etc) but we watched as tables around us that were seated after us got their food, ate, paid and left.   Everyone was very satisfied with their food though so I have to still give Grand Luxe credit. My chicken and avocado salad was very good: a large portion, lots of avocado, flavorful salad dressing. Other orders included the cedar planked salmon (always a crowd pleaser, my friend enjoyed it very much), the fried chicken, the gnocchi and pesto, spicy beef, and garlic shrimp pasta. No complaints about the food, the wait to get it was a doosy though.

gYqPyQkYGgydRgbj2nx7fg.text: I pop in every now and then for a grilled cheese sandwich and soup.  The service is always great.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seared Ahi appetizer with 3 salads. Yum!
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Soup and Grilled Cheese

1b1Yf0b7VnBQgzoykbMCvQ.text: First of all, I really like this restaurant!  It's like Cheesecake Factory.  In fact, I hear it's part  of the same umbrella company.    AMBIANCE: There are tons of booths which means anywhere you sit, you'll feel comfortable with your party.  Our wait on a Saturday night was only 15-20 minutes and I can see why because the restaurant is HUGE!  FOOD: Chicken Lettuce Wraps: Sauteed Chicken Breast and Vegetables in a Delicious Asian Sauce served with Cool Lettuce Wraps.  This came with what tasted like a hoisin sauce & a yellow horseradish sauce.  The horseradish sauce was good... tangy with a kick.  This platter is huge.  I went with two other girls and after we each had about 2-3 lettuce wraps, we were almost halfway full.  Southwestern Salad: Chicken Breast, Fresh Corn, Black Beans, Tortilla Strips, Avocado and Pepper-Jack Cheese Tossed in a Honey-Lime Vinaigrette.  Everyone RAVES about this dish.  It's under the "LARGE SALADS" section and it is huge.  I do not recommend that you eat this by yourself, piggy.  The only bad thing was that the avocados weren't ripe enough and thus, a little firm.  Miso Glazed Salmon: Served with Rice and Stir-Fried Vegetables.  This was very well marinated but a little on the sweet side.  Rice will make you full so you should just eat all the fish!  It's not under or over cooked.... just right!  SERVICE: I was very disappointed with our server: Lori H.  She was only semi-friendly compared to how much more friendly she was with her other tables with older patrons.  What?  Does she think young Asian girls can't afford to eat there?  Sheesh!  I know this kind of place usually appeals to chain lovers (yuck) but for some reason, it's nice to go to a big place with huge portions once in a while.  It's like a food splurge.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana Cream Pie
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Southwestern Salad; Miso Glazed Salmon
