BgNwXBCifAJcYr47S8tuWg.text: Found this place on yelp actually, they were still serving breakfast around noon and I went for the omelette, my date had eggs/bacon hashbrowns. I ended up adding an extra 3-4 items to my omelette, idk how they fit it all in there, but it was delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Omelette plus a few extras

YkzHhc29sXfiosz9ExUHJQ.text: It was my first time here and everything is absolutely perfect ! Here is open 7/24 and they serve perfectly altough it's 2:30 am ! I got fettucini alfredo w mushroom and i can say that these guys make it better than little itally. To be honest here is the one of the best place to eat in Las Vegas...

V_Y3o5jRngWDBFVMEZG8QA.text: Mygoodness, I must say this was the best breakfast of my life. Went to vegas to celebrate my 21st and turnt all the way up. My girlfriend and I had a blast. After two days of nonstop turning up and having a winning streak we can here to relax. The biscuits and gravy was the best I ever had. My girlfriend is Mexican and she's had chillaquilles from all over the place and admitted this was the best. After we left our winning streak became a losing streak, but we left vegas happy from this amazing breakfast.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Biscuits and gravy

DHryPYiAMi2mb7tVQdtw3w.text: Food is good but our waiter told me that the wings weren't battered and in fact they are. That's a huge problem for me. But the lettuce wrapped burger was great.

s1E6kKx3KmRPjoXA9kqIRA.text: If you're anything like me you love paying more for The Cheesecake Factory - if at all possible. And it's totally worth it!   The service was fantastic, the ambiance was great, and the food is delicious!   I had the Kobe burger which was like crack on a bun(tm).

L7SmPrkNU7SiTW5xNUfO5Q.text: I friggin' love breakfast at the Lux. And don't be afraid of the line that forms in the front. It usually moves fast. I can't remember the name of the pancakes I got last time, but they were amazing. I think it was some kind of pecan caramel pancakes. So good. I was only disappointed that it didn't come with eggs or bacon or the usual breakfast sides, so I had to order those items a la carte, which turbo boosted my bill. The orange juice here is freshly squeezed.   Great place for breakfast if you don't feel like spending the money and doing the whole Bouchon thing!

x1i8Yl0nG-SGO4cgq6nIRw.text: Went here on a Thursday evening and were seated quickly. The waiter was nice enough to give us some time to figure out what we wanted because so many things sounded so good on their menu. Luckily there's complimentary bread to help hold us over.   We ended up with a glass of wine each and he had the salisbury steak and I had the prime rib. Both dishes came out fairly good and the sides were good also, which makes this dinner a winner.   This cafe is a little more expensive than what you'd find at other hotel/casino cafes but their quality of food is better. Our 2 dinners, 2 glasses of wine and a side salad came out to about $75

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rib eye
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kobe Salisbury Steak

uFeUkq-i75rjoPc8gzegWQ.text: This place is 24/7 in the Venetian.  There can be a line, but we wanted maybe 10-15 minutes around 3:30am on a holiday weekend.  We came here just for a small snack.. We tried the french fries, and the Boston cream pie.  There is free bread and butter.. it's pretty average.. maybe one notch above the cheesecake factory.  We had the french fries.. eh,  they were a little different than cheesecake, but almost the same. They weren't as crisp as we usually get at cheesecake factory. The portion was small, and they cost 4.50.. still better than most other diner cafes at this hour.  The boston cream pie was decent..   The burgers sounded good, and knowing they're good at the cheesecake factory, they better be damn good here. They also have a nice selection of steaks. We were too full to try them, but I wasn't too impressed by this place.   I'd only come here for late night..

BDyuvzP-3het4NrFWes5qA.text: Awesome. Is the one word I would use to describe this place, over many years of coming to vegas I've always found my way to the Grand Lux Venetian and I have never been disappointed.  The food, service, quality and serving sizes are all awesome.  I don't recommend the Palazzo location, been there once and won't go back.  The service was quite the opposite from the venetian.

1pJn5H5BEQ6OtuhRq0GEuw.text: Went here for the first time during Labor Day Weekend. Portions are huge! I got the flatbread with salad. YUMM, hit the spot after a drunken Friday night. I wish I had room for the cheesecake. Definitely going to be on my list to go here for food when I go back to Vegas for Halloween.

Wb2ELTP7B06ygFEpz1ePpA.text: open 24 hours.  same company as cheesecake factory, so you know it can't be too bad.     - calamari salad was delicious - duck potstickers did not disappoint - spicy chicken flatbread sandwich was okay, nothing special.  the accompanying  fries were cooked perfectly. - jumbo shrimp pasta with red sauce (yum!) - shaking beef was tasty       large menu, good service and decent prices makes this place worth a visit or two...

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. calamari salad, chicken flatbread sandwich.  pardon the bite in the sandwich ;)
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. duck potstickers

P4Xm09wusbNU-tjcamSt_A.text: Went to the Grand Lux Cafe around 3AM after a great night of partying in Vegas. Walked in and noticed greasy and slippery floors. Out of curiosity, noted this to the staff and they acknowledged that it was a problem. Dinner - nothing to write home about. It was OK. Not very flavorful - bland. As were leaving, we made a friendly and light-hearted comment to a gentleman, who appeared to be the manager, regarding the slippery and greasy floors. The irate and condescending response was not something I was expecting. Apparently the grease makes it way from the kitchen on the serves shoes. I have NEVER seen this before. If you go there, out of desperation for food late night, please don't ask any questions regarding the place - or risk the wrath of some irate manager.

AP2S1rrtafAPQa6A4Lregg.text: Great food, great service in what is a chaotic environment. Attentive and helpful with children

WeG-wwH99U-fA0X9NDYt-Q.text: Came here for lunch and there was no wait. We ordered the chicken marsala (regular size $18) and chicken piccatta (lunch size $12.50). When the plates came out, they were identical in size - humongous. We could each only finish half our plates. Both plates were very tasty.

0hKl7NQQ8rgR3ISfcuHtqQ.text: Quick spot to get lunch during the Conf Cobb salad with Margarita

r_tH_wkhJMPJ8VOULXlrag.text: We ate here twice and loved it both times. I normally seek out unique foodie experiences and avoid chain restaurants like the plague, so naturally I assumed when the family wanted to go that I would have to settle for it. Boy was I wrong...  The first visit we went for brunch (Sunday am, seated right away). Two of the kids got Belgian waffles with strawberries and whip, the other, the Italian Market Sandwich. The waffles were good, but the sandwich was amazing. My son generously offered each of us a small bite and agreed it was the best sandwich ever!  "Thinly Sliced Prosciutto, Pepperoni and Salami, Topped with Fontina Cheese and Arugula on Rustic Bread with Sun-Dried Tomato-Basil Aioli". My husband and I both ordered the egg breakfast which was prepared well and included Niman Ranch bacon. The orange juice was fresh squeezed (really, not like other restaurants advertise), and the fresh fruit actually ripe and flavorful. We were very impressed with the quality of the food, but also the inventiveness of the menu- not your standard chain restaurant fare. Everyone was very happy all around.   After much debate about where to go for dinner  (we were there to go to Dos Caminos or Bouchon), we all decided to go here again. We ordered: a BLT (yummy bacon and bread), the Max Burger (has short ribs on it), Sunday Night Pasta (daughter said it was the best past she has ever had), Chop Salad (the only average meal we ordered), and a Top Sirloin steak w/fries ( I had my heart set  on steak frites, but every restaurant in Vegas starts steak at $40 + $9 fries- ridiculous!) The steak was tender, flavorful, and well cooked. At $28 for the 8oz steak and $4.95 for the fries I was very pleased).   Again, a great experience all around. Bravo to Grand Lux for bringing quality dining at a reasonable price. The atmosphere is fine, and simply elegant (but really, does every restaurant have florescent lights now?), but a bit noisy. Compared to fancier places with big names and higher checks, this exceeded our other experiences.

WpL8h-X_ZFVXNj2jDW_GtA.text: Dude, I fell into the bizzaro beignet trap...AGAIN! (Reference my past review on Boulette's Larder, Ferry Building, SF)  The Grand Lux Cafe offers piping hot beignets on their breakfast menu - they emphasize that it takes 10 extra minutes to arrive because they are made to order.  So of course like a damn sucker, I fall for it and order up.  Do I get the delicious doughy pillows covered in powdered sugar - reminiscent of the delights of the Cafe Du Monde in New Orleans?  Hell naw!  The server brought out these round poofs filled with eggy mush and covered in cinnamon sugar.  WTF?!  Sigh, at least the eggs florentine w/ crispy shredded hash browns were delicious, and the service was good.  Otherwise this would have been a travesty.

85saMgIHyPPQrt4CEOK9bg.text: Came here three in the morning. Food was okay, nothing spectacular. Not worth going out of the way for.

JtD2Q6kuxG31NSmI44HyIA.text: Nice atmosphere but I think the food is overpriced. It's a nice restaurant for a group though

ZvJyXFHCyPp8brSbDhY9lA.text: beautiful atmosphere, very intimate, and very big! Whats so great about this place is the fact that you can get something fancy like a steak dinner, or you can get chicken and waffles! It looks like an expensive place but in reality its not at all. Theres a huge menu full of things for anyones specific taste and the service is very good.

wJ5Yz3BXEYdNLrVaSrwM1w.text: Chicken fettuccine alfredo was delish, tasted very authentic! The service was fast & friendly, we had a large party (10+) and they had no problem accomodating us. No one at my table had any complaints so I guess that's a good thing. I think it was a good all ages / family restaurant...we didn't have kids with us but I saw some in there for those who are curious. I would recommend this place for quality food late at night.

eZP1zcj8z10mcFROqu1xkQ.text: since everyone else mentioned it, i guess i will too......  i went to the one at Venetian....  after a night of drinking and partying up at Tryst, we were all craving for some Pho....yes....PHO! and knowing there probably isnt a vietnamese restaurant open at 4am, we decided to come here becuz we knew they had a dish that was similar to pho. its called Zen Noodles. it was actually pretty good. although they didnt give us enough broth, more noodles and chicken which i thought was quite strange. and when we asked our server to give us more broth, she said she will see if anyone else ordered the same dish and if the chef has extras. i guess they dont just have a big pot of broth in the back ready for the next order. but luckily they did have more for us.  we also had the vietnamese spring rolls which were absolutely delish!!! and we totally killed the basket of warm sourdough bread they gave us too! the only gripe i have is that the bowl of noodle soup cost $13! oh well! i guess when youre drunk and hungry, you'll pay just about any amount to satisfy your cravings!

Rru-lTzQ0nFbKluMYvg1Dw.text: One of the best things about Cafe Lux is that it is open 24/7. I first went there at 3am, expecting a "Denny's type" experience. I was soooo wrong. The food is wonderful anytime of day.

9S-wMNpoNSWI6pQlHyUuXA.text: it's not great, but it's not nasty. it's just..ok.. i had the spaghettini with clams stuff (i'm sure it had a fancier name on the menu), and it was decent. i wasn't in love with it, but i didn't hate it. the one thing i do have to say is, they are generous with the amount. i had a huge plate and they didn't skimp with the clams...they had huge, beautiful clams covering my pasta. yum!   prices are just like any other place like this. overall, it didn't wow me, but it didn't disappoint. i liked the decor and set up of the place though. we had a nice, big comfy booth in the middle of the place, and it was lively, but not too loud. there's definitely better places in vegas, but we ate here out of convenience.

nUNGoZ0TigbOw0Tasw1QvA.text: we made reservations for 12 people and they were really cool about it when it ended up being 10. the food is hit or miss and similar to the cheesecake factory menu but not an exact match, although they do serve a select variety of cheesecake factory cheesecakes.   my comments on the dishes i tasted:  -the clam chowder was total fail. not only was it lukewarm, it was devoid of any flavor, clam or otherwise, and just tasted like watered down cream.  -vietnamese fried spring rolls were pretty good -chicken lettuce wraps came with a HUGE bowl of filling. we had to ask for more iceberg lettuce because we ran out 1/4 of the way through the bowl. the flavor was decent although on the salty side.  i like that they're open 24 hours, but for a late night meal, nothing beats noodle asia! (see next review)

TM0zy59slkM2a5f2dyQ79g.text: This place is great because it is open 24 hours. I've tried the calamari. I would say Ichiza has better fried calamari. The zen noodles is pretty good. It is somewhat like pho, but not pho. Santa Barbra sandwhich is pretty good in my opinion. I would ordered that again. The waitress was nice and overall, this place leaves a good impression on me.

q8MFqXBzY3MJzNphts-zKw.text: This one is located in the Venetian. Went here for breakfast/lunch. Cheesecake factory is one of my favorite restaurants, they have such an extensive menu. So when I found out they owned this I was all over it. Got here, got seated quickly and got a basket of sourdough bread. Then I ordered the fish and chips which were melt in your mouth crispy deliciousness on a plate. :) I don't even remember what my boyfriend got, I was too busy savoring the fish and their homemade tartar sauce. The service was ok, we had two different servers. A must go if in Vegas.

RqqG7BsrTl3N2fM8ABJoWQ.text: Location is great because it's located right in the Venetian near the casino floor. They have a huge menu with a large selection of meals, so it catered to all types of eaters and the different cravings you would have for each day of the week and time of the day. They have different menus for breakfast, lunch, dinner, evening, and even late night.  This is one of the only places open 24 hours a day!  The portions are great and the food is decent. It's hard to go wrong with this place. Also service is quite good here and on-par with service in restaurants around the hotel. Breakfast here was kind of disappointing, with small portions and expensive prices. So I suppose the prices are sort of inflated, no surprise since you're within Venetian, but the it's not as inflated as other restaurants and the foot is still pretty good.  I had Salmon Carpaccio the first night and that was really good, but some what expensive $22 - $24 ( I don't remember right now). And the following day had your standard breakfast like scrambled eggs, toast, hash brown, ham and that was something like $18. Which was totally not worth it for me.  All in all, I'd return!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hawaiian smoothie

AJ-d1s2QWb-DF4V63RtAVA.text: I love Cheesecake factory, but this sister restaurant is just a disappointment. I came here multiple times before and waited forever for food. My friends waited 50 minutes for the food to come out this time, and found out their orders weren't even in the system after reminding the waiter 3 times...  I guess I made the mistake of getting food to-go at night since I wanted to take it back to my hotel room. I went for their 24 hour to-go menu and ordered their Buffalo Wings (8 wings for $12), but I DO NOT recommend it! The wings were EXTREMELY salty. I felt like dying after the 1st wing..really not worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sad wings for $12

6gYPYGgOxf3TSgaJLYRgtw.text: It was so good. The bbq salmon was insane. It comes with onion rings but substitute it for broccoli for a more enjoyable dish

VNpwKIhWCuSCwbh7z5GCOQ.text: My husband asked me to share a Cuban sandwich with him, and agreeing to do so was a good decision! The fillings were plentiful. And the bun was fresh and so delicious. I've never had a bad experience at Grand Lux.

pYwDbFq57gIjP73Yw2cgfw.text: While visiting Vegas, the group I was with visited twice in two days. The first day we ordered menu items. We had a really good selection of pizza, salads, chicken and waffles, Belgian waffles, and breakfast sandwiches. It was all very tasty. The fresh whipped cream that came with the Belgian waffle was really good!  The second day, we came for the breakfast buffet. They have an omelet bar, waffles, different pastries, eggs, hash browns, bacon, sausage, cereal and fruit. You also have the option to get 2 drinks. The omelets were quite hearty.   The waffles are incredible! I would go back just for them. They were perfect with a little bit of syrup and some sliced strawberries. They had the perfect amount of crispness!   The service tends to be a bit slow at times since the restaurant is so busy. But like I said. Those waffles are worth it!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast sandwich. Belgium waffle with strawberries
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast buffet. Waffle. Hash browns. Bacon. Sausage. Omelet with spinach, bacon, peppers, mushrooms, cheese.

GKeH9mA3lE04JTXHJ49X-A.text: Came here twice while I was in Vegas and both meals were decent.  My first time here was on my first day after checking in to the hotel. I was hungry and this cafe was right downstairs immediately across from the slots!   Walked right up the counter and the hostess lead my lady and I over to a table. The decor inside of the restaurant is really nice. The lighting is good and I did not smell any hints of smoke while here which was nice.   The meal was good. The fries were on point!!! I would liked for the burger to have been bigger considering the cost of the burger but I guess you can only wish, EVEN in VEGAS!!!  My next experience there was roughly the same. Had a different server and was seated a bit closer to the entrance which was a nice change instead of in the back corner.   The meals were both cooked to my liking. As far as portions, I always say BIGGER is better but apparently other people and businesses do not always see it that way.   #eatup #haveabrew

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. These are really nice and excite me!
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I came I ate and then I LEFT FULL!
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Used for holding da FRIES!!

t-XoBXWr4J-6h7WqCOHYTA.text: This is my new favorite spot! I can't believe it took me so many years to realize there were twin gems at the Palazzo & the Venetian.  Everything I tried was the delicious, from the pizza, to fried tofu over rice, lattes, salads. There menu was so extensive, like a catalogue that caters to everyone!  On top of all the fantastic food, the interior is gorgeous. Clean, classy but not over the top!  If you prefer the dim lighted dining, you can be seated inside. I prefer to people watch at the patio that overlooks the casino. Overall just fabulous!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Buffalo chicken pizza

gKsOH_U1zWDjHl4p1fwLhA.text: We googled 'Vegas buffets' and Mr. Google led us. Not exactly a buffet though. Or at least we missed it or no one told us. Very similar to a PF Changs in menu-size and decor. Half the restaurant is in the mall area. Another portion is by the bar. And there's a light airy seating area by the windows. Definitely ask for the window seating as the bar seating was very dour and drab. I had the chicken enchildas which had an interesting moele (spelling?) sauce. The lady had salmon which was excellent. Good bread before the meal, as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon over lemon Something
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lunch Chicken enchiladas
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bar area

UJDy2dIrK4wgMQVEewdZYA.text: As always, a pleasant experience. It's a busy, noisy place where you can do a quick bite or dinner. Not a romantic or luxerious spot. Open 24/7.  The menu has many options and the portions are huge. Quality is consistent and good. Prices are reasonable. Waiters differ. The're just like normal people......  This time we got a little tucked away on a tiny table. But service was good. No complaints.  Only thing I dislike is that they took some nice items I used to order off the menu. Like The Duck Potstickers and the tomato/bell pepper soup with a cheese sandwich on the side.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy Ginger Beef
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp &amp; chicken (IndoChina)

nPxYOJ80_E4t6bT3B38ACw.text: The Grand Lux Cafe is a great restaurant to go if you're staying at The Venetian/The Palazzo. Not only do they have great food but they are also open 24 hours. Another tidbit is that they are actually owned by The Cheesecake Factory so if you're getting that vibe well now you know.   I haven't seen this place overly packed but they do try to service to you as soon as they can. The waiters and waitresses are friendly and I had no problem with them whatsoever.   I do recommend eating the Pasta Carbonera; with chicken it is a hefty $20 but you are at the casino so you can always win that back. The pasta was cooked well and the flavors were amazing. Yes, it does read that the pasta is imported. However, I asked the waiter and he stated that they are not imported per say. It's more on the ingredients that make the pasta was imported. Tricky tricky haha! By the time I was finished, I had leftovers and no room for dessert but I do hear there's a great dessert place in the Grand Canal Shoppes ;)

Dlc4kYuCBHD94wwKzCrAhg.text: Probably one of the worst experiences I have had on the strip. The staff were unresponsive and seated multiple parties before addressing us. The hostess and staff were some of the most unpleasant people I've ever met. Stay away!

WbcmON9btzbwIoGwWl69uQ.text: The breakfast food and coffee was a 5, and the tables and restaurant were clean, but the service was terrible. The waiter who took our order didn't write anything down and we had a lot of errors in the meal we were brought, which he slowly corrected... Also, we sat with dirty and empty dishes for 15 minutes before someone came by to pick them up, then we tracked someone down 10 minutes later for the check. This was all really odd because the restaurant was pretty empty and there were a LOT of staff around not doing much. We made eye contact with several of them and tried to flag them down, but despite our efforts the service was just plain bad. When you're spending a good amount of money on a meal, you expect to be treated better. I will not be going back.

wYvWsBMViMVyrS3OiJlzUQ.text: I love this spot. They've got late hours as well which is a plus! I've never had bad service. Staff is so polite. The food is flavorful. Huge dinner portions. One of my favorite sit down restaurants in Vegas. I always recommend this restaurant to friends.

rsC9jdTd9YuoJ1R-nW5-og.text: We had breakfast here on a Saturday morning and overall we were pretty impressed.  This restaurant combines a buffet offering with traditional table service.  We aren't fans of the buffet concept so we ordered off the menu.  We were both pleased - the restaurant is quite busy but does a good job of moving people in an out.  There was plenty of staff to wait on customers.  The restaurant is much bigger than it looks.  There is about a 20 ft line of people with a sign that says 5-7 minutes from here.  I would say we were seated in less than 5 minutes.  There was one customer loitering around the hostess station that looked kind of angry.  I felt like saying "Relax man - it's Vegas and life is too short to be this upset about breakfast".  But I didn't...So I digest.....

rsi5fI7g7uRBlpOfSf4TXA.text: Cheesecake Factory's Venetian half. Large portions.  Price: Look to spend about $20 per menu item.  Parking: HOTEL parking  Service: Ok. She was quick to give us our bill and not know we exist afterwards.  Drinks: They have a full bar and serve bloody marys.  Food: Asian Nachos: Fried round wonton with sweet sauce, little bits of chicken, and chopped peanuts. I would not get this again. Way too sweet.  Turkey Salad: The pieces of turkey were obviously lunch meat, chopped salad was ok. Large chunks of cheese.  Sunday Pasta: Good serving, Ok.  Beef Wellington Cafe: Well worth $20. 4 small pieces of beef with a small puff pastry on top, mashed potatoes, Brussel Sprouts, Steamed beans. - I would order this again.  Notes: Open 24hrs.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Asian nachos

AbWq5Ye5i6aQvqSeGQ83Mg.text: We ate here everyday. Really enjoyed the waffles and the drinks! Excellent service. Never had to wait long for a table!

qaiJ4Kr88D42U1yWUjO5Yg.text: Located on the casino floor of Palazzo. This restaurant is priced right, served right and tasted right. We all enjoyed every dish. Don't miss the freshly prepared molte lava cake or beignets. Highly recommended.

sjg9TFnOKyj1ZVcVUCS48A.text: First time here and I have no complaints! The wait time was only 5 mins if that, even with a packed house!   Our server was very friendly and kept the refills coming without asking! She recommended the breakfast buffet and we accepted!   I had a custom omelet, fresh fruit, bacon and waffle! I'm not sure what kind of batter the waffle was made with but it was amazing, taste like cake!   The orange juice was fresh squeezed so it was delicious! I think I'll be back for dinner

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast buffet

Lqw1L6ClMBzjVJnngbVDQg.text: I came here because I had heard from this nudist gym (I like to work up a sweat lol ) that I frequent that the wings here are TO DIE FOR. And oh man, fondle my boba balls and call me Ronald Reagan, but boy were they right. I might as well have been cycling at the gym at 333MPH with my big, muscular calves, because I was sweatin. Spicy alert!!!  not for the faint of heart Ill tell you that. Nevernonetheless, they were tasty, marinated to perfection. Like the tasiest, most perfect chicken wings coated with truffle butter..but WITHOUT the truffle butter . Highly recommend this nutty appetizer (doesn't actually contains NUTS!!) 9.5/10

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. my first bite. Little did i know what i was in for. Tragic.
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. a tear rolls down my cheek. can i take it any more? I dont know. I feel im about to implode. has a man been lost in the sauce?
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. the immense pressure builds within me resonating with the heat of a very very very very small sun. it concentrates itself upon my tongue.

_VwAZZPTGpwQTvtCoj4byA.text: Delicious food and nice location alongside the casino. Very reasonable prices considering the location. The pizza was wonderful; the fresh mushroom flavor coming thru; nice crust; perhaps slightly over salted. Outstanding service from Jessica. This would be close to 5 stars if it were located along the Grand Canal.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Blue Moon on draf
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheese, pepperoni and mushroom pizza (lunch special with salad)

olaUGn9CAT5p8c2OS1tj_g.text: We've been in Vegas for two nights and we've already eaten here three times.   This is an absolute excellent place in the Venetian that's open late (maybe even 24 hours) and has an expansive menu that's got something for everyone. The food is pretty high quality and fairly priced.   We're always seated quickly and served immediately. The service is always friendly and cordial.   Tonight, we came here after a horrible experience at Homestead Steakhouse at Ceaser's (don't go there if you want steak, ever) and we were satisfied, just as we were the past two visits.   I'm on a no-carb diet and they were accommodating every time. I ordered a burger with no bun and they even wrapped it in lettuce for me! Same with the chicken sandwich, which was phenomenal. Plus, they've got a great happy hour menu!   At the Grand Lux, you get pretty damn good food at a low price. With all the places to eat in Vegas, it's gotta say *something* that we've eaten at least three meals here.

5lzAtJoT40tP-1yXV6UO3A.text: This place is amazing. It is my favorite restaurant in Las Vegas. The dishes they have are so delicious. We got the Cafe Beef Wellington and Spice Market Chicken for lunch. Both of them are way beyond our expectations! So we went back for the Cafe Beef Wellington and Rib eye steak for dinner. The next day, we went back again for the blueberry pancakes. They are amazing! The price is very low for the high quality food. Love this restaurant very much! Highly suggest it.

eH-ryiS_sJJSDFj4BJ0oTg.text: I realize it's a chain and that it's located on the casino floor BUT I love the grand lux cafe, primarily because every food item is so tasty. It's not overpriced, the menu is extensive, portions are large, and most importantly, everything is delicious- a rarity these days. It's not a fine dining experience but many of their items are completely crave-able (ie. the Asian Nachos I had twice in three days-wtf is in those things...I want more as I write this). The place must be doing ok given there are two within about 100 yards of each other.   Definitely worth a stop if you are not in need of a fancy meal and/or have less experimental eaters with you (or are clearly addicted to the Asian Nachos).

wnqPVSd-Q2sv3gJnxECf3w.text: An absolute favorite, always hits the spot. The Salmon three ways was delicious, should come with like a soup or salad for the price.  Non the less was great, chicken rolls aptzr was a hit.  My son liked his cheese burger sliders n fries.  Wifes Mojito was on point.  I also recommend the "sunday night pasta".

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

FnmpOYp79elcFoF9xfnuqg.text: We got the French toast, biscuits and gravy and pastrami hash.... o..m...g!  Delish!!!  Service impeccable!  Enjoy!

GJq04MT0bA-y6ycGovVgAQ.text: This was definitely the spot for business breakfasts and lunches. The establishment was totally packed during these meals during a conference being held at Sands.  With that said, they did a good job handling the crowd and getting meals out and complete in under an hour.  I got the breakfast sandwich with hash browns ($12.50). The sandwich was huge and included tomato, egg, ham, cheese, mayo, and bacon. It was a little greasy but substantial. The hash browns were also a bit greasy and needed salt.  Either way, it served an important function for the conference and the Venetian, that's for sure.

Ys7Igo9uOSQBZlcAkXZL2Q.text: Typical Grand Lux experience but all of my food was subpar. I was pretty upset that I ate here and wish I walked to the food court in the Venetian. I ordered the lettuce wraps and they were just okay. Oddly they were served with mustard. I split the macaroni and cheese with my friend, that was not good either. My friend was, however, pleased with the buffalo chicken rolls! Always a good choice. The atmosphere was nice and the place was clean, good service also.

l6M5Js6sLnO9xpqUF4U6-w.text: Terrible service. Dreadful hostess. Mediocre food. 0ther locations much better.Go to other places for breakfast when staying at the venetian. Manager awful too.

-l4jr-8Hqtc9FiXKwIRHkA.text: We ate here for breakfast both mornings of our stay this past weekend. The so called "American Breakfast" came complimentary with our suite. And that's fine if you want a coffee that's included but no juice.  Bacon, sausage, etc. all pork meat choices, no beef or turkey substitutes. And we, along with probably half the world's population don't eat pork. So we were left with eggs, toast, muffin and hash browns. And they were all prepared very well.   Our server Joe, took it upon himself to take his pick of an 18% gratuity. Something normally only done with a group of diners. That was this past Saturday, 3/12/16. I guess Joe didn't think we'd give him a decent tip.  On the other hand, the following morning breakfast experience was much nicer. 3/13/16, with an upbeat waitress whose name escapes me; the bubbly and friendly redhead with a smile. Same breakfast choices as the previous morning. And when presented with the bill, the customer's suggested tip options of 15%, 18% and 20% were there for the customers choosing. Something totally absent the previous morning Joe. This wonderful server received the 20% gratuity. She truly earned it.

A6zHW1aKgT5RkTjGSIA7hA.text: While in Vegas for the weekend, one of my friends suggested we hit up the Grand Lux Cafe for dinner. I knew it was similar to the Cheesecake Factory- but that's all I knew going into it. The service was absolutely wonderful! Our waitress Linda, was an absolute hoot! She made us feel completely welcome, and offered up her favorite items on the menu (the menu is rather large, so this helped a LOT!) I decided to go for the Chicken and Waffles,(one of my favorite dishes) and a Peach Bellini. The Bellini was okay-I'm not a HUGE fan of frozen drinks(it didn't specify that it was frozen on the menu), but the chicken and waffles were OUTSTANDING. Huge portions, and great food for a fraction of what you would pay elsewhere in Vegas. I will DEFINITELY return next time I'm in town!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken and Waffles!

RU__19rg-zzoKwwYjio74A.text: Miso salmon was decent. There was lunch specials which is a bonus. My brother really liked his baked rigatoni. We also got an 18inch sausage, mushroom, and pepperoni pizza. That pizza was SALTY. I had to drink ten cups of water.

Vo86RtRH8xzk3TuQtE92ig.text: Grand Lux is Cheesecake Factory 2.0.  They have an extensive menu just like the Cheesecake factory, but I would say that Grand Lux has better options that are tastier and healthier.  The avocado chipotle burger was massive and delicious. I had to eat with with a knife and fork since it didn't fit in my mouth. The waiter was very nice and allowed me to substitute the side of fries with the chicken and mushroom soup. The soup was perfectly creamy, not too overwhelming.  They have a late night menu from 12am-6pm which means that they are open 24 hours a day! After a long night of drinking, you can stop by the Grand Lux for some late night munchies!   My friends and I came here twice during our trip to Vegas because the prices are great and the portions are big. Many restaurants on The Strip are overpriced, but the Grand Lux keeps it real!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken  sun dried tomatoes
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ahi tuna salad
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

xynFIor5eTD1UDn3Q1KojA.text: Enjoyed several meals here on our last Vegas get away. Very relaxing place to enjoy a quiet meal.

y0foNhyvRB_j03pjCTfVWg.text: We were there this weekend and had a few disappointments in surrounding restaurants, until we came here. We had a large party of 11 and hit the jackpot with this place.  Food was exceptional and service was even better than the food. We had a woman named Betty and she was outstanding. I never had to ask for a refill nor did anyone in my party. She kept a smile and was beyond patient with all of our questions. Being that I have been in the service industry for years, I understand that everyone has "bad" days, but not here every employee was smiling and kind. I even pulled the manager to the side at the end and told him how grateful we were that we had finally had wonderful service in Vegas. Kuddos to this restaurant for picking am amazing staff and hats off to the cooks because the food was delicious . Definately will be back to Vegas in June and will be coming back with a request to have Betty as our server. Thank you for a perfect experience.

tnXXzRDrYPz2vvNLgdoZow.text: Another food bucket list- always wanted to try chicken and waffles.  it was very good! too much food for one small person so the waffle had one bite eaten but chicken with syrup was pretty yummy. Our server was awesome too!

LBheP5s_aCGRM3IGr_W6Fg.text: For a restaurant in the Venetian, I expected a lot more. I ordered a single malt scotch with one ice sphere. I asked if the had ice spheres, to which my waitress said yes. She brought me a glass full of little ice cubes and, the wrong scotch. My first red flag. T-bone steak was thin and over cooked. Garlic mashed potatoes had zero garlic and no flavor. Plus the service was weak and inattentive. Honestly, it felt like I was eating in a senior center. Grand Lux turned out to be a Grand Loss. I do not recommend.

XS0TW6dgFpBwwVxRw_WQcw.text: I had lunch here with my friends. The food was amazing. Had the Miso Grazed Salmon and it was amazing. The coffee is worth to try.

ZGkd8tuI74fhD8xsmGZGpg.text: My friend and I wanted a place to eat on the Strip because we were out exploring that day. We found this place, which was decently priced and had good menu items. It was around noon, so everyone was out getting lunch at the time. Also, there was an annual meeting for AAOS at the Venetian, and everyone had decided to go eat at this restaurant. However, the wait was only about seven minutes, which was awesome!  We decided to try the lunch specials, but we were concerned that the portions would be small since normally at a nicer restaurant like that, their portions are not filling.   I ordered the Lunch Rustic Pizza and Salad ($11.95) with a Mango Margarita ($10.75). My friend got the Lunch Chicken Special-Chicken Parmesan (~$12.95) with a Strawberry Margarita (also $10.75).   When our plates came out, we were shocked at how much food we were given. We were full by the end of our meal. Would this be filling for the average-sized man? Probably not. But it is a good-sized portion for the price.  The only cons are that we had to ask for our complimentary bread, which our waitress brought out right away (she was great!), and the margaritas were a little flavorless in my opinion. The next time I go, i would opt out on the margaritas.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lunch Rustic Pizza and Salad and Mango Margarita

X34cU3ZffTUd1b5gPkS91A.text: Beautiful venue. Incredibly reasonably priced breakfast buffet. Buffet options were all delicious and full of flavor. Even every single type of fruit was sweet and delicious. Our server was polite and attentive.

iUqoqN0scsE9LCRO_Wb8-Q.text: Breakfast buffet is a joke. Servers ignore you. Our server disappeared throughout the whole meal. Mimosa came very late and it was small while others had bigger ones. Servers are just standing around chatting with each other or just trolling looking busy... yet they dont even ask if you need an assistance.

iG-7bqSKJpD8Jlr0lhbJhw.text: There's a waitress there who's shady as fuck. We paid tax and tip, then she claimed we didn't and made us pay for tax again. We were too tired to fight it even more than we did so we just paid. Such a shame bc I really liked this place but don't like to be treated like shiiiiiiiiit

UihFc0Vb1AeDkqxnD5sYCw.text: Yummmmm!   Have the chicken pot pie, its legit. I mostly ate off my sister's plate. I ordered the Pasta Carbonara and that was JUST ok. Its a nice cafe with comfy booths, perfect for slouching in after a night of partying!

W9YwJvt_FewAAZhMLhsp7w.text: If you just got back from clubbing and are staying at the Venetian, this is the place to visit. I actually found this place on Yelp, go figure. We had spent all night gambling and decided to stop here before we got a snooze snooze in. For a 24 hour restaurant, the food here is superbly cooked and even at 3am in the morning, the staff are quite friendly. I got the Cuban sandwich which was cooked perfectly, with the cheese and ham sunk into the bread in a delicious amalgamation.

2a9NmyZwHyiJ6mkovI975g.text: Absolutely amazing!  I got the Lux Melt and my wife got the chicken and waffles.   Both were to die for.  The waffle was the best either of us had ever tasted.  We will go back again!

DCJMkssvY-tA43zY_0OZhA.text: That place rocks! I have eaten here many times. Best Shrimp Scampi I ever had. I come here on every Vegas visit.

vuEtznnK-e9MXZP1LoK3qw.text: Owned by same owners as Cheesecake Factory....enough said.  Too many other places to eat in LV to eat there.

QNV-SB-63oNUX0V3iA3iRA.text: Amazingly Delicious!!   We ordered the Avocado-Chipotle Cheeseburger , Short Rib Grilled Cheese Sandwich, DeLux Drive-In Burger ,  and the Pasta Carbonara with chicken.  ALL OF IT WAS YUMMY! I will definatley return on every Vegas trip!

V4JyDcYQsYJCGzt3nBqpXQ.text: HUGE portion. Get ready to get stuffed.  Make sure to NOT order too much...lol

YCzsLfjTmcOV7gW5ROlnbQ.text: Excellent. We had the best waitress! Breakfast here was awesome. Veggie omelet was cooked to perfection, hash browns, fruit, toast all wonderful. Scrambled eggs and pastrami also so good. Portions were very large. Price right on point. Coffee good. Just a great place, food better than some of the "designer chef" restaurants we ate at.

fetuGKPTFCSrpwWmStrmvQ.text: I came here on a Wednesday for brunch around 1PM. We initially attempted to dine at Bouchon Bistro but they apparently close at 1PM. After walking around hunting for the next best thing we settle for Grand Lux Cafe. I started off with the Ahi Ceviche: Fresh Raw Ahi Tuna Diced and Marinated in Lime Juice, Chiles and Cilantro. Tossed with Avocado, Tomato, Onion and Cucumber. This was such a refreshing and delicious dish for summer. It looked so appetizing that I forgot to take a picture of it. The appetizer was pretty hearty and you could definitely have the Ahi Ceviche as your meal. For my entree I ordered the Sonoma Saladwith Crispy Greens, Grilled Chicken, Avocado, Bacon, Fresh Corn, Sweet Dates, Golden Raisins, Onions, Goat Cheese and Glazed Walnuts. Tossed with our Hazelnut-Mustard Vinaigrette. Since it was 100+ degrees in Vegas I stuck with light dishes which turned out to be very filling. My colleague ordered a pasta and thoroughly enjoyed her entree as well. The service was quick and it was fun people watching it everyone in the casino.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sonoma Salad:  Crispy Greens, Grilled Chicken, Avocado, Bacon, Fresh Corn, Sweet Dates, Golden Raisins, Onions, Goat Cheese and

8Qn4BCXjq-FoZyyX9xbTug.text: It's basically a cheesecake factory.  The portions are huge which is nice and the price is appropriate.  I was feeling steak so I asked our host how their steak was and about the aging process. He proceeded to tell me that the steaks are really good and that the steak is not old but fresh. I should have taken that as a bad sign and ordered something else.  But no, I had to get steak and I hated myself for it.  I think they completely forgot to season the steak. It was just meat without any sort of flavor. It was also overcooked.  Not very impressed.

VmtvQBzt5Mxs25zJ-q_FLg.text: This place is awesome! Start with Asian Nachos.... Their amazing! And it's a lot of food so come hungry! I had chicken and waffles and they are great! Wife had the Short Rib grilled cheese....wow, that sandwich was awesome because I wouldn't let what she didn't finish go to waste!  Reason #567 I'll never be skinny! Staff was really nice too. Definitely one of the more reasonable places to eat in Vegas price wise.

JJ41E4j42cU0Puhle4WlxQ.text: I think this is the only restaurant in Wynn that is open until the wee hours of the morning. We rolled in with a group of 7 and were seated in less than ten minutes.   I got the short rib sloppy joe. I had high expectations as I love sloppy joes. Every once and a while, I get a strong craving for a good old fashion joe...you know the ones that were served in elementary school.   The meat was okay. Nothing to rave about. It could have been ground beef for all I know.   The sloppy joe could have been improved in two ways: 1) more sauce and 2) hamburger bread. I did not enjoy eating a dry sloppy joe on a toasted piece of bread.   Towards the end, my entire party crashed, while I handled the bill. Service was friendly but a bit slow. I struggled to stay awake, while I waited for what seemed like an eternity for the waitress to return with the receipt.

o4LMugk2wIAKAq8aJ6lbIw.text: It's alright pasta chicken the only thing I like is there breakfast.. Wings same as wings stop. Only place open after 3am that why I went

jSdFC15WTpOgFItiHyn6hA.text: Delicious!  I had the pan seared salmon and the Asian nachos.  WOW.    Service was great and I had plenty of refills, never had to ask.  Great experience, I will be back.

q9FG8GglLU7E7xRPelD4Kg.text: Hit this spot at 4am and it was packed.  Food is DELICIOUS and reasonably priced.  The fish and chips were very favorable and surprisingly not greasy.  My husband had the chicken and waffles and both were phenomenal! The waffles were light, perfectly crunchy on the outside and soft on the inside...BOMB!  The chicken was full of flavor.  Our server was Mike and he was on point!  My husband and I cannot recall the last time we had GREAT service and by all staff. This place will be a regular future stop on our Vegas visits!  Highly recommended!

eF4URWvO5axe_DHQkfZhfA.text: Located in the Venetian on the Vegas strip this restaurant is decent. They were quite busy which lacked a bit because the waiter screwed up our order twice. He was very apologetic and still gave us good service in general. The food was good and the coffee was really good. Its a nice large restaurant and the booths are quite comfy. I will definitely come back when im here in Vegas ...

Oc-074Zjw4KUPeBd4eS1Uw.text: I had the gnocchi here. it was just plain and very oily. And I'll be honest, I was pissed that there's no prices for their beverages. I paid $12 for my pasta and $5.50 for a tiny orange juice. That's just ridiculous. Why not charge $20 while you're at it?   The service was fine. I'm sure there are better items on the menu, but to have the balls to charge me half my meal for a few ounces of liquid and not show anywhere the prices, you guys get a rare 2 stars from me.

ma7vsISPZ4lLCBaWaKhpxw.text: 5 stars for the awesome waiter who made our groggy, hungover, end-of-the-trip breakfast way more pleasant.  Friendly attitude, quick service, constant refills, etc.    The food is meh, but you should have known that going in.

ktUtYUHUH6NFTf_xwf68ZQ.text: I was craving calamari for a week before we came here. My boyfriend asked around to see what restaurant had calamari and a couple people directed us here.   We were seated very quickly and given water and bread right away. I already knew I wanted calamari, so we ordered that once we were seated.   It took us a while to decide what we wanted since the menu had a big variety. I guess that's why the website says "something for everyone!" So True!  We finally decided upon the Crispy Caramel Chicken because it just sounded so good! "Crispy Battered Pieces of Chicken Breast in a Spicy Thai Caramel Sauce with Mushrooms, Onions, Red Chile Peppers, Garlic and Ginger. Served with Rice."  The calamari came and it wasn't just calamari. It also came with Rock Shrimp, Zucchini and Onions. Served with a couple dipping sauces. It was all so crunchy, just the way I like it! I loved that they added in the shrimp, zucchini, and onions. It made it all the more better!  The caramel chicken came and we were ecstatic! IT looked just as it was described in the menu, maybe even better! Our first bites had us melting in our seats, it was so tasty! The chicken was breaded perfectly and the Thai sauce was just delicious! It didn't have too much ginger either, which is a surprise since a lot of dishes with ginger tend to have chunks of it.   All in all, perfect experience! The portion was perfect to share, we didnt even finish, so we had some yummy leftovers the next day :)

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Complimentary Bread
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Calamari

mxELNQURjIHHMOS1tLcQRg.text: I think this is the type of place to eat when youre after a party and want something fat and greasy... For that purpose it's great but don't expect to enjoy your food too much after two bites.  Also, the food didn't arrive for a very long time even tho the place wasn't too crowded. We couldn't get service even if we waived a thousand times and our water never came.

OaEyt8tsQWS3AiB6AVh4yg.text: This place inside the palazzo is better than the location in the Venetian. I don't know why, just is.. Lol Eaten there many times. Everything is fantastic! What a wide menu as well! Happy Hour is 4:30pm-6pm and have a great appetizer selection that is all $5 a piece. The best part is they are open 24 hours a day! The ambience in the bar is great and has tables.

z27uP7WGC52A1_itHhK71g.text: Quickly becoming a favorite place for all meals in Vegas. I tend to hang out on this side of the strip, and bang for buck this place does not let you down.

B3XYOuhXGVFJhClp4iyiHg.text: Good lunch buffet, breakfast buffet was so so. We went during the transition time. The lunch buffet had tasty seafood, steak,chicken, egg Benedict,  and salads were superb.

21I7l0R_eFHS1tPX_24IUA.text: Wonderful vegetarian options! My favorite for lunch: Small pizza and salad. I had the Margherita pizza---delicious!! Kumar was a great server and made good recommendations to my dining companions. In a nice location in the Venetian, you can do some decent people watching, too!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The lunch special- small Margherita pizza and salad: delicious!

VUPS1NwWBr7a9GAxEhvGaw.text: Perfect place for a good bite after a long night!  Drinks are good food is always good and fresh, yes it's identical to cheesecake factory and who doesn't love that!  Had a delishh pizza with wild mushrooms and asparagus with their house salad which was delightful!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wild mushroom and asparagus pizza with small house salad

hJWAuYL2WEh9FYmy59-t4g.text: I had to wait half an hour for my steak, - 1 The prime top sirloin was too dry, - 1  Most likely I won't come back.

KIscHPfWWogiV77V-bL8lQ.text: One of my favorites. Pre game dinner prior to kick off ASU vs Oregon State at the Sports Book Venetian Resort and Casino. PRETTY COOL.

MTvkD6d86Ni9XkqUPkCvKA.text: Their food is alright. If you're staying at the Venetian, you are in luck! They have delicious food to satisfy your hunger or to satisfy your late night munchies! I think their portions are reasonably large! I have been able to make two meals out of one several times! You can take out or dine in. Whichever your heart desires!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fruit cup - $4.95 strawberry cup - $5.95
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

L0aYRSYEg-ACDM4vpbZoow.text: Very good, big portions, healthy options, huge menu with basically something for everyone!  Definitely will come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Huge Cobb salad
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak sandwich - delicious!

BFSxeOrodmAU7Sr6WrNyZQ.text: I come here strictly for their Korean Bulgogi burger and now it's discontinued. Of all their big menu items, they discontinued the only item that I liked the most and recommend to my friends to go there for. I don't need to go there anymore. Saves me gas and time.

o-pic_dIkr24Th582suQQA.text: Absolutely amazing! We have been here before and we continue to come back. We have had something different each time and we are amazed every time at just how good this place is.   This time we had the Sunday Night Pasta. Definitely large enough to share. My wife and I split it and didn't finish the plate. She started with a salad and I started with a cup of clam chowder. Let me tell you about the the clam chowder!! Easily the best bowl of chowder I have ever had. Strong herb flavors with a healthy helping of potatoes and clams. Delightful!  Anyway, definitely recommend the Sunday Night Pasta. It is like spaghetti on steroids with beef short ribs AND ground beef! Spaghetti pasta was well cooked and it all wrapped up to be a great meal.  Do it. Don't debate it, just do it!

oNOZ9GSzdjib9a45cWo8qA.text: This restaurant is awesome!  We couldn't figure out where to eat, and decided to give this place a try.  This is one of the decently priced restaurants in the venetian.    I had the mediterrainean mahi mahi. So filling and absolutely delicious.   My husband had the filet with carrots.  Wow!!  An amazing filet for 30$ on the strip!!    Seriously cannot say enough good things about this place.  The ladies sitting at the table next to us had fantastic things to say about it too!!  We will be back several times....for sure!  Way to go Grand Luxe Cafe!!

aBedwlHkd7k1R-2azp_INw.text: 24 hour cafe downstairs, awesome! Grand Lux is known to be the sister of Cheesecake factory so you'll see similarities in their decor and menu options.   I tried their Pasta Carbonara during this trip and it was the best Carbonara that I've ever had. It was creamy and just delicious! Their Asian nachos are also on point. They're a little on the sweet side for me but my boyfriend absolutely loves them.     Service has always been awesome. They have a grand selection of options to try. Next time I'll try their breakfast options if I stay at the Venetian again.

KHWn1wwHyufymhBWX33lmA.text: Food is great, service is great! I was very happy with my meal here. Everything was better than expected and I couldn't have asked for more. I came with a big group and they were so willing to split the check in all the crazy ways we asked with no complaints!

5PDkBop7tsYRjXQD1RCDOA.text: I had the Chilaquiles and they were superb. Highly recommend them lots of flavor. The waffles OMG delish.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chilaquiles.

dmOdOpGZCCW-9ZEYzaI06Q.text: I was looking for a quick bite before our show across the street and landed here.   The first thing I noticed was their extensive menu. There was seriously so much to choose from!  I ordered the Cafe Beef Wellingtons. The steak was flavorful and medium rare just the way I asked! The dish was full of lightly sweetened vegetables (brussel sprouts, mashed potatoes, and carrots) to offset the semi salty filet medallions.   Although the entree was good, the dessert wasn't as up to par. My sister went with the chocolate molten lava cake served with vanilla ice cream. It was presented beautifully. However, the ice cream was extremely frozen to the point where you had to struggle just to get a spoonful. Fudge exploded from the middle just the way it should be, but there was barely any cake. The outside did not have the consistency of a cake. Rather, it was more like a chocolate cookie. The lining was very chewy, while the outside was hard.  Besides the food, service was friendly from the moment we walked in till the moment we left. Everything was done in a very timely manner!

xw9StZL-BjURN_3YZ0LhYA.text: What's so awesome about the Venetian and Palazzo towers is that they each have a Grand Lux Cafe.  Best idea ever!  This place is always crackin'!  Why? Because if you don't know what to eat, then this is your best choice.  They have an extensive menu, just like the one you would find at a Cheesecake Factory, but even bigger!  I love how you have options in every category of cuisine, and know that you will find something to your taste with the confidence that it will taste good.   And if it doesn't, you can always count on their endless list of small plates and appetizers, and their super yummy warm bread available in both white and wheat!  When I come here I usually order a salad because their huge and it gives me the opportunity to eat about 3 baskets of bread.  I would have to admit that I actually come here for the bread.  But their lettuce wraps, egg rolls, and their Ahi Tuna Salad are some of my other regular orders because their good too.  But if you need to load up on some good carbs, and you love butter, come hither to Grand Lux to rid of your hangover after the nightlife on this strip because this joint will be definitely open and ready to serve!  Yelp Challenge! Started 8/20/2011 (56/365).

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seared Ahi Tuna Salad
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Shrimp Thai Rolls

BULjKQJalEkU6_f8-Ng7KA.text: Since we were staying at the Venetian on our last trip to Las Vegas, it makes logical sense that we ended up eating at the Grand Lux Cafe. In fact, after wandering around the casino one night we even discovered that there are two spread out between both the Venetian and Palazzo hotels. Our experience dining at the Venetian Grand Lux Cafe was overall very good as we were able to get seated right away and the quality of our food was perhaps even better than expected. We began with buffalo chicken egg roll appetizers, which were incredible and highly recommendable as a starter that would also pair well with beer. I decided to order a garlic shrimp pasta dish and my partner in crime ordered a strip steak--both meals that I wouldn't say we order on a regular basis when we go out to eat. Once our food came out, we were very impressed as my pasta tasted incredible and his steak was cooked to perfection and seasoned exquisitely. It actually made me happy that we ended up at Grand Lux Cafe rather than a steakhouse, where he would have definitely paid $50.00 for a steak that would have been similar in quality.   Overall, good service, great food, decent atmosphere, and prices that are better than some of the other more high-end restaurants within the Venetian/Palazzo means that if you find yourself staying at either of these hotels, I would recommend stopping by Grand Lux Cafe. The menu is large enough that if you find yourself in a big party, everyone should be happy eating here. And of course it is centrally located within the casino, which for Las Vegas is another plus.

AQf0kxkkFmdQcJ6UtuzEQw.text: Our reservation was at 12pm and its 1:36pm and I just got my latte. All the tables around us have already received their food and we just got our drinks. The service here is seriously terrible and I vouch never to come here again unless it's in the middle of the night and nothing else is opened and as long as no one is here and I'm guaranteed my food in 30 minutes. I'm really disappointed that the service staff doesn't even care after we asked a couple of times why our food hasn't come yet and why it took 1.5 hours to receive our drinks. If I was part of management, I would feel embarrassed and maybe offer the latte or drinks on the restaurant but all they could say was that they were sorry.

6e5S7dV6MiPKswqOQJr26w.text: Great place to eat. Food is slightly higher end than it's red headed step brother. Obviously the place is clean and nice with nice staff. Look forward to trying the one they opened at Red Rock.

-gVSXXsGhGxJav_W6J_SWQ.text: I had the eggs over medium with hash browns and an English Muffin.  It was basic enough and was good.  I love how the hash browns are slightly beyond golden but not burnt.  Most places undercook their hash browns.  The waitress was friendly.  I would say the only thing wrong with my experience was that the coffee tasted odd; my husband thought it tasted watered down.  The waitress offered to bring me a cup of espresso but I was on my way to a meeting and didn't want to take in too much caffeine.

oLOo2u7mrfo7gkbzrmNh3g.text: Walked out due to unfriendly hostesses, and our server never showing his face for ten minutes! Hostess went to find our server, and he totally ignored our table when he came out. And, we are guests of Palazzo. BAD experience.

B36M3gRtdrnQlUDqh0v1nQ.text: 3 stars for their pork chops and one more star for being open 24 hours, just the way it should be, cuz youre in VEGAS and people dont SLEEP here.  awesome variety of food and they're all SO good when you come here after a night of partying and super duper buzzed.  pork chops!! GOOD! get them!  warning: their chicken n waffles is NOT friend chicken and waffles its chicken STRIPS and waffles. the dude who got this was so disappointed he sent it back and ordered pancakes.

yKs0FK14Mu-fgtJCKCPRJA.text: I'm so glad this place is opened late night, because I did not want to go to some breakfast place that we stumbled upon in Excalibur (or resort to Dennys) and my party of 14 tipped them for the tap water that they brought out for our drink asses before we changed our mind. Our bad. We all ended up at GLC and it is like a Cheesecake factory, but I remember CF having a booklet for a menu (oh wait, it was filled with ads as well.) with a page full of different cheesecakes. I had the Carolina BBQ Pork sandwich and it was alright. I think I could have done better with less salt on my fries and I did not see peanut slaw or coleslaw separately. Everything was just piled in all mixed together without enough sauce. Extra sauce please!

IhJkrKjZZxl5WyjSd2SNUg.text: From the same chain that introduced us all to Cheesecake factory, you can expect the same type of experience: good but not great food, ginormous portions, and reasonable prices. This was a good place to go with my budget conscious in-laws.

KyxUD5K6jJVzsoB2qEe9Cg.text: Huge portions of good food at very affordable prices!  The asian nachos that we got for an appetizer were great and unlike anything I had had before.  Had the chicken and short rib combo for my meal and finished maybe half of it.  It is a little silly that they give you such huge portions since most Vegas hotels don't have mini fridges in the room, so all that extra food is going to waste.  Be sure to check this place out if you're tired of the buffets or overpriced mediocre restaurants.

2A5PA8nYKUgwbI3sLc_XdQ.text: I absolutely love the lunch specials here. The Pasta Carbonara is one of my favorite dishes (not too heavy and the flavors work well together.....mmmm, bacon). I also enjoyed their mushroom burger. The mimosas are also quite awesome. Finally, I really like that their portions are huge.

Hez44nrg5IKl6A7up5wQeA.text: This is the spot to eat at after Tao. I don't remember exactly what I ordered but I been here twice and the food was good. A little pricey but worth it!

e80ttBOskaLrkDNB2AEr2Q.text: Long wait in line but ,you can always play some roulette or blackjack at the casino tables right next to the Grand Lux.  A nice sanctuary from the madness of the casino floor . I usually go for the crispy chicken sandwich but, the salads are pretty good.  Once seated at the tables, the service is surprisingly quick.

SueYDdvHnTWLJLHIZ81ocQ.text: as affordable and tasty as the cheesecake factory but without the insane wait.  i sat on the "patio" once and hated it.  the casino noise and smoke drove me nuts.  the inside is huge and spacious.  love the booths.  the last tastiest thing i ate there was the spicy (fried) calamari salad.  but my favorite memory was coming here at 6 am after staying up all night.  i had a greasy omelette, while my friend had an ice cream sundae.

7cS5e6vRWZpgwU0REynm-g.text: I dont give it 5 stars because it could be a little less expensive, but it does serve great food (nothing to fancy either) remember it is on the casino floor and its open 24 hrs, Tip: try the caramel martini (yum!), and, of course, the strawbery cheesecake for dessert.

TrZKa0uPGt5-B1D5v4hYDQ.text: It's a Cheesecake Factory with the Venetian decor.  Plain and simple.  I think the menu itself is being published as a novel in late 2008.  Get ready to spend about a half hour looking over the menu if you read every item.  Do not come here if you are indecisive; it could take you an entire day to decide.  I tried the mashed baked potato spring rolls and they were fantastic, but the portion was large enough to split for 4.  My lunch-sized Southwest Salad was also delicious but a bit too large.  It makes me sad to think about how much food they must waste here each day.  I didn't have any problems with the service being rude/incompitent.  If anything, our waitress was a bit TOO friendly; checking on us every 5-10 minutes.

NNt3LcxGBMFGyZVpjBiymA.text: The Cheesecake Factory is one of the few chain restaurants that I actually enjoy. So a 24 hour Cheesecake Factory in Vegas? I'm all over it! The menu at the Grand Lux Cafe is pretty similar to that of the Cheesecake factory, but with some different dishes as well. We came here a couple weeks ago and were not disappointed. This was the cheapest meal we had in Vegas that weekend, and one of the better meals. Service was fast and friendly, and we will definitely be coming back in the future.

SYMwTyLF1CC84Tb4F2b9dA.text: this place rocked my socks off!! great food for a great price.  Open 24 hrs!!!  I was totally hammered and came here to eat and was sobering up by the time i left....Thanks grand lux   see you in august.

w8KgfjdEZNg2ceWZHE7HTA.text: Came for lunch and was unimpressed. Looked nice at first, until it took half an hour for any food to arrive. Strongly disapprove of the pricing too - $5.95 for a little wine glass of orange juice? Why don't you just go club a baby seal while you're at it.   I got the lunch salmon - grilled salmon served on a bed of mashed potatoes surrounded by some sad looking string beans. Not much to get excited about - everything was average except for price and how long it took to cook.

oDMreYBvNOzmpTxULzY7dQ.text: Grand Luxe's strategy seems to be to replace quality with portion sizes.  Everything here was mediocre.  Bread was dry and flavorless.  We shared a chicken pasta dish in a red sauce.  The pasta was surprisingly cooked to perfection.  Just to be overwhelmed by the sauce.  Oh, so close yet so far.  Shaking beef and caramel chicken combo was ok.  Chicken's taste was overwhelming and nothing special.  The beef was quite good but, in total contrast to everything else at this place, gave a tiny portion. My family loves this place so I will probably be back. Unfortunately.

1e7ktc9SwqvlZPz_w3_-Mw.text: this review is more for the to go part of the grand lux cafe (off to the side where the line starts.  great coffee and pastries are delicious.  my blueberry lemon curd pastry was a great way to start my morning.  the blueberries were sweet and looked like they were picked that morning.  they were way better than the pastries at the wynn coffee shop/cafe.  the tea selection is so-so, coffee is good. i was tempted to just sit down and eat at the cafe, since i do like the one in la, but i wasn't in any mood to wait any longer to eat.

Jgz2wLzQyl4awJ1uoCEmIA.text: This is your Denny's option if you have the alcohol induced munchies after a long night of foolery in the Venetian.   I have to give much props to the server who helped out the homey with a homemade cure all for a stomach ache.  I don't think it worked but how many servers would even try to lend a helping hand.  Portions are big so be prepared to be full or split with another person.

vRrDTIW9IFBO4cc3laazUw.text: I heard this cafe is a variation of the Cheesecake Factory. 15 people, we waited 15 minutes for a large table. Almost everyone had alcoholic drinks + steaks = $700. We waited 30 - 45 minutes for our food, which in this case was understandable, but we were famished. My sister and i shared the pasta with jumbo shrimp, it was spicy, but oh so good!!! the dessert menu was pretty small and unappealing to us.

V49bMLNfaHo5JAUIdQv_AA.text: I eat here so much because it's right there & has huge portions that I can save for later to eat. Take out portion are good too. I call in for take out cause sometimes there is a wait. I normally like the salmon piccata but lately the salmon is cover cooked. Dunno if they changed the chef or what but I haven't been happy.

9AV4apgKBEpawCbMn-xIfA.text: LOVE when good food is open late.  I came here after marquee, YEARNING for some food. The long wait for our food to come made me very very very very cranky. The bread they gave did not suffice.  But the sundried tomato penne def was worth that wait. It is very garlicky, so any vegas hookup should come BEFORE eating this. There was so much flavor that I left no morsel uneaten. I nibbled off everyone else's other dish (shrimp scampi, the sandwiches, the burgers, etc), and nothing compared to my dish. WIN!

_tcXDmCxodWK9uS2BxeQ_Q.text: Best burger I've ever had on the strip, server was super cool and its 24/7! What's not to love?

unNjMACSgivgpwC33L1SVg.text: In my opinion, this place is way too overhyped. Reminds me of a sad version of the Cheesecake Factory. Since my party was so large, gratuity was already included which probably explains the unenthusiastic service. The carbonara lacked flavor and my friends all agreed that it tasted like bland noodles. Not sure how this place has such a good yelp reputation, definitely not up to my standards!

YtnfZHjrYz4e3yNuzt4Wsg.text: I really enjoyed the chicken Flautas!! They were crispy and delicious!! The bartender was very nice, and served the whole menu at the bar. This was very helpful to me, as I was only able to stand due to an injury. I ordered more appetizers to go bc there were more choices than I could eat! Everything was delicious!!

Ch0JtmdmGTJFgvsoe_wtTA.text: Grand Luxe was such a dissapointment, wandered out at 11p and was starving stumbled into  this place with high hopes, ordered sirloin and it may as well been a a chew toy for my dog.  The steak was unedible it was tough and gross!  Ended up eating the mashed potatoes, sourdough and broccoli for dinner, then had nausea and burped all the way back to the room.  Not cool!

sVTP4ZFOzT5QJyhmzBBdKA.text: Been here a couple time.  Great food.   Huge portions.   Dirty silverware a couple time :(

_NWl_tPbB6dtt4St-laPGg.text: Many visits, First time disappointment  We eat at the Grand Lux at least once, every time we're in Las Vegas, (and we've been to the Grand Lux in Boca Raton several times as well). Pot roast was overcooked and tough. Red cabbage and garlic mashed potatoes (two favorites) are no longer offered. Baby back ribs were a little overcooked, and not especially tasty... also overpriced. They also did not keep up with the corn bread that is part of the ribs dinner... they ran out. Mixed review on the Salisbury Steak. One of our group liked it, and one did not.

0k2bUVl-CmY67H3MtDhgHA.text: The waiter was extremely friendly and the food was amazing.  The prices were very reasonable given that this is a vegas restaurant and the portions were large.

DE-2vd8hh5eu8DqL5WlCNA.text: If you are going with more than 2 people forget it... They just can't handle or understand it. We went 6 days in a row for breakfast and had 25 people they just didn't get it...they would not let us make reservation in advance and wanted us to wait for everyone to be there before they seated us.... It was like dealing with morons. There was a woman manager there one day and she got it but the guy manager was impossible.

_cBU6wauPcnEwT1tUJ95mQ.text: Variety of good, tasty food. Prices are a little high but that seems to be the norm on the Las Vegas Strip.  Service was okay. Waiter was kind of a downer. Although we were welcomed with a smile and as we were being seated, the other employees said hello and asked how we were.

pWuo2BACyakc96cBvE_L9A.text: Working at the Guggenheim for almost 5 years, I spent many lunches at the Grand Lux, along with getting lunches to go.   I could go on and on about the many great dishes they have there, but i will pick the one i liked the most, the pasta telephono.   This is its description on the menu "A Rich Tomato Sauce with a Dash of Cream and Melted Mozzarella Cheese. Baked and Topped with Toasted Bread Crumbs."   I really cant describe it's taste, other than its AWESOME!!!   Portions are nice sizes as well. A meal can be split between two "not so hungry" diners.   Service is ALWAYS GREAT!!!   This place is busy, a lot of the time, so it becomes pretty loud. I suggest if you're planning to try and work or hold a meeting, pick another spot.

QRXHEJd9pxGRRuIVfmSUtA.text: Food choice and selection was good.  The decor was nice.  I really wanted to like this place. However everyone at our table ordered burgers and needless to say everyone was sick by the end of the night.

uCwPa15025VPvJR0ZbhNGQ.text: Chicken piccata is awesome and beet goat cheese salad also. Loved their smoothies. Fast service.

5ndwAJCY2Ljn5sbp_AMwEw.text: Almost exactly like the cheesecake factory (sister co) except in Vegas on the strip. We ate here twice the last time we stayed at the Venetian. The food choices are excellent no matter when you go and they are open 24 hours, so perfect for that hangover cure.

ZKn_Gfki7T-US_tF0faOjA.text: Had the BBQ salmon and it was to die for.  Great place to eat when nothing sounds good because the selection is immense.

N2EeL2IVLWj--NZJzbwd2Q.text: This place is a better version of the Cheesecake Factory. The food is underwhelming, but the menu is extensive and the portions are ample. The food definitely tastes better at 3 am than at lunchtime. They have a decent brunch buffet with relatively short lines. The prices are high for what you get but pretty typical for vegas. All in all, it's a solid option for brunch, lunch or late night eating.

NgWPi045WdXasCWSl7dLtA.text: Great dinning in Las Vegas. Yes, its True its like a better version of the Cheesecake Factory, only you only have to wait 5 minutes for a table. I have had the Chicken Madiera, Pasta Cabonara and many other dishes here. The portions are very large and the food is wonderful.  I only wish I had room after eating the dinner to try dessert. I try and eat here everytime I come to Vegas, it really is that good.

xrEuzf5fZceGHG125fmp0A.text: Duck Potstickers - tasty, meaty with a great soy dipping sauce  Mini Chili Cheese Dogs - one of the best hot dogs you will eat, covered with chili, cheese, and a delicious mustard cream sauce; my favorite item!  Sloppy Joe - classic, delicious sauce, and great vegas drunk food  Short Rib Grilled Cheese - see: "joe, sloppy"  Southwestern Salad - if you really need a salad, you really can't beat this; word of warning, this is two meals, easy  Crispy Caramel Chicken - really nice asian inspired dish  Shaking Beef - really good riff on vietnamese shaking beef, with a really good sauce over rice  Indochine Chicken and Shrimp - second favorite dish; it has a really unique flavor that is slightly spicy, sweet and creamy all over rice, plus it has chicken and shrimp; try this one it is worth it  Chicken Salad Sandwich - available at the take-out counter/cafe located near the main entrance of the venetian grand lux.  Sooo, if you can't tell, I really like this place.  I go to Vegas more than is healthy (it's only February and I have already been 3 times, with my fourth trip next weekend).  A golden standard for decently priced, very tasty, and open really really late for post party food.  I love grand lux, especially their mini hot dogs and their surprisingly good renditions of asian inspired dishes.  One word of warning: the dishes are huge.... but you get leftovers for late night snacking or early hangover brunch (if you are like me, I don't like waking up until 2-3pm post party night).  Next time you are in vegas, try this place out, or if you are lucky, there is one in LA too.

RwuKr6EHN6-JVIjyLF4tVA.text: As many other reviewers have stated, this place bears a strong resemblance to Cheesecake Factory and is owned by the same company. I don't think the food here is quite as good though, but it does have the benefit of being open 24/7 so it was exactly what my party was looking for when we rolled in at 2 am in the morning. The late menu is a bit limited (two pages only). I got the Chili-Lime Chicken and Mango Salad which was sort of missing the Chili-Lime flavor part, but they substituted the romaine lettuce for spinach at no extra cost which was nice. I also wish there were more actual bits of chicken in my salad (they were so tiny and hard to find you almost had to squint at the dish to identify them.) I also tried my friend's Crispy Fried Wontons which had great Asian inspired flavors but were SOO salty. Personally I think the Cheesecake Factory is better. Great service though, they brought out a cute little desert for my friend who's birthday it was.

-sTfaiTIux-k4MaQigUYFw.text: Their breakfast buffet is nothing special, you can get this anywhere you go.  The typical hash browns, omelet, watery eggs, fruits, yogurt, cereal, make your own toasts, bacon, sausage...which also includes a beverage.  It was only around $15 for this or you could choose something from the menu which I did another day.  Their corned beef hash was the worst I could have possibly tasted, we were hoping it would taste the ones similar to Bellagio's room service or the one at The Cafe at TheHotel at Mandalay Bay.   We only came here because it is located in the Venetian Hotel where we had stayed.  I probably wouldn't go back, only if it were the last resort.

222gX5R0J-_e6Bv77D2y4Q.text: I have been to several Grand Luxe Cafe but the customer service experience was horrible. Based off of that alone, I will not be returning to this location.

jmqr1192inIrqSbJsCOaiA.text: I LOVE The Grand Lux Cafe. I think that it is, HANDS DOWN better than the Cheesecake Factory.   I didn't know there was a Grand Lux at this hotel but luckily my best friend spotted it on our way to our room.   Naturally, after driving to Vegas (we were only coming from Los Angeles) we were hungry and thrilled to had found a Grand Lux.  All the food was as delicious here as it is at the location in Los Angeles.  Our waiter was friendly. He didn't seem to have very much personalities, he seemed like one those waiters who wanted to keep the dignity of the place. The decor is as if its such a fancy place, and he acted as if he knew he worked for a GRAND establishment and he was keeping up the proper persona.
