Nevertheless, he was very friendly and listened properly to our order.  I'll be back Grand Lux, I love you!  (btw we ordered the same thing we always do - the breakfast sandwich)

Hm53mk2N8vjmYWt_WdUfGw.text: stumbling in at 3am being the only one in this palatial room being able to order any breakfast munchie known to man kind is way cooler than getting laid in vegas. on this particular sozzled night of mine, i happened to be craving maple syrup. i ended up ordering maple syrup with eggs, sausage, and hashbrown as sides. believe me, everything went into the syrup. ever dipped sausage into syrup? yeaa baby it's good. they were cool with that.  this place is gorgeous. quality of food here is exactly what you should expect from the Venetian. and it's not expensive. unless you're poor.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ZVzXItwIvirzzvnHJa_IYg.text: I went to Vegas with my husband a couple of years ago and we ate here. I had never had chicken and waffles before, and I don't know what compelled me to order it, but I did.  Since then, I have ordered chicken and waffles at countless other places. Nothing, NOTHING, comes even close to theirs. I dreamed that one day, we would cross paths again! When I finally found myself in Vegas again, the ONE thing I really wanted to do was go the the Grand Lux Cafe and eat chicken and waffles. Everyone who was with me on my second trip to vegas I have converted everyone to a chicken and waffle loving maniac.  My friends got huevos rancheros (amazing), pancakes (amazing), chilaquiles (amazing).  My only complaint about this place is that their cappuccinos are awful.

c2ZA5S9BRLcGtgNF4Y5Juw.text: I had no idea this place had ties with Cheesecake Factory. Our group came here two nights in a row simply because it was convenient, reasonably priced, and open 24 hours. Had their chicken and waffles during the first visit. The chicken was perfectly crisp and juicy; the perfect compliment to the light and fluffy waffle. I wish I had been able to finish it. For night number 2, I had developed a strange craving for soup. Had a generous bowl of the vegetable and loved it from the first bite to the last. Probably some of the best veggie soup I've had...ever. Might have been the alcohol talking, but I stand by my judgement. Will be in Vegas a few more times soon, so I'm keeping this place in mind if I need a late night fix.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken and waffle. NOM

o6FIcBgATEOAh6OhSXcDxw.text: We went for breakfast and it was really good! At first, we were just going to order off the menu instead of going to the small buffet, but when you add your beverages, the price is virtually the same. The buffet includes your drinks and an orange juice was $5.95 so we decided to go with the buffet. Small but mighty, it did not disappoint! Made to order omelettes, incredible waffles, a big selection of fresh fruit and pastries, and 3 different kinds of hearty breakfast meat! It was seriously so good for standard breakfast food! Yes it was slightly pricey but it was more than average and great service!

pxjp2EDmCLRvKcUJbOnH6A.text: Cheesecake factory-like restaurant.  I wouldn't say they have the best food, but it's good for what you pay for.  I would really give this more of a 3.5 star.    First time I was here, I wanted some comfort food that reminded me of home since we didn't check into the hotel till 2am!  I ordered their Zen Chicken Noodle Soup ( americanized version of pho).  Let me say, not good! The dish was presented nicely, with the soup coming out separately in a saucer, but I was very disappointed with the taste of it.  The chicken were all sliced chicken breast.  Ugh, I should've known better not the order noodle soup here.  I mean, some of their other Asian dishes are good, so I wanted to give it a try.  Nope, wrong!   However, the server recommended the crispy shrimp and chicken rolls, which tasted excellent!  It was hot and crispy, and had a side of a tangy sauce.    Recently came here again and we ordered he rolls again, along with an order of their oversized burger and 2 pastas.  Dinner was delish and cheap! Left as a happy camper and would most likely come back again if I was staying at the hotel.

fwIadJYySjODB5CBArqZzA.text: So far my favorite place I have eaten in Vegas. Cozy, casual, & clean environment with an eclectic menu. Grand Luxe offers a menu that is fresh & affordable that will even satisfy a wide range of tastes. The service has always been fast & efficient when I have dined here & I am looking forward to eating here later this week.

S2UMbagJE-51G90D3HT4ew.text: The service here are horrible if I could I would of give this place zero star.Avoid going here .

nWyHOw271DH40PudAcB8VQ.text: I've only tried one dish here, but it's the best I've had of its kind.   BEST CHICKEN & WAFFLES EVER!  I once ate this wonderful dish 5 times in one weekend. It's that good!

rvvg5LF1Tr631dA-_yoALQ.text: breakfast until 11am!   the lighting is so great and sexy that you never know what time it is. fits right in with the venetian mood lighting.   best breakfast any where in vegas.  service is awesome too

E4wKn-kGGZmNXb0dp1bPEA.text: DESIGNED JUST LIKE THE CHEESECAKE FACTORY! I had the club sandwich which was reallyy good & the boyfriend got the buffalo chicken sandwich, even BETTER than my meal! also great service!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. buffalo chicken sandwich
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. club sandwich

-R1AS3kyU2MMFjsF44g9IQ.text: Review for breakfast buffet and service only. Was not too impressed by the breakfast spread. For $18 I kind of expected a little bit more. The service was excellent, and refilled OJ and coffee quickly, so that helped. But, the food options at the buffet weren't labeled, and there were pretty minimal in the way of healthy options other than a fruit platter and some granola. I'd expect more when the hotels nearby have such lavish buffet options for breakfast.

ZSK0wRVRkBNwbE7X9caSPw.text: The service was a bit slow, hence the four stars.  However, the place is very impressive.  My friends and I walked a long way with one too many drinks in our system and needed food ASAP.  Luckily someone pointed us to this place and it was a delight.  I had the Veggie burger here and it was delish.  Other items ordered were the philly cheese steak bacon burger, which my friend gobbled down w/o the veggie trimmings of course), and a chicken parmsean.  I dont eat meat, but I've never seen a chicken breast that massive ever before.  It was huge!  My friend loved it but it could've easily been shared between 5 people.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Chicken Parmesean

DDMOFLZOnyv3-jUxuPf15A.text: We ate at the Grand Lux before seeing the Priscilla, Queen of the Desert show. It was excellent from start to finish. The decor is beautiful, the seating was a nice booth and we enjoyed the ambiance. We shared the mashed potato spring rolls and were pleasantly surprised by the size and quality of this appetizer. They are delicious, reasonably priced and plentiful. We then shared the roast turkey and brie sandwich...again, delicious and nicely sized. Also reasonably priced. The strawberry lemonade was a wonderful blend of what seemed to be real strawberry puree and good lemonade. We got more than enough to eat by sharing each dish and walked out spending less than $40, including 20% tip. All in all, a complete winner. We would happily eat there again.

SUm1AREF5mxAZ0fUqupuIA.text: Okay so my friends and I came here twice while we were staying at the Venetian the other weekend. The first time, I ordered an Asian salad and a Bloody Mary- both were amazing. Hence, the reason we came back the second time (not to mention that it was conveniently located at the bottom of our elevator when we were leaving the room). Anyways, the second time was a totally bust. We got wings and I'm a HUGE wing fan but these were literally the worst wings ever. I split them with my friend and we each ate one wing and were totally over it. All in all, good location but be careful about  what you order.

p1wUAAXxK1On2I7Zak0G3Q.text: We got seated right away for breakfast.  I love the Grand Lux in Chicago, and this one is just as good.

nsA6zXteTeqQBceXxTLGUA.text: 2.5 Stars...I have been a fan of The Grand Lux Cafe for many, many years (15+ actually) and my most recent visit was a bit disappointing.  The food and wait staff remains good as ever, but the management was what let me down.  We were in town over the weekend for our annual basketball tournament and our team of families are very close knit which means dining together and having fun.  I called in advance to make a reservation for a large party of 35 (their website states that they do take them) but I was told that due to the day and time which was a Saturday morning 11:30am and peak time for them (according to the mgr) they could not and would not accept reservations.  We chose to walk-in together, but each family got their own tables.  Keep in mind all thirty five of us walked in together giving our names and party number one right after another.  They seated us sporadically so we were far apart from each other, not fun.  What I was upset about was clearly seeing two areas that were completely empty and could have easily accommodated us.  If a restaurant has a 550 seat capacity, how difficult would it be to put 35 people together especially when there is clearly room available?  Due to this, I have decided that we will dine at other establishments as a team (see my Nora's Italian Cuisine review) when we return for our yearly tournaments.  There are plenty of restaurants who can accommodate us.

3gSznTDrtQt32lPmyHFRCA.text: For a late night cafe, this place is ridiculously excellent and reasonably priced for the amount of food portions they give you!!!   Located inside the Venetian, this cafe was surprisingly filled at 3AM!!! I had a party of 8-10 and we were seated promptly from what I remember.  Every time we make trips to Vegas, we certainly make sure to stop in and have a bite to eat.   Tasty & affordable, can't get better than that...

IZt1A-_ZNEIPuiPV7aAKSA.text: There's 2 Grand Lux Cafe's - SO CONFUSING!  (Venetian and Palazzo)  Confusion when our two groups claimed to be at Grand Lux yet we couldn't find eachother.  *heh...  I love dining at Grand Lux.  Breakfast - Lunch - Dinner - Late Night  It's VERY affordable and they give you generous portions.  Service is always excellent and the place is huge (the one in Venetian anyways) so there's never a long wait in line.    They have a breakfast buffet (but it ends earlier than I'm usually awake.. like 11am?) and a hefty selection of lunch/dinner dishes you can order anytime.  The food isn't anything spectacular but it's yummy and you can't beat the price and amount of food!  (Their french fries r yummy...and they give u a heaping plate full of them :D)  HIghly recommend.  I LOVE VENETIAN DINING x 2!

4hnYBPFOOUg3UpzgcpNnOA.text: Starving for some breakfast, we came here instead of Canyon Ranch Cafe because there was no wait.  I'm not sure which is better, but the food here was amazing, so I think we made a good choice.  Atmosphere:  Beautiful cafe in the Venetian hotel, we sat in the outside patio area and people watched while we ate.  The customers are the usual eclectic Vegas mix of business people,  groups of friends, and couples.  We enjoyed watching people hurry by with rolling suitcases while others are wearing shorts and t-shirts while drinking beers and giant margaritas.  Service:  Quick, attentive, and on point.  We got our food quickly and our waters were refilled often.    Food: Huevos Rancheros:  I'd say this is the best I've had, it was flavorful, tasty, and the portion size was huge!  The eggs were cooked perfectly and the potatoes were seasoned so well.    I can't remember what my bf got, but it was a vegetable omelette of some sort, he liked it, but liked mine better I think.    Overall:  Huevos Rancheros are great here.

QtB5-rcdbOpJwD4YhwyY9g.text: I love this place, Venetian is our home away from home and we eat at the Grand Lux Cafe every time we come, can not say enough about it, we tried so many things on different occasion and it always very good and always plenty on the plates..  Prefer the Venetian's to the Palazzo's.. Yummy food and great service...

SlAmfT4vNSSNfjZClW1Anw.text: This was a hard review to write. My fiance rated it a  4 and I rated it a 3. The food was good but not out of this world. The service was decent but our food took a little longer than expected. I had the chophouse burger. Although this burger was good, it was not extraordinary. My fiance had the fish and chips. This was the better of the two meals by far. She also had a top shelf margarita for $13. It was loaded with ice. I know it's Vegas but come on right $13 drink!

zy6OJS25fs6LQCmpAa0zUQ.text: Nice breakfast buffet. Had the buffet every morning. Friendly staff. The orange juice was terrific!

56mVywcA5plfdzsJ6d5IXg.text: This place is great! The food and prices are really good and the service is incredible. The menu is huge and everything we tasted was delicious. The breakfast buffet is also very good. Don't be scared of the long line because service is very fast, so the wait is short.

Jla_TNn7iKawPBmklJXjJQ.text: On a recent trip to Vegas, we stayed at the Venetian, and my family member, who has limited mobility, couldn't walk the ten miles around the casino to all of the 37 restaurants that it has to offer. The Grand Lux is practically right at the bottom of the elevators from where we were. Both nights we stayed, we got takeout food from them and both nights, we were wowed by the quality, taste and presentation of our dinners. Portions were on the big side, and everything was extremely tasty and quickly prepared. It says that it's from the creators of The Cheesecake Factory, and that would give you a good idea of the quality of food you're getting here. A tad on the pricey side, but worth it.

T30HtIFqJ780wLWt4_lCxg.text: There is nothing worse than having to line up for breakfast. You then sit down and the fruit plates are hot the server was abrupt and rude. This is way below what I want first thing in the morning.

4IisMg7vLDsbmA9wM9mFnA.text: Not bad at all!  Portions were big, food tasty, prices were really reasonable, server was REALLY NICE (not the intrusive,fake, yapping too much type nice either) and he was easy on the eyes.  cons: they really need to clean their floors

LadOHtGZuTQMBDLaDIF6iw.text: There are two of these places.  There is one Grand Lux in the Venetian, and one Grand Lux in the Palazzo. And since those are technically different hotels, they are also both in one great big building. So it's easy to go to the wrong one. The food was good as was the service. They do an odd thing with their syrup. They pre-mix it with melted butter. So you end up with a weird liquid that may not be the ratio of syrup and butter that you prefer. Other than that everyone enjoyed their brunch.

95ZDdXgkSZAV1jcvRSqz4A.text: Good service but terrible food experience ...... We ordered the turkey burger, shrimp spring rolls, plan waffle with butter and syrup, and chicken tenders and French fries.... We sent back everything but the chicken tenders and French fries (and that was off the kids menu)!!!!!! The waffle was over cooked, the vegi burger was gross and the shrimp wasn't cooked in the spring rolls! And at the end we asked the serve where to go to get the good food she said Omgoodness what did you order? We told her and she said "yea those are bad choice" at least she was honest and knew what we ordered was disgusting!!

i3Svy6814R6nMqkRzfviiw.text: I don't recommend this place to anyone. Me and my friends came here because it was one of the the only restaurants that open for 24 hours. I had crispy caramel chicken. Unfortunately, it was poor quality. The staff was friendly; however, it wasn't worth it.

V-4HfNVj0RQnwS_Uv-U74g.text: Our group ate here are three different occassions from the same weekend trip and although it was only great two out of three times, I still loved this restaurant enough to give it five stars. Let me tell you, the service has a lot to do with it.   First trip was during a late dinner after arriving at the Venetian. Menu was HUGE, as in Cheesecake Factory-esque HUGE. My fab buddies shared their Asian nachos which we all swooned over. My shrinking beef was a bit of a disappointment in that it was mostly onions and green onions rather than beef. What saved this dinner for me was our server Julian. Even through the drunken antics of the guys, he was gracious and continued to serve our party extremely well.  Word of advice: Skip the "breakfast buffet" Totally not worth the $16-something price on it. Not enough selections and the quality was mediocre at best. I was really disappointed with it. Just order from the regular breakfast menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrinking Beef

jzPqiv5JxNLjVhJB7sJCKg.text: Reading some fellow Yelp reviews I persuaded myself to check out the Grand Lux Cafe since I was visiting Las Vegas for a week and staying at the Venetian. I ended up coming here for food time and time again.   I drive past the location at the Beverly Center all the time and never once thought about going to eat here. Well, I dove in and was pleasantly shocked. The food was all delicious from the appetizers and full meals I ordered along with all my guests. We loved it so much we came back twice more during the week.   The place is open 24 hours, always has cute hostess (no servers I found), has reasonable prices for Vegas Casino inflation, and has huge portions. The bread they bring your table isn't shabby either and one thing is guaranteed that you will walk out of here feeling like you just tackled every item at a Vegas Buffet.   The concept here is to put you on the brink of a food coma so you plant yourself at a roulette game after eating and you just play for hours because you cannot move.   The only thing that stopped this place from going 5 star is the slow service. The place is always busy so if your in a hurry to dine then steer somewhere else. If you have a minute to kick back and recycle some energy then this is your place.

HqkykY5MytOzKdc61N9ldg.text: This is basically the Vegas version of Cheesecake Factory, and I'm not complaining!  ATMOSPHERE It looks just like a Cheesecake Factory-- elegant and beautiful. There seems to be a more regal air to it though since it is in Vegas.  There is ample seating and I love the high ceilings. It made it seem like it was an even bigger restaurant than it already was.  FOOD The food was delicious. I ordered the SHRIMP SCAMPI WITH ANGEL HAIR PASTA, which was way more than enough for 2 people.  That's the great thing about this place: the portions are HUGE so you can easily split food amongst you and your friends.  I expected the dish to be very salty, but it was actually cooked perfectly! The shrimp was plump, succulent, and had a little crispiness to it that was unexpected but tasty. The sauce was divine and the diced tomatoes complemented the dish perfectly. The pasta was cooked just right and balanced the dish's flavors.  I would definitely come back again because: a) It's convenient (located in the Venetian) b) They serve tasty and high quality dishes c) They are generous with portions!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. shrimp scampi with angel hair pasta

xue8K17UlgZggSajHCjI7g.text: Grand Lux Cafe is my go-to place if I have guests in town or when I'm hungry and on the Strip.  They have great prices, quality and portions.   My favorite things to order:  Drink-Peach Bellini, light and refreshing!  Appetizer-Calimari is well-seasoned, not rubbery like most places!  Entree- Chicken piccata, perfection!  Dessert-Chocolate chip cookies, freshly baked, you must order at the start of your meal!

2P0evU33sMIQFJGkti95Wg.text: I could have eaten breakfast every day at the Grand Lux!  Breakfast is served until 11am, so make sure you get there before that.  They are a bit flexible (which is good when you are up until 5am) so we tend to roll in at 10:45 or so.    I highly, highly recommend their Brioche French Toast, I think I almost passed out at the table from ecstasy.  I get the French toast with sauteed bananas and pecans, however I suggest the caramel sauce on the side because it is SUPER sweet.  It is a huge portion and could be split easily with another person.    Their breakfast menu is pretty reasonable being anywhere from $9-$12 for a sit down breakfast and their buffet being $16.50.    Drop in here for a good morning after full belly, you wont regret it.  It is located in the Venetian right near the Phantom Theater.

XknMWuIXEVC79WEHQGRMvw.text: There is a lot of reasons why this place is a 5 but Ill give you the big ones 1) Its open 24/7  2) Biggest menu I know of 3) Food quality is always consistent  Even at 3am  App Jalapeno cornbread   Main Sunday night pasta   Dess  Warm sticky bun bread pudding  Best 24 hour spot in Vegas

0x3bhtiO9P2cB7Ei08KMPg.text: Love this place!  We visit Las Vegas twice a year and always include a visit to the Grand Lux. Have never had anything but an excellent meal.  I now must eat gluten-free and they accommodate me very well.

Jg89LAHrKy3b2GsNq-RgKg.text: Love, love, LOVE this place. Great waiters, nice place to eat, and AMAZING food.   Recommendations for the Venetian location: Calamari: to this day, still hands down the best calamari I've ever had.  Spaghettini + Clams dish: really really good! Simple ingredients, amazing flavor.  Vegetable Pizza: yummy yummy in my tummy!  Only "Con" They don't serve the molten chocolate cake here!   CHOICE: Venetian or Palazzo? The Palazzo location has a better dessert selection, but the overall food quality and portions are better at the Venetian. Go to the Venetian unless you desperately need to have that molten chocolate cake :)

H5RASQPCiYfvZ6Qr8vzgEA.text: I have to say that this was by the far the most reasonable cafe to have breakfast, lunch and dinner within budget and leaves you pretty damn full and satisfied. The boss and I went here for lunch finally without feeling rushed and having to washed down everything within 5 min. and run back to the booth and hopes it digest! We made the effort to get replacements so that we can finally have a civilized sit down lunch for once!   We sat next to this sweet elder couple who was enjoying their lunch. I was sold when I saw what the man was eating. A bowl of chili with this scrumptious corn bread and I just had to have it! I wanted the chilis but wasn't sure how that was going to sit in my stomach for the next 6+ hours so decided not to get that. Instead, went for this shaky beef and I swear they had chopped down every scallions in the fridge because my plate was loaded with scallions and onions. Let's just say that after lunch, I was literally brushing my teeth and tongue with altoids.   But OMG, the cornbread was divine! It was so moist, it was like eating a moist sweet yellow cake with corn kernels. It was so moist, that it had to be eaten with a spoon because it kept falling off my hands. But it was the best cornbead i've ever eaten.   The service was decent, the environment was very similar to the cheesecake factory except it's not a chain restaurant? Er, at least I don't think it is.   Another reason I find it endearing is because when I got up to use the restroom, the nice elderly couple asked my boss if I was her daughter. My boss said no but sometimes she has to play the role of a mommy to me. Well, the lady complimented me and said that I was very pretty. *Blushed*

3Ngcj3f34ueBbyrnJvtlVw.text: I eat here everytime I come to Vegas.  It's reliable.  I know the food, the service & the drinks will be good.  I haven't tried something on the menu that I haven't liked.    I especially like the Lemon Chicken Picatta, the Mongolian Beef or the Miso Glazed Salmon.    Portions are big like Cheesecake Factory.

G-nz_stT5J8NPxrAH4vBnw.text: Hotel Cafes were once the place you could get the *** $7.77 Steak and Lobster special *** "after Midnight till 3 A.M in many casinos.  The cafes were decorated with cheesy looking palm trees and cheerful wall decor. The casino Cafes have certainly evolved since then.  After 130 reviews for the Grand Lux, I can only add that I think this is one of the finest Casino/Hotel cafes in Las Vegas.  The Venetian goes the extra mile to ensure that this dining experience is as good as any other in the hotel - even though the price is much less than some of their gourmet facilities. The service is excellent. I had to wait on a second draft beer for a while - and the manager brought another to me " on the house." "We apologize for the wait" ......Excellent treatment   Supurb food........  Supurb service We had the Southwest salad - of monster proportion, along with the BBQ sandwich. More than all we could eat. Nice "people watching" views from the "indoor patio" area.  Once again - you get what you pay for ..... it is not gourmet ...... but it is well worth the stop.  Grand Lux  Cafe ........ it is grand

KwCIcTX7kpgyHHXgiykhEQ.text: Open 24 hours in the Venetian.  Good food for a 24 hour joint.  Better than I expected.  Wouldn't even give a second thought to eating here again.

xwtwQeUQdTxAv0zcW0rCFg.text: Great food and I believe is a little better than Cheesecake Factory where I live locally. Breakfast and lunch prices are worth it. I had a breakfast plate for $6 that came with ham, eggs, toast, fruit, some butter. It kept me full until lunch around 2pm and I had their Miso Salmon for $11 and it was well worth it. I had to stuff myself just to finish it. They gave me two half slices of salmon which was tender but a little dry with stir fried vegetables, mixed rice with some teriyaki soy sauce drizzled over it. Sounds simple but it sure was better than the Miso Salmon at Cheesecake Factory and definately worth it for half the price.  The decor is more upscale and matches the Venetian but less gaudy. Don't expect peace and quiet since it is loud as a cafeteria. The wait was not bad either compared to Cheesecake.

-DUkVkk-t4kJdyKPubmZww.text: This place rules the LV post club food scene.  Yes, its basically the cheesecake factory, but are you really bitching right now?   The menu is longer than most novels.     I thought not.

zxcg7Iug8F2g7fpsD-w7RA.text: This place has really gone downhill since my last visit. Gone are cheesesteak spring rolls. Whose bright idea was that?  It was probably the same person that had a woman's 3 point contest on instead of the Masters. I will no longer dine at this communist establishment.

CVdxAVovI1lK6qTDmOowsQ.text: They say this place was created by the makers of the Cheesecake Factory. My biggest complaint about Cheesecake Factory is how damn touristy it is. It's nearly impossible to have a peaceful, easy lunch there without the place being ridiculously busy and having to wait an hour. But what if there was a place with Cheesecake Factory food, minus the hoards of tourists??   Lo and behold, that is Grand Lux Cafe. It really is too bad it's in Vegas and I only frequent that town about every other year. The food was delicious, and arrived quickly. We had good service, even though we sat in the bar. It absolutely reminded me of Cheesecake Factory in the menu options and flavors. The only sad thing was that I wasn't able to eat all my pasta and I wasted it, since we left the next morning.   Okay, okay, I'll admit it, we visited this place after midnight and a bottle of wine. But honestly--it's really good. I'm sure it wasn't just the wine.

luDSTbV02QbZNxF8gdSDoQ.text: Grand Lux is a great alternative to the glutinous buffets and expensive fine-dining.  I love that it's open late...perfect for those post-clubbing meals. I've been here a few times and have had the fusilli pasta, the fish and chips, but the most recent discovery here is the CHICKEN AND WAFFLES.   I've never had chicken and waffles from other places so I have nothing to compare it to but it was SO GOOD here! The chicken  is similar to chicken strips and are placed over a waffle. The best thing about it is the maple-butter syrup. OMG it must be so bad for you (what isn't here?) but it is so freakin good. I never would have thought sweet, syrupy chicken would taste so good with a waffle.   The breakfast cocktails were also very good. Peach bellini, mimosa, and a pomegranate cocktail. They were on the sweeter side, which I like, but might not have enough booze for some.   Although it's not a buffet, it is definitely a place to get your feast on. Portions are HUGE and I feel like they can actually serve 2. Prices are very reasonable (This place is from the founders of The Cheesecake Factory) for Vegas.   On my next Vegas trip, I'm definitely coming back for the chicken and waffles. YUMMY!!

-oLHYJ5m_szWHkWVhWk3zQ.text: I've been here several times and all the food is amazing.  Some of my favorites are the Brioche French toast, Eggs benedict, Crab & asparagus omelette, egg white omelette, or Joe's special for breakfast or brunch.  You can't have breakfast or brunch without one of their mimosa's or spicy bloody mary's...  YUM!  I also like the lemon chicken picata or miso glazed salmon for dinner.  For dessert they have delicious HOT chocolate chip cookies.  They are made fresh to order.  I'm sure whatever you order is going to be wonderful.  I have never been disappointed.

mTEi3j_GkVei9POpuc8bLA.text: Can't add much that the 19 other reviews didn't touch on. I just want to add my 4 stars to the mix.  We like it because it is a Cheesecake factory clone. The quality is good, the quantity is generous (can't doggy bag in Vegas-can you?) We eat here at least once during Vegas visits and the fact that it's in The Venetian, one of our favorite hotel/casinos, makes the trip quite enjoyable.

uo9hIjerHThLoscsJ94msA.text: Delish! just like the one in LA. So much stuff to try on the menu. All tempting, all rather exceptional. The dessert selections alone is worth a separate special visit.  Fun part: located in Venetian Casino Hotel Resort. Open 24hrs. Great news for when you might get arm cramp from yanking those slot machines too long.

fsOO2kWGlNL1rOMksxIcZw.text: The food here is very good and the portions are very big. If you are with your girlfriends, you can share two dishes to three girls. This place reminds me of a cheesecake factory but more fancy. The prices are very affordable for the portions you get! However, if you have a big group, make sure to call for reservations so that you don't have to wait. We went here this past weekend with a group of 13 girls and there was no wait at all!

YftUs3mK4NjhHlPka8j-1g.text: This place is just like Cheesecake factory, except Cheesecake factory is way better.  I came here during lunch with my girlfriends. I ordered the Chinese Chicken Salad, A burger and some pasta. nothing stood out to me. I think this place sucks during their normal business hours but their late night menu is way better. I would only eat here from now on only if its during late night, preferably after a night of clubbing. My friend ordered the Portobello burger. it was so good and juicy. I cant remember too much of it because I was drunk. I'm sure it wasn't my drunk tastebuds but everyone else took a bite of it and thought it was pretty good. but then again all my friends were drunk when we had it. I don't know if that even counts. =/  I had their Omelet too. actually it was a leftover but I had it when i was sober and it was pretty good. but yeah, as I mentioned earlier, I would only come here for  super late night since it is 24 hour. other than that, No.

JDv488qG7EyFL8X9cSWeIg.text: I ate here with some friends right before taking off for the airport.  The portion sizes were huge for the price.  The service was a little too slow for us, then again we were in a hurry to make our flight.

PZCf-9tffocJ9i94RZlcyA.text: Yummy Pasta Telephono! Huge menu, so many choices! Lots of leftovers! It came with a "small" side salad....their small is the large size salad at most restaurants lol. They took pretty good care of my large group. This place was suggested by my Aunt, so glad we went! Will definitely visit again!

X6h1DpfdWZwa_RKklUSYOQ.text: Ok here is the low down. When your in Vegas you going to end up spending some money. This place is the best place to eat that will not break the bank. The best part is everything you order is top notch. You have to try the rib and chicken combo BBQ. You can order anything here and it just taste great. We go here almost every time we are in Vegas b/c we save so much money and the product is better than 90% of the restaurants out there. Eat here!!!!!

k-odliEVD6GH4-b3N6J-eQ.text: I had not heard of the Grand Lux before my first visit.  I was not disappointed.  I had the best Patty Melt and fries I've ever had.  Hot and crispy, juicy and cheesy.  Yum.    If sex were a food item, I now know what it is.  The Creme Brulee was awesome.  They give you both Vanilla and Chocolate.  Crispy, opening up to cool creamyness.    I will definately go back to try other items on the huge menu.  You may call me a man-whore, but that Creme-Brulee is mine everytime!

JF8yj4HRAFQFLFVJH1f-Bg.text: Brian the bartender was the bomb! Mango margarita was the shit! Turkey club was very good. My experience was great!

8gNYwhfZaW97WoeDtSPLRQ.text: The Grand Lux is a great place to eat if you just can't manage to head down the strip for a steak and eggs special.  There's always a wait to eat here even if it's 3am.  The food is good.  The prices are high, but you do get a lot of food.  Mixed opinions about the staff.  One time I was here the waiter was a real ass.  But other than that, I've had good experiences.  If you can't find something on the menu that looks good to you, ask the waiter for something that you'd like to eat.  Sometimes they'll have it.

TXGjkWYvHO0Ftcahql1ZJA.text: Not a fan of Cheesecake Factory. The menu is too big and the food is so so. Sometimes it's not good at all. Went to Grand Luxe at the Venetian last night. As I sat there I told my sister this feels like Cheesecake Factory. I saw someone's to go box and I knew it was Cheesecake Factory. I got online and sure enough they are the same restaurant. We had a nice dinner. The food was good we took half of it home. If you do not like cheesecake factory you may not like this place. I do think it's better than cheesecake factory.

-DKnia78O8dxP5insHHWvw.text: One of our favorite places to eat.  Asian nachos are the bomb.  Personal favorite is the chicken and waffles.  Dropped it a star because the seafood wasn't up to par for Vegas food.

L1qtRiJlwb8sT6EVsVKn2g.text: Had breakfast alone because my husband was still asleep. I had the Eggs Benedict and you would think that a restaurant that charge you $40 for breakfast would know how to lpoch eggs. I sent it back because they were almost hard boiled, The manager came over and was very apologetic and they gave me the same hard boiled eggs the second time. I was hungry and just ate them, but come on!! The waitress offered to give me dessert to take back to my room, but what am I going to do with that? They should have taken the dish off my bill.

K-Y4GUXcjMhWWh-3oHn3VA.text: The Cheesecake Factory's sister restaurant with an extensive menu of well-priced, well-portioned international items, located near the casino area in The Venetian, Vegas. Open 24/7, this place has something for everyone with Signature items for breakfast, brunch/lunch and dinner to tapas, espresso, dessert, cocktails and late night snacks.  Coffee = Amazing. Highly recommend! It definitely makes my Top 3 for best coffee I've ever had. I take my coffee black, but this coffee was so delicious and flavourful that my girlfriends did as well. Defs worth a try!  We strolled in around 5:20AM and shared the Vietnamese Chicken Summer Rolls (4 big rolls for $12) - a good healthier option of the late-night options.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vietnamese Summer Rice Rolls, $12 for 4 rolls
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Soup du jour, $6

UY9Djtyl9omA2_IjLf3Txg.text: This place was AMAZING!!!  Three of us stopped in to have dinner and all three meals were really good.  I had the Beef Wellington which consisted of 4 nice sized filet medallions with pastry tops, carrots, yummy Brussels sprouts, and whipped potatoes.  I don't normally prefer Brussels sprouts, but these were fantastic.  Our waitress was very good, and we were seating immediately.  It was around 7:30, so I assumed there would be a wait.   The food was reasonably priced in general.  Compared to other places we ate during the week, the prices were low and the food here was MUCH better than what I've had so far.  I'm hoping to make it back once more before we leave.  This is now going to be one of my "must haves" when visiting, and I will highly recommend it to friends traveling to Las Vegas.

I55qS7kZyJUraI5hgDkIRA.text: Grand Lux is a Cheesecake with a fancier name, but when my family wanted to sit down and get breakfast on our way out of the Venetian, the place was right there.  This Grand Lux probably gets more business than the one we have back home in the Beverly Center, but it is more or less the same.  The ambiance and service are pleasant and uninteresting, and the food is unmemorable.  I do take issue with there being no bathroom within the restaurant.  The space is huge, and I fail to see why you have to go into the casino to take a leak.  The good thing about Grand Lux is that the menu is varied to suit all tastes, including very young ones.  We split chicken and waffles, strawberry French toast, and pastrami hash and eggs.  Nothing stood out, and the waffles and French toast probably tended towards bad, but everything was edible.  Grand Lux is nowhere to go out of your way for, but if you're hungry and it falls in your path, there's nothing to avoid at all costs either.

k4O_K4NwABoytC16ir92DQ.text: Amazing! We had the breakfast buffet. There isn't a huge selection of food but what they have out taste terrific. We did some quick math and it would've been twice as expensive to order those things individually. The wife moved the fresh squeezed orange juice. And for me free refills on the milk was a great bonus.

jPxG3_TajexmIHoWeoeC-w.text: This is for the G.L located inside the Venietian. I have eaten here at least 50 times and have never had a bad meal,or service. I always ask to be seated out in the antriem its alittle more airy,and great for people watching.  First of all the waiter/ess will put down some warm bread with dipping oil. This itself may fill you up.    Quite often I order the baked salmon,it comes with a small portion of garlic potatoes,and green beans. I also enjoy their hamburgers as well as the sloppy joe's.   All in all I believe you will allways get a good dinner at a reasonable price.

FOh-k531VY9R59FHMWMt5g.text: Hunger struck around 5p.m. in the afternoon. Had to sneak out of the pool to grab something to eat and I came upon Grand Lux Cafe. I was excited to try the place after seeing the raving reviews on yelp.   Unfortunately, I think I might have came at an off time. Service was unfortunately awful. I waited for my waiter for at least 20 minutes before he came by and asked if I wanted anything to drink. He was entertaining a big group sitting next to me. I asked if another waiter can take my order since I was hungry, but she insisted that I wait for my waiter.   My waiter finally came by and took my order. I ordered Polynesian Salad. It was delicious and large! I liked the flavors of the ingredients in the salad--mango, cucumber, grilled chicken with sprinkling of apricot-pineapple dressing.   After I finished my salad, I noticed that my waiter did not delivered my complimentary bread that I saw on every tables. I was disappointed to see and experience such bad service here because I really enjoyed the food here.   I would come back here for the food, but I really hope that they improved their service next time I am here.   Plus, they are opened 24 hours, perfect for those late night hungers!!

6BFBgX6fP9fcKg90AOnoWg.text: I had heard such great things about this chain. My fried pickles were amazing. The rest just okay. The service was terrible and considering it was early afternoon on a Sunday, not busy At all... it took forty minutes to get my burger.

ZfWIg7ZKdVV3SJm2n9mj7Q.text: Food amazing had a Moscow mule service top notch.  The pork chop was amazing and the overall feel of the place was nice considering it was inside a casino.  My family tried a couple of appetizers and the nacho's were awesome.

risjUt8sPo9VrEG6EeZsSA.text: This is basically a 24-hour Cheesecake Factory, but better, by virtue of it being IN THE VENETIAN.  We kicked off our Vegas trip here, after arriving around 11. Definitely started the trip off right with some surprisingly tasty cocktails - the Pineapple Smash was so awesomely summer, and the Shoot The Moon beer cocktail was really great as well.   For food, the waiter accidentally brought me the Spicy Buffalo Chicken Sandwich, instead of the Spicy Flat Bread Chicken Sandwich I ordered. BUT IT'S OKAY, because he apologized profusely and gave us a complimentary dessert at the end. The buffalo chicken sando itself was spicy and friend and huge and perfect, and I am certainly glad about his mistake. I also tried my friend's kobe burger and it was really, REALLY tasty. One note, though: don't come here when you're counting calories.  For (free!) dessert, the waiter brought out a Warm Butter Cake, which was, frankly, THE BEST. It tasted sort of like a waffle not in a waffley shape, and the ice cream and strawberries just really completed it.  Overall, definitely an choice place for some late night dining, if you can excuse having deja vu of your local Cheesecake Factory.

TyxCpTK5W1Bg78fqQ58yPg.text: Put me in Grand Lux Cafe or a Cheesecake Factory location and slight decor differences aside, they are pretty much identical. Whether it's the atmosphere, the decor, the staff and the menu, these two are pretty much identical.   It's weird too, because as I entered the Venetian and was seeking for a place to eat that was affordable and quick (I had to head to the Blue Man Group show and only had one hour to eat), everyone told me that this Cheesecake Factory-like restaurant was around the corner. When they said that it was similar, I had no idea what I was in for and how much of a clone it really was. Stunning but neat.  So we proceeded to walk in and get seated and a very friendly waiter took care of us. We ordered some stiff drinks, 2 Scotchs, on the rocks. Then while my grandfather 'carbed up' with a clam pasta dish, I went for one of their big salads; in this case it was their Chopped salad - grilled chicken, bacon, tomatoes, blue cheese, avocado, egg and mixed greens. The whole thing was tossed in a vinaigrette.   The food came out from the kitchen in under fifteen minutes. The clam pasta dish according to my grandfather was very tasty and the clams very fresh. The salad was large and despite my best attempts, I could not finish it. The dressing complimented the rest of the ingredients well and I didn't feel heavy from eating it. The service was great and the prices were great as well.  Overall this place is a nice addition to the Venetian. It provides reasonably good food at good prices and with good service. It's reliable and their menu is varied enough to satisfy all kinds of appetite. I didn't however find it to be as good as any Cheesecake Factory location I've been to. It's less tacky though which is a good thing.

wXQGYK3f0NQS_2hhaddTdA.text: Not bad for what it is. We had to wait a long time for a server tho. The food is good, I would come back again, the reason I gave it 3 star is for a long wait time, and it wasn't even busy.

9arILx_E0EQv_T6siezXQw.text: Great place sure its bought by cheese cake but taste isn't anything like cheese cake. It taste even much better.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wow
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-bHHdiSxdViHvJdjx7UZTg.text: Staying at the adjacent Palazzo and getting hungry at around 2 am, our group ended up going to this cafe for a late night dinner. Food was great, salads were exceptionally good. Highly recommend this place since they are open 24/7 and they have great food / salads and appetizer selections. As the other people also mentioned, this is a solid restaurant with variety of foods. Wait time can get long as this seems to be a very popular place for brunch and breakfast in the morning.

yCeQDZ4Wua9iEBAc12gGmA.text: Really good sandwiches & service That is all we ordered so I'm not sure about the rest of the menu.  I would assume that everything is just as good.

vQXGWqKwjIjNGkDW2RYjXQ.text: Wow. On par or better than most acclaimed 5 star restaurants in Las Vegas.  Worth every dollar, something you can't say about most restaurants in LV. Everything we ate was top notch and very tasty..chicken& waffles, Buffalo chicken burger, Almond crusted fish on a bed of delicious mashed potatoes , Chicken pot pie. Even the latte is much better than what you get from Starbucks. Highly recommended. They have two inside the venetian&palazzao and both are incredible.

shOdVbNps-mdedGliz4RfA.text: Ate here for my cousin's birthday since we were staying at the Venetian. There was ahi tuna on the menu and of course, I ordered it. I wanted to get something light because we were gonna head out to Tao afterwards. It was pretty good but I've had better. I couldn't really taste the meat of the tuna. My friends ordered pasta and they were pretty satisfied afterwards so I'm guessing it was good. That's all I really can say about the food...  The place is really nice and it reminded me of CheeseCake Factory and to my surprise, I guess they're sister companies so yea.. and the service was good. Our waitress was really nice and our food came out pretty fast.  Just watch out for the floors if you're wearing heels.. it's slippery!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ECrZDN5jzsAO6r3Dq8wNBQ.text: oh god this place is heaven. i really like coming here because its open 24 7 and they have amazing food here. alot of people love the chicken and waffles but they also have amazing appetizers to choose from also and they  are all big portions and pretty bomb. last time i came here i had the chop steak with 3 different mushrooms including shitake as one of them kinds. it was amazing and tasteful and soo delicious for only 13 bucks with mash too.... i also had their vegam or vegeterian burger which wasnt too great i think the texture and the taste was kind of bland so dont recommend that. but most popular is chicken and waffles and their appetizers is what i hear people ordering around me. the drink prices in here are high so i would save it while im gambling i order there and tip the cocktail waitresses a dollar.   service here is always on point and professional. the setting inside is casual and dark. and is inside the casino in a corner. the prices here are not that high but its definitely  worth the price  because of the huge portions they serve. and great presentation too.

IWDYL78ap69j0QY3szpYWg.text: I give this place 4 stars cuz they cater to customers at anytime of the day and night.  After a hard night of drinking and clubbing, they will take your order for either breakfast, lunch or dinner at anytime.  You want to take it with you to your room, go ahead.  Myself I had breakfast at 5 in the morning...it was good don't get me wrong.  Probably not the appropriate thing to be eatting after vomiting due to alcohol poisoning.  It was good though.  Sunnyside up eggs, hashbrowns, gourmet style...  The last day in Vegas we ate here.  i ordered Chicken fingers.  Now you would think 3 strips of chicken.  Lets try pieces with veggies and mashed potatoes.  No I didn't finsh it, I shared.  other dishes my friends tried was linguini with mussels (funny picture for this dish of me and my friend sharing a string of linguine) in a white wine sauce, flautas, and steak.

MKjOcBm9RjqDJTPVBGU66w.text: I went to this place a few months ago and really enjoyed my dinner but I just came back from Vegas and visited this place once again and found that this time around, my experience wasn't as pleasant.  5 of my girlfriends and I decided to eat here the next morning/afternoon because we were pretty much too hungover to venture outside the hotel (we were staying at the palazzo).  To cut to the chase... here are the pros and the cons:  Pros: -the food is pretty good - i've had the miso salmon here before (a while back) & the seared tuna appetizer was a perfect blend of flavors to keep you mouth-watering satisfied. -it's a fairly reasonable place to dine that won't empty out your wallet. -the portions are pretty big. -free bread. -freshly baked cookies. =]  Cons: -I have to agree with Carolyn C., the floors are extremely slippery! I thought I was going to fall walking in and out of the restaurant! -the servers tend to disappear on you for long, and i mean LOOOOONG periods of time -they say they have a "soup of the day" then return after about 15 minutes of you ordering it to tell you they ran out of "soup of the day" at around 7pm.   -food takes a long time to come out, and the refills for your drinks take just as long... except when the manager comes to your table, the server shows up instantaneously to ask what's wrong and why the manager was at the table. -my friends that ordered the BLT sandwich and the mashed potatoes weren't thrilled with their meal... as they put it, "it wasn't that great"

Qxinsr5kbY7nQnzN8Uexag.text: I was recently in Vegas for four days and seemed to keep ending up here every night (or morning around 5am).  Since this is owned by the Cheesecake Factory, the decor and many choices and the menu had much the same flavor.  First visit (5AM)-Fried chicken and waffles. Second visit (5PM)-a huge Max Burger. Third visit (4AM)-corned beef hash and eggs.  The late night menu was very extensive and there's pretty much something to satisfy every craving.  The corned beef hash is real strips of corned beef, not that dog food can stuff you get at Safeway.  That meal was the least favorite of the three.  Fried chicken and waffles were good.  Burger was great.  Service was quick and filled water and drinks often.  The floor was really slippery like someone dropped a bottle of olive oil and the cleaner spread it around the entire joint.  At one point, a lady fell as she was exiting.  Note to restaurant:slippery floor+tons of drunk people at 5AM=accident and lawsuit waiting to happen.  We ran into Ron Jeremy in the waiting area-the legend of something.

IEcSR3oPwLUqGlMgIPy2Kw.text: So it's about 6 in the morning and we are leaving Tao Nightclub. LONG night. Starving. We walk all the way from the Venetian to Palazzo to eat at Grand Lux and find out that we have to go all the way back to Venetian since Palazzo's location was closed and the Venetian location is the one that is open late.   I ordered the Kobe Beef hot dog, and it was a great portion for an appetizer, though was a little too big. I almost would have prefered tapas sized portions for this one since it could hardly fit in my mouth, and it came with three hot dogs!  One of my friends however, ordered mac and cheese, and it was SO GOOD! SOOO GOOD! I definitely ordered it again when we ate for a second time at the Grand Lux Palazzo right before we left Vegas.   At 6 in the morning, this place was PACKED! It might have even been 5AM, but they had a list, and a wait to eat here. Crazy! I was really disappointed about the Kobe hot dogs so I had to knock off a star for that reason, and I really preferred the Palazzo location in general.

edcVDlGqjwP-NCmwODZRQw.text: We decided to take a day trip to Vegas....cause that's how we Angelino's roll..  4:15 PM- Get the lunch size chicken parmesan...which is HUGE 4:15 AM- Get the dinner size chicken parmesan...which is even HUGER  I was in Vegas for less then 24 hours and Grand Lux was the only place I ate at.  No lie...2 days later I went to the Grand Lux @ the Beverly Center and had another go at the chicken parmesan....it's THAT BOMB!!!

RW2QFe6HY1_qXzYNO2_w-Q.text: Paid this reliable and consistent place two visits on our latest Vegas trip.  We love the fried calamari plate... comes with shrimp and veggies as well. YumFukinYum.  I agree with the similarities to the Cheesecake Factory when it comes to how the courses are delivered, but food quality blows CF out of the water.  Aside from the calamari, we had the Rustic Lasagna, Chicken Royale and Shaking Beef - all delicious.   One thing to keep in mind is that the portions are huge. For those (like us) that don't have the appetite to match, it's appropriate here to split the entree and maybe have a couple appetizers.   If you do end up enjoying this place the way we did, it's definitely worth a trip or two back to sample the many choices on the menu.

kObDpFZ10C-KoKEz2-V_Ww.text: Well there are two Grand Lux.. one at the Venettian and Palazzo... The new one at the Palazzo is better. good food. good price.. nothing much else to say..

VOwSUzakggD2Tl9DAEP2eg.text: Big portions, good food, open 24 hours.  Never had to wait longer than 10 minutes for a table here.  They have a really yummy, and huge Chicken Parmigiana.  Meatloaf was also good.  I'll keep coming back here for late night dining!

ibOqa38YJ_TulH_53_LWyg.text: It is tradition to go here every time I am in Vegas.  The service is good, but the food is even better. I will always get the Chicken & Waffles... it is quite interesting on their rendition of an old favorite.  It is open 24 hours and is great after going to TAO after drinking.  I will always go here whenever I go to Las Vegas.

vvDl0crQbpGqGR_iVDZvmg.text: i think it was about 6 of us that decided we were hungry after the club/bars and stuff. so we decided to eat here at around 4 or 5 in the morning, which was convenient since we were staying at the venetian.  i dont remember what anyone else ordered but i ordered the bacon cheeseburger, it was btwn that and fetticcini alfredo(for some reason i was craving that) but the waiter told me to get that burger. that was the best order at the table for sure!! thanks to that waiter i had a really good bacon cheeseburger.. but i was kind of drunk so i dont remember it as much as i would of sober. this place is a good place to go too though!! check it out if your in LV at the venetian, hungry and maybe even a lil buzzed

Ek_H3XNROy9lJLWUdtH3HA.text: Have eaten here three times for breakfast or lunch and for this type of restaurant and its price point, I don't think they could do anything better. Delicious, simple food, good service. I'll continue to eat here when I visit Vegas and want an easy simple meal that's not too expensive.

VR8mc-6p-PvuolzVamHALA.text: Crisanto was the best waiter I have ever had in my life! I would come back simply for him! He was more than helpful and superb at his job! It is owned by Cheesecake Factory so I was already expecting great tasting food! BUT oh my goodness was the food good! My boyfriend and I got the fried calamari for an appetizer which was soooooo good! huge portions too! I ordered a Santa Barbara Chicken Sandwich and my beau ordered the Modern Cuban Sandwich! BOTH TASTED HEAVENLY! Modern Cuban is a must! Overall I would come back here before anywhere, and if Crisanto is my waiter! :)

MrTABeHobN4dn6jhJwHpxA.text: 2nd time here.  this time, got their lunch special of small pizza and salad for $11.99.  pizza was rather large but salad was so small it was like 3 bites.  so I guess that's what you get when you order a lunch special.  my hubby got a large salad, which he loved.  so why 3 stars?  after 15 minutes of being ignored (the place was dead btw), and watching other people get serviced with drink orders, I had enough and flagged someone down.  after that, someone showed right up and took good care of us from that point forward.  i hate being ignored while you witness other waiters run around on and ignoring you.

CJgMh7rEaFUdV9bE6jXOKw.text: Located @ The Venetian Hotel so it's convenient for hotel guests, casino patrons, party peeps to satisfy early morning, lunch, dinner, late night munchies. Yes, open 24 hours.   My friends and I ate here for an early lunch (about 11am) & late night after clubbing @ Tao. Wait time was not too long prob. about 5 minute wait.   The service is just ok. Seriously...too...slow...   The company that owns GLC owns The Cheesecake Factory.   Good food, nothing too special. Huge portions, Vegas priced though.  I ordered a breakfast plate for lunch with hasbrowns, egg & bacon. I didn't even finish the whole thing. Just your basic breakfast food.   For late night, I wasn't too hungry and just ordered a slice of Red Velvet Cake. :) The slice is about 2 average slices combined. It was good red velvet but I had better. :)

FvHLfdm_4ri7zinj7IS7lQ.text: One of my fav non-fancy schmancy places to eat is the Grand Lux Cafe.   The menu is similar to the Cheesecake Factory but better. They have everything I love for breakfast, lunch and dinner.  During our very first visit, I got the Spare Ribs Grilled Cheese Sandwich and my husband got the Spare Ribs Sloppy Joe.  We also shared New Orleans Beignets which were also delish. It came with 3 different sauces and my fav was the vanilla.    I forgot what the prices were but they were similar to what you would see at the Cheesecake Factory.

jJk34fCoF1qDBxY1aKjSiA.text: My Husband and I heard good things about this restaurant in the Venetian, so we tried it out tonight. They served warm sourdough bread & brown bread with butter to spread. It was mighty good. I chose a fellow yelper's Pasta dish where there were bacon bits & green peas, not bad but you get sick of the dish fast. Need to add red crushed peppers and share the dish while trying out another dish. The pepperoni pizza wasn't too shabby either! :))  Even their ice water was great tasting! lol I definitely would go back again!

EuGuPc3llA6nMpndsxAqGA.text: Don't go! Two of us went for dinner.  The first sign of trouble was so many different staff came by the table we were never quite sure who our waiter was.  Someone took the drink order; a different person took the food order.  Every single item was brought to the table by a different person.  You might think this would make it a very fast and efficient, but no.  I ordered the cream of chicken soup and a small chopped salad.  My partner ordered the smoked salmon platter.  We each had a drink.  When the food arrived the smoked salmon platter did not have a bagel as it should have.  I tried to flag down our waiter or any waiter and it was next to impossible.  Finally our(?) waiter arrived and we explained the problem.  Fifteen minutes later still no bagel and no sign of our waiter.  I got the attention of another waiter and explained the problem.  Ten minutes pass and no bagel and no waiter.  By now I'm getting agitated.  I manager comes over and I explain the problem of the missing bagel and missing waiter.  I also stated that I didn't think we should have to pay for the platter since we have now been there for over an hour.  He went to the kitchen to check.  The waiter then appeared and said the kitchen had no bagels but the manager was taking care of things. (No offer to reorder just more waiting).  Finally two hard as a rock bagels arrive.  As a "courtesy" the manager removed the charge for the $5.00 soup.(How generous)  We never saw him again.  The whole affair, from arriving at the table to check arrival takes nearly two hours! You bet I paid in cash so as not to have to wait for my credit card to come back.  I think the waiter tried his best.  The problem here seems to be TOTAL lack of management and total chaos in the kitchen.  It was 8:00pm and the place was half empty. The looked to be more than ample wait staff. Two hours for soup, salad and a lox platter???!!! This place is totally mismanaged. The food wasn't even up to the usual Grand Lux standards. Stay away.

w8ULmImTFeUFJYQ2bxKpfw.text: Food was great ! Had a blt and casaer salad at 2am...it was great ,fresh and quick...not greasy..had lots of fresh tomatoes and lettuce on it...loved it..will be back for dessert today..lol

JE9kFtscp8jDcH_eDummaQ.text: My FAVORITE Grand Lux Cafe is the one inside Palazzo.  It's open LATE and the food is amazingly good for a casual chain restaurant.  Some of my favorites:  spicy calamari salad, shrimp scampi, miso glazed salmon, and caramel chicken.  Desserts are great too - can't go wrong with a batch of freshly baked chocolate chip cookies or the beignets with 3 sauces.  It's definitely worth the money.

mjxSTMi6afWloeQf7BqEMw.text: Upon hearing that this restaurant is owned by the Cheesecake Factory, I immediately tried to find a way out. It was too late, though, as I had already sat down and ordered my food.  What did come to our table did not contain beef that had gone bad days ago, nor was it a sandwich stuffed with offal. In fact, the Grand Lux makes fairly good food in spite of being attached to the Factory's name.  And it's more than affordable.  What isn't good is the breakfast. Stay away during breakfast hours!

NftWAPhgRdLe8c6Vkfh47Q.text: My review is based off the late night dining experience. Approximately 1am to be exact. I must say that I was really disappointed with the limited food menu after reading that this place was good for late night cravings.   I give credit to the lady greeter who warned us at the door, that they were only serving pizzas, salads and soups at that time.  Still, we were tired and hungry after a late flight so we asked to be seated.   We ordered the Asian nachos, which I really didn't like because there was too much sweet & spicy peanut butter sauce....the whole thing was wayyy too sweet! I don't recommend.  The creamy chicken & mushroom soup was sooo good, we ordered a second round!!!  In my opinion, I think this place is hit or miss with their food. Of course, I didn't really have much to select from.  I think I'll give Grand Lux Cafe a second chance and try their dinner menu next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 2md round of creamy chicken &amp; mushroom
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Asian nachos- no good.  Too sweet
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

_PRdsRK4XanLsMJmI5ifPQ.text: I love this place , I always come here every time I am in Vegas. They have the best food and they are open all night. Perfect place for late night food. Very clean fast and friendly.

H1E8uY_wWysjmjE1m2BAUg.text: Great food...large portions...deducted 1 star because when we were eating we had to listen to someone using a grinder throughout our dinner (construction outside of restaurant)...kind of disappointing since it was our anniversary dinner and it was a Friday night

pwpcqUACRLmbhd3c6N1sFA.text: YUM! Thank goodness they're open late for everyone's late night drunchies!  Food -SHORT RIB GRILLED CHEESE: to die for!!! The choice of melted cheese combined with the short rib, and the pickled onions just marry so well in your mouth. The fries were a bit on the salty side and I should've chosen a salad or something else, but the sandwich is definitely something to get!!! 4.5/5 -SAUSAGE, PEPPERONI AND MUSHROOMS PIZZA: Tastes great when ordered and tastes great for breakfast the next morning! The crust is crunchy and just amazing! 4/5  Service -Our waitress was amazing! Our group was on the buzzed/drunk side and I'm sure that the servers are used to this, but she was very patient with us and even more attentive! 5/5

Nk1hwptN4y83wLM6Zt-Ksw.text: Great food! Super affordable! Stiff drinks and extremely friendly server!!! We will be back for sure before this trip is over! Also love the variety of the menu! I got a burger and my husband got fish tacos!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bunless burger
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish tacos

dZL3wxRhmz8qkp_JOvDk2g.text: I'm in Vegas, pregnant, and starving. What do I do? Yelp of course! I just got out of watching La Reve, which by the way was amazing, but I'll save that for another review.  Found this 24/7 cafe in the Venetian and said hell yeah. Waddled all the way there, got sat right away and didn't know what to order. It didn't help that their menu was so large, and we had only 5 minutes before we couldn't order off the diner menu. Our server was really friendly, and understood our time crunch so she came back to check on us immediately after getting our waters. Too bad we cracked under pressure and went for the late night menu, which had almost the same items.   My bf and I went back and forth between the chicken fettuccine or the chicken mushroom pasta. Finally, we flipped a coin and went for the fettuccine. Boy, we were not disappointed. The fettuccine was the perfect amount for two and it was not too creamy nor dry. We added cheese and crushed peppers to it as well. Sharing goes along way, so we decided to grab dessert too. We had the red velvet cake and it was so huge we couldn't even finish it. We were in heaven..... so much, I came back on our last night to eat here again!   This time we had the chicken mushroom pasta, which was alright. Not my cup of tea but still edible. We came during dinner time and got bread and butter. Then we decided skip dessert and do an appetizer this time. We got the Asian nachos, and it was so different and unique. Something we never tasted, and it was so big, I was full eating the pasta. Crispy fried wontons topped with melted cheese, grilled chickens, fried rice, green onions, and peanut and wasabi drizzled.   Service was on point both times, the waitresses always checked up on us, asked how we were doing, and never kept us waiting too long for our refills and the check!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummmy red velvet cake. :)

1n7yCZxRHN6wyH2aonu75Q.text: -Reasonably priced, hello sister of Cheesecake factory~ -You cant get all of the cheesecake here, only the popular ones, so if you want a very specific type you will need to go to the actual Cheesecake Factory for that.  - Lots of choices on the menu so everyone should have no problems picking something if you have picky eaters in your group -Service was fine! - Bread while you wait for your food! - You can sit on the outside area, just ask for it and there is a wait if they are swamped.  -Portions are huge so it is filling and well priced for what you get!

tunzhpqyVFqds9FRa1Uduw.text: Sweet Thai chili sauce! This place is good, especially late at night. The calamari with sweet Thai chili sauce on the side is so delicious. All the burgers and BLT are close to perfect. Egg rolls will soak up excessive amounts of beer. But BBQ ribs and southwest chicken salad were lackluster. Service was very good, Mike was quick to take care of us and very polite. Breakfast buffet is always good with good endless bacon and coffee. Steaks and most sandwiches are quite good. Don't expect the best bartenders in here though. Go to the main bars in Venetian or Pallazzo for the discerning. All the drinks were too sweet for me.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Calamari of late night menu
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best Homemade Sweet Thai Chili Sauce evvvv-ver
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. BLT dimly lit

w1I3pujEFw_0z0_2sh8Ekw.text: If you're from California, don't eat here. This is our first time here and we all find it to be a big disappointment. I was expecting similar quality as Cheesecake Factory (which is the parent company that owns this restaurant) but the culinary skill here is definitely several levels below. It is subpar. Worse than Denny's.   We ordered simple sandwiches but they were so bad. I didn't think it's possible to make a bad sandwich, all butter, fat and no flavor. The bread didn't taste fresh and worse than what you get at grocery stores. Worse than Safeway sandwiches. They were disgusting. I'm pretty sure they doctored these reviews in order to produce such a good rating.

E6yyee330DSc4G9hI4jyFw.text: I've eaten here for both lunch and breakfast and can't attest to the dinners, but I have to say that this is the beat breakfast in Las Vegas. As many times as I've eaten here I've settled on two dishes for breakfast - the chicken and waffles and the biscuits and gravy.   Both traditional, but both the best I've ever had. While a little pricey - admittedly, there are far more expensive breakfasts on the strip.   As for the buffet option? Also fantastic. Many many choices with options you wouldn't normally find at a breakfast buffet. I can say that I'm never bored with the buffet, but I do recommend the dishes (and they're a little cheaper).   One note to add: they do charge for every fruit juice refill so pay attention to how many your having. I got slammed for 20 bucks in juices cause I assumed it was free - negative Ghostrider.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The potato biscuits and gravy

JsX0XRjIm9klAQrN6tOaXA.text: Good eats in the Venetian hotel!   From the outside this restaurant looks small, but actually it is huge once you get inside. We came here for lunch, and the wait was not bad at all.   My least favorite thing about this restaurant was that there was so many food options on the menu. Despite that fact I decided on spring rolls as an appetizer and salmon as my main dish.   Both items were delicious. I would recommend going here if you are staying at the hotel. It is convenient and has great food.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

sujeqy8c9vth07cm8wUR1A.text: They had some of the best food I've had and not too pricey. The portions are hearty and perfectly seasoned. On our last day in Vegas we ate there for lunch and dinner because it was so good.

AKlAM1tEP-W9gi7YgXWfdQ.text: 4 stars for our waiter, beignets, and the warm butter cake.  The beignets were served with 3 sauces..chocolate, strawberry, and Jack Daniels.  Sauces were good but the beignets stole the show.  They were light and puffy, delicious.  Now on to my favorite dessert right now, warm butter cake.  It's outstanding here.  Light, buttery, and just the right amount of crisp around the outer circle.  This is served with ice cream, strawberries, and whipped cream.  Absolutely a must eat!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Warm butter cake
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beignets

ey-QoaOHO-CXn5F1gZneHA.text: An affordable surprise and delicious surprise at the Venetian. Excellent prices (especially since it's on the Strip), attentive service, quick stop, and quality food. This is a winner-winner-chicken-dinner stop. There are two locations -- at the Venetian (near Poker Room) and the Palazzo. Both fantastic. The menu is broad and there's something for everyone even the most picky and/or allergic eater. The children's menu is fantastic. I loved the Grand Cobb salad. The picture doesn't do it justice. We are returning!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kids menu
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Margarita Pizza

10zRa7vgR-UbG2Woe5Gd3A.text: My husband and I went here late one night later in the evening while staying at The Palazzo.  I think it was the only restaurant open at this time.  I ordered the Pasta Telephono. What part of the description of this dish mentions anything about being spicy?    Pasta Telephono        A Rich Tomato Sauce with Melted Mozzarella Cheese Baked and topped with Toasted Bread Crumbs with Chicken  I am not talking about a little red pepper but a serious amount of it.  One bite and my mouth and throat were on fire.  I even like spicy food a lot.  Between the red sauce and the dim lighting I didn't see the pepper flakes.  My husband and I let the manager know and she said "I'll take it off the bill" and grabbed the plate. That is good because there is no way we would ever pay for it. She asked if I wanted to order anything else.  As hungry as I was, there was absolutely no way.  I write reviews on Yelp because I often rely on other's reviews to figure out where to eat when we visit other cities. Hopefully, reviews I give help others decide too.  If there is one review of mine that I hope people read it would be this one.   I have no idea how this happened at a restaurant in The Venetian, which I consider one of the nicest luxury resorts in Las Vegas.  What is the skill level of the people cooking at this restaurant?

-0bfvFwelU1LVZgjRPr_9g.text: Just what we needed on a Sunday late morning after a bachelorette party the previous night.  We stayed at the Palazzo so it was super convenienf location wise. It was fairly busy, being Sunday morning in Vegas in the summetime. This place used to be a Cheesecake Factory, and is owned by the Cheesecake Factory's parent company, so the decor is gonna remind you of....the Cheesecake Factory. And breakfast ends at 11am.  The chilaquiles were good, but the best thing on the table were the breakfast beignets! It said to allow 15 minutes for them to make and it was worth every second! These things, think giant donut holes, were life saving. Comes with 4 different sauces to eat with them, and holy shit, we shouldve just ordered a vat of these. They were beyond delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chilaquiles
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast Beignets GET THESE!

iVs-7kPg3nVOrKA3F_eu-g.text: This is a nice cafe located in Palazzo.  I had breakfast and ordered the chicken and waffles and my hubby ordered the eggs benedict.  The chicken and waffles was very very good, probably the best I've ever had.  The waffle is nice and fluffy and with powdered sugar and pecans.  And ask for whip cream too.  The eggs benedict was just ok, I think the Hollandaise sauce was a little too sour and the hash browns was too greasy.   The restaurant it self is nice and big, but super loud.  They have huge booths down the middle that can seat 6-8 people comfortably so it's perfect for groups.  They were super busy so even though the food was good and our server was nice, service was not up to par.  I had to ask for for refills on my coffee and water which was not a good thing. They have a great variety of things to order and I would definitely come back to try some of it.  Hopefully I will get better service.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken &amp; waffles with drizzled pecans &amp; powdered sugar &amp; maple syrup
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggs Benedict with hash browns

vA7ApCw0P_MOWcsbxrsI-Q.text: World class restaurants and Chefs galore in Las Vegas and yet here I was at The Venetian's version of The Cheesecake Factory. woof.  Not my president.  Not my restaurant pick.   I came here because I was on a holiday trip with my mom and grandma and their taste in food... well, not mine. My mom wants burgers, and pasta, and very normal lower middle class American food. My grandma wants yogurt. Love them but going out to eat and trying new foods and dishes are my favorite thing on the planet and their dietary desires made me getting what I wanted not possible.   Grand Lux Cafe is perfectly fine if you love meat. The menu, like Cheesecake Factory, is a zillion pages long, most things are chicken based but they have burgers, pasta, salads (most served with meat), and large dessert selection. The portions, again like Cheesecake Factory, are huge and shareable and all things considered, it's an affordable meal with really basic offerings.   I was shocked that on a menu this large there were so few vegetarian options. That was so crazy to me. And I'm sure you can maybe modify some of the dishes to be sans chicken (the ingredient du jour in most things here), I'm not a fan of paying the premium for meat that I'm not getting.   Service here, was actually very good. We wanted for nothing, they were on it with the refills and extra accoutrements for my grandma's hot tea. They didn't keep us waiting, they checked on us at appropriate intervals, it was overall very pleasant.   My mom got some sort of massive burger and my grandma and I split a veggie burger (not your standard morning star crap, but actually a decent patty with the main base being farro) and a salad. The portions were huge on both. We probably could have just ordered one thing and split it considering they complimentary bread and butter they give you. I did not partake in the bread but my family seemed to enjoy it.   The veggie burger was hearty, the fries that came with it were good. The salad had waaay too much dressing for a person who doesn't want to die of a heart attack. It could have been decent but the dressing amount just swamped it. The cheese on it was like the most basic pre-cut grocery store party platter bright orange and True white cheese. Not exactly artisan but it certainly helped to offset the acidic overpowering taste of the dressing.   I'd also gotten a bowl of their minestrone, that was really good, but worth noting that I love salt and it was extremely sodium-rich and not for the faint of heart.  Overall, it's not the worst place you can go. In fact, it's perfectly fine and they're actually open 24 hours a day, 7 days a week, which is a great quality for a restaurant in Vegas. Is it on my top 20 to-do list for Vegas? No. Is it on my Plan-B list for next time in case I can't get in anywhere else or happen to be with people with basic taste? Yes.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veggie Salad
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veggie Burger
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. BBQ Burger

lJPpZlwJzbH1DJBTvNXsxQ.text: More than enough menu options to choose from no matter what you might be in the mood to eat. Their spicy ginger beef is tender and amazing. The wait staff bring their A-game. You get what you pay for here.

IxYuJtcoDBIHuFzbzSLlAA.text: This place is great!!! I'm so sad that they closed the one in Los Angeles. This is legit one of my favorite restaurants. I was here for two days, I ate here 5x  Small list of What to get: Chicken and waffles Avocado chicken salad Shrimp Scampi Chicken strips Fresh basked cookies-box of 12. Ughhhh my favs  Cheesecake

A7FWl39nWt0TZRP9y46v7A.text: i come to the grand lux cafe everytime i visit las vegas! i love how it is conveniently open 24 hours & the food quality is fantastic! so for all the clubbers / late night gamblers, this is the place to hit  up! i ussually like all their pastas and their ahi tuna is soooooooooooo delicious!!
