And there's a section that says they only serve breakfast in the morning, but in the other sections it shows a different breakfast menu under lunch and late night which could be organized in a less confusing way.  All in all the meal was cooked well and we left happy and full.

3BPFM5WIdO2_QRJq2CVgiA.text: Did I miss something here?  I've been to the Grand Lux Cafe in Chicago along time ago, but I remembered that I absolutely loved it.  I have also never had a bad experience at the Cheesecake Factory.  I went to the Grand Lux twice during my stay at the Venetian.  The first time was for the breakfast where I got the breakfast buffet option.  The orange juice was really good and it tasted like it was freshly squeezed.  The fruit offered at the buffet line also tasted fresh and there were a decent selection.  The other buffet offering were pretty standard.  They offered hash browns, scrambled eggs, sausage, and bacon that was way too oily.  There was also an omelet station, but I did not get to have one made because the line was too long and I was hungry!  They also had an assortment of pastries, but I would have rather seen pancakes and waffles instead.  I was also disappointed to see that they did not have cottage cheese, which I thought was a breakfast buffet staple.  Everything cost $20 including tax and tip, but for that amount of money I would like to see more buffet options.  The second time I went was for late night dining.  I started with the broccoli cheddar soup which was RUNNY and BLAND and did not come with crackers or bread until I requested it.  I got the chicken and waffles as my main dish.  The waffle itself was pretty good.  It had good crunchy texture and buttery taste.  The chicken was also decent, but I should point out that these were chicken tenders and not fried chicken with the bone.  It was served with a pecan maple syrup.  I've never had authentic chicken and waffles, but I have a feeling that the original would have been a lot better than GLC"s upscale version.

I6loroOB1X82LtsvQRYiVw.text: the service was meh... the food was made well.. nothing too special or  original about this place just so well make food..we had brunch it was nice to eat at a nice restaurant.. prob wont be coming back but not a bad place beside the place our  food on another person table... next to us... and they said it wasn't there so we took it they just remove the garnish but still.. not very good service but they did ask it we wanted remade.. we had a busy day so we didn't want to wait again..

KHfS3BK2tXaacm-GPC5oiw.text: Its just like cheesecake factory and its so convenient when you're hungry in the middle of the night.

Z7hHsPixjGZLZAJwb2yaag.text: love the slow roast pork burger yummmy~!

_yWr2q1IbEeeOTuuCKQmgA.text: Big portions like Cheesecake Factory in Cali but tastier and more Vegasy since it's in... Vegas.

jmAnHmdEhO9PyICJ6_8_2w.text: Stayed at Venetian for Labor Day weekend and for 2 nights, we had dinner here.  The portions are huge and the prices are fair, if not bordering on affordable.  A big juicy burger (chop house or mushroom) weighs in at about 1/3 lb with a huge serving of fries on the side for only about $13!!!!  The grilled chicken avocado salad is fresh and delicious, the portion serves 2 people (one if you're ravenous and will fill you to the brim!) for $14.  The Manhattan salad with the option of vegetables and cheese (other options include, chicken, shrimp, and price varies accordingly) rang in about $14.  They don't skimp on the cheese or beans or dressing either!  I eat a lot and the salads were filling!  Complimentary sourdough and butter came with the salads.  I think I got about 3 to 4 large slices of sourdough per salad.  How generous is that for a $14 meal?  Dinner for 2 cost under $35!  Much cheaper and fresher than other expensive places in Vegas.  After spending lots of money at a mediocre buffet (Bacchanal to be exact) with below par quality, this place was a delight!  Fresh quality with large portions at affordable prices is like a dream!  Presentation is worthy of any fine dining (maybe I exaggerate here, haha).  This place is open 24 hours too!

kObzoEDgFoA9uXRZ3Ai7Lw.text: The "machine" was run well (they seat you efficiently and fast), service was friendly and fine, they handled my picky eating well (no mayo, add cheese), and the food was absolutely delicious.  The only real gripe is that it's loud, but we were on the "patio" which is basically off the casino, so it may have been quieter inside.  The mushroom "burger" is amazing - it has no meat, it's just made of mushrooms - and flavorful.  The new cuban sandwich is also phenomenal.

ZjoU6wbnKpuv8IBLYL2VGQ.text: We opted to order breakfast off the menu rather than hit the buffet.  I think it was a good move, as the blueberry pancakes were great and the scrambled eggs were fresh (but covered in butter).  Also, if you like smoothies, they make them in nice tall glasses here; we saw a lot of them on diners' tables and tried the mango one.  Quite yummy!

XJ68colscP8zgTu24nRyzw.text: Grand Lux is a great place to stop in at any point of your day....breakfast, lunch, breakfast for lunch....they have many options and the portions are huge.  (The breakfast selections become limited after 11am but they still exist.)  The salads are huge as are the omelettes and sandwiches.  The bread that they have for the table- wheat and sourdough are the ones I've tried- are also very good.  There is almost always a line but it moves pretty quickly and the service is good.

opvruW9pF9if-qBHFl5FdA.text: Solid standby. This is a great place to go when you are too lazy to go to a fancy Vegas joint... or it's too late to go anywhere else like when you are on a winning streak and then realize it's already 430am and you haven't eaten all night.  My favorite has always been their build your own omelettes where you pick either egg whites or whole eggs and choose 4 ingredients such as ham, sausage, bacon, bell peppers, mushrooms, etc.  The list is quite extensive and I just can't remember it all right now.  They start you off with a huge basket of hot sourdough... I made the mistake of eating the bread and got myself all full before my food got here.  As usual, I went with the omelette, and I asked for my hash browns to be super fried and crispy.  They did not mess around... the hash browns came out in 1 piece because it was fried super crispy.  Imagine a thin layer of crunchy potatoes... sort of like a waffle cone but straight.  Anyway, this place never disappoints as long as you understand it for what it is.

pEp4v2yLmx6qtw7G9QDjeQ.text: Went on 3 different occasions during our stay when other restaurants were either closed (off hours) and/or we were too lazy to venture out for breakfast/brunch.  We thought it was going to be overpriced, salty diner food but surprisingly it was fine by us.  Reasonable prices for hotel dining, good portions, and clean.  For a quick bite here and there it worked and we never left upset.  It did its job.

7TBHT9vGcj1XYjDa-8pXag.text: Came here for lunch with my friends. Service was horrible! The wait staff was beyond rude and we had to literally beg for refills on our drinks. We had water and tea.......not sure why they are so rude and inattentive to Customers. The food was ok but my friend ordered cheese on her burger and it did not have cheese on it. Never again! I am usually a big tipper however my tip this time is be nice and be attentive to your customers!

ZmiINSvKDmPZgTuXJYVh0Q.text: BEST Buffalo Chicken Rolls of life!  Love their variety and that you could literally order anything here!

phCbpNsx8f579HJPYQBwbQ.text: Stayed at the Venetian over the weekend, so I guess we had to come try this place out.   Wasn't due to yelp this time, my friends just wanted to stop by.    Came here at 2pm on Friday with 3 of my friends, the place was not too busy.  But 20mins wait for the waitress to take our order was not cool.  Also the food took extremely long to get to us.  We must waited atleast another 20mins.  I ordered the Shrimps with pasta, the plate was $20 and it was excellent.  The food was quality was pretty good overall from trying out my friends dishes.    I don't know why the it took so long to serve us, really can't give this place anything above a 3star because of the wait.

A4D_3luhDIV8VJFtRR7o2A.text: You really cannot go wrong here. Similar to cheesecake but even better with better prices and selection. Portion  still really huge and shareable. We got the chicken waffles and it was just simply delicious. Shaking beef was the other choice and it was very delicious and cooked just perfect. Even for my steak loving husband he was perfectly fine with that portion with rice and vegetables. Finished off with cream Brulee which was perfectly executed. Inside was cool and firm, consistency and texture was how creme brulee should be. Price with drinks two entrees and dessert was $49 total.  Only one that gripe about it was the floor it is way too slippery. ladies with heels you better put the grippers on the back.

CRTqV2Lc1qDJce0Zq7F7Ew.text: Steaks you can cut with a butter knife. Fantastic pasta  Amazing ambience  Lovely decor

AcScss7KZJPmRtlZeTazfg.text: If you like Cheesecake Factory you will like this place. It's the same company but jus packaged a little differently. It's a great option for meal to soak up all the alki after a long night of partying or gambling. The food portions are rather big, I haven't been disappointed once. Price point is really reasonable, around $15 a plate depending on what you get. The service and ambiance is warm and cozy. It's not a super fancy upscale date, break the bank kind of place. Great for families and large group of friends to kick back and enjoy a good meal. They do get busy during peak hours but there is Bouchon bakery around the corner, you can get a little snack as you wait, or play the slots.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak sammich
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sausage, pepperoni and mushroom pizza
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Calamari

YW9yr2zblgknCZPfZWdEXg.text: Nice, solid dining option, moderately priced, very solid food.  Think upscale Cheesecake Factory.  Can't go wrong with anything on the menu, but their Chicken Parmesan is particularly good.

1nE28vsKg-gKaFDoY9LG4g.text: Asian Nachos tastes like heaven. Grand Lux is owned by The Cheesecake Factory and the food and service is exceptional

0WKQZqoNNEY0T-fvF-hRYg.text: Thank you for always being my backup plan while I'm staying here at the hotel when other restaurants fail.  Always opened when I need you & available! The food is always right! Portions are plentiful & always enough to carry out a Baggie! So worth the dine for your money & wide selections to satisfy the pickiest diner.  The bread is always great too & I can go on and on about the drink selections as well.  I haven't had a chance to order dessert bc I never know when to stop eating my meal. Always overstuffed by the end of my meal to try their desserts! I think I gained 5 lbs just from the shrimp pasta last night!

UBp-3SXfQRhOGPymfAlleg.text: Just like how I remembered of the wonderful Grand Lux cafe. There's not one dish that I try that isn't exceptional. Not only is the food really good but the portion they give is beyond imaginable for the price! You'll get your bang for your buck! So excited to be staying at Venetian to order here almost every meal.

lw2KhAoKgJs0Forx8HuyLA.text: I have loved eating here since I first found it on a trip to Vegas and it has never let me down (except when they discontinued my favorite banana dessert which I am still sad about).  Their sourdough bread is amazing. I always get the caramel chicken. It is crunchy on the outside but moist on the inside. It is a must try!!!

llisFcajuGfTkIBhSU3slg.text: The truffle burger was the most amazing burger I've ever had!!!! My boyfriend got the chicken pot pie and he loved it also. Price wasn't too bad for Vegas!! Proportions are great too, I was stuffed and couldn't finish my meal!!  Must say, I would come back any time!!

mTSxRwiEqRos6fBWX4duyA.text: Our server Raul V. did a good job in making sure we were taken care of during our meal. He was quick on his feet, wasn't overbearing, and very attentive. Thank u! The line may seem long but the line moves quickly and customers gets seated fast. Definitely get the chicken and waffles. The waffles are fluffy and it comes with a good amount of chicken.  This is a great place for any time of the day.

hhlG1yDeJAVRqYIx92qhAQ.text: The quality of food for the price is exceptional. Breakfast is not to be missed here.   Really impressed. Great service, delicious, casual upscale atmosphere.

dXCe4BELCdiCOTaNquPBAA.text: Let me start by saying the food here is always great!  This is not a review about the food, its about the 20% added gratuity.  I get it delivered to the poker room at the venetian so I dont have a problem with them adding it, infact i usually tip at least 20%.  I only got 1 meal delivered, and when restaurants usually add it, its for like a party of 5 or more.  Ive eaten here quite a few times and never closely looked at the bill til now, when i noticed it.  The wait staff is shady because they dont mention it in hopes that i dont see it and i tip them twice, which is what ive been doing.  So ive been tipping at least 40% each time.  I wonder if the managers know this is how they operate?  People in here throw poker chips around like its nothing, so they dont think twice about it, and usually just pay the bill and assume its right.  Not the way a popular chain like this should do business

DRo8yJLC6GHmW7onxk4Ijw.text: My boyfriend and I came here for a light bite, and were overwhelmed by the huge portion sizes. We ordered the chicken lettuce wraps and the ceviche. Both were great and definitely worth what we paid for.

FQJSRVGC5qNOdF2nBzsBMw.text: Grand Lux is a Las Vegas standard for me. It will never disappoint. Great food, great variety, great service but don't be discouraged if you see a long line. The places are huge and they move very quickly to seat immediately. The Avocado Chipotle Cheeseburger was awesome and the Asian Salad has never been better. My spouse had the filet mignon and it was cooked a perfect medium, juicy and very tender.

yggoLdkQfIt0xm7MwuJxdw.text: Ugh...was so looking forward to our meal here. The LA location closed awhile ago. They eliminated the shaking beef from the menu (something about removing the medium-portion items) and don't have beignets (because they don't have a bakery capable of making them). We were directed to the Palazzo location to get dessert. I am so disappointed. If I dine at a Grand Lux, then I expect all of them to have the same offerings/menu.

e-5FC6YXbxVVJoozgXglEA.text: Amazing place to have lunch or breakfast, which in Vegas, can be any time of the day. And luckily, this place is opened 24 hours. Their omelets are to die for. It's all inexpensive and you get delicious big plates. What's not to love?

oktmVJj5YbQEJgX8aMRD9w.text: This restaurant has such a huge variety of food for a great price! I went on a Saturday night and it was pretty busy- we got seated really fast though. Service was also great. I order Fettuccine Alfredo and my boyfriend ordered the Spicy Buffalo Sandwich. Both entrees were delicious and the portions where pretty big. I would definitely come again!

f0vjCM1F8FKzDs-RFYz7bw.text: The food here was terrific.  I had the fish and chips and it was crispy and fresh.  What else can you say about Vegas?  The food is delicious and fresh.  My only complaint is the service.  The server felt fake too me when she kept saying this and that is so good.  Cmon lady, why would we ask for your opinion if you are going to give us some generic answer.  They have some Asian fares on the menu but I would stay away if you want authentic food.  Just go to Chinatown on Spring Mt Rd.

mfAhK2-b3HETrZtVrKgTkQ.text: If you love love love Cheesecake Factory....you will love love love Grand Lux Cafe in The Venetian!  My favorites:  Jumbo Shrimp Pasta with lemon cream sauce and the Lemon Chicken Picatta.  YUM YUM YUM!!!  I can't get enough of this place!

DbvahE-VkEK_vzJW-OXulQ.text: Everything is good, ok that's not really all that helpful.. ok try the tiplalia fish and chips if you like fried fish, the chicken strips on a stick with tropical dipping sauce is yummy, but you must get the duck potsticker if and burger melt.  It is the best patty melt I have every had.  It's a little greasey but hey it's a patty melt.  The bread is a pan grilled garlic bread crusted with cheese...mmm and them smothered with thousand island dressing.  The molten lave cake is relly good too.  It's a great place to stop in for a quick lunch. How can this be the same company as cheesecake factory which in my opinion is soooo bad.  only 4 stars because the last server we had was just not cutting it

wzn29ZFQy71blTsdUYfnwA.text: Can't brag enough on the Grand Lux Cafe inside the Venetian.  Great food at reasonable prices and above-average service.  What more can you ask for.  They have a very extensive menu.  I had the Chicken Madeira and Asian Nachos.  Both were excellent with large portions.  My companions ordered similiar dishes which were also outstanding.    This was probably the best meal we ate during this Vegas trip.  Can't wait to go back and try some more selections from their tempting menu.

kWxoaC5PsKVDoixPDx-qVA.text: We really enjoyed our food but the service was absolutely horrible.  No one around us got drink refills unless they asked.  The server stood with her back facing the tables almost the whole time.  I was suppose to get a salad with my lunch and got the sandwich and had to flag her down to ask about it, when she did bring it she practically threw it on the table on her way by.  But I would eat there again.  Nice atmosphere.

XLgAAlR0f-Wfgf9u7DMmYA.text: Came here a week ago for breakfast. I had the breakfast buffet which included a freshly made omelet, oatmeal, fresh fruit, and hash-brown; if you're a meat lover they have tons of bacon, sausage, and ham. The price is very reasonable and includes beverages. Service was good, but my friends who ordered from the menu seemed to have waited a bit long for their food, needless to say their food was great also!

v8V8wmlJG4wr6Qowz50RGg.text: Ever eaten at Cheesecake Factory? Then you've eaten here. Only difference is you will pay more.

MEj-V-dIELzCvez_9kHnfg.text: If you want a sundae as huge as your head .... this is the place!!! Whip cream has no sweetness to it...

Y7Yk0Rrm1HyVGc20D3e3sw.text: Food was awesome but service wasn't as good, maybe because it was real late but still. It seemed like our waiter was trying to rush us out. I do love the fact it's open all night! For those after the club cravings!!

HhBD-9_cCzA3gmjz8kibcw.text: 24 hr, with a different menu after midnight.  essentially cheesecake factory without the cheesecake desserts.  usually, when i come here, i get the salads like the sonoma or polynesian.  this is where you eat if you have a huge group without reservations, avoiding the expensive celebrity restaurants and need to accommodate a variety of tastebuds.

QSyY6UTDbnuGqeuYOhBtrg.text: Pretty sure that we ate here after wandering out of a club at around 5am, it took many helpful security guards and random employees to guide us to food (as all we asked was "where's food?" then insisted on taking pics with everyone who helped us.)  The Baja omelet was exactly what I needed at that point, filled with avocado, green peppers etc.  My friends food all seemed to be pretty tasty as well (tasted the Pasta Telephono which was excellent to my drunken taste buds).  The food was all decent but I can't gauge fairly as I was not quite in a discerning mood, the service was a tad slow and forgot a few things but nothing unforgivable.

fAld2BipcLGnSfqjSdUoSQ.text: I go here at least once everytime I'm at the Venetian. Their prices are good (for Vegas), services is great, and food is high quality. I'll had the BBQ Cedar Plank Salmon more than once. I know that it sounds like a kinda-strange dish, but if you just like fish (not love fish) I think you've find this dish to your liking! It's moist and smokey. You'll find the BBQ sauce a nice flavorful touch. Lastly, they open at 6AM so check them out for breakfast instead of the cheap buffet or stale coffee shop.

zuG_33_OYiNe4N0uKqcJRg.text: I don't usually eat a big greasy meal before hitting the clubs but on this night it was necessary.  I ordered the fried calamari.  It came with a couple of different dipping sauces, some fried zucchini and shrimp.  I had a bite of the carrot cake that someone ordered.  It was very rich but yummy, a bite was all I could muster after eating my calamari.  Our food came out pretty quickly and Wes our server was a sweetheart.  No complaints here.

qJmnGIBJeUIPw3X-gPbmxg.text: This is a review for the Grand Lux Cafe in the Venetian.  There is an identical one in the Palazzo.  So, what more is there to be said here.  I had the opportunity to taste 3 of their tasty treats: the chicken pot pie, a Polynesian salad and a spaghetti dish with chicken.  All in all, each dish was good.  The chicken pot pie was flavorful.  The Polynesian salad was savory, and the spaghetti dish had a nice tomato sauce.  I am really giving it 3 1/2 stars, but it is not quite at the "fan" level for me.  So, if you're tired of the buffet gorging, this would be a nice alternative.

YmG7KRCRrPP9x_VVCXYbIA.text: So your staying at the Venetian and your hekka tired from getting your freak on over at TAO all night. Are you with me?? It's like 4:30 am and they have a full menu!! Got it?? This is not your average Denny's no sir. We were a pretty large party of 11 plus 1 giant banana named Ben. *see pic* It being so late or early depending on how you look at it I guess. It is Vegas after all but that's not the point here. We had to wait awhile before being seated where there were maybe 3 other occupied tables in our section so I wouldnt say it was busy by any means. Our waitress her name escapes me. Sorry, late night!! But she was AWESOME!! Seriously 11 drunktards and she was hekka cheery chatting mith us, taking orders, making suggestions, playing with Ben ,etc. I cant remembered what everyone ordered but I don't think anyone was too impressed with the food, nothing stood out and a few people had to change their orders for they ran out of some things. I on the other hand always order my good ole Vegas stand by bagel & lox, well you cant really mess that up too much now can you?? So in summation basically if there is nothing else open, you dont feel like walking, and the elevator to your suite is right next to this place I would definitely go again!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ben the Banana

JDzD3GBtMDX53WUWrYiVJA.text: whats a trip to lv w.o a stop @ grandlux?????  we got here early (vegas time) saturday mornin (fine noon) for some brunch. the girls and i got seated fairly quick compared to their dinner wait  our server was slow as heck. she kept neglectin our table.  i got a strawberry waffle...do urself a favor! dont order this...soo not worth it.  on the other hand my friends salad/pasta combo cost the same as my waffle and her chicken carbonara was AMAZINGLY dELISH! the portion was reaaaaallly good for the price too..  i swear u hafta stick with the pasta here. u cant go wrong with that!

qz7QjoLzrjXgtWAcqrLrBA.text: Denny's.....slow service, ok food....expensive prices....but cheaper than a fine dining experience.....I won't be back.....I'm a foodie, and I prefer to spoil myself on places like N9NE

VPjPaeuH_2BWH04MKZP80A.text: Grand Lux Cafe is a good place to grab a bite anytime since it's 24 hours. It's owned by Cheesecake Factory or part of Cheesecake Factory, and the menu and prices rival that.  Now, I came here with a few buddies of mine on our last Vegas trip and the food and service is what you'll expect at any Cheesecake Factory chain. The food here was OK, and portions were huge, even for the lunch menu. I wasn't able to finish my pasta dish, and those that know me know I don't have a small appetite. My friends ordered their pizza, salad, and other pasta choices off their lunch menu (Had about 10 or so to choose from) and we were content with our lunch.   Honestly people, the food here is really just OK, and I'm puzzled with the 5 star ratings some people have left. I mean, it IS just Cheesecake Factory inside the Venetian that's renamed Grand Lux Cafe. If this was located in Los Angeles or San Francisco, this is nothing more than a chain restaurant to me.  I'm giving this place 4 stars for being open 24 hours, which is a big plus in my books and the prices are very fair being in Las Vegas. The food here is just what you'll expect before going in. Large portions, fair prices, but nothing to write home about. Will I come back? Of course, but seriously, there are better food out there. Come here for grubbin' food at any hour without putting a dent in your wallet while on the strip.

2yX8DM5F45gfVQkU7gBJRg.text: I have been coming to this Grand Lux for years. And every time I am in Las Vegas, I have to go to Grand Lux. Their sandwiches, their aioli mayo, their cookies- everything is delicious!  But this last time I went to Grand Lux was by far the most memorable because:  1) a group of us girls were sitting in the restaurant really cold (and in dresses). Matt Timms, the manager, noticed that we were all cold and came over and offered us his jacket and other jackets he had in the back. He said he couldn't turn up the heater and knew there was a draft that hit our table and wanted to see if he could make it up to us with a jacket. So sweet!  2) I was sick and getting over a cold. I ordered a hot water to soothe my throat. Jen, our server, was so thoughtful and brought over more things for my sickness including extra broth from a soup we ordered, and a hot tea to go with honey for my throat. 3) before we left Matt Timms sent us over a box of warm delicious cookies. They were sooooo delicious! I had maybe 4.... I mean vegas was almost over and it would be a while before I needed to fit into another skimpy dress.  I cannot wait to go to Vegas and Grand Lux again!

tULBwZO2NGIt5QrI_FDUMA.text: I've been here a few times because it's opened 24/7 and it is convenient when you're hungry for late night after going out. I usually order the Grand Lux Turkey Burger and the Chicken Avocado salad. It's delicious and the portions are pretty big! I always have leftovers. The calamari is great as well! Highly recommended. The menu has a variety of everything including sandwiches and burgers, salads, pastas, entrees, dessert.   Yesterday, I went with a girl friend of mine and we got sat in front of the restaurant where we can look out and people watch. Haha. I liked the spot we had.  I come here every few months and it's definitely a place I go for late night!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grand Lux Turkey Burger. It&#39;s actually a sandwich but it&#39;s called burger on the menu.
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Avocado Salad.
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried Calamari.

nIxUuQs-IYMRRJWHkaLOrw.text: Lemon Poppyseed Pancakes. omg delicious.  I was sooo happy I tried these pancakes. The best ever.

kbKghCrZ64QG-mCdeiiCAQ.text: Went here twice during stay in Vegas... only came during happy hours my fiancee got the typhoon and I got a blueberry mojito both were very sweet... food is delicous just fyi happy hour appetizers are full portions our first visit we ordered the appetizers and a meal and were overly stuff that we didnt have space for dessert second time just got the appetizers and tried the  vanilla cake and that was sufficient for dinner

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vanilla Cake

7nsq2V28HGvgWFb4lY6zaw.text: Delicious place to eat a steak. Mashed potatoes were so good they had such an amazing flavor. I would come back and recommend to family and friends. The man helping us was so nice and helpful! Great service

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sirloin steak w/ potatoes

ZRXvoqejJGQ6lXYVV0yuww.text: If you're staying at the Venetian or Palazzo, this is a good place to check out. The food is good and it's conveniently close to the hotel elevator. My only gripe is that the service is pretty slow/bad here and it wasn't even busy (we had a group of 5).   Food: I ordered the royal chicken and shrimp scampi combo and it was good. You get three big shrimps, a good size piece of breaded chicken and garlic mashed potatoes. Everything was pretty good, reminded me of a Cheese Cake Factory.  Service: Suppper slow. My friends and I came here around 4 on a weekday and it was pretty dead (like only 5-6 other tables had small groups of people).From the time the server took our order until the food came out was about 40-45 minutes! Even the manager had to swing by and check on us and that's when I told him how long we've been waiting (30 mins). After about another 5-10 mins, the food came out. The server didn't even apologies, just dropped the food off and dipped :/  I'd probably come back if I stay at the Venetian or Palazzo again, since the manager stopped by, it shows that someone cared...

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Royal Chicken and Shrimp Scampi Combo
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. DeLux Breakfast Sandwich

W8MRKK8t0sr0XqWuF9AzaQ.text: We came in at 2 am, not expecting spectacular food or service, but at least only one of those was True! Food was delicious: Korean beef with pancakes and turkey and brie sandwich with fries were each filling yet fresh, so we weren't feeling heavy at the end of our meal. Note: while the Korean beef with pancakes were indeed delicious, I would hardly call it a Korean dish; there were the "general Asian flavors" such as ginger, soy sauce, and peanuts, but the Korean beef did not taste of sesame oil nor pear, and the pancakes seemed more flour-based than the traditional Korean pancake. The service was lackluster in my opinion, but I'll let it slide, since I find service tends to go downhill late at night anyway due to the little staff available. Hostess was nice, and quickly showed us to a table. The waiter did not introduce himself, and we were not offered complimentary bread, which we overheard from the other table was because they don't usually do that late at night, but the option was available. Water was not refilled throughout the night, and check took a while to arrive to the table.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Korean beef with pancakes
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Turkey and Brie sandwich with fries

84e6K9SKiqDgtl0DfWqMIA.text: This place is phenomenal. It's the same owners of the Cheesecake Factory so you know you're in a for a treat.  What's great is it's 24/7 so it has been the go/to spot for all hours of the day. They have an all day breakfast selection too if that's what you're craving!  Foodie Favorites: Pastrami Hash, Chicken Pot Pie, pasta Carbonera, CARAMEL MACCHIATO's are a MUST!!!  Service: ALWAYS superb! From greeter's to Waiters I'm constantly impressed!   Ambience: if you have ever been to Cheesecake Factory it's almost the exact same decor ... maybe a bit darker in terms of lighting.  Highly recommend!

lE1Cn67tWwaTXXwUgj3RXw.text: This place was great! We went here for brunch and we're seated immediately. The decor and ambiance in this place was spectacular!  The food came quick, hot and in giant portions!  Highly recommended for a bang for the buck value as well as quality.

eDB-sTZ9MX9dHUM1bJl9EA.text: My friends and I went there last night. The food was all good. My turkey and brie sandwich was even better than it sounded! Came with dried cherries and apricots and a side of fries. Portions are big we all needed boxes .the service was great! Miguel took patiently care of us, made sure to do something for my friend bday and split checks for us always with a smile on his face. Definitely recommend this location

kxwPY4IVwxKYaO7QRGKqZw.text: We love coming to the Grand Luxe Cafe when we are in Vegas. From breakfast to dinner, they always deliver a good meal. We had a Sunday family breakfast this time, and the Pastrami Hash and Eggs were excellent. As a lover of pastrami, I may be biased. In reality, the unsung star was probably the potatoes. Perfectly seasoned. Sounds simple enough but is rarely executed. The only knock I have? The lighting is dim and my pictures sucked so no photos :)

sOT1UXI0rP3b1ZYECGKGZg.text: The four of us came here at 3am because it was one of the only places open near us. Didn't have high expectations but the food and service were surprisingly good. We had the fish & chips, steak, jambalaya, and grilled chicken and avocado salad. The waiter was friendly and attentive.  It's open 24 hours so I'll definitely have Grand Lux in mind when I'm getting hungry in the late am.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish &amp; Chips

uXqdWb2ClZ3gQ7kvVxMKOg.text: Arrived here very early Friday morning and didn't have a chance to have breakfest at home or else I would miss my flight. So by the time I arrived at the hotel I was very hungry. I decided to eat here since I had been here before and because it was in the same hotel as where I was staying. I sat at the bar and had an omelette. It was very delicious and it came out pretty quickly. A lot faster then I had expected. I ended up finishing all of it including the few pieces of bread they bring along with it. As soon as I finished my breakfast, I had received a text message stating that my room was ready. Good for a quick bite if you're in a hurry. Not sure how busy they get for dinner.

keA0fy4qemNUsBaeUfVr6w.text: Came here for a very late night meal with my two aunties on Sunday at around midnight.  We were seated right away and our waitress Debbie came to take our drinks order.  I asked for my usual, virgin pina colada, and my aunties each asked for a cup of coffee.  Our drinks arrived and we were trying to place our food order, which we were indecisive about so Debbie was very patient with us.  I decided on the crab cakes to start off our meal and it was delicious!!  I don't think I have ever had any crab cakes that are that good, even my aunties agreed--saying that they weren't even that hungry to begin with.  I decided to order the ahi ceviche as my main entree.  It was very refreshing & filling, yet not heavy at all.  Although, it got really sour towards the bottom because the lime juice must have all sunken to the bottom of the serving glass.  Auntie Ann had the salmon & lox and that wasn't too bad either.  Although, the salmon was a tad on the salty side...but still tasty nonetheless.  Auntie Bev went with the deep fried calamari as her main dish and we all thought that was very well executed as well.  The batter was crispy and fried to a golden perfection.  It had a few deep fried bay shrimps and veggies as well.  We ended our meal by sharing a creme brulee, which was divine...considering we claimed we weren't too hungry yet ate everything and still had room for dessert.  My virgin pina colada was excellent as well.    Overall, I love the food, and service was excellent.  The fact that they're open 24 hours is a big bonus!  Definitely a place worth returning to...even if there are thousands of other places to eat at in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

gTgq8SNbkOOzQm--TabNKA.text: Not the quality I used too with other Grand Lux across country! Chicken Salad Sandwich was not toasted like other properties. Also didn't like the hair that was so apparent on my sandwich as soon as server sat it down! Disgusting!!! I should have gotten up and walked out then!

gXAWDA3dQ3in9nG3DMPYoQ.text: Very good - hotel food.  I can't write much about it than that.  I must say if you want upscale dennys then go here.

iMRBKteO_mBgRs4fGb1-5w.text: Did the breakfast buffet. Really tasty. The omelettes were awesome! Breakfast meats were tremendous.  Out first time here in Vegas and we really enjoyed this restaurant. Can't compare it to others yet but I would recommend this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cool ambiance.

oPtu2euqMZOFYdxWTJc8XQ.text: This restaurant has great food and service. We were taken care of very well, seated promptly, and the waitress was very knowledgeable about answering questions regarding dietary restrictions.   Great atmosphere. Not too dark or noisy. The food takes a while to make, but it's all worth it.   I had a monte cristo sandwich. (5/5) Just the right amount of toasting without burning and wasn't soggy either. The powdered sugar and preserves went very well with the sandwich. Tasted excellent. Not as messy or greasy as other ones that I've had.  Other people at our table had a shrimp pasta, the pot roast, kids pizza, and a short rib grilled cheese. Everyone was very pleased with the high quality of food for such a good price. Wasn't hard to get a table on a Tuesday evening.   Will definitely be coming back soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Garlic shrimp pasta
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pot roast with mashed potatoes
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Monte Cristo Sandwich

6YrTDHm2AnegAYblzNHpeA.text: When I'm in Vegas, I'm partial to the Grand Lux Cafe inside The Palazzo (as that's where I stay normally). However, between the hours of 2am-6am, the Palazzo's Grand Lux is closed, and that is where this other Grand Lux, inside The Venetian is clutch. I don't always stay out all night, and so when I turn in early (read: before 6am LOL), this is my go-to establishment for a night cap before knocking out.   I was in town over 4th of July weekend, and came in early on one of the evenings, so I headed over to The Venetian to get some food to wash out all the liquor in my system LOL.  It was around 4:45am, and the place was busy (It's Vegas, what establishment open that late isn't busy on a holiday weekend?). Service was quick. I got seated immediately and the waiter had bread and water to my table within 2 minutes of being seated -- I like that. It's funny, because I think the waiter saw it in my eyes that I had just come in from a long night, and so he brought over 2 glasses full of water and not once asked if I wanted anything to drink beside that LOL.   My late-night staple at the Grand Lux is ALWAYS (100%) the Chicken & Waffle. Always! If you don't know, you better ask somebody! LOL -- That is always a God send after a long night of partying and drinking liquor like it was water LMAO!   I ordered the Chicken & Waffle and the Shrimp Rolls on this occasion, although, I will say, the rolls were overkill -- With the bread they brought out, and the Chicken& Waffle order, that was more than sufficient for me. I still grabbed a couple bites of the rolls, and I will say that while they were tasty, they couldn't overcome the greatness of the Chicken & Waffle.   The waffle is always freshly done, great tasting with the maple syrup, and the chicken tenders oh so crisp, and delicious all-white meat. How could you not love this combo to end the night? I know I do. Both items I ordered were great tasting, and service was top notch, as always.  You can't go wrong with this establishment, and the same goes for the one inside The Palazzo. They certainly will continue to get my business when I'm back in town.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken &amp; Waffles and Shrimp rolls

wJmeHVNpF8YZ5nPR5Zv4wA.text: Can't go wrong with a 4am meal here. I've been coming to grand lux for awhile now and after a long night of dancing a drinking this place always hits the spot.   My go to is the chicken and waffles. I mean what else sounds good after drinking and dancing ??? This meal comes with a good amount of fried chicken tenders and a large  waffle. So YUMMY!!!   Service here is good too. Similar to Cheesecake Factory, the bread they serve is good and comes out pretty quickly. Never had a bad experience here. 4 stars.

0QMF1nlhxcWdNOEivsf0GA.text: Here for a conference and dropped in for breakfast one morning. Typical Vegas cafe that provably runs around the clock so wasn't sure it was open for breakfast. Grabbed a seat and ordered the huevos rancharos. It was awesome. Server was friendly and the meal was great. Price was reasonable. Would stop by for sure

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Huevos Rancheros

c9ILNVgY5dXb0yL-hshsmg.text: I thought this restaurant was an exclusive to Vegas till I found out there is also one in Long Island, NY. But nonetheless Grand Lux was a very dope restaurant to go to. Located within the Venetian Hotel and Casino, Grand Lux Cafe is good all types of food cravings whether it being breakfast, lunch, brunch, dinner or dessert. Came here for lunch during my recent stay here and had the Cajun Shrimp Jambalya which tasted awesome...good flavor, good portion, very filling. Best lunch I had my entire 5 days in Vegas. Added to that I had for dessert the Godiva Chocolate Cheese Cake. I'm already a chocolate fanatic as it is, especially when it comes to cakes....this simply was a-freakin-mazing! Rich chocolate and whipped cream topping....smh...I think I could had eaten that for a week straight and would he alright with that, it was that damn good.   Grand Lux...you did your thing with BOTH food and service. The ONLY thing I would say a negative as far as Grand Lux...too much dim lighting. I damn near had to use the flashlight on my phone to read the menu and I have great vision. A tad bit better lighting would be good there but other than that, Grand Lux is definite must go if you're looking for fine dining on the strip in Vegas.

AVxGMswuAXqBACBlPXw0FA.text: This is a must for my husband and I in Vegas. Love that it's open 24 hours. The portions are usually more than we can eat and pretty reasonably price. We never wait more than a few minutes to be seated. My favorite meal so far is the lemon chicken piccata.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

FiIFdh3L1g4JpdVPmYwtiw.text: We met some out of town friends here, we're locals. Very big menu and very attentive servers. Our server was Raymond, personable and not obtrusive. We thought he was very good. He suggested a nice wine, a Riesling. I had the Madeira Chicken. Very tasty but could have been warmer.  My partner had fish and chips. It was made with fresh fish, he enjoyed his meal.  Our friends also liked their food. The restaurant was quite noisy, that is my main criticism.  The wait for a table was only a few minutes. The prices are realistic, not exorbitant. You won't go wrong choosing the Grand Lux.

l5r2jbyuN0KKwuOWwPAstQ.text: After trying to find a reasonable breakfast joint on the strip, my group and I walked downstairs and realized this Cafe in out hotel had just what we were looking for. Seating was instant, although they require all your party members to be present for you to write your name down.   They didn't seem that busy/crowded when we came  but the service was pretty slow. Although our food took a while to come out that's not what bothered me, it was the 15 minutes of awkwardly waiting to ask for our check. I mean the server was nice, but we just rarely saw her.   I ordered the chilaquiles because they're always my breakfast go to. I appreciated the plentiful avocados on it, but overall it was a disappointing dish. There was hardly any salsa on it to soften my chips. They seemed more like nachos if anything. Flavor was good, but the texture was way to crunchy for chilaquiles.   I'd consider trying their dinner dishes, because their breakfast seems just average.

EvgkvInWRrGrQ67ECLO6Sg.text: Grand Lux Cafe is related to Cheesecake Factory, which will make sense as soon as you see the decor, giant menu, and take out bags. It's the same deal- large portions, tons of options. Everyone will be happy. I had the peanut butter and banana pancakes. They were very good, and the granola on top was a unique add. If you're looking for a familiar meal on the strip this will fill that need.

eGCF-yDCZ789xCfevX2U9g.text: We came for breakfast on a holiday weekend so service was not that great. Took forever to get seated even though many table were available. Hostess did their best to avoid eye contact and being friendly. Service improved once we got drinks, which also took a long time. I was impressed with the quality and portion size of food though, as I wasn't expecting much. This was the biggest thing of oatmeal I've ever had and the side portion of sausage was huge and really good! My husband also enjoyed his hash and virgin blood Mary. Although this place didn't blow me away, it got the job done for two hungry people. I'd give it another try.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. HUGE portion of oatmeal, fixings, and side of sausage (all very good)

_pnc-TlvGlCVJg5-eD3X7g.text: This place is really just your run of the mill American food chain with inflated Vegas prices. I couldn't imagine gorging myself with another buffet for breakfast (they have a buffet if you want it though) so we decided to come here since it was conveniently in our hotel.   The service, food, atmosphere, etc. were all fine but I wouldn't go out of your way to come here.

MzRU3UiuZK_2SiNfHv1iHA.text: 3.5. Stars  We arrived in Vegas pretty late and we found out that Lux is the go-to restaurant for late food without having to stroll down the strip. The restaurant was actually really hard for us to find because we entered through the Palazzo and didn't know there was two and wandered off to the Venetian one, which people say is the better one. It turns out, if you enter through the Venetian front entrance, it's to your right, past the Bellini Bar and right next to JuiceFarm. It definitely reminded me of an upgraded version of Cheescake factory with a dimmer environment but better food and service. Their menu is just as big as the Cheesecake menu and it took me awhile to figure out what type of food I wanted to eat before I asked for recommendations. Because we came late, we didn't have to wait to get seated but I was still surprised how busy it was for a weekday afterhours.   They gave us complementary bread that was right out of the oven to start while we looked over our menu. The waiter was able to give us pasta selections because we wanted something heavy before we passed out after the long drive. I ended up getting the Sunday Night Pasta, which was delicious. The noodles were how I liked it, the meat sauce had really good chunks of beef short rib, and there was just enough parmesan to top it off. My mom got the Lemon Chicken Piccata and it was really disappointing. The sauce was too salty and the chicken was really dry. I actually felt bad for my mom and we switched plates because she hasn't come to Vegas in a couple years and I didn't want her to have a disappointing first meal.  Service was on point, with the waiter checking up on us often and making sure our water cups were never empty. Overall, besides the Piccata, the experience was above average!

ZSUCFbsD1poG0RQDZiwirA.text: OMG the Churro French Toast is deliciously sweet! Crispy on the outside and super soft in the inside and it's a huge portion so be prepared to share. Be sure to get there early too because the waiter mentioned that they tend to run out before breakfast stops being served. I highly recommend the breakfast quesadilla too. It comes with a side of hash brown and sour cream, salsa & guac... Delish! NY steak & eggs is also a good choice if you're not looking for something too out of your comfort zone. Service was good as well, very attentive waiter. A must try if you're visiting Vegas!

FTAQ3t6Fk51NyodSBm8N7w.text: The lemon chicken piccata is absolutely delicious and a very large serving to my surprise. I sat at the bar and received great prompt service from the bartender. I was so full I didn't have any room for the butter cake which looked amazing! They also have two pour sizes for the wine which was great.

KGNxnaA7R44A9ScHGN9MBA.text: After a night out at Hakkasan, we headed back to our hotel, the Venetian. Before going to bed, we wanted a meal and stopped by Grand Lux. It was already 3am and there were very few customers. Yet it took forever to get a few mediocre burgers. Not sure what the hold up was since we weren't asking for anything special. The entire meal was uninspired and time consuming. If you're hungry in the middle of the night, I suggest that you go somewhere else.

G7vq7OeRw6Yvpd8L7CM7nQ.text: Nice spot for lunch for a casual dinner.   Pros: 1) Party of 2 was able to be seated within 5 minutes on a Saturday evening.  2) Server, Christian was very nice and prompt. 3) Menu was very diverse...a lot of different options...maybe even too many. My opinion is keep the menu simple and focus on quality...but I digress 4) The quality of food matches the prices...You get what you pay for.  Con's: 1) Drinks were a little pricy. My husbands entree was less $$ than my Sangria.  2) I ordered the margarita pizza and the crust was limp and soggy...not the best.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

EQ6Gt_dJyHiyQAjbe_5meQ.text: I was pleasantly surprised by this little cafe in the Venetian. After a long day of walking around, we were looking for some reasonably priced comfort food and we found it! The waitress was lovely and was inquisitive about allergies (I have many). The dishes were perfect portions, enough for you to be full with a small amount left over. I will definitely be.going back on our next trip to Las Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mini beef Wellingtons
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spaghettiiiii

z5I-Q9e37rXrwcy0zpwV7Q.text: The food is ok but the service... the service is great!  We had the breakfast buffet and it was nice but not exceptional, just the all American food: eggs, sausage, oatmeal, biscuits and gravy, etc.  But the waitress was very nice, very funny, efficient, and just overall happy with her job. I love this!

bawMTcZTN4ruspGgbrFkfg.text: Food is pretty good but not great. The Cajun jambalaya is probably their best dish. Also the buffalo egg rolls are good

0b8z4bTFdpIdWusOr2NuoQ.text: Placing an order to go and picking it up in the bakery store front is a great alternative to room service.  The caramel macchiato was heavenly, as was the belgian waffle.  The sweet potato fries are worth the upcharge, especially when dipped in ranch.

dz6iUKc8LCCO8RhfgQFtHw.text: We gots no bread and had to send food back twice because it wasnt cooked eight. Overpriced for crappy service

1wII3hAUU8Mw0-eJh-MSUQ.text: Omg this was the best jambalaya I have ever eaten. The restaurant has a huge selection and genre of food. Its like a bj on steroids. I highly recommend anyone staying at the Venetian to stop by here because it is conveniently located downstairs. The portions are a huge as well. I will be eating here everyday!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Buffalo chicken wings
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Asian spring rolls
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken pot pie

Zz1RgHbKupWtFH9TyL1FsQ.text: Restaurant inside a casino doesn't sound super classy, but hey, no judgment. Sometimes we just like the convenience of whatever is right in front of us.  Given the premises I was pleased. As suspected, I wouldn't consider this place classy: Sure, the interior is "Vegas-classy" and pretty nice, but the echoes of cutlery, loud conversation and waiters intensely running around takes away any intimacy, which is something I'd require from a classy place.  Food was very quick, and portion sizes huge, so if you're looking for a quick meal this is a good spot. Plating wasn't very exciting, and a but in the pricy side - but taste was good so I still think this is a solid place.  And they have excellent lattes (huge plus).

6yvBAdqiPe1nQiGzpc8kAw.text: We went into this buffet with high expectations and we're very pleased! The price was not bad for how good the food and service was. We did not have to wait at all to be seated or served either. If you would like the opposite experience to the one we had here at the Grand Lux Cafe, then try the Buffet at the Wynn, although we do not advise it.

H6_2KZs4Z8qxIxrME-MAgw.text: Grand Lux is always a good time. The food is consistently delicious, I've never ate something here that I didn't like. They're also open later than the norm, so that's also a big plus for me. I've never had a less than satisfactory time here until yesterday. The boyfriend and I went in for dinner, it took about 8 minutes until we were even greeted at our table. The server never introduced himself (we later found out his name was Joseph from our tab), we had to ask about 3 times to receive the beverages we ordered (a beer, water and an iced tea), his table side manner was just..plainly put, rude..he wasn't attentive, I felt like we were an inconvenience for him by being there. With all the different places I can eat, especially on The Strip, I'm not sure I'll be coming back to Grand Lux, definitely not any time soon, or in 2014 for that matter.

zMW8ySMaG0Ae_DsiVP6CBQ.text: Reasonable price for Las Vegas and the service is decent. The food is pretty good too!

S4sakIA9fzz4v1JgdKScpQ.text: 24/7 makes this to place to go after a crazy night out in Las Vegas. Highly recommended but there are better options during regular hours.

Keaug-OE7jmbA929TLbpsw.text: Created by the founder of Cheesecake Factory, Grand Lux Cafe is like a more upscale European version of it's former self. Open 24 hours, it's a great place to sober up after the wild night.  It's 4am and we're all hungry. Us being Lucy Y., David G., Sarah A., and myself. Having been here before, I recommended coming here for some early morning grub. We encountered some half naked drunk dudes standing around the restroom outside the restaurant. Good stuff!  We were promptly seated and I was craving breakfast. Ordered the Smoked Salmon with onions and scrambled eggs, it came with hash browns on the side. Simple and delicate at the same time. Contrast of smoked salmon and eggs together created a good plate overall. Filling enough for bedtime.    Pricier than most 24 joints in the hotels, but the food and service is better also. Keep in mind only the late night menu is available after a certain time.

JJNbjUBlwPqE4GNEY93zOQ.text: Ate here twice during one of our trips while we stayed at the Venetian. We got to Vegas fairly late one evening and after unloading our things in our room we went downstairs not knowing where to eat and came across this place since it was opened late.  It was actually similar to Cheesecake and then I find out that they are the same company.   There was absolutely no wait even for breakfast. So before we left to head back home, we got our breakfast here.

2v8tB8lpMZXAhht-_eun9g.text: I dunno maybe it's what I ordered or something was different with this visit.... I dropped a star because afterwards I didn't feel really good. Like the food was good, but the walk back wasn't very enjoyable, might have been the load of bread and butter I had before I ate.... I dunno.  I will say that illness aside, still a great place to eat, the special was a salmon dish and the soup du jour was clam chowder (shou-deir) and that was rich and creamy. I also had the short ribs and those were really really good, only two ribs, but still tender and juicy.   And also great service as usual.   So please just cause I dropped a star doesn't mean don't go back and enjoy a steak, because I might go back again later this week.

xUrNjiK7XeDN7WBQM8oD5Q.text: If you love The Cheesecake Factory, you'll love Grand Lux Cafe. And it's open 24/7 for all the people awake at all hours of the day in Vegas.  Situated in the Venetian made it the perfect place for my friends and I to hobble into after clubbing at Tao. We enjoyed sitting outside so we could people watch all the other intoxicated clubbers walking around the casino area. I ate here both nights I stayed at the Venetian.  I always have a huge appetite and craving for fatty foods after I club or party.  Their gigantic bacon cheeseburger and sausage and mushroom pizza hit the spot. They were only $9.95 each too! I scarfed half of each down and somehow made my way up to the 10th floor of the hotel to finally knock out. The cheese in both dishes was perfectly gooey, cooked the way I asked, and although I'm sure 1000 calories, worth every bite to help absorb the alkie my liver was trying to digest.  MMM... big portions always get 4 starts from me!

hofDSfqRCK6u2ZC0G4Vk0A.text: Although we have a huge Grand Lux in Houston, I hardly ever go there because it's so busy. It turns out they all are! I went to this Grand Lux because it was in my hotel. We ate at this place several times and although it was super busy, we were always seated within 10-15 minutes. They have a lot of variety so you don't always have to order the same thing. I thought the food was Good and the drinks were pretty awesome.  Don't forget there is another Grand Lux at the Palazzo, so if this one is packed... just walk to the other side of the Casino and enjoy your meal!

miI6pFBGGtNfHoTxTt01cQ.text: This place is not unlike a Cheesecake Factory. I had a FatTire and the Kobe burger. The burger was very good. I also tried the enchiladas and the angel hair pasta with shrimp. Everything here seems to be on point. Service is excellent. I came here with a long time local who recommended the place. A must go if in the area.

TG0kyjStx9JvFm9P0CbdUw.text: This restaurant is really similar to its sister The Cheesecake Factory.  I really like how expansive the menu is and the portion sizes are always enough for a small village, which since I enjoy the food so much, makes for good leftovers.  I like that I can try something new each time, this time was the BBQ Asian Pork Tacos, which I highly recommend.    The service is really good, considering the size of this place is massive and its always packed.    The downsides are it's VERY loud and its hard to get great service since they are spread so thin.  Upside, they are open late and inside the Venetian which makes it convenient.

772uVUR5LVKrn_Z-ar5ksg.text: Where do i begin! this place, lets just say that in this place i had my first AHA moment in food !! yes, everything is good, and when i say everything i mean it. I went to Vegas last week and i tried this place like 4 times and it never disappointed me! NEVER! I highly recommend the turkey brie sandwich and the trout. You know what, i recommend everything !! and you know whats the catch, the place is soo cheap for the quality of food and atmosphere they offer!! please if you are in vegas and you happen to go to the Venetian,  please do stop by and send my hellos!

tgqTvFN0qMnO1QfcjhIbUw.text: Great salads. Try the Manhatten or for lunch the Pasta Fresca. Large portions - enough to split with your other easily. Freshest quality. Good service. Very reasonable prices for a Vegas casino location, $10-$15 for most huge entrees. We will go again!

N0SDz2hiIlR991WfvirnVQ.text: These are my favorite coffee shops in Las Vegas.  The restaurants are clean, spacious and have an ambiance you can't beat.  The menu is extensive and the food is prepared like you're at a gourmet restaurant.  The pasta dishes are amazing, the meat dishes delightful and your appetizers, soups and salads are way above average.  Service is great, but sometimes spotty, but the portions make up for this slight defect.  Go hungry and expect a better meal than at the Cheesecake Factory.

_oYHEKZX5xudDjV0g4Sj6g.text: I go to my local Cheesecake Factory quite a bit as it is pretty kid friendly so when I was staying at the Venetian I had to bring the kids here.  We came in for breakfast and made sure to come on the earlier side since from previous experiences the line gets long fast.  For breakfast they have a buffet option for $16.99 or you can order from the menu.  For kids the buffet was $9.50 and since one of mine is only 2 years old she was free.  So two kids buffets for $9.50 total is a deal that can't be beat.  I had the chicken and waffles which is a heart attack waiting to happen but was very good nonetheless.  I will definitely be back since the food is good and the servers are attentive and friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Red velvet pancakes
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken and waffles

-e8jbuuLKs0h7qc71NqMxw.text: Back in the day when I lived in Vegas this was the go-to late night dining spot. Their late night menu has plenty of variety and everything is always good. Now whenever I'm in town I usually find myself there. Staff is consistently good. This visit, the kitchen even made my favorite flatbread chicken sandwich even though it wasn't included on the late night menu. Ranch is amazing. My husband had the chicken and waffles and says it was the best he'd ever tasted and a friend's corned beef hash was delicious! Thank you for feeding my belly on hungry Vegas nights!

uGvD1pfUid3cJl_v2uIoYg.text: The cafe is inside Venetian reasonable price great food a must try if u don't wanna eat buffet the chicken waffle is good

lENeARa4SNPzgQ9ejWoGRQ.text: Been here twice. Perks are: beautiful people [employees and guests], open 24/7, fresh yummy food.  I always know I would be satisfied when I come here, and the price isn't bad for the out of control portions they serve.   I've yet to have dessert here but next time I'm in Vegas I'll make it a point to. :]  I recommend this place for any party animal who's hungry and can't find a place open and is near the Venetian!   Enjoy!

t9tw_1lPRNT0FaoWs1i7qQ.text: Great place we found on our hunt for dinner when we first arrived in Las Vegas. Great menu and very large portions. Food was delicious. We got these amazing spring rolls filled with mashed potato and cheese as a starter. Service was very friendly.

wDR7BVALL_SbOUpimCQ-2A.text: A better version of cheesecake factory. I had some pizza and pasta. It was tasty.

0pm7k2l5FMvmW-hHjwFSxQ.text: Grand Lux has always been my go-to spot whenever I'm around the vicinity. Whether I'm staying at Venetian, or even a little bit further out like at TI or Encore, I always make that extra walk to eat here.  I really enjoy dining here for a quick meal. It's opened late, they have a big variety of different foods, and the service is always on point. The restaurant is quite big inside though it doesn't look that way outside of the front. It's great bc I never had to wait for a ta  I think I come here at least one or two lunches when I want to eat something decently good. Their salads and sandwiches are perfect for lunch. Also, I always find myself here when I'm hungry at odd hour like 10-11pm at night.  I really enjoy eating at Grand Lux. I honestly think you can't go wrong with dining here. They have something for EVERYONE. Their menu is quite extensive so even the pickiest eater can find something they like at Grand Lux. I highly recommend their sandwiches for lunch and pastas or big plates like their meatloaf for dinner or even 4th meal. Lol. You can't go wrong dining here at Grand Lux!!

-HwUkpm6E3tbE2z-_zSb1Q.text: I usually go to the Grand Lux Cafe in the Palazzo, but since I was with a different group of friends this time, we went to the Venetian.  I can honestly say that I did not really enjoy my seared ahi salad.  :[  (Sad to say).  It might have been how it was presented on the plate as it wasn't at all how I would have pictured it to be.    I should have just stuck to breakfast food that day since they were having a breakfast buffet until noon or 1 pm.  The service was still good, but I wasn't impressed by the food.    I'm going to stick to the one at the Palazzo from now on.

bnAr_xIEWLdFxf6vAV4_LQ.text: Wasn't terrible, but the food was not good enough for me to consider giving it any more than 3 stars.  The prices and the service were not good enough either.  It wasn't bad or anything, but it certainly was not what I'd want for the price I paid.  I ordered the Caramel Chicken and it was pretty bland, essentially tasted like the honey chicken at Pei Wei (which I could have gotten for half the price) and was not in any way unique tasting or as delicious as it was made out to be.  It is likely that I would not go back unless I was staying at the hotel and was feeling really lazy.

2VakCxy4PlYAcU1IGgqT7A.text: Someone told me the Grand Lux was just like the Cheesecake Factory and they were right.  Lots to choose from.  Breakfast menu served all day long, lunch and dinner.  I opted for the cheeseburger (pregnancy craving) with the sweet potatoe fries.  YUM YUM YUM.  Hubby had the chicken and waffles and he cleaned his plate! :)    But again, if you've been to a Cheesecake Factory, it's pretty much the same experience minus the decor.

i0exsA7t8VPYzTY-LfeMow.text: If you've ever been to a Grand Lux (or really, even a Cheesecake Factory), then you know what to expect. This is nothing extraordinary, but the menu is giant and everything I've tried has been good. It can be pretty noisy during peak times.  I went twice for lunch, and got lunch specials both times. The lunch portions are GIANT, so don't worry about leaving hungry (especially since meals come with free bread baskets). The first time I tried the lunch-size pizza + salad. The pizza was a little on the greasy/soggy side, but still pretty tasty. The second time I came alone and sat at the bar, and I tried the Southwest chicken salad. Really tasty, but a little heavy-handed on the dressing.  Both times the wait staff were very attentive. Prices are very reasonable ($10-$12 for lunch). I was staying in the Venetian and the Grand Lux was right by my elevator bank. I don't know that I would seek it out, but if you're nearby it's definitely a solid choice: good food, good prices.

3W9yykdoamU-pYbLm4urAg.text: I do recommend the Greek salad and Sunday night pasta. The Short Rib Grilled cheese sandwich was an average and the fries was cold.  The service is excellent.

PkZTfhrCZPUDmyMslrm0Ig.text: Found this little gem while we were walking around the venetian.  It was midnight and had to order from their night menu but the food was delicious! The serves was amazing too. We decided to come in the next day and the same results.  This is a must while in vegas and the prices were very reasonable! !

asAyZU8D4iSyXk6Z10mcZw.text: Huge fan of this spot after TAO or LAVO!  Love their Garlic Shrimp Noodle or their Eggs, any style, Hash Brown Potatoes with Toast! =P  Used to come here twice a week.  Miss this place!

AKt1SK7HcYBqSbYIHj4Xig.text: I luv this place!!! Always great service, awesome food and for you night owls this is the place for late night food....... I have been stuck on the pasta with chicken, sun dried tomatoes and mushroom. A-May-Zing!!!!!!!! Asian nachos are a must so come late and hungry, Grand lux won't disappoint

RwrEWO-qBKv27pb_fOdfFA.text: Always one of our favorites in Vegas. We ate there for lunch and it did not disappoint. The portions are big. Our server was pleasant but seemed overwhelmed. The food was delicious. The lines for this place are usually very long, but worth it!

HDxmsXTnrsNbietkLFslfg.text: Ordered the spicy ginger beef plate. Excellent. Perfectly seared and tender. Didn't have to wait long for a table. Service was good. Good portions.

1DwYKR9ls9zi3MK8DBKfIQ.text: I can see how this place reminds people of the Cheesecake Factory: similar decor and huge menu. Fortunately, the food is a lot better! We came here after finding out that Bouchon Bistro closes for lunch at 2pm, so started out a disappointing experience.   My husband ordered a cheeseburger and I, eating for 3, got the fried chicken and mashed potatoes. WOW, the food was great!  We started with the spinach and cheese dip that had artichokes in it and was served with a nicely spiced salsa.  My chicken came super crispy, but still very juicy. My husband's burger was a perfect med well and he really liked it. We were both happy, even though we'd wanted to eat at BB.  I took the rest of my chicken to go and gave it to a guy sitting outside the casino and he said he enjoyed it as well, so I wanted to be sure to put that in my review.  Service was a little spotty. Hard to find out waiter sometimes because the place is so huge and drink refills were slow to come.  Not sure we'll be back because there are so many great places to eat in Vegas, but happy to know this place is there.

z2iz94NSUvH3ln0MxkauPQ.text: Joey B our waiter was awesome!  Great waiter good food what else do you want?  A huge menu with tons of choices.

SN89bSMO-8ef0lIQls8wWQ.text: I prefer the Palazzo side.  We were seated at the bar side and our server was really enthusiastic about his job.  The wings are really good.  Crab cakes were too sweet.  Flatbread was great.  A lot of food for a very good price.

Oe48wWaPnTa-EiNYGyNaTA.text: Try the chicken and waffles late night after all of your fun!! You won't regret. Plus the Venetian is fun to explore while you're there.

LtlK1gsKZE2uuRqiStBbMg.text: Stopped by this place for a late dinner with my brother. They must do great business seeing as they're open almost 24 hours. The cafe is a lot bigger than it looks from the front, with some seating in the front (with view of the casino floor) and a huge space in the back. The service was good overall, and the waiter didn't stop by so many times that he became annoying (props), but on to the food.  What people say is True, the Asian Nachos are pretty good. Sweet, tangy, savory, and salty with crispy wonton chips and meaty chopped chicken. A plate of these is pretty much a meal in itself.  The avocado-chipotle burger and the delux drive-in burger were both decent, but super greasy.The portion sizes are good though, and they give you a choice to swap sides. I had the salad w/ vinaigrette and it was good (left me feeling a little less fat). But I've been spoiled by Austin so my standards for burgers is a bit skewed...  Price-wise, it's a bit expensive, but I guess "regular/cheap" for Vegas. It's a good place to stop by if your hungry and it's late.

8Ll_1KxYXQbg-G36dEZuCw.text: This is my best kept secret in Vegas. I've been coming here for like 15 years and never been disappointed. This is the Cheesecake Factory ( same menu, same cheese cake ) without the glitz and glam and wait time. Open 24 hours, you can eat good food whenever. Garlic Shrimp Scampi and all the burgers are my fave. Pastas and Chicken Madeira are just like the Cheesecake Factory.

y1iSKdFFdIh0JJReUbV8jg.text: Great food! Service is a little slow but my wife and I were glad that the food was worth the wait. I do wish they had less things to choose from because the menu is exactly like the cheese cake factory where it is always hard to pick something due to having so many options. I would recommend this place to anyone.

pXWOIaDRzPPwkyfABh6psw.text: A lot of people compare this place to its sister restaurant the Cheesecake Factory, but I must say, the food here is much better than the food at Cheesecake Factory!  For starters, this place is open 24 hours and on the ground floor of the Venetian...this means that this is the PERFECT place to go to before partying/clubbing and also after your post partying/clubbing activities when you're in a state of drunken stupor.  Food definitely does taste 10x better when you're drunk! LOL.  In any case, I came here for a late lunch one time, and I ordered what I expected to be a light snack - Asian Nachos - but as it turns out, the portions were HUGE.  The Asian Nachos consisted of crispy fried wontons covered with chicken in a sweet-hot peanut sauce that was topped with Wasabi cream and melted cheese...and on top of that, there was fried rice in the middle of the dish. MMM....this dish was pretty yummy!!  In addition to the nachos, I also had a Spicy Calamari Salad which consisted of crispy calamari, organic greens, carrots, cucumber and green onions tossed with a delicious spicy vinaigrette!! This salad also came in a large portion and could be easily shared between 2 people. I highly recommend this salad as it is quite scrumptious!  I would definitely come back here again to try the other items on the menu!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Asian Nachos!!

FRTKip7uR5NXNsdw_fL1LA.text: Food is good.And our wittress, Iliana was so really nice and friendly ! I am coming again!

iU_oihNgssBFJflOa7hWcQ.text: Fast seating for breakfast at 8am, even during CES. Huge restaurant. A bit loud but not terrible. Good service. Tasty omelette.

PD5tfp3qLrRa9L8zjUVBPg.text: I prefer the Palazzo location over the Venetian location.  My favorite is the French Toast during brunch.  It is crispy on the outside and soft, warm, and gooey on the inside.  I have never experienced French Toast like this, but I am hooked and have been since trying it a couple of years ago.  I always order it with a mimosa, freshly sliced strawberries and bananas, and it includes the caramel syrup. OMG!!!    Yum!

R_gnkTuCT4GASG2P3czh-Q.text: This restaurant never stops to amaze me.  Several trips to Vegas and always stop in for at least one meal.  The wait is always minimal, nice atmosphere, great service, fantastic pricing and oh my gosh the food!  Their breakfast buffet is simple but high quality, fresh pastries, fruit, omelette bar and other warm items or you can order off the menu.  Their coffee is also outstanding.  I don't give 5 stars often but this place deserves them.

VApV55OgYV3rMWukxjA-Bw.text: Service SUCKED.  We had to flag down random waiters all the time for re-fills or utensils which is a pet peeve of mine.  I would understand if you're slow because it's busy but when I look around and see empty tables/empty booths....i now think you're just lazy & stupid.  My friend got a sandwich and the bottom bread was soggy (not semi-soggy), it was inedible.  I am a huge fan of chicken and waffles so anywhere and anytime I can get it, I will so that's the only reason we stopped by this place.  My review for the chicken and waffles: They need to use real waffle batter (i'm sure they can afford it).  The chicken was also super dry.  Would I come back?  If I was drunk and it was the only place open....yes....

BFGnF4j6j9IiEGNfNsYU6A.text: Huge portions. The ahi tuna salad was huge. Definitely worth it, though I went back a 2nd time and the portion was significantly less so it's pretty inconsistent.

Og9Zy6oO2WwVp4vr-9XVwA.text: This place was good and and the portions were great. We were jonsing for pasta and this was a good place to get it. The portions were huge! I got the pasta telescope, or something like that,  it was delicious.  Had good flavor not a ton of chicken but oh well...I actually had leftovers that we took back to the hotel. My husband  got the chicken parm which was huge. It was a large piece of chicken. It needed a little more flavor but it was good. I like what I got a lot better. We also got these potato spring roll type things with cheese and bacon on them and those were very tasty. The prices were decent and it hit my pasta craving so I was happy when I left. I would go back.

mHcSVTeVOtVpdU6EFnEyDQ.text: This is the Cheesecake Factory's older sister. Cheesecake Factory is one of my favorite places to stuff my face, so I knew that I wouldn't be disappointed with Grand Lux and I wasn't. Oh so lets see. This one is inside the Venetian, directly in off of the casino. They have a patio and also inside seating. We sat at the patio which looks off into slot machine land. Our waitress' name was December, I thought that was so cute! And she was on point. They bring out bread, like at the Cheesecake Factory, but it's BETTER if you can imagine that. I got the pot roast cheese fries that were of the Lord God himself and the soft tacos with pork filling. I can't remember what my friendgirl got, she was shoveling it in her mouth so I know it was good. Then we got an order of beignet AND THEY WERE DELICIOUS!!! They came with a chocolate sauce, whiskey sauce and raspberry sauce. Oh, they were so good! All in all, a great meal during my Vegascation!

Yh2H8IBKfXjWO5iuFgStOQ.text: I have to admit, I am impressed with the Grand Lux Cafe.  When you're in the Venetian and looking for a place to eat, you got high-end, food court, and their Grand Lux Cafe.  Just from the gold decor, attentive well-dressed attentive servers, and the ambiance, you'll start thinking this is a pricey restaurant to eat at.  Nope...the Grand Lux Cafe is very affordable and the prices for their cafe/grill food mimics a local Denny's or IHOP.  But that's the just the prices that mimics these chain branded restaurants.  Food quality, presentation, service, and selection is all top notch here at the Grand Lux Cafe.  In other words, you cannot go wrong here.  Grand Lux Cafe serves everything from breakfast to high quality meals like Filet Mignon.  Such a huge selection, I had to ask the waiter to give us extra time to decide.  In the meantime, we got our bread served and it was killed in minutes. For dinner, we shared the calamari which is also served with fried vegetables and fried shrimp.  I don't eat vegetables, but there's something about fried vegetables that makes it go down better.  The calamari was delicious, lightly breaded, and wasn't rubbery.  Yes..I've had overly chewy and rubbery calamari, but not here.  Cristina P. had a salad and I got the Crispy Chicken Sandwich with a bowl of soup.  Let me add that there isn't a Crispy Chicken Sandwich on the menu, but all you have to do is ask and sometimes you shall receive.  My chicken sandwich was exactly how I expected it to taste...chicken breast that's golden fried, crunchy, tasty, and perfectly sandwiched in a hamburger type bun.   In all, I have to say that the Grand Lux Cafe is an easy stop if you're hungry, undecided, and in the Venetian.  There's plenty for everyone here and the price is better than most.

eRScEENfS1o9gbYBLIXbrA.text: Chicken and waffle was great. Also, korean chicken burrito was grear too. I will come back.

OjwOO4nhYuv_yDgW_cXBOg.text: Mmm creme brulee....vanilla or chocolate? What!? I get both...for under $10!?  Delicious and affordable fine dining in Vegas. Life is good at the Grand Lux Cafe.
