The salads and sandwiches are the best options Desserts- Yes. They always please. The lemon meringue tart is one to try WIGB? yes

J6TH-hCHlUBjGAfc2YouYA.text: Apparently, these are the same owners as The Cheesecake Factory. This one is open 24/7, so very convenient. I ordered the turkey burger, which was not frozen, but home made. Thumbs up for that. I'll go back to order an entree the next time.

b0kyTRMxWUm3Tk8MsZfWOw.text: My girlfriend got a free meal from work to go to the Grand Lux Cafe. First time for both of us but we were excited.  The best way I can describe it is an upscale cheesecake factory. Awesome variety and awesome food. Service was excellent.  They gave us some bread which was very soft and tasted so fresh. Then we ordered the mashed potato egg roll appetizer. It was soo good. For entree I got the combo deal which came with chicken parm and some shrimp scampi. The food was plenty and very good. Chicken parm was on point and so was the pasta. Biggest shrimp I have seen in awhile haha! I almost wanted to drink the sauce they give you with the shrimp.  An upside and downside is it can be relatively loud with people passing by but also you can be in your own world and people watch.  I give 4 stars and can't wait to go back!

OofK2bLXml7Jo216vLQy1A.text: Ate here twice at my stay in Vegas! First time me and my friends shared the Chicken and Shrimp Jambalaya and Chicken Piccata- both dishes were pretty good! The chicken piccata could have had a bit more sauce but still tasty! The second time I went I got the Chipotle avocado burger - it was really big so was only able to eat half of it but pretty tasty as well! If you're staying at the Venetian it's a good spot for lunch or dinner- especially since they have a huge menu to pick from!

7pdoqNaZ1CvUemLgKvYCaQ.text: Great dinner at a reasonable price while visiting the Venetian. We didn't want an extravagant meal and we found this on yelp. It had excellent reviews. Our food was delicious. Service was a little slow but this place was super busy. If in doubt check it out!

WlRceti3TpjM7usHZAu9Aw.text: From a night of dancing @ XS. . . we sure work up an appetite! Thank goodness this remains open during the wee hours! I always look fwd 2 Vegas trips and eating here! We arrived here around 2am. . . located in the venetian. A grp of six hungry girls. . . I ordered the garden omelet- it came with hashbrowns and a choice of toast, bagel or English muffin. . . i got a bagel. The omelet was filled with tons of veggies and cheese.  The egg was prepared light.   Very mouthwatering! Servings are HUGE!  Service was a bit slow. . . but very friendly.   Thanks for being open late!

F57DB_ClwJYxvrnHxvltxw.text: Great service! Food was pretty good, I didn't think there was any wow factor. The margs are delicious too!

HnhcFx31kH4HHhkRONUMBw.text: I went four star just because the first Grand Lux in the Palazzo was out of eggs bennies. Out? Hmmmm.  So I walked over to the Venetian Grand Lux and sat at the bar and had fantastic eggs bennie. Huge portion and the eggs were perfect. Good hash browns and the menu goes on and on. The drinks looked great and the French toast next to me looks huge and really good. I did not reach over and have a taste, but was tempted.  Good experience considering how much food they put out! I'll go back. Maybe for lunch..

n4BDnpZxp_xL-m1YOfm-Tw.text: I'm glad I read the reviews here that made me choose to come. We had dinner here our first night and breakfast before we left. Both meals were outstanding. Huge portions and good quality. Short wait and nice atmosphere. Only change I would make would be to do their buffet breakfast instead of a la cart. Our meals were amazing but we were in a rush to catch our flight.

zrV2yUsz1SxymeH51iRBRw.text: Chain restaurant but food quality is always good. Price is reasonable compared to other high-end restaurants inside the hotel.   The Service: Very efficient and attentive. Never disappointed.   The Food:   Shrimp Scampi - Sauteed with White Wine, Lemon, Garlic, Fresh Tomato, Basil, Parsley and a Touch of Cream. Served with Pasta. Huge portion~ Lots of pasta. The shrimp is to die for. Cooked to perfection. Love the garlic taste shrimp. The sauce is very flavorful. My favorite on the menu!

GGLFVkiVnKTToZW7appIQA.text: Great place to go to if you're super hungry and drunk. I love their pasta carbonara and their pasta with grilled chicken, tomato, basil & mozzarella. They also have this noodle soup which is similar to pho, but I forgot the name of it. It tastes good though. They also give generous portions and the pricing is decent.

Y2IZnUNeO7VmVnAjKbNtig.text: Great food, friendly, fast service and clean environment every time we visited. Having this restaurant in our hotel made our visit enjoyable! Will eat here every visit!

d43nnmd2bdmc1QCaGRTMcw.text: The best desserts in Las Vegas! Chocolate chip cookies, bread pudding, waffles are sooo good. They are very reliable for salads and American faire.

P8KeyeHgMijILYAysiEW3Q.text: I have been on gluten free diet so it's very hard to find restaurants that offer GF. This place has pretty good options of GF food and it was very good.

MDbn9fVE6ZrPGVaDAAtUBw.text: Very good service and good food you can count on. Not overpriced great consistent  place to eat. Had brunch buffet and volcano shrimp.

DpXpCqycH3rXg8aOLNDLpw.text: While we were staying at the Venetian we learned that their main late night option is the Grand Lux Cafe, open 24 hours and actually pretty similar to The Cheesecake Factory but on a grander scale.   I wasn't too excited about eating here since I knew the food was probably similar to The Cheesecake Factory, which to me tastes average. Even though we came with no reservations we still got seated promptly - very happy about that since we were all hungry.   We were in the mood for dinner portion meals so we ordered and shared:  * Spicy Thai Fried Chicken (medium plate): This  was amazing!! Beautiful presentation and the portion just right; chicken was super tender and flavorful too.   *Kobe Burger: Eh, the beef patty was under seasoned and it took forever to come out.   *Fish and Chips. Delicious!! Portion was generous - we were given four strips - plus they came out fresh and deliciously crunchy. The fries that it came with were delicious as well.   The complimentary bread and butter were warm and mm mm tasty.   Service, albeit slow, was still nice and attentive. Not a bad dinner experience, overall, since their massive menu is sure to please every type of eater.

P05dlUFlvjQdukqNgYauSw.text: This is like a high class diner tucked away in the midst of the casinos' with a fancy name.  About it.  I am just rating for breakfast.  First it takes awhile for the food to come out.  However if your looking for breakfast comfort food then this will do the spot.  If you are expecting anything more special then this is not the place.  It will do the job in an eloquent setting and the prices are a tad over what a diner would cost ya.  I will say you don't have too many options for American contintental in this casino though.

ukc0hNjk-HCq5uEAjPGd9A.text: It's okay, there wasn't anything there that really impressed me. I'd go again but I wouldnt go out of my way to eat there if you know what I mean.

1DiejbH7ulmOTpDyZX4Fow.text: It's no wonder I like this place, as I really like Cheesecake Factory. Tons of options and rather large servings. Came here before when staying at the Venetian, as it's open 24 hours (or until the wee hours) so always a place to dine whenever you're hungry in Vegas.  We came here for lunch on our first day, and I just wanted a small meal since we were eating dinner in a few hours. The lunch special of half a sandwich, soup, and salad stood out to me and was a reasonable $9. Their complimentary bread was not my cup of tea since it's not very soft, but that was better for me so I could save my appetite for my lunch. The butter here is really tasty though!  Although the restaurant was not busy, our food took forever and a day to come out. When it finally did I was pleased with my dish, as it was a good amount of food for the price. The salad was tasty, and they brought my blue cheese dressing on the side. The chicken mushroom soup was pretty tasty, and they give you a huge cup of it! My BLT however...the bread was so badly burnt, I didn't eat any of the bread. Also, I like my bacon chewy, but these were burnt to a crisp. Stole some of my friends' fries and dipped it in their yummy ranch so I got my fill of carbs.  They also brought out a complimentary birthday treat for my friend, and their whipped cream was light and yummy, and the crisp that came with it was also light and tasty as well.  Overall, we all enjoyed our meals, but just wished service was quicker.

Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lunch special - salad, half BLT, cream of chicken mushroom soup

YyBHdpy8J-MPgCbPN8i2ZA.text: Wow I expected much more from one of the Venetian's flagship eateries. yelp.com/user_local_phot... I stepped up to the plate as I was debating between the Grand Lux & the new burger joint Rattlecan. I opted for the tried and True and struck out several times. I had no wait to be seated and as I was guided to my table I almost wiped out as I slipped on the greasy floor in front of one of the kitchen door. STRIKE ONE!. After studying hard to read the menu in the very dimly lit back of the resturant I decided on several items for dinner. FOOD ORDERED: Salisbury Chopped Kobe Steak House Green Salad A guy (manager?) came to me about 10 min after I ordered and told me that the chef did not like the look of the kobe beef, and would not serve it customers. This tells me that they didn't have any kobe beef. Regaudless, I had to pick another choice now almost 20 min into the trip. STRIKE TWO! FOOD Re-ORDERED: Chicken Royale and Shrimp Scampi House Green Salad WHAT I GOT: House Green Salad ... my salad and it was very good the blue cheese dressing was exceptional (although they charged me extra for it) 4****Stars yelp.com/user_local_phot... Chicken Royale and Shrimp Scampi ... I was pretty suprised by the entree it had lightly breaded shrimp in a citrius tasting cream sauce, masted potatoes grilled green beans and a thin piece of fried chicken with scallions. yelp.com/user_local_phot... This was not like any scampi I'd ever eaten nor was the chicken although tender very "royal". Both tasted ok but I was not thrilled with what I got. The Mashed potatoes wer good as were the beans even though they were cold. I finished my meal, the buss lady took away my plates and I waited for my check. And waited, and waited until I finally flagged down another waitress who said she'd inform my waitress, and I waited some more. Finally after 15 min I got a check then had to wait 5 more min for her to run my card. STRIKE THREE! Grand Lux Cafe YOU're OUT! The Grand Lux Cafe is is a very nice place with great atmosphere, maybe a tad too dark but it needs to really work on the service. I will not return to Grand Lux Cafe.

ela53AXqN4xJ7UtDOzsxtA.text: If you're looking for a casual and tasty cafe I would highly recommend this place. The portions are really big for the price. I had the pasta telephono lunch special and it was enough for 2 meals. My friend ordered the bacon cheeseburger and the patty was huge. We both enjoyed our meal and the customer service was great.

faYSjnY0udjvJpxbmk02cw.text: OMG love the grand lux anytime of day or night!  Excellent service pretty much every time i go there!  Creme brulee chocolate and regular are soooooo good!  Chocolate espresso martinis are fantastic,.  Thai chicken pizza (i get it without the chicken) with peanut sauce is really tasty!

LJIejDRvY8IsUpwKjpv9RA.text: I ate the Grand Lux Cafe located in the Venetian for brunch awhile ago and thought it deserved a good review. I was there with a group of about 15 people and the service was excellent, even though we had a large party they were quick to keep us entertained while getting our food out promptly. I ordered the Seared Ahi Salad and it was amazing! I don't recall what everyone else ordered, but there we no complaints about the food! I shared an oreo cheesecake type of desert with a friend and that was wonderful as well! Our waiter was the nicest guy. He thought one of the girls that was with us was cute, he brought her out a cute little dessert with some strawberries. Definitely plan on eating here again!

NQgtWFst-NqzdabZl6yP6w.text: For a large, casino based restaurant, this place is great. We have been here at least 20 times through the years. The food is nearly always very good and if there is a problem, they do fix it. The walk from the covered parking is a bit long so it will take awhile if you are in high heels.

S8BpcNYj3W9rA2N2OWWM4Q.text: service was prompt and friendly only reason not a 5 is a feel I got a lil attitude when I asked why the sandwich's w/mayo were on a platter on counter not refridgerated ( like health code specifys). was told they had just been made I accepted this as truth got a turkey and it was perfect. server was tammy c I was there 8-8-15 at 11.08am.

EXjucq7AoOTgajfZFM7YgQ.text: This place is like Cheesecake Factory.  I ordered a Chicken Pot Pie, which looked big with the crust on top, but it was just a teaser.  The crust itself wasn't good at all and the filling was just okay -- not too much flavor.  About 4 - 5 years ago, this place had a Lobster Pot Pie -- back then the crust was a puff pastry with lots of lobster chunks....those were the good ol' days....  I tried some pasta and it was definitely better than the pot pie.  Prices are very reasonable for Vegas.  I'll come back here and try something other than the pot pie next time.

A3G7UPTdBEQvLMGmxHRmRA.text: Love this place!  It's by the same company that owns Cheesecake Factory, only better

31QkkXVmhjvuI-M5F8fp9Q.text: Everything about this restaurant is excellent! Price,quality, service!We always take our guest here! Never ate at the one in The Palazzo.Weve never had a bad dish!

Tx0-rRxfk5gfajMe09l1EQ.text: Got the breakfast sandwich and it was great, as were the hash browns.  Price was reasonable and great for being in the Venetian.  Service was a little slow to refill waters but it was crowded.

jljzvt5X0NQxzvqYexHE1w.text: Everything we ate in this restaurant was excellent.  Even when there were long lines, they got people seated very quickly.

GU6cduIO22Dji8NxI1lCYA.text: Located inside The Venetian is the Grand Lux Cafe. You cant miss it! It is right by the escalators leading up to parking lot where valet is done. I would describe Grand Lux Cafe as a upscale Cheesecake Factory, but a little bit more expensive. It seems that every single time that I am in Vegas, I end up here. From prior experiences, I would have rated this place a 4-5 star, but it did not meet my expectations this time around. It will definitely make me hesitate whether or not I would want to dine here the next time around. Did my eagerness and excitement for this place finally die?   We arrive and sit in a booth in the bar area because we wanted to watch the Lakers game that was on.   Being in the mood for a burger, I ordered The Max Burger which had certified angus beef topped with cheddar cheese, Applewood smoked bacon, sauteed mushrooms, onions and roasted short ribs, with Fries. It was good, but not good where I was jumping with joy.   Our waitress Jina was on PMS the whole night.   She was rude and the gf kept noticing it. I was paying attention to the game so I dont know what exactly was going on. I can tell you what I heard from the gf though. She was working as if she hated her job and did not want to be there. She would roll her eyes whenever we wanted some more water, drinks, etc. She was throwing some of our dishes onto the table. She was telling us to move our drinks out of the way in a rude way so she could set down our dishes. She was fat. She was ugly. She was Jina.

diPDgtbg6-8quuQtek30Pw.text: I had the best sandwich of my life here! The beef short rib grilled cheese was out.of.this.world.period!

oiOwm0VDzyvZzwjK5pabcw.text: I was aware that this restaurant was part of the Cheesecake Factory but oh wow.. was the menu extensive. So extensive I got overwhelmed but nonetheless ordered from the lunch menu.   My sister and I had the Chicken Jambalaya. I went in with few expectations and not expecting to be impressed. Fortunately, I was. It was delicious. The waitress said that fans of spicy dishes loved this; therefore, I was reluctant to order it but I'm glad I did. However, there was waaay to much rice.   My brother ordered the Margherita Pizza. I tried a small slice and it was very good.   Dad had one of their burgers, I forgot which one. It was HUGE. He had to eat it with a fork and knife but loved it.   Mom enjoyed her Chop House Salad. However, it was too big for her to finish.

L-hIR-SjQVU2CSiEirXF_A.text: Note: This review is based on some very hazy memories of incidents that occurred at around 2:00 AM.  It was a bit pricey, sure, but the silverware was quite professionally bound in a white linen napkin. Mmm. Linen. I also remember the clear glass plates. How awesome is that? Who uses glass plates these days...apparently only the cool kids at the G-Lux.   I had one of Hannah W.'s fries. It was utterly perfect, dipped in cold red ketchup. Expect nothing but the freshest, purest ingredients when you first taste the banana creme pie, as well as the two flavors of creme brulee.  It was really dark in there, for some reason. It made me sleepy. But we had also arrived just in time to beat the clubbing crowds who were hunting for a last-minute snack. I love it when that happens.

mr6mGeMDQ9xXD-Otl81_GA.text: Service was above and beyond! Not only by our waitress, but also the night manager was thoughtful and generous!

vNLklmcQffKyrNabNAYPxw.text: Owned by Cheesecake Factory, we figured it was sketchy at best.   But decent for a quick lunch before an afternoon of shopping. Surprise! It was actually quite good. Ahi tuna burger, rare the way I asked, and quality tuna. Wasabi cream on the side. Side salad sub'd instead of fries, and it had amazing yummy bleu cheese on it...and a light dressing.  Bread...ooohhh try the wheat, delivered warm to your table, you slather on the butter and think you're in heaven. Okay service. Lots of iced tea refills and fab girlie convo...welcome to Vegas.

ppGCj99YYwP4d60GOJLheg.text: BEST ALL-EGG-WHITE OMELETTE!  They had the best all-egg-white omelette I've ever had. Ordered it for lunch. (Mushroom, spinach, onion, Swiss cheese). Also ordered tomato slices as side with bagel and cream cheese.  Returned to this place for dinner the same day, and ordered the veggie as a meal with 4 veggies, but didn't know it came with a bowl of rice in addition to 4 veggie choices. If I knew, I wouldn't have ordered a starch as a veggie. Mushrooms, chili cornbread (starch), spinach, broccoli and bowl of rice. The Chili cornbread was a bit heavy with butter/oil, but was flavorful.  I then returned AGAIN the following morning to order the same awesome omelette, but it wasn't as good. The second omlette was not as fluffy, not as flavorful (less buttery flavor), there was too much spinach, and not enough mushrooms, but it was still a very good omelette.  This was my favorite place to eat on this trip.

lokBiIUBlZXjkqMZvcXIiw.text: We came here for breakfast and thought it was a great place to eat.  Had the chicken and waffles with maple pecan butter and my wife had a scrambled eggs plate.  Everything was very flavorful and the service was good.  The place is slightly dark but looks a place you want to eat at.  It does cost a little more than breakfast should but eating on the strip always cost a little more.  Wish we came back for lunch to see what other good stuff they had to offer.

XlQ3FWxFsBd3B3Oojg9GMQ.text: I enjoyed bread and butter. The Greek Salad was ok but seemed to be missing something I couldn't put my finger on. The mahi mahi dish was cooked nicely btu also was missing something. It wasn't exactly bland but as said, missing something. But it was a decent enough meal. On a crowded night, when I thought they'd never get to my table to take my order, the waiter appeared, When I thought, where is my salad, it is quick to make!?!? it appeared, and the waiter was friendly.

J1C3ZFu2-bBgmtgFkEcmyg.text: "One of these days, if you keep putting those retainers in a napkin, you're going to lose them," (The Mr., 2009).    "No, I'm very careful with them," (Me, 2009).    (1 hour later...)  . . .  Grand Lux's elite search and rescue team were on all floors searching for my clear Invisalign retainers, d'oh!  It ended with a call on my cell phone 2 hours after going back to our room telling me they found them!  Now that's SERVICE.   Service 5**** Aside from going above and beyond their orthodontic duties, they constantly follow up with you when they sense even a bit of a wait (which happens a lot during the wee hours of the night)  Food 4**** This is the late night go-to spot if you want good food for relatively cheap prices to pre-nurse your soon-to-be hangover the next morning.  It's a much better alternative for those of you who don't want to walk through "ghetto row" to get to the Steak and Eggs at what used to be Barbary Coast.  ------------------------------------------  Short Rib Grilled Cheese  $12.00 4.5 ****  It has that sweet salty flavor from the meat and the caramelized onions paired with melted cheese.  Mmmmm!  We've tried other items as well where the food is delicious, but the last weekend was one of those rare sober trips that I could actually recall what I ate. =)

EZOoCImQNH3Uh6eLgguTGg.text: the thought of room service crossed my mind when i was staying at the venetian... then after opening the room service menu and doing all the math, my head started hurting because so much tax+fees had to be added for everything on the menu.  skip the room service, just walk your lazy ass downstairs to the grandlux cafe and pick up something and bring it back to your room!   i ordered a fruit cup and clam chowder for munchies and it was so good!  my clam chowder was definitely pricey ($7) but it came with a loaf of sourdough bread they serve at the restaurant, enough for me to dip my soup.  fruit cup came with assorted melons and berries, light enough for my hungover self.  you can order/pick up your to-go items right at the bakery (full menu from restaurant).  the restaurant itself is 24hours and provides post midnight menu, a classier alternative to cheap $5 steak and eggs.  p.s. grandlux is a sister restaurant of the cheesecake factory, quality standard guaranteed.

ePtsPmshH3Ca5K47mY09WA.text: This the best veggie burger ever....or at least so far.  Always quality food here!  Been eating this veggie burger for years now.  A++ and thanks for having a superb veggie burger option on the menu.  Some places have a disgusting frozen patty.  Yours is fresh and tasty!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veggie burger is 5 stars

ZCUfjes1cN2TTol22CizPg.text: Great food and staff. We went in for my birthday dinner and everything was great. She even gave us a waffle thing with whipped cream and a candle lol. Most places don't even do little things like that anymore.

K-8qOf85Eo5x9f82-RdfCQ.text: A must go to while in Vegas ! Loaded mash potato egg rolls and sliders yummy. The brunch is also good as well

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

KWmdFgeWRSeXBKvRZ7I9kA.text: 1st time visitor here,beautiful atmosphere & service was outstanding.Out here on business and we had a table of 8. Everyone had something different and we all enjoyed our meal. I had the miso halibut over rice,boom. I'll be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Q2-ilitl-xoyC5S2FJX3OA.text: There are 2 locations; one in the Venetian and the other in the Palazzo Hotel. We called in a to-go order; but realized we called the wrong location. So to all readers be sure to contact the right location.  The food is average to good; similar to other Cheesecake chains. The staff is friendly and accommodating. The prices are reasonable. The to-go area is separate from the main dining so it's somewhat quieter; but still nice. Open 24hrs... big plus!

PkOZM2eU-uOejXfOaLaMGw.text: Don't known how I feel about this place. Appetizers were on point especially the chicken quesadilla but Our entrees which consisted of Parmesan chicken with spaghetti and crusted pork chop were pretty lousy. Parmesan chicken has no flavor whatsoever and my pork chop was a waste also. I was very disappointed with myself because usually I will speak up and make sure that we return the food if we aren't satisfied for some reason. Spent $100 while there. Their non alcoholic mint pineapple drink was pretty good. Give them a try but I don't recommend our plates. They have a huge menu to chose from. Might be back to give them another try soon. Portions are big so you may want to just share an entree.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Parmesan chicken
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken quesadillas and fried calamari mix with shrimp, onion rings and zucchini
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crusted pork chop

ssWzu0X0XuPAyDyCjMUpKw.text: I am in a nationwide search to find the best mushroom Swiss burger and I found the best here so now I must attempt to find one better than their mushroom truffle burger. Our first night staying at the Venetian we wanted to dine in the suite so I ran downstairs and got take away. Fantastic food but the mushroom truffle burger was certainly the star and a whole new standard the burger joints of America must live up to.  There are a ton of gourmet burger establishments in Vegas but don't discount this restaurant for a fabulous burger.

W5l5M0kL0Bei6XJ3TzHYZw.text: The place had a nice atmosphere, the only thing I didn't like was the smell of cigarettes.  I wasn't able to enjoy my meal. Since the cafe is in the casino I didn't have a choice.  We decided to take most of our meal to go.  Once in our hotel we ate our meals and everything was great. The sweet potatoes fries were delicious and came with a great dipping sauce. For their food portion, it was great for the price.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lunch &amp; dinner
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast

OuTrEkCCeZW8ZY6MF1WJPg.text: Food n staff were amazing patient n very knowledgeable about their menu. Drinks were super strong. Chicken n waffles was the BEST. Appetizers a re so large of a quantity you might not eat all your main entree

O_Fzg8924BAlljJAhhOYAQ.text: My first time to try.  I was there to eat a meal and I was there during Happy Hour.  I was told I could not be served a Happy Hour drink but I could go to the bar and get one.  The bar chairs were full and bartender busy doing something so it was going to be a nightmare to try to get a drink.  So I had my mediocre food and mediocre service from the waiter and got out of there.  Very disappointed and will not be back.

MIKsEq0Hsb8nzuCMzIkSQQ.text: I watched a food server speak rudely, several times, to the the man at the next table because, as a visitor from a foreign country, he did not speak English well. My friend, in fact, had a word with the waitress, asking her to be civil.  On another occasion, we watched the server deliver our food to another table. Realising their error, they picked up the plates and placed them in front of us. I spoke to the waitress and said they should serve us fresh food, not food that sat at someone else's table.  On yet the last occasion, the manager informed me I was confused which restaurant I was in when I told him the squashed 14 inch waffle I was served was not the fluffy Belgian waffle I had been served and eaten at the restaurant for many years. He told me the waffles were always squashed flat.  Honestly, these all add up to a place that I don't want to visit again. I may find another Grand Lux to eat at in the future. Hopefully, they will have a management team that cares about its customers.

47_2xS8JBrWTO8lVn6lwYg.text: Are you looking to stretch a dollar on the strip? This is the place for you! We were not expecting anything crazy since we came here brunch. But holy smokes can, their portions could feed a family of 4 for $10! I ordered the sandwich lunch special which came with a Caesar salad (full size!), Cream of Mushroom Soup (they say "cup", it's a bowl - and huge too!), and a half BLT sandwich. When the waiter first brought it out I had to do a double take! And everything was SO good! It was morning and I also had a coffee, and at the end the waiter asked if I wanted a fresh cup in a to-go form. I almost cried from happiness.  Best place - will be back next time we're in Vegas!

fPsTXD977doxXtzonIU8jw.text: Who doesn't love a 24/7 food place?  Located just outside of the Venetian casino, it has an extensive menu with really decent prices.  This is the second time I have come here and I love love love our server Ashley ! So fun upbeat and friendly!   This time I ordered a peach Bellini - my go to drink. It was surprisingly frozen and delicious - just how I like it!  Yum I wish I would of known this earlier.   The steak sandwich was cooked to perfection, and my husbands pasta ( chicken carbonara) was also amazing.   We came here 3 times during our stay, each time it was great with the exception of the first time when my husband had calamari - it was just ok .   For selection, value, service and hours of operation- you really must try this place! Thanks again Ashley !!

JDNZDzXuJ9cQS1PSBxPSjg.text: Great atmosphere, wonderful staff and amazing food!! The food cost is quite appropriate. We left full and satisfied, and that's not always what happens when eating out. Often we are left full yet unsatisfied. This was not the case here. We will definitely return.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Buffalo Chicken
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grand Fried Calamari

yBeLikEkvVehrikjXR99gA.text: It was pretty late when I arrived in Vegas on a Friday night thanks to a flight delay. Most of the good restaurants on the Strip were pretty much closed for the night and I didn't really want to settle with McDonald's, Denny's, or White Castle. And because I didn't rent a car for this trip, I couldn't venture out to my usual late night off-Strip spots like Jinya Ramen or Bachi Burger. So I decided to hit up my old reliable late night eating spot, Grand Lux Cafe. When I got there, I wasn't in the mood for a burger since I had one just a few hours earlier before my flight from SFO. So I went with ordering a couple of appetizers from their late night menu, the Pastrami Reuben Egg Rolls and the Buffalo Chicken Rolls. I kind of almost regretted ordering two apps though, because the portion sizes for each one were ridiculously huge and could basically be considered a meal on their own right. Pastrami Reuben Egg Rolls -- bit.ly/1TBZAi2 Hot Pastrami, Melted Cheese, Sauerkraut and Mustard in a Crisp Wrapper. Served with Thousand Island Dressing and Pickles These were seriously good! Basically you're taking everything that's awesome from a reuben and rolling them up into crispy egg rolls. Buffalo Chicken Rolls -- bit.ly/25jdk39 Chicken Breast, Cheese and Our Very Spicy Delicious Buffalo Sauce all Rolled in a Spiced Wrapper and Fried until Crisp. Served with Celery Sticks and Blue Cheese Dressing These reminded me of those buffalo chicken rolls that you get at 7-Eleven, but kicked up several notches. I liked with how much chicken was in each roll and how the buffalo sauce had a perfect amount of heat to them. So basically I ordered two sets of uber egg rolls, but it didn't bother me one bit, especially since my waiter said they were two of his favorite apps on the menu. I was struggling to finish both though because of their portion size, but I pushed through and finished!! Honey Vanilla Latte -- bit.ly/1sRc7Tb Double Espresso, Honey, Vanilla and Steamed Milk I ordered this basically to keep my night going into the wee hours of Saturday morning since my plan was to stay up as long as I could to make up for the lost hours from my delayed flight. And it definitely did the job. It was a nice flavor! All in all, I left Grand Lux Cafe stuffed, very satisfied, and ready to continue my late night gallivanting on the Strip. I'm glad that they still deliver with quality late night eats!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Honey Vanilla Latte
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Buffalo Chicken Rolls
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pastrami Reuben Egg Rolls

u0uLPhutMDrWAyAc5DlvYQ.text: Good for later dining casual. Always delicious American fare dining. Great for all day dining.  Our favorites include Sunday Night Pasta, Shrimp Scampi, Grand Lux Burger and more.  The food is tasty and the atmosphere is welcoming and calming away from the busyness of the casino.  The service is nearly excellent 100% of the time, so let's call it 99.9% perfect.  The menu has so many diverse and interesting choices on the menu it would be impossible to not find something for everyone to enjoy.  I find the pricing to be very fair; actually, we'd be willing to pay a little more because the food is really good!

Ul9iFtP-fNPVKFGR_iIJ0A.text: Located inside The Venitian hotel, this restaurant is definitely one we would come back to.  Brian started us out with some amazing bread with butter.  We just had water for our drinks.  Talk about a Breakfast gone Beast Mode!  Honestly the hubbs and I coulda shared his chicken w/waffles.  This dish is their popular menu selection.  The chicken strips are very well battered, moist and juicy, not so badly fried that the chicken is dried out.  We almost finished it all but had to bring left overs back to our hotel.  I ordered the eggs, hash brown, ham, bacon and English muffin w/a small side of fruit.  Good grief these plates were on point and so filling and then some.  For the price, are you kidding me?  What a deal for so much food.  Again we ordered waters but it was $39 for us.  Convenient, great food and Brian was such an Awesome waiter!  Offered us so many options and fast service on refills and requests.  Definite recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

TPwITjJUVjEegUHfBcqvoA.text: Everything tastes just like the Cheesecake Factory (its owned by the same people) so the food is generally good. The pizza was a bit greasy, but fine. Definitely could split between a few people. Fair warning their ranch has garlic in it, like a lot. It's a nice atmosphere though. I was full or I would've gotten the brownie dessert, it looked mouth watering every time it passed my table.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

WvkrhnicXxFu_-kpeuyJAg.text: Excellent food and great service. Have patience because this place is typically packed, but worth the wait. Excellent cafe late. Exceptional breakfast and lunch. Haven't had dinner, but I would venture to say it is probably just as good as the breakfast and lunch.

1aT-ycvoRSkkj43U8R8lKw.text: My husband and I were looking to have a quick lunch. As soon as we walked in they sat is down right away. Our server Brian S. Came right over and took our order. He was very friendly, we didn't feel rushed as he explained some of the menu items. We went with his recommendation and so glad we did. We never had to wait for refills and our food came right out. Really enjoyed our lunch thanks to Brian.

Mt6lRK7gknv9P2pkhaYUXQ.text: This is one of my favorite restaurant at Palazzo! The servers are very attentive & accommodating! Got seated right away, without a wait! My boyfriend got the T bone steak & I got Carbonara with Chicken. Both very delicious & very fulfilling! I would definitely go back to try the other pastas!

t681Nc5AnrtyTD6MUgYMfg.text: Great service. Tons of great options to choose from! Bread & butter served first. I had the Pear & Strawberry salad... so refreshing! Plenty of space for big groups. Full bar area. Although, restrooms are across the way in the casino. Remember this is on the Venetian side!

r_d2urPk76Ljhz1CucuN5A.text: An affordable, good ambiance, good food restaurant with lots of options from yummy burgers to salads and more. Lotsss of options on menu. Friendly and attentive staff all around. Best part? Open 24 hours!

87qckwfusnu3Ra5j7oE-aw.text: If you're craving eggs for brunch on a weekday past 11 or 12, good luck finding it anywhere else besides Grand Lux -- I did, and failed. Although the food and service here is always on point, I wanted to try someplace new, but Venetian doesn't have any breakfasty places that serve any eggs at the time we got hungry. We ended up here and were satisfied. One dish to share is plenty -- portions are huge!

3W6T59o6NOIyfxTtU3eoZw.text: Horrible service and cost arms and legs!!! Waiters and managers were super rude and apathetic (back on May), we waited for a service almost an hour,, children food did not taste good, Very disappointed,, We'll not come again!!!

Sl1tcSq7kqYJTqMR1ts7SQ.text: This place was much larger than I expected, so we didn't have to wait for a table. The menu has fantastic variety, and the drinks were great! The only two things keeping this review from five stars is that there is no bathroom, you have to go out into the casino, and some of the menu items we ordered were not the best tasting (eggs Benedict) and others were very small portions and an odd take from the description (biscuits and gravy). But the omelet was great in both portion and taste (I shared with a buddy), and the service was wonderful.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

vF-SDuyudpx45uPeQATYdg.text: My favorite restaurant to go to !! I love all their food especially the cheesecake since it is tied to the Cheesecake Factory . Love the ambience

MtmY4FCfajkOf6D7N7Yp1w.text: My boyfriend and I came here on a Saturday night after spending the afternoon wandering around the Strip with our giant margarita.  We weren't very hungry as we'd been to the buffet earlier in the day and didn't want to go very far (especially after we walked all the way to Planet Hollywood the evening before).  We were seated very quickly (honestly we only had to wait as the hostess was seating another party that arrived mere minutes before us) in a lovely little corner booth that was much needed.  Anyway, our waitress quickly appeared with water and answered our questions regarding the food.  I'll be honest, I cannot for the life of me remember what my boyfriend ordered that night, but I do remember what I ordered...mostly because I asked questions about it: the Indochine Shrimp and Chicken and some non-alcoholic refresher drink.  The food wasn't awful, but at the same time I don't believe it was completely memorable either (as you can probably tell).  This was a decent experience as neither one of us were really motivated to find somewhere else to eat - so if you are staying at the Venetian and don't want to go very far or spend very much, this is nice place to go!!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

x-ns5zW80wXt43pIM-D5mQ.text: The fried chicken and waffles. Oh. my. gosh. This is a MUST EAT! I love fried chicken, chicken tenders, chicken nuggets, basically any version of chicken that's fried, but I'm not a fan of chicken and waffles, however, these ones blew my mind. The fried chicken was perfectly seasoned and crunchy and the waffle was fluffy and airy. The syrup was sweet but not overpowering and everything tasted so savory and literally melted in your mouth. It came with like four pieces of fried chicken too so they don't skimp!  The buffalo chicken rolls were crispy and full of flavor. The buffalo flavor was stronger than I'm used to but I still liked it. It's listed as an appetizer but it's filling so share with a friend.  I substituted the shrimp scampi with fettuccine noodles because I prefer thicker noodles to thin ones but they were undercooked for my preference. I like my noodles a little softer and these tasted a bit gritty. The dish was overpowered with lemon juice. All I could taste was lemon. Even the shrimps tasted soaked in lemon juice. It was disappointing and not worth the $22.   Pasta carbonara was okay but nothing special. It didn't have much flavor. I wouldn't get it again.  The side caesar salad was about $7. Should've just paid the $3 more to get the entree size.   The waiter checked on us a few times but we had to ask for the complimentary bread after being seated for about 20mins. We didn't realize we were even suppose to receive bread until the two tables seated after us were given bread first and we had the same waiter. Unfortunately, it wasn't anything to rave about. It was bordering cold bread and lacked flavor.   TLDR; Come for the fried chicken and waffles!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp scampi with fettuccine noodles. Lemon overpowered the pasta and the noodles were a little under done for my taste
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Side Caesar salad
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Buffalo chicken rolls. Sooo good! Highly recommend!

mtu1uJ4wxyx97CmB-JcTAw.text: I've generally been very unimpressed with food in Vegas, but I stopped here for lunch while at a Conference and I was pretty impressed.   I got a few appetizers as my meal -- the Asian nachos, the potato skins egg rolls, and the tuna ceviche. All of them were pretty good. The Asian nachos were definitely the star of the show. I also enjoyed the egg rolls. The ceviche was a little disappointing though.   The restaurant was pretty full, but luckily I didn't have to wait to be seated. The service wasn't that great as I didn't see my waitress except to order and get my food.   I would come back here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tuna ceviche
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Potato skin egg rolls
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Asian nachos -- amazing

Q3RVZniTtQo2GtD33cjrTw.text: Great service in the bar and the biscuits and gravy tasted great. I don't usually order that for breakfast but the bartender suggest it, so great pick!

MxQpBsDGuDENhbukE2zkyg.text: Honey listen, this Braised Pot Roast and the chicken nachos (sorry my pictures are not the best but they were so delicious; we were hungover).  The braised pot roast is perfection. The mashed potatoes melt in your mouth. The vegetables are well seasoned. Everything on this plate is well seasoned and omg mouth watering. Trust me. Perfect for when you're hungover and need a hearty meal haha. ;-)  Those nachos were the best nachos ever. In fact, I cut pieces of my pot roast and put some on the nachos and I'm just drooling thinking about how good it was.  EVERYTHING IS GOOD HERE.   Not pictured are the drinks. We didn't order alcohol as we were already too drunk haha. I had the Pineapple Mint Splash and he had the Passion Fruit Ginger Crush. Both were insanely good but we ordered another Passion Fruit Ginger Crush. Add a shot and boom, the best drink you've ever had.   Come here EVERY time you visit Vegas.  Love you Grand Lux, ever since you were in LA, and sadly left us. I'm still missing the birthday dinners here. Nothing but the best here.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

mZrwU98U0qLuYNFv0gv8eQ.text: A busy breakfast place! I wanted to give them a higher rating, but the service was terribly slow.   The line might be long, but it goes by quick. Typical breakfast dishes like omelettes, pancakes, etc... The prices were reasonable for being in the Venetian. I had the french toast and it was nice and fluffy.   This is a good place for all, family, couples. But just keep an eye of your waiter and make sure your food is put in.

fr1dqu-pYM8cl3mjum_LLw.text: The food tastes so good here! And they have the fabulous service with a fair price!!! I'll definitely choose this place again next time I visit Vegas!!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

IY2qpa1rli_DYW_j9LMnMw.text: I came for breakfast and dinner. Both times I went were amazing. The Red velvet pancakes were so yummy . It was sweet and fitted my personal tastes. I came with a couple of friends and they ordered light breakfast, the Benedict and the omelette. They said it was normal and were ok.  After a few hours of gambling and walking around taking pics, we decided to try this place again but for dinner. On yelp it showed that shrimp scampi were on top favorites there so we tried it. We weren't that hungry so we ordered a salad and 2 plates of shrimp scampis to share. The salad was nice and refreshing. The strawberry and pear complimented the salad dressing quite nicely with the cheese as well. Shrimp scampi were delicious. The shrimp was breaded and fried; they had a lot of flavor. The pasta was ok, it had a little too much lemon but the creamy sauce managed to tone it down a little. I'd definitely recommend this place for any hour of the day.

Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp scampi
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Omelette and hash browns

Lw1fT_396gTxK2MjQDU-3Q.text: Every time we go to grand lux it is always delicious!  they have a really good happy hour their pineapple martini and calamari is so good.

Rbxb9oRRM3QidvHmsC0BKQ.text: The food was good, but it wasn't worth waiting 40 minutes at our table for it to arrive. When the entree did arrive it also arrived with my appetizer.. my no longer warm appetizer.. Dropped the ball on this one

xXYMlcuH0VY2AIP4BEiKMQ.text: The bartender here (young dark-haired male) is the ideal bartender you'd want if you were starting a restaurant. Efficient, knowledgeable, personable, and most importantly... he made killer cocktails. Despite not staying at the Venetian and falling in love with the Encore during this stay, the experience at GLC may swing me in the other direction. Pretty good prices too.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

bcZZfNKkWWkB7ddUyWLddQ.text: The $45 half bottle of Veuve Clicquot was by far the best part of the meal. Burger was soaking wet, couldn't even hold the bun. Salad was similar to what you'd order from Wendy's.

wWkPWCEMVJPKRszFLAAosA.text: It's another classic 24 hour cafe, nothing bad and nothing outstanding. Well, perhaps the fried green beans are, because I enjoyed them:). Fresh ingredients- absolutely. Service, decent- we sat at the bar and ordered cocktails and food. Perhaps it's simply best pit that a 24 hour LV Cafe is a perfect union of traditional comfort food and a casual bar. Ambiance, well none it is a 24 hour eatery in a casino.  Best option for a quick bite, etc. it's fine.  For me it always comes across as a glorified diner.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

YxrCwWuy9yklGLiYPIu-_Q.text: Most places in Vegas are overpriced. This one especially so.  Ordered a burger medium rare. I don't know if the grind is especially fatty or if they cook their patties in clarified butter, but it wasn't good. I just can't understand how someone could let a burger leave the kitchen in the falling apart, bizarrely cooked fashion in which it arrived on my plate.  Not a fan.

VaRiuA_VbnOC8vd5OtpSSA.text: I've been a guest at the Venetian several times and every visit I eat here multiple times. It is open 24hrs a day, and in Vegas that is appreciated! I've never had to wait long for a table, even with a group. The menu is very extensive and I have tried many items from their breakfast, lunch, and dinner menu. I'm never disappointed. I enjoyed the brunch buffet on my last visit. I know I will return.

CpaplGIyiTI-0k8ozmAZ4Q.text: Great place to go after clubbing til the wee hours of the night! We got:  Scrambled eggs, hash browns, sausage: The maple sausage wasn't quite sweet enough, but not bad. The hash browns I also thought were too thick and not crispy enough, but the eggs were pretty good.  Crab cakes: YUM. I really can't say any more. Texture was amazing, plenty of crab, delicious dip...nom nom nom!  Italian vegetable soup of the day: Very salty but plenty of veggies. Good after drinking so much.  That's all I had/tasted. My other friends got a pizza that looked amazing and a seared ahi tuna salad that also looked great!

a3tiSQ-TydV1XlfPQ8-x4Q.text: We have taken with ourselves Chicken Royale, is it has been impossible, disgustingly prepared, have thrown out. I demand return of money. Marika.

YBWFdhmHaUyImDLL2jgUTQ.text: I like this place, it's one of the more affordable places to eat on the strip (if you don't count the endless fast food).  From the makers of Cheesecake Factory...  I actually came here twice over 4 days on my last trip.  The first time, I came for lunch, after winning big across the street at The Mirage.  I had just ordered the 10oz. burger with bacon and fries.  First, you get a big ole' loaf of bread, then you get your great entree. The burger was good and done correctly (it didn't leak when you lifted it up).  The fries were crisp, hot, and plentiful.  For dinner, I had ordered a sandwich.  Again, it came with bread and lots of food.  The service was fast and the physical location is great, right next to the casino and the restaurant is huge!

SHXNgOlAs4x8ymSyhUurGg.text: Had the Chicken Angeli. It was crispy goodness and came with asparagas and gnocchi. Place was classy looking and we also got free bread and butter. Would go here again!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Angeli

S-lC4CiO0XV2zEHsASl0UQ.text: It was slow glassware had water spot the silver wasnt polished went for late night dinner i wasnt feeling well.just got married first dinner out with my wife. i took 2 bites out off a ribeye i order as i tasted it it didnt taste right i had to go to the restroom couldnt find one i threw up a little as i came in i was kick out by the bald bearded manager instead of asking me if i was ok or offering anything to help my upset stomach, he was really rude i was taken by surprise by his attitude for a hospitality professional than he tryed to make pay for something i didnt eat in a to go bag. i refused to pay since he kicked me he threaten me by saying he will call security if i didnt pay in other words worst service ever this will never happen at omni or any other 4 diamond resort i recommend you let him go or transfer him to work security or complete retraining as he followed out off the casino trying to security for help for his lack of training ticket number 2284 server ahmet time 23:52

pAyvajz56uD4hLfZU1ueqw.text: 24 hours open...all u need in Vegas!  We were at the Vanetian and in need of food as we had been without any since dinner so decided to go to this one based on the review we read and we were not a bit disappointed. We were there around 6 AM. That time we only had the option on breakfast buffet. The buffet was pretty amazing with many options. The guy will make an omelet as per your customization and it is pretty heavy! I was almost full by the end of it! tried a couple of pastries and cakes and all were amazing. I definitely would like to go there again. $18 for all you can eat is a good enough deal too.

RL0kPpXnrE1fnkYFSL1p6A.text: During our recent trip to Vegas, we got a chance to check out the grand lux cafe in the Venetian. There was a 30 min wait or so and it was pretty impressive, considering the restaurant is so big.   I had the buffalo chicken sandwich, which was the best I have ever had. Our waiter was a great guy and he was kind enough to bring me extra buffalo sauce. We left satisfied.

fay_9kIti5yvNaxmw2dQYA.text: I'm not sure if they're owned by the same company, but I like to think of this place like a higher quality/fancier ingredients version of the Cheesecake Factory.  So in True fashion, definitely expect huge portions when dining here. I would recommend sharing...everything.   Also, order a box of the chocolate chip cookies to go....though I think you need to warn them about 20 minutes before ordering...it says something on the menu.They taste amazing, especially when they first bring them to you fresh out of the oven. Your group will thank you later that night when they're stumbling back from the clubs looking for something sweet. Also, it's quite the deal for a Vegas establishment.

V7O8vK2Z0rAtzWFsgJkcOg.text: The Chicken Mushroom Soup never gets old here. It's perfect with the free bread they give out.   I also got the Cuban Sandwich here, which isn't a pressed sandwich here. It's not toasted from the outside, which is a signature of the Cuban, but it was still good.   The Chicken Parmesan was enormous ! It was definitely big enough to feed two people. It also came with a serving of pasta.

Q7LQ51Hn1C7eu1ep3YHagw.text: The portion are huge, had the blueberries pancakes, waffles with chicken and the omelet with spinach and mushroom was a top notch. Don't care if the service were slow, better than the food court. Worth it.

VRAxBpV4k8mxXLs6lEdXEQ.text: Service was a bit slow at first. But it was worth the wait. Delicious huevos rancheros!!!! The French toast  was fluffy, and custard based. The sauce links were blah. Strawberry Bellini pretty, but just ok. Good spot for breakfast in the Venetian

_YuQf8_bGYA0AoIKi0zO5w.text: Food was not good! Too salt. There is a lot of other places with better food for better price. On the plus side the bread they gave was good. Meal size was decent.

4Rkz70WzORk-llanmTxnXQ.text: Other than going to the buffet, Grand Luxe is another must-hit restaurant when in Vegas, especially because its "As good as it gets!" after a late night on the strip, as it is open 24 hours!!  Portions are big (I made a meal from a small salad and their crabcake appetizer) and you really do get what you pay for.   The best salad I've had (ever) is their Roasted Beet and Goat Cheese Salad made with Mixed Greens, Fresh Roasted Beets, Goat Cheese and Toasted Pistachios Tossed with a Hazelnut-Citrus Dressing.  The menu is not as extensive as Cheesecake Factory, and Grand Luxe is more expensive, but when in Vegas...

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Roasted Beet and Goat Cheese Salad

v34Ckf3t-fn5vZFklAvekQ.text: We always have such a great time here. The food and the service is always great! Everything I've ever gotten from here has exceeded my expectations. More recently I had the big (5) stack of pancakes with a butter maple syrup. Holy hell, I've been craving more ever since!

7fUMSVfUVllab8bvQoFggw.text: Their foods are pretty good here. We had a large party but was seated right away for lunch. Not sure if it was because we were in a big groups our waitress wasn't so attentive to. Their portion of foods were pretty big here and tasted pretty good. Where I didn't even realized they brought me the wrong order until I already dogged in (maybe because I was too hungry) but it tasted goods so I'm not complaining. Hahah but overall if you want a quick meal after the long night you had, definitely try here.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

inI5gBk4j-GCpEkO605xXw.text: This place earned the 5th star for 1 reason. Our waiter Kevin. But I will get to that.   The Grand Lux is one of my wife's favorite places. Unfortunately the one we usually go to went out of business.   So being her birthday and us in Vegas...it was a must.    We were a group of 10. Many first timers. We started with Appetizers. Asian Nachos, potato spring rolls and calamari.   The Asian Nachos were just how I remembered.  So much flavor and depth. The spring rolls were cooked just right. I don't generally like Calimari but tried it and it was so good. The batter was great.  Main course. Everyone's food looked great, but I will comment on mine. I ordered the modern Cuban sandwich. It was so good. Crunchy bread, full of flavor. The meat was cooked perfect. I love a hearty bread and this was it. I just wish it was bigger.   The waiter, Kevin, was attentive and there every single time I even thought about needing something. He made us all feel like VIPs. It was a great night.

_qKjIl0cLFbWoOcPWcFUtA.text: Service sucked, and did not expect to pay $12 for a Moscow mule that doesn't even come in a copper mug

X2AxrooM7m6nJP77D-ytig.text: My go-to for post clubbing food. Good food, decent service, reasonable prices, good portion sizes.   No complaints. It isn't "OMFG! this is the best place ever," but I am a fan for sure.

fymIdFU0ZX3iVcJyHyUVlA.text: Great for late night dining! After Tao....this is the spot! My fiance and I ordered buffalo wings and fried calamari at 3 am. The food was good and definitely hit the spot!   Since we were staying at the Venetian, we ate here again for a late lunch the next day. The lunch portions were a perfect size. Food is good, you won't be disappointed.

ZQAzhjlwdajbdwiXaIB72g.text: This place gets 4 stars for being open 24 hours a day, serving Cheesecake Factory food, and being consistent.  If you are hungry, no problem.  The portions are HUGE.  The location is inside of the Venetian hotel, just near the elevator bank.  The prices are reasonable, but there might be a wait.  You can order food to go.

dfXk0pVKnXZMbe1AB5oARg.text: This place is pretty good. The food is not the best, but it's good. The buffalo chicken wraps are really tasty. The chicken parm was a bit toooo breaded, but even the lunch serving is MASSIVE. The "small salads" are huge! Just on food, I'd give this place 3.5 stars. BUT! They're 24 hours which is really nice to have a place 24 hours in the hotel and the price is right! Most places in Vegas, the pricing is at a premium, but this place? It's a deal!! Ate here 2 times with a family of four and both times got out for just about $50.

JK4aHoA8goI67l_jB0IiYQ.text: Ok came here for the late night munchies after a typical vegas saturday night.  I was just at their counterpart early that morning for breakfast and I was extremely happy with the food.  This time around the food selection is not as large at night, which was expected but the food was not outstanding.  I would normally expect the opposite since it normally seems that food is that much better after you've been drinking all night long.  Fries were, chewy, not sure if that is the right word but definitely looked like they just came right out of the fryer.  So maybe old, not sure.  Burgers were good but once again nothing special.  I still give this place a 4 stars since service was still top notch and food was still good for a late night joint.

mOV6lVw5dCl9csZyjkkevw.text: Seriously, the shortrib grilled cheese made the 5 hour drive from the OC worth it. It was all we could think about during the drive. Super greasy. Super oniony. Super good. Super duper.

1JTj4BNkSHPAgl-s-USkAw.text: Never got to the point of eating anything. The server was beyond rude. He almost hit my wife in the face with his elbow while setting the water glasses down. Cut her off while she was trying to order a drink after he asked what she wanted. And we left when He got pissed off that I asked for clean water glasses since ALL three had green food pieces in the glasses with dry food chuncks on the outside of them. I know it happens but to jerk the glasses off the table splashing water out of them.  Maybe he was having a bad night but we didn't go there to get treated like crap.  So Sadly I can't speak about the food. But there is an Italian joint up in the food court that was really good. :)

ZZQOVYJEgfr8XyUmlsDWRA.text: Good price and tasty. I just ate at their cafe located next to the theater and had a salad ( only $6 and huge!!) and a cake ($5 and fresh). This is very reasonable price!!

FTnEWtUkd6fdKWVowbISUA.text: It was nice to find a reasonably priced place to eat with in Las Vegas. Our waiter was super nice and he mentioned that his wife was also a waitress there and they worked the same shift; now that is love people.   Back to the review.   Right from the start the waiter told us that the portions were huge so if we did not eat a lot that we could get a lunch portion or might want to share.  The honesty was refreshing as in Vegas all everyone does is try to up sale.   The food was great. Me and the g/f split a pizza and the LUNCH/half portion Sonoma salad, delish.  As I said about portion size, we couldn't finish that and gave it to one of the many down on their luck people we say on the bridge. Funny thing is that when I gave the half pizza to the homeless couple, the woman looked right at me and said, thank you, god bless, but what I REALLY need is some matches.......you can eat matches?

0mxCgSyJNJl9ugWa8s6OyA.text: Food is OK. Nothing special. It's super greasy, tho. If you wanna gain extra lbs., this is the place to go.   Server - they gave me a headache. I asked him to wait for 15 min to bring  the desert that I was ordering - but he brought it right away, like in 1 minute. You know why? It was right around time for him to leave - and he just wanted to get tipped before he leaves - He even complained about it to me- don't do that to me, man. Talk to your manager.  Also, it isn't that great to see servers counting tips in front of customers. Ha ha.

K6Ql8suHur2w_OONh1UV6g.text: Love this place! Went to the one @ Venetian for Chicken & Waffles after the club. Then again for breakfast. I recommend the red velvet pancakes, mocha & eggs benedict.

PdKRd9pl1AHbOfBfh9LPSw.text: Great variety of menu items...food is good.   Definitely a place to try again and again.

b0nq8KrNddoHA6VQgeeg5w.text: Grand Lux Cafe, this place is da bomb. Everyone in my group who came here did not have a negative thing to say about it. Satisfies you like a restaurant should, by giving you bomb ass food. Their breakfast menu takes the cake, you can try ordering other stuff on the menu but I havent am im content only knowing the breakfast menu. Located inside the venetian. Kind of like cheesecake factory in that it has other ethnic food like pho, but dont order anything thats not American, will cause you to dislike

qvlJgKgJQMuslErJOmDxzA.text: The food was okay nothing really special on the buffet menu. Fast and friendly service though is nice.

2tQzXbeicCIxuRRpFW8iQA.text: The food was greater than I expected! I had the chicken tortilla soup and tried my boyfriend's clam chowder. Both so delish! There was no wait when we went in around noonish. I ordered the Sunday Night Pasta and it was good! We definitely didn't expect to get full so fast, so we had to box 2/3 of our entrees home. This place is in the Venetian. I never wanted to try this place just because the one in LA had really bad ratings, but for sure I really only go to the Grand Lux Cafe in LV.

ztMdDskqfzMXxOcO4myXEQ.text: Huge serves, fresh crunchy vegetables and lettuce, it was too tasty. One of the salads we had even had shredded fennel in vinegar; who knew you could get food this good in Vegas?  We set off searching for the first meal of the day. It's 3.15pm, and the drums of the American beer gods are gently thumping. I need  food and fluid stat.  Paddy says lets go for this, then changes his mind upon approach, to the noodle place. I don't care what everyone else is doing; if I don't eat, I'm going to kill someone.  This place was a real surprise.

p_UJhbgMh7xzoPokpzepeA.text: One word: Dependable!  We ate here 2-3 times on our business trip to Las Vegas. We always seemed to gravitate to this restaurant...we couldn't help it. It's dependable. The food is good and this place always seems to be open!  The first time I came here, I was having lunch. I ordered the Buffalo Chicken Sandwich. It wasn't the best I have ever had, but it was good. It just was a lot of breading and a lot of bread to eat at once. The second time I came, it was after a party...so everyone in our party was looking for a late night fix. I ordered a ham and cheese omelet. It was pretty good.  Nothing TOO much to say here. If you have been to the Cheesecake Factory, it is pretty much just like that. it is a dependable place with tons of choices for everyone in your party.

jKSI1Ox3UjzH6FuzSzFQmw.text: We ate at the Grand Lux Cafe at The Venetian in Las Vegas and it was our first time.  The only thing that I heard about this place before we went was that it was a spinoff from the creators of The Cheesecake Factory.  I figured it would probably be good.  We went for breakfast one morning and took our two kids.  My wife opted for the 'Express Breakfast", aka the buffet.  They had all sorts of fresh fruit, pastries, yogurt, bacon, sausage and breads.  They also had cook to order omlets.  My wife enjoyed it all.  Pretty good for being a buffet.  I ordered the Chilaquiles off of the menu.  I couldn't have made a better choice!  Delicious ranchero sauce, cheese, scrambled eggs, tortilla strips and I'm sure other stuff. All I remember was that it was heaven.  My wife thinks I'm crazy because I kept talking about how good my breakfast was the entire day.  In fact it was so good that we went out of our way to go back the next day for breakfast.  Unfortunately I can't comment on other menu items but the menu was large and varied as others have already mentioned.  Also, the portions are big.  Great food, I'll be sure to stop by whenever we are somewhere that Grand Lux Cafe is.

hXrF3Q23r8CcmE275_12jw.text: Grand Lux Cafe...       Thank you Grand Lux Cafe or I would have not survived Vegas for a week. My boyfriend and I stayed at the Venetian on our New Year's Vegas trip. I ate here at least 3 times; the first time was at 3 AM on our arrival night. I ordered a club sandwich, which was pretty good on an empty stomach from my 5.5 hrs drive from LA to Vegas. I ordered the sandwich from the bakery because the line was long for the restaurant itself due to club goers. I was disappointed when the guy at the register told me that the wait time will be 40 mins. 40 mins for a sandwich! He was lucky I was hungry!        A few days later I grabbed some lunch from the bakery, I had ordered a BBQ chicken pizza and a Caesar salad. The pizza was really good and satisfying. The salad was fresh and the dressing was tasty. My friends had ate some lunch from the cafe about 30 mins earlier, when my boyfriend and I arrived at the suite we were luckily to have some of their calamari. The calamari is to die for!! It comes with an array of dipping sauces and in the mix of calamari - there are some pieces of zucchini. After bites and bites of calamari, it's refreshing to take a bite of the soft zucchini. It helps balances the taste of the calamari. Especially with fried foods, after a handful I'm usually sick of the greasy taste in my mouth. The calamari at Grand Lux is fried perfectly and keeps you wanting more. The portions of the food is pretty good too.        On my next Vegas trip, Venetian and Grand Lux are definitely on my hit list.

h84GxDud5n9afjQOookKoA.text: I feel a little unfair giving them only three stars since I've only been here once and it could have been an isolated incident but 3 stars is still "A-OK"  We stayed in the Venetian and the Grand Lux is as convenient as it comes for Venetian guests. Right below the rooms, around the corner from the guest elevators and open all night.  When we went, it was 3:30am, we were all buzzing, tired and STARVING. We were sat rather quickly, despite the line, served water and menues, had our orders taken, then left alone... For forever.   After about twenty minutes, a waitress swooped by and dropped some bread on the table. We get bread?? About forty-five minutes after that, we're all falling asleep on our table and our waiter comes by to apologize for the wait. He said everybody ordered breakfast all at once and the cooks are overwhelmed. Understandable enough... Until we looked around and no one in the restaurant is eating. If they're cooking, shouldn't SOMEONE be eating?  Fast forward another half hour and we decide to cancel our order with the waiter and go upstairs, right then, of course, our food shows up.   Now, there are 260+ reviews that will tell you the same thing, but just to be another to say it, the food was delicious!! Of course it was delicious! I was a little sad that I couldn't finish it all. I got the Chicken Flautas, they were crispy on the outside, creamy on the inside and the avocado sauce was just spicy enough. It's apparently one of the more popular late-night orders, along with the Buffalo Eggrolls, which I was told were also kind of perfect. My friend that ordered the Egg White Omelette said it was THE BEST omelette he's ever had. That's as good as it gets, literally! So I don't know, is the amazing food worth an hour and a half wait in the middle of the night? Your choice. Be drunk enough to not care or not hungry enough to notice.

CBTXtpixmPa_jr-Ildzmtw.text: HAD THE MAX BURGER!!!! OMG! SOOOOOOOOO F'IN GOOD! Certified Angus Beef Topped with Cheddar Cheese, Crisp Bacon, Mushrooms, Onions and Roasted Short Ribs. Served with Fries. WHAT?!?! a burger with roasted short ribs?! I should've added avocado on that thing! one of the best burgers I've had...and it was a nice big burger. I couldn't finish it (I normally finish all my food and then some). Downfall is...it took a real long time for them to get our food out. Our waiter was nice...but he never gave us bread! :( I'd come back though and have another Max burger!

fJ_nVBGR2rY8UIailCJR4w.text: Great service, great for large parties & Asian Nachos/BBQ chicken pizza is a must!

K3k61-PeEEDhrsuTskbHzg.text: This is the best value within the Venetian  in Las Vegas.  As I understand it it is related to Cheesecake factory.  They serve large servings and it was always good.  I ended up eating there several times.  I found it better then many of the celebrity restaurant on and around the strip.  When your tired of spending too much for so so food, go here.

aJDsLtIUOvMJA0T50z-nTQ.text: The last few times they've disappointed.  They do not have as good of service compared to when they opened, over 10 years ago.  Also they have smaller portion sizes..... They really don't have the level of quality control that they once had, either.    And they are not getting any cheaper.  I'm all for the same food and a more expensive menu. But when the food quality and consistency drops and then the price goes up.... that is bad business.  We've stopped recommending them as we once did.  Years past we'd  tell everyone they had to go but now we don't.    Hopefully, they revert back to the good times.  PS~ this review is for the original Grand Lux Cafe in the Venetian.  Not the newer one.

9foLarUNwz3y26LsXUP9pg.text: I've gone to the Grand Lux Cafe in Palazzo and Venetian and had a good experience at both.  They are apparently in a few different states.  If this seems similar to Cheesecake its because it is!  Its part of it.   The portions are HUGE.  You hardly ever have to wait for a table.  Its pretty casual yet the decor is very GRAND.    There are so many things on the menu that someone is bound to love something.  They are quick with service and its the go to spot if you want something better than the McDonalds, Chipotle and less expensive then the places in the hotels where you HAVE to make a reservation.   You would never think such nice expensive hotels Venetian and Palazzo would have something like this but it does exist!  I'll come here ONLY after I've gone to the Buffet at least once during the trip. haha  Oh PS the wait staff is super friendly.  The waitress is giving my friend a super hug. haha. So Vegas

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Part of Cheesecake Factory.Huge Portions. Friendly Staff

vryluDEO-8Zn-Blr_mF7ww.text: This place had great service and everything was quick and fast with the refills on the bread and on the drinks, which is awesome and what I expect when I'm in Vegas ! :)   The food though isn't that great in my opinion. I had the Miso Glazed Salmon because I wasn't feeling good at the time and didn't feel like eating lots of beef and heavy meat soo I ordered the salmon.   The dish was soo huge and the piece of fish was gigantic, so big I took only a few bites and I was done!! I should of shared with someone which was downfall.   If you want to eat here, you should have a really big appetite !!

hOVmX6Le8GKqjbTOERQcdQ.text: I had the experience of eating at the LA location years ago, and I remembered it to be quite fancy. Nowadays when my gf's and I do vegas, this is the place they die for after a night of partying. They go bananas for the potatoes egg rolls, I mean BANANAS, IE. 2-4 dozens! its pretty good but I think I like to change things up sometimes :|

veZfJlwYEcmHY_snnVqcLA.text: Basically like a cheesecake factory, but open 24 hours....  Located in the Venetian, this is the sister restaurant to cheesecake factory so expect it to look the same- huge venue with a lot of the same variety and eats on their menu.  Just minus the big ass cheesecake menu, though they still have some on the menu.   I think this is a good place to hit up when you have a big party (came here for a bachelorette weekend) and you just want something casual.  I'm a cheesecake factory fan so I liked this place too.  *Chicken lettuce wraps- It's no PF Changs lettuce wraps but it's still ok.  Huge portion too, I ended up sharing it with others.  *Margarita pizza- can't go wrong with this and it was good here.  *Sunday Night Pasta- meat sauce w/ chunks of beef short rib, mushrooms, onions, garlic and parmesan cheese.  This was sooooo good!  I'm drooling just thinking about it.  Wish they had it at the cheesecake factory in SD.

K3adzO_DenNR-pqJstNSjQ.text: My GF and I came to Vegas for a week vacation. She had been to Vegas couple times and I went to school here so I conceder myself a local. We stop by the Cafe to get some breakfast based on other reviews. At first we were both really impressed on the decor. We were seated immediately but friendly and helpful wait staff to a very nice booth. I ordered the bloody Mary  with the chicken and waffles and my GF had the croissant egg benedict.  PROs: 1.) Nice people and very nice restaurant.  2.) Drinks were good, I can recommend the Bloody Mary. 3.) Chicken and Waffles was great, plenty of food and the syrup was good.  4.) Reasonable priced given the decor and food.   CONs: 1.) Wait staff took a while to get the order and bring the food. They were nice and it did not look that packed but it did took a bit too long  Final: We would go back

t5Na1k-HEQ-K9_pz9lxrWQ.text: Must visit while in Las vegas!  Foods proportions are ginormous! And the price is great.  Only 4* because the food is kind of bland.

18-bmDwW-EEg8KdNMDUgtg.text: This really is my all time favorite cafe to eat at on the Las Vegas strip.  Whether it is for breakfast, lunch, dinner or late night it really hits the spot for every meal.  Best part of this place has to be all their pasta dishes.  I haven't ordered a pasta dish yet that I haven't liked.  Everyone defiantly has to try the pasta dishes if you ever get a chance to come out here.  I've also had  a chance to try some of their appetizers and breakfast food and it was delicious!    A couple of the YELP reviews below were complaining that it was a Cheesecake Factory owned place.  Doesn't really matter to me since their menu is completely different than Cheesecake Factory.  Overall a great cafe to try in Las Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ccB3EvlHaP7SDvBctIOVOA.text: Love this place!  2 locations in Vegas, one at the Palazzo Hotel and one at the Venetian.  I had originally walked over the Palazzo location Friday night for dinner at 8pm but was turned away due to a kitchen problem?  Anyway, it was a short and quick walk over to this location.  I was quickly seated on a Friday night and it took my server a bit of time to get to me.  Its okay because I had bread and water and the extensive menu to look over since there is tons of choices!  My server did not mention the specials to me...I overheard the other server next to me tell his tables the soups and specials for the evening.  I usually never order specials but it would of been nice to hear her mention it to me as well.  Anyway I decided on the Sunday night pasta entree ($18) and a side broccolini ($5) for my little one!  It was a good choice!  I loved the taste and the soft stewed meat in the pasta dish. It was different but very tasty!  Loved the side order of broccolini as it wasn't drenched in butter or oil like some other places, just steamed like how I like it!  Flagging down my server for the bill and a box took a bit longer than usual, I was in a rush though, I had a flight to catch in a few hours, so maybe she didn't want to rush my Friday night dinner.  So no biggie, she didn't know.  All in all, I loved this place.  Big portions, good food, and a great atmosphere!

10Udj_lUdFlBsHbVcM5S5Q.text: Grand Lux Cafe is a good place to eat if you are indecisive on what to eat because they offer an extensive list of dishes. You want steaks, got it. You want Asian, got that too. You want Cajun, yessir!  I had the Rib Eye steak with whipped potatoes and it was decent. It's not the best Rib Eye I've ever had, but for the price, it was tasteful. I requested a side of horseradish and mixed it in my whipped potatoes. Man, it was bomb...gave it a lil' spark (no pun intend), which I like.  I stay at Venetian/Palazzo on most of my visits to LV, so Grand Lux Cafe will always be an option.

vzwCIXH9ieuKePdnuwM1JQ.text: They bake you cookies to go with you! How great is that! FRESH BAKED COOKIES!!! funny part is that this place is known as "cheesecake factorys cousin"

scWropmHptDjLnCojz0yTA.text: Love it here!   I went here for a friend's bachelorette dinner and we all ordered a little bit of everything and ate family-style a few months back. Service was fantastic and swift. Huge selection to choose from. Monstrous portions. Deliciously cooked food.   Went back again recently with the hubs and actually remembered what I ordered this time around since I was, ahem, sober. We had the Fried Calamari appetizer, Madeira Chicken, Cajun Shrimp and Chicken Jambalaya...mmmmmmm. I wish I had a more room in my belly. We barely touched our dessert of New Orleans Beignets since we were stuffed but we just had to try them out.  I just wish my eyes weren't always bigger than my stomach.
