I was feeling gross from all of the unhealthy food I ate the day before so I ordered the protein breakfast. Great, healthy option...sometimes you need that after a night out. There is a breakfast buffet until 11 but since we were seated at 10:45 it didn't seem worth it. My friend ordered hashbrowns, eggs and sausage. The sausage was the best, not too greasy. 2 entrees + drinks = $40. I thought that was very reasonable.

OA5u_tEU44F9Jeb_sLQsAw.text: Crabs cakes were off the hook and the food was good. I wouldve gave it 4 stars but the floor was super duper greasy like it was coated in butter. Me and my friends kept on joking about it the whole time it was that bad,.. It felt like we were ice skating lol. Mop duty anyone?

OFGYJw-x9WEuSWpa-Z0zjA.text: I can't believe I haven't reviewed this place.  I really like this place.  Portions are massive.  The food is good.  The place is beautiful & clean.  The chicken pot pie is delicious.  Their chicken sandwiches are also nicely done (pick any one of them and you won't be disappointed).  The fried chicken strips are also fantastic; they're not overly fried and they're perfectly tender.

5aFqPtsZEFmh-Rmm9zL5mQ.text: Huge menu which makes for a challenging selection. The prices are decent and so are the drinks. The food is very basic. Don't be in a hurry when you stop by, this place is a little slow.

ZlwAXC8nyQcUH5h0maLPhQ.text: Stopped by here after a horrible Lunch somewhere else to get my grandma and husband some dessert the cashier was so sweet she recommended a cherry danish and Both the fruit tarts I love how the fruit is fresh and she told me everything is made fresh daily I got ended up getting 1 cherry danish and two fruit tarts when I got home they had the fruit tarts and said they we're scrumptious thank you for making such great sweets we are locals and will definitely be back

Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

qXSeY4tFaEVjqY3glL9k6g.text: The Food is good.  Had the mushroom and chicken soup which goes well with the bread they served.   Also, had the avocado and chicken salad.  Could have used more avocado.  However it was good.  Portions are large and this place has never disappointed.  Service was excellent.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ErYQ0-Sq4JfG6TY9KKh4hQ.text: Some of the best food I ever had food quality clean food and it's right next to the casino

omh_nRlGqYCyEIjuvwrEaQ.text: This place is like cheesecake factory- decor is horrendous just like cheesecake, the food is good enough, just like cheesecake factory and the menu is giant just like cheesecake factory.   With all that said, the place is super convenient because it's large and they have an extensive menu that will satisfy anyone- even the pickiest (and most annoying) of all eaters. Good for people who don't like to try new things or spend a lot of money- the food is basic- basic american food.  I came here and ordered breakfast- which was fine but I really liked their strawberry smoothie.  I was in dire need of vitamin C, fruit and I didn't want to eat because my jaw hurt and I was hung over so I drank my breakfast and was rejuvenated.

iwlEiGGtEdW9l3TWzl5YvA.text: Convenient, classy, excellent service, HUGE menu to choose from... can't ask for much more while in Las Vegas. Located inside the Palazzo, Grand Lux is perfect for breakfast, lunch, or dinner. There are so many great choices on the menu - it is sure to please any palate. The staff is attentive & courteous. Oh - and the portion sizes are more than generous. They are sure to satisfy.

VuY3zKDqxc-vcMZVoR8bSQ.text: This place is surprisingly good. I had the chicken and waffles. They were surprisingly very good. Chicken was crispy and the waffle had powder sugar and pecans. The bartenders are very attentive and drinks were good.

Haw-zzfTa8k4op9OWdG03w.text: The 4 stars is strictly for their brunch menu & nothing else. I came here for brunch with my coworker & the food was really good. We ordered the biscuits & gravy and the fried chicken & waffles. Both dishes came with a pretty huge portion and both were really good. The biscuits were seasoned and came with scrambled eggs underneath it as well. The fried chicken was crispy & the waffle was really good with it. It was just the two of us & we couldn't finish because the portion was huge so we ended up taking it to go & giving it to our other coworker upstairs (we were staying at palazzo). One dish would be enough to share between two people.  The next time we came for lunch w my bf & his friend's, and the food was so-so. My bf & I decided to share the jambalaya dish with half shrimp half chicken and the dish was pretty bad. It was filled with bell peppers and did not have much of the jambalaya flavor. There was also not much sauce compared to most jambalaya dishes & it was pretty dry & just bad in general.  I would definitely recommend this place for breakfast or brunch, but other than that, I would not come here again for lunch or dinner.

5fBVPAqIveVblCFvGgBEFw.text: This place was great. The kids really enjoyed their meals but the salad selections were oh my God delicious. I didn't expect the size and the taste to be that perfect. The Mendocino Salad was my favorite. The dates, goat cheese and the dressing was so good and To top it off they had cornbread chucks made it even more better. I am planning on going their again tonight just for the salad. Loved the salads.

X5c-uB48lPAn0YdC7Or4XA.text: 4 stars for the ENORMOUS portions. I am so glad the waiter warned us about the portions prior to ordering because they are seriously massive, which was great for sharing and for the price. The dishes aren't too expensive less than $20 for a dish in Vegas. Grand Lux is located inside the Venetian and it reminded me a lot like Cheesecake Factory.   Some of my friends and I came in on a Saturday for lunch and there was no line. The ambiance is very ~dark and sultry~ seriously a replica of Cheesecake Factory's ambiance. They have a variety of pastas, burgers, pizzas. We had their pepperoni, sausage, and mushroom pizza which was pretty big for $13 the pepperoni was a bit salty, but I thought it was really delicious. We also had their chicken marinara pasta with mozzarella super yummy after a night of drinking. They also have free bread which is great for a starter.   The customer service was great. They're very quick and helpful. I'd definitely come back when I'm in town and we're in need for something carby with large portions. :D

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pepperoni, sausage, and mushroom pizza

1dvM3lRaumZ_LLGffYJtuQ.text: Went to Grand Lux inside the Venetian hotel twice because it was that good! Went with a group of five and only ordered three entrees because their portions are huge! I guarantee anything you order will be delicious. The food, atmosphere, staff are all great :)

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ukbQTmVW8_0qEZhaPgUrNA.text: The Grand Lux reminds me of a better version of the Cheesecake Factory - the ambience is very similar. Our server was excellent - she went out of her way to make sure we were happy and content, and made sure there was always bread on our table. The food here is pretty good, but their Brussels sprouts are to die for! They tasted similar to that of BJ's, but maybe it's the Vegas magic that made it incredibly memorable. I'd definitely come back here whenever I make it back to this city.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Warm bread
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cream of chicken
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brussels sprouts side

futqbkGujGJ6Eexp0mkivw.text: I ordered a protein breakfast to go and the menu specifically says "egg whites". It was to my dismay that I was given whole eggs. My husband is a chef and has told me to NEVER send your order back so I will eat everything else on the platter but not the eggs.... it's just a waste of money, when I paid for egg whites and didn't get them. Everything else on here is delicious but they just didn't get the eggs correct.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Protein breakfast with egg whites??? Doesn&#39;t look like it...

9ROLh8d_RfofuRt-KKzspw.text: Got to love this location on the casino floor of the Venetian Hotel.  Extensive menu and excellent food but the world knows this already.  I have eaten in several Grand Lux Cafes in shopping malls but this location is quite the turn on as you can't help but feel the buzz from the casino and somehow not smell the fumes of the smokers.    This is definitely a bargain compared to the dining options other than fast food, in this magnificent hotel.

_-Rzi2AGUWFH1w_RAV4U2Q.text: I've dined here a few times over the past years and can't believe that I've never left a review.  Imagine the Cheesecake Factory but with pricier food.  Similar quality, better service but cheaper than other dining options within the hotel, yet alone the strip.  The best part of this place is its location, especially if  you're staying in the Venetian or Palazzo. You just walk down from your room and you're there.  They provide large portions and the food is actually very tasty.   They have a full bar.  What's great is if you have a comp, you can use it here too!  What's better than great tasting food?  You guessed it... free great tasting food!   Be back soon.  Thanks for keeping me full without breaking my wallet.

iyoiwvcHtcDSO22ytKOWaw.text: I ordered a chicken Caesar salad and at first they forgot to give me it then when I came back for it there was no dressing. Terrible service.

QPRrRhmFCxB0sGkNuUOIWg.text: Celebrated my 30th birthday dinner here with my closest friends! Our server Claudia was so sweet and nice! I had the strawberry martini which was way too sweet for my taste. It had strawberry infused Tito's, which sounded great but was too sweet! I had the soup of the day, cream of chicken. I wasn't amazed by it, it could definitely be creamier and have a little more salt. For dinner, I ordered the garlic shrimp pasta, the portion size is big so i had enough for leftovers later. Claudia was so sweet to pack our food with silverware so we can eat it back upstairs at the hotel. They gave me a little ice cream bowl with a candle for my birthday, which didn't make me feel like i was turning 30 so i'm ok with that!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

EARHWBCSpBGqGGNw9vFJeA.text: Stopped in for a breakfast brunch. It was delicious! So very many options on the breakfast buffet and - considering it's Vegas - it was reasonably priced. The pastrami hash is wonderful. The coffee is wonderful. Eggs Benedict is wonderful. And there is so much more. Don't let the little desserts fool you - they are amazing! This place is a real gem. Their service is impressive.

zh48XT3IshDXFKoYWbD_ow.text: Typically Grand Luxe is pretty good, but unfortunately this morning/ afternoon they were seriously lacking in the food preparation department. Ordered an omelette with peppers, onions and ham. It seemed someone decided season the mixture for me. It was rather salty and the ham tasted a bit off.  Other than that service was good and food came out in a timely fashion. When they have the Buffett brunch, it's delicious and I highly recommend it.

XTANiKM3HYKZmguZQI8CKA.text: The breakfast itself was outstanding. The fruit was incredibly fresh and I'm convinced that they made their own fresh squeezed orange juice. The 4 star rating is due to the size of the buffet and location. It's inside a door way which was super confusing if you weren't sitting near it. In addition, it was a tad confusing because normally at buffets you pay before you enter, but this place seats you with a menu. The items in the buffet ranged from scrambled eggs, to the breakfast meats, various pastries, cereal, oatmeal and the fruit bar. It was kind of comparable selection wise to a holiday inn express. The quality of the food was very good. Only complaint is the eggs were a tad runny and the sliced ham was cold and on the dry side. It is 25 a head on the weekend, but does include your choice of juice.

ut24VrjQKaW2GqmVtVkAqA.text: Enjoyed this restaurant. Large selection of food on their menu. They open 24 hr so if you are feeling like breakfast waffles for dinner this is the place to go. Service was good. The lettuce wrap chicken was delicious! Big portion for appetizer. Could def eat this as entree! Their chicken and avocado salad was also good and large portion. Shrimp scampi was too oily, will skip this dish next time. Will def come back again.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

eWVHqIcRchuJCDa2vXbuKw.text: I ate here when we stayed at Venetian and was pleased. The portions are huge-the food is good-and so was the service. Ambiance was perfect.  There is no need to dress formally here, you can show up in casual clothing. The location is great-right next to the casino area. When I was here-it dos get crowded so I would avoid typical meal times and show up later or earlier. Overall, good experience and a great place to pop in for a bite to eat.

T4DfanNWJD78Ec_aDWxd_Q.text: Went there for breakfast this morning and was pleased with our experience. The service was was on point. Had the express breakfast and was happy with everything I tasted. Omelet was delicious, fruit was fresh, and the muffins were fresh!

2ZUs5jnHvZjgM9fDPGc0XQ.text: Excellent service for brunch. Our waitress Amanda was personable, attentive, and overall provided outstanding service.  When she learned that I had a bad experience at a fine dining place (Mesa Grill) last night for my birthday, she decided to make me a special birthday treat.  You cannot ask for better service and hospitality from a waitress.   On top of that, the food was quite good for brunch food. I would definitely go back to this place when I'm in Vegas.

3Ac2dIIpeTdZiRTdZkfJ_g.text: Went to grand lux cafe in Venetian and ordered same cedar plank salmon as my friend. My salmon was at least 25% smaller than his so I requested that they cook me another one. Waiter proceeded to take BOTH of our plates away after having already waited 40 minutes for our food. I stopped the waiter from doing this so I could avoid starvation.  New plate of salmon was undercooked so I ate the edges. Spoke to a manager about my 25% smaller salmon and he gave me a whopping 25% off my salmon dish only. Where do they find these kind of people?!

DJg92yLAQpFFGHVcz0pKZg.text: Grand Lux is quite possibly always on my to-do list when on Vegas strip. Salads, pasta, and their signature entrees never disappoint. I will say the location in the Venetian doesn't have nearly as many menu choices. No beignets. They also don't have bathrooms inside the restaurant.

bcnKd-1XJZ-YhC4xRUgn6g.text: WONDERFUL! Amazing selection of food and always always delicious. I come to Las Vegas and time and time again The grand lux has never ever dissapointed! I always get the Hawaiian smoothie and ask for the bread :)

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The beignets were AMAZING

56LN3EyqSeHEW3REXXzcOg.text: Went there recently for my birthday with a party of 6. Service was great and the food was amazing. I had the beef Wellington which was the best I have had anywhere. From the pot pie to the short rib spaghetti everyone's meals was excellent. This place was so great we were even debating going back the next morning for breakfast. I would say this is a hidden gem on the strip.

IhYc9oOPN7n33rbs3GSnEQ.text: Great food and great service!! I visit everytime I'm in Las Vegas. I've had it for breakfast and dinner. I always come for their chicken and waffles and the portions are huge! My husband had the fried fish and chips and his portion was crazy big! I will visit here everytime I'm here. No doubt!

CErbdtEwaLZcJUqxUqrl3w.text: Such amazing good food and they are open 24/7 it's way better then late night cheep food with out the over budget price

ZUqed0DI807gE2FQsASMaA.text: The food is very tasty, well prepared, but served in rather big portions.  It may even be wise to order just one meal for two people.  For a very nice and elegant restaurant, the prices are decent. Our service was a bit slow, but courteous nonetheless.

swmynB23Rw3KA_1OS-RAUA.text: This place was more between three and four stars. Everything we had was fine, but nothing was spectacular.   Service -They told us when we arrived that one person was taking our order and another would be taking care of us after, due to a shift change. The heads-up was good, but when the order came out wrong, the second server wasn't that helpful in fixing it. One of our friends ordered an egg white omelette and it came out made with eggs. He asked the waitress who said they could fix it, but it would take awhile. Shouldn't something they messed up be expedited?  Food -We all got eggs or an omelette. The omelettes were pretty large and not greasy. My husband and I got ours made with veggies, and it definitely came with a lot of fresh veggies. The home fries they were served with looked like they were frozen and heated. -Bread came in a basket for the whole table with butter and jam. It was toasted and pretty good. Nothing special, though. -Not really their fault due to when we arrived for our meal, but wish they served breakfast for longer.  Drinks -I just had water, but my husband and our friend each got a bloody mary. It was served with two pickled asparagus on top, which they both enjoyed a lot. They said they drink was a healthy amount of spicy!  Ambiance -This is one of those places right off the casino floor. I get that many people come to Vegas for this, but it's actually not an aspect I enjoy due to all of the cigarette smoke. We were seated on the perimeter of the restaurant, so quite close to the casino. The restaurant is all open to the casino, but perhaps requesting a seat a bit further to the interior of the restaurant would block this smell a bit?  This was pretty quick and easy, but given the amount of options in Vegas, not sure I'd run back.

3NNXd7zMiH4qY4R1KhtK1w.text: We were so hungry after I arrived at the Venetian. After checking in, we went looking for places to eat. We didn't have much time as we had to catch our show at TI later. The Grand Lux looked grand, so we went right in. I took the server's suggestion and got chicken pasta with mushrooms - it was good! Wifey got fish and chips which didn't have much kick to it. We went on another day late night and got a dessert. A little pricey but got variety of food.

L9Y8GNgJ-VUV-jZhuZCXpg.text: Quantity, quality and people watching.  The 3 best things when you're in Vegas and grabbing a meal.  Add some good coffee and good company and well...you've got yourself a winner before you even hit the tables :)  Was happy to hear there's one of these at Roosevelt Field now but the 2 hr wait there turns me off!! I'll be waiting til our next trip to Vegas i guess...

kmRbEF4oTm7l6MGn5Z_Xig.text: We ate here two times and the food was delicious, timely and on point. We were looking forward to eating here as this place had a great reputation. I believe the food deserves 4 stars, no complaints about the food at all.  However, the service was quite a disappointment. One bartender in particular, a lady named Lina, was so rude to my dad because he did not have his ID on him as he ordered a beer at the bar. He is someone in his late 50's, and we simply could not believe her attitude and the backlash from her. He's a very reasonable guy and her rudeness and arrogance was disgraceful. She would not even give him time of the day to ask to go and get his ID from the room, although he clearly was above 21. I know there are rules and regulations for bar tenders in the US as I have lived here for almost 8 years, but her attitude was beyond arrogant and narcissistic. We did not eat there the third time, because of Lina. The rest of the staff was very apologetic on her behalf, but you do not give attitude to your customers when they're clearly over 21 and the CEO of global company that held a conference next door at the Venetian. She had the audacity to start explaining to my dad that they ID in bars "all over the world" which was just laughable because I do not believe this lady has even left the USA based on her arrogance and demeanor. Very disappointing. Safe to say, we will not be returning.

FilfAy0bx_Nouxhfrkt6Mw.text: Grand Lux Cafe is under the same ownership as Cheesecake Factory. We tried Grand Lux last year on a whim while looking on Yelp and we have been back every Vegas trip since! The best dish here is the pasta carbonara! Their free bread at the beginning of the meal is just great as well... so warm and soft.

oe95-w-pDRfM5vLMDzYWfw.text: Someone once told me that this is the busiest restaurant in the world given the amount of people they serve 24/7.  Not sure if it's True but I believe it.  Grand Lux Cafe has a great selection of food and everything is always done well.  The only negative I can say about this place is the floor can get oily and slippery.  I've never experienced that in any other restaurant but here. Depending on the hour of the day you come here, you can feel like you're sliding on grease.  Besides that, it's a great place to get good food at a decent price in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Southern fried chicken

ZwkL700gOFpoEvJ_MEBRpQ.text: Hungry at 4am in Vegas? Feet hurt? Need some grub to cure the booze you just pounded?   Grand Lux Cafe satisfied those needs - we ordered Carbonara and a salad of some sort.  The pasta dish was HUGE we couldn't even finish it (and we were drunk) and that says alot because we should be able to DOWN it all.   But it was so filling!  Totally coming back when I'm in Vegas next time for some late night eats.  No idea how I got home.. I think I walked or cab'd it.

UnNWW-z4DyKI4feR1U88OA.text: Came here on a Saturday night.  Host never wrote our party name down.  Waited for 20 minutes.  She admitted that she just blew us off when we were trying to make a reservation.  Then waited for another 20 minutes for our waiter to decide to bring our drinks.  All this for mediocre food.  Save your money and time people.  You have been warned

OYEQsiWr3CM5e70Wis9G0w.text: I've been to Grand Lux Cafe twice now and both visits have left me happy. I'm a fan of anywhere that has breakfast/brunch options all day, and Grand Lux offers just that and more.  On my last visit to Vegas, we came here for a late brunch and were seated right away, despite how busy the place was. They have a pretty extensive weekend brunch menu and lunch menu so there's tons of options to choose from. I ended up getting the eggs any style and your choice of bacon, ham, or sausage links with toast and hash browns. This was more than enough food and my tummy was very happy.   Service was quick and efficient. We were helped out by a couple different servers and they both always made sure we had enough water, coffee, and were both more than happy to give suggestions/recommendations.  If you find yourself roaming around The Venetian looking for a solid breakfast/brunch spot, Grand Lux Cafe is perfect. They are also open late night, so it's definitely an option when you're coming home from the clubs.

_SVLHq8GmIKv8kckya6CUA.text: Updating review after our 2 breakfasts. Just go for the buffet! It's a simple buffet if you are looking for good food without breaking the bank. The service has been great all 3 trips. It is located right by the room elevators and next to the casino without being too loud.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bar area

rhSVJ1E-P7ysyBO3wPtFLQ.text: WOW, huge portions. Like BIG! Bigger than my. . . . . .  After Tao, best place to eat is at Grand Lux. Ordered the burger for $13, and the size was BAM! I ate the whole thing!  The misses ordered a breakfast item and the portion were enough to feed 3.   My favorite part while waiting for a table was "WHO DAT? WHO DAT? Who will beat them Saints? This was cheered by people waiting in line before the Superbowl. What a nice atmosphere.    I joined in and cheered also.

O6xyNpKkG_1mXbeW8PkPXg.text: Late-night meal fix (and I mean MEAL) with an extensive menu.   I don't understand why but there's only one guy working the front when the demand is clearly high. This means we waited about half an hour for our food.  But we were hungry at 4am.   The burger my friend had boasted a patty that was an inch thick. At least. Another friend ordered a shrimp scampi with scarily large shrimp and my omelet had a 10-inch diameter...and we ate it all.  Delicious but the wait during such a crucial time of need resulted in the docking off of 2 stars. Oh and it's pretty expensive for drunk munchies.   Pro tip: The premade sandwiches are freaking DELICIOUS and only about $7, which is the best deal on their menu.

LKanymnQhajp-f4jN0mXmg.text: One of the more affordable meals at a very upscale casino (Venetian).... food is what  you would expect from the Cheesecake Factory family. Been here several times, my favorite dish is the Short Rib Grilled Cheese. Good service and good food. Huge menu!! (Can be good or bad lol). When you are hungry, everything sounds good, and there is a lot to choose from! Hard to make a decision.

OWAh1lvACgl98waS17AOMw.text: I love that this place is 24 hours and has this fancy upscale feeling. Most 24 hour places aren't as nice as this one.   We came here during dinner time though, not during the wee hours of the morning. And the place was fairly busy but since we had reservations we didn't have to wait very long.   The server was extremely friendly to us considering we had a big group (my family and I). She took our drink orders down and carded almost all of us minus the parentals. She even carded my oldest brother who is waaaay above the drinking age. I guess he just looks that young.   I ordered the Short Rib Grilled Cheese Sandwich. It came with french fries. It wasn't that bad actually. But it wasn't my favorite. It was pretty greasy but I guess most sandwiches with a name like that tends to be on the greasier side.  My brother ordered the Crispy Caramel Chicken and it was so so good. He let me try some and immediately I wanted to trade with him. It was so delicious. The sauce is sweet but not too sweet that it tastes like dessert. The chicken was crispy enough but not too much that it's hard to bite into. Oh man, I wish I had some right now!  The drinks were pretty strong and come in big glasses.   The service was awesome. Our server was so nice and friendly and joked with us. Very accommodating too!  We love coming to this place. So we'll definitely be back on our next trip!

FsgcjEl9pwZ4FcWycgLNNA.text: If I could give this no stars, that would be the rating. We were asked by the hostess if we wanted immediate seating for breakfast, that we could sit at the bar. We took the seats and my wife and I ordered. I got pancakes and my wife ordered oatmeal. Pretty simple and should have been fast. We had a conference to go to so we wanted a quick bite. My wife went to register for the conference after waiting 15 minutes. I continued to wait for our food. 20 minutes later I asked the bar tender where our food was. He pulled the ticket and gave it a waitress. 10 minutes later I got fed up and left. As I was leaving the waitress stopped me to say it would only be a few more minutes. I'm 45 minutes into this ordeal, really? I gathered my things and as I walked out someone came with our order. I kept walking. Even if they comped the meal, I wouldn't have eaten it. I can't tell you about the food, because I haven't eaten it. I can tell you the service is about the worst I've ever encountered. It was relatively busy, but ever one around us was seated after us fed and left before we were even served. Total lack of customer service.

_RDHEWWSwExl2bjz5cTzXQ.text: Looking for a place to grab a bite in the Hotel, and this place looked like it could handle the party of six (6) without much trouble. They have a huge menu, just like the Cheesecake Factory, tons of stuff to order.   The other five (5) ordered these spicy bloody marys, man they tasted great. Hot and peppery, with pickled asparagus on top. After taking a taste of the g/f's (can't use her name) (actually don't know why I can't) I wished I had ordered one too. But I went with the old standby, ice tea, boring but thirst quenching.  Two in the party went for the breakfast sandwich, it was stuffed with ham,bacon,scrambled eggs, cheese on thick cut toasted bread. They devoured them like finger food. I had the Manhattan salad with shrimp and chicken. It looked better then it tasted. I'm not sure what it was missing but I wouldn't order it again.  Service was good, food was hot and fresh, and they refilled my ice tea several times without asking for it. That's always a plus for me, I love to get bloated on ice tea while I eat.

1FkD7LAayzsAO__je_EwCQ.text: Cheesecake Factory is my favorite, or rather, the only chain that I like.  Grand Lux Cafe is the spitting image of its sister, from the wait to the menu to the quality of food and service.  I've also eaten at the one in Beverly Hills.  All consistent.  It was Christmas dinner time in Vegas, and we were headed to the one at the Palazzo, but we came across the one in the Venetian first, and since it was only a 20 minute wait (unheard of in Cheesecake Factory land) we stayed.  Our server was nice and we got apologies from both her and the manager for the long wait of our food.  Hell, I didn't care as long as I had my pomegranate martini ($13) to sip on, and some warm bread and butter to munch on.  I had the spaghettini w/ clams and rock shrimp.  Very garlicky and yummy.  I thought the pasta was a little on the dry side, until I got down to the bottom of my plate (yeah, it's a lot of pasta), where all the olive oil and white wine goodness had coagulated, probably from sitting under a lamp for awhile.  Anyways, it was good and I'd order it again. My petite friend ordered the "max burger" which had everything on it including bits of beef shortrib (are you serious?!).  She managed to eat half of it, said it was great, but suggested that seasoned and/or curly fries would have been a better partner than regular fries.  Someone else ordered the fried chicken which looked like it could have fed our whole table.  It was served with mashed potatoes, snap peas, broccoli, and sweet potatoes.  It must've been delish cuz she ate all her sides before getting to the chicken.  The least favorite meal at the table was the pasta carbonara.  Bland and made with cherry tomatoes, which she didn't like.  I took the little cherries and added them to my dry pasta which was actually a good pairing.    And just like the Cheesecake Factory, we didn't have room for the cheesecake or any other dessert.  That was my bad.

LOMcyD9o8G5MaZ1jlY3wRQ.text: What can I say?  Beggers can't be choosers.. it was late..  we were hungry.. we came.. we ate... we left.. and wen't back to sleep.  Where else would I go at 5 in the morning after shakin' my bootie at Tryst all night?    It was a bit of a trek, as we had to navigate our way through the lovely canals of Venice, with the gondolas idly sitting in the waters, as if to remind us what time it was.  And, it was a little surreal... I was headed to breakfast and the sun was coming up when I really should have been going to sleep. But, then again, this is Vegas, the city that never sleeps.    The menu was nice.. the service was okay..  We had the mashed baked potato spring rolls.. yummy...I had a chicken sandwich with a side salad that was entirely forgettable ..  I ate my friends french fries- I give them 4 stars for the ranch dressing, though.

c2N0cf8R52_zBJY9NiE0CA.text: Yeah, I know it's just an upscale Cheesecake Factory but it's a hell of a lot better food and service. My friends and I arrived here at about midnight and the place was still pretty packed. We were seated right away in a booth in the corner of their main dining room and it was perfect for us. Our server Javier was perfect in every way. He knew the menu and helped us along with our choices. He was always polite and made sure that everything was taken care of, he was very sociable and made us feel comfortable the whole night.  We ordered the Sunday Night Pasta, Chicken Pot Pie and I had the Chicken and Waffles. The pasta was OK, the pot pie was pretty standard and the Chicken and Waffles are not what you expect. It's actually boneless breaded chicken not your usual chicken wings. It was actually tender and juicy and flavorful. The waffles were absolutely perfect but the best thing was my Vanilla Honey Latte it is quite possible the best latte I've ever had!  One things for sure, I'll be back for some more!

KYngGasCaYl1C7E6c6twrw.text: This is the best place to get some great food on the strip and it doesn't cost an ARM and a leg. They have a great selection on the menu. My favorite is the Sunday Night Pasta. It's freakin awesome. The portions are generous which is another plus.

eboNSCvu-xPGMXnO9m_gFA.text: Great hangover food. It's so close to the hotel rooms, there really is no point in ordering room service. When all else fails while staying at Palazzo, this is the place to go! Considering it's created by the minds behind Cheesecake Factory, it's only natural that the food be just as delicious.  Staying at the Palazzo wouldn't be the same without it.

D4Copv-w2zX4ojWOUmQgXw.text: My favorite 24 hr cafe...related to Cheesecake factory (notice the similarity in the look of the menu?) Yum: Veal Saltimbocca - Tender Veal, Fresh Sage, Proscuitto and Fontina Cheese Coated with Parmesan Breadcrumbs. Served with Pasta and Wine Sauce Chicken Pot Pie- omg, this is HUGE! It could feed 2-3 seriously with big chunks of chicken and veggies. Best on the menu: Mediterranean Mahi Mahi-Crusted Fresh Mahi with Roasted Tomato, Artichoke, Capers, Basil, Olive Oil and Balsamic Vinegar over mashed potatoes.  Yuck: Asian nachos--wayyyy too sweet, I ate half a chip and fed the rest to A. Rib eye steak: A ordered it and well, its the quality of a cafe-if you want steak just pay and go to a steakhouse

Nma_7AgS4pnry5h68hvmeA.text: This is my rant and is as accurate as possible.  Times are approximate.  What you are about to read is detailed.  You may want to turn away now especially if you absolutely love Grand Lux.  My friend Yin was set on going to the Grand Lux location at the Venetian.  We probably should've gone to a buffet instead.  A haggard server took our orders and pleasantly answered our questions.  She suggested a vinagerette on the side since I wasn't sure about whether I would like it or not.  Omelette and Hash Browns, two Pasta Carbonaras, Fried Chicken and Waffles (Boneless fried chicken and one Belgian Waffle - why it's plural on the menu is misleading) and Cajun Shrimp & Chicken Jambalaya.  She even recommended lunch portions of our Carbonaras because they serve HUGE portions.  They switched servers to a perky young lady who seemed eager to take our order.  Sharida was her name, I believe, and she had curly hair.  She was taking over for the previous lady.  We were glad to have her.  After about 15 minutes, the first server surprisingly came back with the duck potstickers (delicious by the way) and a boat of my salad dressing.  In addition, a scalding hot loaf of sliced sourdough bread came a few minutes later.  Within this time, Grand Lux Cafe seats about six guys with luggages by their side to my right.  Soon thereafter, a family of five sits to my left.  15 minutes after getting our appetizers and bread...  The table of six guys gets their order of cold sandwiches and other quick-fix dishes.  "Hmmm..." we think to ourselves.  "They get their order before us but they sat later.  At least we got our potstickers and bread to tide us over.  Besides, it probably takes quicker to fix their lunch than ours does.  What am I going to do with this salad dressing without salad though?"  They take our appetizer plate and small dishes away.    20-minute mark from the time they delivered our appetizers...  25-minute mark...  The family to my left gets their orders.  I noticed some had fried chicken, others pasta, still others, hot and tasty dishes.  Okay, something was seriously wrong.  30-minute mark..  35-minute mark..  I try to flag down our waitress who went from one of the bar tables and goes to six-guy table to my right and asks if everything came out alright.  I try to catch her attention through her peripheral vision, but she clearly makes her way to the kitchen.    40-minute mark..  My cousin gets up and seeks out our waitress.  He follows her, calls out, but according to him she ignored him and bolted for the kitchen.  The two ladies at the end of the bar simply tell him, "You don't look so happy."  "I'm not," he says, but with a smile because they're girls.  He was hiding his frustration.  He sits back down with us.  45 minutes after getting our appetizers...  All of us are so hungry and waiting there.  I lost my appetite.  Our drinks aren't even filled.  My cousin says, "Let's get out of here."  I on the other hand didn't want to leave without at least paying for the potstickers.  "Let's just leave," he repeats standing up.  "I don't need this.  We should just go somewhere else.  Clearly the other tables got their food and we didn't."  He pointed out the bar area also got their food right away.  I was beginning to suspect a number of different factors as to why we didn't get ours, but I had enough of it too.  I stood up too looking around for any server.  Yin makes her way to the hostess to try and flag a manager.  My brother stands up. Our table is empty.  Just as the last of our friends agrees and stands up ready to leave, several food servers come out with our dishes.  The cheese on our carbonara was dried and hard from the prolonged heat.  The fried chicken wasn't fresh.  The waffle was on the verge of being burnt.  The omelette looked rubbery.  In spite of it all, I liked my creamy pasta and I think the bacon saved it.  I just had to move the cheese.  I was so upset I only ate half of it and didn't enjoy it as much as I could've had it been fresher earlier.  You can *definitely* tell all of our food had been sitting out for a while.  Salad greens were wilted and had dark spots and tomatoes were mushy.  The manager, Marty, kept asking how she could make it up to us...crap 5000 word limit-  We understand restaurants tend to get busy especially during Sunday mornings and afternoons in Vegas, but clearly, there was some miscommunication between servers and the kitchen.  Maybe it was Sharida's first day.  There are legitimate reasons as to why service (albeit friendly) was abhorrent.  Our server could've at LEAST periodically come by with a status.  I've never ever come across service like this.  I guess it was bound to happen sooner or later.  I'd go back to Grand Lux Cafe out of mercy, but never will I set foot at this location again.    We had as much fun on our dining experience as you had reading my rant.

Z8dijwYVQ8HIloiRHncWyw.text: A miniature version of cheesecake factory. Kinda like cheesecake   factory's little brother.. Located inside the palazzo.  I'm not making that up, it really is from  the creators of cheesecake factory.  In fact, I ended up liking this place better than CF. times ten.  Has a wide range of entrees to choose from but not as much as big   bro.  They have some things that are similar, like some of the main   dishes, salads and desserts. But what cheesecake factory DOES NOT have are CHEESESTEAK ROLLS.  What it is.. Philly cheesesteak with cheese and mushrooms rolled in to a little, yummy appetizer. Crispy outside.. And warm philly cheesesteak inside.. but bitesized. (kinda like an egg roll..but not.. it's better.)   I had to rave about it because I liked it so much. They also have comp bread n butta which was pretty good.  not the same bread as cf's.. equally as good as my favorite molasses bread.  I ordered the chicken with sun dried tomatoes & mozzarella pasta and added  grilled shrimp to it.  It was screwdriver shaped pasta with creamy sauce, full of flavor.  I liked it!  Really really big dish, I ate alot and still had plenty of leftovers.  people in my party ordered salmon dishes.. one miso salmon dish (which tasted good, better than CF's) and one called "salmon 3 ways"  (which had 3 different flavors of salmon).. another ordered the combo of ribeye and shrimp scampi w. mashed potatoes.  A big plus is that it's open 24 hours! Well, it IS vegas.  soo coming back to try the late night menu next time i'm there.

0ZknV-P52igbMJRAKvsC0w.text: I really think they get more business in the middle of the night then they do during the day. It's open 24 hours which is the perfect place to go that's close by and on the strip after a fun night of clubbing. Everyone seemed to have the same idea as us and we must've waited half an hour for a table. We had a larger group though - of like 8 people. When we finally sat, I was already regretting picking food over sleep. When in doubt pick sleep always - just a tip. Haha. Anyways I wanted something light to settle my alcohol ridden stomach so I ended up getting the Zen noodles. Worse thing to get. Wow, I was hoping for halfway decent noodles but these were dreadful. The broth was thin and too lemongrass-y. The noodles were short and rough and the texture was almost too al dente. They put chicken in there and it's a bit rough and overcooked. At least they had the soy bean sprouts and lime and cilantro and all the other herbs on the side for me to add. I would day that was the most authentic part of my dish. And so overpriced at like $13. Crazy. I left unsatisfied and looking forward to just crashing. Other dishes looked ok like the flatbread pizza, sandwiches and breakfast. Yeah I just caution ordering such an Asian dish at such an American place.

64klhhm_BobQG1gcO2Y4xg.text: Grand lux, how i love thee. The step child of the cheese cake factory and you never seem to disappoint me in any meal. Good cheap good, great service and huge portions.   Grand lux is probably our default decision whenever we can't decide on a restaurant to go when were in Vegas. It should be everyones! SHIT WHY NOT! Huge extensive menu, that serves a great variety of cuisines! Cheaper than any other restaurants in the hotel!

i8kOZq0D45MMjCIxFMaD9A.text: Great soup but I would pass on the Chicken and waffles... Great hours (24/7) Better than Cheesecake factory.

Ka0NGr4cAfeyi2BfuICJkw.text: I ate breakfast there on weekday morning.  Normally I wouldn't goto Grand Lux with so many other options in Vegas but I wanted to try something new and the situation at the time didn't allow for anywhere else.  Service was slow even though the restaurant wasn't that busy.  Although the restaurant is open 24 hrs, they aren't very flexible about fulfilling requests.  Tried to order a house salad but they said they couldn't meet the request.  Not a big deal, but it was late in the morning you would think they could throw some lettuce in a bowl especially for a restaurant that's open 24 hrs.  Like I said, not a big deal since they aren't a diner.  Ordered the corned beef hash and eggs.  Portions are huge just like the Cheesecake Factory.  It was good, nothing outstanding however.  Prices aren't outrageous, besides the typical Strip markup.  All in all an OK experience.  I wouldn't eat here again unless it's 4AM but that's only because there are so many other dining options in Vegas.

enZVTFdNHFE90sUTR7Nwgw.text: Ah, the Venetian!  Though I can't afford it very often(...er, often... eh...ever...), the Venetian is undoubtedly my favorite hotel on the Strip (which probably contributes to my fondness of Grand Lux)!  On this trip, we caught a late dinner here post-Blue Man Group...  Location-wise, the "patio'd" dining area of Grand Lux has a great view for people watching, looking out upon the escalator landing that meets the casino floor to the parking structure and shopping center.  And the people watching here is excellent... the sexy, the desperate, the suave, the chic, the buffoonery!  The interior/exterior is inline with the vibe and feel of the Venetian, simple-chic , with notable designerly touches of old-country influence and theme .    Grand Lux is by no means a fancy-shmancy bistro.  It is, in essence and actuality, a well-dressed upscale Cheesecake Factory affiliated establishment.  And for the intent and perspective of casual ambiance, generous portions, affordable dining, it's well suited...  The puree'd Butternut Squash and ginger soup was a great start to the late night meal; delicately sweet with a subtle tartness.  Only one person had ordered it, but it was so good, she insisted on passing it around amongst the five of us.  It was that good...  I had the Spicy Flat Bread Chicken Sandwich;  sharable serving of four triangular flatbread sandwiches set atop a platter of fries.  A smokey-spiciness from the chicken and the pepperjack cheese is offset by a cool avocado-corn salsa.  I ate half and saved the other have for breakfast.  Also around the table was the chili-cheese topped jumbo Kobe Hotdog (w/fries), the Braised Pot Roast dinner, and the Chicken Royale (w/ white wine butter sauce)... everything tasted good (the cool thing about foodies, if they've got something good, they like to share!)   Our bill for the food (sans drinks)?  Just north of $60.  It's one of the better (if not one of the best!) casual after-midnight menus on the strip... with the bonus of watching an entertaining  parade of people.

ot2WjxO5cCCTv2l-LcUyqA.text: What a pleasant surprise. It was really really good.  Ok. This Grand Lux Cafe is located on the casino level of the Palazzo. It is open 24 hours, so I didn't really think it was going to be THAT great. After fumbling around the casino with our stomach lining stuck to the spine, we decided we will settle for this place, not knowing what kind of surprise we were in for.  We ordered Caprese Salad, and I ordered Chicken Parmasan. (I forgot what my guy ordered. uh oh =P) The caprese salad was probably one of my favorite caprese salads I've had in a while. Instead of getting a neatly cut tomatos and cheese, we were greeted with a bed of lettuce and chopped tomatos, smothered in cheese and excellent dressing. Oh man, my mouth is watering just thinking about it. Then the chicken parmasan. When I was ordering this dish, the server asked if I wanted the dinner size or lunch size. I ordered the lunch size, bit worried if I ordered enough food, but then this humongous chicken came out on top of spaghettini lighly tossed with tomato sauce. Oh man, it was probably one of the best I've had, but since it was so huge, I could only eat half of it. I wonder what the dinner size would look like, but I am sure it could be able to feed 2.   We came back home to LA after a lovely stay at the Palazzo. When we were passing by Beverly Center, then that is when we realized that they have another Grand Lux Cafe on the 1st floor of Beverly Center. Oh man, we are glad to know that we can get their food right at home. (Assuming they serve the same stuff)

MlLfo_QPd3nZsDhdZ_9SFQ.text: The food and service at this restaurant was excellent. Our party ranged in age from 50 to 80, and we were all extremely satisfied with the soup, salad, sandwich, and pasta dishes. They were all freshly made and delicious. We highly recommend this restaurant!

eySQLed_eb2pdo33j_RDnw.text: Came to this location for the first time for dinner with my fiance. We actually left our credit card here and they held it graciously and honestly for several hours until we returned. Aside from that side note the service was great and the food was fresh and cooked well. We enjoyed our visit here and will be coming back soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

S-I1c6eZxSvvu3Xdp0U-rw.text: Just order the chicken and waffles. It was the best. We also order the potatoe egg rolls which were very good

hsVNa4t0Z0qU0I_Ggf6BSA.text: Huge menu like the Cheesecake Factory and very convenient but the food takes forever to come out. The service was very friendly just wish they could speed up a little. Perhaps this is the result of having such a big menu.

Afjbs1wirF1Jy3zXEOWADA.text: Really delicious breakfast. No wait. Classic bloody Mary's. Loved the bartender, Raymond. Cool, funny, quick drinks and personable. Can't beat it.  The restaurant looks crowded, but consider eating at the bar.

S_HklOlLgtWZGZ8yQddAqw.text: One of those fancy restaurants at the Venetian. They had pretty fair prices for Las Vegas but the food took a little too long to come out. I was impressed by the food though. I got the sunday night pasta, the dish itself had very large portion, sauce looked very overwhelming. But after mixing it up it had the perfect sauce to pasta ratio. The dish also had a great amount of meat so it wasn't a full carby meal. All of my other friends had great meals as well. I would recommend the Thai children rice as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sunny side up eggs with hash brown potatoes and link sausages
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sunday night pasta

-KznNxB4BhC6kjjs5pdyzg.text: I happen to go to the Palazzo location more, however this one is just as "Grand."  I dislike returning to the Strip for eating out because the price is exaggerated and I'm not as satisified with the meal as the price would suggest.  Grand Lux is an exception.  One of the best places to eat in Vegas for sure!  When I think shrimp scampi or wines, I go here.  Vegan or vegetarian, meat lovers or burger folk, are all going to be satisified here.  My friends and family from out of town will usually come here with me for I recommend and suggest this spot before most others.  I'm a proud regular to this venue.  I've fallen out of Cheesecake Factory for a few years now.  The creators of that chain are responsible for the creation of Grand Lux.  Grand Lux over Cheescake Factory, Yard House, etc. Etc.

37IWElHhy-kKJhXu3GbNcw.text: Amazing bacon cheeseburger, went there twice in 3 days. Both times I was amazed, perfectly cooked, perfect bun, and the perfect amount of cheese! My wife had the Grand Cobb Salad also amazing!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon Cheeseburger

0rvZ3bROpIvQ1lLPq-IeSw.text: I absolutely loved everything about this place. My husband & I came in for dinner on a wed night around 7pm. Not too busy & seated quickly. However the table was small & booth on one side & chair on the other. I wasn't comfortable & asked for a different sitting. She was so understanding & sat is in a different table. The waiter was amazing (no name tag unfortunately) & the food was so good my husband had the Salisbury steak & I had the Parmesan crusted pork chop with baked potato & brussel sprouts. Nothing disappointing about this place & the food. Definitely recommend & definitely will be back.

wsb9y5fLBPxPVrLNGQY1gw.text: I actually visited Grand Lux twice on my 5 day vacation in Vegas. One time with a large group and once after a night of clubbing! Both experiences were pretty good!  Everyone is spot on with the Cheesecake comparison. If you've been there it's pretty much the same here. Inexpensive, large plates, and plenty of items to choose from.  The first night I ordered the "Shaking Beef" and my late night meal was chicken & waffles.  The shaking beef was pretty good. Nice chunks of beef, red onions, green onions, and white rice. Definitely liked the kick it had to it. The chicken and waffles were ok. Nothing spectacular but it fulfilled my late night craving!  Next time I club it up at TAO or Lavo I will definitely return. I don't know if I would consider it a "go to" spot for me but it's cool. If you're on a budget this is a great place to dine because there are MANY options under 20$ Not bad for Las Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pan Roasted Chicken
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon ($18)

ahdZgwaJR3sGbfc8GXK8Yw.text: My last review for the Grand Lux was in 2011. It's now 2015 and STILL this place did not disappoint. A little on the pricey side, but you really do get what you pay for.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp scampi
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken and waffle

bnqQQtoXoZyTkd8esQYBZg.text: While on our three night stay in Vegas we had breakfast all three mornings here because it was that good. I had a different omelette two mornings and the buffet the third morning. Each omelette was delicious and the buffet had a lot of good options. I recommend the waffles though it they are there. My boyfriend and his friends have probably been dreaming of them ever since. The wait to be seated was never longer than 10 mins, and we had a party of 8 on that trip during the peak breakfast time. A definite must try while in the hotel or in Vegas in general!

RzDVaatEbtJdiiCWToeTgQ.text: I came here for lunch with a party of 7 the other day, and we all left satisfied with full bellies :D   We were seated really fast and our waitress came by with waters almost as fast! We ordered and just sat there and talked.  I swear we were all talking for about half an hour and finally someone noticed how long it was taking to get our food together. Right when we were about to ask our waitress where our food was, a small group of waiters/waitresses come out carrying all of our food!  I got the 7 mushroom burger and I have to say that it was very good. The problem I was having was that it was so damn big! I honestly didn't know how to start eating it and tried numerous methods and eventually I gave up and tried with my hands. It worked, but I made a huge mess in the process. The mushrooms were sliding left and right, and everything was just falling off. It tasted really good; the different mushrooms added lots of flavor. I finished it, but it was so much work to eat a burger.   Come and try this place out! The staff is friendly and alert, and the food is very good. Just keep in mind that if you order the burger I did, you'll have to put in some real work to eat it!

FFMwRNnzgENMFQUxVCDnRg.text: Had breakfast here and it was nice and satisfying. As stated by other yelp review, this place reminds me of a Cheesecake Factory with regard of food selection and portion. I asked for asparagus, mushrooms and tomatoes as an add on for my egg and hash breakfast, and I got a large portion of each. I was charged the price of a veggie omelette, which was nice. The service was friendly and really fast in comparison to the Bouchon.  While the Grand Lux has better bang for the buck, and the veggie omelette and selection were better, I would say the Bouchon has much better bread.

inRkNq1mcaP-drE0k9n60A.text: Seriously. What do you eat in Vegas when you're a college student on a budget?  Long story short, Grand Luxe is owned by Cheesecake Factory and therefore it's prettyyy similar. Have a large group with mixed taste buds? Want a sit down restaurant that won't hurt the wallet too bad? Grand Luxe is fooo youuu!

G86RDjL9gABHgeN7Bvhm6g.text: I love Grand Lux Cafe! The first time I came here was for second dinner after the first dinner had ended in much disappointment (some cafe at the Wynn before watching a show, ugh, never again). I ordered the seared ahi tuna salad and the portion of the salad was so large, I couldn't finish it (I eat a lot). Service is also friendly and attentive. Ordered another salad the second time I came back but it wasn't as good as the ahi tuna salad. The bread that you start off with though is excellent. I can eat the wheat one for days.   Anyway, it's my to-go spot for late night eating in Vegas (: I would say it's way better than Cheesecake factory.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seared ahi tuna salad

jY11gF9UVKdEcSReT_9Jmw.text: This was one of the better cafes I have tried in Las Vegas.  It was easy to get a table and the service was good.  Nothing spectacular but even at 4am we were able to get some solid early morning food after being out for 12 hours.   We ate here 3 times mostly out of convenience and that it was consistent.    The Zen Noodles were great.  I would order them anytime without hesitation. The menu was rather large but I stuck with something easy.

6_ylMZAEu7E43ubVucD-8g.text: very good. i had the breakfast buffet and a blood mary. good service.

gb3VNxLVm4khyn9LhriCMw.text: Had the breakfast buffet for $20 and it was pretty good. The omelet was very delicious and they have everything you need from hash brown, sausages, bacons, waffles, fruits to bagels; except for oatmeal.

_Ha9C9hrx4VR-VlbPRjsZw.text: My husband and I usually eat breakfast here. This place is great. I love the protein breakfast and my husband gets a waffle or eggs and toast. We are not huge breakfast eaters but we always get a great breakfast when we come here. My husband loves the fresh squeezed orange juice and the coffee is very good.

Bywag5rmzCO6MQZ5tLjnHA.text: The take-out bags, decor, and atmosphere mirror Cheesecake Factory. Same owners?  Great diner for late night meals. Food is surprisingly good-had the "max" burger. Then again, I was starving.

tJz53Vr0CoPJkQediiIjxw.text: Been here multiple times and I love the food every time. I have gotten the chicken parmesan and the chicken Royale and I have to say they are both very good. The portions are big and the service is great. This is a must when you come out to Vegas.

lEQ2nkEtOW1-F_XQqpkKCw.text: Almost perfect. Food was excellent (buffet), had to wait on waffles but well worth the wait. Service was good, not awesome but with fruit that fresh, waffles that good and a well cooked assortment of buffet food, I'll def be back! Prob this trip...

NwcObtZWRkhck-PqMMbIbg.text: Let's be honest. You don't go to Vegas and look forward to eating at the Grand Lux. I eat at Grand Lux because it's 5 AM, I'm blacked out, but I'm too fat to head up to my room on an empty stomach (the Lord knows I skipped dinner at normal human hours because eating is cheating).  It's basically like a Cheesecake Factory. All of their food is above average. Their fried chicken is actually pretty bomb. I definitely got a greasy boner over that dish.

0MWweTcwdmwvGSD_nEZ67Q.text: The food here was mediocre.  We ate here after a show because it was one of two restaurants that were open so late.  The serve breakfast all day, which others in party thought was good. I got the short rib grill cheese.  It was tasty, but it was less of a grill cheese and more of a short rib sandwich.  I would eat here again if it was late or I had few options.

BiAmM3tzQ7z7X5nkKTxEcQ.text: Ain't going to lie, I love GLC. It has an extensive menu with everything being delicious and huge portions. I had the shrimp scampi pasta and delicious.  It's definitely a fall back if you don't know what to eat and have a picky eater ;)

gzU4en-GMxUfAFaxAelpAQ.text: The breakfast here is absolutely amazing! The crab omelette, chicken and waffles, and biscuits and gravy are the BEST! The line to be seated was long but it moved very fast. The service was great as well. I will definitely return EVERY time I'm in vegas.

e4M1z1hKEcCGW-GHA9H47g.text: Great Happy Hour/Dinner. Good value for your money. HH dishes and drinks are the best value in town at $5. Portions are outrageously filling and deliciously prepared. Our server, Ben F. Server 635, was the best!

eOq3qXvZrLV1KvgONg02_w.text: I cant say anything bad about this Cafe, I was in a date two days ago in Las Vegas, and a friend recommended this place for us, it was amazingly great. Classy Cafe, service was perfect, when i was going in to the place, i thought it is too expensive, but i was surprised when i saw the menu, it wasn't that expensive, the prices were good comparing with the place, i ordered a cheese spinach dip as appetizer, and Cob salad for my date, and rib eye stake sandwich with fries for me, when we got the food, my date said just the appetizer could be enough, because the plates were huge, we couldn't even finish half of the food. Plus the taste was really good. I have a really nice memories in this place. hope to go back there soon, with the same person ;)

ugVDmqGC46pnYImBt8gb2A.text: This was the perfect spot to hit up right after we checked into our room at the Palazzo..since it was just right downstairs!  We were all starving..so we ordered right away...  Me and my sis split the blue cheese salad and mini kobe hot dogs...both were delish!!!  My blue cheese salad also had crispy, nice-sized bacon bits in it that gave it that extra kick!    Our kobe hot dogs were good too, on top of a split open piece of toasted brioche bread!!!  Yummy!  My only mini complaint was the VERY talkative waiter!!!  He did keep us entertained though!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Blue cheese salad with crumbled bacon bits!
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kobe beef mini hot dogs

zKEr8ua4uAMrsnX5WGkVng.text: Um, I didn't get the hype of this place. I ordered their lunch special where it came with fettucine pasta and a salad. My boyfriend had the chicken waffles. I think they make the pasta themselves and it was all stuck together; when this happens, the pasta becomes undercooked in some parts (gross) and there's nothing special about the salad. My boyfriend's waffle was soggy when it should have been warm and crispy.  Service was good though, but the food was subpar.

6MV7jtqHP72ceFN1yzTtSw.text: One of my favorite places to eat at the Venetian in Vegas!   Because I'm super bored, I shall recite a little poem for you:  The ambiance is sublime,  and your food is simply divine.  The service can be a little slow, (-1 star) you'll probably be so hungover you won't even know, or notice because the breakfast buffet, is probably cheaper than Mandalay Bay's.  Pastries, bacon, omelettes made before your eyes, "Is this heaven?!" you start to cry. "No!", I must disagree, "You haven't even tried the fried buffalo rolls with cheese."  The restaurant is open 24/7, am or pm, come at 11! Or go to the side that's enclosed, and order your scrumptious food to go!

qavVFlKfqyWIgmKbmnR2ZQ.text: One of my favorite places to eat in Vegas when looking for a casual meal thats not incredibly expensive. It's simple American food with the traditional selections of hamburgers, sandwiches, and pastas that you would get at any other American restaurant. I stayed at the Palazzo with friends once on a trip and we literally ate here for every meal for three days. The reason why this is possible is because they have a HUGE menu. Two of my favorites are the chicken flautas and their corned beef hash.   Grand Luxe is a sister restaurant of the cheesecake factory so their food is pretty similar in taste and style. One star off though because they don't have the brown break like cheesecake factory and thats always a disappointment for me whenever I go :(

wQI6DNGOwHCg0AhQdNPRww.text: I went on an all-girls trip to Vegas and this was my friend Audrey and I's first stop after dropping off our bags!  I really enjoyed myself here. Audrey ordered a lunch salad for herself which turned out to be pretty massive. I ordered a pizza/salad lunch combo. The pizza isn't frozen-- it's made to order! I love it because I actually order my pizzas cheese-less (please don't hate). The balsamic dressing that came with my salad was delicious. My pizza was perfect!  We were definitely well taken care of here and we both enjoyed ourselves.  I paid about $15 for my lunch, this is definitely not bad considering it's Vegas and everything is usually expensive. The atmosphere was really great too. It is a great place to come to after spending hours traveling to Vegas.  If you want a cute, relaxing place to have a meal whether with friends or a significant other, I definitely recommend it. It won't burn a whole in your pocket and you'll leave feeling satisfied.  I don't know if this place is owned by Cheesecake Factory or not, but the place is really really similar. Food varies, but the general atmosphere is very similar to Cheesecake Factory. The service is better though!

c7H8-HocgvJoKd4y3V3QKA.text: I've only eaten here for the breakfast.  So it may be difficult to gauge since I've had the egg white veggie omelette one time and Joe's scramble another time.  There wasn't anything special about my meal.  Although Joe's scramble could have been a little less saltier with the ground beef.    The toast is served a little too toasted and crunchy.

SfIRVAurYJKo8x5p76V2wQ.text: SERVICE: 1/5.  Some of the worst service I've ever had, and it's such a shame because I would have given this place a great review.  Our server took forever to get us our food (despite the fact that it was 2am and the tables were mostly empty... he could have at least come to us to apologize), he didn't once stop by to check on how our meal was going, and we sat there for 15 or 20 minutes with empty plates before he brought our check.  In fact, he only brought the check because my boyfriend yelled and got his attention.  THEN, it took a while for him to bring us the check and return credit cards.  We were all pretty irritated.  VARIETY: 5/5.  Lots of late-night options, which we appreciated.  Everything from burgers to omelets to desserts.  FLAVOR: 4/5.  Pretty good.  I enjoyed my winter vegetable soup, the beignets were deliciously fluffy (though I thought the sauces were unnaturally sugary and preservative-laden), and the burger was flavorful and well-cooked.  VALUE: 4/5.  Considering it's Vegas, not too bad.  My soup was around $5, burger around $13.  It's a good thing I waited 2 days to cool off before writing this review... I had originally been considering giving it 1 star!  But in retrospect, the food really was pretty good.  So if you're ready to face the prospect of unapologetically slow service, I'd recommend coming here.

fnnIpS8NDpfT6f_n1XwZ_Q.text: This place here is very good, i always get either a Greek or southwest salad, they are always so fresh and crisp, i also like their sandwiches and they are also very quick..

Z8U7L_caM4nTflR31KWB1Q.text: This place is located in the Palazzo. I had breakfast here and ordered the egg white omelette with bacon, onion, and sausage. This was very fresh and savory. It wasn't oily like your typical restaurant or cafe you go to. The bacon, onion, and sausage was cooked and placed inside the egg white so it almost looked like a taco. This came with hash browns that was cooked perfectly, since it had the right amount of burning on the top.

Wf_06Bz_8MdVws4YOPO94w.text: Grand Lux is one of my all-time favorite places to eat at whenever I'm in Vegas! There's a beautiful spectrum of different menu items, something for everyone.   I was kind of surprised to find that it is a branch of the Cheesecake Factory, yet it felt like it was a fitting piece of information. The interior design and the seating all seemed familiar.  I've had breakfast, lunch, dinner, and late dinner here before, and I don't think anything has ever failed my taste buds. I notably remember the Shaky Beef with rice plate (which is Vietnamese Com Bo Luc Lac) and it was simply amazing, better than most Vietnamese restaurants I've been to (and I'm Vietnamese)! It was a steep price though, 20 bucks. But worth the splurge. When you're in Vegas, you just wanna spend money like there's no tomorrow anyway.  Also, if you just want something on-the-go for that quick meal before you go out drinking, their sandwiches in the cafe are all bomb. I always devour those without hesitation.

lED4ua2e5BSRMGBp6z68Yw.text: We ate here daily during our week long stay at the Venetian. Every thing we are was great, (except for the pancakes-too thick for my liking, but tasty nonetheless) we never tried the buffet for breakfast because the huevos rancheros and chilaquiles were spicy good. Delicious waffles and lightly breaded chicken. Great salads at lunch and the crispy buffalo sandwich looked great as well as the fish and chips.  Dinner was so flavorful. We tried the chicken Revello and it was fantastic. Very good cocktails here, as well. You cannot go wrong with your dining here. And the prices are relatively reasonable compared to some of the other restaurants in the Venetian, especially at dinner time.  EAT HERE! You won't be sorry.

15343Xqy0P9HhdK9KV_YbQ.text: Breakfast here is terrible.  It is way busy and full, the buffet is over priced and the food is below mediocre.  I love me some eggs benedict, but the menu here doesn't offer many different types as other restaurants do and only had regular eggs benedict with ham.  I hate ham, so I asked the waitress to substitute it for bacon, which she said would not be a problem.  Obviously, there was a problem, because when we got our meals, there was no bacon to be found, but tons of ham.  I was starving so I just sucked it up and ate it.  It was soggy and gleaming with oil.  Beyond unappetizing.   I always found this place to be overrated and this trip proved it to me once again!

TS6UoDO-qAShd1ZHWIjlFw.text: Way better than expected for a hotel restaurant. Parmesan pork chop and roasted vegetables were outstanding.  Great service.

52l3vr53iXZiRCHw3bEOoQ.text: Great buffet, but slow to refill food items. Melissa was a great server. MUST get the orange juice!

0O-Mv_Q23cCCdSsaTUvTNw.text: Service is a little slow.  But...  Eat the asian nachos..  Its a life changer.  AMAZING!!!!!!!!!!

xZB31sQvlObqFSB9KnYp6w.text: Disgusting food, terrible service, dismissive management.  Group was seated at 11:30 and greeted by our server about ten minutes afterward.  We were able to put in our order by 11:55, but the food did not arrive until 1:20.  Our table was not served bread.  We had to flag the server down for drink and water refills.  We watched entire tables of people sit down, order, eat, and leave in time while we were waiting for our food.  Our server repeatedly assured us that the food would be served soon, and a manager named Lisa even came by (after about an hour) to tell us that our orders would be up soon.  When the food finally did come, it was cold, had clearly been sitting, and was damn near inedible.  I had Zen Noodles - described as pho on the menu, but in reality it was canned chicken broth (cold by the time it was served) poured over a clump of rice noodles with sliced chicken.  I was so disappointed - no seasoning, no flavor...just a lot of bland, cold, blech.  No one else in my group even came close to finishing or even enjoying their meal.  The "extensive menu" is full of previously frozen/processed/reconstituted crap.  The food was below Denny's in terms of quality or tastiness.    I think the icing on the cake was when we let our server know that we'd like the check.  20 minutes later, she delivers the check.  One in our group was leaving from the restaurant to the airport for her 3:30pm flight, so she asked if she could close out first.  The server said yes, grabbed the check, and we watched her go EVERYWHERE EXCEPT THE POS TO CLOSE OUT THE CHECK...checking on other customers, talking to another server...it was almost like she was wandering around looking for something else to do just so that my friend would miss her plane.  When we asked the manager, Lisa, for help, she walked away from me and told me that they were really busy and the server would take care it when she could.  Would never come back.  Hope this tourist trap hellhole gets converted into a roller skating rink or a dog salon or something useful.

LR23So0ryB4iF09r0DXH_w.text: Okay... so my tastes have changed.... I still like this place, but after my last visit it's not as good as my previous visits.  It's still good, just not as good as I remember it to be.  I will try it again next week and let you know if it meets my standards again!

MWpHKOfI7KOP9Un5B4ZaEA.text: This place sucks and the manager was rude if you want over priced shitty food come here you will love it

_OVisUkt-gjSw4Ly-seOrw.text: Excellent food w great friendly service.  You cannot beat the value.  It's beautiful inside, the dining feels casual enough though that you don't feel intimidated or underdressed.  They're open so late and the late night menu is very diverse!  Thai chicken/shrimp spring rolls were amazing w fresh mint, carrots and butter lettuce to wrap them in.  Dipping sauce was crack!   House salad was big, good dressing.  The calamari was very nice, big portion.  We're definitely come back!  Can't wait to try the burgers and chicken/waffles!  Ooo

iCwRT-g3vtOXHBx1ohylaw.text: I'm from Houston , and visit the glc location here often. Of course when I'm in Vegas, I eat here!   I've stayed in the Venetian twice, and both times dined here, it's just that good.  This last time, I celebrated my 10 year anniversary and renewed our vows... Dinner reception was here of course. I had no issues reserving a table for 12, and enjoyed our dinner . Great service, and great food. The menu is very diverse, from tacos and burgers, to pasta and salads.  There's even a breakfast/brunch buffet in the morning for $18... It includes coffee and juice too!  I love this place, it's just plain delicious.

9cEE8AvGG5BS_kF3iBm3yg.text: my boyfriend and i come here often and we are always satisfied. we have tried many items on their menu, and we have never been disappointed. i most recently tried their chili-lime chicken and mango salad and the flavor was phenomenal. my boyfriend got his usual, pasta telefono, which is always amazing. the waitstaff at this location is always great and the place is always clean.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. chili-lime chicken and mango salad and pasta telefono. so yummy

vFvMdqBUUaVH97kjvK1A0A.text: The Grand Lux Margarita is a really excellent drink, one of the best margaritas I've ever had.  The Grilled Steak Sandwich is tender and flavorful, on a perfectly toasted roll.  I had the salad with mine (rather than fries) and it was fresh, varied, and the dressing was a light and tasty vinaigrette.  The complimentary bread is a light sourdough with a wonderful, crisp crust.  In general the prices here are extremely modest considering the fact that it's in Las Vegas.  Husband and I ate lunch here for around $50, and that included my cocktail.

ElNQsTNGr5-ghzKBdi5RTg.text: Love this place! I'm always going back, this is one of my favorite restaurants in town! The only reason why it's getting four out of five stars is because we've had a bad experience once which THREE dishes that had to be put back in the kitchen just because they could not get our order right. But other than that any other time it's been good: the food, the service and variety.

pOWYVC0riNmA--fuaQf39g.text: As often happens when a restaurant has too large a menu, the quality of the food suffers. The chicken parm was okay, but the spaghetti was bland. Shrimp scampi is not scampi at all. The shrimp is breaded (?!) and served in a cream sauce, not butter. The parmesan crusted pork chop was the tastiest of the dishes, but side vegetables were limp and lukewarm. I'd also mention the gin and tonic was weak, but watered down cocktails are a Vegas tradition. The restaurant is more than usually noisy. This can be helped slightly by requesting not to sit near the open kitchen. Our wait staff (more than one server per table) were friendly and attentive. Since this is open 24 hours, I'm sure there is a convenience associated with the higher ratings - when you're a bit tipsy and everything else is closed, you don't care much about quality at 2am. If you're looking for a nice evening of semi-casual dining, however, there are other options.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork Chops, Chicken Parm, and Shrimp &#34;Scampi&#34;

3h6HJn2h_KOYTX2FNn8EoA.text: We are at the Grand Lux twice this trip. One time was for dinner, the other for breakfast. It truly never disappoints! The service was attentive and spectacular both times. We were seated right away. The menu has just about anything you could want. I had an Asian chicken salad at my dinner and the $18.95 breakfast buffet on our breakfast trip. Both were wonderful. I feel like the food quality and service are top notch and at a truly reasonable price by Vegas standards. We will be back!

KEvOppVgdEMR_U6IiOr34A.text: A group of coworkers and I went there several times during a conference for lunch.  We were seated quickly each time, but food always took a very long time to be served. Service was friendly, however.  Food was decent, but I did love my Ahi Burger.  This restaurant is a higher end version of the Cheesecake Factory, but if I had to choose, I prefer the Cheesecake Factory.

h0lizk07nJYwbo0GDfVAJQ.text: We stopped in for a late night/early morning bite after pounding the liquor hard at the Bourbon Room. We were kind of disappointed that most of the menu wasn't available that time of night. We were really craving an entree, but had to settle on sandwiches instead. We ordered some ahi tuna to start.  The tuna was ok, nothing spectacular or anything. It was served with carrots, bean sprouts, and cucumbers. There was no soy sauce or wasabi served with the dish. Instead, the plate had a line of what appeared to be some kind of creamy horseradish.  I ordered a BLT and it was tasty. Nothing really to write home about, but then again it's a BLT, kind of hard to screw up.  Our server was very friendly and attentive considering the time of day. I would probably pass if I had to eat here again, but if you want a bite to eat during odd hours, it's one of the few places open where you can sit down and have a bite.

MrQppTogFLPNCCvvPIaLlg.text: Stayed at the Venetian when I went to Vegas last week and after a long time of trying to find something decently priced for lunch, we stumbled back to our hotel and decided to eat here based on one of our friend's recommendation.   It's a 24 hour restaurant and is a branch of Cheesecake Factory. I think they also had an AYCE breakfast buffet for $20, but I went with the lunch special of a soup-sandwich-salad combo instead. There was barely a wait. The food was pretty tasty, but I still need to try more dishes in order to really judge the food. Everything came out to be around $14 with tax/tip, which I think is pretty cheap in Vegas.   I'd definitely come back here for the decent price and food!

ot2sW0n51yFR5tmJG0da-w.text: Have been anxiously awaiting my first dinner at Grand Lux for some time now.   Finally went my last time I was in Vegas.    was not quite as epic as everyone made it out to be but I enjoyed the food either way, definitely better than alot of spots on the strip.   Got a short rib grilled cheese, which if you have never tasted the combination of juicy meaty, grilled short rib and grilled cheese than I suggest you do so.
