This is still a good example of this love affair but Los Angeles has several establishments where they serve a better one, Grand Lux's was slighly dry.  Nonetheless, it definitely hit the spot. :D  Also ordered the Asian nachos, which was my FAVORITE thing of the evening.  Made like regular nachos but with an Asian twist, and with Won Ton strips instead of tortilla chips which I feel is one of the more unique and impressive dishes I have came across in some time.    Their grand Lux burger was also good but not everything my friends ordered came out as spectacular as say the Asian nachos.  Would definitely come back here if near here while im in Vegas.

OzQdiF5u7iNZuUI4rq8twQ.text: Came in here for a quick dinner before getting ready to go out. Very "Cheesecake feel" obviously.  The food was good. I loved their Asian Nachos. I ended up getting a pasta dish (forgot the name) and it was decent. A little too heavy for my taste, but that differs from person to person so i don't count it against them. My husband ordered a meaty pasta dish that  DID NOT look so appetizing (looks like someone diarrhea'd all over a plate of noodles) but if you could get past the looks of it, it was actually pretty good. They should definitely serve it premixed.   I had ordered a Caesar salad to go with my food, but the waitress forgot to write it down and accused me of not ordering it...although everyone else at my table heard it. It was a lot of food, so I didnt mind so much...except the accusation.  Overall it was a good place to eat for nothing special. It's really like a "lets go out to eat cause I dont want to cook" kinda place and not a place to eat when you want something nicer.

dfsS3K3ASiZgD2leTPzLYA.text: After a long night of partying, my boyfriend and I ended up at the Venetian. We had just gotten out of Tao and needed food to soak up the liquor we had consumed. With not many late night options, we found out that the Grand Lux was still open. We had already eaten at the one in the Palazzo that morning so we knew the food wouldn't disappoint. We were seated quickly. Our server was very friendly.  Since we weren't starving, we decided to split a pizza. We ordered the Sausage, Pepperoni & Mushroom pizza off of the late night menu. The food did take a little while to get to the table. The pizza reminded me of &pizza's pizza because of the shape of the pizza. Pizza was good, a tad bit salty but still good. It was very filling and we couldn't finish it because we were so full. Grand Lux is definitely a solid place when looking for good, reasonably priced food.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

t3yCHQMbzGCWzLyFjK8dAQ.text: There is so much good food in Vegas, that I think taking a special trip to Grand Lux is dumb. If you are staying in the venetian, and you don't have much time to even go to the canal area, then sure, eat here.  I honestly can't even remember what I ordered. It was good, not great. Our server was very dumb and very slow, which was super frustrating for my aunt.   I just looked at the menu, and I definitely ordered the veggie burger which was pretty good. But again, there is so much good American food in Vegas, that you should really go here only if convenient.

_zrSeTRA-XS8-9NGBsFaDA.text: Came here during my cousins bachelorette and overall, liked it. Everyone in our party enjoyed their food except one. We all tried her Jambalaya and agreed that it tasted like canned tomato sauce. She did order a burger after and enjoyed it. Service was quick and friendly overall (had some mix up with our drink orders). They didnt take forever, like many places, after we placed our drink orders. Definitely recommend the Lemon Chicken Picatta and Thai Fried Chicken. Its like Cheesecake Factory so same quality of food. Good place to eat in Vegas that is nice but wont leave a huge dent in your wallet.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

4HEW4hEI8HRFACV5yd362w.text: Perfect spot for lunch.   Southwestern chicken salad was light and made me want more.  Attentive servers.   I did not realize this was part of cheese cake factory.  Similar over the top interior.  Would definitely come back.

rMQIfvQYKG26t1mN6yHjuw.text: Aloha, this is the closest food to the casino at the Venetian.  Generous portions, good variety & tasty, living up to what's in Las Vegas.  Best Happy Hour menu.  We ate here twice in 2 days (didn't want to get too far from the casino, LOL).  The pastrami sandwich & Asian nachos were our favorites.  Enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

lXddF13hbZw91_9fdvLGjA.text: Heard that the breakfast buffet or express buffet was amazing so decided to check it out.  We arrived just after 7am, it was not busy and there was no wait.  You can tell it's a Cheesecake Factory concept, uncomfortably close seating next to everyone.  Everyone's in your business and there is no privacy.  We asked for orange juice and coffee.  Then we went into the buffet room, I heard that the selection was small, quality over quantity.  I was surprised how small the selection was, one side of room were 3 hot dishes, one with hash browns, one with sausage, bacon & ham, and one with scrambled eggs, I noticed 3 more hot plates on the other side of the room, I hoped they contained grilled tomatoes, mushrooms or maybe something interesting, but sadly no, just a mirror image of what I already had.  There was an omelette station, chef couldn't even cook over medium eggs correctly, one was with hard yolk and one was undercooked with snotty whites. Fruit selection was nice all ripe, pastries were nice too. Service was slack, never got a coffee refill and had to ask for a juice refill and then wait several minutes for it.  Lots of people looking around for refills.  Had to stack dirty plates on the empty table next to me cause nobody was clearing.   Not overly impressed with this place.  Need a few more hot items for selection and more attentive service.  I noticed the section next to us has a female server who was on the ball, even getting coffee to go for her guests.

nY8EoN0wjr4A6HLoN4-nig.text: Location---location---location.The only thing this overrated cafe has going for it is its location. Easy for guests of The Venetian to access and to sign overpriced food tabs to their rooms.  With coffee at $4.50 a cup and orange juice $6.50 a glass their Express Breakfast Buffett is their best deal. Their Buffett Omelette station is the usual. Nothing special added.   We ordered off the menu this morning. I couldn't stomach their Florentine Omelette. They cover it with Hollandaise sauce which I like but them broil it onto the top of this salty mess of an egg dish.   We also ordered their Huevos  Rancheros. I love Huevos Rancheros. Their version was the worst I've ever tasted. The ranchero sauce they ladle around it is a disgustingly sweet slop.  Too many other great options for breakfast in Las Vegas to ever go back.

tWywVa-Lg8d8s4AQHtqmrQ.text: We had a late lunch here while at the Venetian. The food was plentiful but only decent. The salmon 3-ways, although well prepared wasn't seasoned 3-ways. Someone else had the chicken pot pie which was huge and reportedly very tasty. The atmosphere was perfect for being in the midst of everything.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The bar.

GNQqPjaWHlKEc1dHEkVlGQ.text: I'm not sure why you would want a nice restaurant open to the casino, unless... are there people who enjoy a nice meal with the ambient noise of casino games and people wandering through? I kind of prefer music or the conversation with others at the table, or myself if I'm eating alone I'm just that interesting to talk to.   I wouldn't  normally start with a criticism for a place where I had a good meal but that really stood out, sure a food court should have a noise level of a crowd at a heavy metal concert but the Gand Lux is a nice place. Not that it hurts the place it was crowed and the food was good and well priced. I would recommend it, just maybe go for a table in the back.

UlnL2XJ9CfHpFA9go3qkIw.text: I got to the restaurant and there was no one there waiting. No one around in the waiting area period. Not busy at all. My best friend went up to the counter to get us a table. I was with my 2 yr old and my younger siblings(five total). We stood there waiting as people suddenly started to show up, so some people that only had 2 or 3 people got sat first, understandable. I hear this guy walk up to the counter and ask how long to seat six? However, I didn't pay no mind to listening to the response. Anyway, that fact is relevant to what I'm getting to next. As we wait a little longer, I ask my friend how long the wait is. He told me, about five minutes from the time we got there. It's fine that we had to wait a little longer than five minutes, but then, , the host seats the table with six first! I'm like, ok, maybe they sat them down at a table with six chairs. Idk? (giving her the benefit of the doubt) Nope! She sat us right next to them in the same size booth like table. That is NOT ok with me! I got there when no one else was there and you seat me after a party that showed up after me? For what reason? It wasn't because we had different servers. We had the same server.  This was around five in the evening so whoever the two girls were, working in the front, great job on customer service!  I was facing the host when I heard my friend's name, as the two girls conversed, so I thought she was calling us, but that's when she called the party of six instead. I'm pretty sure the other girl was letting her know we were first but I don't think she cared.  Either way. That's just rude. Aside from the host with the most, careless attitude , lol,   I ordered the miso glazed halibut. It was not very good. I couldn't tell whether I was smelling or tasting the fish. It was gamey,  and it tasted kind of slimy with not much of a miso glaze or taste. I asked my best friend to taste it, (he's a sushi chef), he said it didn't taste right and the texture was rubbery. Our waitress, Shanene,  apologized and some other guy did as well. He didn't introduce himself, but he came to my table and took my order. I think he might have been the manager? He was super nice and so was our waitress. The food is just ok. I give them three stars to be fair. It's not a bad place or bad environment, however, the first person to come in contact with us did not make a good lasting impression. I'm good on this place. We still gave a 22% tip regardless. I want nothing out of this, as I won't be back anyway. I just want to state that what the host did is not ok.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My not so happy face, in a not so busy place.
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Not so, miso, glazed Halibut lol

zmmLYuhw7D9ANeyKqnq-SA.text: When I first came to Vegas and saw Grand Lux Cafe, my first impression was that this place was the most vanilla-lookin restaurant within a 2 mile radius. After my experience there, I have to say I was thoroughly impressed with the quality of the food and service here. We came with a large party of 10+ and were seated almost immediately with no prior reservation and got a wide range of different items on the menu, including carbonara pasta and barbecued chicken pizza. Everything was delicious!

3McwTWYKC-Ec607drKqUSQ.text: I enjoy the Grand Lux Cafe in Chicago. My sister got carryout late one night.   Asian Nachos - Yuck! I didn't care for them at all!  Crab Cakes - Good  Chicken Pasta - This was good too...just wished it was a bit more creamy.  Strawberry Shortcake - Not bad  Solid place to eat at.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Asian Nachos
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Pasta
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab Cakes

Z7BOxU7GwghgoBjXZPbiLA.text: The Grand Lux Cafe is one of my favorite restaurants inside the Venetian. The food is always consistent and the prices are reasonable. I've been here for breakfast, lunch and dinner before. Each time I leave with a happy stomach and money left in my pocket. There's a lot of variety on the menu. I enjoy having the omelettes during breakfast and the average price is around $13. Some fast food places at the food court charge more than that. Lunch averages around $20 and dinner is around $30.   The other day I tried out the Caramel Chicken and it was delicious. The chicken had a nice crisp to it and the sauce went really well with the white rice. In my opinion, almost everything on the menu is acceptable. The burgers are good. The omelettes in the morning are tasty. I always have trouble ordering because everything sounds tasty. You seriously can't go wrong with the Grand Lux.   To top of the good food is the friendly services. The servers are always attentive and efficient when it comes to customer service. Like I said, I've been here at least 4 times now and I've never left disappointed.

VYO9CvnusRzn46vr3Rhs4g.text: I'm not normally a plate cleaner. In fact, I often have left overs for days. But, my plate was clean for the biscuits and gravy. Best biscuits and gravy I've ever eaten. Even my husband loved it, and he doesn't even like biscuits and gravy. No pictures but definitely a clean plate.

boDemF4o-l2s-YWNRujEyA.text: Went here because there was a wide variety of food options which made it easy to dine with a group. We got sat down right away with no wait for an early dinner.  The server was really nice and very accommodating. Ordered pasta but the pasta itself was undercooked and quite hard/chewy. Flavor was good but the undercooked pasta definitely ruined the dish. It took quite awhile for them to get the check but it was pretty busy. Another note is there are no restrooms inside the restaurant. You would have to go outside to the casino's restroom. Also, be careful if you're wearing heels.  The floors were quite slippery.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken, sun-dried tomato, creamy pasta

7NIC73sJ6owQcUx8TZu5WQ.text: Without a doubt the best restaurant in Vegas  A bold statement  We are here breakfast 2 days lunch 2 days and dinner 3 days  An excellent menu that won't empty your pocket  Fish and Chips are #1 in US and I am a fish and chips expert  We also had lettuce raps and beef Wellington with the best steak I have had  Our friends and family came with us one night and had different items from the menu  We all sampled each other's food and not one item was sub par   All food is fresh and very high quality  I dare you not to eat here  Waiting staff are so good and friendly not to mention very helpful   Thanks

NOCyX8RdIEfflfbxB6eKLw.text: BOMB BOMB!!   We visit Las Vegas 3x a year. We make a point to eat at Grand Lux Cafe every time. We always order the Asian Nachos and Buffalo Chicken Rolls. Service is always good, food always great. I would love to order something different on the menu, but I just love their Asian Nachos so much and it's so filling! Every dish that passes me look delicious!!!

0dzP59dDfqU2MVoR-K3rIw.text: My wife and I stayed at the Venetian for 4 days. We ate breakfast twice and stopped in for dessert one evening.  Breakfast bar was great the first time. Lots of options, omelette chef, and great fruit variety. The second time we stopped in a little later and the buffet had been picked through and didn't get replenished while we were there. We were happy with a custom omelette and fruit anyway.  The evening adventure turned into the Butter Cake, brownie sundae, and coffee. The butter cake was definitely the way to go! Overall I recommend stopping here.

WbAHND9sN5gPHrpz78iwRg.text: Great food and great drinks.  Very accessible and good prices.    Friendly and quick employees.

0Omr_jRWn6ChBvCbsBOl_Q.text: By far one of my favourite places to grab food during my stay in Vegas! Being from Canada the only place I can really compare it to in the States is Cheesecake Factory, as they have quite a large menu and american style portions(you don't see me complaining). Very well cooked meals, didn't have to send anything back at all. As well all you can eat bread so I was a happy raver. We were just staying at The Palazzo so probably about a couple minute walk from the lobby and you're there! They also have a cafe side in case you're looking for something quick and easy. Definitely try their desserts, you won't be disappointed!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

bWv94YA921pjg8O3CcdfVw.text: Grand lux by Vegas standards is nothing special. It's an acceptable place to eat if you're short on time and money. It's like a cheesecake factory that's been upscaled a bit. I've eaten here when i'm sober as well as drunk. I would not recommend getting the sliders ( Even though my bestfriend Magic Mark insists on ordering it everytime ).. they're a little bland for my taste.  Do try the chicken alfredo and pasta carbonara. It's decent and flavorful. I like to ask for some extra sauce for the chicken alfredo on the side.  If the line is long, hit the take out line, it's usually much faster. Grand Lux gets pretty busy later in the day

Mli6sP2oGGvwH54dU6_F0A.text: Sister restaurant to Cheesecake Factory, and just as good!! I had an amazing salad with crab and shrimp at a reasonable price, plus every table gets warm, fresh bread to start your meal.   The waitress was wonderful -friendly, helpful and attentive, despite being busy.   Amidst all of Vegas's kitschy over-priced restaurants, buffets, and expensive high end eateries this is a nice quality casual dining oasis!

w277um3uYmhKdxjwI5dYDQ.text: It is a good place to unwind after a day of walking down the strip.  The food was good and its location is convenient, but nothing that stood out.  Have been here a few times as its a place where most of our group can definitely find something on the menu as it has a large selections of items to chose from.  Service was good but just standard.

uaAKshI2q8-UqT0gCQ4GHg.text: This is an amazing place to eat. Very tasty and affordable food. Customer Service was great and accommodating with large groups without reservations. I would definitely come back again.

O9oCzLYV5kFlKK3HP9zz0Q.text: This is about the only restaurant worth your money in the food court... The food is great quality and about the same price as other restaurants surrounding. I ate a a great burger while my friend ate another and it was  good.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This was delicious ...

6ei7q8zGY83QhRE5UcsGsQ.text: Grand Lux has a wide variety of plates like Cheesecake Factory, but a step up in quality from CF.  The two times we went, our group had plates mixed between: breakfast, pasta, salmon, sandwiches, and various sides.   The food was tasty and on-point...  The service was ~3 stars on one visit, and ~4 stars on the other visit, due to various lag-times and non-presence of our servers.   If you gamble at the tables, speak with the Casino Host about your player's #'s, and you may be able to have some of your chow comped!

aaw42sOXOouYhOmRaBmsBA.text: This place has been such a hit and miss with both service and food.  2/5 Customer Service We walked up at 11:00pm. No wait just us two. Hostess smiled and looked around for tables, then looked around for a coworker... By this time there was 8 people behind us. She asked us how many for the second time, we said two, she smiled and made eye contact with another employee who started walking her way. This couple who was behind us was then asked by her how many, they said two and she said "ok come with me"... What the heck? And sits them on an "outside" . The second coworker makes it to us 2 mins after and puts us in between two other couples. Tight and awkward. Like in previous posts, although not busy everything took long.  I was already a bit irritated about the hostess situation and waiting 10 mins for bread and water that we decided just to share a waffle since we had heard great things and eat dinner elsewhere.  4/5 Food Bread was terrible. More like toast. Super hard and very crumby. Not hot or even warm. Waffle oj the other hand though was perfect. Crispy, fluffy and full of flavor!! So so good. A must try.  There is no check back with your food. We had 3 waiters in the 45 min time frame we where there. No refills either on water. Bill was quick to come out.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Strawberry waffle

3QDAcVI3z539tiqUgK4T-Q.text: Hands-down 5 stars! On a late Friday night (or perhaps in the wee morning hours), my husband and I sneaked out of the room and came here to get a drink and chicken wings. We were seated in a nice comfortable booth and ordered a Pina Colada and Buffalo Chicken Wings. Loved the classy ambiance. Service is commendable.  Within a few minutes our drink was served. My husband who normally doesn't take alcohol actually loved the Pina Colada here. Chicken wings were amazing too! Loved it so much that we brought our parents to the restaurant the next day for lunch!  Tip: The entree portions are pretty big, unless your stomach is rumbling, 2 people can easily share one entree and leave the restaurant on a full stomach.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Buffalo Chicken Wings
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pina Colada

yLtXCEvaOj1193In0m_0ow.text: Had breakfast 3 days in a row here. Quick, friendly service and decent food. The coffee was STRONG and bitter but all else was good.

xBZOwxmS-gQp4SgabNJoyw.text: The food was spectacular. I got the caramel chicken with some brown rice and a Hawaiian smoothie. Very yummy. However, customer service wasn't very good

5lYC9lEQ7kyf-TV4wf-1Rw.text: Awesome restaurant for romantic late night dinner. We had soup of the day clam chowder. Asian nacho, glazed porkchop and Asian pear martini.   Their complementary bread is crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. Very delicious.  Clam chowder is very rich and fabulous combo with their bread. 4/5 stars  Asian nacho is sweet, sour and little bit of Chili. Serves with chicken, cheese and tasty nacho chip. Very unique but too much sauce. 3/5 stars  The porkchop is superb tender and perfect with their mash potato and veggies. 5/5  I love their Asian pear martini. Just awesome sweet and perfect amount of vodka.

gkQiX045wspCbvSLPGeMOQ.text: This place recently did a solid remodel and looks better than ever. I love coming here for an affordable bite each time I stay at the Venetian.   Best part? This place is 24/7...exactly what you need in this town for about 281 reasons.   Breakfast until 11 Lunch and dinner Late night menu  Bread here is on point at lunch and dinner. :D Portions are huge. Save money... split a plate!

K0qHfeQCm1vemwgewftEpg.text: Flying in super late at night, Yelp helped us locate this place. The reviews & that fact that it was open 24 hours was enough for us to stop by :)  It is located inside The Venetian hotel. We had to ask for help to locate it & it seems all the people that work at The Venetian knew what directions to point us in.  When we got there, there was no line so we headed straight up to the hostess. She seated us immediately.   Our waitress have us bread to snack on after she got our waters.  I ordered the Fresh Garden Omelette. It has mushrooms, tomato, avocado, green onion, zucchini, fresh spinach, Harvati cheese & sour cream. It came with a side of hash browns.  The omelette was HUGE! I ate only half & took the other half to eat later on. It was really good, the sauce in it was really runny though but eh, whatevs.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Omelette.
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu.

4mzQx3PnKimARFVLt8zB7g.text: Food is exactly what you'd expect from Cheesecake Factory. For some, that's a great thing. For others, it's just ok. We're with the latter crowd. However, the incredibly friendly and courteous service here from everyone we interacted with deserves the 5 stars hands down. It's great for kids too.

KLR1Q8Lx_3Xxd_IoxQ_k2A.text: This restaurant was honestly our last resort to come eat here. It was closer to our hotel as well.  Place looked pretty packed when we were getting seated. Waited 5 mins to be seated though. 10 minutes in, that's when the crowd was dying down.  Waiter looked like he hated his job by the way he took our drink orders. Took him 15 minutes to bring out our water as well.  The table next to us had lots of complaints but I would rather want their server than ours to be honest. He was so attentive to their needs.  I order the pasta carbonara ( $17 )  Husband ordered the tomato loving pasta w/ grilled chicken ( $19 ) My pasta was so bland, omg. I had to add salt and it still did nothing. I wasn't expecting it to be so dry because according to the Yelp pictures, everyone raved about it.  My husbands pasta was honestly a lot better than mine. Although his chicken was drier than the heat in Vegas. He could've lived without the chicken. His has so much flavors going on. I usually like white sauce and he loves his red sauce. But man did I regret my order. Our server didn't even bring out our food nor did he check up on us. Terrible service from him. Most definitely not coming back there.  2 stars for my untastful carbonara and not so great service.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Forgot the name but it&#39;s pretty much a tomato lovers pasta.
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pasta carbonara. Tasteless.

MTcDr6j5xsbdvgPbNLwyTQ.text: 3.5 Stars  I tried this restaurant for the first time because I stayed at the Venetian. This place is like another Cheesecake Factory because it has a different variety of foods.  First off, the portions are HUGE. We were warned by the server, but I didn't think it'd be that big. We ordered 3 pastas and 2 appetizers for five people. We only finished one appetizer...  For starters, we had the calamari and Thai crispy rolls. The breading didn't stick to the calamari, which just made it okay. I thought the Thai crispy rolls were just alright also, but my friends really liked it. The crispy rolls were the only thing we finished.  We all agreed that the best item we ordered was the Garlic Shrimp pasta. I like this dish because it wasn't too heavy for pasta. The pasta with Grilled Chicken, Sun Dried-Tomatoes, and Mushrooms was pretty good also. I didn't really enjoy the Pasta Carbonara because I don't like bacon and it kind of overpowered the dish.  The service was really good. It was the best service we had in Vegas. Our server was really friendly and attentive. I wish I had her name so I could give her some recognition.  I wanted to give this place four stars, but it's just not a four star restaurant to me. I don't know how to explain it... I would probably come back to this place because it's affordable to eat in Vegas. It's also open 24 hours so I'd pick this place to eat when I'm drunk too.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pasta with Chicken, Sun-Dried Tomatoes, and Mushrooms
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pasta Carbonara with Chicken
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Garlic Shrimp Pasta - Best dish!

D6OJv6wMxNY2b73QFjq_uQ.text: Had to go out for a short business trip. Always like to stop by for some great food. This time I added on a delicious margarita with my sliders. My friend got a Chinese chicken salad and the pot roast. Also got a big burger. Everything was top notch as always.  Thanks for another wonderful meal. See y'all next trip.

YKZ-yZiWFO9HnLqWpEnpmQ.text: Always love eating here for breakfast when my husband and I stay in the hotel. I love hot chocolate and theirs is so good! Super creamy and chocolatey.  We've had many waffles in Vegas and this place has the best one! The butter maple syrup that comes with the waffle is amazing! Seriously I think about this waffle often.  Overall, friendly staff and very knowledgable with their menu items. Thank you for another great breakfast!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amazing waffle with butter maple syrup!

KDSViLz7ywUJWAdsjlKr_g.text: Beyond not worth the price for the breakfast buffet. It's like paying for one of those free continental breakfasts at a bed and breakfast.

PfOVsjDhaMziIg3K3I81yw.text: Great food and service from Ernesto love this little spot with great food portion and decent prices . I ordered the calamari appetizer it was amazing

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

hmcC-Ucgq5hNngDCkpGruw.text: Do I love staying at the Venetian? Yes. Do I like Cheesecake Factory, Luxe's owners? Yes. Could it be that I'm biased in favor of Luxe?  Yes.  Pros This is definitely a nice place to eat with good food and nice ambiance.  Prices are ok.  Cons Wait can be long.  Should you try this place out if you're in vegas?  Yes, but go during off hours to have the best experience.  It's next to the escalators and the slot machines near the bathrooms.

XzpynS481Qdn41cxx65C6w.text: After a night out at Tao, my party split. Some were too drunk to continue the night, while others (including myself) held it together and carried on! I had the pleasure of staying at The Venetian, so we thought... Why go out to The Strip where it's incredibly hot? So we started looking...   I'm not a big fan of going to sit-down places in Vegas; I really don't see the point. But the food court only had two places open - none of which seemed appealing. Luckily, a worker of the Venetian walked by us, so I (probably drunkly) walked up to her and asked if there were any other places that we could eat. She was really nice, pointed at Grand Lux, and said, "It's REALLY good." I was sold.   We walk in (party of four) and are immediately seated. Our server is VERY nice and attentive - and please keep in mind this was around 3 am - so I really doubt he wanted to be there. I forgot his name, but the guy was awesome.   Onto food: We ordered the BLT sandwich, someone else ordered a burger, and per the servers recommendation, someone ordered Asian nachos (AMAZING, btw). I ordered the Bacon-Cheese burger(!!!!!).   The Asian nachos were freaking amazing... They're made with crispy friend wontons, covered with chicken, sweet peanut sauce, and wasabi cream and melted cheese! The plate comes with about ten of them, and we were all able to get one and enjoy it. It's just crispy goodness! Very yummy.   My Bacon-Cheese burger was freaking good. I just reviewed GR's BurGR, and I was really unimpressed with the service and food. My burger was a disappointment. Luckily, I had come to the GLC the night before, so this burger was still on my mind. I ordered it well done, and it was made perfectly. It's ANGUS beef with crispy bacon, melted American cheese, grilled onions, and mayo. I really recommend it! I was starving, and yet, I couldn't even finish it. It was huge! The fries that it came with were meh, but nothing a little ranch can't fix.   Overall, I can recommend this place for lunch or at least for the Asian nachos and burger that I ordered. The service was GREAT, but the time it took to get our food was a bit long... No matter. He kept checking on us, and made sure that our drinks were filled. That alone is good enough for me.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Bacon-Cheese Burger! So yummy.

ZQB4K7jFuZ_iunoQ8v8VsA.text: Think about this place as a 24/7 Cheesecake factory.   No matter if you have been gambling for hours or you just came back from the club shaking your a** off, those guys will stand by your side and feed you whenever you want to.   They have a large menu divided into breakfast, lunch, dinner with lots of variety and cuisines.  Portions are big and they provide great quality within the whole concept. Service and pricing is definitely adding up to a great value overall so if you are around hungry, i wouldnt hesitate to give them a go.  Great food in a relaxed environment serving you with a smile 24/7...just go!

zwhJpFDwceYQgJbKTItECA.text: My last night in Vegas, I wanted some good eats within walking distance of my hotel. After checking yelp, Grand Lux fit the bill. My friend and I were seated immediately upon entering, and we got straight to ordering. I ordered a chocolate espresso martini to start followed by the asian nachos as an app and the chicken and waffles for my entree. My friend went with the chicken parm. Our server was really nice, and made sure coffee/ water was always full.  If you like vodka, I would recommend trying their martini- that thing was strong! I switched to coffee and poured it in about halfway through. Asian nachos were great- fried wontons with rice, cheese, chicken, and two different yummy sauces on them. Entrees arrived soon after, and oh man, they were huge! There were probably 6 chicken strips on my waffle and my friend's chicken parm was easily the size of his 14 inch oval platter. Both meals were well rec'd- I took home the majority of my food (thank goodness for mini-fridges!). My friend said this was his favorite meal of our entire trip. So yes, more expensive version of The Cheesecake factory. So what's wrong with that? Absolutely nothing :)

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

CyCHS4HpXEPGezfgv71_UQ.text: I used to love the Grand Lux Cafe here at The Venetian but the service by staff and quality of food have certainly declined.  One of the best things about GLC is that it is open 24hrs, but the last three times I've visited late night they've all been disappointing experience.  Maybe it's because I'm used too excellence when dining here, but they just don't seem like what they used to be.  The wait time was much longer than what I was told and there were forgotten items and modifications made to my meal.  On top of that, a plate that I always order here was not served to it's potential.  The chicken that night tasted absolutely plain.  It's going to be a while before my next Grand Lux meal

2i-nx1kfMvSw2S8dkiHinA.text: Wonderful place to eat breakfast --lunch or dinner we had it all there--from the wonderful breakfast waitress Jeanne--to the night servers--all was good from the eggs bagels and to the steaks my husband and I ordered there--So much mashed potatoes I could not finish them halfway--not a bad word to say about the food served there--even the manager was so sweet she helped us out with a small problem gladly---Lorena Rojas was such a big help--restaurants need more people just as great as she was to us--Mrs-E Aharoni--Woodland Hills California

zOTw0B3mMXhilEjYXqNisA.text: Okay, so the 4 stars really reflects that you can get just about type of food you want at a reasonable price right in the hotel.  The menu is very big, and some of the dishes are 3 stars, but some are 4.  The burgers are great, the big salads are very good. Avoid the Italian food and I wouldn't order the steak. But if you want a Cobb salad, a burger, chicken sandwich this is a good place to grab one for 15-20 out the door with a drink.

0iTZDxhe260fcYtId4e6zw.text: This place is an indecisive diner's worst nightmare! The menu is huge and features most everything one could think of!  We experienced very good service here. The food is average but the portions are huge! Prices are relatively cheap, just be prepared to walk away with a doggy bag!

j_8DHV8TnCWATBa0gdxszA.text: We just love the Grand Lux Cafe!!  Just to be a little different this trip, we sat at the bar.  The bartender came over got us our drinks and then disappeared for quite sometime.  I finally had to call over another person to take our order.  She was very apologetic, he probably returned about 20-25 minutes later...hummm  This would account for the 4 star rating and not a 5. One thing about the Grand Lux, is that the portions are HUGE!!  We had cheeseburgers and as always they were terrific!! Will definitely go back the next time we are in Las Vegas..

Y7vpvMbrpSwqbWvU6VEysg.text: I just recently had a late night dinner at Grand Lux and everything was amazing. Me and a girlfriend stumbled in there after work on night to fulfill our carb addiction. I ordered the carbonara which was phenomenal, but our favorite part was our server Chuy! Chuy was nothing short of fantastic! He was very attentive and made sure we had everything we needed. Also, the manager Matt came around to make sure that everything was to our liking. I love Grand Lux and will be dining there a lot more often. Thank you Chuy for taking care of us that night!

vgN0SMp0N9hQdVHtdn1yuQ.text: I refuse to believe that this is anyway associated with the Cheesecake Factory. There's simple no way because this place is tremendous. Seriously. It's impossible.   We at their three times as it was right around the corner from the elevators, but I'm glad we did. I ordered huevos rancheros first and they were dynamite. A BBQ chicken flatbread second...equally dynamite.   The creme de la creme was the chicken & waffles. Perfectly cooked chicken, a thick Belgian, chopped pecans, a maple butter sauce makes for a plate full of awesome! This was so great that the redneck next to us actually stopped talking on his cell phone to comment how wonderful it looked. I was actually full halfway through, but I just couldn't stop eating it. Could. Not. Stop!   I loved this place and am really looking forward to having it again very soon!

chTvFTddMT3BznciCAQdWA.text: Four words: short rib grilled cheese.  It was magical.  Four out of 8 people at my table ordered it and the other 4 wished they'd followed suit.   The Grand Lux is a good choice when you're trying to eat a good meal at a good price, but don't want to be all cheap and McD's about it. The prices are fair for the portions and quality of the food.   The service was off in one instance where everyone got their food except me because of a kitchen error (I think my plate was sent to a different table). However, I'm not bitter because the server was straight up about it and very apologetic. He vowed to get me my grilled cheese right away and even offered a side to hold me over. When I said I didn't need a side, he insisted, so I went with french fries and he brought me the a huge bowl of fries. I'm talking 2 or 3 times a normal meal portion. Not necessary, but I appreciated the gesture.   Oh, and I definitely appreciated that grilled cheese!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

wkLhojxfO_fLnSNHPtkcHQ.text: I don't know how this place got 4 stars. My boyfriend and I were on vacation last week and this is the first place we hit. He got the enchiladas with rice and black beans. The rice came out burnt and chewy and after sending it back the server came back with it but the with the same rice but just a larger portion. She then asked if he wanted more black beans. Why?!? Why can't the chefs just remake the freaking rice right? How hard is it? RUBIOS makes better Spanish rice and you guys are suppose to be competing with all the other restaurants but can't make rice right? Anyway, I got the Salisbury steak and it was chewy and the crust on the outside was hard. My coworker said there breakfast is good but we'll never know because we're never coming back.

tyVCBg5pj04zHpsdLm-WEw.text: It's been a long time since I wanted to give a joint 6*s - but, I guess if you call everything a unicorn, they are eventually all just horses . I really thought perhaps this was a mirage (at 4am in Vegas), but alas...it was the Venetian (womp womp). The food was truly out of this world!! I want to write an ode to the salted caramel syrup my cousin had with her chicken and waffles. I mean, like in Gaelic. Hardcore. We took some to go, and drank it for "breakfast" the next day. I had the Zen Noodles and all I can tell you is, it's some of the best "pho" I've had in awhile! The lemongrass broth beats plain ol chicken or beef or veggie any day! You can add the veggies (sprouts, basil, lime) and request the Sriracha (although it was in paste form, and I prefer the chili pepper sauce). The noodles are big and flat, and I like how they bring you extra broth in a small carafe - aye! que cute! My bestie had the chicken parm, and I'm telling you, the portions DON'T PLAY. If we had been in the same moods, and not so tipsy, I would have shared. As it were, we had parm the next day for lunch - BOTH of us. I see there are nothing but 4's and 5's down the line for this place, so believe them! TIP: Um, don't go SO drunk you can't enjoy it....and they're open all night (one of the few!) venetian.com/grand-lux-c...

C79VRRzfFwob5cVHjdQGIA.text: Absolutely loved the food here. The breakfast buffet offers excellent food and amazing value. Staff is amazing too!

zzOPT03vpzOKq3QgprQFAg.text: Honestly, I was hoping this place would be much better but it really disappointed me. My friends and I were hungry at 3 am and the Grand Lux Cafe was open so we decided to eat here.   We were seated within 5 minutes and then we waited a while for our waiter. Finally, we ordered, and I got the tomato soup expecting a nice simple red soup with maybe some basil. I was extremely disappointed when the tomato soup came out a while later with beans and onions and the flavor was spicy. The soup was chunky and nothing like a tomato soup I have had before. It was not good and cost me about 10 dollars of something I was only able to eat 1/4 of.   I wish I had ordered a sandwich with the salad because it looked much better than what I got. This place does have a huge menu and it's my fault for picking probably the worst thing on it.   I would give this place another chance but the service was really slow, granted it was late, and I just wish my soup was better. Overall one of my least favorite meals I have had in a long time and it should have been much better.

LQ6y5v-CAaOsM26GICZ2yQ.text: We came here for a quick dinner before heading out for the night. Since we were staying at the Venetian, we decided to just keep it simple and eat close by. Luckily, there was not a long wait for a party of 6.  Let me just put it out now. RUDE SERVICE! I don't care if it's Vegas or not vegas, if you're a server, you should have a good attitude no matter what restaurant or location you're at. Our server, I shall leave his name out of this review, was rude the moment he came to our table and asked for drinks. We had already been drinking all day at the pool and all we wanted were waters. He gave us this look of disgust and made a comment along the lines of just waters?... And just kind of walked away to let us look over the menus. It would have been nice too to introduce yourself too, sir.  Finally when he came back to take our orders, I asked him if they put the ranch on the side or on the Buffalo Wings appetizer dish and he looked at me as if I were asking a stupid question. His reply was "So you want it on the side...? Or just extra on the side...?" I then had to explain to him to leave the ranch on the side because I was allergic to dairy and eggs. He then straight up said "Well then you can't have them!! It has all of those in it" in a tone of voice assuming I'm supposed to know this?! Forget it then. We ended up ordering the Chicken Lettuce Wraps for an appetizer and when it came to entrees, I ordered the Clams with Pasta dish. I asked him what kind of noodles they used and he said, "Egg noodles. You can't have that either!" I asked if they could substitute the noodles for non-egg noodles and he started listing off random noodles I barely recognized by name. I guess I had a confused look on my face because he just sighed and asked if I just wanted rice noodles instead. Done. Oh, and by the way, throughout this whole conversation over food allergies, this guy has the nerve to laugh and joke about it....  Food comes out, he doesn't even come back to check on us until after we're almost done and it's only to ask if we wanted boxes. Honestly, this place is open 24/7 and I know for sure I would come back here after a night of drinking, but if all the servers here had this guys attitude, I would rather go to Denny's. Looking at the other reviews, it seemed like our table just got bad luck and got this horrible server. Overall, the food is pretty good with big portions. I would probably compare this place to a Cheesecake Factory with a Maggiano's ambiance.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Clams with Rice Noodles

DilNwKxDctUUCqciI1YjUA.text: Food wasn't so great. Since they have such a large menu it was hard to choose & what they specialize in. I feel like all the food was just okay. Not much of a flavor or zing. I wouldn't go here again because I couldn't find any of the good stuff they serve. Tried a couple plates & they were all just "whatever.  Drinks: Pina colada was yummy! My friend got fresh brewed coffee & she enjoyed that as well. I guess Lux is just a good place to grab a couple drinks and head out.

j--iQ2sagZSd4K5dVIUcYA.text: I like this place for its convenience and deliciousness... and its WAY more upscale than your typical "cafe". Reminds me of cheesecake factory, and in fact they DO sell cheesecake factory cheesecake on the menu! I split the lemon ricotta pasta with my friend... omg.... the noodles were so good... and the sauce was so rich and creamy... and there was a very strong TART taste of lemon in it... and the capers were soo good with it too... and not bad for under $15 I believe. It was included in one of their lunch specials. OMG: yelp.com/biz_photos/gran... The food did take awhile to come out... but in the meantime, I was just sipping the Fat Tuesdays and munching on the crunchy bread................ We even ate here "to go" -- there's a separate shop in the front of the restaurant that sells "to go" sandwiches, salads, small portions, and espresso beverages. Even for $6.99, the greek salad packed in a LOT of lettuce, flavor, toppings, cheese, etc. and took awhile to eat because there was SO MUCH LETTUCE packed into the plastic box. So I'd recommend it for a quick meal. The chicken salad sandwich ($5.99) was also surprisingly delicious, and the mayo wasn't all gross and light.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. lemon chicken ricotta pasta

5v3y8vZmGTKa3VRqoQJWEA.text: I realize when I stay at the Palazzo, there's no reason to eat outside of the Palazzo/Venetian area.  Haha.  Grand Lux Cafe never disappoints and is where I usually eat on my first night in town.  The menu is HUGE and I have never been disappointed.  I personally had the chicken and vegetables topping farro.  OMG -- it was SO good.  The description doesn't do it justice at all.  It is moist and savory goodness.  Others at the table ordered the Zen noodles (think Vietnamese pho), salmon and beef with rice.  Everything was delicious and hearty in taste and size.  The service was impeccable.  I was initially intimidated by what looked like a long wait.  People were sitting on the floor (!) waiting to be called.  Surprisingly, we got seated in less than 5 minutes in the bar area.  Works for me!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Zen noodles -- think Vietnamese pho.
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef with rice.  Delicious taste but kind of chewy.
Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon

Y54jtcYVrkqHomJTviTTQg.text: Ah the Grand Lux Cafe... my friends and I became fast fans of this joint after our last stay at the Venetian. Between 7 people, I think we frequented it a combined ~15 times in 48 hours. Snack, late night snack, dinner, late night snack, late lunch. What can I say, we got lazy and it was conveniently located in our hotel when we didn't want to venture far for food. A couple of key items on the menu got us through the weekend: the burger melt, the max burger, the cream of chicken soup, and last but not least, the winter melon soup. Thats nice... nothing like a hearty burger, soup and greasy fries to soak up all that alcohol. Loved this place.

vXHJbttz9-B-LCq0JT4qBw.text: Well... uh, ok, I hate to be the one to do this but I'm basing my review off of what the server man put in front of me. Ok, here we go..... Had just arrived at this casino, met my sweetie, was real late and neither one of us had dinner so we head into the Grand Lux Cafe.   I'm in the mood for soup, didn't like their soup options so I decide to have their Zen Noodles. After reading the menu description, I realize they're talking about pho, I say yes, that's perfect, definitely will hit the spot. So our server brings my noodles and I immediately notice that the bean sprouts look not so fresh, so I poke my finger into them and eeeeew!(mushy). I spoon a taste of broth and OMG! Are you kidding me! This tastes like chicken broth out of the can. I say whoa now! I am so not going to eat these noodles. So we call over the waiter asking him to send it back and to bring back a menu, (I said please) I felt bad for doing this but I usually pay around $5 for a good bowl of pho in the bay area and they were charging $14. The manager came over and apologized profusely and took care of us from there on, (good manager) Obviously the best thing here on out is if I want a bowl of Pho then I will only order from a noodle shop.

xGDNjX7ICN5w3UZx_Jw6ug.text: owned by the Cheesecake Factory this restaurant offers an abundance of selections in their menu similar to the Cheesecake Factory only the food is a lot better! portions are big and the waitstaff are friendly.  if you go ask for Jin! the fried calamari was cooked to perfection not rubbery or hard.

LilqfABCngwg3U7DaSP_6g.text: MMMMMMMMMM. SHORT RIB GRILLED CHEESE  never seen this anywhere else and it is AMAZING. seriously out of this world. Ate so many places while in vegas and this is definitely a stand out.  Their hot sourdough bread and butter is also great  Came here 3 nights in a row at like 3 am.... short rib grilled cheese twice. Had the chicken avocado sandwich another time which was also amazing.  short rib grilled cheese. you will thank me.

_-IhO2iBetu-eVC__8EUqA.text: $16 bucks for the Lux Buffett. Not super grand food but they were attentive. The mushroom and asparagus omelette tasted decent. The vegetables were undercooked and too much hollandaise sauce. If you want fast, buffet the way to go.

l4r3o9hrCEk0Lu9KV6QlLg.text: This place is decent.... I went here for a "work function" during the eyewear expo. This was a buffet style event, so I might be limited on what I'm able to share... the food was decent, but the place is nicer than the quality of food. Now, don't get me wrong, the food is good just felt like more attention went into the decorations... I'm picky!

IMoRKCQtyOqNYU_71e4CVg.text: after a night of drinking, we were looking for a place to eat, the only place still open was the grad lux, its just like a cheesecake factory. The food was actually pretty good, I got the chicken salad sandwich, which came with lots of chicken salad. Other people ordered steal, duck dumplings, fried chicken 7 waffles, breakfast food, no one complained about the quality, the food was wonderful.   I knocked back a lot of stars because the service was ABSOLUTELY HORRIBLE. we were waiting for our food for an hour, and one of the servers dropped my friends steak on the floor and had to go make another one, but they said they would not charge for  the steak since it took them so long to make it and the accident. So the steak took another 1/2 hr to come out. after we finished our food, it took them another 45 minutes to bring us the bill, it was the most waiting ive EVER done in my life for food and bill. and on top of that they charged us 2 times for the steak and the waiter apologized but then told us he had to "ask his manager" to take off the steaks. First of all, we didn't order 2 steaks, and we shouldnt pay for both, and 2nd they said it would be comp'd so it should of been. we waited another 30 min for them to take it off the bill. it was horrible service, I would go back to this place eventually, but it wont be for a while.

cmLgeeQROUklY-MHTWXaKQ.text: this place was awesome!!! I came here this past weekend for my birthday and had a very good (and large) white wine clam spagetti. It was pretty good. perhaps a little dry for some but i thought it was fine. the service was great and even had a nice little dessert for our birthday.

qrqVumpH2mU7k0ec8rruJQ.text: Great flavored, massive servings, cheap eat in Vegas.  I went back multiple times.  Chicken parm is great (feeds at least two people) and so is the edamame.

gobqqa-K1voFk_Q9TfLoAw.text: Great place to eat after clubbing at TAO or any other LV club.   My friend and I was making fun of Grand Lux because we thought it was a total bite of Cheesecake Factory. From the decor to the take out bags.   Until a day later we realized it was created/founded or whatever by Cheesecake Factory. That was a lol on our part.   Service was mediocre that night because all the clubbers were heading here to eat their early morning meals and absorb as much alcohol as they can.    A handful of drunktards... including us.   Food: I was not hungry that night so all I got was a super small salad for a premo price. A couple friends ordered Zen Noodles.. aka the Hangover cure... that came wayy late. We were done eating already. We let the server know and he galdly tooked it off the bill.   After our meal, the manager came by to apologize and explain why it took so long. In addition to the free Zen Noodles, he gave us two orders of desserts to go. We thought it was a really nice gesture by him even though it was super busy that night.   I'm a fan.

CwZo3QwzpS9zcJNATVVPfw.text: If you like the CheeseCake Factory, you will enjoy Grand Lux Cafe.  On my recent trip to Vegas I ate here twice.  The first night was at 3:30am, after clubbing heavy.  The food was great and just what I needed to bounce back.  My biggest complaint about Vegas is the lack of reasonable places to eat, that still taste good.  I hate buffets so that has a lot to do with why I feel that way too...If your looking for no surprises and a decent meal, here's the spot.

DGQ-7fdZ04nqmyGRTn-OSw.text: I admit the food at the Cheesecake Factory is a lot better. But the place itself is still pretty nice and the food isn't bad either. I ordered the Pasta Telephono with sauteed chicken and it was pretty good. sorta reminded me of the Four-Cheese pasta at Cheesecake. The server was really nice and very attentative even though we were a big group of ten. All in all, it's a nice place to have dinner at. Keep in mind though that the portions are HUGE. I had so much leftover from my dinner, it could've been my breakfast and lunch for the next day :x

UQnXGuMD_fpNR_YqGTD89g.text: So after a journey around the Venetian, the girls settled for Grand lux Cafe because it's like a sibling of the Cheesecake Factory. I ordered the parmesan chicken and shrimp scampi combination platter. It was yummy and it filled me up. Our waitress forgot to bring a coca cola and my hot tea so she did not charge us for it. Really sweet .. Along with quick and excellent service.

dLYOSh_qBO08uHMDzO39rw.text: This restaurant is everything a restaurant should be.  Great food, great service, great value.  First, they made a simple omelette amazing wiht freshly roasted vegtables, home-made (real) hash brown potatoes and even a great bagel.  We each had a spicy bloody mary which was really amazing.  Lastly, we had the beignets as breakfast dessert.  The service was really great.  A very relaxed and enjoyable experience.  The rest of the menu looked great and can't wait to come back again soon.  Run don't wakl to Grand Lux Cafe.

WcjITAkJtlD91ABl1BOhvg.text: phone yelp.  3 stars because I'm averaging  experiences.  the first 2 were 4 star worthy - good food, cheap prices for vegas standards, and and decent service - but the last experience was terrible.    for late night delights, u want a place that fulfills the two fs - filling and friendly.  because the service was terribly slow - it took over an hour to get food at 5 am when no one was there - and by that time nothing could satisfy our hunger -  this place only gets one F.

jP4uOMzrrU5NI5H3vPGJqg.text: This place is really nothing more than a Cheesecake Factory superimposed in swanky Vegas hotel.   And of course, in True Cheesecake fashion, the glossy, voluminous menu book puts any children's storybook to shame and the offering always seems better on the menu than on the plate.   But then again, when it's 3.30AM, you've blown $600 for either an overpriced champagne at a club or at the blackjack table with impossible bets, and you're dying for some post-party munchies, none of the above matters.    All you care about is the unlimited serving of warm bread with butter, carb-heavy dish big enough to feed a family of 4 in a third world country, and a glass of ice-cold coke to wash it down with.    Budget-friendly comfort food.

16WrjjsDadWsS56bnibDag.text: a.k.a - The Cheesecake Factory.  This place is definitely the sister restaurant, nay, the twin restaurant to the Cheesecake Factory.

6gWJawU42mJFnmDR4i2W0A.text: I was in joy when seeing the sign while wandering around with the bf.  we're seated immediately at the comfortable table. As usual, I did the ordering, and my eyes are always bigger than my stomach.  We had chicken and waffles which was something different to try, but tasty,  steak sandwich - very good, fried calamari with rock shrimp - an excellent dish, salad & soup combo which was nothing special, we didnt  even finish half of it. However, each portion was way bigger than I thought. For the drink, my bf had beer, while I got orange & strawberry smoothie in a big glass was super good that I kept drinking instead of eating food, but still couldnt finish, therefore I had to ask my bf to suck it up 'cause I didnt want to waste it.  I love the service here, my waiter was nice, friendly & attentive, he came by few times to ask if everything was ok, and another gentleman which I guessed its the manager came over to check on us making sure we're well served. With an awesome service & food like this, I would love to come any time.

EFweSqsPwDsQvOJM__mLUQ.text: After a long night at Tao, come here at 5am and order up a plate of pasta with sundried tomatos. It's gigantic, full of oil and starch to soak it all up. The sourdough bread on the table was deeelicious and a cup of coffee was a puurfect end to the night/ morning.

wlDWkJfzaYGWqDVviW9-og.text: Came here before going to the wax museum for a late breakfast/early lunch around 11:15am....I ordered a belgian waffle with strawberries and my friend ordered an egg white omelet with hash browns and wheat toast...super yum!  Lots of food, very fresh, fast service, reasonable pricing.  Pretty much the same as cheesecake factory, but I'm impressed that they're open late night, so next time I'm out late in Vegas, I'll know where to get some afterhours grub----definitely recommended!

6h6MJwiKRX-8YAA_YhVcIg.text: Grand Lux is located at The Venetian hotel and is open 24 hours!  it's obviously very convenient if you stay at the Venetian and also after a club, this is a great place to go.  Ok, I pretty much get the same thing when I come here - the Zen Noodles.  It's sort of like Pho, it's what I call "American Pho."  lol.  I also got the Duck Potstickers, which is really good!  Although, for the price of that appetizer, I wish we would've gotten more than 5 pieces.  Another good thing is that this place has a wide selection on their menu.  Maybe one day I'll think of getting something else rather than my noodles! ;)

bZSxXA9WRVMRL8sGj5yggw.text: When we go to Vegas, we are at this restaurant at least twice. The menu is huge, the service is great, they are always open. When I go I typically get the Sunday Night pasta. It can easily feed 2 people, if not 3. Its my absolute favorite. I love the spicy calamari salad, I usually get some dirty martini's with all this. This restaurant is huge. They have a 'patio' type area in the front, and their bar, and some restaurant seating by the host area, don't let that fool you, in the back is a gigantic restaurant. Even if the line is long, you won't wait too long. You will probably spend more time looking at the menu trying to decide, then you will waiting for a table.  The prices here are very decent, they are not typical Las Vegas over priced food prices... its regular. I love this place.

bUAfcxOmmwuk20uG9yh4kQ.text: Yumm...its ok... fun place to hang out though.

imsQtBvfW6NGX7P5sWaENg.text: Went here on Saturday night after a long night.  The waiters are so nice and accomodating!  My half of the table ordered a vegetarian pizza, fried calamari, and spinach and artichoke dip.  All were delicious!

d9lf-APEd0uGSYI0KTcByA.text: I freakin love this place!! Atmosphere is awesome, service is perfect, and most importantly, the food is phenomenal. I've been here several times and with big groups each time. I've never heard a single complaint about the food from anyone in my groups. Everything on the menu is good - you can't go wrong! Even the bread and butter they start you off with is addicting. I always have to to eat here when I'm in Vegas - it's been set in stone.

JfCiPKA6-Yx8F6Ior4vSlQ.text: decently priced, generously portioned meals, pretty extensive menu --  coupled with an excellent mixed drink menu, made by the bar adjacent to the cafe -- makes this place an easy choice for those seeking a no nonsense and no frills experience in Las Vegas of all places.

AbeSvyc3Qexi9S815s0Vgg.text: Food is Okay. Breakfast wasn't very good (which is very disappointing when you are hung over) but their salads and sandwiches were decent. Can't really complain too much since it is open 24 hours but its not super special.

vMNhGHGmYKMVwltYpHzsiw.text: I have eaten here 3x and tried several dishes here, and most of them have been really good. It's a money 24 hour place for late night Vegas, and it's not as pricey as the fine dining, yet the food is usually as good. It's owned/affiliated with Cheesecake factory so I'm told, and the big menu, portions, and solid food quality reflect that. I actually like it more than Cheesecake Factory though because the menu items are more to my taste and a little more creative and fun in my opinion.

LnqDPJIj8VMQBBImT4JQTQ.text: Been here multiple times over the past two years. Service is always very good, prices are more than reasonable - especially for Vegas, and has one of the best Hamburgers I've ever had

n8nV-ZUGyQysBfmjGyw4Yw.text: Spent $275.82 here on 02/20/11 for a party of 4 folks.  Great atmosphere but expensive alcoholic drinks.  I'll be back in another year.

-6FTSc669E8nr19XhXgsEw.text: I only had drinks, the staff was friendly and knew how to make great drinks! Great place to chill after a concert. My favorite drink stop

4vuChq8m8TxPcCvo1Pw3dA.text: I ate here the night I arrived in Vegas! Wooo-weee...this place was A-Maz-ing. I ordered the soup and it came out in this super sleek steel basin and the waiter poured it in my bowl right in front of me. The presentation was exquisite.

tGUwqAxoVv0ZnxSgGzkP_w.text: Went with a large group for a birthday party, and the waiter forgot about us. :( Other than that, it was awesome. Check out the ceiling while you're in there!

_vY9am0rRFTfOKlknvZElw.text: This place is just OKAY. It is owned by the Cheesecake Factory. The food is just mediocre. Nothing special. The only plus side about this place is it's 24 hours. Wouldn't go back to eat here.

gr_v5-np3JIyElXqFZfGag.text: Went here before seeing Phantom at the Venetian. Ok first the bad. We went to be seated and they were very insistent that our whole party be there before they put us on the waiting list. Guess everyone has to be present to share in the punishment wait because the dinning room had plenty of open tables. After the punishment wait was over we were seated and the menu has tons of different options. THe service was very friendly and attentive. When the food came the first thing I noticed was how big the portions are. I mean that plate was full. Although my stomach was ready to blow I had to had a piece of the cheesecake. Sense it is from the cheesecake factory it was also excellent. While a bit pricey the food here is well worth the money and the portions are more then generous. I highly recommend dinning here when you are in Vegas.

VGcYkEC166ClhAg4dGJThQ.text: Grand Lux is a crowd pleaser. There is something for everyone. Service is friendly. Food is good, everything from the buffalo chicken rolls to the wedge salad, to the chicken parm or schnitzel.

TY1jgbsiLWLQkCl9BYMFEQ.text: I'm surprised that this place is by the makers of Cheesecake Factory, because I much prefer Cheesecake Factory.  I liked the Asian nachos, chocolate cake, and artichoke dip.  What I wouldn't order again: chicken & waffles or shrimp scampi (delicious shrimp, yucky sauce).  The prices are on the high side, so you can end up really disappointed if you get something that turns out to be not-so-delicious.

PTf2hukNb9lCYbeLX_5o5A.text: A pleasant surprise in casual dinning. We were looking for a light snack and found this restaurant in the Palazzo. The prices are very good and the food even better. It's a small place with a limited menu but the portions are quite large. I had one of their pizzas and I was quite satisfied. The duck pot stickers are excellent.  Very nice establishment.  Our waitress was very nice and provided us with excellent service.

SF14CN2ZWyCZ9uC8OSJlwA.text: I usually come here for breakfast when I am in Vegas. There is not a specific thing I order every time, everything is pretty much delicious! The waiters are so nice and energetic!

q7wZULkGZSpR69le1__DnA.text: The Grand Lux Cafe was packed when we got there but the line moved fast and we got seated. The decor and menu looked like I had seen it before. Come to find out it is owned by the same people who own The Cheesecake Factory. Nonetheless the menu had a lot of great choices and the service was great. I spent $45 on breakfast! Only in Vegas...I ordered the Joe's scramble along with a delicious blood orange mimosa. The food and drink was fantastic. For a splurge once in a while this was definitely worth it.

aBBALUUVPs3Y4bj2hEvOBQ.text: Very much enjoyed our late night eats here. The portions were probably 3x bigger than what we expected, so value certainly isn't a problem. I enjoyed my shrimp scampi which was good, but too creamy for shrimp scampi. Our service was very friendly and reasonably paced. We didn't feel rushed at all.

p1vICRalhKWk6uJjdQUGfg.text: Great place to dine. Good service and food is good. The cedar plank BBQ salmon is awesome. I always order it whenever I'm in town.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand Lux Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

mN7f1GMjEo_Ezd-XC625LQ.text: The venetian is one of my favorite places in Las Vegas, play in the poker room long enough and you'll get comped and will most likely end up eating at Grand Lux.  I love this place, the food tastes good, the service is wonderful and they have a very diverse menu.  they have asian nachos which i didn't try but definitely will next time. You have to check this place out and it's open 24 hours, what's better than that??

tbklYCAIoE5Y0VvIdqE4yg.text: Good breakfast option on the strip.  Lots of items available in a variety of price points.  Weekend buffet looked good, but we ordered off menu.

psgu0rwg4WL97g-DJWGUPw.text: I'm still really fond of this place because it's one of the better 24 hour joints on the strip. I've never actually eaten here during regular dining hours and probably wouldn't recommend doing so since Vegas has so many other restaurants to offer. I usually get the shaking beef...I just wish they put in more beef and less onions.  Service tends to lag a bit but we've never had any real problems until last week when a hostess could not appropriately handle a simple seating request. She led us to a table outside by the casino, which was too loud and noisy for our tastes so we asked if we could be seated further inside (there's a big room in the back with plenty of empty tables, we've eaten there often enough to know this). She quickly retorted there aren't any available and we'd have to wait. Uhm, what? You didn't even bother to check! We agree to wait for one, so we follow her back to the front and my boyfriend asks her how long the wait is...but she simply shrugs her shoulders and rudely turns away to chat with the other hostess. Meanwhile, we're sitting there waiting for almost 10 minutes being completely ignored, as we see 4 different small parties being seated...a few of which were led directly to the back dining room where we requested to be. WTF. When we were finally seated, we notice that the party who came after us was seated at a big comfy booth while we were stuck at one of the tables with the most foot traffic. This peeved the BF so much that he felt obligated to speak to the manager, who understood our concern and apologized profusely, even throwing in a free bag of cookies. Anyways, moral of the story is if you can't be friendly to a customer and make them feel welcomed, you probably shouldn't be a host or hostess at a restaurant.

T1x2Wd8AGsEckvt_fk32og.text: I loved the food here. Very fresh and tasty. I had a salad with lobster.  The vegetables were soooo fresh and there was a good amount of lobster on it. The portions were pretty big. The service was also good. Overall it was a pleasant lunch.

1gQdWm8oq_-zb19LIvc_hA.text: 5 Stars for  - Breakfast. Late night snack! Carrot cake!!!! 4 Stars for the rest of the menu. 3 Stars because they don't serve breakfast all day - come on this is vegas! 2 Stars for how slippery the floor is  We ate here like 3 times in two days and it was just fine, but they need to have the full breakfast menu all the time.

S5qbkLUXaEaHQ8PYBaHb3Q.text: While dodging porn stars and technophiles, my crew and I were desperately searching for a place to eat. Zine in the Palazzo was a bit pricey for a quick bite. We sat down at Noodles at the Venetian, but after 10 minutes and not even a fly-by from a waitress, we left. We landed at the Grand Lux in the Venetian, and I was impressed.   The menu is huge. I can not imagine someone being unable to find their particular craving, and although there are only two specific vegetarian entrees, they are both delicious. I had the most insane vegetable plate (red cabbage, mashed sweet potatoes to name two), and they even let me substitute green beans for the white rice it was supposed to be served with. We also had the tofu entree, and it was equally delicious, perhaps a little sweet for everyday consumption, but a great treat. The smoothies are top-notch. As you can see from the pictures, everything looks amazing, which means a lot to me. When someone in the kitchen cares enough to make it look pretty, it is a  promising sign it will taste good.  The fact that the Grand Lux pulls it off while serving a dining room of probably at least 5000 square feet makes me love it even more.  In the battle of 24-hour upscale diner/cafe casinoland, The Grand Lux definitely exceeds Cafe Bellagio in taste and presentation. True, sometimes you just need to gaze at a spectacular flower display while chomping on your $18 patty melt, but if scenery is not a concern, head to the Grand Lux.

Ur424A9d1en7pbr3QM4LLA.text: Went here for dinner last night, as we were staying at the Venetian, and it was right near the elevator to our room. The girl who seated us was very friendly, but I knocked a star for the waitress. She seemed to have went on break or something, she didn't really come back for much, and it took a while to get refills. My sisters boyfriend had to get up and ask for drinks at one point. The food was spectacular! I had the chicken royale, and it was one of the best things I've tried in a while. Later in the night, we ran down for a late night slice of cheesecake, and it was so creamy & delicious. I would definitely come back, the food is worth the slow service.

h6no8J8CkpnTRtDQnC6D7A.text: It was our first night in Las Vegas. We weaved in and out of casinos, losing track of time and space and after a few hours, our stomachs begged for nourishment. Our problem? It was 3am. We walked the strip, discouraged by the quick stop places that were open and even had the "Dennys" conversation but alas as we slithered through another casino it seemed there was a place open for business and that place was the Grand Lux Cafe. The restaurant could have used better lighting but then again it could be seen as "romantic" atmosphere. Perhaps so much so that the patrons at the table next to ours may have gotten so lost in their own world, they forgot other people around them can hear their bedroom conversations.  I've never met the woman before but I now have a great knowledge of her working woman parts. I did lose my appetite quite quickly and luckily we decided to take our meals back to the hotel but I can't complain too much, it's Vegas!  Pros: Best fettuccine Alfredo I have ever eaten in my life. Open late. Fast seating and service.  Cons: Can be very noisy. But c'mon, it's Vegas, baby!

1icGpwQr-F7g27Bc-kATfw.text: this place is so wonderful! warm bread always, good food, service is amazing. I always have to come here first when I get to Vegas. Wish they had one in the Bay Area. I se people compare it to Cheescake Factory but this is way better but yet somewhat similar. Located in The Venetian Hotel.

1oKabob1YudeXPvoy8pslg.text: One of my favorite restaurants. There is one in downtown Chicago that I've been to a few times, this location is just as good. Had the seafood salad and potato spring rolls- delicious! I love the dim lighting here and always great service.

-iz86dJmVFTHxU5-V1sUQA.text: Had several meals and were all pretty good. A glorified diner, but food was fresh and unique.

wtkblH0EO6iIzMDFeZ7v1g.text: awesome service, great testing food and good selection. wine menu was good too of course

e7AA2a3X-fTfe_OHoGXd_Q.text: So I'm updating my review and subtracting a few stars.  =(  Sad.  This review is actually for the Grand Lux Cafe on the side where you order togo.  This was my first time ordering togo at Grand Lux so I was surprised to see a few really cheap items on the menu.  Chicken or tuna salad sandwiches were only about $6!  I ordered a tuna salad sandwich and a Caesar Salad for $4.95 and instantly received my food because they were both premade.  -Tuna Salad Sandwich: just your regular bread with lettuce and tomato, stuffed with tuna salad that was below average.  I've had premade tuna salad sandwiches on campus at UCSD and they were a lot better. -Caesar Salad: crunchy lettuce is a plus!  But the ranch looked grainy and tasted spicy!  Wat the eff?  Please up the service and quality of food, Grand Lux.  Or else you don't deserve to be serving Venetian customers!

M02RJ4qUSiNpcYMBEVu1ZA.text: The big chicken pot pie is huge here! It pretty good actually...  This place is a good place to share your food... we came here with 8 people and ordered like 5 dishes and everyone was full... The service kinda sucked, the prices are alright, it's good if you split it up with everyone...

UPPa2Z0hpyxK7LQHV8FavA.text: Listen up y'all. This is the sister/brother restaurant of Cheesecake Factory. If you like that type of food, then this is the place to go. But for me I wanted to try something that was a different experience.   So I came here with a group of people (7 people) and we all shared our entrees.   **FOOD: - We ordered the Grand Italian pizza and according to my brother, it tasted like something that you can get from the frozen aisle at a Ralphs. - Pasta with Chicken, Sun dried Tomatoes and Mushrooms and Pasta Carbonara was too CHEESY!! After a few hours, the boy and I got a tummy ache. I would not recommend the pasta entrees. It isn't great (my opinion).  - The Sonoma Salad was probably the only OK entree. I mean you can't go wrong with a salad.  - The other entree was a bake chicken with mash potatoes, no bueno. My cousin said the chicken was dry.   Overall I would recommend this restaurant if you do like the American type of food and if you're on a tight budget (entrees range from $10-$20) . But I would definitely not come here again.

EmAbKz7F8hAO1xLGSyVdQQ.text: After a terrible dinning experience at the food court at Green Valley Ranch, I was pleasantly surprised by our dining experience at the Grand Lux at the Venetian.  I have been there several times and have always enjoyed it, but this was the first time we went with our 3 girls.  We got right in, had amazing service that went above and beyond to help make it a nice dinner despite having 2, 4 and 6 year olds with us.  The Cobb salad was as good a salad as I have ever had at a restaurant; fresh, high quality chicken, bacon and blue cheese.  Wife loved her smaller chop salad.  Girls devoured the edamame, volcano shrimp and sliders.  I spent twice as much on dinner as the night before, but felt like we got a bargain.  Can't say enough good things about our diner.

RuFdWd-qHbXbWtjdS6mRwA.text: What an amazing find this place was! Went last week when we were on vacation.  We weren't really wanting a big dinner and so we'd passed all the trendy/pricey upscale places.  They're fine when you're wanting a nice dinner out but we just wanted something simple.  We walked past this place and decided to give it a try. I'm so happy we did!  There were several people in line to get a table and I was worried that we'd have to wait a long time for a table, but it's deceptively large and so it only took like 5 minutes for them to seat us.  We were seated at a table for 2 that one side is a long bench and the other side chairs.  So there were people next to us, but enough room for me to get in/out.  Even though we were close to the people next to us we didn't find it hard to hear each other and we couldn't hear anyones conversations except the ladies right next to us. That is such a plus in my mind.  The menu has lots of choices - pasta, salads, sandwiches, chicken dishes, steaks, etc.  this is a perfect place in vegas when you're with several people and not everyone wants just sushi or italian.    They bring out nice warm bread (and butter) after seating you.  My husband and I both opted for hamburgers. He got the Max burger (with short ribs on the burger, hello!) and I got the bacon cheese burger. They easily substituted cheddar for me instead of american.  Burgers were about $12-13 each and came with fries or organic green salad.  This was the largest regular size restaurant burger I've ever had and also the best I've had. It truly looked as if when I ordered it, the guy in the kitchen pulled out some ground beef and made my patty by hand.  I couldn't even quite finish 1/2 of it.  And I can eat an entire red robin burger.  Seriously, it was just delicious.   Service was wonderful.
